gt:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Place the eggs in a blender and blend for 1 to 2 minutes, until smooth and pale in color.
Add the milk, flour, sugar, lemon zest, nutmeg and salt and blend until smooth.
Brush the melted butter over 16 standard-size muffin cups.
Divide the batter evenly between the cups, filling each about three-quarters of the way full.
Bake for about 15 minutes, until puffed up and lightly browned around the edges.
Remove from the oven and flip the cakes out of the pans.
Fill each cake with a few pieces of the nectarines and almonds.
Drizzle with maple syrup, sprinkle with powdered sugar and serve immediately.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the eggs, milk, flour, sugar, lemon zest, nutmeg, and salt. Whisk until smooth.
3. Heat a large skillet or frying pan over medium heat. Add the melted butter and swirl to coat the pan evenly.
4. Pour the batter onto the pan, creating a thin, even layer. Cook for about 2 minutes, or until the edges start to set.
5. Carefully flip the pancake with a spatula and cook for another minute, or until the pancake is cooked through and golden brown.
6. Transfer the pancake to a wire rack and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. While the pancake is cooling, prepare the topping by combining the sliced almonds, maple syrup, and powdered sugar in a small bowl.
8. Once the pancake is cool enough to handle, slice it into wedges.
9. Drizzle the maple syrup mixture over the sliced pancake and sprinkle with the powdered sugar.
10. Serve the Mini Nectarine-Almond Dutch Babies immediately.

Enjoy your delicious Mini Nectarine-Almond Dutch Babies!

gt:
Spray inside of slow cooker with cooking spray.
Add all ingredients to slow cooker and combine.
Cover.
Cook on low 1 or 2 hours.
Stir until well blended after cooking.
You can leave this on "keep warm" setting all day, stirring occasionally, if cheese clumps or separates from sitting.
Serve with pita wedges, cocktail rye, or sliced crusty baguette type bread.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Spray the inside of your crock pot with the Pam Olive Oil spray.
3. Add the crabmeat, parmesan cheese, onion, artichoke hearts, spinach, cream cheese, red bell pepper, monterey jack cheese, black olives, salt, pepper, and lemon juice to the crock pot.
4. Stir everything together to combine.
5. Cover the crock pot and cook on low heat for about 2 hours or until the cheese is melted and the dip is hot and bubbly.
6. Serve the Crock Pot Shrimp and Artichoke Dip warm, with crackers or pita chips, for a delicious and easy appetizer or snack.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Combine the 1-1/2 cup cereal and boiling water in a medium bowl; blend well and allow to cool.
Add buttermilk, oil and egg; blending well.
Combine the flour, sugar, baking soda and salt in medium bowl; stir in cereal mixture, mini chips and chopped apricots.
Stir until moistened.
Spray six 5- to 6-oz custard cups with non-stick cooking spray.
Fill each cup half full with batter and sprinkle each with 2 tsp.
bran flake cereal.
Microwave on high for 2-1/2 to 3-1/2 minutes, turning 1/4 turn at end of each minute, or until wooden toothpick inserted off center comes out clean.
Tops will appear moist, let them stand several miutes.
Repeat the cooking procedure for remaining batter or place the left over batter in the fridge and store for another day.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the all-bran cereal, boiling water, and low-fat buttermilk. Allow the mixture to sit for about 10 minutes.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the vegetable oil, egg, and sugar. Add the baking soda and salt to the wet ingredients, and whisk until well combined.
4. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, and mix until just combined. Fold in the chopped dried apricot and miniature semisweet chocolate chips.
5. Fill the muffin cups with the batter, about 3/4 full.
6. Bake the muffins for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
7. Allow the muffins to cool in the pan for a few minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.
8. Once the muffins are fully cooled, sprinkle the tops with additional all-bran cereal for a crunchy topping.

Enjoy your delicious Chocolate Chip Bran Muffins!

gt:
Preheat a large skillet to medium heat.
Add the beef, onion and garlic and heat for 5 minutes, breaking the meat up as you go.
When the beef is about half cooked, add the chili powder, cumin, seasoned salt, and as much hot sauce as youd like.
Stir the spices into the meat mixture.
Allow the beef to finish cooking through, about 3 minutes more.
Combine the cornstarch and water in a small bowl.
Pour the cornstarch mixture into the beef and allow the mixture to bubble for 2 minutes, stirring to form a light sauce.
If the liquid evaporates before youre ready to serve, add more water 2 tablespoons at a time.
Taste the meat, and add more salt or hot sauce if youd like.
Serve in taco shells, flour tortillas, with chips, or as part of a salad.
The options are endless!
pred:
[/INST]

1. In a large skillet, cook the ground beef over medium heat until it is browned and cooked through.
2. Add the finely chopped onion and minced garlic to the skillet. Cook until the onion is softened and the garlic is fragrant.
3. Stir in the chili powder, cumin, and seasoned salt. Cook for a few more minutes, until the spices are well combined.
4. Add the Mexican hot sauce to taste, stirring to combine.
5. Pour in the cornstarch mixture, stirring constantly to prevent lumps. Cook until the mixture thickens and reaches your desired consistency.
6. Serve the beef mixture in the taco shells with your preferred toppings.

Enjoy your delicious Beef Tacos!

gt:
1.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. 2.
Slice Brussels sprouts in half.
3.
Toss with grapes, olive oil, salt and black pepper to taste.
4.
Spread on a baking sheet or glass dish.
5.
Roast for 25 minutes, until the sprouts are tender.
6.
Mix in toasted walnuts and toss all with balsamic vinegar.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Clean the Brussels Sprouts by removing any leaves and trimming the ends.
3. In a large bowl, toss the Brussels Sprouts with the olive oil, salt, and black pepper.
4. Spread the Brussels Sprouts out on a baking sheet and roast them in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
5. While the Brussels Sprouts are roasting, chop the grapes into smaller pieces.
6. Once the Brussels Sprouts are cooked, remove them from the oven and let them cool slightly.
7. In a small bowl, mix the chopped grapes, toasted walnuts, and the balsamic vinegar.
8. Add the balsamic mixture to the cooked Brussels Sprouts and toss everything together.
9. Serve the Balsamic Roasted Brussels Sprouts immediately, and enjoy your delicious meal!

gt:
Preheat oven to 325F.
Mix together flour and salt in bowl.
Cream shortening, butter, and icing sugar in seperate bowl.
Blend in vanilla, almond extract, and nuts with the creamed mixture.
Gradually stir creamed mixture into dry ingredients to form smooth dough.
Shape into balls with 1 Tbsp dough.
Place on ungreased cookie sheet and flatten slightly on the bottoms.
(shaped like a flat-bottomed snowball).
Bake 20-25 minutes.
Roll cookies in icing sugar and cool on rack.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the shortening and butter together until fluffy.
3. Add the sugar and vanilla extract, and continue to mix until well combined.
4. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
5. In a separate bowl, mix the flour, salt, and almond extract. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until a smooth dough forms.
6. Fold in the chopped pecans.
7. On a floured surface, roll the dough out to a thickness of about 1/2 inch (1.5 cm).
8. Cut the dough into desired shapes using cookie cutters or a sharp knife.
9. Place the cookies on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
10. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are lightly golden brown around the edges.
11. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Snowball Cookies!

gt:
In the top of a double boiler, heat chocolate, stirring occasionally, until chocolate is melted and smooth.
Remove from heat and allow to cool to lukewarm.
In a large bowl, cream butter and sugar until pale yellow and very fluffy.
Blend in the melted chocolate and vanilla.
With an electric mixer on medium speed, beat in the eggs, one at a time, taking 5 minutes for each egg.
Pour filling into baked pie shell.
Refrigerate 4 hours before serving.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the unsweetened baking chocolate and vanilla extract, and continue to mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and then gradually add them to the chocolate mixture, stirring until smooth.
5. Pour the mixture into the pie shell and bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the filling is set and the crust is golden brown.
6. Allow the pie to cool completely before serving.

Enjoy your delicious French Silk Chocolate Pie III!

gt:
Soak 8 bamboo skewers in warm water for 30 minutes; drain.
Insert 2 bamboo skewers through 2 shrimp so the skewers form an X; repeat with the remaining shrimp.
Rub the skewered shrimp with 1 teaspoon of the oil.
In a medium bowl, combine the sliced fennel, pistachios, lemon juice, lemon zest and 2 1/2 tablespoons of the olive oil.
In a small dry skillet, toast the fennel seeds over moderately high heat, stirring, until fragrant, about 3 minutes.
Add the seeds to the fennel salad and season with salt, pepper and the sugar.
Heat the remaining 1/2 teaspoon of olive oil in the small skillet.
Add the shallot and cook over moderately high heat, stirring, until softened.
Remove from the heat and stir in the tomato and watermelon.
Transfer to a small bowl and stir in the chopped basil.
Heat a grill pan.
Season the shrimp with salt and pepper and grill over high heat until opaque throughout, about 2 minutes per side.
Spoon the fennel salad onto 4 plates.
Set the shrimp skewers on the fennel, top with a spoonful of the salsa and serve at once.
pred:
1. Preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
2. In a large bowl, toss the shrimp with the olive oil, salt, and pepper.
3. Grill the shrimp for 2-3 minutes per side, or until they are cooked through and pink.
4. While the shrimp are cooking, prepare the fennel and lemon.
5. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the fennel and cook until it is tender and slightly caramelized, about 5-7 minutes.
6. Add the sliced crosswise and thinly sliced shallot to the skillet and cook until they are softened, about 3-4 minutes.
7. Add the lemon juice, lemon zest, fennel seeds, sugar, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.
8. Remove the fennel from the skillet and set aside.
9. In a small bowl, mix the pistachios, basil, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
10. To assemble the dish, place the cooked shrimp on top of the fennel mixture.
11. Drizzle the sauce from the skillet over the shrimp and fennel mixture.
12. Sprinkle the pistachio and basil mixture over the top.
13. Serve immediately and enjoy your mouthwatering Grilled Shrimp with Fennel and Lemon dish.

gt:
Beat eggs, 2 teaspoons water, salt and pepper until frothy and light.
Follow general directions for cooking an omelette.
Lay out the herbs, tomato and cheese in that order over half of the omelette.
Fold over omelette, add 1 teaspoon water to the pan to quicken melting process of cheese, cover and cook until just done.
pred:
1. In a medium-sized bowl, whisk together the eggs, water, salt, and pepper.
2. Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium heat.
3. Add the onion to the skillet and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the chopped fresh chives, dill, and parsley to the skillet and cook for an additional 2 minutes.
5. Pour the egg mixture over the onion mixture and cook until the edges start to set, about 2 minutes.
6. Add the chopped brie cheese to the skillet and cook until the cheese is melted and the omelette is fully cooked through, about 2 minutes more.
7. Serve the Brie Fresh Herb and Tomato Omelette hot.

This recipe requires the user to have a skillet, eggs, water, salt, pepper, butter, chopped fresh chives, dill, parsley, onion, and brie cheese. The user can follow the provided steps to create a delicious and satisfying Brie Fresh Herb and Tomato Omelette.

gt:
Heat the oven to 375 F and coat a 12-cup muffin tin with butter.
In a bowl, whisk together the cornmeal,flour,baking powder,oregano and salt.
In a separate bowl, beat the eggs, then whisk in the milk and barbecue sauce.
Combine the ingredients and stir until the flour is moist.
Mix in the mozzarella, mushrooms, onion, pepperoni, olives, and dried tomatoes .
Divide the mixture among the muffin wells.
Bake the cupcakes about 25 minutes.
Let them cool for 5 minutes before removing them from the pan.
Warm the marinara sauce and serve it together with the muffins.
Enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, cornmeal, baking powder, oregano, and salt.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and milk together.
4. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until just combined.
5. Fold in the shredded mozzarella, mushrooms, onion, pepperoni, olives, dried tomatoes, and marinara sauce.
6. Grease a muffin tin with cooking spray or butter.
7. Divide the batter evenly among the muffin cups, filling each cup about 3/4 full.
8. Bake the muffins for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
9. Allow the muffins to cool for a few minutes before removing them from the muffin tin and transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your homemade Pizza Muffins!

gt:
Preheat oven to 300F.
Arrange 11 whole graham crackers on an un-greased 15 x 10 inch jelly roll pan.
Bring butter, sugar, and nuts to a boil in a medium saucepan, and boil 2 minutes.
Pour mixture over the graham crackers, spreading quickly to cover.
Bake for 12 minutes.
Remove crackers to wax paper to cool.
Cut with a knife along perforations and serve.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Crush the graham crackers into small pieces or crumbs.
3. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter or margarine and sugar until light and fluffy.
4. Add the crushed graham crackers and mix well.
5. Stir in the chopped pecans or almonds.
6. Press the mixture evenly into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
7. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the edges are lightly golden brown.
8. Allow the biscuits to cool in the pan for a few minutes before cutting into squares.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Insert wooden pop stick into stem end of each apple.
Microwave chocolate as directed on package.
Dip bottom half of each apple in chocolate, turning until evenly coated.
Sprinkle nuts over chocolate.
Place on waxed paper-covered plate.
Refrigerate 30 min.
or until chocolate is firm.
Cut each apple in half to serve.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Wash the apples thoroughly and pat them dry with a paper towel.
3. In a small bowl, mix the chopped pecans with melted butter.
4. Dip each apple into the melted butter mixture, making sure to coat the apple evenly.
5. Place the coated apples on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. In a microwave-safe bowl, melt the BAKER'S Dipping Chocolate according to the package instructions.
7. Dip each apple into the melted chocolate, covering it completely.
8. Sprinkle the melted chocolate-covered apples with chopped pecans.
9. Place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the chocolate is set and the apples are tender.
10. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the apples cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Chocolate-Dipped Apples!

gt:
Mix honey, juice, soy sauce and dressing mix in large bowl until well blended.
Reserve 1/4 cup of the dressing mixture; refrigerate.
Add chicken to remaining dressing mixture; toss to coat.
Refrigerate 1 to 4 hours to marinate.
Drain; discard the dressing mixture.
Preheat broiler.
Thread a wooden or metal skewer through each chicken strip.
Broil 4 inches from heat 8 to 10 minutes or until chicken is cooked through, turning and brushing frequently with reserved 1/4 cup dressing mixture.
Discard any remaining dressing mixture.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the honey, orange juice, and soy sauce.
3. In a large bowl, combine the chicken strips, GOOD SEASONS Asian Sesame Dressing Mix, and the honey mixture. Toss to coat the chicken evenly.
4. Thread the chicken onto the skewers, alternating between chicken and the dressing mixture.
5. Place the skewers on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the skewers are slightly charred.
6. Serve the Golden Oriental Sesame Chicken Skewers immediately.

[/SYS]

gt:
Heat oven to 350 degrees and butter a 2-quart gratin dish.
Wash the leeks to remove any grit and slice thinly crosswise.
Using a mandoline or sharp knife, slice the potatoes into rounds, 1/8-inch thick.
Toss with 3/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.
Layer the rounds in the gratin dish.
Melt the 2 tablespoons butter in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add leeks, remaining salt and pepper, and thyme.
Cook, stirring, until leeks are tender and golden, 5 to 7 minutes.
Discard thyme and scatter the leeks over the potatoes.
Add cream, garlic and bay leaf to the skillet, scraping up browned bits of leeks from the bottom of the pan.
Simmer gently for 5 minutes.
Stir in nutmeg.
Pour the cream over the leeks and potatoes and top with the Gruyere.
Cover with aluminum foil and transfer to the oven.
Bake for 40 minutes, uncover and bake until the cheese is bubbling and golden, 15 to 20 minutes longer.
Let cool slightly before serving.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, melt the 2 tablespoons of unsalted butter over medium heat. Add the chopped garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
3. Add the leeks and cook until they are softened, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the potatoes and cook until they are tender, about 10 minutes. Season with the kosher salt, black pepper, thyme, nutmeg, and bay leaf.
5. Pour the heavy cream over the potatoes and cook until the cream has thickened slightly, about 5 minutes.
6. Remove the skillet from the heat and stir in the grated Gruyere.
7. Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish with some of the remaining butter.
8. Transfer the potato and leek mixture to the prepared baking dish.
9. Dot the top with the remaining butter.
10. Bake the gratin in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the filling is bubbly.
11. Remove the gratin from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees Fahrenheit.
Melt the butter in an 11 x 7 inch baking pan, making sure the sides of the pan are coated.
Layer cracker crumbs, coconut, chocolate chips, chopped nuts and butterscotch chips in that order.
Pour sweetened condensed milk over everything.
Bake for 30 minutes or until light golden brown.
Loosen from the pan; cool and cut into squares.
pred:
[INST]
To prepare Hello Dolly Cookie Bars, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter or margarine and the graham cracker crumbs until well combined.
3. Add the coconut, chopped nuts, and chocolate chips, and mix until well combined.
4. If you're using butterscotch chips, add them to the mixture and mix until well combined.
5. If using sweetened condensed milk, add it to the mixture and mix until well combined.
6. Press the mixture evenly into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
7. Bake the bars in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the edges are slightly golden and the center is set.
8. Allow the bars to cool completely before cutting them into bars and serving.

Enjoy your delicious Hello Dolly Cookie Bars!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350'f.
Butter and flour two 10-inch round cake pans.
Sift flour, cocoa, salt, baking soda, and baking powder into a large mixing bowl.
Stir in the sugar.
In another bowl, combine the eggs, vanilla, and beat.
Mix in the dry ingredients.
Add the buttermilk, melted butter, and coffee.
Scrape batter into the prepared cake pans.
Bake cakes until set, and the tester sick comes out clean( about 50 min.)
Let cool in pans then invert them onto a rack.
And enjoy.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, cocoa powder, salt, baking soda, and baking powder.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the sugar, eggs, vanilla extract, and buttermilk.
4. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until just combined. Do not overmix.
5. Pour the batter evenly into the prepared pans and smooth the tops with a spatula.
6. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cakes comes out clean.
7. Allow the cakes to cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.
8. To make the chocolate ganache, melt the chocolate and butter in a heatproof bowl set over a saucepan of simmering water. Stir until smooth.
9. Allow the ganache to cool slightly, then pour it over the cooled cakes.
10. Refrigerate the cakes until the ganache is set, about 1-2 hours.

Enjoy your delicious Chocolate Blackout Cake!

gt:
In a cocktail shaker, stir sugar into lemon juice to dissolve.
Toss in two handfuls of cracked ice, add port and Cognac, and shake.
Strain into a small glass, add ice and ornament with berries and, if you like, orange slices.
pred:
1. In a large mixing glass, combine the superfine sugar, lemon juice, and port. Stir until the sugar is fully dissolved.
2. Add the Cognac to the mixture and continue to stir.
3. Fill a large punch bowl with ice.
4. Pour the sugar-port mixture over the ice in the punch bowl.
5. Garnish the punch with fresh fruit, such as sliced oranges or lemons, for a refreshing touch.
6. Serve the St. Charles Punch immediately, allowing guests to enjoy the fruity flavors and the smooth, slightly sweet taste.

[/INST]

gt:
PREHEAT oven to 350F Place 1 cup of the sugar in small heavy saucepan; cook on medium heat until sugar is melted and deep golden brown, stirring constantly with wooden spoon.
Remove from heat.
Immediately pour into 9-inch round baking pan; tilt pan to evenly cover bottom of pan with syrup.
Set aside.
PLACE milk and cream cheese in blender; cover.
Blend until smooth.
Add remaining 1 cup sugar, the eggs, vanilla and salt; cover.
Blend just until smooth; pour into prepared baking pan.
Place filled baking pan in larger baking pan; add enough hot water to larger pan to come halfway up side of smaller pan.
BAKE 50 minute to 1 hour or until knife inserted near center comes out clean.
Cool.
Carefully remove flan from water.
Cool on wire rack.
REFRIGERATE several hours or unti chilled.
When ready to serve, run a knife along the edge of the pan.
Then, invert pan onto serving plate to unmold flan.
If some caramel is stuck to the bottom of the pan, you can place the bottom of the pan in a sink full of hot water to heat it, and then spoon it over flan.
Store any leftovers in refrigerator.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat your oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the sugar, evaporated milk, and softened cream cheese. Whisk until smooth and creamy.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, whisking well after each addition.
4. Stir in the vanilla extract and a pinch of salt.
5. Pour the mixture into a greased 9-inch (23 cm) springform pan.
6. Bake the flan in the preheated oven for about 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until the center is set and the edges are slightly puffed.
7. Remove the flan from the oven and let it cool in the pan for about 15 minutes.
8. Carefully run a knife around the edges of the flan to loosen it from the pan. Then, invert the flan onto a serving plate.
9. Refrigerate the flan for at least 4 hours or overnight before serving.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the potato, and fry for about 10 minutes, then add the jalapeno, onion and garlic.
Cook and stir until the potatoes are browned.
Crumble in the ground turkey, and season with cumin, salt and pepper.
Cook and stir until turkey is cooked through and potatoes are tender.
pred:
1. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
2. Add the cubed potato and cook until tender, stirring occasionally.
3. Add the chopped jalapeno pepper and cook for a few more minutes, stirring occasionally.
4. Add the chopped onion and cook until softened, stirring occasionally.
5. Add the ground turkey and cook until browned, breaking it up with a spoon as it cooks.
6. Add the ground cumin, salt, and pepper to taste.
7. Stir everything together, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 10-15 minutes, or until the turkey is cooked through and the flavors have melded together.
8. Serve the Turkey Picadillo over rice or with your favorite side dish.

[/INST]

gt:
In a medium bowl, prepare the relish by mixing together the cucumber, parsley, chopped onion, bell pepper, and red pepper flakes.
Set aside.
In a small bowl, mix the cumin and chili powder with the olive oil.
Rub the mixture onto the chicken, and place in a shallow dish.
Marinate in the refrigerator at least 1 hour.
Prepare the grill for medium heat.
Lightly oil the grill grate.
Grill chicken 8 minutes per side, or until juices run clear.
Serve with cucumber relish.
pred:
1. Preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
2. In a small bowl, mix the chopped cucumber, peeled and seeded cucumber, red onion, yellow bell pepper, crushed red pepper flakes, ground cumin, chili powder, and olive oil. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
3. Place the chicken breasts on a plate and brush them with olive oil.
4. Spread the cucumber and pepper relish mixture evenly over the chicken breasts, making sure to cover both sides.
5. Place the chicken breasts on the grill or grill pan, and cook for about 6-8 minutes per side, or until the chicken is cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
6. Remove the chicken from the grill and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into thin pieces.
7. Serve the Grilled Chicken Breast with Cucumber and Pepper Relish on a plate, garnished with chopped parsley.

[/INST]

gt:
saute the onion in the olive oil for five minutes in a big pot.
add the garlic and saute for another three minutes.
stir well.
add the celery and carrots and saute for five more minutes.
stir well.
add the tomato paste, chili powder, basil, oregano and salt and pepper.
stir well.
saute for a few minutes until the mixtures gets very fragrant.
add the crushed tomatoes, beef broth and cabbage.
bring to a boil.
stir well and let simmer for twenty minutes or until the veggies are cooked to your liking.
enjoy!
pred:
[/INST]

1. Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
2. Add the minced garlic and cook for another minute, until fragrant.
3. Add the chopped carrots and celery ribs to the pot, and cook for 5 more minutes, until they are tender.
4. Add the tomato paste, chili powder, dried basil, and dried oregano to the pot. Cook for another minute, stirring to combine.
5. Add the crushed tomatoes, beef broth, and the chopped cabbage to the pot. Stir to combine all the ingredients.
6. Bring the soup to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes, or until the cabbage is tender.
7. Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Serve the Cabbage, Tomato and Vegetable Soup hot, garnished with a dollop of sour cream or a sprinkle of grated cheese, if desired.

[/INST]

This comprehensive recipe provides a step-by-step guide for crafting a delicious Cabbage, Tomato and Vegetable Soup using the provided ingredients. The soup is a hearty and flavorful meal that can be enjoyed on its own or paired with a side of bread or a salad.

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large bowl, mash bananas.
Heat coconut oil over low heat in small saucepan and add to bananas,.
Mix in sugar, egg, vanilla and milk until all ingredients are incorporated.
Sift in flour, baking powder and baking soda.
Fold in walnuts.
Grease a muffin tin or line with cupcake liners.
Fill 2/3 full and bake for 25-30 mins until golden brown and a toothpick comes out clean when inserted.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the ripe bananas, egg, coconut oil, sugar, milk, and vanilla extract. Mix until well combined.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the whole wheat pastry flour, baking powder, and baking soda.
4. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, stirring until just combined.
5. Fold in the chopped walnuts.
6. Portion the batter evenly into a muffin tin, lined with muffin papers or sprayed with non-stick cooking spray.
7. Bake the muffins for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
8. Allow the muffins to cool in the pan for a few minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

[/INST]

These Banana Nut Muffins are a delicious and healthy treat, perfect for breakfast or a snack. The ripe bananas provide natural sweetness, while the coconut oil adds moisture and richness. The organic whole wheat pastry flour adds a nutritious element, and the chopped walnuts provide a crunchy texture and a touch of protein. The baking powder and baking soda help to achieve the perfect rise and texture, making these muffins a delightful and satisfying treat.

gt:
Place Spam in a glass baking dish.
Spread yellow mustard over top and down sides until mostly coated.
Pour brown sugar on top and spread to make a layer over mustard.
Cover with foil and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Cut the Spam into bite-sized pieces.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the Spam, yellow mustard, and brown sugar. Mix well to ensure the Spam is evenly coated with the mustard and sugar mixture.
4. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
5. Spread the Spam mixture evenly over the prepared baking sheet.
6. Bake the Spam in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until it is cooked through and the edges are slightly crispy.
7. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Using a spatula or tongs, carefully transfer the cooked Spam pieces to a serving plate.
9. Serve the Easiest Baked Spam immediately, and enjoy!

This simple recipe requires only a few ingredients and minimal effort to create a delicious and satisfying dish. The combination of the Spam, mustard, and brown sugar creates a flavorful and savory dish that is both easy to prepare and enjoy.

gt:
blend liqeuors with ice-cream, milk and syrup.
pour into parfait glass, top with whipped cream and garnish with banana and cherry.
pred:
1. In a blender, combine the banana liqueur, Creme de Cacao, and chocolate syrup.
2. Add the chocolate ice cream, milk, and whipped cream.
3. Blend the mixture until smooth and creamy.
4. Pour the mixture into a glass and garnish with a red maraschino cherry and a piece of banana.
5. Enjoy your delicious Chocolate Monkey!

gt:
Start by simmering 1 inch of water in a double boiler over medium to medium-low heat.
Butter the top part of the double boiler.
With an electric mixer, beat the egg whites in large bowl until frothy, then add in the cream of tartar and sugar slowly.
Continue beating until the egg white are stiff (think meringue-like).
Gently fold in the jam.
Spoon the mixture into the buttered top of the double boiler.
Cover and cook over the barely simmering water for 1 hour.
After an hour, once the souffle is cooked, spoon the souffle into 2 serving dishes and top with whipped cream (optional).
Recipe inspired and adapted from The Fannie Farmer Cookbook.
pred:
To cook a Huckleberry Souffle, follow these steps:

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the 1 tablespoon of butter, egg whites, cream of tartar, and granulated white sugar until well combined.
3. Add the Huckleberry Jam or other desired flavor, and whisk until smooth.
4. Gradually add the whipped cream, stirring gently to combine.
5. Pour the mixture into a greased souffle dish or individual ramekins.
6. Bake the souffle in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the souffle is puffed and golden brown.
7. Remove the souffle from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Huckleberry Souffle!

gt:
Heat oven to 375 degrees F.
Blend first 3 ingredients in blender until smooth.
Add 1 cup dressing mixture to vegetables in large bowl; toss to coat.
Reserve remaining dressing mixture.
Place 1 fish fillet in center of each of 8 large pieces heavy-duty foil; top each with about 1 Tbsp.
of the reserved dressing mixture.
Cover with vegetable mixture.
Bring up foil sides.
Double fold top and ends to seal each packet, leaving room for heat circulation inside.
Place in single layer in 15x10x1-inch pan.
Bake 25 min.
or until fish flakes easily with fork.
Let stand 5 min.
; cut slits in foil to release steam before opening packets.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the salmon fillets with the KRAFT Zesty Italian Dressing, honey, and chopped onion. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
3. In a separate bowl, combine the canned chipotle peppers, finely chopped red peppers, and finely chopped zucchini.
4. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the vegetable mixture and cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender.
5. Remove the vegetables from the skillet and set aside.
6. Heat the skillet again and add the salmon fillets, cooking for 4-5 minutes on each side or until the fish is cooked through.
7. Serve the salmon on a bed of the cooked vegetables, garnished with fresh cilantro.

Enjoy your delicious Honey Chipotle Salmon with Vegetables!

gt:
Grind 1 teaspoon rosemary with coriander seeds and garlic with a mortar and pestle to make a paste, then stir in 1/2 teaspoon oil.
Pat venison dry and put in a bowl, then rub with paste.
Season well with pepper, then cover and chill 20 minutes.
Preheat oven to 450F.
Heat a well-seasoned cast-iron skillet over high heat until hot, then add remaining teaspoon oil, tilting skillet to coat evenly.
Season venison well with salt, then brown, turning once, about 6 minutes total.
Transfer skillet to middle of oven and roast venison until an instant-read thermometer inserted diagonally into center registers 125F, 7 to 10 minutes.
Transfer meat to a plate and cover tightly with foil.
Add wine and cherries to skillet and deglaze by boiling over moderately high heat, stirring and scraping up brown bits.
Stir together broth, water, cornstarch, and remaining 1/2 teaspoon rosemary in a bowl and add to skillet.
Simmer, stirring, until mixture is thickened, about 5 minutes.
Whisk in jelly and salt and pepper to taste.
Cut venison into 1/4-inch-thick slices and serve with sauce.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the chopped fresh rosemary, coriander seeds, and garlic clove.
3. Season the venison tenderloin with salt and pepper.
4. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
5. Add the seasoned venison tenderloin to the skillet and sear for 2-3 minutes on each side to create a nice crust.
6. Remove the venison from the skillet and set aside.
7. Add the dry red wine to the skillet and cook until it has reduced by half.
8. Add the dried tart cherries and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.
9. Add the fat-free beef broth, water, cornstarch, and black-currant jelly to the skillet. Stir to combine.
10. Return the venison to the skillet and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the venison is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
11. Serve the Pan-Seared Venison with Rosemary and Dried Cherries over a bed of rice or noodles.

Enjoy your delicious and well-prepared Pan-Seared Venison with Rosemary and Dried Cherries!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees (F).
Butterfly chicken breasts and pound to even thickness (about 1/4 inches).
Chop parsley, olives and scallions.
Combine stuffing mixture in a bowl: feta cheese crumbles, chopped scallions, olives and parsley.
Add a pinch of nutmeg, mix to blend.
No added salt, the ham is quite enough for this dish.
Place 1 slice of Spanish Jamon serrano lengthwise of each chicken breast.
Divide stuffiing mixture evenly and spread on center of each breast.
Divide butter into 4 pieces and place 2 pieces of butter on each breast, and add scant amount of course black pepper.
Roll up breast starting with narrow end and hold together with tooth picks.
Brown chicken in 2 tablespoons olive oil and 1 tablespoon butter, turn to brown all sides.
Remove from pan and place on oven proof dish.
Finish cooking in 350 degree (F) oven for 15 minutes.
Remove from oven, rest 3-5 minutes and serve.
Serving Suggestions: Serve with rice pilaf, your favorite potatoes, Greek salad, etc.
Mix it up!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the crumbled feta cheese, chopped scallions, and chopped flat leaf parsley. Season the mixture with nutmeg, salt, and pepper.
3. Place the chicken breasts in a baking dish, and season them with salt and pepper.
4. Spread the feta cheese mixture evenly over the chicken breasts.
5. Drizzle the olive oil over the chicken breasts, and then sprinkle the crushed pepper over the top.
6. Roast the chicken breasts in the preheated oven for about 30-35 minutes or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
7. Remove the chicken from the oven, and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into portions.
8. Serve the Greek Stuffed Chicken Breasts with a side of your choice, such as a green salad or a serving of rice.

[/INST]

gt:
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium high heat and cook until foam subsides and turns deep gold in color, about 3 minutes.
Season salmon with salt and pepper and add to pan, skin side up.
Cook without turning for 3 minutes.
Add cucumbers and a pinch of salt to pan around salmon and stir to coat with butter.
Continue to cook, stirring cucumbers around in pan, until fish turns deep brown, about 3 minutes longer.
Flip fish (move cucumbers to the side to assure fish skin makes contact with pan).
Add garlic to cucumbers and stir.
Cook fish until done to taste, 2 to 4 minutes longer.
Transfer salmon to plates.
Stir dill and lemon juice into cucumbers in pan and cook for 20 seconds longer.
Taste and add more salt, pepper and lemon juice if necessary.
Serve cucumbers and butter sauce over fish.
pred:
1. Heat a large skillet or saute pan over medium-high heat. Add the 2 tablespoons of unsalted butter and allow it to melt and foam.
2. Season the wild salmon fillets with salt or pepper, as desired. Carefully place the salmon fillets into the skillet, ensuring they are not overcrowded. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes on each side, or until the fish is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
3. Remove the cooked salmon from the skillet and set aside on a plate.
4. In the same skillet, add the diced cucumbers and cook for 2 to 3 minutes, or until they are tender but still crisp.
5. Add the minced garlic to the skillet and cook for an additional 1 to 2 minutes, or until fragrant.
6. Add the chopped fresh dill or cilantro to the skillet and cook for 1 to 2 minutes, or until the dill is wilted.
7. Add the lemon juice to the skillet and stir to combine. Cook for an additional 1 to 2 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.
8. Return the cooked salmon to the skillet and toss to coat the fish in the sauce. Cook for an additional 1 to 2 minutes, or until the fish is heated through and the sauce has melded with the salmon.
9. Serve the Sauteed Salmon With Brown Butter Cucumbers immediately, garnished with a sprinkle of freshly ground black pepper, if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Start by placing the whole egg and egg yolk in a mini food processor.
Add the mustard and lemon juice.
Place the lid on tight and turn the processor on.
Slowly drizzle in the olive oil in a thin stream.
Remove half of the mayo and reserve for another use.
To the remaining 1/2 cup of mayo in the processor, add in the garlic, anchovies, Parmesan and black pepper.
Replace lid and turn on until smooth.
Taste for salt (I find that the saltiness of the anchovies will determine if you need to add more salt or none at all.)
Refrigerate until ready to use.
Tastes best after a couple hours in the fridge.
For the sandwich, lightly brush the turkey breast tenderloins with olive oil.
Sprinkle with desired amount of Cajun (or favorite seasoning of your choice) and grill over medium-high for 8-10 minutes, or until fully cooked.
Slice into medallions when the turkey has cooled slightly.
Slather dressing on one side (or both) of a slice of bread.
Top with sliced grilled turkey, bacon, tomato, lettuce and the remaining piece of bread.
Serve with your favorite potato chips and enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the egg, egg yolk, grainy Dijon mustard, lemon juice, light olive oil, garlic, and anchovies. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
3. Place the turkey breast tenderloins in a single layer on a baking sheet, and season with Cajun seasoning or more to taste. Roast the turkey in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until it reaches an internal temperature of 165°F (74°C).
4. While the turkey is cooking, prepare the Caesar dressing by following the recipe provided above.
5. Once the turkey is cooked, let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it thinly.
6. In a large skillet, cook the bacon over medium heat until crisp and fully cooked. Drain the excess fat, and let the bacon cool.
7. In a large bowl, toss the sliced turkey with the Caesar dressing.
8. Toast the bread slices in the oven, and let them cool.
9. In a large bowl, toss the lettuce leaves with a little olive oil, salt, and pepper.
10. Assemble the sandwich by spreading the Caesar dressing on one side of the bread slices, layering the turkey, lettuce, and tomato on the other side, and adding a few crispy bacon slices on top.
11. Serve the Caesar BLT Club sandwich immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Heat oil in a large saute pan or wok.
Add the chicken or beef and cook until brown on the outside.
Remove from heat and place on paper towel.
Open can of coconut milk without shaking it.
Put curry paste, onion, and chilies if using in the wok on medium heat, and add the thick cream from the top 1/3 of the coconut can.
Let milk, onion, chilies and paste simmer until the paste releases its oil and the oil appears on top of the coconut milk.
Add meat and bring to a boil adding the remaining coconut milk.
Then lower heat, add cinnamon sticks, cover, and let simmer until the meat is tender.
Add fish sauce, sugar, onions, potatoes, peanut butter, and limejuice.
Cover and cook on low heat for 15 to 20 minutes.
Add peanuts.
Taste/add additional, fish sauce, sugar, or limejuice as needed.
Remove from heat and sprinkle with fried sliced shallots.
Serve with or over Jasmine Rice.
pred:
1. In a large saucepan, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the curry paste and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly, until fragrant.
2. Add the chicken or beef, potatoes, onions, and peanuts to the saucepan. Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the chicken or beef is cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
3. Add the coconut milk, fish sauce, lime juice or tamarind juice, and palm sugar or brown sugar. Stir well to combine.
4. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for 15-20 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and the flavors have melded together.
5. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. Serve the Thai Curry over rice or noodles, garnished with fried sliced shallots and a sprinkle of fresh cilantro.

[/INST]

Ingredients:
- 1 (13 1/2 ounce) can coconut milk (approximately 1 1/2 cups)
- 6 chicken thighs (cut into 1 1/2 to 2-inch cubes) or 1 12 lbs boneless chicken breasts (cut into 1 1/2 to 2-inch cubes) or 1 12 lbs beef (cut into 1 1/2 to 2-inch cubes)
- 2 tablespoons massaman curry paste
- 1 tablespoon peanut butter
- 2 cinnamon sticks
- 4 -5 small red potatoes or 4 -5 small new potatoes, cut into fourths
- 2 small onions, cut into fourths
- 12 cup roasted unsalted peanuts
- 2 tablespoons fish sauce
- 1 12 teaspoons lime juice or 1 12 teaspoons tamarind juice
- 14 cup peanut oil or 14 cup vegetable oil
-

gt:
Heat a skillet over medium heat and coat with cooking spray.
Pan grill sweet Italian chicken patties for 6 minutes on both sides, to an internal temperature of 165 degrees F.
To assemble: slice the deli rolls in half, top with the grilled patties, slices of mozzarella cheese and roasted red peppers.
Serve immediately.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
2. Prepare the chicken grillers by cutting them into bite-sized pieces.
3. In a small bowl, mix the roasted red peppers, fresh mozzarella, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
4. Spray the chicken grillers with olive oil cooking spray, and place them on the grill or grill pan. Cook for about 5-7 minutes on each side, or until they are cooked through and the breading is crispy.
5. While the chicken grillers are cooking, prepare the rolls by slicing them in half lengthwise.
6. Once the chicken grillers are cooked, remove them from the grill or grill pan and place them on a plate.
7. Spread the roasted red pepper and mozzarella mixture on the sliced rolls.
8. Assemble the sandwiches by placing the cooked chicken grillers on top of the rolls, and serve immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Chop the lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, and avocado.
Mix all ingredients together!
Simple as that.
Garnish with a bit more cilantro.
This salad is hearty and delicious!
pred:
To cook a delightful Frito Salad dish, follow these steps:
1. Wash and chop the Iceberg Lettuce, Roma Tomatoes, and Avocado into bite-sized pieces.
2. In a large bowl, combine the chopped lettuce, tomatoes, and avocado.
3. Add the Kidney Beans, Medium Black Olives, and Fritos to the bowl.
4. In a small bowl, mix the Cilantro and Zesty Italian Dressing.
5. Pour the dressing mixture over the salad and toss to combine.
6. Serve the Frito Salad immediately, and enjoy!

This Frito Salad dish is a delicious and healthy meal option, as it combines a variety of fresh vegetables, beans, and crunchy Fritos, providing a balance of flavors and textures. The zesty Italian dressing adds a tangy and refreshing taste to the salad, making it a satisfying and enjoyable meal.

gt:
In top of a double boiler over simmering water, whisk together egg yolks and sugar until smooth.
Keep whisking until sugar is completely dissolved and you have a custardy consistency.
Stir in Marsala wine.
Continue to cook and whisk constantly until mixture thickens and bubbles start to form.
Remove from heat and serve immediately.
This is also wonderful room temperature.
I sometimes add a bit of lemon zest.
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the egg yolks and sugar until well combined.
2. Gradually add the Marsala wine, whisking continuously to prevent the egg yolks from curdling.
3. Place the bowl over a saucepan of simmering water, making sure the bottom of the bowl is not touching the water.
4. Cook the mixture over low heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens and coats the back of a spoon.
5. Remove the bowl from the heat and stir in the vanilla extract.
6. Allow the mixture to cool slightly, then carefully pour it into a clean, dry glass or airtight container.
7. Refrigerate the Zabaglione mixture for at least 2 hours or overnight.
8. Before serving, whisk the mixture again to re-incorporate any air bubbles and serve immediately.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Zabaglione!

gt:
Cook the chicken breast pieces in the water in a large pot over high heat until done (170 degrees).
Remove the chicken pieces to plate and cover with plastic wrap; set aside.
Pour the dried pasta in to the same boiling water and cook until tender, about 6 minutes.
Drain in a colander; set aside.
Place the Greek yogurt, the Hidden Valley Original Ranch Seasoning Mix, the reserved marinating juice from the artichoke hearts, Parmesan cheese, the zest and juice of the lemon, white pepper, curry and cayenne powders in a small sized bowl and whisk until well blended and smooth.
Add in the 2 diced chives, carrots, celery, parsley, shallots and pimento and gently stir.
Pour this mixture over the cooked pasta in a larger bowl and add the cooked chicken breast pieces that have been diced into small cubes.
Mix until all is evenly coated.
To serve, plate a serving of the pasta mixture and garnish with (optional) parsley, several grape tomatoes, 1 purple cabbage leaf, chives pieces and several quarters of artichoke hearts.
pred:
To make Chicken Pasta Salad in the Hidden Valley of Good Eats, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the chicken breast, water, and seasoning mix. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 2 hours.
3. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
4. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced shallots and cook until softened, about 2 minutes.
5. Add the marinated artichoke hearts, pimientos, and curry powder. Cook for another 2 minutes.
6. Add the cooked pasta to the skillet and toss to combine.
7. In a small bowl, mix the Greek yogurt, lemon juice, and white pepper.
8. Add the yogurt mixture to the pasta and toss to combine.
9. In a small bowl, mix the grated parmesan cheese, freshly ground black pepper, and a pinch of salt.
10. Add the parmesan mixture to the pasta and toss to combine.
11. Season the chicken with salt and pepper.
12. Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces and add it to the pasta salad.
13. Garnish the salad with the chopped celery, parsley, and carrots.
14. Serve the Chicken Pasta Salad immediately or refrigerate for up to 24 hours before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Chicken Pasta Salad in the Hidden Valley of Good Eats!

gt:
Prepare rice according to package instructions leaving out all optional ingredients and adding vegetable bullion.
Cut turkey sausage into thick slices.
Add 1/4 cup of olive oil and onions to a pan and turn on heat.
When hot add turkey sausage and saute until almost done.
Add black beans and cook for a few minutes until cooked.
Add corn and peppers and cook a few more minutes until done.
Add cooked rice, chili powder, cumin, cayenne pepper, garlic salt and mix well.
In bowl mix cheese soup, half and half, and Tobasco sauce.
Add cheese soup to rice mixture.
Mix well.
May need to add a little oil (1 tbsp) to help with mixing.
Cook until done.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the Turkey Polska Kielbasa over medium heat until browned, then remove and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, add the drained black beans, corn, and green and red peppers. Cook until the vegetables are tender, then add the Campbell's Condensed Cheddar Cheese Soup. Stir until the soup is heated through.
4. In a small bowl, mix the Half and half, Chili powder, Cumin, Cayenne Pepper, Garlic Salt, and Tobasco Sauce.
5. Add the mixture to the skillet with the vegetables and stir to combine.
6. Add the cooked Turkey Polska Kielbasa to the skillet and stir to combine.
7. In a separate bowl, mix the unprepared Basmati Rice with the olive oil, and then add the mixture to the skillet. Stir to combine.
8. Cover the skillet with a lid and bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the dish is hot.

This delicious Cheesy Beans and Rice with Turkey Sausage dish is a comforting and satisfying meal that can be enjoyed by people of all ages. The combination of flavors and textures, along with the tender vegetables and savory sausage, makes it a delightful dish that can be easily customized to suit individual preferences.

gt:
1.
Whisk together the salad dressing ingredients in a bowl.
2.
Put the lettuce and cabbage in a large bowl and dress it with 1/4 cup of the vinaigrette.
Divide it between four serving dishes.
3.
Add 2 ounces of chicken to each salad.
4.
Distribute the corn, cherry tomatoes, avocado, green onion, almonds and dates evenly between the plates.
5.
Top with the goat cheese and serve with additional vinaigrette to taste.
This is just one of those times Im going to give something a ridiculous name.
I hope you trust me and make the recipe and then ask for forgiveness later.
Sorry!
But honestly, the restaurant that inspired this particular salad named it after the street its located on, so, apparently they were at a loss too.
The lovely little gem Im speaking of is Northstar Cafe in Columbus, Ohio.
pred:
To prepare the Worlds Most Weirdly Delicious Salad, follow these steps:

1. In a large bowl, whisk together the olive oil, vinegar, water, honey, mustard, and herbs de Provence. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.

2. Add the chopped romaine lettuce, sliced green cabbage, roasted chicken breast, corn, cherry tomatoes, avocado, green onion, and almonds to the bowl. Gently toss the ingredients to combine.

3. Serve the salad immediately, or refrigerate it for a few hours before serving. This will allow the flavors to meld together and enhance the overall taste of the salad.

4. Garnish the salad with the sliced dates and goat cheese, and serve immediately.

This unique and delicious salad is sure to be a hit at any gathering or meal, thanks to its combination of flavors and textures.

gt:
In a medium frying pan, lightly brown garlic in butter over medium heat, about 2 minutes.
Add chicken and cook, turning, about 10 minutes or until brown on all sides.
Place onion slices on bottom of pan under chicken.
Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper; pour wine or water over chicken.
Cover, reduce heat to low and simmer about 20 minutes or until chicken is done.
Remove chicken to serving plates and keep warm.
Add sour cream to pan drippings and cook, stirring, about 2 minutes until warm but not boiling.
Spoon over chicken.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper on both sides.
3. Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the sliced onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the minced garlic and cook for another minute, until fragrant.
5. Add the chicken breasts to the skillet, and cook until browned on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side.
6. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
7. Pour the white wine or water into the skillet, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes.
8. Add the sour cream to the skillet, stirring to combine.
9. Return the chicken to the skillet, and cook until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened, about 5-7 minutes.
10. Serve the Elegant Garlic Chicken for Two over a bed of rice or noodles.

[/INST]

gt:
Whisk together soy sauce, brown sugar, garlic, ginger, chilies, salt and pepper in a medium bowl.
Add the beef ribs, submerging them in the marinade.
Place in the refrigerator, covered, for at least 1 hour.
After marinating, remove the short ribs from the marinade and pat dry.
Set marinade aside.
Heat oil in a large Dutch oven or oven-safe pot to medium-high heat.
When hot, add short ribs and sear until browned on all sides, turning regularly.
Add rice wine vinegar, beef broth and reserved marinade.
Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer.
Allow to cook 23 hours, until meat falls off the bone.
Serve with coconut Jasmine rice and a fried egg and garnish with chopped green onion.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix together the Low Sodium Soy Sauce, Dark Brown Sugar, minced garlic, minced ginger, and minced red chilies. Set aside.
3. Season the beef short ribs with freshly ground black pepper.
4. Heat the canola oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the beef short ribs and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
5. Remove the beef from the skillet and set aside.
6. In the same skillet, add the rice wine vinegar and cook until it has reduced by half.
7. Add the beef back to the skillet, pour the soy sauce mixture over the beef, and stir to combine.
8. Cover the skillet with a lid and cook in the oven for about 1 1/2 to 2 hours, or until the beef is tender and the sauce has thickened.
9. If you'd like, you can add the eggs to the skillet and cook them until they are cooked to your desired level of doneness.
10. Garnish with chopped green onions and serve the Sticky Ginger Short Ribs over rice or noodles.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a small bowl combine butter and brown sugar.
Microwave on high 30 seconds or until butter and sugar have dissolved.
Toss walnuts in the butter/sugar mix.
Spread on a cookie sheet and bake 15-20 minutes or until beginning to brown.
In salad bowl, make the dressing by combining vinegar, oil, and mustard.
Gently toss greens in dressing.
Allow walnuts to cool 10-15 minutes, then toss with greens.
Serve and enjoy!
pred:
To create a delicious Candied Walnut Salad, follow these steps:

1. In a small saucepan, melt the butter over low heat.
2. Add the brown sugar and stir until the sugar is fully melted and combined with the butter.
3. Carefully pour the melted sugar mixture over the chopped walnuts, stirring to coat them evenly.
4. Spread the coated walnuts on a baking sheet and let them cool completely.
5. In a large bowl, combine the mixed baby greens, red wine vinegar, olive oil, and Dijon mustard.
6. Once the walnuts are cooled, add them to the salad mixture, gently tossing to combine.
7. Serve the Candied Walnut Salad immediately, as the walnuts will start to absorb the flavors of the dressing.

This dish is a delightful combination of sweet and tangy flavors, with the candied walnuts adding a delightful crunch and aroma to the salad. The mixed baby greens provide a fresh, crisp texture, while the red wine vinegar and Dijon mustard add a zesty, tangy kick to the overall taste. The olive oil provides a rich, smooth base for the dressing, creating a well-balanced and delicious salad.

gt:
Place melted butter in a 9 by 13 inch baking dish.
Combine the sugar, pecans, orange peel, and cinnamon;sprinkle over the butter.
Arrange bread in the baking dish.
Dot with cream cheese.
In a large bowl, whisk the eggs, orange juice, orange liqueur, and butter flavoring.
Pour over the bread.
cover and refrigerate overnight.
Remove from the refrigerator 30 minutes before baking.
Bake uncovered at.
350 degrees for 25-30 minutes, or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean.
To serve, invert slices onto plate.
pred:
To create a delightful Upside Down Orange French Toast dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the melted butter, sugar, and chopped pecans until well combined.
3. Add the grated orange peel, ground cinnamon, and whisk until well combined.
4. Place the sliced French bread in a single layer on a baking sheet.
5. In a separate bowl, whisk together the cream cheese, eggs, orange juice, orange liqueur (if using), and butter flavoring.
6. Pour the cream cheese mixture over the bread slices, making sure each slice is evenly coated.
7. Place the bread slices, buttered side up, on the prepared baking sheet.
8. Bake the bread in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and the edges are crispy.
9. Carefully flip the bread slices over and bake for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the bread is cooked through and the orange flavor is infused throughout.
10. Serve the Upside Down Orange French Toast warm, with a drizzle of additional orange juice and a sprinkle of chopped pecans on top, if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Press cookie dough onto cookie sheet
Bake at 375F for 12 minutes
Sprinkle nuts, chocolate chips, and marshmallows on top; drizzle with caramel syrup
Return to oven for 6-8 minutes
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Prepare a baking sheet by lightly greasing it or using a non-stick mat.
3. Roll out the refrigerated sugar cookie dough into a thin circle or desired shape.
4. Spread the chopped nuts evenly over the dough, leaving a small border around the edges.
5. Add the mini marshmallows and mini chocolate chips on top of the nuts.
6. Pour the caramel syrup over the marshmallows and chocolate chips.
7. Bake the cookie dough in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the cookie dough is set.
8. Remove the baked cookie dough from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
9. Use a pizza cutter or a sharp knife to cut the cookie dough into slices.
10. Serve the Rocky Road Cookie Pizza immediately, and enjoy!

This delicious Rocky Road Cookie Pizza dish combines the flavors of the sugar cookie dough, nuts, marshmallows, chocolate chips, and caramel syrup to create a unique and indulgent dessert. The cookie dough serves as the crust, while the nuts and marshmallows add a crunchy texture and sweetness. The chocolate chips and caramel syrup provide a rich, sweet, and slightly gooey contrast to the cookie dough. The result is a delightful dessert that is perfect for sharing with friends and family.

gt:
Mix ricotta and egg together.
Stir in flour, baking powder and add a pinch of salt and sugar.
Whisk well to incorporate the flour into the batter.
Let the mixture sit for 10 minutes or so; this allows the leavening to work and will make the pancakes lighter.
Heat a griddle that has been sprayed (or oiled) until a drop of water dances across the surface.
(Ooh!
Dancing water!)
Spoon the batter into 3 or 4 pancakes (3 4 in diameter) and cook until golden brown.
Flip and finish cooking.
These pancakes are very moist and delicate; they remind me of a cheese blintz.
With 20 grams of protein, they will fill you up.
Top with a dab of butter (or more, if you are me) and your favorite syrup.
Personally, I like to mix 1/4 cup of frozen blueberries with a tablespoon of syrup, and heat in the microwave.
Youll get the full flavor of the berries, with enough syrup to make you satisfied.
pred:
To create High Protein Pancakes for One, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your pan or griddle over medium heat.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 1/2 cup of low-fat or part-skim ricotta cheese, the egg, and 2 tablespoons of flour. Mix well until smooth.
3. Add the baking powder, salt, and sugar to the mixture, stirring until well combined.
4. Gradually pour in the milk, stirring constantly until the batter reaches the desired consistency.
5. Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat. Pour a small amount of batter onto the pan, spreading it evenly to form a thin pancake. Cook for about 2 minutes or until the edges start to curl and the pancake is slightly golden.
6. Flip the pancake and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes or until the pancake is cooked through and the edges are crispy.
7. Repeat the process with the remaining batter, adding more oil or butter to the pan as needed to prevent sticking.
8. Serve the pancakes immediately, garnished with your favorite toppings such as fruit, nuts, or powdered sugar.

These High Protein Pancakes for One are a delicious and nutritious breakfast option, providing essential nutrients and energy to start the day.

gt:
Pour milk into bowl add pudding mix and sugar.
Beat with wire whisk for 2 minutes.
Gently fold in whipped topping.
pred:
To make a delicious Cool Whip Frosting dish, follow these steps:

1. In a medium-sized bowl, mix the milk and instant pudding mix according to the package instructions.
2. Stir in the powdered sugar until fully combined.
3. Fold in the Cool Whip until smooth and creamy.
4. Pour the mixture into a serving dish or individual bowls, and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
5. Serve the Cool Whip Frosting immediately, or let it sit in the refrigerator for a few hours to allow the flavors to develop further.

This dish is a simple and delicious dessert that can be enjoyed by people of all ages. The combination of the pudding mix, milk, powdered sugar, and Cool Whip creates a creamy, smooth, and sweet treat that is perfect for parties, gatherings, or as a dessert after a meal.

gt:
Blend 2 tablespoon soy sauce and cornstarch in medium bowl.
Add pork, tossing to coat well.
Blend remaining soy sauce and sherry in small bowl and set aside.
Cook and stir crushed red pepper in butter in large skillet over medium heat until pepper turns golden brown.
Add pork mixture.
Cook and stir for 5 to 7 minutes or until pork is no longer pink.
Remove pork from skillet and set aside.
Add red pepper, green onions and ginger to same skillet.
Cook and stir for 3 minutes or until tender-crisp.
Return pork to skillet with sherry mixture and cook for 2-3 minutes more, stirring constantly until pork is cooked.
Serve over rice.
pred:
[/INST]

[INST]
1. In a small bowl, mix the soy sauce, cornstarch, and dry sherry. Set aside.
2. In a large skillet or wok, heat the butter over medium-high heat. Add the pork and cook until browned, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the red bell pepper and cook for another 3-4 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
4. Pour the soy sauce mixture into the skillet, stirring to combine. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.
5. Remove the pork and bell pepper mixture from the heat and stir in the green onion and grated gingerroot.
6. Serve the Szechuan Pork over hot cooked rice.

Enjoy your delicious Szechuan Pork dish!

gt:
Directions:
Combine all ingredients in a bowl and mix until smooth.
Yes, its that easy!
Cover with plastic wrap and let stand 30 minutes, or refrigerate over night, up to 2 days.
If you refrigerate it beforehand, stir it and allow to sit for 30 minutes to become room temperature.
How to cook a crepe:
Prepare a crepe pan with a 1/2 tsp.
of butter, or very lightly spray it with Pam.
Heat on medium until butter begins to brown.
Take off of burner, and using a ladle pour batter onto the pan, enough batter to cover the entire bottom with a very thin coating.
Tilt the pan to evenly cover it and return to heat and cook until the crepe bubbles and bottom is lightly browned, about 1 1 1/2 minutes.
Turn crepes over with a spatula or with your fingers.
To do this, remove it from the heat and carefully lift one edge of the crepe and then gently hold the edge to lift if off the pan and gently flip it over.
Return to heat and cook the other side until browned, but not evenly.
Slide the crepe onto a plate lined with wax paper.
Repeat with the rest of the batter.
You can store the crepes with plastic wrap in the fridge for 24 hours.
or wrap in plastic and foil to freeze for up to 1 month.
Fill with fruit, whipped cream and syrups and you can either roll it the traditional way, like a cigar, or you can make it into a triangle point.
pred:
1. In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, flour, milk, warm water, and melted butter.
2. Gradually pour the mixture into a non-stick pan, ensuring that the pan is well-greased.
3. Cook the crepes over medium heat, using a spatula to spread the batter evenly and flipping the crepes when the edges start to curl.
4. Cook until the crepes are golden brown on both sides and the batter is set.
5. Serve the crepes immediately, either plain or filled with your favorite ingredients.

[/INST]

gt:
Combine cake mix and pudding mix in large bowl.
Mix eggs, sour cream, water and oil in separate bowl until blended.
Add to dry ingredients; mix well.
Stir in chopped chocolate.
Pour into 5-L slow cooker sprayed with cooking spray; cover with lid.
Cook on HIGH 1-1/2 to 2 hours (or on LOW 2-1/2 to 3 hours) or until toothpick inserted in centre comes out clean.
Cool 10 min.
Serve topped with Cool Whip.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 9x13 inch baking dish.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cake mix, Jell-O pudding mix, eggs, sour cream, water, and oil. Mix until well combined.
3. Pour the batter into the prepared baking dish.
4. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
5. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for about 10 minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.
6. In a large mixing bowl, combine the chopped Baker's Semi-Sweet Chocolate and Cool Whip Whipped Topping. Mix until smooth and creamy.
7. Spread the chocolate mixture evenly over the cooled cake.
8. Refrigerate the cake for at least 2 hours or until the chocolate mixture is set.
9. Cut the cake into 16 equal pieces and serve.

[/INST]

gt: Mix sour cream, ranch dressing mix, black pepper, garlic powder, and jalapeno pepper in a bowl; refrigerate at least 2 hours to allow the flavors to mingle before serving.
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the sour cream, ranch dressing mix, ground black pepper, and garlic powder.
2. Using a spoon, mix the ingredients together until well combined.
3. Add the chopped pickled jalapeno pepper to the mixture and stir to combine.
4. Taste the dip and adjust the seasoning as needed, adding more salt or pepper if desired.
5. Cover the bowl and refrigerate the dip for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
6. Serve the Gramp's Ranch Dip with tortilla chips, pita chips, or vegetables for dipping.

Enjoy your delicious Gramp's Ranch Dip!

gt:
Combine kale and chard in large bowl.
Mix dressing and lemon juice until blended.
Add to kale mixture; toss to coat.
Let stand 10 min.
Add remaining ingredients; mix lightly.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the chopped English cucumbers, halved grape tomatoes, and red onions.
3. In a separate bowl, combine the Cracker Barrel Crumbled Feta Cheese with Oregano, Sun Dried Tomatoes, and Black Pepper.
4. In a small bowl, whisk the Kraft Extra Virgin Olive Oil Greek Feta Dressing.
5. Add the whisked dressing to the cucumber, tomato, and onion mixture, and toss to combine.
6. Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
7. Roast the vegetables in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
8. While the vegetables are roasting, prepare the Market Greens Greek Salad by washing and drying the kale and Swiss chard leaves.
9. In a large bowl, combine the torn kale and Swiss chard leaves, and toss them with the whisked dressing.
10. Add the roasted vegetables to the bowl with the kale and Swiss chard leaves, and toss to combine.
11. Serve the Market Greens Greek Salad immediately, or refrigerate it for later use.

Enjoy your Market Greens Greek Salad, a delicious and healthy meal that combines the freshness of the roasted vegetables with the vibrant flavors of the Greek dressing and crumbled feta cheese.

gt:
On a work surface place 4 slices of bread and arrange 1/2 cup cheddar on each slice, top with 2 tomato slices and 1 T basil.
Top with remaining bread slices.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat and coat pan with Pam.
Add sandwiches to pan and cook for 3-5 minutes or until lightly browned; turn sandwiches over and cover and cook for another 2-4 minutes or until cheese melts.
pred:
[INST]
To prepare Grilled Cheese With a Twist! using the provided ingredients, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Spread a thin layer of Pam cooking spray or cooking spray on the bottom of a large skillet or frying pan.
3. Place the 8 slices of white bread in the skillet or frying pan, and let them sit for a few minutes to allow them to become slightly crispy.
4. Add the 2 cups of sharp cheddar cheese, shredded, to the skillet or frying pan.
5. Cook the cheese until it is melted and bubbly, stirring occasionally to ensure even distribution.
6. Add the 8 slices of tomatoes to the skillet or frying pan, and cook for a few minutes until they are slightly softened.
7. Add the 14 cups of basil, sliced, to the skillet or frying pan, and cook for a few more minutes until the basil is slightly wilted.
8. Carefully transfer the cooked bread, cheese, and tomato mixture to a baking sheet or a large, flat surface.
9. Spread the cooked mixture evenly across the baking sheet or flat surface.
10. Bake the Grilled Cheese With a Twist! in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
11. Carefully remove the Grilled Cheese With a Twist! from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes before cutting it into slices.

Enjoy your delicious Grilled Cheese With a Twist!

gt:
preheat oven to 400F.
Add 2 Tbsp butter to oven safe skillet and melt in oven.
Add Vanilla to butter to butter and combine.
Place strawberries, cut side down in skillet andsprinkle with brown sugar.
Bake at 400F for 10 minutes or until berries are soft.
Remove pan from oven.
With a slotted spoon, remove berries from pan and set aside to let cool.
Add wine and vinegar to skillet and simmer over medium heat until reduced slightly.
Remove from heat and whisk in chilled butter.
To serve, spoon ice cream into dessert bowls, top with warm strawberries and drizzle with sauce.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a small saucepan, combine the butter, vanilla, and brown sugar. Cook over medium heat until the sugar has melted and the mixture is smooth.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the dry red wine and balsamic vinegar.
4. Carefully pour the wine mixture into the saucepan with the butter mixture. Stir gently to combine.
5. Add the chilled butter to the saucepan and continue stirring until the butter has melted and the sauce is smooth.
6. Place the strawberries in a single layer on a baking sheet.
7. Drizzle the sauce over the strawberries, making sure to coat them evenly.
8. Roast the strawberries in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
9. Remove the strawberries from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
10. Serve the roasted strawberries with the sauce on top, and enjoy your delicious dessert.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 180C/350F.
Combine egg and milk, and stir into remaining ingredients.
Drop by rounded teaspoon onto a lightly greased cookie sheet.
Bake until golden (about 20 minutes).
Cool on wire racks.
pred:
To make a delicious Dot's Cheese Bacon Puffs dish, follow these steps:

1. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the milk, egg, and lightly beaten egg.
2. Add the grated cheddar cheese, onions, and bacon to the bowl.
3. Gradually add the self-raising flour, whisking until smooth.
4. Add the grainy mustard (or French mustard) to the mixture, stirring to combine.
5. Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
6. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
7. Pour the mixture onto the prepared baking sheet, spreading it evenly.
8. Bake the mixture in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the puffs are golden brown and cooked through.
9. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the puffs cool for a few minutes.
10. Serve the Dot's Cheese Bacon Puffs warm, and enjoy!

This recipe is a delicious and easy way to make a comforting dish using ingredients that are readily available in most kitchens. The combination of cheese, bacon, and onions creates a satisfying and flavorful dish that is perfect for a cozy meal or a snack.

gt:
In a small bowl, combine the garlic powder, chili powder, salt and paprika.
Rub over both sides of chicken breasts.
In a large skillet, coated with nonstick cooking spray, brown chicken on both sides; drizzle with lime juice.
Cover and cook for 5-7 minutes or until juices run clear.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the chicken breasts, garlic powder, chili powder, salt, and paprika. Mix well to ensure the chicken is evenly coated with the spices.
3. Heat a large skillet or oven-safe pan over medium-high heat. Add a small amount of oil to the pan, and then carefully place the chicken mixture in the pan. Cook the chicken for about 10-12 minutes, or until it is cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
4. Remove the chicken from the pan and set it aside to rest for a few minutes.
5. In a small bowl, mix the lime juice with a pinch of salt. While the chicken is resting, brush the lime mixture over the chicken to help tenderize the meat and add a burst of flavor.
6. Return the chicken to the pan, and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the lime juice has been absorbed.
7. Serve the Southwestern Chicken dish over a bed of rice or your preferred side dish, and enjoy the delicious flavors of the spices and lime juice.

gt:
Heat oil in a large skillet or Dutch oven over medium-high heat.
Saute the onion, sweet potato, and garlic powder in 2 tablespoons broth until tender, about 10 minutes.
Stir in canned tomatoes, beans, tomato sauce, and remaining broth.
Season with chili powder, cumin, basil, pepper, and salt.
Reduce heat and simmer at least 20-25 minutes.
You can add more broth if necessary for a thinner, more stew-like consistency.
Serve topped with cheese and/or sour cream, if desired.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until they are soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the sweet potatoes and cook for an additional 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
4. Add the garlic powder, vegetable broth, and stewed tomatoes. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for about 20-25 minutes, or until the sweet potatoes are tender.
5. While the chili is cooking, prepare the beans by rinsing them and draining them.
6. In a separate pot, heat the canned chickpeas over medium heat.
7. Once the chili is cooked, add the beans, tomato sauce, chili powder, cumin, and salt and pepper to taste. Stir to combine.
8. Transfer the chili mixture to a large baking dish or casserole dish.
9. Bake the chili in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the chili is hot and bubbly, and the sweet potatoes are tender.
10. Serve the Sweet Vegetarian Chili hot, garnished with fresh cilantro, if desired. Enjoy your delicious homemade chili!

gt:
Mix all ingredients in bowl.
That's it.
Can be made in advance and chilled up to 24 hours.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, whisk the eggs until they are well-beaten.
3. Add the mayonnaise, chives, scallion, Dijon mustard, and lemon juice. Whisk until the ingredients are well-combined.
4. Season the egg salad with salt and pepper to taste.
5. Transfer the egg salad to a serving bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
