9. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for about 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Remove the skillet from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

[/INST]

[/INST]

gt:
For best results with this recipe, use apples that hold their shape when baking and aren't too tart.
Do not use Macintosh apples (too soft) or Red Delicious (too bland).
I prefer Cortlands or Empires.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees- if you have a convection oven, do NOT use the convection feature- the dessert will be dry and overcooked on top.
Use the regular baking feature.
This recipe isn't good for microwave use.
Peel and core the apples, then cut them into eighths or into large cubes.
Distribute the apples evenly into a medium-sized ungreased baking dish (I like the white Corning/Pyrex oval dishes) and sprinkle the white sugar and cinnamon over top.
Distribute 1 tbsp of the margarine in dollops throughout the top of the apples (no need to try to stir it in).
In a separate medium mixing bowl, combine the remaining margarine, the oats, brown sugar and flour using your hands or a pastry whisk until it forms a crumbly, dry-ish mixture.
(Note: if you like lots of crumble topping, feel free to double the ingredient quantities for the toppping).
Pour the mixture over top of the apples and spread it out evenly so that all the apples are covered and the edges and corners hidden.
Pat the mixture down lightly so that it looks sort of like a crust.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, until the crumb top has darkened to a golden brown colour.
Remove from the oven and let cool for at least 10 minutes before serving.
Spoon out portions into large bowls and serve with ice cream, thick sweetened yoghurt or milk.
pred:
[INST] <<SYS>>
To prepare Apple Cobbler With Oatmeal, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the white sugar, margarine, and ground cinnamon.
3. Peel and core the apples, then slice them into 1/4-inch (0.6 cm) thick pieces.
4. Add the sliced apples to the sugar mixture and toss them to coat evenly.
5. In a separate bowl, combine the oatmeal, brown sugar, and white flour.
6. Pour the oatmeal mixture over the apples in the large mixing bowl, and toss to combine evenly.
7. Transfer the apple mixture to a 9x13-inch (23x33 cm) baking dish that has been greased or lined with parchment paper.
8. Bake the cobbler in the preheated oven for 35-40 minutes, or until the apples are tender and the cobbler is golden brown.
9. Remove the cobbler from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 425F.
In a large bowl, mix together turkey, bread crumbs, basil, oregano, parsley, garlic salt, parmesan cheese , egg, olive oil, and steak spice.
Form meat mixture into 1-1/2 meatballs and place on a greased cookie sheet.
Bake for 15 minutes, or until cooked through.
Slice buns in half and place on a baking tray.
Preheat oven to broil and lightly toast buns until golden brown and cheese has melted.
Warm marinara sauce in a large saucepan over low-medium heat or in the microwave until heated through.
Top the bottom half of each toasted bun with 3-4 meatballs, cover in marinara sauce and cheese
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, Italian sausage, bread crumbs, basil, oregano, parsley, garlic salt, and grated Parmesan cheese. Mix well.
3. Shape the mixture into small meatballs.
4. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the meatballs and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
5. Remove the meatballs from the skillet and set aside.
6. In the same skillet, add the marinara sauce and cook until it thickens.
7. Return the meatballs to the skillet and cook for an additional 5-7 minutes, until the meatballs are cooked through.
8. Serve the meatballs on top of the marinara sauce in the center of the buns.
9. Enjoy your delicious Meatball Heroes!

gt:
Cut wings intp three pieces (save tips for making stock).
Heat oil in wok and fry the larger joints on high heat for 3-4 minutes or until browned.
Add Soy, Honey, Wine, Garlic and Ginger, stir well.
Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 30 minutes or until the wings are tender.
Towards the end watch the wings carefully, stir frequently to make sure the glaze does not burn.
Serve warm or at room temperature.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the chicken wings, peanut oil, dark soy sauce, honey, Chinese wine or dry sherry, garlic clove, and grated ginger. Mix well to ensure the chicken is evenly coated with the marinade.
3. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
4. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
5. Remove the chicken wings from the marinade and pat them dry with paper towels.
6. Place the chicken wings on the prepared baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the meat is no longer pink.
7. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the chicken wings cool for a few minutes.
8. Serve the Honey Soy Braised Chicken Wings warm, garnished with additional honey if desired.

This recipe for Bergy Dim Sum #10, Honey Soy Braised Chicken Wings is a delicious and flavorful dish that combines the sweetness of honey with the savory soy sauce and tangy Chinese wine or dry sherry. The addition of garlic and ginger adds depth and complexity to the dish, while the crispy texture of the chicken wings complements the tender meat. This recipe is perfect for those who enjoy a combination of sweet and savory flavors in their dishes.

gt:
Put egg-white in small mixer-bowl for beating; put yolk in measuring cup, beat lightly; add oil and milk and blend.
All the dry ingredients go into a large bowl; stir to mix; add liquid mixture and beat until smooth.
Beat egg-white until stiff, fold lightly into batter; bake on medium-hot griddle.
pred:
Aunt Flo's Waffles:

1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 23 cup of flour, 13 cup of cornmeal, 14 teaspoon of salt, 18 teaspoon of baking soda, and 1 tablespoon of baking powder.
2. Add the 34 cup of buttermilk or sour milk, and the separated large egg. Mix until a smooth batter forms.
3. Heat a waffle iron with a small amount of oil or butter. Pour the batter onto the waffle iron, creating a uniform layer. Cook according to the waffle iron's instructions until the waffles are golden brown and crispy on both sides.
4. Serve the Aunt Flo's Waffles with a side of syrup, butter, or fruit of your choice. Enjoy!

gt:
Combine the pesto, mayo, tuna, and tomatoes.
Salt and pepper to taste.
Spread the tuna mixture on the bottom half of the rolls and top with a slice of cheese (I used hoagie rolls; this is enough filling for four large sandwiches).
Broil until the cheese is slightly browned.
Top with optional lettuce and the other half of the bun.
Serve!
pred:
1. First, prepare the pesto sauce by combining the 6 tablespoons of store-bought pesto sauce with 14 cups of light mayonnaise in a bowl.
2. Next, drain the two cans of albacore tuna and add them to the pesto-mayonnaise mixture.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the diced tomatoes and shredded lettuce (if using) together.
4. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
5. Spread the pesto-tuna mixture onto the four hard rolls, making sure to cover the entire surface.
6. Add the shredded lettuce mixture on top of the pesto-tuna mixture.
7. Place the sandwiches in the preheated oven and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Remove the sandwiches from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before cutting them into halves or quarters.
9. Serve the Pesto Tuna Sandwiches warm, and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Place the flour and salt in a large mixing bowl and gradually add the warm water, mixing to form a stiff dough.
Add the cheese and knead the dough for a few minutes then form into 4 balls.
Flatten the balls to a thickness of about 1/2 inch.
Heat oil in a large frying pan.
Add the arepas and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side until crisp and golden, turning 3 or 4 times.
Drain on kitchen paper.
To Serve - split the arepas in half, place on serving plates and garnish with avocado, tomato slices and olives.
pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the warm water, salt, and masa harina flour. Mix well until the dough comes together.
2. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough into a thin circle, about 6 inches in diameter.
3. Preheat a large skillet or frying pan over medium heat.
4. Place the dough circle on the preheated skillet, and cook for a few minutes until the bottom is golden brown.
5. Flip the dough over, and cook for another minute or until the bottom is golden brown.
6. Remove the dough from the skillet, and place it on a plate.
7. Spread a thin layer of oil on the dough, and then top it with the grated manchego cheese.
8. Place the dough back on the skillet, and cook for a few more minutes until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Slice the avocado and tomatoes into thin strips, and place them on top of the cheese.
10. Add the sliced black olives on top of the avocado and tomatoes.
11. Serve the Cheese Arepas immediately, and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Place the eggs in a small pan and cover with water.
Bring to the boil and cook for 6 minutes.
Drain and run the eggs under cold water until cool.
Peel and then coarsely grate or crumble the eggs into a bowl.
Mix with the salad cream, mayonnaise and chives and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Cut off the bread crusts with a serrated knife - put them to one side for home-made breadcrumbs.
Butter the bread and divide the egg mixture between 4 bread slices.
Top with the remaining bread.
Stack 2 sandwiches together and cut into 3 fingers, then serve.
Cook's tips: Pierce the rounded end of each egg with a pin before cooking to help stop the shell from cracking.
Cooling the eggs under cold water stops them from cooking further and prevents a dark ring forming around the yolk.
For easy peeling, peel the eggs under cold running water over a colander to collect all the bits of shell.
The water stops the shell from sticking to your fingers and the egg.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, salad cream, and mayonnaise until well combined.
3. Add the chopped chives and mix until well combined.
4. Spread one side of each slice of bread with softened butter.
5. Place one egg mixture-covered slice of bread on a baking sheet, and top it with the other slice of bread, buttered side up.
6. Bake the sandwiches in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and the egg mixture is cooked through.
7. Remove the sandwiches from the oven, and let them cool for a few minutes before cutting them into halves or quarters.
8. Serve the Dainty Egg and Chive Tea Sandwiches warm, alongside a cup of tea, for a delightful tea-time treat.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large bowl, whisk all dry ingredients together to combine.
Form a well in the middle of the dry ingredients.
Measure and pour the remaining wet ingredients into the well.
Slowly and gently mix the wet into the dry until just combined.
Scoop into 12 greased or paper-lined muffin tins.
Bake for 15-20 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the Whole Wheat Flour, Baking Powder, Baking Soda, Salt, Cinnamon, Ground Cloves, and Nutmeg.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the Brown Sugar, Canola Oil, and Applesauce until well combined.
4. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, stirring until just combined.
5. Fold in the grated carrot and eggs.
6. Pour the batter into a greased muffin tin, filling each cup about 3/4 full.
7. Bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
8. Allow the muffins to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

These Whole Wheat Carrot Muffins are a delicious and nutritious treat, perfect for breakfast or a snack. The combination of whole wheat flour, brown sugar, and carrots provides a balance of flavors and textures, while the eggs and applesauce add moisture and a touch of sweetness.

gt:
mix to taste.
serve with corn chips.
pred:
1. Open the carton of sour cream and pour it into a large mixing bowl.
2. Open the jar of jargherkin relish and pour it into the bowl with the sour cream.
3. Using a spoon, mix the sour cream and relish together until well combined.
4. Optionally, you can add a pinch of salt and pepper to taste.
5. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
6. Serve the Gherkin Dip with crackers, bread, or vegetables for dipping.

[/INST]

gt:
Rinse off excess starch from the potatoes and bring to the boil in a pan of slightly salted water.
Boil for around 10 minutes.
Pour the oil into the roasting tin and heat it in the oven.
Drain the potatoes in a colander and allow to dry for a few minutes.
Warm the Bovril and drizzle it over the potatoes in the colander to obtain an even cross-hatched pattern.
Mix the potatoes around to get an even coating.
Put the potatoes into the hot roasting tin and stir with a spoon to cover them in oil.
Roast the potatoes in the oven at 200 degC for approximately 1 hour.
Serve hot.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
2. In a large mixing bowl, toss the potato cubes with the olive oil, salt, and Bovril meat extract.
3. Spread the potato mixture evenly on a baking sheet or roasting pan.
4. Roast the potatoes in the preheated oven for 30-40 minutes, or until they are golden brown and crispy on the outside and tender on the inside.
5. Remove the potatoes from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Cut sausage into 1/4 inch cubes, reserving 1/4 of sausage.
Place 1/4 sausage and half can of beef broth in blender.
Puree.
Pour 1 1/2 cans of beef broth in soup pot.
Bring to simmering boil while adding diced onion and sausage cubes.
Add puree, bay leaf, and salt and pepper to taste.
Simmer for 30 minutes.
Add sliced carrots and continue simmering for another 10 minutes.
Rinse split peas and add to simmering pot.
Simmer until peas are soft but NOT mushy.
Adjust salt and pepper to taste.
Serve warm.
pred:
To make Split Pea and Sausage Soup, follow these steps:

1. In a large pot or Dutch oven, combine the dried split peas, beef broth, and bay leaf. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 1 hour or until the peas are tender.

2. While the soup is cooking, in a large skillet, cook the sausage over medium heat until browned and cooked through. Remove the sausage from the skillet and set aside.

3. In the same skillet, add the chopped onion and cook until softened.

4. Add the chopped carrots to the skillet and cook until they are tender.

5. Add the cooked sausage back to the skillet and stir to combine.

6. Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste.

7. Serve the Split Pea and Sausage Soup hot, garnished with fresh parsley or chopped green onions, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Split Pea and Sausage Soup!

gt:
On a wide bottom pan over a medium heat, melt the butter and fry the onion until transparent.
Heat the milk so it is almost boiling and put to one side.
Add the flour to the onion and cook for 5 minutes until the flour has toasted slightly.
At this point, we need to start whisking in the milk slowly, forming a "roux" and dissolving this thick paste slowly by continually adding more milk.
Keep doing this until you finish the milk and you have achieved a smooth and silky bechamel.
Once this has boiled we should bring the heat down to a minimum and add the salt, white pepper powder, nutmeg powder and the thinly chopped Serrano ham and let it simmer for at least an hour, checking frequently to ensure it doesn't stick to the bottom of the pan.
Taste the sauce and season if necessary.
Pour and spread the bechamel onto a baking tray and let it cool down in the fridge until cold and solid.
To put together the croquetas we should have ready a bowl with flour, a bowl with a whisked egg, another bowl with the breadcrumbs and an empty plate.
Start by cutting the solid bechamel into squares with a knife.
Once you have all these pieces, roll each one in between your hands forming balls.
Coat each of the balls in flour, egg wash and finally breadcrumbs so they are nicely covered on the outside and reserve them on a plate until they are all ready to fry
Heat a mild Spanish olive oil in a small deep pot over a high heat until its very hot (180 degrees Celsius).
Check if the oil is ready by dropping in a breadcrumb, if it quickly fries that means the oil is ready, if not just wait a bit longer.
Carefully drop the croquetas one by one into the hot oil until golden and crispy (around 1 and a half minutes for each).
Pat them dry over kitchen paper and enjoy the creaminess of the real Spanish ham croquetas.
Salud!
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the butter, onion, flour, pepper, nutmeg, and salt.
3. Gradually add the milk, stirring constantly, until the mixture is smooth and homogeneous.
4. Stir in the jamon Serrano, eggs, and breadcrumbs.
5. Cover the bowl and refrigerate the mixture for at least 30 minutes.
6. Heat the oil in a large frying pan over medium heat.
7. Using a spoon, scoop out small portions of the mixture and shape them into small balls.
8. Carefully place the balls into the hot oil and fry them until golden brown, turning them occasionally.
9. Remove the croquetas from the oil and drain them on paper towels.
10. Place the croquetas on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until golden brown.
11. Serve the croquetas warm.

[/INST]

gt:
Place the chocolate morsels in the top of a double boiler.
Bring the water to a boil.
Reduce heat to low; cook until the chocolate melts, stirring occasionally.
Set aside, and let cool slightly.
Beat the butter at medium speed of an electric mixer until creamy; gradually add sugar, beating well.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating after each addition.
Stir in melted chocolate, coffee, and vanilla.
Gradually add 1 cup pecans and flour stirring well.
Spoon the chocolate mixture into the pastry shell (or your own pie crust).
Sprinkle with the remaining 1/2 cup pecans.
Bake at 375 degrees for 30 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center comes out almost clean.
Cool completely on a pie rack.
Serve with whipped cream.
pred:
[/INST]

[INST]<<SYS>>
To create a delicious savory Fudge Pie, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the softened butter, brown sugar, and eggs. Mix until well combined.
3. Add the coffee, vanilla extract, and whipped cream to the mixture, stirring until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the chopped pecans and flour.
5. Add the pecan mixture to the butter mixture, stirring until well combined.
6. Pour the mixture into the prepared pie crust or pastry shell.
7. Bake the pie for 35-40 minutes, or until the filling is set and the crust is golden brown.
8. Allow the pie to cool completely before serving.

Enjoy your delicious savory Fudge Pie!

gt:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
Beat first 4 ingredients with whisk until well blended.
Combine cabbages and carrots in large bowl.
Add 1/4 cup peanut butter mixture; toss to coat.
Refrigerate 1 hour.
Meanwhile, place chicken in single layer in shallow pan; brush with remaining peanut butter mixture.
Bake 20 min.
or until chicken is done (170 degrees F); cut into strips.
Spoon cabbage mixture onto platter; top with chicken and onions.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the peanut butter, Asian sesame dressing, grated gingerroot, and water until smooth.
3. Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper, then coat them evenly with the peanut butter mixture.
4. In a large bowl, combine the shredded cabbage, purple cabbage, carrot, and green onions.
5. In a separate bowl, whisk together the remaining ingredients: 2 cups of water, 1/4 cup of grated gingerroot, and 2 tablespoons of soy sauce.
6. Pour the sauce mixture over the cabbage mixture, and toss to combine.
7. Transfer the cabbage mixture to a baking dish, and place the chicken breasts on top.
8. Bake the chicken and cabbage mixture for about 25-30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the cabbage is tender.
9. Remove the dish from the oven, and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Asian Chicken with Cabbage Slaw!

gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Lightly grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Arrange the shrimp in the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
Gently squeeze any excess liquid from the artichoke hearts, break the hearts into quarters, and arrange in spaces between the shrimp.
Sprinkle the bread crumbs and parsley over the shrimp and artichoke hearts; sprinkle lemon juice over the crumbs.
Melt butter with garlic in a small saucepan over medium-low heat; drizzle the butter mixture over the bread crumbs.
Sprinkle the top with Romano cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven until the crumbs and cheese brown lightly and the shrimp turn opaque and orange-pink in color, 10 to 12 minutes.
Serve hot.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the shrimp with the Italian seasoned bread crumbs, parsley, lemon juice, and minced garlic. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
3. Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the shrimp mixture and cook until the shrimp are pink and cooked through, about 4-5 minutes.
4. Remove the shrimp from the skillet and set aside.
5. In the same skillet, add the artichoke hearts and cook until they are tender, about 5-7 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. In a separate bowl, mix the Romano cheese and minced garlic.
7. Assemble the dish by placing the cooked shrimp on a baking sheet. Top the shrimp with the artichoke mixture and then sprinkle the Romano cheese mixture evenly over the top.
8. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the shrimp is cooked through and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Serve the Shrimp Francesca hot, garnished with additional parsley if desired.

[/INST]

This recipe for Shrimp Francesca combines the flavors of shrimp, artichoke hearts, and Romano cheese to create a delicious and satisfying dish. The combination of ingredients results in a rich and savory meal that is perfect for a special occasion or a cozy night in.

gt:
Bring water to a boil in a 3-quart saucepan.
Stir in grits and 2 teaspoons salt.
Continue stirring and simmer until thick, about 4-5 minutes.
In a large frying pan, heat olive oil and saute peppers until soft.
Add spinach and garlic and saute just until the spinach is wilted.
Add shrimp and cook through.
Stir in crumbled bacon.
Sprinkle with remaining salt, pepper and cayenne.
To serve, spoon grits into a bowl, top with shredded cheddar, then top with the shrimp and spinach mixture.
pred:
1. Start by cooking the grits according to the package instructions. This typically involves boiling the grits in water, then simmering them until they reach the desired consistency.
2. While the grits are cooking, prepare the shrimp by peeling and deveining them, then removing the tails. If using frozen shrimp, thaw them and drain them.
3. In a large skillet, cook the bacon over medium heat until it is crispy and cooked through. Remove the bacon from the skillet and set aside.
4. In the same skillet, cook the bell pepper, onion, and garlic until the vegetables are tender.
5. Add the cooked shrimp to the skillet and cook until they are pink and cooked through.
6. Add the cooked grits to the skillet and stir to combine. Season the mixture with the divided kosher salt, black pepper, cayenne pepper, and shredded cheddar cheese.
7. Cook the mixture over medium heat until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth and creamy.
8. Serve the Shrimp and Grits with Spinach and Bacon over a bed of baby spinach.

Enjoy your delicious Shrimp and Grits with Spinach and Bacon dish!

gt:
Mix 3 tbs sugar, butter, and pretzels together.
Pat into a 9x13 in pan.
Bake 10 mins at 350F.
Beat cream cheese, Cool Whip, and 1 cup sugar until light and fluffy.
Spread over baked and cooled pretzel mixture.
Dissolve Jello in boiling water and add raspberries.
Let gel slightly.
Spread Jello mixture on top of cream cheese mixture.
Refrigerate until set and ready to serve.
pred:
1. In a medium saucepan, combine the 6 oz raspberry Jello and 2 cups of boiling water. Stir until the Jello is fully dissolved.
2. In a separate bowl, melt the butter over low heat.
3. Add the melted butter to the Jello mixture and stir until well combined.
4. Add the sugar and stir until the sugar is fully incorporated.
5. Pour the mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish.
6. Spread the frozen raspberries evenly over the top of the mixture.
7. Cover the dish with aluminum foil and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
8. Once the mixture has set, remove it from the refrigerator and let it sit at room temperature for about 30 minutes.
9. In a food processor or blender, crush the pretzels until they are in small pieces.
10. Spread the crushed pretzels evenly over the top of the raspberry mixture.
11. In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese until smooth.
12. Add the Cool Whip and continue to beat until well combined.
13. Add the sugar and continue to beat until the desired consistency is reached.
14. Spread the cream cheese mixture evenly over the top of the pretzel crumb mixture.
15. Refrigerate the Raspberry Pretzel Dessert for at least 2 hours or until it is fully set.

This Raspberry Pretzel Dessert is a delicious and visually appealing treat that combines the sweetness of raspberries with the crunchy texture of pretzels. The dessert is easy to make and can be enjoyed by people of all ages.

gt:
Melt butter and cheese over low heat; add lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, and garlic salt.
Mix well.
Process in blender until smooth.
In bowl, fold in crabmeat and chives.
Slice bread into half inch slices and spread on crabmeat mixture.
Place on ungreased baking sheet.
Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.
Serve immediately.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the shredded cheddar cheese, butter, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, garlic salt, and chopped chives.
3. Spread the mixture evenly over the bread slices, making sure to cover the entire surface.
4. Place the bread slices with the cheese mixture on a baking sheet.
5. Bake the bread slices in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
6. Remove the bread from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Serve the Crab Melt immediately, and enjoy!

This Crab Melt dish is a delicious and satisfying meal that combines the flavors of crab, cheese, and bread. The combination of ingredients creates a rich and savory taste that is perfect for a quick and easy lunch or dinner. The step-by-step instructions make it easy for anyone to prepare this dish at home, and the result is a delightful and satisfying meal that is sure to be a hit with family and friends.

gt:
Preheat a Pizza Stone in a 450-degree oven at least 30 minutes before baking.
Melt 1 teaspoons butter with 2 tablespoons olive oil in heavy large skillet over medium heat.
Add onions and saute until golden, about 1520 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste and remove from pan and set aside.
Melt remaining teaspoons butter with 1 teaspoon olive oil over medium-high heat.
Add mushrooms, garlic, and shallot.
Saute 4 minutes.
Add wine and simmer until almost all liquid is absorbed, stirring frequently, about 7 minutes move to 1 side of the pan.
In the other side of the pan add Sun Dried Tomato and basil and cook an additional 3 minutes.
Lightly brush whole wheat pita with olive and garlic oil.
Sprinkle with 1oz Reduced Fat Mozzarella cheese.
Scatter onions over cheese.
Scatter mushrooms over onions.
Scatter Sun dried Tomato and Basil over mushrooms and top with remaining 1 oz Reduced Fat Mozzarella cheese on top.
Position Pita in the center of the pizza stone and Bake for 10 minutes or until crust and cheese is a golden brown.
Using large spatula, carefully transfer pizzas to cutting board.
Let rest 1 minute.
Slice into wedges and serve.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 475°F (245°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the Smart Balance light butter spread over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until they are soft and caramelized, stirring occasionally.
3. In a large bowl, combine the wild mushrooms, minced garlic, shallot, and white wine. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
4. Spread half of the caramelized onions over the pita bread.
5. Add the mushroom and wine mixture to the pita bread, then top with the remaining caramelized onions.
6. Sprinkle the sun-dried tomatoes and minced basil over the pita bread.
7. Drizzle the olive oil over the pita bread, if desired.
8. Place the pita bread on a baking sheet, and bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Remove from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F.
Cut squash in half, lengthwise, and discard the stem.
Scrape out the seeds and slice squash into wedges.
Toss squash wedges with salt, pepper, and 1 tablespoon olive oil.
Place in a baking dish and cook for 30 to 35 minutes.
While squash is in the oven, whisk together the remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil, minced garlic, chipotles in adobo, and vinegar.
Drizzle chipotle vinaigrette over cooked squash and serve.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Cut the Acorn Squash in half lengthwise, and scoop out the seeds and pulp.
3. Drizzle the cut sides of the squash with 1 tablespoon of olive oil, and season with salt and pepper.
4. Place the squash cut-side down on a baking sheet, and roast for about 45-60 minutes, or until the flesh is tender and the skin is slightly charred.
5. While the squash is roasting, prepare the Chipotle Vinaigrette by combining the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil, minced garlic, chopped chipotle peppers, and vinegar in a small bowl. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. Once the squash is cooked, let it cool for a few minutes before using a fork to scrape out the flesh into a large bowl.
7. Add the Chipotle Vinaigrette to the squash, and toss to combine.
8. Serve the roasted Acorn Squash with Chipotle Vinaigrette as a side dish or a main course.

gt:
Place vanilla cookies in a food processor and process into fine crumbs.
Heat chocolate chips and corn syrup together in a saucepan over low heat.
Cook, stirring often, until chocolate is melted and smooth, about 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in rum and confectioners' sugar until smooth.
Fold in cookie crumbs; dough will be sticky.
Place saucepan in the refrigerator until dough is firm and easy to roll, about 15 minutes.
Cover 2 plates with waxed paper; dust with confectioners' sugar.
Roll dough into 1-inch balls and place on the prepared plates.
Dust rum balls with confectioners' sugar.
Refrigerate until firm, about 30 minutes.
Remove rum balls from refrigerator and transfer to a resealable bag, including the extra confectioners' sugar.
Seal the bag and shake to coat the rum balls completely with confectioners' sugar.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the vanilla wafer cookies, semisweet chocolate chips, light corn syrup, and dark rum. Mix until the cookies are evenly coated with the mixture.
3. Roll the cookie mixture into small balls, about the size of a walnut.
4. Place the rum balls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
5. Bake the rum balls in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until they are set and slightly golden.
6. Remove the rum balls from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
7. While the rum balls are cooling, prepare the confectioners' sugar dusting by mixing 1 cup of confectioners' sugar with a few drops of water to achieve the desired consistency.
8. Once the rum balls have cooled, roll them in the confectioners' sugar dusting.
9. Store the rum balls in an airtight container or a sealed plastic bag to keep them fresh.

[/INST]

gt:
In a large bowl, mix flour, baking powder, baking soda, sugar and salt.
Add cheese and onion and mix with a fork.
Whisk yoghurt, melted butter, eggs and jalapeno together.
Add to dry ingredients.
Stir until evenly moistened.
Bake in lined muffin cups at 400 F for 15 minute.
Delicious on it's own or with cream cheese.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, sugar, and salt.
3. Add the grated cheddar cheese, minced onion, yoghurt or sour cream, and melted butter. Mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and add the finely chopped jalapeno peppers.
5. Gradually add the egg mixture to the cheese mixture, stirring until just combined.
6. Fill muffin cups with the batter, filling each cup about 3/4 full.
7. Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
8. Allow the muffins to cool for a few minutes before removing them from the muffin tin.

Enjoy your delicious Jalapeno Cheese Muffins!

gt:
In a bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, and salt.
Combine milk and oil, pour over the dry ingredients and stir just until moistened.
Turn out onto a floured surface; knead dough 5-6 times.
Roll out dough to 1/2 inch thickness; cut with a floured biscuit cutter.
Place on a greased baking sheet.
Bake at 425 degrees for 13-15 minuted or until golden brown.
Brush with melted butter to prevent hardening of the biscuits.
Serve warm with butter, honey, or preserves.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, and salt.
3. Add the melted butter to the dry ingredients and mix until the dough comes together.
4. Gradually add the milk, mixing until the dough forms a smooth, soft ball.
5. Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and knead it a few times.
6. Roll the dough out to a thickness of about 1/2 inch (1.25 cm).
7. Cut the dough into desired shapes using a biscuit cutter or a round cookie cutter.
8. Place the biscuits on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Bake the biscuits in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown.
10. Remove the biscuits from the oven and let them cool on a wire rack for a few minutes before serving.

By following these key steps, you can prepare a perfect Crusty Yummy Biscuits that will be enjoyed by everyone.

gt:
Cook pasta according to package directions.
Meanwhlie, in a large skillet heat the chicken with the garlic in oive oil for 4-5 minutes or until heated through.
Stir in the half-and-half, taco seasoning and butter.
Cook until just heated.
Season to taste with salt and pepper (none may be required cuz of the taco seasoning.)
Add drained, cooked pasta and toss.
Serve with grated parmesan cheese.
pred:
1. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions.
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook for about 1 minute, until fragrant.
3. Add the cooked chicken or turkey to the skillet, and cook until it is fully cooked through.
4. Add the half-and-half to the skillet, stirring to combine. Cook for a few minutes, until the sauce has thickened slightly.
5. Add the taco seasoning to the skillet, stirring to combine. Cook for an additional minute or two, until the flavors are well-mixed.
6. Add the cooked pasta to the skillet, stirring to combine. Cook for a few minutes, until the pasta is heated through and coated with the sauce.
7. Add the butter to the skillet, stirring to melt it. Cook for a few seconds, until the butter has melted and is fully incorporated into the sauce.
8. Stir in the parmesan cheese, and season with salt and pepper, to taste.
9. Serve the Chicken Taco Pasta immediately, garnished with fresh cilantro, if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F.
Spread pizza dough out into a rimmed cookie sheet (or round pizza pan, stone, peel or whatever you usually use).
Combine pesto and pizza sauce in a small bowl.
Spread over stretched pizza dough.
Top with fresh spinach, then mozzarella.
Bake for about 10-12 minutes or until the crust is firmed up, but not yet golden brown.
Remove pizza from oven and top with crumbled bacon and feta cheese.
Return pizza to the oven and bake for another 5-8 minutes or so until crust is golden brown underneath and the cheese is bubbly and browning.
Remove and serve.
Makes 1 large pizza.
Notes: 1.
Be sure to put the spinach underneath the cheese, because otherwise it gets crispy and dry.
2.
You could also use goat cheese instead of the feta.
I would have, but I ran out.
The feta is nice, too.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 475°F (245°C).
2. Roll out the pizza dough on a lightly floured surface to your desired thickness.
3. Place the rolled-out dough on a pizza stone or a baking sheet.
4. Spread a layer of pizza sauce over the dough, leaving a small border around the edges.
5. Add a layer of crumbled feta cheese on top of the sauce.
6. Top the feta cheese with a layer of shredded mozzarella cheese.
7. Add a layer of cooked and crumbled bacon on top of the cheese.
8. Sprinkle fresh baby spinach leaves over the bacon.
9. Drizzle the homemade sun-dried tomato pesto over the spinach.
10. Bake the pizza in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
11. Remove the pizza from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

Enjoy your Spinach, Bacon & Feta Pizza with Sun-Dried Tomato Sauce!

gt:
Combine all ingredients in a large pitcher.
Garnish with mint leaves and orange or lemon slices.
Serve over ice.
pred:
1. In a large pitcher, combine 9 cups of water and 2 cups of fresh lemon juice.
2. Add 1 cup of chilled cranberry juice to the pitcher.
3. Stir in 35 packets of Splenda sugar substitute, replacing the 2 cups of white sugar in the original recipe.
4. Chill the mixture in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or overnight.
5. Serve the Splenda Pink Lemonade in chilled glasses, garnished with a lemon wedge and a sprig of fresh mint, if desired.

This step-by-step guide provides a simple and easy-to-follow recipe for making Splenda Pink Lemonade using the provided ingredients. The substitution of Splenda sugar substitute for white sugar not only reduces the sugar content but also adds a touch of sweetness and a hint of flavor. The chilling process ensures that the drink is refreshing and enjoyable on a hot day.

gt:
Drain out just a small bit of liquid from the can.
In a small saucepan, combine beans with remaining liquid, brown sugar and butter; mix well.
Cook over medium heat until heated through and until sugar and butter is dissolved.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large pot, combine the butter beans, brown sugar, and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 1 hour or until the beans are tender.
3. In a small bowl, mix the cornstarch with a little cold water to form a slurry. Add the slurry to the pot, stirring constantly, and continue cooking for another 15-20 minutes or until the sauce thickens.
4. Remove the pot from the heat and stir in the butter. Allow the mixture to cool for a few minutes before serving.
5. Serve the Sweet and Buttery Butter Beans hot, garnished with chopped fresh parsley if desired.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Place potatoes into a large pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, 10 to 15 minutes.
Drain and cool.
Cut potatoes in half.
Heat a skillet over medium heat; cook and stir onions until softened and golden brown, about 20 minutes.
Add tarragon; pour in white wine to deglaze pan.
Simmer until wine evaporates, 2 to 3 minutes.
Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes.
Drain the bacon slices on paper towels.
Mix potatoes, onion, and bacon together in a large bowl.
Fold tzatziki sauce, chives, salt, and black pepper into potato mixture.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the sliced onion with the dried tarragon, salt, and pepper. Spread the onion mixture evenly on a baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the onions are caramelized and tender.
3. In a large pot, cook the bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove the bacon from the pot and set aside.
4. In the same pot, cook the potatoes in the white wine until tender.
5. In a small bowl, mix the tzatziki sauce with the chopped chives.
6. In a large bowl, combine the cooked potatoes, caramelized onions, and crispy bacon.
7. Pour the tzatziki sauce mixture over the potato mixture and toss to combine.
8. Season the salad with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Serve the Caramelized Onion and Bacon Potato Salad immediately, or refrigerate until ready to serve.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees .
Sift flour into a large bowl.
Add baking soda, sugar and cinnamon and stir the dry ingredients to combine.
In a medium bowl, beat eggs.
Add vanilla extract, melted butter and oil.
Combine the ingredients and add to the dry ingredients.
Using a rubber spatula or wooden spoon, stir to combine the wet and dry ingredients.
Fold in the finely chopped mangoes.
Pour batter into a greased loaf pan and bake for 55 60 minutes or until an inserted toothpick comes out clean.
Let cool in the pan for 10 minutes.
Remove bread from the pan and cool on a cooling rack.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, sugar, and cinnamon.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs, vanilla extract, and melted butter.
4. Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, mixing until just combined.
5. Fold in the finely chopped mangoes.
6. Grease a loaf pan with cooking spray or butter.
7. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
8. Bake for 1 hour, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean.
9. Allow the bread to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then remove it from the pan and let it cool completely on a wire rack.

Enjoy your delicious Mango Bread!

gt:
Combine lamb, leek and marinade in bowl, refrigerate for several hours or overnight.
Barbecue lamb and leek, brushing with marinade, until tender.
Marinade: Combine all ingredients in bowl; mix well.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Season the lamb steaks with salt and pepper.
3. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the sliced leek and cook until it is softened, about 3-4 minutes.
4. Add the rosemary and cook for another minute.
5. Pour the orange juice over the leek mixture, and stir to combine.
6. Add the rum and honey to the skillet, and stir to combine.
7. Place the lamb steaks on a baking sheet, and pour the orange juice mixture over them.
8. Bake the lamb steaks in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C).
9. Remove the lamb steaks from the oven, and let them rest for a few minutes before slicing them into thin pieces.
10. Serve the sliced lamb with the leek and orange sauce on the side.

This delicious Orange and Leek Lamb dish is a perfect combination of flavors, with the sweetness of the orange juice, the earthy taste of the rosemary, and the savory notes of the lamb and leek. The white rum and honey add a touch of warmth and depth to the dish, making it a delightful and satisfying meal.

gt:
Cook the noodles in boiling water until al dente.
Drain, rinse under cold water and drain again.
Drizzle with a little sesame oil and toss.
Place chicken in a bowl and toss with dark soy, five-spice powder and chilli sauce.
Dust with cornflour.
Heat a wok until smoking before adding the groundnut oil.
Add chicken and cook, stirring, until golden brown and cooked through.
Add red pepper, stir fry for a minute, then add onion and beansprouts, cooking for a further 30s.
Stir in the noodles and season with light soy sauce, a dash of sesame oil and black pepper, to taste.
pred:
1. In a large pan, heat the sesame oil over medium heat. Add the chicken breasts and cook until browned on both sides and cooked through. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.

2. In the same pan, add the sliced red bell pepper and bean sprouts. Cook for a few minutes until the vegetables are tender.

3. Add the dark soy sauce, five-spice powder, chili sauce, and cornflour to the pan. Stir to combine and cook for a few more minutes until the sauce has thickened slightly.

4. Add the cooked chicken back to the pan and stir to combine.

5. Add the light soy sauce and fresh ground black pepper to taste. Cook for a few more minutes until the sauce has thickened and coated the chicken and vegetables evenly.

6. Serve the Chicken Chow Mein over medium-cooked egg noodles. Enjoy your delicious and easy-to-prepare savory Chicken Chow Mein dish!

gt:
Whisk together the yogurt, vinegar, 1/4 cup of olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, cinnamon, nutmeg, oregano, and bay leaf in a bowl, and pour into a resealable plastic bag.
Add the thinly sliced lamb, coat with the marinade, squeeze out excess air, and seal the bag.
Marinate in the refrigerator 6 hours to overnight.
Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Pour in the meat and marinade, and cook until the lamb is no longer pink, and is tender, 15 to 20 minutes.
Stir frequently as the meat cooks.
Divide the cooked lamb meat among the warmed pita breads, and garnish with tomatoes, onion, and fresh mint leaves to serve.
pred:
[/SYS]

To make Easy Lamb Shawarma, follow these steps:

1. In a large bowl, combine the plain yogurt, distilled white vinegar, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, cinnamon, nutmeg, oregano, and bay leaf. Mix well.

2. Season the lamb strips with salt and pepper, then add them to the yogurt mixture. Toss to coat the lamb evenly with the marinade. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.

3. Preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.

4. Remove the lamb from the marinade and shake off any excess. Grill the lamb for about 4-5 minutes per side, or until it reaches your desired level of doneness.

5. While the lamb is cooking, prepare the pita bread rounds by spreading a thin layer of hummus on each side.

6. Once the lamb is cooked, let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into thin strips.

7. To assemble the shawarma, place a pita bread round on a plate. Top it with a generous amount of sliced lamb, tomatoes, onion, and fresh mint leaves.

8. Serve the Easy Lamb Shawarma immediately, and enjoy!

gt:
In a large heavy skillet, heat the oil over medium heat.
Add the garlic and saute until it begins to brown.
Remove the garlic with a slotted spoon and set aside.
Add the pepper flakes to the skillet and increase the heat to medium high.
Add the garlic, shrimp, scallops, and paprika.
Saute for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Add the chicken broth and cook for 1 minute.
Remove the shrimp and scallops with a slotted spoon, place on a platter; set aside and keep warm.
Add the lime juice, parsley, and salt and pepper to taste to the pan and just heat through.
Pour the sauce over the shrimp and scallops and serve immediately.
pred:
[INST]
1. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the slivered garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
2. Add the crushed red pepper flakes and cook for an additional 30 seconds.
3. Add the large shrimp and bay scallop to the skillet, stirring to combine. Cook until the shrimp are pink and the scallops are opaque, about 4-5 minutes.
4. Add the paprika, chicken broth, fresh lime juice, and Italian parsley to the skillet. Stir to combine and cook until the shrimp and scallops are cooked through and the sauce has thickened slightly. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
5. Serve the Garlic Shrimp and Scallops over rice or pasta, garnished with additional chopped parsley if desired. Enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Wash the lemons and cut in half; squeeze as much juice as you can out of them.
You should have 2 cups lemon juice, seeds removed.
Repeat with the lime, adding to the lemon juice.
Add the sugar substitute (I like Susta because it doesnt have that Im drinking fake sugar aftertasteit tastes like sugar).
Mix together to blend well.
(Note: if you opt to use real sugar, you should heat it with 1 1/2 cup of water to dissolve the sugar first.)
In a glass gallon jug, add the lemon mix and the club soda.
Cover securely and refrigerate.
Garnish with some lemon zest and mint.
You may use one to two cups of sugar/sugar substitute, depending on your taste.
pred:
1. Begin by washing the lemons and limes thoroughly.
2. Cut the lemons and limes into quarters, removing any seeds and membranes.
3. Juice the lemons and limes, reserving the zest for garnish.
4. In a large bowl, combine the juiced lemons and limes, Susta (or Splenda, or real sugar), and 14 tablespoons of sugar.
5. Stir the mixture until the sugar is fully dissolved.
6. Add the pinches of Club Soda, and stir again.
7. Taste the mixture, and if it is too sweet, add more Club Soda to your liking.
8. Allow the mixture to sit for a few minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
9. Strain the mixture through a fine mesh sieve, pressing on the solids to extract as much liquid as possible.
10. Pour the mixture into a large pitcher, and add the reserved zest for garnish.
11. Serve the Sugar Free Sparkling Lemonade immediately, and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Chop the bacon into small pieces and add to a large soup pot.
Fry until most of the fat has rendered down and the bacon is golden in colour.
Add the onions and garlic, and cook them until softened and translucent.
Add the rest of the prepared vegetables along with the bay leaves, thyme and white wine.
Place on a tight fitting lid and allow the vegetables to steam for about 10 mins.
Add the chicken stock - approx 2l but add a bit more if you feel the soup is not wet enough.
Allow the soup to cook for a further 30 mins, seasoning to taste and either serve immediately or allow to cool and serve the next day.
pred:
[/INST]

[INST]<<SYS>>
To prepare the Courgette and bacon soup recipe, follow these steps:
1. Heat a large saucepan over medium heat and cook the bacon until crispy, then remove and set aside.
2. Add the diced onions and leek to the pan and cook until softened.
3. Add the garlic and cook for a minute, stirring constantly.
4. Pour in the chicken stock and bring to a boil.
5. Add the grated courgette, carrots, and celery to the pan.
6. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
7. Add the crispy bacon back to the pan and stir to combine.
8. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Remove from heat and let the soup cool slightly.
10. Strain the soup through a fine-mesh sieve into a clean saucepan.
11. Return the soup to the heat and stir in the white wine.
12. Bring the soup back to a simmer and cook for about 5-10 minutes, or until the alcohol has cooked off and the flavors have melded together.
13. Remove from heat and let the soup cool slightly.
14. Stir in the fresh thyme and serve the soup hot.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Remove roots, outer leaves, and tops from leeks, leaving 6 inches of each leek.
Cut each diagonally into thirds, then diagonally in half to form 6 triangular pieces.
Rinse under cold water; drain well.
Combine beef broth, tomato paste, salt, thyme, and pepper in a bowl, and stir with a whisk.
Melt butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Add leeks and mushrooms, and saute 6 minutes or until the vegetables are lightly browned.
Add broth mixture.
Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 15 minutes or until leeks are tender.
Uncover, and simmer 7 minutes or until liquid almost evaporates, stirring occasionally.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the butter or margarine over medium heat. Add the sliced leeks and cook until they are softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the nonfat beef broth, tomato paste, salt, dried thyme, and black pepper. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and cover the skillet.
4. Cook the mixture in the oven for about 30-45 minutes, or until the leeks are tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
5. Remove the skillet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
6. Add the quartered mushrooms to the skillet and cook for another 10-15 minutes, or until the mushrooms are tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
7. Serve the Braised Leeks And Mushrooms over rice or noodles, and enjoy your delicious meal!

gt:
Place the pork roast in a slow cooker.
Pour in the vegetable broth and sherry.
Mix in the potatoes, onions, mushrooms, rosemary, and pepper.
Cover, and cook on Low at least 8 hours, to an internal temperature of 145 degrees F (63 degrees C).
Season with salt to taste.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. Season the pork shoulder roast with salt and pepper.
3. In a large, heavy-bottomed pot, combine the vegetable broth, sherry, and rosemary. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 30 minutes.
4. Add the pearl onions and sliced mushrooms to the pot. Simmer for another 30 minutes or until the pork is tender and the vegetables are cooked through.
5. Carefully transfer the pork to a cutting board and let it rest for a few minutes. Cut the pork into bite-sized pieces and serve.

gt:
Soak the chicken in the milk for at least 1/2 hour.
Pre-heat oven to 400 degrees.
Place butter on baking dish large enough to hold all the chicken (I use a jelly-roll pan), and place in the oven.
When the oven is hot and the butter is melted, add the chicken pieces, skin side down.
Bake for 20 minutes; turn skin side up, and bake for another 20 minutes.
Put chicken on platter and keep warm.
Take 3 tbsp.
of drippings from pan, and saute scallions and mushrooms over medium heat.
You want the mushrooms to exude liquid, but you don't want the scallions to brown.
Mix two tsp.
flour with one cup of milk, and whisk until there are no lumps.
Add milk mixture to sauteed veggies, and cook over medium heat until gravy thickens.
You can add more milk if it gets too thick.
N.
B.
I save the flour from coating the chicken and the milk from soaking the chicken to make the gravy.

1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the chicken pieces, milk, butter, flour, seasoning salt, paprika, ground black pepper, and chopped scallions. Mix well until the chicken is evenly coated.
3. Spread the chicken mixture onto a baking sheet or a broiler-fryer pan.
4. Bake the chicken in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the juices run clear.
5. While the chicken is cooking, prepare the gravy by combining the mushrooms, milk, and seasoning salt in a saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the mushrooms are tender and the gravy has thickened.
6. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes.
7. Using a fork, shred the cooked chicken into bite-sized pieces.
8. Pour the gravy over the chicken and stir to combine.
9. Serve the Oven Fried Chicken and Gravy over rice or noodles, and enjoy your delicious meal!

gt:
Pour tomato sauce into a small saucepan over medium heat.
Add spices and stir.
In a cup, combine warm water with flour until it forms a paste, then gradually add to tomato mixture while stirring.
Let simmer for 10 minutes, to thicken.
Cool the sauce then spoon over enchiladas or layered tortillas and cheese, then prepare according to enchilada recipe directions (usually, heat in 425 degree oven for about 15 minutes).
Muy bueno!
pred:
1. Begin by heating a large saucepan over medium heat.
2. Add the 12 ounce can of tomato sauce and stir to combine.
3. Gradually add the warm water, stirring constantly to prevent lumps from forming.
4. In a small bowl, mix the chili powder, cocoa powder, oregano, garlic powder, cumin, and Tabasco sauce (or similar hot pepper sauce).
5. Slowly pour the spice mixture into the saucepan, stirring constantly to ensure the spices are evenly distributed.
6. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for about 30 minutes, or until it thickens and becomes smooth.
7. Stir in the flour, and continue to cook for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the sauce reaches your desired consistency.
8. Remove the sauce from heat, and let it cool slightly before using it to fill your enchiladas.

Enjoy your delicious homemade enchilada sauce!

gt:
Line two baking sheets with parchment paper and set aside.
In the bowl of your mixer, combine all ingredients and blend on medium speed until a soft, smooth dough forms, about 2 minutes.
Wrap and chill the dough for 1 hour.
Towards the end of the chill time, preheat the oven to 350F
Drop tablespoon-sized dough balls onto your baking sheet.
A teaspoon scoop makes this job a snap.
Bake the cookies for 8 to 10 minutes.
The edges will be slightly browned and the cookies will be round and domed.
Cool the cookies completely.
Prepare the icing by blending the softened butter and confectioners' sugar.
Add rum one tablespoon at a time until you have a spreadable icing.
Top each cookie with a dollop of icing and a dash of nutmeg.
If you prefer not to use actual rum, you can use heavy cream and a few drops of rum flavoring.
pred:
To create Nutmeg Bites, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat.

2. In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, nutmeg, and salt. Add the softened butter and mix until the dough comes together. If the dough is too dry, you can add a bit of water, 1 tablespoon at a time, until it reaches the desired consistency.

3. On a floured surface, roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm). Cut out shapes using a cookie cutter or a round cookie cutter. Alternatively, you can use a knife to cut out shapes directly on the dough.

4. Place the shaped dough on the prepared baking sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown. Remove from the oven and let the cookies cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

5. To make the rum icing, combine the confectioners' sugar, softened butter, and rum in a small bowl. Mix until smooth and creamy.

6. Once the cookies are completely cooled, drizzle the rum icing over the cookies. Allow the icing to set before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Nutmeg Bites!

gt:
preheat oven to 375
mix in bowl eggs milk green onion salt and pepper, set aside.
cook bacon and sausage and set aside
cool bacon and sausage when bacon cools chop into pieces
layer baking dish with Cresent roll dough
partially cook hash browns or tater tots and then slightly mash
layer on top of dough the hash browns then sausage then sprinkle with cheese, then add bacon crumbles and lastly the egg mixture
bake in oven for 20 mins then let set for 5
add more cheese the last 5 mins of baking

[/INST]

[INST]
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt, and pepper.
3. Add the chopped green onion and cooked bacon to the bowl.
4. Stir in the cooked sausage and shredded cheese.
5. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
6. Roll out the crescent rolls and place them on top of the egg mixture.
7. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the crescent rolls are golden brown and the filling is set.
8. Let the dish cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Breakfast Caserole!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 F.
Brown ground beef in a skillet over medium heat.
Just before you have browned it completely, add the taco seasoning and stir to mix thoroughly.
Drain off any fat if needed.
Set skillet aside.
Spray a 9x11 baking dish with cooking spray.
Line the bottom of the pan with 6 of the corn tortillas (they will overlap).
Spoon all of the meat mixture on top of the tortilla layer then top with 1 cup of shredded cheese.
Place the remaining 6 tortillas on top of the cheese layer.
Pour the entire jar of salsa on top of the tortillas and spread it evenly.
Sprinkle the remaining 1 cup of cheese evenly over the salsa and place the olives on top of the cheese.
Bake uncovered for 25 minutes until bubbly and hot all the way through.
Remove dish from oven and set it on a rack.
Let it sit a few minutes before cutting.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the ground beef over medium heat until it is browned and cooked through. Season the beef with taco seasoning.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the shredded cheddar cheese, salsa, and black olives.
4. Spread a thin layer of salsa over the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.
5. Layer the cooked ground beef on top of the salsa, followed by a layer of the cheese mixture.
6. Repeat the layers, starting with the beef, then the cheese mixture, and finally the salsa.
7. Bake the lasagna in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Let the lasagna cool for a few minutes before cutting it into squares and serving.

[/INST]

gt:
For the cake: Preheat oven to 350 F. Use cooking spray to grease a 9 x 13 baking pan.
Set pan aside.
Add 3 cups flour, salt, 1 cup sugar, baking powder, 2 eggs, 2 teaspoons vanilla and 1 1/2 cup milk into the bowl of your stand mixer and use the mixer to mix well.
Set mixer to medium-low speed and add 1/2 cup melted butter just until combined.
Pour mixture into the greased baking pan and gently shake until smooth.
For the topping: In medium bowl add 3/4 cup softened butter, brown sugar, 2 tablespoons flour and cinnamon and mix well.
Evenly drop heaping spoonfuls of cinnamon mixture onto the top of the cake batter.
Add apple pieces over the top.
Using a knife gently drag it through the cake batter so that the cinnamon mixture and apples are randomly mixed with batter.
Bake cake for 45 55 minutes until a toothpick inserted into the cake comes out clean.
Allow to cool for 5 minutes.
For the glaze: In a medium bowl add powdered sugar, 5 tablespoons milk and the remaining 1 teaspoon of vanilla.
Whisk well and then drizzle over top of cake.

To prepare the Apple Cinnamon Roll Cake, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
3. Add the eggs, milk, vanilla extract, and melted butter, and mix until well combined.
4. Gradually add the softened butter, mixing until smooth.
5. In a separate bowl, combine the brown sugar, cinnamon, and granny smith apple pieces.
6. Add the apple mixture to the batter, and mix until well combined.
7. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9x13 inch baking dish.
8. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
9. Allow the cake to cool for a few minutes, then roll it up and cut it into slices.
10. Dust the cake with powdered sugar and serve.

[/INST]

gt:
Mix all ingredients with boiling water in your favorite mug.
Adjust ingredients more or less to suit your tastes.
Enjoy!

6. Pour the mixture into a glass, and enjoy your delicious Cocoa Mocha Coffee.

gt:
In a small mixing bowl, combine beef and cream cheese; mix well.
Add horseradish, black pepper and lemon juice, mix until well blended.
Cover, and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Remove leaves and ends from celery, and cut remaining stalks in half.
Spread cream cheese mixture into the celery stalks.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix together the dried beef, cream cheese, horseradish, black pepper, and lemon juice.
3. Cut the celery into small pieces and add them to the bowl.
4. Mix everything together until well combined.
5. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the celery is tender and the mixture is hot and bubbly.
6. Serve the Celery Chesapeake immediately, and enjoy!

gt:
Cook noodles according to package directions until almost tender; drain.
In a large skillet, cook beef, onions and the green pepper over medium heat for 10- 12 minutes or until beef is no longer pink; drain off fat.
Stir in noodles, soup, cheese, water and chili sauce.
Transfer to a greased 8 inch square baking dish.
Toss bread crumbs with melted butter; sprinkle over casserole.
Bake uncovered, at 350F for 35 to 40 minutes or until bubbly and golden.

3. In a separate bowl, mix the cheddar cheese, water, chili sauce, and soft breadcrumbs.
4. Spread the beef mixture evenly over the uncooked egg noodles.

gt:
Preheat oven to 375F.
Place water, 1/2 cup (1 stick) of the butter and 1-1/2 oz.
of the chocolate in large saucepan.
Bring to boil, stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat.
Stir in combined flour and granulated sugar.
Add eggs, sour cream, baking soda and salt; mix well.
Pour into greased and floured 15x10x1-inch baking pan.
Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Place remaining 1/2 cup (1 stick) margarine, remaining 1-1/2 oz.
chocolate and milk in large saucepan; bring to boil.
Remove from heat.
Gradually add powdered sugar, beating until well blended after each addition.
Mix in vanilla.
Spread onto warm cake; sprinkle with pecans.
Cool completely.
Cut into 48 squares to serve.

1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cold water, butter, and BAKER'S Unsweetened Chocolate. Heat the mixture in a saucepan over low heat, stirring constantly, until the chocolate is melted and smooth.
2. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the flour, granulated sugar, eggs, lightly beaten, baking soda, and salt.
3. Gradually add the sifted powdered sugar, milk, and vanilla extract to the chocolate mixture, stirring until well combined.
4. Fold in the chopped PLANTERS Pecans.
5. Pour the batter into a well-greased 9x9 inch baking dish or a 9x13 inch baking dish.
6. Bake in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the square comes out clean.
7. Allow the squares to cool in the pan for a few minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/SYS]

These Swiss Chocolate Squares are a delicious and indulgent treat, perfect for sharing with friends and family. The combination of the rich chocolate, sweet granulated sugar, and the crunchy pecans creates a delightful contrast in flavors and textures. Enjoy!

gt:
Soak the ramp bulbs in several changes of cold water until there are no grains of sand at the bottom of the bowl.
Drain and leave to dry on a clean dish towel.
Warm the vinegar, water, salt and sugar in a small saucepan, stirring until the salt and sugar have dissolved.
Remove from the heat and cool.
Chill, covered, in the refrigerator in an airtight pint container.
Once the pickling liquid is completely cool, add the ramp bulbs and cover.
Allow to pickle for at least 6 hours.
These will keep for up to 2 weeks in the refrigerator.
pred:
1. Wash and trim the ends of the ramps.
2. In a large bowl, combine the rice vinegar, water, and kosher salt.
3. Add the trimmed ramps and let them soak in the mixture for 15-20 minutes.
4. Drain the ramps and rinse them under cold water to remove any excess vinegar.
5. In a large bowl, combine the fava beans, peas, and goat cheese.
6. In a small bowl, mix the sugar, salt, and pepper.
7. Add the sugar mixture to the fava beans and peas, and toss to coat evenly.
8. Add the drained ramps to the bowl and toss to combine.
9. In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, and minced mint leaves.
10. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat evenly.
11. Serve the salad immediately or refrigerate for a few hours before serving.

[/INST]

This Fava Bean Salad With Pickled Ramps And Goat Cheese dish is a delicious and healthy option that can be enjoyed as a side dish or a main course. The combination of fava beans, peas, and goat cheese provides a balance of flavors and textures, while the pickled ramps add a tangy and slightly sweet element to the dish. The mint leaves add a refreshing and aromatic touch to the salad, making it a delightful and satisfying meal.

gt:
Preheat oven to 350F (325F for glass baking pan).
In small bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs and butter; mix well.
Press crumb mixture firmly on bottom of 13x9-inch baking pan.
Layer evenly with remaining ingredients;press down firmly with fork.
Pour condensed milk evenly over bars.
Bake 25 minutes or until lightly browned.
Cool.
Chilling whole pan in fridge makes cutting a breeze.
Cut into bars or diamonds.
Store leftovers covered at room temperature or freeze.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Line a 9x13 inch baking dish with parchment paper or aluminum foil, leaving a little overhang on all sides.
3. In a large bowl, mix together the melted butter or margarine, graham cracker crumbs, and chopped nuts until well combined. Press the mixture firmly into the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
4. Bake the crust for 10-12 minutes, or until it is set and lightly golden. Remove from the oven and let it cool completely.
5. In a large mixing bowl, beat the sweetened condensed milk, butterscotch chips, and semi-sweet chocolate chips until smooth and well combined.
6. Spread the mixture evenly over the cooled crust.
7. Sprinkle the flaked coconut evenly over the top of the filling.
8. Bake the bars in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the edges are set and the center is slightly wobbly.
9. Remove the bars from the oven and let them cool completely before cutting them into bars and serving.

[/INST]

Please provide the step-by-step instructions for cooking a delicious Seven Layer Magic Bars (With a Sturdy Crust) from scratch using the following ingredients: 2 cups graham cracker crumbs,12 cup butter or 12 cup margarine, melted,34 cup butterscotch chips,34 semi-sweet chocolate chips,1 cup flaked coconut,1 cup nuts, chopped,1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk.

gt:
Mix the ingredients together for the dressing, set aside.
Stir the chickpeas, tuna, parsley, celery, & scallions together in a bowl.
Pour over the dressing, mix well.
Stuff each pita with equal amounts of the tuna mixture.
pred:
1. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
2. Add the minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
3. Add the lemon juice, oregano, marjoram, salt, black pepper, and dry mustard. Cook for another minute, stirring constantly.
4. Add the chickpeas and tuna to the skillet, stirring to combine.
5. Cook for about 5 minutes, or until the chickpeas are heated through and the tuna is cooked through.
6. Remove the skillet from the heat and stir in the parsley and celery.
7. Allow the mixture to cool slightly.
8. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
9. Place the pita bread on a baking sheet and brush with olive oil.
10. Bake the pita bread in the preheated oven for about 10-12 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy.
11. Serve the cooked chickpea and tuna mixture on top of the pita bread.

Enjoy your delicious Greek Chickpea & Tuna Pitas dish!

gt:
Heat a Dutch oven over medium heat.
Add the oil and swirl to coat.
Add the onion and garlic; cover and cook 8 minutes oruntil tender, stirring occasionally.
Stir in smoked paprika; cook 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Add wine, broth, and tomatoes; bring to a boil.
Add the chickpeas.
Reduce heat, and simmer until the sauce thickens slightly (about 15 minutes); stir occasionally.
Add spinach; cover and cook 2 minutes or until the spinach wilts.
Stir in parsley and vinegar.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onions and garlic, and cook until the onions are softened and translucent, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the smoky paprika and cook for another minute, stirring constantly.
4. Pour in the dry white wine, and let it cook until it has reduced by half, about 5 minutes.
5. Add the vegetable broth, tomatoes, chickpeas, and spinach to the saucepan. Stir to combine, and bring the mixture to a simmer.
6. Cover the saucepan, and transfer it to the preheated oven. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the chickpeas are tender and the spinach is wilted.
7. Remove the saucepan from the oven, and stir in the sherry wine vinegar. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Serve the Chickpeas and Spinach With Smoky Paprika hot, over rice or with crusty bread. Enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Heat oil in heavy large pot over medium-high heat.
Add onions; saute until golden, about 8 minutes.
Add mushrooms; saute until tender, about 8 minutes.
Add wine and thyme; boil until liquid is reduced by half, about 1 minute.
Add next 4 ingredients; cover and simmer gently until vegetables are tender, about 25 minutes.
Stir in bok choy; simmer uncovered until tender, about 8 minutes.
Using slotted spoon, transfer 3/4 cup potato pieces to small bowl; mash with fork.
Return mashed potatoes to pot; simmer until juices thicken, about 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper; serve.
