1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large oven-safe pot or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until they are soft and translucent, stirring occasionally.
3. Add the wild mushrooms and cook until they release their juices and become tender, stirring occasionally.
4. Pour in the dry white wine and cook until it has evaporated, stirring occasionally.
5. Add the dried thyme, vegetable broth, and soy sauce to the pot. Stir to combine.
6. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 30 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender.
7. Add the bok choy to the pot, and cook for an additional 5-10 minutes or until the bok choy is tender but still bright green.
8. Season the stew with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Transfer the stew to a large oven-safe casserole dish or baking tray.
10. Cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven for about 30-45 minutes, or until the stew is hot and bubbly.
11. Remove the foil, and let the stew sit for a few minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
12. Serve the Wild-mushroom and Potato Stew hot, garnished with fresh thyme or parsley, if desired.

[/SYS]

This Wild-mushroom and Potato Stew is a delicious and hearty dish that combines the earthy flavors of wild mushrooms with the comforting warmth of potatoes. The addition of bok choy adds a touch of freshness and crunch, while the soy sauce and dried thyme add depth and complexity to the overall taste. The cooking procedure involves several steps, but the end result is a satisfying and flavorful stew that can be enjoyed by a wide range of palates.

gt:
Heat the butter in a frying pan and fry the onion slowly until golden brown.
I added little shrimps this time.
Prepare the ingredients.
Heat vegetable oil in a pot and fry the meat until the colour changes.
Add potatoes.
After the potatoes are coated with oil and cooked for a while, add the little shrimps and carrot.
Saute a little further.
Pour in the water and add bay leaves.
Bring to a boil.
After bringing to a boil, skim any scum.
Turn down the heat to low to medium and simmer for 20 minutes.
Turn off the heat (this is necessary), break the curry roux, and add to the pot.
Add the fried onion, Japanese Worcestershire-style sauce, Yakiniku Japanese BBQ sauce and chutney.
These are the seasonings I used in this recipe.
Simmer over low heat.
pred:
1. Begin by heating the vegetable oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.
2. Add the onion and cook until it becomes soft and translucent.
3. Add the carrot and continue cooking until both vegetables are tender.
4. Add the pork and cook until it is browned and cooked through.
5. Add the potatoes and cook until they are tender.
6. Add the water and bring the mixture to a boil.
7. Add the curry roux, bay leaves, and seasoning according to your taste.
8. Reduce heat to low and simmer for about 20-30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
9. Add the chutney and Japanese Worcestershire-style sauce, and stir to combine.
10. Simmer for another 5-10 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and the flavors have melded together.
11. Serve the curry over rice or with your choice of side dish.

[/INST]

gt:
Cover eggs in cold water.
Salt heavily.
Bring to a rapid boil, leave lid on and remove from heat.
Let sit 20 minutes.
Place in ice water to cool.
Peel and cut lengthwise.
Remove the yolks and place in a medium bowl.
Place the whites on a platter.
Mash yolks with the remaining ingredients.
Stir until smooth.
Pipe or spoon filling into each egg white.
Sprinkle each with a bit more kosher salt.
Refrigerate until serving time.
pred:
To make Kims Kickin Deviled Eggs, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Carefully peel the hard boiled eggs and place them in a large mixing bowl.
3. Add the Miracle Whip, sour cream, white vinegar, spicy brown mustard, sugar, Frank's hot sauce, kosher salt, and black pepper to the bowl.
4. Using a fork, mash the ingredients together until they reach a smooth, creamy consistency.
5. Carefully transfer the mixture to a piping bag or a plastic bag with a small hole cut in the corner.
6. Pipe the mixture onto the tops of the hard boiled eggs.
7. Place the eggs in the preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the filling is set and the eggs are cooked through.
8. Allow the eggs to cool for a few minutes before serving.

Kims Kickin Deviled Eggs are a delicious and spicy twist on traditional deviled eggs, perfect for parties or gatherings. The combination of Miracle Whip, sour cream, and spicy brown mustard adds a unique flavor profile to the classic deviled egg recipe.

gt:
Cover large baking sheet with foil.
Spread semi-sweet chocolate in a thin layer onto pan.
Refrigerate 10 min.
Spread white chocolate in a thin layer over semi-sweet chocolate.
Sprinkle with remaining ingredients.
Refrigerate 4 hours or until firm.
Break into pieces or cut with cookie cutters to make Holiday OREO Bark Christmas Trees (see Tip).
Store in tightly covered container.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a non-stick mat.
3. In a large bowl, melt the semi-sweet chocolate and white chocolate together, stirring occasionally.
4. Add the melted chocolate mixture to the chopped OREO cookies, stirring until the cookies are evenly coated.
5. Spread the cookie mixture onto the prepared baking sheet, creating a thin layer.
6. Place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are slightly crispy.
7. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. While the bark is cooling, crush the candy canes into small pieces.
9. Once the bark is cool, spread the crushed candy cane pieces evenly over the top of the bark.
10. Allow the bark to cool completely before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Holiday OREO Bark!

gt:
Put the shallots and the raisins in 2 separate, small, heatproof bowls.
In a small saucepan, combine the sherry, vinegar and agave syrup and bring to a boil.
Pour 2 tablespoons of the hot mixture over the raisins; pour the rest over the shallots and add the thyme and 1 teaspoon of salt.
Cover both bowls.
Light a grill.
In a small bowl, combine the lemon zest and juice with the olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Set aside 3 tablespoons of the dressing.
Add the garlic, crushed red pepper and rosemary to the remaining dressing in the bowl.
On a rimmed baking sheet, drizzle the broccoli with half of the dressing from the bowl and toss well.
Season with salt and pepper.
Brush the remaining dressing from the bowl on the ciabatta slices.
Grill the broccoli over moderate heat, turning, until lightly charred and barely tender, 8 minutes.
Transfer the broccoli to a bowl, cover with foil and let steam for 5 minutes.
Grill the ciabatta over moderate heat until crisp, 1 minute.
Cut the ciabatta into 1-inch cubes.
Transfer to a platter and top with the grilled broccoli.
Drain the raisins and shallots and scatter them over the broccoli.
Garnish with the toasted pine nuts, drizzle with the reserved 3 tablespoons of dressing and serve.
pred:
1. Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
2. In a large bowl, toss the broccoli with the olive oil, garlic, red pepper flakes, rosemary, and salt.
3. Grill the broccoli for 4-5 minutes, flipping halfway through, until it is tender and slightly charred.
4. In a small bowl, mix the golden raisins, dry sherry, sherry vinegar, agave syrup, and thyme.
5. In a large bowl, combine the grilled broccoli, bread, raisin mixture, and toasted pine nuts.
6. In a small bowl, mix the minced garlic, crushed red pepper, and chopped thyme.
7. Drizzle the dressing over the salad, tossing to coat evenly.
8. Serve immediately or refrigerate for a few hours before serving.

This Grilled Broccoli and Bread Salad with Pickled Shallots dish is a delicious and healthy meal option that combines the natural flavors of broccoli, bread, and pickled shallots. The grilled broccoli adds a smoky, charred taste, while the bread provides a hearty, satisfying texture. The pickled shallots add a tangy, zesty flavor that complements the other ingredients. The dressing, made from the raisin mixture, sherry vinegar, and agave syrup, adds a sweet and tangy touch to the dish, balancing the flavors and making it a delightful meal.

gt:
Preheat oven to 400, Peel and wash potatoes, dice and begin to boil.
In a large skillet add ground beef, onion, garlic, salt and pepper, and Worcestershire sauce.
Cook until beef is browned.
Drain corn and peas.
When potatoes are done, mash well.
Add ground beef to a glass baking dish.
Top with corn, peas and then mashed potatoes.
Coat top of potatoes with cheese.
Bake for 20 min.
Enjoy!
!
pred:
To create a delicious Cottage pie, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).

2. In a large skillet, cook the ground beef over medium heat until it is browned and cooked through. Drain any excess fat.

3. Add the minced onion and garlic to the skillet, and cook until the onion is softened.

4. Add the cooked ground beef to a large mixing bowl.

5. Add the mashed potatoes, worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper to the bowl. Mix well to combine.

6. Transfer the mixture to a 9-inch (23cm) baking dish.

7. Spread the corn and sweet peas evenly over the top of the beef mixture.

8. Sprinkle the shredded cheddar cheese over the top of the vegetables.

9. Bake the Cottage pie in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly, and the filling is hot and bubbly.

10. Serve the Cottage pie hot, and enjoy!

Feel free to adjust the ingredients or cooking time according to your preferences.

gt:
Get your ice cream maker ready, based on your directions.
In a large bowl, mix the yogurt, milk, heavy cream, honey, and vanilla bean paste together.
Pour the yogurt mix into the ice cream machine and turn it on.
Let the frozen yogurt begin to freeze and set up, about 10 minutes.
Crush half of the raspberries, then toss the crushed berries and the remaining whole berries into the frozen yogurt.
Add the chocolate chips to the frozen yogurt and let the machine run for another 3-4 minutes.
Serve right away if you like a softer consistency.
Pour into an airtight container and freeze if you want the frozen yogurt to set up a bit more.
Makes about 4 cups.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Raspberry Chocolate Chip Frozen Yogurt dish, follow these steps:

1. In a large mixing bowl, combine 4 cups of plain yogurt, 1/2 cup of milk, and 1/2 cup of heavy cream. Whisk the ingredients until smooth and well-combined.
2. Add 3/4 cup of honey and whisk until smooth.
3. Add 2 teaspoons of vanilla bean paste or extract, and whisk until well-incorporated.
4. In a separate bowl, mix 1-1/2 cups of fresh raspberries with 1 cup of semi-sweet chocolate chips.
5. Pour the yogurt mixture into a freezer-safe container, and layer the raspberry and chocolate mixture on top.
6. Cover the container with plastic wrap or aluminum foil, and freeze the mixture for at least 4 hours or overnight.
7. Once the mixture is frozen, use a spatula or a fork to scoop out desired portions.

This Raspberry Chocolate Chip Frozen Yogurt dish is a delicious and refreshing treat that combines the tangy taste of yogurt with the sweetness of raspberries and the richness of chocolate chips. The combination of these flavors creates a delightful and satisfying dessert or snack.

gt: mix well, chill and enjoy.
pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the black beans, corn, tomatoes, onion, and red bell pepper.
2. Add the lime juice and balsamic vinegar, and mix well.
3. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
4. Serve the Balsamic Black Bean and Corn Salsa immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.

[/INST]

gt:
Heat the oil over medium high heat in a large saucepan.
Mix flour, salt, and pepper in a large bowl.
Add meat to flour mixture and dredge until lightly coated.
Add the meat to the oil and cook until brown on all sides.
Top with remaining ingredients and stir.
Cover and cook on medium heat for 90 minutes.
Remove the bay leaves.
Serve with boiled potatoes, cabbage, or pickled beets.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
3. Add the chopped onions and cook until they are soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the stew meat and cook until browned, breaking it up into smaller pieces as it cooks.
5. Add the flour, stirring constantly, and cook for 1 minute.
6. Gradually pour in the water, stirring constantly to prevent lumps.
7. Add the bay leaves, salt, and black pepper, stirring to combine.
8. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 1 hour, or until the meat is tender.
9. Add the canned cranberry sauce with whole cranberries, stirring to combine.
10. Simmer for an additional 15 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and the cranberries are soft.
11. Remove the pot from the heat and let it sit, covered, for 10 minutes.
12. Serve the Stew With Cranberries (Swedish Kalops) hot, garnished with fresh parsley.

[/INST]

gt:
In bowl, combine artichoke hearts, cheese, mayo & garlic powder.
Place chicken in greased 11x7x2 inch baking dish.
Spread with artichoke mix.
Bake uncovered at 375 degrees for 30-35 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the artichoke hearts, grated parmesan cheese, mayonnaise, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
3. Place the chicken breasts in a single layer on a baking sheet.
4. Pour the artichoke mixture over the chicken breasts, making sure to coat them evenly.
5. Bake the chicken in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the breading is golden brown.
6. Serve the Artichoke Chicken immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees.
Chop Roast into cubes or shred into bite size pieces.
In a sprayed or buttered casserole dish mix the Roast, left over sauce from Roast, Cream of Mushroom Soup, Shredded Cheddar Cheese, frozen broccoli and Milk.
If you thaw the broccoli before you add it you likely will not need to cook for 45 minutes, but if you're feeling lazy (like me) then you don't have to thaw it - just make sure you keep the casserole in the oven long enough to get warm!
Top the mixture with the French Fried Onions.
Bake in 350 degree oven for 30-45 minutes.
Stir before serving.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the leftover pot roast, dripping from the roast, milk, shredded cheddar cheese, and cream of mushroom soup. Mix well to combine all ingredients.
3. Add the frozen broccoli to the bowl and mix until the broccoli is evenly distributed throughout the mixture.
4. Transfer the mixture to a 9x13 inch baking dish.
5. Spread the French's cheddar french fried onions evenly over the top of the casserole.
6. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the casserole is hot and bubbly, and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
7. Serve the Delicious Low Carb Leftover Pot Roast Casserole warm.

This casserole is a delicious and satisfying meal that utilizes leftover pot roast and other ingredients to create a comforting and flavorful dish. The combination of the tender pot roast, creamy mushroom soup, and the crispy fried onions creates a delightful contrast of textures and flavors. This casserole is perfect for a cozy night in or a satisfying meal for a family gathering.

gt:
Combine flour, salt, olive oil and rosemary.
Slowly pour in the wine and knead the dough until it gets smooth and a bit harder than bread dough.
(You might need more than 1/2 cup of wine.)
Let the dough rest for about 20 minutes in a cool and dry place.
For the dough into 8 cm long ropes as thick as your pinky finger.
Close each rope into a circle.
Bring some water to a boil and drop in your taralli, a few at a time.
As soon as they come up on the water surface, remove them and bake them at 200 degrees C for about 30 minutes.
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, salt, and rosemary.
2. Gradually add the extra virgine olive oil, stirring to combine.
3. If the dough is too dry, add a little more white wine, a tablespoon at a time, until the desired consistency is reached.
4. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic.
5. Cover the dough with a damp cloth and let it rest for 30 minutes.
6. Preheat your oven to 450°F (232°C).
7. Divide the dough into 12 equal portions.
8. Roll each portion into a long, thin rope, then cut the rope into 1-inch (2.5 cm) pieces.
9. Place the taralli on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
10. Brush the tops of the taralli with a little more olive oil.
11. Bake the taralli in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until they are golden brown.
12. Remove the taralli from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious homemade taralli!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Lightly grease a 9 inch pie pan.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add garlic and onions and cook, stirring occasionally, until onions are soft.
Stir in spinach and continue cooking until excess moisture has evaporated.
In a large bowl, combine eggs, cheeses, salt, pepper, and crushed red pepper.
Add in spinach mixture and stir to blend.
Pour into prepared pie pan.
Bake in preheated oven until eggs have set and the top is slightly browned, about 25-30 minutes.
Remove and let cool for 10 minutes before serving.
If youd like, top with additional freshly grated Parmesan cheese.
*I also love using this recipe to make individual-sized little quiches.
You can either use regular-sized muffin tins (15-20 minutes cook time), or the cute mini ones (about 10-15 minutes).
Just be sure to prepare the tins well with cooking spray (or use muffin liners), and watch to be sure that they dont get overcooked!
Recipe is adapted from www.allrecipes.com.
(Click See Related Blog Post for more pics and info!)
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the Vegetable Oil, Minced Garlic, and Chopped Onion. Mix well.
3. Add the Frozen Chopped Spinach, and mix until it is well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs until they are well-beaten.
5. Add the whisked eggs to the spinach mixture, and mix until well combined.
6. Add the Shredded Muenster Cheese, Grated Parmesan Cheese, Salt, Freshly Ground Black Pepper, and Crushed Red Pepper. Mix until well combined.
7. Pour the mixture into a greased 9-inch (23cm) pie dish.
8. Bake the quiche in the preheated oven for 45-50 minutes, or until the center is set and the edges are golden brown.
9. Allow the quiche to cool for a few minutes before cutting it into slices and serving.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
In a 8 qt stockpot, simmer the first 10 ingredients, covered, for 45 minutes, or until the chicken is tender.
Remove chicken from the pot.
Debone the chicken, chop the meat and reserve.
Add to the pot: potatoes, cabbage, kale and turnips.
Simmer, covered, for 25 minutes longer.
Return the boned chicken to the pot and add the salt and pepper.
Simmer a few more minutes until all is hot, and serve.
The soup keeps well for a few days in the refrigerator.
pred:
1. Soak the dried white beans in water overnight and drain them.
2. Cut the chicken thighs into 1/2-inch pieces.
3. Cut the chorizo into 1/2-inch pieces.
4. Cut the smoked ham into 1/2-inch dice.
5. Chop the salt pork into small pieces.
6. Peel and chop the onion.
7. Crush the garlic cloves.
8. Combine the beans, chicken, chorizo, ham, salt pork, onion, and garlic in a large pot.
9. Add the Worcestershire sauce and Tabasco sauce, and stir to combine.
10. Add the water, and bring the mixture to a boil.
11. Reduce the heat to low, and simmer for about 2 hours, or until the beans are tender.
12. Add the potato, cabbage, kale, and turnip to the pot, and continue to simmer for an additional 30 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
13. Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste.
14. Serve the Caldo Gallego hot, garnished with a drizzle of olive oil and a sprinkle of parsley.

[/INST]

gt:
1.
Preheat the broiler of an oven and place the oven rack 10 from the heating element.
2.
Season the pounded veal cutlets lightly with salt and pepper.
In a saucepan over medium heat, simmer all of the sauce ingredients for about 20 minutes.
3.
Build a breading station by placing flour, beaten eggs, and bread crumbs in separate shallow dishes and working with one scaloppini at a time, dredge it in the flour, the eggs, and the bread crumbs and transfer the breaded scallopini to a dish.
4.
In a large frying pan, heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil over medium-high heat.
Fry the breaded scallopini, 2 at a time, turning once with tongs, until each side is golden brown, about 3 minutes; and wiping out the frying pan and adding fresh oil between.
Either transfer scallopini to large baking platter or to individual, oven proof plates.
5.
Once all the scallopini have been fried and placed in your baking dish, top each scallopini with 13 cup of the marinara sauce, sprinkle with 1 1/2 tablespoons of Parmesan, and one or more slices of provolone cheese.
6.
Place the scallopini under the broiler until the cheese is golden and bubbly, about 5 minutes.
Dress each plate with some of the chopped parsley and serve immediately.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, bread crumbs, and salt.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the marinara sauce, garlic powder, basil, oregano, and red pepper flakes.
4. Dip the veal cutlets in the egg mixture, then coat them evenly with the bread crumb mixture.
5. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the veal cutlets and cook until golden brown on both sides, about 2-3 minutes per side.
6. Remove the veal from the skillet and place it on a baking sheet. Pour the marinara sauce mixture over the veal, making sure it coats evenly.
7. Bake the veal in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the veal is cooked through and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Remove the veal from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes.
9. Slice the veal into thin pieces and serve it on a plate, garnished with fresh parsley.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Mix all ingredients in a small bowl.
Chill (optional).
Serve with tortilla chips or as an accompaniment to fish.
pred:
To create a delicious Nectarine Salsa, follow these steps:

1. Wash and peel the nectarines, peaches, or pineapple, and chop them into small pieces.
2. In a large bowl, combine the chopped nectarines, peaches, or pineapple, minced garlic, and minced jalapeno pepper (if using).
3. Add 12 tablespoons of fresh lime juice to the bowl, and mix well to combine the ingredients.
4. Gently stir in the chopped cilantro, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
5. Cover the bowl and refrigerate the salsa for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
6. Serve the Nectarine Salsa chilled or at room temperature, as a refreshing side dish or a topping for various dishes.

This Nectarine Salsa is a delicious and healthy addition to your meals, providing a burst of flavor and a touch of freshness. The combination of sweet nectarines, tangy lime juice, and spicy jalapeno pepper creates a unique and satisfying taste experience.

gt:
Pat the pounded chicken breasts very dry with paper towels.
Season with salt ,pepper and sunny paris seasoning on both sides.
Heat a large saute pan and add equal parts olive oil and butter just enough to geneouresly coat the pan.
Just before putting the chicken in the pan dredge it in flour lightly.
Saute over medium high heat three to four minutes each side, brown nicely but watch the heat, lower if getting too dark.
Remove chicken to a plate and cover to keep warm.
Add the shallots to the pan and briefly saute, two minutes or so.
Add the wine and scrape up all the brown bits,bring heat up to high, watch closely and reduce to a thick glaze.
Stir all along.
Add the cream and mustard, season with additional salt, pepper and seasoning blend.
Boil over high heat stirring until reduced and thickened.
Add tomatoes and tarragon, stir and add the chicken back along with any juices.
Return heat to medium low and cover heat for two minutes.
Serve with fluffy white or brown rice.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the chicken breast halves, salt, pepper, and penzey's sunny paris seasoning. Toss to coat evenly.
3. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook until browned on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
4. In the same skillet, add the shallots and cook until softened, about 2 minutes. Add the chopped tomatoes and cook until they start to release their juices, about 3-4 minutes.
5. Add the dry vermouth or white wine to the skillet and cook until it has reduced by half, about 3-4 minutes.
6. Add the heavy cream to the skillet and stir to combine. Cook until the sauce has thickened, about 5-6 minutes.
7. Add the cooked chicken back to the skillet, stirring to combine.
8. In a small bowl, mix the Dijon mustard and butter. Drizzle the mustard mixture over the chicken and cream mixture, stirring to combine.
9. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
10. Transfer the chicken and sauce to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and slightly caramelized.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Blend all ingredients, pour into pie shell and bake for 1 hour and 350F (180C).
or until done.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the silken tofu, pumpkin puree, date sugar, molasses, vanilla extract, cinnamon, nutmeg, allspice, and ginger. Mix well.
3. Pour the mixture into the pie shells, making sure to evenly distribute the filling.
4. Bake the pies in the preheated oven for 45-50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the pie comes out clean.
5. Allow the pies to cool completely before serving.

By following these key steps, you will be able to prepare a delicious and satisfying Silky Vegan Pumpkin Pie.

gt: Stir together all ingredients until well blended.
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the grated mozzarella cheese and pesto sauce. Mix well to ensure the cheese is evenly coated with the pesto.
2. Add the drained and finely chopped sun-dried tomatoes to the bowl. Mix gently to combine all ingredients.
3. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
4. After 30 minutes, taste and adjust the seasoning if necessary. You may need to add more salt, pepper, or a pinch of crushed red pepper flakes for extra kick.
5. Serve the Mozzarella Pesto Spread immediately or store it in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

Enjoy your delicious Mozzarella Pesto Spread!

gt:
Heat a large skillet over high heat, add sausage and cook until brown, breaking up the meat into bite size pieces.
Add the artichokes and garlic to the skillet, and saute over medium heat until the garlic is tender, about 2 minutes.
Add the broth and sun dried tomatoes.
Boil over medium-high heat until the sauce reduces slightly, stirring occasionally, about 8 minutes.
Meanwhile, bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Cook the pasta in boiling water according to package directions.
Drain the pasta and add to the skillet along with 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese, basil, and parsley.
Toss until the sauce is almost absorbed by the pasta.
Stir in the mozzarella.
Season, to taste, with salt and pepper.
Enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the sausage over medium heat until browned, breaking it into bite-sized pieces.
3. Add the minced garlic and cook for a few more minutes until fragrant.
4. Add the artichoke hearts, chicken broth, and sun dried tomato slices to the skillet. Stir to combine.
5. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for about 15-20 minutes, or until the sausage is cooked through and the artichoke hearts are tender.
6. In a separate pot, cook the pasta according to the package instructions until al dente.
7. Drain the pasta and return it to the pot.
8. Add the cooked sausage and artichoke mixture to the pot with the pasta. Stir to combine.
9. Add the shredded Parmesan cheese and stir until the cheese is melted and the pasta is well-coated.
10. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
11. Serve the Suasage Artichoke and Sun Dried Tomato Pasta in bowls, garnished with additional Parmesan cheese and fresh basil and parsley.

[/INST]

gt:
Brown ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat, about 6 min.
Add spices, cook an additional 1 min.
Add onions, dressing, and garlic; cook 3 min.
Pour in tomatoes; simmer 5 to 6 min., stirring occasionally or until slightly thickened.
pred:
1. Preheat a large skillet or frying pan over medium-high heat.
2. Season the ground beef with chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper.
3. Add the beef to the skillet and cook until browned, breaking it up into small pieces as it cooks.
4. Add the onion to the skillet and cook until softened.
5. Pour in the Italian Sun-Dried Tomato Dressing and stir to combine.
6. Add the drained diced tomatoes and bring the mixture to a simmer.
7. Reduce the heat to low and let the mixture cook for about 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
8. Serve the Mexican Beef Skillet over rice or noodles.

[/INST]

gt:
Dice potatoes.
Cook until tender; drain.
Put into large bowl.
Add onions and Italian dressing; toss to coat.
Cover and chill at least 1 hour.
Combine mayonnaise, mustard and salt in small bowl; pour over potatoes; toss to coat.
Add celery, eggs and relish; toss lightly.
Slice remaining eggs.
Garnish top of salad.
Sprinkle with paprika.
pred:
[INST]
To prepare Picnic Party Potato Salad, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Wash and peel the red potatoes, then cut them into bite-sized pieces.
3. In a large bowl, combine the potatoes, green onion, and Italian dressing. Mix well to ensure the potatoes are evenly coated.
4. Transfer the mixture to a large baking dish or roasting pan.
5. Roast the potato mixture in the preheated oven for about 45-60 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and cooked through.
6. While the potatoes are cooking, prepare the mayonnaise and mustard mixture. In a small bowl, mix the mayonnaise and mustard together until well combined.
7. Once the potatoes are cooked, remove the dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Add the mayonnaise and mustard mixture to the potato mixture, stirring to combine.
9. Add the diced celery and dill pickle relish to the potato mixture, stirring to incorporate.
10. Season the salad with salt and pepper to taste.
11. Serve the Picnic Party Potato Salad immediately, or refrigerate it for a few hours before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Picnic Party Potato Salad!

gt:
Grease a shallow 3qt baking dish; set aside.
Steam or boil the peeled yams until almost tender; cool and slice into approximately 1 1/2 inch slices (you want them to fit in a the 3qt baking dish in one layer).
Preheat oven to 375F.
In a small saucepan, simmer brown sugar, syrup, butter, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally, until sugar has dissolved and syrup thickens, about 5 minutes; Remove from heat and stir in whisky (or other liquor of choice).
Drizzle syrup over yams.
Cover with aluminum foil (at this point, they may be refrigerated until you're ready to bake them).
Bake the yams, basting every 15-20 minutes, until syrup has thickened and absorbed (note: not all the syrup will absorb), about 1 1/4 hours.
May be served hot, warm, or at room temperature.
pred:
To create a delicious Whisky (Or Bourbon) Baked Sweet Potatoes (Or Yams) recipe, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Peel and chop the sweet potatoes (or yams) into even-sized pieces.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the chopped sweet potatoes (or yams), brown sugar, sugar-free maple syrup or regular maple syrup, and melted butter. Mix well to ensure the sweet potatoes (or yams) are evenly coated.
4. Add the cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt to the mixture, stirring to combine.
5. If desired, add the Scotch whisky to the mixture, stirring to incorporate.
6. Transfer the mixture to a greased baking dish, ensuring that the sweet potatoes (or yams) are evenly distributed.
7. Bake the sweet potatoes (or yams) in the preheated oven for 45-50 minutes, or until they are tender and cooked through.
8. Remove the baking dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

This recipe creates a delicious and flavorful dish that combines the natural sweetness of the sweet potatoes (or yams) with the warm, rich flavor of the whisky. Enjoy!

gt:
Grease 9 x 13 glass dish.
Bring chicken broth to boil, add can chicken, and pasta, cook till pasta done and most of the broth is absorbed.
DO NOT DRAIN.
Pour into glass dish.
Saute in butter, onion, bell pepper, pimentos, and sliced mushrooms till onions and mushrooms wilted.
Spread over chicken and pasta.
Mix with wire whisk over low heat cheese soup, evaporated milk, stirring till heated, then pour over vegetables covering top of casserole.
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
pred:
[INST]To prepare Cheesy Chicken Spaghetti, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the butter over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
3. Add the sliced mushrooms and cook until they are tender, about 5-6 minutes.
4. Add the chicken, breaking it apart as it cooks. Cook until the chicken is fully cooked through, about 10-12 minutes.
5. In a separate bowl, combine the chicken broth, evaporated milk, and spicy cheese soup. Pour the mixture over the chicken and mushrooms in the skillet.
6. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then cover and cook in the oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the sauce is bubbly and the chicken is cooked through.
7. While the chicken and sauce are cooking, cook the angel hair pasta according to the package instructions.
8. Once the chicken and sauce are cooked, remove the skillet from the oven and stir in the parmesan cheese.
9. Serve the Cheesy Chicken Spaghetti over the cooked pasta, and enjoy your delicious meal!

[/INST]

gt:
Prepare grill for covered direct grilling on medium.
Place beans on 16- by 12-inch sheet of heavy-duty foil.
Fold in half; crimp foil edges to create sealed packet.
Toss apples with 1 teaspoon each maple syrup and oil.
Rub 1 teaspoon oil all over pork, then sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon each salt and black pepper.
Place packet, apples, and pork on grill; cover.
Grill apples 8 minutes, turning once.
Transfer apples to large bowl; cool.
Grill beans 10 minutes.
Transfer packet to plate; open and let cool.
Grill pork 15 minutes or until instant-read thermometer inserted into pork registers 145 degrees F, turning occasionally.
Transfer to cutting board; let rest 10 minutes.
Chop lettuce.
In very large bowl, whisk vinegar, mustard, remaining 1 tablespoon oil, 2 teaspoons syrup, and 1/8 teaspoon each salt and black pepper.
Add spinach, lettuce, beans, and apples; toss well.
Thinly slice pork across grain.
Serve with salad.
pred:
1. Preheat your grill to medium-high heat.
2. Season the pork tenderloin with salt and pepper.
3. In a small bowl, mix the maple syrup, olive oil, and minced garlic. Brush the pork tenderloin with the mixture, ensuring it is evenly coated.
4. Place the pork tenderloin on the grill and cook for approximately 10-12 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare. Remove the pork from the grill and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into thin strips.
5. While the pork is cooking, prepare the salad by washing and peeling the apples and green beans.
6. In a large bowl, combine the sliced green beans, apples, and any remaining dressing from the pork.
7. In a small bowl, whisk together the balsamic vinegar, Dijon mustard, and olive oil.
8. Add the dressing to the salad and toss to combine.
9. To serve, divide the salad into two portions and place the pork strips on top of each salad.

Enjoy your delicious Grilled Pork and Apple Salad!

gt:
Preheat oven to 180C/160C fan forced.
line a baking tray with baking paper.
Place thighs on a work surface, open out and generously spread tapenade inside each.
Fold fillets back into shape.
Cut pastry sheets in half.
Place chicken at one end of the sheet fold edges in, fold pastry over chicken and roll to make a neat parcel.
Pinch sides to seal.
Place, seam-side down, on a prepared tray.
Brush with egg to glaze.
Sprinkle with basil.
Bake for 25-30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and pastry is golden brown.
Serve with vegetables.
