To create a delicious savory Chicken Wellingtons dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Season the chicken thigh fillets with salt, pepper, and any additional herbs or spices you prefer.
3. In a small bowl, mix the basil and parmesan tapenade.
4. Place the frozen butter puff pastry on a lightly floured surface. Roll out the pastry to a thickness of about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm).
5. Cut the pastry into circles using a cookie cutter or a round object, such as a glass.
6. Place a chicken thigh fillet in the center of each pastry circle.
7. Brush the edges of the pastry with the beaten egg, creating a border around the chicken.
8. Fold the pastry over the chicken, pressing the edges together to seal the filling.
9. Place the Wellingtons on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
10. Bake the Wellingtons in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the pastry is golden brown and the chicken is cooked through.
11. Remove the Wellingtons from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes.
12. While the Wellingtons are resting, steam some green and yellow vegetables, such as broccoli and carrots, until they are tender but still crisp.
13. To serve, place the Wellingtons on a plate and garnish with a sprinkle of dried basil leaves.

Enjoy your delicious Chicken Wellingtons dish!
<</SYS>>

[/INST]

gt:
Spray a 9x13 glass baking dish with cooking spray.
Melt the butter and peanut butter together in a microwave safe bowl until melted and stir to combine.
Mix in the powdered sugar and vanilla.
Add the oats until a dough forms and pulls away from the sides of the bowl.
You might need more or less than three cups of oats; add until the dough reaches your desired consistency.
Press the mixture into the 9x13 pan and spread evenly.
Pour the butterscotch chips in a small microwave-safe bowl and microwave for 30 seconds.
Stir well and continue microwaving in 30-second intervals until fully melted.
Pour over the top of the peanut butter/oat crust and spread evenly.
Allow the bars to cool and set.
Refrigerate to allow the butterscotch to harden, if desired.
(I did refrigerate the bars and liked the consistency that it produced.)
Gently slice into squares.
They are pretty rich so I would recommend cutting them into 24 small squares but you could certainly cut them larger, too.
Tip: There are so many ways that you could adapt this to make it your own: use milk chocolate or white chocolate chips in addition to or instead of the butterscotch; use Rice Krispies cereal instead of oatmeal (or any of your favorite cereals); add chocolate chips to the crust mixture; add peanuts to the crust mixture; sprinkle nuts, chocolate chips, or drizzle caramel or chocolate sauce over the caramel mixture ... see what I mean?
The possibilities are endless!
pred:
To prepare a delicious Peanut Butter Butterscotch Bars dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and peanut butter until smooth.
3. Add the powdered sugar and vanilla extract, and continue to mix until well combined.
4. Gradually add the oats, stirring to ensure they are evenly distributed.
5. Fold in the butterscotch chips.
6. Press the mixture evenly into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
7. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the edges are slightly golden and the center is set.
8. Allow the bars to cool completely before cutting into squares and serving.

Enjoy your delicious Peanut Butter Butterscotch Bars!

gt:
Place the potatoes, butter, garlic, salt, pepper, and water in the slow cooker.
Cover with lid and cook on high for 4 hours, or cook on low for 6 to 7 hours.
When finished cooking, remove the lid and add in the sour cream.
Mash the potatoes with a potato masher to desired consistency.
Taste for salt and pepper.
Serve.
pred:
1. Preheat the slow cooker on low heat setting.
2. Place the washed and quartered red potatoes in the slow cooker.
3. Add the 4 tablespoons of butter to the slow cooker.
4. Crush the garlic cloves using a garlic press or a knife, and add them to the slow cooker.
5. Add the 1/2 tablespoon of salt, 18 teaspoons of black pepper, and the 1 cup of water to the slow cooker.
6. Cook the potatoes on low heat for 6-8 hours, or until they are tender and mashed.
7. Once the potatoes are cooked, add the 1-1/2 cup of sour cream to the slow cooker.
8. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Serve the Slow Cooker Country Style Garlic Mashed Potatoes hot.

This recipe combines the flavors of garlic, sour cream, and mashed potatoes to create a delicious and comforting dish. The slow cooker ensures that the potatoes are cooked evenly and tender, while the garlic and sour cream add a rich and creamy taste to the dish. The combination of these ingredients results in a satisfying and comforting meal that can be enjoyed by everyone.

gt:
Cook the frozen spinach in boiling water for 10 to 15 minutes until completely defrosted and heated through.
Chop the artichoke hearts either by hand or in a food processor and add to the spinach pot.
Drain into a colander and push down on the mixture with the back of a spoon until all the liquid has drained out.
In a bowl, mix together the garlic, mayonnaise, sour cream, milk, lemon juice and Parmesan cheese.
Add the spinach and artichoke mixture.
Season to taste and place in an oven-proof dish.
Bake in a 350 degrees F oven for about 30 minutes.
Top with another handful of Parmesan cheese and serve warm with pita chips.
pred:
[INSTR]
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the spinach, artichoke hearts, minced garlic, mayonnaise, sour cream, milk, lemon juice, and Parmesan cheese. Mix well.
2. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
3. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) for about 20-25 minutes or until the dip is hot and bubbly.
4. Sprinkle the extra Parmesan cheese over the top of the dip before serving.

[/INSTR]

[/SYS]

gt:
1.
To prepare sauce, combine the mayonnaise, Sriracha, lime juice, and soy sauce in a small bowl, stirring with a whisk.
Cover and chill.2.
To prepare chicken, combine flour, black pepper, and paprika.
Place flour mixture in a shallow dish.
Combine eggs and 1 tablespoon water; place in another shallow dish.
Place crushed cereal in another shallow dish.3.
Sprinkle chicken evenly with salt.
Working with 1 piece at a time, dredge chicken in flour mixture.
Dip in egg mixture; dredge in cereal.4.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add oil to pan, swirling to coat.
Add chicken pieces to pan; cook 2 minutes on each side or until done.
Serve immediately with sauce.
pred:
1. In a small bowl, mix the canola mayonnaise, Sriracha, lime juice, and lower-sodium soy sauce. Set aside.
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, black pepper, paprika, eggs, water, and salt. Gradually add the chicken tenders, tossing to coat evenly.
3. Heat the canola oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Working in batches, cook the chicken tenders until golden brown and cooked through, about 3-4 minutes per side.
4. Transfer the cooked chicken tenders to a plate.
5. Pour the sauce mixture over the chicken tenders and toss to coat evenly.
6. Serve the Pan-Fried Chicken Fingers with Spicy Dipping Sauce immediately.

This dish is a delicious and flavorful combination of crispy chicken tenders and a spicy dipping sauce. The sauce adds a tangy and spicy kick to the dish, while the crushed cereal provides a crunchy texture and a nutritious boost. The dish is perfect for a quick and satisfying meal or a fun twist on a classic dish.

gt:
Toss berries in a medium bowl with the kKirsch, eau de vie or creme de cassis and 2 tablespoons of the sugar, and let sit for 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, sift together all-purpose flour and almond flour.
Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
Butter a 9- or 10--inch ceramic tart pan or clafoutis dish.
In a medium bowl, beat eggs with remaining sugar, seeds from the vanilla bean or vanilla, and salt.
Place a strainer over the bowl and drain berries, allowing all of the liquid from the berries to run into the egg and sugar mixture.
Whisk to combine.
Arrange drained berries in the buttered baking dish.
Beat the sifted flours into the egg mixture and whisk until smooth.
Add yogurt or kefir and combine well.
Pour over fruit, scraping out all of the batter with a rubber spatula.
Bake in the preheated oven for 35 minutes, or until the top is browned and the clafoutis is firm and puffed.
Press gently on the top in the middle to see if its firm.
If it isnt, return to the oven for 5 minutes.
Remove from the oven and cool on a rack.
Serve warm or at room temperature.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, sugar, and vanilla (or almond extract).
3. Add the flour, almond flour, and salt to the bowl, and mix until well combined.
4. Gently fold in the blueberries and blackberries (or just one type of berries) and the kirsch, eau de vie de myrtille, or creme de cassis (if using).
5. Pour the batter into a greased 9-inch (23cm) round cake pan.
6. Bake the cake for 45-50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
7. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.
8. Serve the Berry Clafoutis warm or at room temperature, garnished with a dusting of powdered sugar or a drizzle of honey.

Enjoy your delicious Berry Clafoutis!

gt:
Chop all the vegetables into small pieces.
Put 1 Tbsp of olive oil into a pot and add minced garlic and ginger there.
Once it starts to smell nice, add the chopped vegetables.
Cook for about 15 min on low to medium heat.
Stir around while everything is cooking.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add 2 cups of water.
Put the lid on and simmer for about 20 min until all vegetables are softened.
Cook on medium to low heat.
Then turn off the heat and let cool before blending.
Pour all the soup into the blender and turn on for about 20 sec.
Make sure the soup is not hot to avoid getting burned.
Once blended, pour the soup back into the pot and turn to a low heat.
Add milk or soy milk while gently stirring to mix all together.
Season with salt and pepper as needed.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Wash and peel the vegetables, and chop them into bite-sized pieces.
3. In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onions and sauté until softened.
4. Add the chopped garlic and ginger, and cook for another minute.
5. Add the chopped carrot, celery, turnips, and kabocha squash to the pot. Cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. Pour in the water and milk or soy milk, and bring the mixture to a boil.
7. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let it simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
8. Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Serve the Vegetable Potage hot, and enjoy your delicious homemade meal.

gt:
Heat oil in 6-quart saucepan over medium heat.
Add chicken, cumin, oregano, salt and pepper Cook, stirring occasionally, 5-7 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink.
Remove from pan; set aside.
Add onion, bell pepper and garlic to pan.
Cook over medium heat 3-4 minutes or until softened.
Return chicken to pan.
Stir in chicken broth, beans and corn.
Cook until mixture comes to a boil.
Cover; cook over low heat 15 minutes.
Add cheese; stir until melted.
Garnish each serving with cilantro and lime wedge.
pred:
1. Heat the oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
2. Add the chicken pieces and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
3. Remove the chicken from the pot and set aside.
4. Add the onion, bell pepper, and garlic to the pot and cook until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.
5. Add the chicken back to the pot, along with the cumin, oregano, salt, and pepper. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.
6. Pour in the chicken broth and bring the mixture to a boil.
7. Add the beans, corn, and Land O Lakes American cheese slices to the pot. Stir to combine.
8. Reduce the heat to low and let the chili simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the beans are tender.
9. Stir in the chopped cilantro and lime wedges.
10. Serve the White Chicken Chili hot, garnished with additional cilantro and lime wedges, if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Combine first 6 ingredients in a medium bowl, stirring well.
Coarsely chop eggs.
Add eggs to mayonnaise mixture; stir gently to combine.
Arrange 4 bread slices on a cutting board or work surface.
Top each bread slice with 1/2 cup egg mixture, 2 bacon pieces, 2 tomato slices, 1 lettuce leaf, and 1 bread slice.
Serve sandwich immediately.
Enjoy!
pred:
1. In a large bowl, whisk together the fat-free mayonnaise, thinly sliced green onions, reduced-fat sour cream, whole-grain Dijon mustard, and grated lemon rind. Season with fresh ground black pepper to taste.

2. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs until they are well-beaten.

3. Place the egg mixture in a large mixing bowl and stir in the toasted bread, cooked bacon, and sliced tomatoes.

4. Fold the ingredients together gently, ensuring that the bread and bacon are evenly distributed.

5. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.

6. Serve the Egg Salad BLT on toasted bread or sandwiches, garnished with additional thinly sliced green onions if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Place a soup pot over medium heat and coat with the oils.
Add the onion, leeks, mushrooms, garlic, ginger, carrots, parsnips, celery, pepper, thyme and bay leaf.
Cook and stir for about 6 minutes, until the vegetables are softened but not browned.
Pour in the chicken stock and mushroom liquid and bring the liquid to a boil.
Add the noodles and simmer for 5 minutes until tender.
Add the chicken, and continue to simmer for another couple of minutes to heat through; season with soy sauce and pepper.
Remove dried chili.
Sprinkle with chopped parsley before serving.
And you may drizzle extra sesame oil.
pred:
To cook a delicious Chicken Noodle Soup With an Asian Touch, follow these steps:

1. In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the 2 tablespoons of extra virgin olive oil over medium heat. Add the 1 teaspoon of chili oil or regular sesame oil, and stir to combine.

2. Add the minced garlic and ginger, and cook for about 1 minute, until fragrant.

3. Add the sliced onion, leek, and carrots, and cook for another 3-4 minutes, until the vegetables are tender but still slightly crisp.

4. Add the sliced parsnips and celery, and cook for an additional 3-4 minutes, until the vegetables are tender.

5. Pour in the 2 quarts of chicken stock, and bring the mixture to a boil.

6. Add the dried ramen noodles, and cook according to the package instructions, usually about 5-7 minutes.

7. Once the noodles are cooked, add the shredded cooked chicken, soy sauce, and fresh ground black pepper. Stir to combine.

8. If desired, add the 12 cups of fresh flat-leaf parsley or 12 cups of cilantro, and stir to combine.

9. Serve the soup hot, garnished with a sprinkle of fresh herbs if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Chicken Noodle Soup With an Asian Touch!

gt:
In a bowl, toss the bananas slices in lemon juice to keep from browning.
In an extra large fancy glass bowl, in a layering effect, place the pineapple, blueberries, HALF of the strawberries, oranges, kiwi fruit, watermelon, and the remaining strawberries or raspberries.
In a mixer bowl, beat the softened cream cheese until smooth.
Add in confectioners sugar, and continue beating.
Add in the lime juice; mix to combine.
Set the speed to lowest, and add in HALF of the whipped cream; mix until blended.
Then add in the remaining whipped cream until blended (still on lowest speed).
Pour the whipped dressing all over the fruit in the bowl, and allow to drizzle inside of bowl.
Chill for a minimum of 1 hour before serving.
pred:
1. First, gather all the necessary ingredients, including the fresh fruits, cream cheese, confectioners' sugar, lime juice, and whipped cream.
2. Wash and chop the fruits into bite-sized pieces, ensuring that the blueberries, strawberries, pineapple, watermelon, bananas, and oranges are all separated into distinct layers.
3. In a large bowl, combine the chopped fruits, cream cheese, and lime juice. Mix until the cream cheese is well-incorporated into the fruit mixture.
4. Add the confectioners' sugar and lime zest to the bowl, and continue to mix until the desired consistency is achieved. The fruit salad should be sweet and tangy, with the cream cheese adding a creamy texture.
5. If desired, fold in the whipped cream to create a fluffy and airy layer.
6. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or a lid, and refrigerate the fruit salad for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
7. Serve the Delicious Layered Fruit Salad immediately, or chill it in the refrigerator for a few more hours before serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Combine all ingredients in a saucepan.
Simmer over medium heat and stir until mixture is smooth.
Serve immediately.
pred:
1. In a saucepan, heat the milk over medium heat until it reaches a simmer.
2. In a separate saucepan, heat the chocolate and bittersweet chocolate over low heat, stirring occasionally, until melted and smooth.
3. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the simple syrup.
4. Pour the melted chocolate mixture into the simmering milk, stirring gently to combine.
5. Reduce the heat to low and let the mixture simmer for about 5-7 minutes, or until it reaches your desired thickness.
6. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the whisky.
7. Stir in the Lustau, White Street's house-made hot chocolate, and the freshly grated cinnamon.
8. Pour the hot chocolate mixture into a mug, and garnish with a dollop of freshly whipped cream.

Enjoy your delicious and boozy hot chocolate!

gt:
In a bowl, toss the peanuts and lime juice; let stand for 1 hour, tossing occasionally.
Drain the peanuts and pat dry on paper towels.
In a large nonstick skillet, heat the vegetable oil until shimmering.
Add the shallots and cook over moderately high heat, stirring, until browned and crisp, about 2 minutes.
Using a slotted spoon, transfer the shallots to a plate.
Add half of the peanuts to the hot oil and cook over moderate heat, stirring, until golden, about 5 minutes.
Using a slotted spoon, transfer the nuts to paper towels.
Season with salt and let cool.
Repeat with the remaining peanuts.
In a bowl, toss the peanuts with the lime leaves, garnish with the shallots and cilantro and serve.
pred:
1. Heat a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add the sliced shallots and cook until they are softened and slightly browned, about 2-3 minutes.
2. Add the sliced kaffir lime leaves or zest of 1 lime, and cook for another minute or until fragrant.
3. Add the vegetable oil and cook until it shimmers.
4. Add the fresh lime juice or lemon juice, and stir to combine.
5. Carefully add the peanuts to the skillet, stirring to ensure they are evenly coated with the sauce. Cook for a few minutes, until the peanuts are golden and slightly crispy.
6. Remove the skillet from the heat and let the peanuts cool slightly.
7. Garnish with the cilantro sprigs, and serve immediately.

[/INSTRUCT]

[/SYS]

gt:
Preheat oven to 425.
Line 15 1/2" x 10 1/2" jelly roll pan with foil.
Place squash in pan; drizzle with oil and sprinkle with salt and toss to combine.
Roast squash 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, in 1 cup liquid measuring cup, stir maple syrup with spices.
Toss squash with maple syrup mixture.
Roast 15-20 minutes longer or until fork tender.
Spoon squash, along with any pan juices, into serving dish.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, toss the cubed butternut squash with the olive oil, salt, and pumpkin pie spice.
3. Spread the squash mixture evenly on a baking sheet or roasting pan.
4. Roast the squash in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until it is tender and slightly caramelized.
5. While the squash is roasting, prepare the maple syrup by heating it in a saucepan over medium heat.
6. Once the squash is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. In a small mixing bowl, combine the ground red pepper (cayenne) and maple syrup.
8. Pour the maple syrup mixture over the cooled squash and toss to coat evenly.
9. Serve the Maple Roasted Squash immediately, as it is best when hot and freshly prepared.

Enjoy your delicious Maple Roasted Squash, a perfect side dish or a healthy snack, with the added flavors of maple syrup and pumpkin pie spice.

gt:
Place beans into a pressure cooker and fill with enough water to cover the beans by 1 inch.
Bring to a boil, and boil for 2 minutes.
Remove from the heat, drain and cool for 1 hour.
Add water to the beans again, filling just enough to cover the beans by 1/2 inch.
Season with salt, fennel seed, cayenne pepper and mixed peppercorns.
Put the lid on and set the pressure to high, or 15 pounds depending on your indicator.
Bring to a boil and cook for 35 minutes.
Let the pressure lower naturally before releasing the lid, according to manufacturer's instructions (about 15 minutes).
Serve hot.
pred:
To create a delicious Spicy Red Beans With Fennel Seed, follow these steps:

1. Sort through the dry kidney beans and remove any debris or stones. Rinse the beans thoroughly under cold water.
2. In a large pot, combine the beans, salt, fennel seed, cayenne pepper, and freshly ground mixed peppercorns.
3. Add enough water to cover the beans by at least an inch. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer and let it cook for about 1-2 hours, or until the beans are tender but still have a slight crunch.
4. Remove the pot from the heat and let it sit, covered, for about 15-20 minutes. This will help the beans absorb the flavors and make them even more delicious.
5. Serve the Spicy Red Beans With Fennel Seed hot, over rice or with your favorite side dish. Enjoy!

This recipe is a delicious and flavorful way to enjoy kidney beans, with the added spiciness and aroma of fennel seeds. The combination of ingredients creates a rich and satisfying dish that can be enjoyed by everyone.

gt:
Brown beef, onions, peppers and garlic in large skillet over medium-high heat until browned and veggies are soft.
Add taco seasoning and 1/2 cup of enchilada sauce, stirring until combined.
Turn off heat and add cream cheese.
Stir until cream cheese has melted into mixture.
Spread 1/2 cup of enchilada sauce into the bottom of a greased 13x9 casserole dish.
Spoon about 1/4 cup of meat mixture down the center of each warmed tortilla and roll up.
Place enchiladas seam side down in dish.
Top enchiladas with remaining 1 cup of enchilada sauce.
Then top with pepper jack cheese.
Bake for 20 minutes at 350 degrees or until cheese is melted.
Serve with rice and beans if you so desire!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the ground beef over medium heat until it is no longer pink. Drain any excess fat.
3. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the skillet. Cook until the onion is translucent.
4. Add the bell pepper and serrano or jalapeno peppers (if using) to the skillet. Cook until the vegetables are tender.
5. Stir in the taco seasoning mix and cream cheese. Cook until the cream cheese is melted and the mixture is well combined.
6. In a small bowl, mix the enchilada sauce with 1 cup water.
7. In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground beef mixture, enchilada sauce mixture, and 1 cup of the enchilada sauce.
8. Soften the softened tortillas by wrapping them in a damp cloth or placing them in a steamer.
9. To assemble the enchiladas, spoon a small amount of the beef mixture into the center of each tortilla. Roll the tortilla over the filling, enclosing it completely. Place the enchiladas seam-side down in a baking dish.
10. Pour the remaining enchilada sauce over the enchiladas.
11. Sprinkle the remaining 1/2 cup of monterey jack cheese over the enchiladas.
12. Bake the enchiladas in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
13. Serve the Awesome Beef Enchiladas hot. Enjoy!

gt:
Preheat oven to 375F.
Blend together butter, sugar, vanilla, and salt in a bowl with a fork until combined well.
Sift flour into butter mixture and blend with fork until mixture forms a soft dough.
Transfer dough to an ungreased large baking sheet and pat into a 9- by 4 1/2-inch rectangle.
Crimp edges decoratively and prick dough all over with tines of a fork.
Score dough crosswise with the back of a knife into 8 sections.
If desired, sprinkle with chopped toasted nuts and press gently into dough with your fingertips.
Bake shortbread in middle of oven until edges are golden, about 15 minutes.
Cool shortbread on baking sheet on a rack 10 minutes, then cut into slices (while still warm) with a sharp knife.
Transfer slices with a spatula to rack to cool completely.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the softened butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the vanilla extract and salt, and mix well.
4. Gradually add the flour, mixing until the dough comes together. If the dough is too dry, you can add a bit of water or milk to achieve the right consistency.
5. If desired, add chopped toasted nuts to the dough.
6. Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and shape it into a disk. Wrap the dough in plastic and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 2 hours.
7. Roll the dough out on a floured surface to your desired thickness.
8. Cut the dough into desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a sharp knife.
9. Place the shaped dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
10. Bake the cookies for 12-15 minutes, or until they are lightly golden brown.
11. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Shortbread cookies!

gt:
In a large saucepan coated with non-stick spray, saute onion and garlic until tender, about 5-8 minutes.
Add the broth, beans, tomatoes, carrots, macaroni and oregano.
Cook until vegetables are tender, about 20 minutes.
Stir in chopped spinach and bring to a boil.
Remove from heat and let stand for 10 minutes.
pred:
1. Heat a large pot on medium heat. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic, and cook until the onion is translucent.
2. Add the low sodium vegetable broth, kidney beans, and diced tomatoes to the pot. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let simmer for 10-15 minutes.
3. Add the sliced carrots to the pot, and continue to simmer for another 10-15 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.
4. While the soup is simmering, cook the uncooked elbow macaroni according to package instructions.
5. Once the macaroni is cooked, add it to the pot with the vegetables and broth.
6. Stir in the dried oregano and chopped spinach. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes or until the spinach is wilted.
7. Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Serve the Spinach Minestrone hot, garnished with a drizzle of extra virgin olive oil and a sprinkle of freshly grated Parmesan cheese, if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Dissolve the Jello gelatin in boiling water; add raspberries.
Put in refrigerator to thicken slightly.
Mix crust ingredients and press firmly into a 9x13 pan.
Bake at 350 degrees for 9 minutes.
Cool completely.
Cream the 1/2 cup sugar and cream cheese; fold in the Cool Whip until well mixed.
Spread over cooled crust.
Pour raspberries over cream layer and chill.
If you like, more Cool Whip can be spread on top.
pred:
To make Raspberry Cream Bars, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the melted butter, sugar, and cream cheese. Mix until smooth and creamy.
3. Add the softened cream cheese mixture to the crushed pretzels and graham cracker crumbs. Mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, combine the boiling water and the raspberry Jell-O gelatin. Stir until the gelatin is fully dissolved.
5. Add the dissolved gelatin mixture to the cream cheese mixture and mix until well combined.
6. Pour the mixture onto a greased and floured baking sheet. Spread it evenly to create a 1-inch thick layer.
7. Bake the Raspberry Cream Bars in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the center is set.
8. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
9. Spread the Cool Whip evenly over the cooled Raspberry Cream Bars.
10. Refrigerate the Raspberry Cream Bars for at least 2 hours or until the Cool Whip is set.

Enjoy your delicious Raspberry Cream Bars!

gt:
Sprinkle beef with salt and pepper.
Heat oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Add ginger and mushrooms; stir-fry until mushrooms are tender, about 3 minutes.
Add beef to skillet; stir-fry until beef browns but is still pink in center, about 1 minute.
Add snow peas, half of green onions, and half of cilantro; stir-fry 1 minute.
Stir in hoisin, chili-garlic sauce, and five-spice powder; saute until peas are crisp-tender, 1 to 2 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Transfer to bowl.
Sprinkle with remaining green onions and cilantro.
pred:
1. Prepare the ingredients:
- Wash and chop the green onions and cilantro leaves.
- Rinse the snow peas and shiitake mushrooms, and pat them dry.
- Cut the steak into thin strips.
- In a small bowl, mix the hoisin sauce, chili-garlic sauce, and Chinese five-spice powder.

2. Heat the oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
3. Add the sliced green onions and cilantro leaves to the skillet, stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
4. Add the minced ginger and stir-fry for 1 minute.
5. Add the sliced snow peas and cook until they are bright green and tender, about 3-4 minutes.
6. Add the steak strips to the skillet and cook until they are browned on all sides, about 3-4 minutes.
7. Pour the hoisin sauce mixture over the steak and stir-fry until the sauce has thickened and the steak is cooked through, about 2-3 minutes.
8. Serve the Beef, Shiitake, and Snow Pea Stir-Fry over rice or noodles.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Combine the 2 teaspoons of lime juice with the milk, let stand for 5 minutes.
In a large bowl, cream together the butter and 3/4 cup sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in the egg, then stir in the lime zest and milk mixture.
Combine the flour, baking powder and baking soda, blend into the creamed mixture.
Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto the ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven, until the edges are light brown.
Allow cookies to cool on baking sheets for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
To make the glaze, stir together the remaining lime juice and sugar.
Brush onto cooled cookies.
pred:
To prepare delicious Spring Lime Tea Cookies, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the softened butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the egg and lime zest, and mix well.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and lime juice.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until just combined.
6. Fold in the white sugar.
7. Chill the dough in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
8. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Scoop the dough into balls and place them on the prepared baking sheet.
10. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are lightly golden brown around the edges.
11. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Spring Lime Tea Cookies!

gt:
Place filets in a re-sealable plastic bag.
Combine the marinade ingredients in a glass bowl or measuring cup.
Pour the marinade over the filets, seal the bag and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Thoroughly combine the butter, worcestershire sauce and mustard.
Set aside until the steaks are cooked.
Remove the filets to a warm platter.
Place about a teaspoon of flavored butter on top of each filet.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the steaks, olive oil, garlic, rosemary, thyme, Worcestershire sauce, and Dijon mustard. Mix well to ensure the marinade is evenly distributed.
3. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or up to 8 hours.
4. Remove the steaks from the marinade and pat them dry with paper towels.
5. Heat a large skillet or oven-safe pan over medium-high heat. Add a small amount of olive oil to the pan and sear the steaks for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until they are browned and cooked to your desired level of doneness.
6. Transfer the steaks to a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 6-8 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 120°F (49°C) for medium-rare.
7. Remove the steaks from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes before slicing them thinly across the grain.
8. Serve the Marinated Filet Mignon With Flavored Butter immediately, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat the oven to 400.
Generously butter a 9-inch-round or 8-inch-square nonreactive baking dish.
Toss the plums with the sugar and rum; arrange in the prepared dish in an even layer.
With a rolling pin, crush the toasts in a bag to 1/4 -inch crumbs.
(Or pulse in a food processor.)
Toss the crumbs with the butter; scatter over the fruit.
Bake for about 15 minutes until the plums are soft and the top is golden.
Serve warm or at room temperature over ice cream.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the Italian plums, sugar, rum, and anisette toasts.
3. Add the melted butter to the mixture and stir until well combined.
4. Transfer the mixture to a 9-inch (23cm) square baking dish.
5. Cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake for 45 minutes.
6. Remove the foil and continue to bake for an additional 15 minutes, or until the plums are tender and the mixture is bubbly.
7. Allow the dish to cool for a few minutes before serving.
8. Serve the warm Italian Plum Betty dish with a scoop of vanilla ice cream on the side.

[/INST]

gt:
Put the broccoli florets into a bowl.
Toss the chives, parsley and oil with the broccoli.
Add salt, pepper and red pepper flakes to taste.
Preheat your grill for medium heat.
Cut off four 10-inch sheets of foil and put them on your work surface.
To prepare the packets, put about a cup of the broccoli in the center of a 10 inch sheet of foil.
Bring the top and bottom of the foil up and roll down, then just roll the sides in.
Put the packets onto the grill and grill for 10 to 15 minutes with the grill cover on.
Remove from grill.
Open carefully (theyre hot!!)
Enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat your grill to medium-high heat.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the broccoli florets, chives, parsley, coconut oil, salt, and pepper. Toss the ingredients together until the broccoli is evenly coated.
3. Spread the broccoli mixture onto a baking sheet or a large plate, making sure it is evenly distributed.
4. Grill the broccoli packets for about 5-7 minutes, or until the edges are slightly charred and the broccoli is tender.
5. Remove the packets from the grill and let them cool for a few minutes.
6. Open the packets and serve the broccoli immediately.
7. If desired, add a pinch of red pepper flakes for extra flavor.

Enjoy your delicious Broccoli Packets!

gt:
Cut off small ends of passion fruit.
Scoop out pulp into mesh strainer placed over blender container.
Press pulp with back of large spoon to extract juice into blender container.
Add cream cheese and sugar to blender; blend until smooth.
Spoon 1/4 cup pineapple chunks into each of 12 parfait or dessert glasses.
Cover each with layers of 1 Tbsp.
cream cheese mixture, 1/4 cup mangos, additional 1 Tbsp.
cream cheese mixture and 1/4 cup papayas.
Top each with 2 Tbsp.
each COOL WHIP and pomegranate seeds.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a small saucepan, combine the 3 passion fruit, sugar, and water. Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 10-15 minutes, or until the sauce thickens slightly.
3. In a large bowl, combine the softened cream cheese, sugar, and 1/2 cup of the passion fruit sauce. Mix until smooth and creamy.
4. In a separate bowl, combine the pineapple chunks, mangos, and pomegranate seeds.
5. In a separate bowl, combine the thawed COOL WHIP and the remaining passion fruit sauce.
6. To assemble the parfait, layer the pineapple mixture, cream cheese mixture, and COOL WHIP mixture in a tall glass or bowl. Repeat the layers until you reach the top with the COOL WHIP mixture.
7. Chill the parfait in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or until the COOL WHIP is firm.

Enjoy your delicious and refreshing Tropical Fruit Parfait with Passion Fruit Sauce!

gt:
Combine olive oil and garlic and steep about 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 400 degreed F.
Split loaf of bread lengthwise, then in half to form 4 sections.
Set bread, cut side up, on baking sheet and spread with garlic infused oil.
Rub cloves directly on bread and leave pieces on the bread.
Sprinkle with dried oregano.
Bake for 4 - 5 minutes until bread is golden and crispy.
Remove large pieces of garlic.
Season bread lightly with salt.
pred:
To cook a delicious Garlic Bread dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 450°F (232°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the 3 tablespoons of extra-virgin olive oil, the 3 garlic cloves, crushed and peeled, and the oregano.
3. Spread the mixture evenly over the top of the 12 inches loaf Italian bread.
4. Sprinkle the dried oregano and 12 teaspoon of salt over the bread.
5. Place the bread in a baking dish and bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and the garlic bread is cooked through.
6. Remove the bread from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing it into individual servings.

Enjoy your delicious Garlic Bread dish!

gt:
Preheat oven to 300F.
Mix butter, Italian seasoning and garlic powder until well blended; set aside.
Unroll dough on lightly floured surface.
Separate into two 7x3-1/2-inch rectangles.
Place, side-by-side, on nonstick baking sheet.
Firmly press seams and perforations together to seal; brush with half of the butter mixture.
Sprinkle evenly with cheese and onions; top with turkey.
Starting at one of the short ends, roll up reach rectangle to form log.
Pinch seams and ends together to seal.
Position logs lengthwise, seam-sides down, in centre of baking sheet.
Brush with remaining butter mixture.
Bake 25 min.
or until lightly browned.
Let stand 5 min.
Cut each log into six slices.
Serve with the marinara sauce.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the melted butter, Italian seasoning, and garlic powder.
3. Unroll the crescent rolls and press them together to form a large rectangle.
4. Spread the melted butter mixture evenly over the dough, leaving a small border around the edges.
5. Layer the shredded mozzarella cheese over the butter mixture.
6. Add the chopped onions and thinly sliced deli turkey breast on top of the cheese.
7. Roll the dough up, starting from the long side, and press the edges to seal.
8. Cut the roll into 12 equal pieces.
9. Place the rolls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
10. Bake the rolls for 12-15 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
11. While the rolls are baking, prepare the marinara sauce.
12. Once the rolls are done, remove them from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
13. Serve the Pizza Roll-Ups with Dipping Sauce warm.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Preheat oven to 200 F.
Split the crackers, pecans, cereal and pretzels evenly between 2 large pans, toss to combine and spread it out.
I use 9 x 13 pans.
Mix the last five ingredients (oil through garlic) in a small bowl then pour it over the crackers and cereal and toss to coat.
Bake in a 200 F oven for 20-30 minutes, stirring every 10 minutes.
Remove from oven and let it cool completely.
Then store in tins or Ziplock bags.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 200°F (93°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the oyster crackers, melba toast, pecans, kix cereal, corn chex cereal, pretzel sticks, and oil. Mix well.
3. In a small bowl, whisk together the ranch dressing mix, dillweed, lemon pepper, and garlic powder.
4. Pour the dressing mixture over the dry ingredients and mix well.
5. Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the crackers are crispy and the mixture is well-cooked.
7. Remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

This Dill Cracker Snack Mix is a delicious and satisfying treat that combines the crunchiness of crackers, the chewy texture of melba toast, and the crunchiness of pecans and pretzels. The addition of dillweed and lemon pepper adds a unique flavor profile, while the ranch dressing mix provides a creamy and tangy taste. The combination of these ingredients results in a delightful snack that can be enjoyed by everyone.

gt:
Arrange chicken in lightly greased 13 x 9 inch baking dish.
Put sliced swiss cheese on each chicken breast.
In a separate bowl, combine soup and wine, stirring well.
Spoon sauce evenly over chicken.
Sprinkle stuffing mix over this.
Drizzle butter over crumbs.
Bake at 350 for 50-60 minute.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the chicken breasts, Swiss cheese, cream of chicken soup, and dry white wine or water. Mix well to ensure the chicken is evenly coated with the sauce.
3. Add the herb seasoned stuffing mix, and mix until well combined.
4. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
5. Place the chicken mixture on the prepared baking sheet.
6. Dot the chicken with melted butter.
7. Bake the chicken in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the stuffing is golden brown.
8. Remove the chicken from the oven, and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into portions.

Enjoy your delicious Creamy Baked Chicken Breasts dish!

gt:
Place leafy green vegetable in pot with oil, wata, onion, bell pepper, garlic etc.
Cover n leave to cook down till soft.
When soft place chicken breast evenly chopped and partially cooked into pan with cock soup seasoning and a pinch of salt with tomato paste.
Leave to cook for next 30 mins then serve.
pred:
1. Wash and chop the green choped leafy vegetables, onion, bell pepper, and garlic cloves.
2. In a large bowl, combine the chopped vegetables, garlic cloves, and hot pepper.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the cock soup seasoning, cooking oil, and a pinch of salt.
4. Add the chicken breasts to the bowl with the vegetables and seasoning mixture.
5. Toss the chicken and vegetables together until the chicken is evenly coated with the seasoning mixture.
6. Add the tomato and tomato paste to the bowl and toss everything together.
7. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
8. Serve the Chicken cooked salad dish over a bed of lettuce or your preferred salad greens.

[/INST]

gt: Build in an ice filled highball glass.
pred:
[/INST]

[INST]<<SYS>>
To create a delicious Pama Sea Breeze cocktail, follow these steps:
1. In a cocktail shaker, combine 2 ounces of pama pomegranate liqueur, 2 ounces of cranberry juice, and 1 ounce of grapefruit juice.
2. Shake the mixture vigorously for about 10-15 seconds to ensure the ingredients are well combined and chilled.
3. Strain the mixture into a glass filled with ice.
4. Garnish the cocktail with a slice of grapefruit and a sprig of mint for added flavor and visual appeal.
5. Serve the Pama Sea Breeze cocktail immediately and enjoy the refreshing taste of this delightful summer drink.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Brown Ground Meat in a large pot.
Salt and pepper meat to your taste.
Add onion and cook until onion becomes translucent
Add wine and cook about one minute
Add all 4 regular size cans of tomato sauce.
Rinse each can with a splash of water and add to pot.
Salt and pepper sauce to your taste.
If using dried basil, add now.
You can adjust basil amount to your tatse.
Bring to a boil, turn to low and let simmer partly covered for 3.5 hours stirring occasionally.
If using fresh basil, add for last 30 minutes.
You can put sauce directly onto cooked pasta.
Use for a lasagna or lasagna roll ups.
You options are endless!
It also freezes very well for up to 3 weeks.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the ground turkey or lean ground beef over medium heat until browned, breaking it into small pieces as it cooks.
3. Add the chopped onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the canned tomato sauce, stirring to combine.
5. Add the fresh or dried basil and red wine. Stir to combine.
6. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Transfer the mixture to a casserole dish or oven-safe baking dish.
8. Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the meat sauce is bubbly and hot.
9. Serve hot over pasta or your favorite noodle.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Boil sweet potatoesh in salted water until fork tender.
Mash sweet potatoe, add flour, salt, egg, knead 15 times and roll into 1" rope.
Cut into 1" pieces, slightly with with floured fork tine.
Set aside to firm up in refrigerator.
Drop into boiling water until bubbles disappear and float to top.
Freeze and reheat a few seconds in broiling water.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the cubed sweet potatoes, water, and egg. Mix well.
3. Add the flour gradually, stirring until a dough forms.
4. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic.
5. Roll out the dough into a thin, even layer.
6. Cut the dough into desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a sharp knife.
7. Place the gnocchi on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
8. Bake the gnocchi in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until they are golden brown and cooked through.
9. Serve the Sweet Potato Italian Gnocchi warm, with your favorite sauce or topping.

[/INST]

gt:
In a bowl, mix sweetened condensed milk and key lime juice.
Whisk this till blended well.
Add Cool Whip and whisk till blended.
Pour into pie shell and refrigerate for 2-4 hours.
Enjoy!
pred:
1. First, gather all the necessary ingredients: 1 can Sweetened, Condensed Milk, 1/2 cups Key Lime Juice, 1 package Graham Cracker Pie Shell, and 1 container Cool Whip.

2. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).

3. In a medium bowl, mix the graham cracker crumbs, melted butter, and sugar until well combined. Press the mixture evenly into the bottom and up the sides of a 9-inch (23cm) springform pan.

4. Bake the crust for 8-10 minutes, or until it is set and lightly golden. Remove the crust from the oven and let it cool completely.

5. In a large bowl, whisk the sweetened condensed milk, key lime juice, and eggs until well combined.

6. Pour the mixture over the cooled crust in the springform pan.

7. Bake the pie for 35-40 minutes, or until the filling is set and the center is slightly jiggly.

8. Remove the pie from the oven and let it cool completely.

9. Once the pie is fully cooled, refrigerate it for at least 2 hours or overnight.

10. Once the pie is chilled, carefully remove the springform pan and place the pie on a serving plate.

11. Using a hand mixer or a stand mixer, whip the Cool Whip until it reaches the desired consistency.

12. Spread the whipped Cool Whip over the top of the pie.

13. Serve the Key Lime Pie immediately, and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350F with rack in middle.
Heat oil in a wide 5- to 6-quart ovenproof heavy pot over medium heat until it shimmers, then lightly brown roast on all sides with juniper berries and herbs, 8 to 10 minutes total.
Add garlic and sprinkle roast with sea salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper, then cook until garlic is golden, about 1 minute.
Pour wine over roast and briskly simmer until reduced by half.
Pour milk over roast and bring to a bare simmer.
Cover pot and braise in oven, turning roast occasionally, until tender (milk will form curds), 2 to 2 1/2 hours.
Transfer roast to a carving board and loosely cover.
Strain juices through a fine-mesh sieve into a bowl (discard solids), reserving pot, and skim off fat.
Return juices to pot and boil until flavorful and reduced to about 2 cups.
Season with sea salt and pepper.
Slice roast and serve moistened with juices.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. In a large, heavy-bottomed pot or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the pork roast and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the roast from the pot and set aside.
3. Add the chopped garlic to the pot and cook for 1 minute, until fragrant.
4. Add the crushed juniper berries, rosemary, sage, and bay leaves to the pot. Cook for 1-2 minutes, until the herbs are fragrant.
5. Pour in the dry white wine and cook until it has almost completely evaporated, about 3-4 minutes.
6. Add the milk to the pot and stir to combine. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then cover the pot and place it in the preheated oven.
7. Cook the pork roast in the pot for 2-2 1/2 hours, or until the internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C). Remove the roast from the oven and let it rest for 10-15 minutes.
8. Carefully remove the roast from the pot and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into portions.
9. Strain the cooking liquid through a fine-mesh sieve into a clean pot or a large bowl. Discard the solids.
10. Return the cooking liquid to the pot and stir in the minced roast, which has been removed from the bone. Cook over medium heat for a few minutes, until heated through.
11. Serve the Pork Roast Braised with Milk and Fresh Herbs hot, garnished with fresh herbs and a drizzle of olive oil, if desired.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
In a medium mixing bowl, stir together flour, baking soda and baking powder; set aside.
In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter, 3/4 cup sugar and 1/2 cup brown sugar.
Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Add the flour mixture and sour cream to the creamed mixture, beating until combined.
Fold in the cooked sausage and 1 cup of blueberries.
Pour the batter into a greased 9 x 13 pan.
Sprinkle nuts on top.
Bake at 350 degrees (F) for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Serve warm with blueberry sauce.
For the sauce:
In a medium sauce pan, combine the sugar and cornstarch.
Add the water and 2 cups of blueberries.
Cook and stir over medium heat until thickened and bubbly.
Cook and stir 2 minutes more.
Stir in lemon juice.
Cool slightly.
Makes 2 cups sauce.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 9x9 inch baking dish.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and butter. Mix until the butter is evenly distributed and the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the sugar, sour cream, eggs, and lemon juice. Add the wet ingredients to the dry mixture and mix until just combined.
4. Fold in the cooked and drained pork sausage, chopped pecans, and fresh or frozen blueberries.
5. Pour the batter into the prepared baking dish and smooth the top with a spatula.
6. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
7. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Blueberry Sausage Breakfast Cake!

gt:
Cream butter & sugar, add eggs (1 at a time) beating after each one.
Dissolve baking soda in buttermilk.
Add to creamed mixture.
Add dates and orange slice to flour to coat.
Add coconut.
Combine the two mixtures.
Makes stiff dough that should be mixed with your hands.
Bake in a greased and floured 13x9x3 pan at 250* for 2 1/2 hours.
Combine orange juice and powered sugar and our over the hot cake.
Let it stand over night before serving.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter or margarine and sugar together until light and fluffy.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
4. Combine the baking soda and buttermilk, and then add the mixture to the butter-sugar mixture. Mix until well combined.
5. In a separate bowl, combine the flour, dates, candy orange slices, chopped nuts, flaked coconut, and orange juice.
6. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until just combined.
7. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9x13 inch baking dish.
8. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
10. Once cooled, dust the cake with powdered sugar.

[/INST]

gt:
Have White Butter Cake made and cooled, and removed from pans, recipe attached below
MAKE WHITE CHOCOLATE FROSTING, IT NEEDS TO CHILL UNTIL COLD SO SHOULD BE MADE FIRST
Place white chocolate in a large bowl.
Heat cream in the microwave or stovetop just until hot, pour over chopped chocolate, .let sit 1 minute then stir until smooth.
Chill in the refrigerator until.very cold, 1 to 2 hours.
When ready to frost cake whip mixture until light and creamy.
MAKE RASPBERRY WHIPPED CREAM FILLING
Whip cream into soft peaks, add jam, sugar and vanilla, whip until firm peaks just form.
Cut each cake layer in half with a sharp knife to make 4 layers of cake
Place one layer on your serving plate
Cover this layer with 1/3 of the raspberry filling
Place second cake layer lb top of this and cover with another 1/3 of filling
Add third layer and remaining filling, place fourth layer on top.
This will be frosted.
Frost entire cake with the whipped white chocolate frosting
Garnish with the truffles and colored sugar, and fresh tasberrys
pred:
[INST]1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans.

2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.

3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture, alternating with the milk, beginning and ending with the dry ingredients. Mix until just combined.

4. Divide the batter evenly between the prepared pans.

5. Bake the cakes for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Allow the cakes to cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.

6. In a small saucepan, heat the raspberry jam over low heat until it reaches a smooth consistency. Set aside to cool.

7. In a large mixing bowl, beat the heavy whipping cream until stiff peaks form.

8. In a separate bowl, combine the confectioners sugar, vanilla extract, and chopped white chocolate.

9. In a small saucepan, heat the heavy cream over low heat until it reaches a gentle simmer.

10. Gradually pour the hot cream over the white chocolate mixture, stirring gently to combine.

11. In a large mixing bowl, beat the remaining heavy cream until stiff peaks form.

12. Fold the whipped cream into the white chocolate mixture.

13. In a small bowl, mix the colored sugar with a few drops of water to create a smooth, runny consistency.

14. Carefully fold the colored sugar mixture into the white chocolate mixture.

15. Carefully fold the cooled raspberry jam into the white chocolate mixture.

16. Carefully fold the cooled raspberry mixture into the white chocolate mixture.

17

gt:
1.
Heat oil in a skillet over high heat.
Add mushrooms; saute 4 minutes.
Add herbs and garlic; saute 1 minute.
Stir in 1/3 cup broth, juice, and pepper.2.
Bring milk and 1 1/2 cups broth to a boil.
Stir in polenta; cook 4 minutes, stirring constantly.
Stir in half of cheese and 1/4 teaspoon salt.
Divide polenta among 4 gratin dishes; top with remaining cheese.
Broil 5 minutes.
Top each serving with 1/2 cup mushrooms.
pred:
[INST]1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the mushroom blend and cook until the mushrooms are tender, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the cremini mushrooms and cook until they are tender, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the thyme, oregano, garlic, and vegetable broth. Cook until the liquid has evaporated, about 5 minutes.
5. Stir in the lemon juice and black pepper.
6. In a small bowl, whisk together the milk and polenta.
7. Pour the polenta mixture into the skillet and stir to combine. Cook until the polenta is tender and creamy, about 5 minutes.
8. Stir in the shredded cheese and salt. Cook until the cheese is melted and the polenta is heated through, about 2 minutes.
9. Serve the Cheesy Polenta with Mushroom Saute immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Mix and set aside the butter and soda.
In a large pan, mix and boil the sugar, water,and syrup to hardball stage (254 degrees F).
Add peanuts and stir constantly until mixture turns yellow (NOT AMBER) about 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and add butter mixture and vanilla.
Pour onto greased cookie sheet.
Pat into a thickness you like with the back of a spoon.
Cool and break into pieces.
Store in airtight container.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat your oven to 300°F (150°C).
2. In a large, heavy saucepan, combine the butter or margarine, baking soda, and sugar. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture reaches 300°F (150°C) on a candy thermometer.
3. Remove the mixture from the heat and stir in the peanuts and vanilla.
4. Pour the mixture onto a greased baking sheet or a silicone mat. Spread it evenly and let it cool for about 10-15 minutes.
5. Using a spatula or a butter knife, carefully break the mixture into small, irregular pieces.
6. Return the mixture to the oven and cook for an additional 15-20 minutes, or until the pieces are golden brown and crispy.
7. Remove the mixture from the oven and let it cool completely.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Heat oven to 325F.
Chop 1/4 cup nuts finely; place in medium bowl.
Add gingersnap crumbs and butter; mix well.
Press onto bottom of 13x9-inch pan.
Beat cream cheese and sugar in large bowl with mixer until blended.
Add pumpkin, spice and vanilla; mix well.
Add eggs, 1 at a time, mixing on low speed after each just until blended.
Pour over crust.
Bake 45 min.
or until centre is almost set.
Cool completely.
Refrigerate 4 hours.
Microwave caramels and milk in microwaveable bowl on HIGH 1-1/2 min.
or until caramels are completely melted, stirring every 30 sec.
; spoon over individual servings of cheesecake.
Sprinkle with remaining nuts.
Serve with Cool Whip.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Grease a 9-inch springform pan with non-stick cooking spray or butter.
3. In a large bowl, mix the softened Philadelphia Brick Cream Cheese, sugar, and pumpkin pie spice until smooth.
4. Add the melted butter, pumpkin, and vanilla, mixing until well combined.
5. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and milk.
6. Add the egg mixture to the cream cheese mixture, mixing until smooth.
7. Pour the batter into the prepared pan.
8. Bake for 45-50 minutes or until the center is set.
9. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes.
10. Meanwhile, prepare the caramel topping. In a small saucepan, combine the sugar, water, and corn syrup. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the sugar has dissolved. Cook for about 5 minutes or until the caramel reaches a soft-ball stage (240°F/115°C).
11. Remove the caramel from the heat and stir in the butter.
12. Pour the caramel over the cooled cheesecake.
13. Sprinkle the chopped pecans evenly over the caramel.
14. Refrigerate the cake for at least 4 hours or overnight.
15. To serve, remove the cake from the pan and transfer it to a serving plate.
16. Top the cake with the Cool Whip Whipped Topping.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Place bacon in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook until browned on one side, then turn over to cook on the other side.
Add the almonds to the skillet at this time, and cook, stirring until light golden brown.
Remove the bacon from the skillet, leaving the bacon drippings.
Crumble or chop bacon, and return to the skillet.
Melt the butter in with the drippings.
Add the green beans; cook and stir until tender, about 8 minutes.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Begin by preheating your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the bacon over medium heat until it is crispy. Remove the bacon from the skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, add the slivered almonds and cook until they are golden brown. Remove the almonds from the skillet and set aside.
4. In a separate bowl, combine the frozen cut green beans, butter, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
5. In the same skillet, heat the butter over medium heat. Add the green beans and cook until they are tender but still crisp.
6. Add the cooked bacon and almonds to the skillet and stir to combine.
7. Serve the Sauteed Green Beans over rice or noodles, and enjoy your delicious homemade meal!

[/TUTORIAL]

gt:
Blend all of the crust ingredients in a food processor and press into the bottom of a lightly greased 9x13 pan.
If you do not have a processor, you can use a pastry blender to incorporate the butter into the flour.
Bake at 350 degrees F for 18 minutes or until browned.
Blend the filling ingredients until smooth.
Pour over the baked crust and return to the 350 degrees F oven for 30 minutes or until the filling is set.
Cool completely before serving.
pred:
[INST]
To prepare the Mango Cream Cheese Bars, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, and coconut.
3. Add the butter and mix until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
4. Press the mixture evenly into the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish.
5. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown.
6. While the crust is baking, prepare the filling. In a separate mixing bowl, combine the cream cheese, eggs, lemon juice, milk, and sugar. Mix until smooth.
7. Once the crust is done, remove it from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Spread the cream cheese mixture evenly over the cooled crust.
9. Arrange the cubed mango on top of the cream cheese layer.
10. Return the baking dish to the oven and bake for an additional 25-30 minutes, or until the filling is set and the edges are golden brown.
11. Allow the bars to cool completely before cutting them into squares and serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Divide the prawns between two glasses or pint mugs.
Finely mince the garlic cloves.
Halve and seed the chilli, then finely chop the chilli flesh.
Mix the mayonnaise with the garlic and chilli, and divide between two small dishes.
Serve the prawns with the garlic/chilli mayonnaise and lemon wedges for squeezing over the prawns, and a pint of Guinness or your favourite real ale.
NB: The garlic & chilli mayonnaise also goes brilliantly with any grilled or barbecued fish or seafood.
Try it with salmon steaks wrapped in vine leaves or uncooked prawns threaded onto skewers, cooked on the barbecue.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large bowl, mix the cooked prawns, garlic cloves, red chili, and mayonnaise.
3. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
4. Transfer the mixture to a large, oven-safe baking dish.
5. Bake the prawns in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until they are cooked through and the mayonnaise is melted and bubbly.
6. Serve the prawns immediately, garnished with a lemon wedge.
7. To make a Guinness Chaser, pour a Guinness stout or ale into a glass, and enjoy alongside your prawns.
