gt:
Combine and beat first 3 ingredients together until slight mounds form.
Add sugar gradually beating well after each addition.
Continue beating until meringue stands in stiff glossy peaks.
Spread or force meringue through a cake decorator or cookie tube.
Bake at 170AC for 12-15 minutes until brown.
pred:
1. In a clean, dry bowl, whisk the egg whites until they are frothy and form soft peaks.
2. Gradually add the sugar to the egg whites, whisking continuously to ensure the sugar is evenly distributed.
3. Add the cream of tartar and salt to the egg whites, and continue to whisk until the mixture is stiff and glossy.
4. Preheat the oven to 200°F (93°C).
5. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. Using a spatula, carefully spread the meringue mixture onto the prepared baking sheet, forming a smooth, even layer.
7. Bake the meringue in the preheated oven for about 1 hour, or until it is dry and crisp.
8. Remove the meringue from the oven and allow it to cool completely.
9. Once the meringue is cool, use a spatula to carefully transfer it to a serving plate.
10. Enjoy your homemade AMIEs MERINGUE!

gt:
In a greased oval 5-6 quart slow cooker, combine the vegetables and broth.
Place drumsticks over vegetables.
Sprinkle remaining ingredients over all.
Cover and cook on LOW for 5-5 1/2 hours, or until meat thermometer registers 180* F.
pred:
1. Preheat the slow-cooker on low heat.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the turkey drumsticks, potatoes, carrots, celery, onion, garlic, seasoning salt, dried thyme, dried parsley, and pepper.
3. Pour the chicken broth over the ingredients, making sure to coat them evenly.
4. Cover the slow-cooker and cook on low heat for 8-10 hours or until the meat is tender and the vegetables are cooked through.
5. Remove the slow-cooker from the heat and let it rest for about 15-20 minutes before serving.
6. Serve the Turkey Leg Pot Roast with mashed potatoes and a side of steamed broccoli or your preferred vegetable. Enjoy your delicious homemade meal!

gt:
Cook shrimp in butter 2 - 3 minutes.
Remove from skillet and chop up very small.
Add onions and peppers to skillet and saute 3 minutes.
Add onion mixture to potatoes and mix well.
Stir in eggs then shrimp.
Stir in enough bread crumbs to make mixture firm.
Roll potato mixture into balls then roll balls into additional bread crumbs.
Cover and chill 30 minutes to 4 hours.
Heat oil in deep fryer.
Fry balls for about 4 minutes; drain on paper towels.
Serve immediately.
Makes 2 dozen small fritters!
Enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the mashed potatoes, beaten eggs, green onions, green pepper, and chili pepper. Mix well.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the breadcrumbs and vegetable oil.
4. Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium heat.
5. Using a spoon, scoop out small amounts of the potato mixture and shape them into small patties.
6. Carefully place the patties into the hot skillet, cooking for about 3-4 minutes on each side or until golden brown.
7. Remove the fritters from the skillet and place them on a baking sheet.
8. Bake the fritters in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until golden brown and cooked through.
9. Serve the Shrimp Fritters hot, as a side dish or appetizer.

[/INST]

gt:
Begin by placing chicken in a large pot and covering it with water.
Add garlic cloves and some salt to flavor it.
Bring it to a boil, then let it simmer for about 1 hour and 20 minutes.
Remove chicken and let cool so that its easier to handle.
Tear meat off of chicken and either shred with fingers or chop with a knife and set aside.
Next, brown sausage in a large Dutch oven or other pot.
Remove sausage, leaving grease.
Add chopped onion to the pot, sauteing until tender and translucent.
Return sausage and chicken to pot with onions.
Add white rice and 2 cups of water.
Sprinkle in a little salt and Creole seasoning.
Bring water to a boil.
Stir until rice puffs and most of water is gone (this time will vary depending on what type of rice you use).
Cover, lower heat, and simmer 15-20 minutes.
Season to taste with salt, pepper, Creole seasoning, and cayenne.
This will make about 6-10 servings depending on your appetite.
Each person can add more Creole seasoning and Tabasco sauce if they would like extra spice.
The leftovers are delicious, so its a great meal to make on Sunday and enjoy for a few more days!
You can also change it up by adding bell peppers, tomato sauce, or different meats.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large, oven-safe skillet or Dutch oven, heat the oil over medium heat.
3. Add the chicken and cook until browned on all sides, about 10 minutes. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
4. Add the sausage to the skillet and cook until browned, breaking it up into smaller pieces as it cooks.
5. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
6. Add the rice to the skillet and stir to combine with the sausage and onion.
7. Add the water, salt, creole seasoning, pepper, and cayenne to the skillet. Stir to combine.
8. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover the skillet.
9. Cook the Jambalaya in the oven for about 30-40 minutes, or until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed.
10. Remove the skillet from the oven and let it sit for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Place couscous in a large bowl and pour boiling water over the top.
Let it soak for 10 minutes to swell the grains, then fluff it with a fork.
Add the remaining ingredients to the couscous and stir well to combine.
Chill in the refrigerator, if desired, and enjoy!
pred:
To create a mouthwatering Curried Couscous Salad dish, follow these steps:

1. In a large bowl, combine the uncooked couscous with the boiling water. Allow the mixture to sit for about 5 minutes, or until the water is absorbed and the couscous is tender.
2. In a separate bowl, combine the chopped tomatoes, green bell pepper, and chickpeas.
3. In a small bowl, mix the yogurt, curry powder, salt, and pepper.
4. Once the couscous is cooked, drain the excess water and transfer the mixture to a large mixing bowl.
5. Add the yogurt mixture to the couscous, and stir to combine.
6. Serve the Curried Couscous Salad immediately, or refrigerate it for a few hours before serving, allowing the flavors to meld together.

Enjoy your delicious Curried Couscous Salad!

gt:
Lightly coat bottom of large nonstick skillet with cooking spray and heat over medium heat until hot.
Add onion and garlic and cook, stirring often, 5 minutes.
Add bell peppers and mushrooms.
Cover and cook 3 to 4 minutes.
Add flour and cook, stirring constantly, 1 minute.
Stir in broth until well blended.
Cover and cook over medium-low heat for 5 minutes.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Remove from heat and stir in parsley.
Toss pasta with mushroom mixture.
Serve right away.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
3. Add the minced garlic and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
4. Add the green and red bell peppers to the skillet, and cook until they are slightly softened, about 3-4 minutes.
5. Add the mushrooms (both white and shiitake) to the skillet, and cook until they are tender and slightly browned, about 5-7 minutes.
6. Add the flour to the skillet, stirring constantly to create a roux. Cook for about 1-2 minutes, until the flour is lightly browned.
7. Gradually pour in the vegetable broth, stirring constantly to avoid lumps. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for about 10-12 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened.
8. Season the sauce with salt and pepper to taste.
9. In a large pot, cook the linguine according to the package instructions until al dente.
10. Drain the linguine and return it to the pot. Pour the sauce over the linguine and toss to combine.
11. Add the chopped parsley and toss again to combine.
12. Serve the Linguini with Wild Mushrooms Sauce immediately, and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Crack the eggs into large bowl, mix until slightly bubbly
Add milk into egg mixture, stir, and set aside
Cut up the sausages unto small pieces, set aside
Melt the butter with vegetable oil in the pan with medium heat
Put the diced onion and sausages, stir fry but not until fully cooked
Pour the egg mixture to the pan
Add the shredded cheddar cheese
Add salt and pepper to taste (optional)
Serve with toast bread
pred:
[INST]
To prepare an Omelette using the provided ingredients, follow these steps:
1. In a small bowl, whisk the eggs until they are well-beaten.
2. Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat.
3. Add the diced onion to the pan and cook until it is soft and translucent.
4. Add the Bratwurst sausage to the pan and cook until it is browned and fully cooked.
5. Pour the whisked eggs into the pan, stirring gently to scramble the eggs.
6. Add the shredded Cheddar Cheese to the pan, stirring until it is melted and combined with the eggs.
7. Add the Butter to the pan, stirring until it is melted and incorporated into the mixture.
8. Season the Omelette with Salt and Pepper, if desired.
9. Cook the Omelette until the edges are set and the center is still slightly runny.
10. Carefully flip the Omelette and cook for an additional 30 seconds or until the bottom is set.
11. Remove the Omelette from the pan and let it rest for a moment before cutting it into wedges.

Enjoy your delicious Omelette!

gt:
Heat gas grill on medium or charcoal grill until coals are ash white.
Combine butter and pesto in bowl; mix well.
Reserve 1 tablespoon butter mixture; set aside.
Thread shrimp and vegetables onto separate skewers.
Brush shrimp and vegetables with butter mixture.
Place vegetable kabobs onto grill.
Grill, turning and brushing with butter mixture once, 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned.
Place shrimp kabobs onto grill.
Grill, turning and brushing with butter mixture, 6 -8 minutes or until shrimp turn pink.
Brush reserved butter mixture onto shrimp and vegetables before serving.
Serve with couscous, pasta or rice, if desired.
pred:
[INST]To cook a delicious Pesto Shrimp Brochette dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
2. In a small bowl, mix the softened Land O Lakes Butter with the prepared pesto sauce.
3. In a large bowl, combine the large fresh raw shrimp, peeled and deveined, with the pesto butter mixture.
4. Allow the shrimp to marinate in the butter mixture for 15-20 minutes.
5. While the shrimp are marinating, prepare the vegetables. Slice the zucchini and yellow summer squash into diagonal pieces, approximately 3/4 inch thick.
6. Soak the wooden skewers in water for 30 minutes or use metal skewers.
7. After marinating, remove the shrimp from the butter mixture and transfer them to a plate.
8. Thread the shrimp onto the skewers, alternating between shrimp and vegetable pieces.
9. Grill the shrimp and vegetable skewers for 5-7 minutes, or until the shrimp are cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
10. Serve the Pesto Shrimp Brochette over hot cooked couscous, pasta, or rice, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Pesto Shrimp Brochette dish!

gt:
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, fish sauce, rice wine vinegar, brown sugar and sesame oil.
Vigorously whisk in corn starch until incorporated.
Add a pinch of crushed red pepper flakes.
Heat canola or grapeseed oil in a large wok or skillet to medium-high heat.
Add chicken breast and season with salt and pepper.
Cook for about 45 minutes, stirring frequently, until browned.
Add broccoli and stir-fry vegetables and cook another 34 minutes, until just slightly tender.
Add sauce and cook, stirring constantly, until sauce has thickened, about 2 minutes.
Serve stir-fry over cooked rice or quinoa and garnish with cashews or peanuts and Sriracha.
pred:
1. In a small bowl, whisk together the low sodium soy sauce, fish sauce, rice wine vinegar, dark brown sugar, and toasted sesame oil. Set aside.
2. In a large skillet or wok, heat the canola oil over medium-high heat. Add the sliced chicken and cook until browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
3. Add the broccoli florets to the skillet and cook until tender, about 3-5 minutes. Season with crushed red pepper flakes.
4. Add the stir-fry vegetables to the skillet and cook until they are slightly tender, about 2-3 minutes.
5. Pour the sauce mixture over the chicken and broccoli in the skillet, stirring to combine. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.
6. Serve the Cashew Chicken & Broccoli Stir Fry over cooked rice or quinoa. Garnish with chopped cashews or peanuts, and drizzle with Sriracha for added flavor.

[/INST]

gt:
Spray 10 mini loaf pans with vegetable oil cooking spray.
In a 2-quart saucepan, heat the milk and marshmallow together over low heat.
Stir constantly, because condensed milk scorches easily, until the marshmallows are melted.
Remove the mixture from the heat.
Combine the cracker crumbs, pecans, coconut, dates and cherries in a large bowl.
Add the bourbon to the milk mixture and pour over the crumb mixture.
Mix well with your hands.
Scoop the mixture into the prepared pans and press down firmly to mold into shape.
Refrigerate for 2 days.
pred:
To prepare a delicious No Bake Fruitcake by Paula Deen, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the sweetened condensed milk, miniature marshmallows, graham crackers, and pecans. Mix well.
3. Add the crushed coconut and chopped dates, and mix until well combined.
4. Stir in the maraschino cherries and Bourbon.
5. Transfer the mixture to a 9x13 inch baking dish that has been greased or lined with parchment paper.
6. Bake the cake for about 30-35 minutes, or until it is set and the edges are slightly golden.
7. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool completely.
8. Once the cake is cooled, cut it into squares and serve.

This No Bake Fruitcake by Paula Deen is a delicious and easy dessert that can be enjoyed by people of all ages. The combination of sweet condensed milk, marshmallows, graham crackers, and pecans creates a moist and flavorful cake, while the cherries and coconut add a touch of natural sweetness and a delightful texture. The Bourbon contributes a subtle warmth to the dessert, making it a perfect treat for any occasion.

gt:
Cook pasta as directed on the package, set aside.
While cooking, heat the chicken stock in the microwave to warm, add the chicken and set aside.
Melt butter and oil in a large skillet/sauce pan.
Add wine and lemon juice and bring to a boil, reduce heat and return to simmer.
Add artichoke quarters, capers, broth and chicken.
Slowly bring back to boil.
Mix half and half and flour until smooth, add to boiling sauce to thicken.
Remove from heat, then add spinach and noodles, toss.
Top with parsley and parmesan.
Serve immediately.
pred:
To prepare a perfect Chicken Piccata Pasta, follow these key steps:

1. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions until it reaches the desired level of doneness.
2. In a large skillet, heat the butter over medium heat. Add the chicken, cook until it is browned and cooked through. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, add the chicken stock, lemon juice, and capers. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 10 minutes.
4. Add the sliced chicken back to the skillet, and cook until the sauce has thickened slightly.
5. Add the artichoke quarters to the skillet, and cook until they are tender but still crisp.
6. In a small bowl, whisk together the flour and lemon zest. Gradually whisk in the half-and-half, and continue whisking until the sauce thickens.
7. Add the whisked sauce to the skillet, and stir to combine with the chicken and vegetables.
8. Season the sauce with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions, and then drain it.
10. Add the cooked pasta to the skillet with the chicken and sauce, and toss everything together until the pasta is coated with the sauce.
11. Serve the Chicken Piccata Pasta immediately, garnished with fresh parsley and parmesan cheese.

By following these key steps, you will have a delicious and well-balanced Chicken Piccata Pasta ready to enjoy.

gt:
Preheat the oven to 400F Peel the bananas and slice in half lengthwise.
Lay the pieces into a buttered 9x13x2-inch ovenproof dish.
Pour the lime juice and rum evenly over the bananas.
Sprinkle on the cinnamon, nutmeg, and brown sugar.
Dot on the butter, if using, and bake for 10 to 15 minutes.
Serve hot, topped with a tablespoon of fresh cream or ice cream.
pred:
To make a delicious Tropical Baked Bananas dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Peel the bananas and cut them into equal-sized pieces.
3. In a small bowl, mix the dark rum, juiced lime, and ground cinnamon.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the ground nutmeg, dark brown sugar, and butter (if using).
5. Place the banana pieces in a baking dish.
6. Pour the rum mixture over the bananas, ensuring that they are evenly coated.
7. Sprinkle the nutmeg mixture evenly over the bananas.
8. Bake the bananas for 25-30 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
9. Remove the baking dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
10. Serve the Tropical Baked Bananas warm, garnished with a sprinkle of cinnamon and nutmeg.

The ingredients used in this dish, such as bananas, lime, rum, cinnamon, nutmeg, dark brown sugar, and butter, work together to create a delicious and tropical-inspired dessert. The combination of the sweetness of the bananas, the tanginess of the lime, and the warmth of the rum and spices creates a delightful and satisfying treat.

gt:
Place half of the strawberries in 1-cup serving bowl; top with layers of half each of the yogurt and Walnut Oat Topping.
Repeat layers.
Serve immediately.
pred:
1. First, wash and dry the strawberries.
2. In a small bowl, mix the sliced strawberries with a tablespoon of honey.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the sliced strawberries with a tablespoon of walnut oat topping.
4. In a tall glass, layer the strawberry mixture, yogurt, and walnut oat topping.
5. Serve immediately and enjoy your delicious Strawberry Yogurt Parfait.

[/INST]

gt:
Cook the pierogies according to package directions.Cook bacon in a large nonstick skillet until crisp.
Remove bacon; crumble.
Increase heat to medium-high.
Add onion, sugar, and thyme to drippings in pan; saute 5 minutes.
Stir in peas; saute 1 minute.
Add pierogies, salt, and pepper; cook 30 seconds.
Sprinkle with crumbled bacon.
Serve with sour cream.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove the bacon from the pan and set aside.
3. In the same pan, add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the sugar and thyme to the pan and cook for another 2 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. Add the green peas to the pan and cook for 2 minutes more.
6. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked onion mixture, frozen green peas, and sour cream.
7. Place the pierogies in a single layer on a baking sheet.
8. Pour the sour cream mixture over the pierogies, making sure to coat each one evenly.
9. Bake the pierogies in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the filling is bubbly and the pierogies are cooked through.
10. Serve the Pierogies with Bacon, Sauteed Onion, and Sour Cream immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
In an 8 quart pot, bring water to a boil and cook shells for 8 minutes or until al dente.
Drain and cool immediately with cold water.
Drain and place open side down on paper towels.
In a medium bowl, combine the rest of ingredients except the spaghetti sauce.
Reserve the 1/4 cup of Mozzarella.
Place a thin layer of spaghetti sauce into the bottom of a 12 x 9 x 2 inch baking dish.
Preheat oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit.
Spoon the cheese mixture into each pasta shell and place open side up, in a single layer, in prepared pan.
Pour the rest of sauce over the stuffed shells.
Loosely cover with foil and bake for 40 minutes.
During last 5 minutes of baking, remove foil and sprinkle remaining Mozzarella cheese on top.
Bake 5 more minutes.
Garnish with fresh chopped basil.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Cook the pasta shells according to the package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the mozzarella cheese, parmesan cheese, ricotta cheese, eggs, black pepper, garlic powder, and dried parsley. Mix until well combined.
4. Fill each pasta shell with the cheese mixture, dividing it evenly among the shells.
5. Place the stuffed shells on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. Bake the stuffed shells in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
7. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the shells cool for a few minutes.
8. Garnish the stuffed shells with fresh basil leaves.
9. Serve the Baked Stuffed Pasta Shells warm, and enjoy your delicious homemade pasta dish!

gt:
Place the sesame seeds in a dry skillet over medium heat.
Cook and stir for 5 minutes, or until golden brown and fragrant.
In a medium bowl, mix toasted sesame seeds, green onions, garlic, tahini, soy sauce, white sugar, red wine vinegar, and pepper.
Place desired meat in the mixture, cover, and marinate as long as you like, but overnight is best.
Grill as desired.
pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the sesame seeds, green onions, minced garlic, tahini, soy sauce, white sugar, and red wine vinegar. Mix well to ensure all ingredients are evenly distributed.
2. Add the freshly ground black pepper to the mixture and stir to combine.
3. Cover the bowl and refrigerate the marinade for at least 2 hours or overnight.
4. Preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
5. Remove the marinade from the refrigerator and let it come to room temperature.
6. Place the meat in a large resealable plastic bag or airtight container. Pour the marinade over the meat, making sure it is evenly distributed. Seal the bag or container and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
7. Remove the meat from the marinade and pat it dry with paper towels.
8. Grill the meat for 4-5 minutes per side or until it reaches your desired level of doneness.
9. Serve the cooked meat with the marinade as a dipping sauce.

Enjoy your Absolutely Ultimate Marinade dish!

gt:
Preheat oven to 450F.
Heat 2 tablespoons oil in heavy large ovenproof skillet.
Add 11/4 cups onion; saute until onion begins to soften, about 5 minutes.
Add turkey and chiles; saute 3 minutes.
Stir in salsa; simmer until heated through, about 3 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Stir in chips.
Sprinkle with cheese.
Place skillet in oven; bake just until cheese melts, about 5 minutes.
Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup onion and cilantro; drizzle with crema and serve.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet or oven-safe pan, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
3. Add the chopped red onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the diced cooked turkey and cook until browned, about 5 minutes.
5. Add the 4-ounce can of diced green chiles, salsa with chipotles and garlic, and stir to combine.
6. Cook for 5-7 minutes, or until the turkey is cooked through and the flavors are well-mixed.
7. In a separate bowl, mix the tortilla chips, crumbled queso fresco or Cotija cheese, and chopped fresh cilantro.
8. Pour the cooked turkey and salsa mixture over the tortilla chips and cheese mixture.
9. Transfer the entire mixture to a baking dish, and bake in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Serve immediately, garnished with a dollop of Crema mexicana or sour cream, if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
In a bowl, combine the shrimp, black pepper sauce, grated ginger, orange zest, orange segments, and orange juice ~ marinate for 1/2 hour.
In a hot skillet or wok, melt the butter and olive oil, garlic, soy sauce, and sherry ~ saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add the marinated shrimp mixture.
Saute for about 3-4 minutes until shrimp turns pink.
NOTE: Sauce will be thin ~ you MIGHT be able to thicken it with a little cornstarch mixed with cold water, then add the cornstarch mixture to the hot sauce and simmer for 2-3 minutes while stirring, although I read that cornstarch doesn't react well to acidic ingredients so I have not tried to thicken this sauce with it.
Perhaps I will buy some arrowroot and try that for this sauce!
Serve over cooked jasmine rice, with steamed broccoli, or green beans.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the sliced ginger, minced garlic, and soy sauce.
3. Add the shrimp to the bowl and toss to coat the shrimp evenly with the marinade.
4. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 15 minutes, or up to 2 hours.
5. In a small bowl, mix the minced gingerroot with the black pepper sauce.
6. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the minced ginger mixture and cook for about 1 minute, stirring constantly.
7. Add the orange segments to the skillet and cook for 1-2 minutes, or until they are slightly caramelized.
8. Add the butter to the skillet and stir to melt it.
9. Add the shrimp to the skillet, cooking until they are pink and cooked through, about 2-3 minutes.
10. Remove the shrimp from the skillet and set aside.
11. In a small bowl, mix the black pepper sauce with the dry sherry.
12. Add the shrimp to the skillet and toss to coat them with the sauce.
13. Cook for 1-2 minutes, or until the shrimp are cooked through and the sauce has thickened slightly.
14. Serve the Orange-Ginger Black Pepper Shrimp over rice or noodles, and enjoy!

gt:
Mix all ingredients well.
Marinade beef or chicken in marinade
Cook and enjoy.
pred:
1. In a small bowl, combine the 1/3 cup of oil, 1/4 cup of lime juice, 1 tsp of garlic powder, 1 tsp of cilantro chopped, 1/4 tsp of black pepper, 1/4 tsp of salt, and 1/2 tsp of chili powder. Mix well to ensure all ingredients are evenly distributed.
2. If you are marinating meat, poultry, or seafood, pour the marinade over the ingredients and let them sit in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes to 2 hours, or even overnight.
3. Preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
4. Remove the marinated ingredients from the refrigerator and let them sit at room temperature for a few minutes before grilling.
5. Grill the marinated ingredients for a few minutes on each side, or until they reach your desired level of doneness.
6. Serve the grilled meat, poultry, or seafood with the marinade as a dipping sauce or as a side sauce.

[/INST]

gt:
Scoop avocado pulp into a medium bowl.
Add the other ingredients and mash with a fork until combined but still chunky.
Pour into a serving dish and serve with tostidos on the side.
pred:
1. First, prepare the avocado by removing the pit and peeling the skin.
2. In a large bowl, mash the avocado with a fork or a potato masher until it reaches the desired consistency.
3. Add the minced jalapeno, scallions, tomatoes, lime juice, salt, and dry mustard to the avocado mixture.
4. Stir everything together until well combined.
5. Taste the mixture and adjust the seasoning as needed.
6. Cover the bowl and refrigerate the guacamole for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
7. Serve the guacamole immediately or store it in the refrigerator for up to 24 hours before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Gspeed's Guacamole!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Grease a 12-cup muffin pan.
Stir oats and milk together in a small bowl; set aside.
Whisk flour, white sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in a large bowl.
Whisk vegetable oil and egg together in a separate bowl; stir egg mixture into flour mixture just until batter is combined.
Fold oat mixture into batter; fold in saskatoon berries.
Divide batter evenly into the prepared muffin cups; sprinkle muffins with brown sugar.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 18 minutes.
Cool in pans 10 minutes.
Serve warm or cool completely on a wire rack.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the rolled oats, milk, and white sugar. Whisk until smooth.
3. Add the all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt to the mixture. Whisk until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg and vegetable oil.
5. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients, stirring until just combined.
6. Fold in the frozen saskatoon berries and brown sugar.
7. Pour the batter into a greased muffin tin, filling each cup about 3/4 full.
8. Bake the muffins for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
9. Allow the muffins to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Saskatoon Berry Oat Muffins!

gt:
Cream the butter, add the white and brown sugar.
Scrape down the bowl, add egg and vanilla.
Mix together the flour and the baking soda and add to the creamed mixture.
Add the oatmeal, cherries, chocolate, and toffee.
Using plastic wrap, divide into 3 logs and wrap.
Chill and slice 1/2" thick.
Bake on parchment (or wax papered) covered baking sheet at 350* for 8-10 mins.
Cool on rack.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the egg and vanilla, and mix well.
4. In a separate bowl, mix together the flour, baking soda, and salt.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture, alternating with the oatmeal and mixing until just combined.
6. Stir in the cherries, chocolate, and toffee pieces.
7. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
9. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
In a medium bowl, whisk the fresh cheese with the shallot, chives, tarragon, cider vinegar and walnut oil and season with salt and pepper.
Drizzle the spread with olive oil and serve with grilled sourdough bread.
pred:
1. In a small bowl, whisk together the fromage blanc, minced shallot, chopped chives, and chopped tarragon. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
2. In a separate small bowl, whisk together the cider vinegar, walnut oil, and a pinch of salt.
3. Slowly drizzle the cider vinegar mixture into the fromage blanc mixture, whisking constantly to combine.
4. Taste and adjust the seasoning as needed.
5. Spread the creamy cheese and green herb mixture onto a piece of grilled sourdough bread.
6. Serve immediately, and enjoy your delicious Creamy Cheese and Green Herb Spread dish.

gt:
Preheat your oven to 400 F.
Roll out your pizza dough onto a greased pizza pan and spread on your olive oil.
Top with shredded mozzarella cheese, sliced tomatoes and black pepper.
Bake for 20-25 minutes or until cheese is brown and bubbly.
Top with fresh basil and enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 475°F (245°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the prepared pizza dough, olive oil, and grated cheese. Knead the dough until it comes together, then shape it into a ball.
3. Place the dough ball on a lightly floured surface and let it rest for about 10-15 minutes.
4. Meanwhile, prepare the pizza sauce by combining the sliced tomatoes, minced garlic, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
5. After the dough has rested, punch it down and roll it out on a lightly floured surface to your desired thickness.
6. Transfer the rolled dough to a pizza stone or a baking sheet and spread the sauce evenly over the dough.
7. Add the sliced mozzarella cheese on top of the sauce.
8. Bake the pizza in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Remove the pizza from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
10. While the pizza is cooling, prepare the basil topping by tearing the leaves from the basil stems.
11. Once the pizza has cooled slightly, use a pizza cutter or a sharp knife to slice it into 8 equal pieces.
12. Transfer the pizza slices to a serving platter and garnish with the torn basil leaves.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Simple Tomato Margherita Pizza!

gt:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Quickly brown the chicken breast halves on both sides.
Do not cook through.
Remove from heat, and set aside.
Pour the green beans into a 2 quart casserole dish.
Place the chicken on top of the beans.
In a small bowl, mix together the cream of chicken soup and mayonnaise.
Spread over the top of the chicken and beans.
Sprinkle Parmesan cheese over the top.
Bake for 35 to 40 minutes in the preheated oven, until the chicken is no longer pink, and the cheese is browned.
pred:
To cook a delightful Chicken and Green Bean Casserole dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the chicken breast halves, green beans, and condensed cream of chicken soup.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the mayonnaise, garlic powder, and Parmesan cheese.
4. Pour the mayonnaise mixture over the chicken and green bean mixture, and stir to combine.
5. Transfer the mixture to a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
6. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for about 30-35 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and hot.
7. Remove the casserole from the oven, let it rest for a few minutes, and then serve it hot.

This delicious Chicken and Green Bean Casserole is a popular dish that combines tender chicken, creamy condensed soup, and crunchy green beans, all baked together to create a warm and comforting meal. The use of olive oil adds a touch of flavor, while the mayonnaise and Parmesan cheese provide a creamy and savory taste.

gt:
Beat whipping cream and sugar together in mixing bowl until stiff.
Dissolve coffee granules in boiling water.
Cool.
Add to whipped cream and beat in.
Makes enough to frost and fill one 8 or 9 inch 2 layer cake.
Keep Mocha Cream refrigerated.
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine 2 cups of heavy whipping cream and 2 tablespoons of white sugar.
2. Add 1 tablespoon of instant coffee powder to the mixture, stirring to combine.
3. Gradually pour in 1 tablespoon of boiling water, stirring continuously to ensure the mixture is smooth and well-combined.
4. Allow the mixture to cool for a few minutes, then place it in the refrigerator to chill for at least 2 hours.
5. Once the mixture has chilled, use a hand mixer or a stand mixer to whip the cream until it reaches the desired consistency. This will create a fluffy and airy Mocha Cream.
6. Serve the Mocha Cream immediately, or store it in the refrigerator for later use.

Enjoy your delicious Mocha Cream!

gt:
In mixing bowl, cream together the sour cream, cream cheese and dry ranch mix.
Add half of the sharp cheese, the pepper jack cheese, green onions and crushed crisp bacon.
Fold until blended.
Place mixture on a piece of plastic wrap and shape into a ball as best you can.
Chill for at least 1 hour.
Take the ball out of the plastic and smooth it with your hands.
Roll the cheese ball in the remaining sharp cheddar cheese.
You might need to press the shredded cheese into the ball if it is too cold and firm.
Serve with crackers.
Store tightly wrapped in the fridge.
pred:
[/SYS]

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the sour cream, softened cream cheese, and dry ranch dressing mix until well combined.
3. Add the shredded cheddar cheese and pepper jack cheese, mixing until the cheese is evenly distributed.
4. Stir in the finely chopped green onions.
5. Cook the bacon until crisp, then crumble it into the cheese mixture.
6. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
7. Using your hands, shape the mixture into a ball, making sure it is evenly distributed.
8. Bake the cheese ball in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Remove the cheese ball from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing it into wedges.
10. Serve the cheese ball with crackers or your favorite dipping sauce.

[/SYS]

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat the oven to 355F, and grease and line a 9 springform pan.
Pour the Guinness into a large saucepan, and add the sliced butter.
Heat until the butter is melted, and remove the saucepan from the heat.
Whisk in the cocoa and sugar.
Beat the sour cream with the eggs and vanilla in a bowl or mixer; then pour the chocolate mixture into the sour cream mixture and blend.
Finally beat in the flour and baking soda.
Pour the batter into a the springform pan, bake for 50-60 minutes (touch the top of the cake to test, it will spring back when touched if done).
Leave to cool completely in the pan.
For the icing: Beat the powdered sugar into the cream cheese.
Add the cream, and beat again until its spreadable.
Ice the top of the cake only (so it looks like the frothy top of a glass of Guinness).
pred:
[INSTR]
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 8-inch round cake pans.
2. In a large bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, and powdered sugar.
3. In a separate bowl, combine the sour cream, vanilla extract, and melted butter.
4. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until just combined.
5. Fold in the chocolate chips and cocoa powder.
6. Divide the batter evenly between the prepared pans.
7. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cakes comes out clean.
8. Allow the cakes to cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. To make the frosting, beat the cream cheese and powdered sugar in a large bowl until smooth and creamy.
10. Add the heavy cream and vanilla extract, and continue to beat until the desired consistency is reached.
11. Once the cakes are completely cooled, use a spatula to spread a layer of frosting on top of one of the cakes.
12. Place the other cake on top of the frosted cake, and spread the remaining frosting evenly over the top and sides of the cake.
13. Refrigerate the cake for at least 30 minutes before serving.

[/INSTR]

[/INST]

gt:
In a stand mixer, combine milk, yeast and sugar.
Let sit for 5 minutes until bubbly.
Stir in butter, eggs, and salt.
Add flour, 1 cup at a time.
Continue adding flour until dough comes together.
You might not need the full amount of flour.
This dough will be a bit stickier than most doughs.
Knead for 5 minutes with machine.
Place dough in a large, greased bowl.
Cover and let rise until doubled.
Divide dough into 18 pieces.
Form into balls, and flatten.
Place on a baking sheet sprinkled with corn meal.
Let rise for 2030 minutes.
Preheat a cast iron skillet.
Cook muffins 1015 minutes until done.
Flip muffins as needed during cooking to avoid burning.
Let cool on a wire rack.
Once cool, split muffins with a fork.
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the milk, sugar, and yeast. Allow the mixture to sit for about 5-10 minutes or until the yeast is activated and the mixture becomes frothy.
2. Add the butter, eggs, and salt to the mixture. Stir until well combined.
3. Gradually add the flour to the mixture, stirring until a smooth dough forms.
4. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic, about 5-10 minutes.
5. Place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl, cover it with a clean cloth, and let it rise in a warm place for about 1-2 hours or until it has doubled in size.
6. Preheat your oven to 450°F (232°C).
7. Punch down the dough, and then divide it into 8-10 equal pieces.
8. Shape each piece into a small ball, and place them on a lightly floured surface.
9. Cover the dough balls with a clean cloth and let them rise for about 20-30 minutes or until they have doubled in size.
10. While the dough is rising, prepare a hot griddle or a large frying pan.
11. After the dough has risen, gently press your thumb into the center of each dough ball to create a small indentation.
12. Place the dough balls on the griddle or frying pan, and cook them over medium heat for about 2-3 minutes on each side or until they are golden brown.
13. Transfer the cooked English Muffins to a wire rack to cool.
14. Serve the English Muffins warm, with butter and your choice of toppings.

[/INST]

gt:
In a large skillet, brown meat with garlic, drain half the fat, and add the next 6 ingredients.
Simmer uncovered, 45 minutes.
Boil one 10 oz package lasagna noodles with 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1 tablespoon olive oil.
Cook noodles al dente.
Combine in a bowl: cottage cheese, eggs,Parmesan Cheese, salt, dried parsley flakes
Place 4 noodles in a baking dish.
Spread half the cottage cheese mixture over the noodles.
Add 1/2 pound of mozzarella slices, and a little less than half the meat mixture.
Repeat the layers, ending with the meat mixture.
Sprinkle generously with Parmesan and bake 20 to 30 minutes at 350 degrees until hot and bubbly.
Let stand 10 to 15 minutes before cutting into squares, unless your family is wigging out with hunger -- in which case, go ahead and dig inches.
pred:
To make the Pioneer Woman Lasagna, start by preheating your oven to 350°F (180°C).

1. In a large skillet, cook the ground beef and hot breakfast sausage over medium heat until the meat is browned and cooked through. Drain any excess fat.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked meat, minced garlic, dried parsley flakes, dried basil, salt, and pepper.
3. In a separate mixing bowl, combine the cottage cheese, eggs, and parmesan cheese.
4. Spread a thin layer of tomato paste on the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.
5. Layer the meat mixture on top of the tomato paste, followed by a layer of the cottage cheese mixture.
6. Repeat the layers, alternating between meat and cottage cheese mixtures, until you have used all the ingredients.
7. Pour the remaining tomato paste over the top of the lasagna, and sprinkle with the remaining dried parsley flakes.
8. Bake the lasagna in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until the cheese is bubbly and golden brown.
9. Let the lasagna cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

Enjoy your delicious Pioneer Woman Lasagna!

gt:
Line a baking tray with grease-proof paper or a silicone mat.
Break the milk and dark chocolate into a large heatproof bowl and microwave in 30-second increments, stirring in between, until all the chocolate is melted.
Alternatively, you can set the bowl over a saucepan with 1 inch of simmering water in to melt.
Add in the vanilla extract and mix until combined.
Pour the melted chocolate mix onto the lined tray and spread in an even layer.
Spoon the Dulce de leche onto the chocolate and swirl into the chocolate with a toothpick or skewer.
Sprinkle marshmallows and biscuits/crackers over the melted chocolate.
Place in the fridge until set, about 2 hours.
Once set, peel away from lined tray and break into pieces.
Bark will keep in an airtight container, in the fridge for 4 days.
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 8 ounces of Milk Chocolate and 8 ounces of Dark Chocolate.
2. Melt the chocolate in a double boiler or a heat-resistant bowl set over a pot of simmering water.
3. Once the chocolate is melted, stir in the 1/2 teaspoon of Vanilla Extract.
4. Add the 13 cups of Dulce De Leche to the chocolate mixture, stirring until well combined.
5. Spread the chocolate mixture evenly onto a large baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
6. Sprinkle the 1 cup of Mini Marshmallows evenly over the chocolate mixture.
7. Sprinkle the 1 cup of Broken Graham Crackers evenly over the marshmallows.
8. Refrigerate the baking sheet for about 2 hours or until the chocolate is set and the marshmallows are firm.
9. Using a sharp knife, cut the bark into desired shapes and sizes.
10. Serve the Dulce de Leche Smores Bark immediately or store it in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to a week.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Lay your serviette out flat before you in a diamond shape.
Take the point at South and roll it neatly completely up to the North point.
Fold the serviette in half and place it into a wine glass.
An optional variation would be to insert a serviette/napkin ring over the folded end before putting it into the wineglass.
pred:
To cook Serviette/Napkin Folding, Candle in a Wine Glass Fold using the ingredients provided, follow these steps:

1. Gather the necessary materials: a large paper, a large cloth, and a wine glass.
2. Fold the large paper into a cone shape, creating a base for the candle.

15. Place the candle on top of the paper cone.
16. Fold the large cloth into a triangle shape, creating a platform for the candle.

gt:
Combine first 5 ingredients for pico de gallo; set aside.
Meanwhile spray large skillet with cooking spray.
Add cactus paddles, in batches; cook on high heat 5 min.
on each side or until cactus is lightly cooked and sticky liquid has evaporated.
Top 6 cactus paddles in skillet evenly with chorizo and Singles; cover with remaining cactus paddles.
Cook 3 min.
or until Singles are melted.
Serve with pico de gallo.
pred:
To make a delicious Cheesy Chorizo Nopales dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the chopped onions and serrano chile over medium heat until the onions are softened and the chile is slightly charred.
3. Add the crumbled Mexican chorizo and cook until it is browned and cooked through.
4. In a small bowl, mix the KRAFT Zesty Italian Dressing with the chopped fresh cilantro.
5. Cut the 2 large plum tomatoes in half and place them in a baking dish.
6. Add the cooked chorizo mixture to the tomatoes in the baking dish.
7. Sprinkle the cheese on top of the chorizo mixture.
8. Pour the KRAFT Zesty Italian Dressing mixture over the cheese.
9. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Serve the Cheesy Chorizo Nopales dish hot, garnished with additional chopped cilantro if desired.

This delicious dish combines the flavors of the Mexican chorizo, the tangy and zesty taste of the KRAFT Zesty Italian Dressing, and the freshness of the cilantro, creating a delightful and satisfying meal.

gt:
Cut chicken into serving pieces and place in a large pot.
Cover chicken with water.
Add the onion, celery and bay leaf.
Cover and simmer for 3 hours or until tender.
Remove chicken.
Strain and measure broth.
There should be approximately 4 cups of broth.
If there is more, reduce by boiling; if less, add water.
Mix flour with a little cold water to form a smooth paste.
Stir into broth and heat until thickened.
Add cream, salt, sage, thyme and pepper.
Remove the chicken from bones and return meat to gravy.
Prepare dumplings and drop by spoonfuls into hot gravy.
Cover and simmer for 20 minutes with out removing lid.
Serve chicken surrounded by dumplings on a large, deep platter.
Dumplings: Sift flour, baking powder and salt into a bowl.
Mix egg and milk and stir into the dry ingredients.
Drop into hot gravy and simmer covered for 20 minutes.
Serve with hearty root veggies on the side.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large pot or Dutch oven, combine the chicken, water, onion, celery, bay leaf, and seasonings. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 1 hour or until the chicken is cooked through.
3. Remove the chicken from the pot, let it cool, and shred it into bite-sized pieces.
4. In a large mixing bowl, combine the shredded chicken, cream, sage, thyme, pepper, and egg. Mix well.
5. In a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, salt, and milk. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until smooth.
6. Pour the mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish.
7. Cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake for about 30 minutes or until the dumplings are cooked through and the filling is hot and bubbly.
8. Remove the foil and continue baking for an additional 10-15 minutes or until the dumplings are golden brown and crispy on top.
9. Serve the Chicken 'n Dumplings hot.

[/INST]

gt:
1.
Line cupcake tins with the liners.
Fill the tins two-thirds full with the batter and bake the cupcakes as directed in the recipe .
2.
Frost the cupcakes, reserving some of the frosting.
Pile the frosting up a little in the center to make a sort of domed shape, more like an eyeball.
To make the surface smooth, dip a butter or frosting/palette knife in hot water and smooth it over the top of the frosting.
3.
Tint the remaining frosting bright red with the food coloring.
Using the pastry bag, pipe the red frosting on the tops of the cupcake in vein patterns.
Make the veins radiate from the center of the cupcake to make the bloodshot quality more realistic.
Cut the jelly beans in half.
Place a jelly bean half into the circle of the round candy.
Now you have and iris and a pupil.
Place this in the center of a cupcake.
Continue with the rest of the eyeballs.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Line the muffin tins with white paper cupcake liners.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the recipe batter, red food coloring, and small round tip from the pastry bag. Mix until the desired color is achieved.
4. Fill the cupcake liners with the batter, about 3/4 full.
5. Bake the cupcakes in the preheated oven for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
6. Allow the cupcakes to cool completely in the pan.
7. Once the cupcakes are cooled, use the pastry bag and small round tip to pipe the Vanilla Butter Cream Frosting onto the cupcakes.
8. Add small black jelly beans as eyes, and round candies with a hole in the middle as pupils.
9. Serve the Eyeball Cupcakes and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Heat oil in large saucepan over medium-high heat.
Add onion and cook until tender.
Mix in garlic, jalapeno, green chile peppers, cumin, oregano, and cayenne.
Continue to cook and stir until mixture is tender.
Mix in chicken broth, chicken and white beans.
Simmer 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat, stir in cheese until melted.
Serve warm with tortilla chips and salad.
**We put tortilla chips in bottom of serving bowl, add the chili.
Good eating!
pred:
1. Heat the vegetable oil in a large saucepan or Dutch oven over medium heat.
2. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the pan and cook until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the diced jalapeno pepper and cook for an additional 2 minutes.
4. Stir in the chopped green chili peppers, ground cumin, oregano, and ground cayenne pepper. Cook for 1 minute.
5. Add the chicken broth, chicken, and beans to the pan. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the beans are tender.
6. Stir in the shredded monterey jack cheese and let it melt into the chili.
7. Serve the Chili Blanco hot, garnished with fresh cilantro, if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Cook noodles per package directions; drain.
Add garlic, pepper, and broth to a large saucepan; bring to a boil.
Lower heat, and simmer 10 minutes.
Combine soy sauce, sake, and honey in a small bowl; stir with a whisk.
Heat a large nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray over med-high heat.
Add in mushrooms and carrots, stir/saute 2 minutes.
Stir in soy sauce mixture; cook 2 minutes stirring constantly.
Add vegetable mixture to broth mixture; stir in beef.
Cook 2 minutes or until beef loses its pink color.
Stir in noodles, green onions, and spinach.
Serve immediately.
pred:
1. Prepare the ingredients:
- Rinse the udon noodles or spaghetti in cold water to remove any excess starch.
- Chop the mushroom caps and carrot into bite-sized pieces.
- Slice the beef thinly.
- Cut the green onion into diagonal pieces.
- Rinse the spinach and pat it dry.

2. Cook the noodles:
- Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the noodles and cook according to the package instructions until they are tender but still firm. Drain the noodles and set aside.

3. Cook the beef:
- Heat a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add the beef and cook until it is browned on all sides, then remove it from the pan and set aside.

4. Make the sauce:
- In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, sake, honey, and crushed red pepper flakes.

5. Combine the ingredients:
- In a large bowl, combine the cooked noodles, beef, mushroom caps, carrot, green onion, and spinach.
- Pour the sauce over the ingredients and toss to combine.

6. Serve:
- Serve the Udon-Beef Noodle Bowl in a bowl, garnished with additional green onion if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Udon-Beef Noodle Bowl!

gt:
Mix the lemon juice and dried chillies in a bowl, season with salt and pepper, add the onion rings and leave to marinate until required (you could do this step more in advance if you like).
Boil the potatoes in lightly salted water for about 15 minutes, or until cooked.
While the potatoes are cooking make the sauce by combining all the ingredients except the olive oil in a blender; then heat the oil in a pan, add the blended sauce ingredients and simmer for about 5 minutes until the sauce thickens.
TO ASSEMBLE THE DISH: drain the potatoes and place in a warmed serving dish, pour the sauce on top; drain the onion rings and scatter them and the chili strips over the top of the dish; garnish with hard-boiled eggs and olives.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 200°C (400°F).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the sliced onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the deseeded and crumbed dried hot red chilies, and cook for another 2 minutes.
4. Add the heavy cream, salt, and freshly ground black pepper. Stir to combine, and cook until the sauce thickens slightly, about 5 minutes.
5. Add the mozzarella cheese, and stir until melted and combined.
6. Add the green or red chili pepper, turmeric, and the sliced potatoes. Toss everything together until the potatoes are coated in the sauce.
7. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish, and bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and the cheese is bubbly and golden brown.
8. Garnish with black olives and halved hard-boiled eggs.
9. Serve immediately, and enjoy your Mexican Potatoes With Cheese Sauce!

gt:
In a jar with a tight fitting lid, combine the garlic, ginger, soy sauce, rice vinegar, peanut oil, sesame oil and hot pepper sauce.
Close the lid, and shake vigoroulsy to blend.
Set aside to let the flavors blend.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil.
Add udon noodles, and cook until tender, about 3 minutes.
Drain, and place in a serving bowl.
In a microwave-safe bowl, combine the peppers with green onions and peas.
Heat in the microwave until warm, but still crisp.
Add to the noodles in the bowl, and pour dressing over all.
Toss to coat, then sprinkle with sesame seeds.
Toasting sesame seeds: Toast sesame seeds in a dry skillet over medium heat.
Shake pan or stir occasionally until lightly browned and fragrant, about 3 minutes.
pred:
To cook a delightful Sesame Udon Noodles dish, follow these steps:

1. In a large bowl, combine the minced garlic, minced gingerroot, and soy sauce. Set aside for 10 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.

2. In a large skillet, heat the peanut oil over medium heat. Add the sesame oil and hot pepper sauce, and stir to combine.

3. Add the green bell pepper, red bell pepper, and yellow bell pepper to the skillet, and cook until the vegetables are tender but still crisp.

4. Add the snap peas to the skillet, and cook until they are tender but still crisp.

5. Add the soy sauce mixture to the skillet, and stir to combine. Cook for a few minutes until the sauce has thickened slightly.

6. Add the cooked udon noodles to the skillet, and stir to combine with the vegetables and sauce.

7. Cook for a few more minutes until the noodles are heated through and the sauce has coated the noodles evenly.

8. Remove the skillet from the heat, and stir in the lightly toasted sesame seeds.

9. Serve the Sesame Udon Noodles immediately, garnished with the sliced green onions.

[/INST]

gt:
Spread cut sides of roll with dressing and mustard.
Fill with remaining ingredients.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Spread the MIRACLE WHIP Light Dressing on one side of the whole wheat kaiser roll.
3. Place the partially split roll on a baking sheet.
4. Spread the GREY POUPON Dijon Mustard on the other side of the roll.
5. Place the sliced turkey breast on top of the mustard-covered side of the roll.
6. Top the turkey with the mixed green pepper strips and shredded carrots.
7. Place the roll in the preheated oven and bake for 5-7 minutes or until the bread is golden brown and the cheese is melted.
8. Remove the roll from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing it in half.
9. Serve the California Turkey & Vegetable Sandwich warm.

This California Turkey & Vegetable Sandwich is a delicious and healthy meal option that combines the flavors of smoked turkey breast, tangy Dijon mustard, and fresh vegetables. The whole wheat kaiser roll provides a satisfying and nutritious base, while the melted cheese adds a creamy and rich texture. This sandwich is perfect for a quick lunch or a satisfying snack.

gt:
Melt butter in large nonstick skillet over medium-low heat.
Add leek; cover and cook until leek is soft but not brown, stirring often, about 7 minutes.
Increase heat to medium-high; add garlic and mushrooms and saute until mushrooms begin to brown, about 7 minutes.
Add pea tendrils; cook until pea tendrils just begin to wilt, tossing often, about 3 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the butter over medium heat. Add the sliced leek and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the minced garlic and cook for another minute, until fragrant.
4. Add the sliced crimini mushrooms to the skillet and cook until they release their liquid and become tender, about 5 minutes.
5. Add the pea tendrils to the skillet and cook until they are heated through, about 2 minutes.
6. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and slightly caramelized.
8. Serve the dish immediately.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Combine the chopped eggs, herbs, celery and red onion in a large bowl, and season to taste with salt and pepper.
Whisk together the vinegar, lemon juice, yogurt, mayonnaise, mustard and olive oil.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Toss with the egg mixture.
Line plates or a platter with arugula, top with the egg salad and serve.
pred:
1. First, gather all the necessary ingredients. You will need 8 large eggs, hard-boiled and finely chopped, 1 cup finely chopped fresh herb (such as parsley, dill, tarragon, chervil, or chives), 2 celery ribs, finely chopped, 1 small red onion, finely chopped, soaked for five minutes in cold water, drained and rinsed, salt & freshly ground black pepper, 1 tablespoon white wine vinegar or 1 tablespoon sherry wine vinegar, 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, 13 cup plain low-fat yogurt or 13 cup buttermilk, 1 tablespoon Hellmann's mayonnaise or 1 tablespoon Best Foods Mayonnaise, 1 garlic clove, green shoot removed, minced, 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard, 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, and 1 (6 ounce) bag baby arugula.

2. In a large bowl, combine the hard-boiled eggs, finely chopped herbs, celery, and red onion. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

3. Add the white wine vinegar, fresh lemon juice, and minced garlic to the bowl. Stir to combine.

4. Gradually add the yogurt or buttermilk, stirring to incorporate the ingredients.

5. If the mixture is too thick, add a little more yogurt or buttermilk to achieve the desired consistency.

6. Stir in the mayonnaise, mustard, and olive oil.

7. Taste the salad and adjust the seasoning as needed.

8. Fold in the baby arugula and serve immediately.

This healthy egg salad is a delicious and nutritious addition to your meal. The combination of the fresh herbs, vegetables, and yogurt or buttermilk provides a balanced and flavorful dish that is perfect for a light lunch or as a side dish.

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Melt butter in large saucepan over medium heat, add onions and cook until tender.
Add water, evaporated milk, soup, rice, and cheese.
Cook until cheese melts.
Add broccoli.
Put mixture into casserole.
Bake at 350 degrees for 50 minutes.
Top with buttered crushed saltines and bake for another 5 minutes, or until topping is crunchy.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, stirring occasionally.
3. Add the water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover the saucepan, and simmer for about 15 minutes or until the onion is tender.
4. Add the evaporated milk, cream of chicken soup, instant rice, and Velveeta cheese to the saucepan. Stir until the cheese is melted and the ingredients are well combined.
5. Add the thawed and drained broccoli to the saucepan, stirring to combine.
6. In a separate bowl, mix the saltine crackers with melted butter.
7. Pour the mixture from the saucepan into a 9x13 inch baking dish.
8. Sprinkle the saltine cracker mixture evenly over the top of the casserole.
9. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes or until the casserole is bubbly and the crackers are golden brown.
10. Allow the casserole to cool for a few minutes before serving.

This delicious Vi's Cheesy Broccoli casserole is ready to be enjoyed!

gt:
Get the ingredients together
Grease the oven dish with some butter.
Peel the apple and slice.
Put the apple slices in the dish.
Add the ginger and cinnamon - I put the stick in the middle with a layer of apple underneath and on top.
Sprinkle with the juice of the lemon and add a generous spoonful of the sugar
Put the flower, pinch of salt and butter in a large bowl.
Wash and dry your hands really well.
Then rub the butter into the flower like this, by gathering handfuls of the mixture and rubbing your hands together.
The more you rub, the more the butter will be incorporated in to the flower and the end result
will be a crumb-like mixture.
Add the rest of the sugar.
You can also add oats, seeds, muesli or granola too.
Mix well.
Cover the apples with the crumble mixture and put the oven dish into the oven at 180 degrees for 60 minutes.
When it is ready the top layer of the crumble will be hard and the apples will be soft and brown, because they will have absorbed the sugar while cooking.
Enjoy!
!
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, butter, ground ginger, cinnamon, and salt. Mix until the dough comes together.
3. Add the brown sugar (or honey) and mix until the dough is crumbly.
4. Peel and core the apples, then slice them into 1/2-inch pieces.
5. Transfer the apple slices to the dough mixture and toss to coat evenly.
6. Transfer the apple mixture to a baking dish, spreading it evenly.
7. Bake the crumble in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until the apples are tender and the crumble is golden brown.
8. Allow the crumble to cool for a few minutes before serving.

gt:
In a LARGE juice pitcher (1 gallon/4 litres), stir together the 3 packages of koolaid and the sugar.
Add about 1/3 of the water and stir well, making sure Kool-Aid and sugar dissolves.
Slowly stir in remaining water; chill.
pred:
[/INST]

1. First, gather all the necessary ingredients. In this case, you will need 3 (6 g) packages of your favorite Kool-Aid, 12 cups of sugar, and a gallon of cold water.

2. Open the Kool-Aid packages and pour the contents into a large mixing bowl.

3. Add the sugar to the Kool-Aid mixture, stirring to ensure that the sugar is evenly distributed.

4. Pour the cold water into the mixing bowl, stirring to combine the ingredients.

5. Allow the mixture to sit for a few minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.

6. If the mixture is too thick, you can add a bit more water to achieve the desired consistency.

7. Once the mixture is to your liking, pour it into a pitcher or a large container.

8. Store the Kool-Aid mixture in the refrigerator until it is time to serve.

9. To serve, pour the Kool-Aid mixture into individual glasses and enjoy!

10. Remember to always follow the recommended serving size and guidelines for the specific Kool-Aid package you are using.
