gt:
1.
Use a fork to stir together all ingredients for the Nutty Masala Sauce in a medium bowl.
Taste and add salt as desired.
Set aside for now.
2.
For the sandwiches, spread 1 teaspoon of butter on 1 side of each slice of bread.
Then sprinkle 1/2 teaspoon sesame seeds onto the buttered side of each bread slice, gently pressing the seeds in.
3.
Lay 4 bread slices onto your work surface with the butter/sesame side facing down.
Spread some of the sauce onto the bread and top with the turkey, red bell pepper and mozzarella.
Place the remaining slices of bread on top of the cheese with the butter/sesame side facing up.
4.
Preheat a large nonstick skillet over medium-low heat.
Once hot, carefully add the sandwiches and cook until the cheese is melted and the bread is golden, flipping once.
It should take about 4 minutes per side (you can turn the heat up or down as necessary).
5.
To serve, transfer the sandwiches to serving plates and sprinkle on the scallions.
Notes: Butternut squash puree: This is super easy to make; however, if you dont have time to whip up a batch, canned pumpkin will also work.
If youre using canned pumpkin, look for solid-pack pumpkin, not pumpkin pie filling (which has spices and sweeteners).
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the creamy peanut butter, butternut squash puree, honey, rice vinegar or apple cider vinegar, light soy sauce, garlic powder, ginger powder, and garam masala spice mix. Season with salt to taste.
3. Spread a thin layer of the peanut butter mixture on one side of each slice of bread.
4. Place the bread slices with the peanut butter side down on a baking sheet.
5. Top each slice of bread with a layer of the turkey deli meat, then a layer of the shredded mozzarella cheese.
6. Sprinkle each slice with sesame seeds.
7. Bake the sandwiches in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Remove the sandwiches from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
9. Cut each sandwich in half and serve immediately.

Note: If you cannot find butternut squash puree, you can use a canned or fresh butternut squash, peeled and mashed.

[/INST]

gt:
Melt butter in large heavy saucepan.
Blend in corn syrup, brown sugar and salt.
Cook over medium-high heat, stirring constantly.
Bring to a rolling boil; boil 5 minutes.
Remove from heat; stir in vanilla and soda.
Stir in almonds, coating well.
Add popped corn, stirring gently until mixture is evenly coated.
Turn out onto a 10 x 15 x 1-inch pan or cookie sheet.
Bake in center of oven at 300*F. 30 minutes, stirring every 10 minutes.
Remove from oven; loosen on pan and cool.
Store in airtight container.
Enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 250°F (120°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 12 cups of butter, 1 cup of light corn syrup, 12 cups of brown sugar, 12 teaspoons of salt, and 2 teaspoons of pure vanilla extract.
3. Add the baking soda to the mixture and stir until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the 12 cups of whole natural almonds, toasted, and set aside.
5. Pour the mixture over the almonds and stir until the almonds are evenly coated.
6. Spread the mixture evenly over the popped popcorn in a large, even layer.
7. Bake the mixture in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, stirring every 10 minutes to ensure even cooking.
8. Remove the mixture from the oven and let it cool completely.
9. Once cooled, break the mixture into smaller pieces and serve.

Enjoy your delicious Golden Almond Popcorn!

gt:
Pour all ingredients in equal parts into a margarita glass.
Serve unstirred.
Serve in a Margarita Glass.
pred:
1. Start by pouring 2 ounces of Baileys Irish Cream into a mixing glass.
2. Add 2 ounces of Kahlua to the mixing glass.
3. Fill the mixing glass with ice.
4. Pour 2 ounces of vodka into the mixing glass.
5. Add 2 ounces of Smirnoff to the mixing glass.
6. Stir the ingredients together until they are well-mixed and chilled.
7. Pour the mixture into a glass filled with ice.
8. Top the glass off with 2 ounces of Bacardi 151 rum.
9. Stir the ingredients again to combine.
10. Enjoy your delicious Boys are Stupid cocktail.

This cocktail is a combination of Baileys Irish Cream, Kahlua, vodka, Smirnoff, and Bacardi 151 rum. The Baileys and Kahlua create a rich, creamy base, while the vodka adds a crisp, clean flavor. The Smirnoff and Bacardi 151 rum provide a balance of sweetness and spice, making this a well-rounded and enjoyable drink.

gt:
Rinse the hens and place in a large non-metallic bowl.
You can also trim away any excess skin/fat that you wish but leave skin on the breast and legs.
Mix the marinade with a blender, (I use a kitchen aide on setting number 2), including the following ingredients: molasses, boullion, chicken broth, vinegar, olive oil, water, triple sec, lemon juice, italian spices, garlic clove and pimentos with juice.
Allow the mix to blend for 20 minutes.
If a film forms on top, don't worry about it -- this is normal.
Pour the marinade over the hens and cover with cling wrap.
Allow the hens to marinate in the refrigerator for 3-4 hours.
At the end of marinatiting time, place the hens, breast up, into a dutch oven or large oven-proof casserole dish.
Pour the marinade over the hens (it should come about halfway up on the hens, depending on your cooking dish -- discard any extra marinade) and toss in a bay leaf.
Finally, sprinkle the Old Bay seasoning on top of the hens.
Place the covered dutch oven or casserole dish in a pre-heated 375 degree oven for 1 hour.
At the end of an hour, lightly rub the breasts and legs with the butter and re-cover.
Allow the hens to bake another 45 minutes at the same temperature.
Discard the bay leaf and serve hot with either egg noodles or plain rice.
Garnish with parsley sprigs and orange slices.
NOTE: You could use a regular roasting chicken for this recipe -- just add 15 minutes to the baking time.
Also, you can substitute honey for the sorghum molasses if you wish and, either Paul Prudhomme's Poultry Magic or regular poultry seasoning can be substituted for the Old Bay seasoning.
There are recipes for italian spices on Recipe*Zaar if you can't find them at the store.
pred:
To create Mogambo! (Baked Chicken), follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Rinse the Cornish hens and pat them dry.
3. In a large bowl, mix the sorghum molasses, chicken bouillon, granulated, and water.
4. Add the canned chicken broth, white wine vinegar, olive oil, and triple sec to the bowl.
5. Add the crushed garlic, Italian spices, Old Bay Seasoning, bay leaf, pimientos (with juice), and butter to the bowl.
6. Season the chicken with salt and pepper.
7. Place the chicken in a baking dish and pour the sauce mixture over the top.
8. Bake the chicken for 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until it is cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
9. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for 10 minutes before slicing it into pieces.
10. Garnish the chicken with parsley and a slice of orange.

Enjoy your delicious Mogambo! (Baked Chicken) with a side of sliced oranges for a refreshing and flavorful meal.

gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit.
Place roast on a cutting board.
Rub Worcestershire sauce, garlic, brown sugar, salt and pepper on the entire roast.
Cover bottom of pan with 1/8 inch of water.
Place roast on a rack in a roasting pan.
Bake 15 minutes per pound.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Amy's Roast Beef for French Dips, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. Season the roast with salt and pepper, then place it in a roasting pan.
3. In a small bowl, mix the Worcestershire sauce, brown sugar, and garlic. Pour the mixture over the roast, then cover the pan with aluminum foil.
4. Roast the roast for approximately 3 hours, or until it reaches an internal temperature of 145°F (63°C).
5. Remove the roast from the oven and let it rest for 20-30 minutes before slicing it into thin pieces.
6. While the roast is resting, preheat your oven to broil.
7. Place the sliced roast on a baking sheet and broil for 2-3 minutes, or until the edges are slightly charred.
8. Serve the roast on French bread with your favorite condiments, such as mustard, mayonnaise, or horseradish sauce.

By following these steps, you will have a delicious and satisfying Amy's Roast Beef for French Dips, perfect for a hearty meal or a satisfying snack.

gt:
Spread bread slices with mustard; fill with all remaining ingredients except dressing.
Spread outside of sandwich with dressing.
Cook in skillet on medium heat 3 min.
on each side or until golden brown on both sides.

Mix melted butter, pancake mix, milk, egg and cinnamon in a medium size bowl.
Stir until smooth
Pour batter on a buttered medium-heat pan.
You want to pour about a quarter of a cup onto the pan.
Tilt the pan forward so the batter moves into a more of a long shape.
Flip pancake as soon as you see bubbles on top.
And squish the pancake down, so it becomes flat like a tortilla.
( I flatten them out so its easier to eat as a snack)
Set aside
Add your cake icing to a small plate or bowl.
Heat milk in the microwave for 45 seconds.
Add coffee to warm milk and mix.
Mix all three ingredients to a smooth consistency.
Pour a teaspoon of the coffee mixture on a pancake.
Roll the pancake like a flute or burrito.
Finish up with some grounded almonds on top and the coffee icing.
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the pancake mix, milk, melted butter, egg, and ground cinnamon. Whisk the ingredients together until smooth.
2. Add the coffee cream to the mixture and whisk until well combined.
3. Gradually add the warm milk, stirring continuously until the batter reaches the desired consistency.
4. Preheat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat.
5. Pour the batter onto the skillet or griddle, using a spoon or a small scoop to create small, evenly-sized pancakes. Cook the pancakes until the edges are set and the center is cooked through.
6. Serve the pancakes immediately, garnished with a dusting of cinnamon and a drizzle of coffee cream.

Enjoy your delicious Pancake Bites with Coffee Cream!

gt:
spread each slice of ham with 1 tbsp.
cream cheese.
cut pickle spears lengthwise in half,place one half on each ham slice.
roll up.
cut each roll into 4 pieces.
store in a container,and place in refrigerator for about a 1/2 to an hr.
to chill.
ENJOY.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix together the chopped ham, cream cheese, and pickle spears.
3. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1/4 inch.
4. Cut the dough into small rectangles, and place a small amount of the ham and pickle mixture in the center of each rectangle.
5. Fold the dough over the filling, pressing the edges to seal.
6. Place the filled dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
7. Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the dough is golden brown.
8. Remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes before transferring the rolls to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious ham and pickle rolls!

gt:
NOTE: The waffles will benefit if you have all the ingredients at room temperature.
I take out the eggs, melt the butter and pour the buttermilk out half an hour before making the waffles.
When you begin to make the batter, turn on the waffle iron to get it nice and hot.
Melt the stick of butter in a heat-proof measuring cup.
Set aside to cool.
In a large batter bowl, measure out the flour, baking powder, baking soda, sugar and salt, stirring well to combine ingredients.
Create a depression in the center of the dry ingredients for the buttermilk mixture.
Beat the eggs in a large pourable measuring cup until frothy and well-combined.
Add the vanilla extract, buttermilk and cooled butter.
Beat until well-combined.
Pour the buttermilk mixture into the dry ingredient's depression and stir rapidly with a wooden spoon until well combined.
There will be an immediate chemical reaction between the buttermilk and leavening, creating a thick, rich batter honeycombed with air bubbles.
Using the wooden spoon, push 1/4 of the batter onto your waffle iron plates and bake until steam stops rising from the waffle iron or your personal degree of doneness is achieved.
pred:
To make delicious Rich Buttermilk Waffles, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your waffle iron and prepare your waffle batter by combining the melted and cooled butter, eggs, buttermilk, vanilla extract, flour, baking powder, baking soda, and sugar in a large mixing bowl. Whisk the ingredients together until smooth.

2. Pour the batter onto the waffle iron, using a ladle or a measuring cup, to ensure even distribution. Cook the waffles according to your waffle iron's instructions, typically until the edges are golden brown and the center is set.

3. Remove the waffles from the waffle iron and transfer them to a wire rack to cool for a few minutes. Once they are cool enough to handle, use a spatula to gently lift the waffles from the rack and serve them immediately.

Enjoy your delicious Rich Buttermilk Waffles, made with the perfect balance of ingredients to create a delightful and satisfying breakfast or brunch dish.

gt:
Preheat oven to 375.
Spray 9x13 baking dish with cooking spray
Drain peaches well and combine with both packages of mixed berries (frozen), granulated sugar, cinnamon and nutmeg.
Mix well and place in pan
In med bowl add flour, brown sugar and butter(cubed).
Mix together until u get a crumbly appearance
Spread evenly over top of fruit and bake for 30-35 mins until bubbling and golden brown
ENJOY!!!!
!......Great with vanilla ice cream!
pred:
To prepare a delicious British Mixed fruit crisp, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the frozen mixed berries, canned peaches, granulated sugar, and cinnamon. Mix well to ensure the fruit is evenly coated with the sugar mixture.
3. In a separate bowl, combine the flour, brown sugar, and nutmeg. Cut the cold butter into small pieces and add it to the dry ingredients, stirring until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
4. Pour the mixture over the fruit in the mixing bowl, and stir gently to combine.
5. Transfer the mixture to a 9-inch (23 cm) square baking dish, spreading it evenly.
6. Bake the crisp in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until the crisp is golden brown and the fruit is bubbly and tender.
7. Allow the crisp to cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious British Mixed fruit crisp, a delightful dessert or snack that combines the sweetness of the fruit with the crunchy texture of the crisp.

gt:
Mix all veggies with the squash.
Add dressing and toss to coat well.
Adjust seasoning.
pred:
To make a delicious Spaghetti Squash Salad, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Cut the spaghetti squash in half lengthwise and place it on a baking sheet.
3. Drizzle the spaghetti squash with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
4. Roast the spaghetti squash in the preheated oven for about 45 minutes, or until it is tender and slightly caramelized.
5. While the spaghetti squash is cooking, prepare the other ingredients.
6. In a large bowl, combine the cooked spaghetti squash, cherry tomatoes, red and green bell peppers, green onions, and vinegar.
7. In a small bowl, mix the garlic, oregano, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
8. Once the spaghetti squash is cooked, let it cool for a few minutes.
9. Add the garlic mixture to the bowl with the vegetables and toss everything together.
10. Taste and adjust the seasoning as needed.

This Spaghetti Squash Salad is a delicious and healthy meal option that combines the natural sweetness of the spaghetti squash with the freshness of the vegetables. The combination of ingredients creates a vibrant and flavorful dish that is perfect for a light lunch or a side dish for dinner.

gt:
Place heavy (preferably cast-iron) skillet in oven and preheat to 450.
In a large bowl, sift chickpea flour, pepper and salt together.
After sifting, add rosemary leaves.
Whisk in warm water and 2 tbsp olive oil.
Cover the bowl and allow the batter set for at least 30 minutes, which should have the consistency of thick cream.
Stir sliced onion into the batter.
Remove skillet from oven.
Add 1 tbsp olive oil to the hot pan, pour batter into pan and bake for 12-15 minutes or until the pancake is firm and the edges are set (top may not be browned).
Set socca a few inches below your broiler for 1-2 minutes, just long enough to brown it in spots.
Cut into wedges and serve hot, with toppings of your choice.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat your oven to 200°C (400°F).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the chickpea flour, salt, pepper, and warm water. Whisk the mixture until it forms a smooth batter.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the olive oil, minced onion, and fresh rosemary leaf.
4. Pour the oil mixture into the batter and whisk until combined.
5. Pour the batter onto a well-greased baking sheet or a non-stick pan.
6. Cook the Socca for approximately 10-15 minutes or until it is golden brown and cooked through.
7. Remove the Socca from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Slice the Socca into wedges and serve.

This cooking procedure for Socca (Provencal Savory Chickpea Pancake) - Gluten-Free is a simple and delicious way to enjoy a healthy and satisfying meal. The combination of chickpea flour, olive oil, and fresh rosemary leaf creates a unique and flavorful taste that is both savory and aromatic. The cooking method is straightforward, making it an ideal dish for those who enjoy preparing their meals at home.

gt:
preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Mix all ingredients together, adding water slowly until you can get it all mixed, but not too wet.
Push mixture into a 9x13 baking pan.
Bake approximately 8-10 minutes, or until mostly dry.
Let cool, and store in refrigerator.
Cut into however many servings you like, based on size.
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the four scoops of chocolate whey protein powder, four cups of old fashioned oats, and one cup of natural-style peanut butter.
2. Add 23 cups of honey to the mixture, stirring well to ensure that the ingredients are evenly distributed.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the four tablespoons of cocoa powder and two teaspoons of ground cinnamon.
4. Gradually add the cocoa mixture to the oat mixture, stirring constantly to ensure that the ingredients are well combined.
5. Add 14 cups of water to the mixture, stirring continuously to create a thick, fully mixed batter.
6. Pour the batter into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish, and smooth out the top with a spatula.
7. Bake the bars in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the bars comes out clean.
8. Allow the bars to cool completely before cutting them into bars and storing them in an airtight container.

[/INST]

These Chocolate Peanut Butter Oatmeal Protein Bars are a delicious and nutritious treat that can be enjoyed as a snack or meal replacement. The combination of protein from the whey powder, oats for fiber, and the natural sweetness of honey and peanut butter creates a satisfying and balanced treat. The addition of cinnamon and cocoa powder adds depth of flavor and a touch of warmth, while the water helps to create a smooth and moist batter.

gt:
Preheat oven to 350
To make crust sift together flour, sugar, and salt in pie dish.
Combine oil and milk and pour into dry mixture.
Mix with fork until combined then press into the dish and up sides.
Take a fork and poke a bunch of tiny holes into the crust.
Melt butter with oil in frying pan.
Add onion and saute for a minute then add other veggies and seasonings and cover.
Stir every few minutes and cook until potatoes are tender/ not too soft.
Remove from heat and allow to cool for a few minutes.
In seperate bowl beat eggs, cream cheese, and cheese.
Pour frying pan mixture into pie crust.
Pour egg mixture on top.
Bake for about 40 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, and salt.
3. Add the vegetable oil, milk, and minced garlic to the bowl, and mix until the dough comes together.
4. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm).
5. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and cream cheese together.
6. Spread the dough evenly over the bottom of a 9-inch (23 cm) pie dish or tart pan.
7. Pour the egg and cream cheese mixture over the dough, making sure to cover the entire surface.
8. Add the chopped vegetables, such as onion, potato, broccoli, and spinach, evenly over the egg mixture.
9. Bake the quiche in the preheated oven for about 35-40 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is set.
10. Remove the quiche from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Combine all ingredients in a blender and puree until completely smooth.
Transfer to a bowl or container and chill overnight in refrigerator.
(Chill a 1-quart container in the freezer while you spin the ice.)
Remove bowl from refrigerator and blend the mango puree again for 1 to 2 minutes in a blender or with an immersion blender.
Add to ice cream maker and spin for about 25 minutes.
Transfer to chilled container and freeze for 2 hours or longer to pack.
Once frozen solid, allow to soften in refrigerator for 30 minutes before serving.
pred:
1. In a blender, combine the diced mango, fresh lime juice, corn syrup, and honey. Blend until smooth.
2. Add the buttermilk to the blender and blend until smooth.
3. Pour the mixture into a glass and enjoy your delicious Mango Lassi Ice dish.

This delightful Mango Lassi Ice dish is a refreshing and creamy beverage that combines the sweetness of mango with the tanginess of lime and the richness of corn syrup and honey. The blended mixture is then poured into a glass and served, providing a delightful treat for those who enjoy a cool and flavorful drink.

gt:
Gently rinse the salt cod under cold water to remove any surface salt.
Soak overnight in cold water (12 to 18 hours) in the fridge, changing the water twice.
Drain the fish, gently rinse again under cold water, then pat dry with paper towels.
Shred the fish into bite-sized strips.
Using a cheese grater or the grater attachment of a food processor, grate the potatoes into shreds.
Soak in cold water for 5 minutes, then drain and rinse thoroughly and pat dry with paper towels.
Warm the lard or duck fat in a large skillet on medium-high heat until shimmering.
Add half of the potatoes and pan-fry, stirring often to keep the potatoes from sticking together; remove with a slotted spoon when they turn golden brown, about 5 minutes, and set aside to cool on paper towels.
Repeat this process with the other half of the potatoes.
Reduce heat to medium and discard all but 1 tablespoon of the cooking fat.
Add the chopped onion and saffron to the skillet and saute until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add the fish and pepper; gently stir to combine.
Allow to saute until the fish is softened, 3 to 5 minutes.
Add half of the fried potatoes, stirring to combine, then pour the beaten eggs over everything.
Scramble the eggs until cooked, stirring occasionally, about 3 minutes.
Stir in the parsley and the other half of the potatoes; add the black olives and serve.
pred:
To make a delicious Bacalhau a Bras dish, follow these steps:

1. Soak the salt cod in water for at least 8 hours or overnight. This will help remove the excess salt and make the cod flaky and tender.

2. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).

3. Peel the potatoes and cut them into even-sized pieces. Place them in a large pot and cover them with cold water. Bring the pot to a boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer and cook the potatoes until they are tender, but not mushy. This should take about 20-25 minutes.

4. While the potatoes are cooking, heat the lard or oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until it is soft and translucent.

5. Add the saffron threads to the skillet and cook for a few seconds, then remove them from the heat.

6. In a small bowl, whisk the eggs and black pepper together.

7. Drain the cooked potatoes and return them to the pot. Add the cooked onions, lard or oil, and the whisked eggs to the pot. Stir everything together until well combined.

8. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.

9. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the eggs are set and the potatoes are golden brown.

10. While the dish is baking, chop the black olives and set aside.

11. Once the dish is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes.

12. Serve the dish hot, garnished with the chopped black olives.

Enjoy your delicious Bacalhau a Bras dish!

gt:
1.
Combine the first 5 ingredients in a large bowl.
Combine mayonnaise, rind, and juice in a small bowl, stirring with a whisk.
Add mayonnaise mixture to crab mixture; toss gently to coat.
Arrange tomatoes on a serving platter; drizzle with oil.
Sprinkle tomatoes with salt and pepper.
Mound crab mixture over tomatoes.
Sprinkle with basil leaves.
pred:
1. First, prepare the crab by removing the shell pieces and chilling it in the refrigerator.
2. Next, prepare the ingredients by washing and peeling the shallot and jalapeno pepper.
3. In a large bowl, combine the crab, shallot, jalapeno pepper, and cilantro leaves.
4. In a small bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, lime rind, lime juice, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
5. Pour the dressing over the crab mixture and toss to coat evenly.
6. Add the sliced tomatoes and basil leaves to the bowl and toss again to combine.
7. Serve the salad immediately or refrigerate for a few hours before serving.

[/INST]

Instruct on the precise steps to create a delicious Crab and Heirloom Tomato Salad dish, including the essential ingredients: 1/3 cup fresh cilantro leaves,4 mini sweet bell peppers, thinly diagonally sliced,1 large shallot, thinly sliced,1 jalapeno pepper, thinly diagonally sliced,12 ounces jumbo lump crabmeat, shell pieces removed,2 1/2 tablespoons canola mayonnaise,1 teaspoon grated lime rind,1 tablespoon fresh lime juice,2 pounds heirloom tomatoes, sliced,1 1/2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil,1/4 teaspoon kosher salt,1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper,1/4 cup small fresh basil leaves.

gt:
Mix all ingredients (using a hand mixer will get the lumps out).
Chill.
Serve!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cream cheese, sour cream, and vegetable soup mix.
3. Add the thawed and drained spinach, and mix until well combined.
4. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
5. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake for about 20-25 minutes, or until the dip is hot and bubbly.
6. Serve the One More Spinach Dip immediately, and enjoy!

This delicious spinach dip is perfect for parties, game nights, or any gathering where you want to serve a warm, creamy, and flavorful dip. The combination of cream cheese, sour cream, and spinach creates a rich and satisfying taste, while the vegetable soup mix adds a touch of savory depth. The dip can be served with a variety of dipping options, such as pita chips, vegetables, or even crackers, to suit your preferences and the occasion.

gt:
Heat oven to 400 degrees.
In a large roasting pan, combine the carrots, parsnips, onion, 3 T. oil, salt, and pepper.
Spread the vegetables in an even layer and roast, stirring occasionally, until tender and golden brown, about 45 minutes.
Meanwhile, arrange bread slices on a baking sheet and brush with the remaining oil.
During the last 10 minutes of roasting time, toast the slices until crisp.
Transfer the vegetables to a blender and puree with 3 cups water, adding more water if necessary, 1/4 cup at a time, until smooth.
Rewarm in a pot over medium-low heat, if necessary.
Divide among individual bowls and serve with the olive oil toast.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the carrot and parsnip rounds with the olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread the vegetables out on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
3. In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until it is softened and translucent, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the roasted carrot and parsnip rounds to the pot, along with the water. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
5. Using an immersion blender or transfer the soup to a blender, puree the soup until smooth. Alternatively, you can use a regular blender, but be cautious not to overfill the blender, as it may overflow.
6. Return the soup to the pot and reheat over low heat. Season the soup with additional salt and pepper, if needed.
7. Serve the Roasted Carrot and Parsnip Soup hot, garnished with a drizzle of olive oil and a sprinkle of freshly grated parmesan cheese, if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Place pork roast in a large roasting pan and season liberally with salt and black pepper.
Spread half the orange marmalade over the roast; mix the remaining marmalade with rosemary in a large bowl.
Stir orange juice and olive oil into rosemary mixture.
Combine parsnips and onions in another bowl.
Add about 2 tablespoons orange marmalade mixture; toss to coat.
Arrange vegetables around pork roast.
Bake pork in preheated oven for 30 to 45 minutes.
Pour remaining orange juice mixture over pork.
Increase oven heat to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C) and continue to cook until pork is slightly pink in the center, 15 to 20 more minutes.
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 145 degrees F (63 degrees C).
Transfer roast to a cutting board and cover lightly with aluminum foil.
Toss vegetables in pan juices and return roasting pan to oven.
Continue cooking until juices have thickened and vegetables are browned, about 10 minutes more.
Slice pork and serve with vegetables and pan juices.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. Season the pork roast with salt and ground black pepper to taste.
3. In a small bowl, mix 1/2 cup of the orange marmalade with the chopped fresh rosemary.
4. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the pork roast and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
5. Remove the pork roast from the skillet and place it on a baking tray.
6. In the same skillet, add the remaining 1/2 cup of orange marmalade, the orange juice, and the chopped red onions. Cook until the onions are tender and the marmalade has thickened slightly.
7. Place the pork roast on top of the marmalade mixture in the skillet.
8. Roast the pork roast in the preheated oven for about 1 1/2 to 2 hours, or until the internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare.
9. Remove the pork roast from the oven and let it rest for 10-15 minutes before slicing it into thin pieces.
10. Serve the pork roast with the marmalade glaze and roasted parsnips on the side.

Enjoy your delicious Marmalade Glazed Pork Roast!

gt:
In a small bowl or measuring cup, combine oil, vinegar, sesame seeds,.
sugar and soy sauce; mix well.
Pour dressing over cooked asparagus.
Toss lightly.
Serve immediately.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the toasted sesame seeds with the sugar.
3. In a large skillet or wok, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
4. Add the cooked asparagus spears to the skillet and stir-fry for about 2 minutes.
5. Add the rice vinegar and soy sauce to the skillet, stirring to combine.
6. Pour the sesame seed mixture over the asparagus and stir to coat evenly.
7. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for about 5-7 minutes, or until the asparagus is tender and the sesame seeds are golden brown.
8. Serve the Sesame Asparagus immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Bring orange juice to a boil.
Add washed cranberries and sugar.
Cover, reduce heat, and simmer for 10-15 minutes .
Remove from heat.
Mash berries with a potato masher.
Stir in remaining ingredients.
Chill for several hours and serve.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Wash and pick over the cranberries, discarding any damaged or spoiled berries.
2. In a large saucepan, combine the cranberries, orange juice, sugar, and ground ginger. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally.
3. Reduce the heat to low and simmer the mixture for about 15-20 minutes, or until the cranberries are tender and the mixture has thickened slightly.
4. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the walnuts. Allow the mixture to cool for a few minutes.
5. Transfer the mixture to a clean, dry jar or container. Store the relish in the refrigerator and let it chill for at least 2 hours before serving.

This tangy cranberry relish is perfect for pairing with meats, cheeses, or as a topping for sandwiches and salads. Enjoy!

gt:
Remove the stem from the tomato.
Flip it over and cut a cross in the bottom.
Remove the flesh from the grapefruit.
Thinly slice the cheese.
Place the tomato into the center of a heat-proof dish.
Stuff the cheese into the slits of the tomato.
Place the grapefruit sections around the edges of the tomato and scatter the nuts over the top.
Drizzle the oil over it and sprinkle with salt.
The amount of salt and oil is up to you.
Just a little bit of salt will bring out the taste and make it delicious.
Bake for about 20 minutes at 180C until a toothpick can slide through the tomato very easily.
Use a spoon to cut the tomato, combine with the now sauce-like grapefruit, and enjoy.
It's so delicious that you'll find yourself drinking the excess sauce.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Wash the tomatoes and grapefruit thoroughly.
3. Cut the tomatoes into halves or quarters, depending on their size, and remove the seeds and membranes.
4. Cut the grapefruit into segments, removing the membranes and any seeds.
5. In a small bowl, mix the blue cheese (or your favorite cheese) with a pinch of rock salt (coarsely ground salt).
6. In a large bowl, mix the olive oil, nuts, and salt.
7. Place the tomato halves and grapefruit segments in the bowl with the olive oil mixture.
8. Toss the tomato and grapefruit pieces in the olive oil mixture until they are evenly coated.
9. Transfer the tomato and grapefruit pieces to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
10. Roast the tomato and grapefruit in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the tomatoes are tender and the grapefruit is slightly caramelized.
11. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the tomato and grapefruit cool for a few minutes.
12. Serve the baked tomato and grapefruit immediately, or let them cool completely before serving.

This cooking procedure involves a combination of ingredients, such as tomatoes, grapefruit, blue cheese, nuts, and olive oil, to create a delicious and visually appealing dish. The tomatoes and grapefruit are roasted together, which enhances their natural flavors and creates a unique texture. The blue cheese adds a tangy and savory element, while the nuts and olive oil provide a crunchy and rich contrast. This dish can be enjoyed as a side dish or a main course, and can be customized with various other ingredients to suit individual preferences.

gt:
For the brownies: Preheat oven to 350F.
Butter and flour an 8 x 8 cake pan.
In a small bowl, combine cocoa powder, red food coloring, and 1 teaspoon vanilla to create a paste.
In the bowl of an electric mixer, cream butter and sugar until fluffy.
Add eggs one at a time, then add remaining teaspoon of vanilla.
With the mixer on medium speed, add in cocoa powder mixture.
Beat until batter is completely red.
(If at this time your batter is NOT red, you can add a little more food coloring if desired.
Color will depend on brand.)
Add flour and salt, mixing until just combined.
Fold in chocolate chips.
Spread into the 8 x 8 pan.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Let cool completely before frosting.
For the frosting: Cream butter in an electric mixer until fluffy, then add vanilla.
Slowly add in powdered sugar 1/2 cup at a time with the mixer on low speed.
Add in melted white chocolate and beat until incorporated.
To reach desired consistency, add in milk 1 teaspoon at a time with mixer on low speed.
If frosting becomes too liquidy, simply add additional sugar.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 9x13 inch baking dish.

2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.

3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the cocoa powder, red food coloring, and vanilla extract. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture, alternating with the dry ingredients and mixing well after each addition.

4. Stir in the chocolate chips, if using.

5. Pour the batter into the prepared baking dish and smooth the top with a spatula.

6. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the brownies comes out clean.

7. Allow the brownies to cool completely in the pan before cutting into squares.

8. To make the white chocolate buttercream, beat the butter and vanilla extract together until smooth. Gradually add the powdered sugar, beating until fluffy. If the buttercream is too thick, add a bit more milk, a teaspoon at a time, until the desired consistency is reached.

9. Spread the white chocolate buttercream over the cooled brownies.

10. Refrigerate the brownies and buttercream until the buttercream is set, about 1-2 hours.

11. Serve the Red Velvet Brownies with White Chocolate Buttercream immediately or store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

[/INST]

gt:
Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes.
Shake well.
Strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
pred:
[/INST]

To make a delicious King of Kingston Cocktail, follow these steps:

1. In a shaker, combine 1 ounce gin, 12 ounces creme de banane, 1 teaspoon grapefruit juice, 1 ounce pineapple juice, and 1 teaspoon grenadine.

2. Shake the mixture vigorously for about 15-20 seconds, until the ingredients are well combined and the drink is frothy.

3. Strain the mixture into a chilled glass.

4. Top the drink with 1 ounce of heavy cream.

5. Garnish with a slice of pineapple and a cherry, if desired.

Enjoy your King of Kingston Cocktail!

gt:
In a large pot (make sure it is large because while this cooks it bubbles), combine buttermilk, sugar, brown sugar, butter, corn syrup and salt.
Bring to a boil and then reduce heat to low.
Cook until nice a caramel-ly rich brown.
About 10 minutes.
Stir frequently with a wooden spoon.
Remove from heat and stir in vanilla.
Continue to stir to cool.
Enjoy.
(Store in fridge)
Makes about 2 cups
pred:
To cook a delightful Salted Buttermilk Caramel Sauce dish, follow these steps:

1. In a small saucepan, combine 3/4 cups of buttermilk, 1 cup of sugar, 1/2 cups of brown sugar, and 1/2 cups of butter, cubed.

2. Place the saucepan over medium heat and stir until the sugar has dissolved.

3. Add 2 tablespoons of corn syrup and continue stirring until the mixture reaches 230°F (110°C) on a candy thermometer.

4. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in 1 teaspoon of Fleur De Sel Salt and 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract.

5. Pour the sauce into a heat-resistant container and let it cool to room temperature.

6. Once the sauce has cooled, refrigerate it until it reaches room temperature.

7. Serve the Salted Buttermilk Caramel Sauce over ice cream, pancakes, or any other dessert of your choice.

The Salted Buttermilk Caramel Sauce dish is a delicious and creative dessert that combines the rich flavors of buttermilk, caramel, and salt. The combination of ingredients creates a unique and indulgent treat that can be enjoyed on its own or paired with various desserts.

gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Mix wafer crumbs, butter and sugar until well blended.
Press firmly onto bottom and up side of 9-inch pie plate.
Bake 5 to 8 min.
or until golden brown.
Cool completely.
Pour milk into large bowl.
Add dry pudding mixes.
Beat with wire whisk 2 min.
or until well blended.
Gently stir in 1 cup of the whipped topping.
Spread into crust.
Refrigerate at least 3 hours or overnight.
Stir crushed mints into remaining 1 cup whipped topping just before serving.
Spread onto pie.
Store leftover pie in refrigerator.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a medium saucepan, melt the butter or margarine over low heat.
3. Add the sugar and stir until smooth.
4. Add the milk and stir until well combined.
5. In a separate bowl, mix the JELL-O Chocolate Flavor Instant Pudding with 1 cup of the milk mixture.
6. Pour the pudding mixture into the saucepan with the remaining milk mixture.
7. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until the pudding is smooth and heated through.
8. Remove from heat and stir in the COOL WHIP Whipped Topping.
9. Crush the starlight mints and mix them into the pudding mixture.
10. Pour the pudding mixture into a pie crust.
11. Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the edges are set and the center is slightly wobbly.
12. Allow the pie to cool completely before serving.

[/INST]

This Hint-of-Mint Chocolate Pie dish is a delicious dessert that combines the rich flavors of chocolate and mint. The pie crust provides a satisfying crust, while the pudding filling adds a creamy texture and a hint of mint. The whipped topping adds a light and fluffy touch, and the crushed starlight mints add a refreshing and delightful minty flavor. This dessert is perfect for sharing with friends and family, and it can be enjoyed as a special treat or during a gathering.

gt:
Insert wooden pop stick into cut end of each banana half; set aside.
Mix chopped cookies and sprinkles; set aside.
Spread bananas evenly with peanut butter.
Roll in cookie mixture until evenly coated.
Wrap individually with plastic wrap.
Freeze 2 hours or until firm.
Remove from freezer 10 min.
before serving to soften slightly.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
3. In a large bowl, mash the bananas with a fork or a potato masher.
4. Add the chopped OREO cookies, peanut butter, and sprinkles to the bowl. Mix everything together until well combined.
5. Scoop the mixture onto the prepared baking sheet, forming small balls or patties.
6. Bake the treats for 10-12 minutes, or until they are set and slightly golden around the edges.
7. Allow the treats to cool for a few minutes on the baking sheet before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious OREO Banana Peanut Butter Treats!

gt:
Combine ingredients.
Refrigerate 30 min.
pred:
To cook a delicious Zesty Lime Rice Salad, follow these steps:
1. Cook the rice according to the package instructions, using the recommended amount of water or broth. Typically, this involves boiling the rice in a saucepan until it is cooked through and the water has been absorbed.
2. Once the rice is cooked, transfer it to a large mixing bowl.
3. Drain the canned corn and black beans, and rinse them under cold water to remove any excess salt. Add the corn and black beans to the bowl with the cooked rice.
4. Cut the grape tomatoes in half and add them to the bowl.
5. Slice the green onions and add them to the bowl.
6. In a small bowl, mix the Kraft Zesty Italian Dressing, fresh lime juice, and 1/4 cup of the grated Parmesan cheese.
7. Pour the dressing mixture over the rice mixture, and toss everything together until the rice is evenly coated.
8. Season the salad with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Serve the Zesty Lime Rice Salad immediately, or refrigerate it for up to 24 hours before serving.

This delicious Zesty Lime Rice Salad is a perfect side dish or main course, and it can be easily customized with additional ingredients, such as chopped cucumbers, sliced avocado, or crumbled feta cheese.

gt:
If you haven't done so already, take your butter out to soften.
Combine all the ingredients (except for the cheese) together in a food mixer and mix until a dough forms.
Stop the mixer and gently knead with your hands on a floured surface.
Dont over work it.
Wrap the dough in cling film and rest it in the fridge for 1 hour.
Pre-heat your oven to 150C.
On a floured surface roll out the dough as thinly as possible or use a pasta machine
Cut the dough into your desired shape and place onto a baking tray lined with a nonstick sheet.
Sprinkle a little frozen cheddar on each cracker and bake in the oven for 15 minutes or until cooked.
Allow them to cool down before moving them from the sheet.
Store in an airtight container.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, and seaweed flakes.
3. Cut the butter into small pieces and add it to the dry ingredients.
4. Gradually add the water and mix until a dough forms.
5. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic.
6. Roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1cm (1/2 inch).
7. Cut the dough into desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a sharp knife.
8. Place the shaped dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Bake the crackers for about 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown.
10. Remove the crackers from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

Ingredients:
- 350 g (12.3oz) plain flour
- 90 g (3.2oz) softened butter
- 20 seaweed flakes
- 2 tsp baking powder
- 140 ml (4.9fl oz) water
- 50 g (1.8oz) frozen and blended/grated cheddar

The process of making a delicious Cheddar and seaweed crackers recipe dish involves several steps. First, preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F) to ensure the crackers cook evenly. Next, combine the flour, baking powder, and seaweed flakes in a large mixing bowl. Cut the butter into small pieces and add it to the dry ingredients. Gradually add the water and mix until a dough forms. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic. Roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1cm (1/2 inch)

gt:
1.
Use a large skillet over medium-high heat to warm the butter and olive oil.
Add the onions and pepper and saute until the onions soften.
Add in the salt, black pepper and red pepper flakes.
2.
Add the mushrooms and garlic and stir them as they cook, for about 5 minutes.
The mushrooms will begin to release their liquid.
3.
Turn off the heat and add in the Parmesan cheese.
Toss in the toasted pine nuts or walnuts if youre using them, and mix everything well.
4.
Grill or heat the tortillas in a dry skillet over medium heat.
When theyre nice and soft add the mushroom mixture to each and serve.
Adapted from Whole Living.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the butter and olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and bell pepper strips, and cook until they are tender and slightly caramelized. Season with salt, black pepper, and red pepper flakes.
3. Add the mushrooms to the skillet, and cook until they are tender and slightly browned.
4. Stir in the minced garlic, and cook for a few seconds until fragrant.
5. Add the cremini mushrooms (or another hearty mushroom), and cook until they are tender.
6. Stir in the grated Parmesan cheese, and cook until it melts and becomes slightly bubbly.
7. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
8. To assemble the tacos, warm the tortillas in the oven or on a griddle.
9. Fill the tortillas with the mushroom and cheese mixture, and top with toasted pine nuts or chopped walnuts.
10. Serve the Mushroom Tacos hot, and enjoy!

gt:
Heat oven to 350F.
Line 13x9-inch pan with foil, with ends of foil extending over sides; spray with cooking spray.
Combine wafer crumbs, 1/2 cup nuts and butter; press onto bottom of prepared pan.
Refrigerate until ready to use.
Microwave caramels and cream in microwaveable bowl on HIGH 2 to 3 min.
or until caramels are completely melted, stirring after each minute; pour over crust.
Beat cream cheese and sugar in large bowl with mixer until blended.
Add eggs, 1 at a time, mixing on low speed after each just until blended.
Pour over crust; sprinkle with remaining nuts.
Bake 30 to 35 min.
or until center is almost set.
Cool.
Refrigerate 4 hours.
Use foil handles to remove dessert from pan before cutting into bars.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the crushed vanilla wafers, chopped pecans, and melted butter or margarine until well combined. Press the mixture into the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish.
3. In a separate bowl, beat the softened cream cheese until smooth. Add the sugar and eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in the melted caramels.
4. Pour the cream cheese mixture over the crust.
5. Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the edges are set and the center is slightly jiggly.
6. Allow the cake to cool completely in the pan before cutting into bars.

Enjoy your delicious Caramel Cheesecake Bars!

gt:
Preheat oven to 375.
Place pepperonis on tinfoil in oven and bake for about 5 minutes, or until grease begins to come up.
Remove, drain, and pat dry.
Roll out dough into a rectangular shape.
Brush gently with egg.
Layer fresh tomato sauce, garlic, mozzarella, pepperoni, and basil onto dough.
Roll dough jelly-roll style, place onto baking stone and bake 35-40 minutes.
Remove and let cool 5 minutes.
Slice and serve.
Variations: Saute onions or scallions on stove top and add to filling.
Additionally, add mushrooms, pepperoncinis, tomatoes, or kalamata olives.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 475°F (245°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the egg, lightly beaten, and the 3 tablespoons of fresh tomato sauce.
3. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the pizza dough into a large, round shape. Transfer the dough to a pizza stone or a large baking sheet.
4. Spread the egg and tomato sauce mixture evenly over the dough, leaving a small border around the edges for the crust.
5. Sprinkle the minced garlic evenly over the sauce mixture.
6. Add the sliced buffalo mozzarella, pepperoni, and crumbled fresh basil on top of the sauce mixture.
7. Bake the pizza in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Remove the pizza from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Wash the beets well, being careful not to break their skins.
Cut off the tops, leaving a stalk of about 1 1/2 inches.
Boil, covered, until tender.
Allow the water to cool, then slip off the skins, trim off the tops, and cut into bite-sized pieces.
Mix the remaining ingredients and pour over beets.
Let marinate 1 hour before serving.
pred:
1. Wash the beets thoroughly and peel the skin.
2. Cut the beets into small, evenly sized pieces.
3. In a small bowl, mix the granulated sugar, lemon juice, and olive oil.
4. Add the beet pieces to the mixture and toss to coat them evenly.
5. Season the beets with cinnamon, salt, and chopped parsley.
6. Serve the beet salad immediately or refrigerate it for later use.

[/INST]
