gt:
Add water and milk to a pot and heat.
When the pot starts to boil, add miso paste and dissolve.
Add grated ginger as well!
Add chicken ramen noodles to the pot from step 1, and loosen the noodles.
Cook to your preferred hardness.
(I cooked for 1 minute.)
Add toppings to finish.
If you find the flavor is too strong, add more hot water.
pred:
To cook a delicious Chicken Ramen dish, follow these steps:

1. In a large pot, combine the two packages of Chicken ramen noodles and 600 ml of water. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer and let it cook for about 5-7 minutes, or until the noodles are fully cooked and tender.

2. While the noodles are cooking, in a small bowl, whisk together the 200 ml of milk and 1 tbsp of Miso.

3. Once the noodles are cooked, carefully drain the excess water and add the whisked milk mixture to the pot. Stir to combine.

4. Add the grated ginger to the pot and stir to combine.

5. Cook the mixture for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.

6. Serve the Chicken Ramen in bowls, garnished with chopped green onions and a drizzle of soy sauce, if desired.

This dish combines the flavors of the ramen noodles, milk, and miso, creating a rich and satisfying meal. The addition of the grated ginger adds a touch of warmth and complexity to the dish.

gt:
Simply place all ingredients in a mixing bowl and mix together completely.
Chill for 1 to 2 hours before serving.
Enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the stone ground mustard, lime juice, and cilantro.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the ground cumin and a pinch of salt.
4. Spread the mustard mixture onto a baking sheet or a silicone mat.
5. Roast the mustard mixture in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. After the desired roasting time, remove the mixture from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Stir in the cooled mixture into the bowl with the ground cumin and salt.
8. Taste the mixture and adjust the seasoning as needed.
9. Serve the Cilantro Lime Mustard as a dip, spread, or topping for various dishes.

[/INST]

gt:
In a medium sized mixing bowl, beat together pudding mix, milk, sour cream, pumpkin puree, cinnamon and nutmeg.
Whip for about 2 minutes until mixture thickens.
Put it in the refrigerator and allow it to chill for 1 hour.
In another bowl, whip together the whipping cream, vanilla extract and powdered sugar.
Whip until stiff peaks, about 3-5 minutes on high speed.
Then make the crust.
Crush Oreo cookies (in a bag or a food processor) until you have fine crumbs.
Mix in the melted butter.
Place about 1 teaspoon of the cookie crumbs into the bottom of 20 small shot glasses.
Fill up the rest of the way with pumpkin mixture.
Top with whipping cream.
If you have any cookie crumbs left, sprinkle those on top.
Serve chilled.
They can be chilled for up to 4 hours before serving.
pred:
1. First, prepare the pudding mix according to the package instructions, using the cold milk and sour cream.
2. In a separate bowl, mix the pumpkin puree, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
3. Add the melted butter to the pudding mix and stir until combined.
4. Add the pumpkin mixture to the pudding mix and stir until well combined.
5. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
6. Line a 9-inch (23cm) springform pan with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
7. Press the pudding mixture evenly into the bottom of the prepared pan.
8. Crush the Oreo cookies into fine crumbs.
9. Melt the butter in a small saucepan over low heat.
10. Add the crushed Oreo cookies to the melted butter and stir until the cookies are evenly coated.
11. Spread the cookie crumb mixture evenly over the pudding mixture in the pan.
12. Bake the pie for 40-45 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is set.
13. Allow the pie to cool completely before cutting and serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Combine the almonds and sea salt in a large food processor.
Turn on to process.
Stop and scrape down the sides as needed.
The almonds will go through several stages but will begin to release oils after a few minutes and the almonds will become creamy and smooth after several minutes of processing.
If desired, add 2 to 3 teaspoons of honey to the almond butter at the end of processing.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the dry roasted almonds and sea salt.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the honey and melted butter.
4. Add the honey mixture to the almonds and sea salt mixture, stirring until well combined.
5. Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
6. Bake the almond mixture in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the almonds are golden brown and the mixture is slightly crunchy.
7. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the mixture cool for a few minutes.
8. Once cooled, transfer the mixture to a food processor or blender and blend until smooth and creamy.
9. Optionally, if you prefer a smoother texture, you can add a bit more honey or butter to the mixture.
10. Enjoy your delicious Sea Salted Almond Butter dish!

This savory Sea Salted Almond Butter dish is a delightful addition to any meal, and it can be served as a spread, a topping, or even a snack. The combination of the crunchy almonds, the smooth almond butter, and the subtle saltiness of the sea salt creates a delightful contrast of textures and flavors. The honey adds a touch of sweetness, while the optional butter enhances the creaminess of the dish. This versatile recipe can be easily customized to suit individual preferences, making it a great option for both casual gatherings and more formal occasions.

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl combine oats, brown sugar, cinnamon and salt.
Stir in LUCKY LEAF Premium Apple Pie Filling.
In a second large bowl stir together eggs, 3 cups milk, oil and vanilla.
Stir egg mixture into oat mixture until combined.
Pour mixture into a greased 3-quart rectangular baking pan.
Bake in the preheated oven for 45 to 55 minutes or until oatmeal mixture is set.
Serve warm in bowls with milk or half-and-half.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the oats, brown sugar, cinnamon, and salt.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, oil, and vanilla.
4. Pour the wet ingredients over the dry ingredients and stir until well combined.
5. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x9 inch baking dish.
6. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the center is set.
7. Allow the dish to cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Sweet Apple-Cinnamon Baked Oatmeal!

gt:
Place pear in a food processor; pulse until finely chopped.
Place pear, rind, juice, and vanilla bean in a large saucepan.
Stir in pectin.
Place pan over high heat; bring to a boil.
Stir in sugar; cook 5 minutes or until sugar dissolves.
Bring to a boil; cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.Remove from heat.
Skim foam from surface; discard.
Remove vanilla bean.
Scrape seeds into pear mixture; discard bean.
Stir 5 minutes to ensure fruit is suspended in jam.
Cover and chill overnight.Note: Refrigerate Pear-Vanilla Freezer Jam in airtight containers up to three weeks, or freeze up to six months.
pred:
To prepare the delicious Pear-Vanilla Freezer Jam dish, follow these steps:

1. Wash and peel the Bartlett pears, then chop them into small pieces.
2. In a large saucepan, combine the chopped pears, grated lemon rind, and fresh lemon juice. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the pears are tender and the mixture has thickened slightly.
3. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool slightly.
4. Split the vanilla bean lengthwise and scrape out the seeds. Add the vanilla seeds to the cooled pear mixture.
5. In a small bowl, mix the pectin crystals with 2 tablespoons of water. Set aside.
6. In a clean saucepan, combine the sugar, 1 cup of water, and the pectin mixture. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture reaches 220°F (105°C) on a candy thermometer.
7. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool slightly.
8. Carefully pour the hot mixture over the pear mixture, stirring gently to combine.
9. Cover the saucepan with a lid and let it cool to room temperature.
10. Refrigerate the mixture for at least 2 hours or overnight before transferring it to an airtight container or freezer-safe storage bag.

After refrigerating, the Pear-Vanilla Freezer Jam will be ready to enjoy as a spread on toast, as a topping for yogurt, or as a delicious addition to various desserts and baked goods.

gt:
Begin by heating up only 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
While the oil is heating, make four shallow slits in the fatty side of the duck breast.
Turn it over to the meaty side and make 4 to 5 slits around a centimeter deep...this is where we will add the lime wedges.
When the oil is hot, place the duck filet in the pan fat side down and let it brown for less than a minute.
Flip it and quickly brown it on the meaty side for less than a minute.
Transfer the duck breast into a baking pan and smear it with the honey.
Slice the lime into wedges and cut those wedges in half.
Wedge one into each of the slits in the top of the duck (the meaty side).
Sprinkle the whole thing with half of the thyme and put it in the oven at 375 degrees F for 10 minutes.
In the meantime, add the rest of the oil into the pan over medium heat.
Then add the slices of zucchini.
Sprinkle them with the rest of the thyme and flip them 2 or three times.
They should take 3-5 minutes maximum.
When done they should be slightly brown on each side, or at least a little translucent.
Place the zucchini on a plate and place the finished duck on top.
Pour the honey drippings from the pan onto the duck.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the olive oil, lime juice, honey, and thyme. Season the duck breast with salt and pepper.
3. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the olive oil and cook the duck breast until it is golden brown on both sides and cooked through, about 4-5 minutes per side.
4. Remove the duck breast from the skillet and let it rest for a few minutes.
5. In a small bowl, mix the liquid honey and thyme.
6. Place the duck breast on a cutting board and slice it into thin pieces.
7. In a large skillet, heat the remaining olive oil over medium heat. Add the sliced zucchini and cook until they are tender but still crisp, about 4-5 minutes.
8. Add the honey mixture to the skillet and stir to combine. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes or until the zucchini is coated with the honey mixture.
9. Serve the duck breast slices on top of the zucchini mixture. Enjoy your delicious Duck Breast With Lime and Honey!

gt:
Beat sweet potatoes, sugar, milk, butter, egg, salt and maple flavoring until smooth.
Put into greased 2 qt casserole.
In small bowl, mix brown sugar, pecans and flour.
Cut in butter until crumbly.
Sprinkle over sweet potatoes.
Bake, uncovered, at 325 for 45 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the mashed sweet potatoes, sugar, milk, softened butter, egg, salt, and maple flavoring. Mix well.
3. Add the brown sugar, chopped pecans, and flour to the mixture. Stir until well combined.
4. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9x9 inch baking dish.
5. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
6. Allow the cake to cool for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

This step-by-step guide will help you create a delicious Sweet Potato Bake dish using the provided ingredients. The dish is a popular dessert or side dish that combines the natural sweetness of sweet potatoes with the rich flavors of maple and pecans. The step-by-step instructions ensure that you follow the correct process to achieve the desired outcome.

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Spray a baking sheet with non-stick cooking spray.
Heat olive oil in a skillet or frying pan over medium heat.
Add garlic and saute until soft, about two minutes.
Add spinach and cook until liquid has evaporated.
Stir in salt, pepper, Parmesan and garlic powder.
Remove from heat and let cool.
On a lightly floured surface, roll out pizza crust into a 10x14 inch rectangle.
Spread spinach mixture and mozzarella cheese on top of dough.
Starting from on end, roll up the crust to make one large loaf.
Pinch seam to seal.
Place loaf onto prepared baking sheet.
Bake in preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes, until golden brown.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and sauté for 1 minute, until fragrant.
3. Add the spinach to the skillet and cook until it has wilted, about 3-4 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
4. Transfer the spinach to a large mixing bowl and set aside.
5. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the pizza crust dough into a 12-inch circle. Transfer the dough to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. Spread the spinach evenly over the dough, leaving a 1-inch border around the edges.
7. Sprinkle the shredded mozzarella cheese over the spinach.
8. Drizzle the grated Parmesan cheese over the mozzarella cheese.
9. Bake the pizza in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Remove the pizza from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Heat the oven to 350 degrees F and arrange 2 racks to divide the oven into thirds.
Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper; set aside.
Whisk the flour, baking soda, and salt together in a medium bowl until aerated and combined; set aside.
Place the butter and brown sugar in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment.
Beat on medium speed until lightened in color and fluffy, about 3 minutes.
Stop the mixer and scrape down the sides of the bowl and the paddle with a rubber spatula.
Add the egg and vanilla, return the mixer to medium speed, and beat until incorporated, about 1 minute more.
Reduce the mixer speed to low and slowly add the flour mixture until just combined.
Stop the mixer and scrape down the sides of the bowl and the paddle with the rubber spatula.
Return the mixer to low speed, add the chocolate chips, and mix until just combined.
Drop the cookie dough by rounded tablespoons about 2 inches apart on the prepared baking sheets (about 12 per sheet).
Place the remaining dough in the refrigerator.
Place both sheets in the oven and bake for 7 minutes.
Rotate the sheets front to back and top to bottom and continue baking until the bottoms and edges of the cookies are golden brown but the tops are still soft, about 6 to 7 minutes more.
Place the baking sheets on wire racks and let cool for 5 minutes.
Using a flat spatula, transfer the cookies to the wire racks to cool completely.
Let the baking sheets cool completely and repeat with the remaining dough (you can reuse the parchments).
Store the cookies at room temperature in an airtight container for up to 3 days.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the egg and vanilla extract, and mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until just combined.
6. Fold in the chocolate chips.
7. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are set and the centers are still slightly soft.
9. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

Please provide the recipe for the Chocolate Chip Cookies, including the necessary ingredients and instructions for preparation.

gt:
Whisk mayonnaise, buttermilk, sugar, milk, lemon juice, olive oil, vinegar, garlic and herb seasoning blend, celery seed, salt, and black pepper together in a bowl until smooth and creamy.
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to use.
pred:
1. In a small bowl, mix together the mayonnaise, buttermilk, sugar, low-fat milk, lemon juice, extra-virgin olive oil, white wine vinegar, garlic and herb seasoning blend, celery seed, salt, and pepper.
2. Stir until well combined, ensuring that the ingredients are evenly distributed.
3. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
4. After 30 minutes, taste the dressing and adjust the seasoning as needed.
5. Serve the Creamy Coleslaw Dressing over your favorite coleslaw mixture, such as shredded cabbage, carrots, and bell peppers.

Enjoy your delicious and creamy coleslaw dressing!

gt:
Add all ingredients into a blender.
Blend on high speed until ice is crushed and drink is smooth.
pred:
1. Wash and hull the strawberries, and cut them into small pieces.
2. In a blender, combine the strawberries, cream of coconut, pineapple juice, and peeled banana.
3. Add ice to the blender, and blend the mixture until smooth and creamy.
4. Pour the smoothie into a glass, and enjoy your delicious tropical strawberry smoothie.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 375F.
In a large bowl, beat butter with sugar and brown sugar at medium speed until creamy and lightened in color (about four minutes).
Add vanilla and egg, mix on low speed until incorporated.
Stir flour with baking soda, salt and spices; add to cream mixture, mixing well.
Stir in oats.
Fold in chocolate chips and walnuts.
Drop by rounded tablespoon onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake 8-9 minutes for a chewy cookie.
Bake 10-11 minutes for a crisp cookie.
Cool one minute on a cookie sheet; remove to wire cooling racks.
Store in tightly covered container.
pred:
To cook a delightful Clementine's Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Cookies dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the softened butter and brown sugar until smooth.
3. Add the egg and vanilla, and continue to mix until well combined.
4. Gradually add the flour, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, and nutmeg, mixing until a smooth dough forms.
5. Fold in the oats and chopped walnuts.
6. Chop the semi-sweet chocolate chips into smaller pieces.
7. Scoop the dough onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown around the edges and slightly firm to the touch.
9. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Clementine's Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Cookies!

gt:
In a medium saucepan, bring the broth and 1 teaspoon of the salt to a boil.
Stir in the couscous.
Cover, remove from the heat, and let stand 5 minutes.
Transfer to a large bowl and let cool.
Add the tomato, peas, mint, 4 tablespoons of the oil, the lemon juice, 1/2 teaspoon of the salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper to the couscous.
In a large nonstick frying pan, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon oil over moderately high heat.
Add the shrimp, the remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/8 teaspoon pepper.
Cook turning, until just done, about 3 minutes in all.
Serve the couscous salad topped with the shrimp.
pred:
1. In a large saucepan, combine the chicken broth, salt, and couscous. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 15 minutes, or until the couscous is tender and the liquid is absorbed.

2. Meanwhile, in a large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the tomato, peas, and mint, and cook for about 5 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.

3. Stir the cooked couscous into the skillet with the vegetables.

4. Season the shrimp with pepper, and cook them in the skillet with the couscous mixture until they are pink and cooked through, about 3-4 minutes.

5. Serve the shrimp and couscous mixture over a bed of the cooked couscous.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Line a large baking pan with parchment paper or coat with nonstick cooking spray.
Place broccoli onto prepared pan.
Add olive oil, minced garlic, 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese, salt and pepper.
Toss to combine, then spread in an even layer on baking sheet.
Bake for 1215 minutes, or until tender.
Remove from oven, sprinkle with remaining Parmesan cheese, and squeeze lemon juice on top (if desired).
Serve immediately.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Roasted Garlic Parmesan Broccoli, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the broccoli florets with 3 tablespoons of olive oil, minced garlic, and salt and pepper to taste.
3. Spread the broccoli evenly on a baking sheet or roasting pan.
4. Roast the broccoli in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until it is tender and slightly crispy.
5. While the broccoli is roasting, prepare the Parmesan cheese mixture. In a small bowl, mix 1/2 cups grated Parmesan cheese with a pinch of salt and pepper.
6. Once the broccoli is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Drizzle the roasted broccoli with the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil, and then toss the broccoli with the Parmesan cheese mixture.
8. Serve the Roasted Garlic Parmesan Broccoli immediately, garnished with a squeeze of lemon juice (optional) for added flavor.

Enjoy your delicious Roasted Garlic Parmesan Broccoli!

gt:
In a nonstick 12-inch skillet, warm oil over medium heat until hot.
Add chicken and sprinkle with black pepper and 1/4 tsp.
salt.
Add onion and green pepper to skillet.
Saut, turning chicken once and stirring vegetable mixture occasionally, until chicken is browned and vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, use a vegetable peeler to remove a 3-inch strip of peel from the lemon.
Cut lemon into wedges for garnish.
Stir lemon peel, rice, garlic, cayenne, broth, water and remaining 1/2 tsp.
salt into mixture in skillet and bring to a boil over high heat.
Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 20 minutes.
Stir in frozen peas; cover and cook 5 minutes.
Remove skillet from heat and stir in olives.
Spoon into a serving dish and garnish with lemon wedges.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet or oven-safe dish, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
3. Season the chicken thighs with black pepper and salt.
4. Add the chicken thighs to the skillet and cook until they are browned on both sides and cooked through, about 10-12 minutes.
5. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
6. In the same skillet, add the onion and green bell pepper. Cook until the onion is translucent and the bell pepper is slightly softened, about 5-7 minutes.
7. Add the garlic to the skillet and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
8. Add the lemon juice to the skillet and stir to combine.
9. Pour in the chicken broth and water, and bring the mixture to a simmer.
10. Add the frozen peas to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes, until the peas are heated through.
11. Stir in the cayenne pepper and olives.
12. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for 15-20 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the liquid has been absorbed.
13. Serve the Arroz con Pollo over a bed of rice.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees; Grease a loaf pan or other small baking pan of similar size.
Combine frist 3 ingredients in small bowl.
Combine next 5 ingredients in separate bowl.
Add dry ingredients to wet and fold in raspberries.
Bake 15-20 minutes or until done.
Serve warm!
pred:
[TUTORIAL]
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the unsweetened applesauce, sugar, and vanilla. Mix well.
3. Add the egg white and mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the whole wheat flour, all-purpose flour, cocoa, baking soda, and baking powder.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, stirring until just combined.
6. Fold in the raspberries.
7. Pour the batter into a greased 9x9 inch baking dish.
8. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
9. Allow the brownies to cool completely before cutting into squares and serving.

[/TUTORIAL]

[/INST]

gt:
Place all ingredients in a blender.
Blend the mixture for 20 seconds, or until smooth.
Spray a skillet with cooking spray.
Heat over medium heat.
Pour 1/4 cup of pancake mixture in the pan.
Cook until the pancakes are dry and bubbly on the edges, and bubbles appear on top.
Turn and brown the other side.
Serve with applesauce, bananas, strawberries, or maple syrup.
pred:
[/INST]

To create delicious Oatmeal Pancakes, follow these steps:

1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 2-1/2 cups of dry rolled oats, 1 cup of butter milk, and the 1 teaspoon of baking powder. Mix well.

2. Add the 1 teaspoon of cinnamon and 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract to the mixture. Stir to combine.

3. In a small bowl, whisk the 6 whole egg whites until they are frothy.

4. Add the whisked egg whites to the oat mixture, and mix until the batter is smooth and well combined.

5. Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat. Grease the pan with a small amount of canola oil.

6. Pour the batter onto the pan, using a spoon or a ladle, to create evenly-sized pancakes. Cook the pancakes until they are golden brown on both sides and the edges are set.

7. Serve the Oatmeal Pancakes warm, with your favorite toppings, such as maple syrup, butter, or fruit.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Oatmeal Pancakes!

gt:
Preheat the grill for high heat.
In a bowl, mix the lamb, green onions, garlic, curry powder, cumin, red pepper, salt and pepper.
Form into 4 patties.
Lightly oil grill grate.
Grill patties 5 minutes on each side, or until done.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the ground lamb, green onions, minced garlic, curry powder, ground cumin, dried red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper.
3. Form the mixture into small patties, approximately 1 inch (2.5 cm) in diameter.
4. Heat a large skillet or oven-safe pan over medium heat. Add a small amount of oil to the pan, and cook the patties until they are browned on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side.
5. Transfer the patties to a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until cooked through.
6. Serve the Spicy Lamb Patties with your favorite side dish, such as rice, naan, or a salad. Enjoy your delicious homemade meal!

gt:
Preheat oven to 400 F.
In a skillet over medium-high heat, add olive oil.
Add mushrooms and peppers and cook for for 6-8 minutes, or until mushrooms are soft, stirring occasionally.
Add garlic, cumin, and cherry tomatoes.
Cook for 1 minute, stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat and set aside.
Brush corn tortillas with olive oil on both sides and sprinkle with cayenne pepper on one side.
Place them in a single layer on a baking sheet and bake at 400 F for 4-5 minutes, or until just starting to brown.
Remove from oven, and flip the tortillas over.
Spread a layer of refried beans over the tortillas.
Add a small layer of the cooked vegetables.
Put pan back in the oven for about 5-7 minutes, being careful not to burn.
Note: Depending on how thick the corn tortilla is, it may take less time to bake.
Remove from oven and top with avocado slices, cilantro and chipotle cream (if desired).
To make the chipotle cream, add hot sauce, cashews, lime juice, apple cider vinegar, water, and sea salt into a food processor.
Blend until smooth.
Note: You can also cook these tostadas in a toaster or convection oven.
Enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the sliced mushrooms and green pepper, and cook until they are tender, about 5-7 minutes.
3. Add minced garlic and cook for another minute.
4. Add the refried beans, cumin, cayenne pepper, and chipotle hot sauce. Cook for a few minutes until the beans are heated through.
5. Brush the tortillas with a little extra olive oil, and place them on a baking sheet.
6. Place the tortillas in the preheated oven and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until they are crispy and golden.
7. Remove the tortillas from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
8. In a small bowl, mix the cashews, lime juice, apple cider vinegar, water, and sea salt.
9. In a large bowl, mix the sliced mushrooms, green pepper, beans, and cashew mixture.
10. Assemble the tostadas by placing a layer of the bean mixture on each tortilla.
11. Garnish with chopped cilantro and a slice of avocado.

Enjoy your delicious Portobello Tostadas with Chipotle Cream!

gt:
Use cucumbers with no wax residue on the peels.
Slice cucumbers in 1/4-1/8 slices.
Cut garlic cloves in quarters, then smash them a bit.
Put cucumbers and garlic in a bowl.
Heat vinegar (I like apple cider vinegar, but white works also), water, sugar, salt, dill, red pepper flakes, coriander and peppercorns in a small sauce pan until sugar and salt are dissolved.
*
Pour over the cucumbers and garlic.
Cover and let marinate in refrigerator for at least two hours.
Serve cold.
* We dont use very much salt at my house.
You may want more salt.
Or more sugar.
This recipe is just basic, you can play with the ingredients to make them work for you.
pred:
1. Wash and peel the cucumbers and garlic.
2. Cut the cucumbers into small, bite-sized pieces.
3. In a large bowl, combine the cucumber pieces, garlic, vinegar, water, sugar, salt, dill, red pepper flakes, coriander, and peppercorns.
4. Stir the mixture well to ensure all ingredients are evenly distributed.
5. Cover the bowl with a clean cloth or plastic wrap and let it sit in the refrigerator for at least 24 hours.
6. After 24 hours, remove the pickling mixture from the refrigerator and let it come to room temperature.
7. Taste the pickling mixture and adjust the seasoning if needed.
8. Pour the mixture into a clean, sterilized jar with a lid.
9. Store the jar in the refrigerator for at least 24 hours before consuming.

[/INST]

These pickles will have a tangy and slightly sweet flavor, with a hint of garlic and dill. The red pepper flakes and coriander add a spicy kick, while the peppercorns provide a subtle, aromatic depth. Enjoy your homemade Garlic Fridge Pickles!

gt:
In a food processor, pulse all of the ingredients until smooth.
Transfer the mixture to a saucepan and cook over moderate heat just until the oil begins to separate, 5 minutes.
Scrape the dip into a bowl and serve warm.
Looking for party-ready recipes?
Try our top guacamole recipes, birthday cakes, or punch recipes.
pred:
1. In a small bowl, mix together the olive oil, capers, thyme, sherry vinegar, crushed red pepper, and salt. Set aside.

2. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the black olives and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they are tender but still have some crunch.

3. Carefully pour the olive oil mixture over the olives, stirring to combine. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.

4. Remove the skillet from the heat and let the sauce cool slightly.

5. Serve the Bagna Cauda immediately, using a spoon to scoop the sauce over the olives. Enjoy the delicious flavors of the olive oil, capers, thyme, sherry vinegar, and crushed red pepper.

[/INST]

gt:
This omelette is delicious even without bonito flakes.
If you stir-fry the cabbage before cooking, it'll wilt and soften.
This means that the okonomiyaki will lose its crunch.
Chop the Chinese cabbage up into 1 cm pieces and slice the sausage into whatever size you prefer.
Combine the sausage and cabbage with the beaten egg.
If the pieces of cabbage are too big, the mixture will be difficult to mix.
Cook the omelette in a frying pan that has been greased with a thin layer of oil.
Allow the omelette to cook slowly without interfering.
Once one side is cooked, flip the omelette over.
You can cover the pan with a lid if you like, but the omelette will turn out just fine without it.
Slide the omelette onto a plate and pour over some mayonnaise and okonomiyaki sauce to serve.
If you have them, decorate the omelette with bonito flakes and red pickled ginger.
It'll make the omelette look even more similar to okonomiyaki.
Mapo-Style Chinese Cabbage made with store-bought, ready-made mapo dofu sauce mix.
Chinese Cabbage Stew made with stew roux.
Chinese-style Stir-Fried Leeks.
Wakame Omelette make with either seasonal fresh or dried wakame seaweed.
pred:
1. In a medium-sized frying pan, heat a small amount of oil over medium heat.
2. Crack the egg into the pan, and scramble it until it is cooked through.
3. Add the Chinese cabbage and sausages to the pan, stirring to combine.
4. In a small bowl, mix the mayonnaise and okonomiyaki sauce.
5. Pour the mayonnaise mixture over the cabbage and sausages in the pan, stirring to combine.
6. Optionally, add Bonito flakes and red pickled ginger to the pan, stirring to combine.
7. Cook the mixture until the cabbage is tender and the sauce has thickened slightly.
8. Serve the Okonomiyaki-style Chinese Cabbage Omelette hot, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.

This recipe combines the flavors of Chinese cabbage, sausages, and a creamy mayonnaise-based sauce, creating a delicious and unique Okonomiyaki-style dish. The addition of Bonito flakes and red pickled ginger adds a touch of authenticity to the dish, while the optional garnish of fresh herbs enhances the overall presentation.

gt:
Heat oil in deep-fryer to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (205 degrees C).
Cook wings in hot oil for 15 minutes, turning occasionally.
Drain on a paper towel-lined dish, then transfer to a shallow baking dish.
Broil in the preheated oven for 15 minutes, turning once.
Melt butter in a medium stock pot over medium heat.
Stir in hot sauce, garlic, jalapeno, Thai chile, habanero, yellow wax, and red chile peppers.
Reduce heat to medium low and cook for 15 minutes, or until peppers are softened.
Season to taste with salt and pepper, and pour over wings, turning to coat.
Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and continue baking for an additional 10 minutes.
Let cool for 5 minutes, and enjoy.
Be sure to have plenty of water handy!
pred:
[INST]To prepare the chicken wings, start by cutting the chicken wings into smaller pieces, making sure to remove the bones and any excess fat. In a large bowl, combine the chicken wings, vegetable oil, and butter. Mix well to ensure that the chicken wings are evenly coated with the marinade. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.

After marinating, preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil. Remove the chicken wings from the marinade and shake off any excess. Place the chicken wings on the prepared baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the skin is crispy.

While the chicken wings are baking, prepare the sauce. In a small saucepan, heat the hot sauce, garlic, jalapeno peppers, Thai chile peppers, habanero peppers, yellow wax peppers, and red chile peppers over medium heat. Cook for about 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sauce has thickened and the vegetables are tender. Season the sauce with salt and pepper to taste.

Once the chicken wings are cooked, remove them from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes. Then, use a slotted spoon to transfer the chicken wings to a serving platter. Pour the sauce over the chicken wings and serve immediately.

Enjoy your delicious and spicy Andy's Five Pepper Chicken Wings!

gt:
Melt butter in 10-inch skillet until sizzling; add onion, red pepper and garlic.
Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until onion is softened.
Stir in flour; continue cooking 1 minute.
Add broth and whipping cream.
Continue cooking, stirring with wire whisk, until mixture is thickened.
Stir in cheese, seasoning, yogurt, spinach and hot pepper sauce until spinach wilts and mixture is heated through.
Remove from heat.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve warm with crackers, bread slices or assorted vegetable sticks.
pred:
[INST]To create a mouthwatering Halloween Swamp Dip, follow these steps:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the butter, onion, and red bell pepper.
2. Cook the mixture over medium heat until the vegetables are tender and the onion is translucent.
3. Add the garlic and cook for an additional minute, stirring constantly.
4. Stir in the flour, and cook for 1-2 minutes, until the flour is slightly browned.
5. Gradually pour in the chicken broth, stirring constantly to avoid lumps.
6. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 5-7 minutes, or until the dip has thickened.
7. Stir in the heavy whipping cream, feta cheese, and Italian seasoning.
8. Allow the dip to cool slightly.
9. Stir in the plain yogurt, spinach leaves, and hot pepper sauce.
10. Season the dip with salt and pepper to taste.
11. Serve the Halloween Swamp Dip immediately, or refrigerate until ready to serve.

[/INST]

gt:
Add the slices of drained tofu into a cold pan with the olive oil.
Turn the pan to medium heat, and break up the tofu a bit with a spatula.
When the tofu starts to sizzle, sprinkle the cumin, chili powder, seasoned salt, and cayenne pepper over the tofu.
Continue to break it into little bits, stirring every few minutes, until the tofu is browned and crispy on all sides.
Meanwhile, combine the lime zest, goat cheese, half-and-half, and salt in a small food processor or blender.
Pulse to combine, adding a splash more of the half-and-half if needed to form a smooth sauce.
Assemble the tofu and any desired toppings in taco shells, then drizzle with the goat cheese cream.
Eat!
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the tofu and cook until it is golden brown on both sides and slightly crispy.
3. In a small bowl, mix the seasoned salt, cumin, chili powder, and cayenne pepper. Add the tofu to the skillet and toss it in the seasoned mixture. Cook for a few minutes until the tofu is coated evenly.
4. Add the lime zest to the skillet and stir to combine.
5. In a small bowl, mix the softened goat cheese, half and half, salt, and a pinch of flour.
6. Pour the goat cheese mixture over the tofu and stir to combine. Cook for a few minutes until the sauce is slightly thickened.
7. Serve the Crispy Tofu Tacos with Goat Cheese Lime Cream in corn tortillas, topped with shredded cabbage, lime wedges, cilantro, and any other desired taco toppings.

[/INST]

gt:
Spray pan with Cooking Spray (quick clean up with a non-stick pan).
Add 1 cup Salsa (adjust amount to your preference) and heat until it's hot and bubbly.
Stir and push mix into the center of the pan making a well for the egg.
Carefully drop 1 egg into the well of salsa - don't break the yolk.
Cover with a lid and cook over medium heat until the yolk is hardened to a soft consistency (no longer runny but not too hard either).
Sprinkle Egg with pepper and a dash of salt.
While still hot remove Egg and salsa from the pan and place on top of greens, adding more salsa if desired.
Sprinkle with shredded cheddar cheese and pour some Light Ranch Dressing on the greens around the outside edges of the salad.
Enjoy!
pred:
1. In a small bowl, whisk together the egg and cooking spray.
2. Heat a non-stick skillet or frying pan over medium heat.
3. Pour the egg mixture into the pan, ensuring it covers the entire surface. Cook until the edges start to set, then carefully flip the egg over. Cook for an additional 30 seconds or until the egg is fully cooked.
4. While the egg cooks, prepare the mixed leaf salad by combining the spinach, iceberg lettuce, and baby carrots in a large bowl.
5. In a small bowl, mix the salsa and light ranch salad dressing to your desired consistency.
6. Once the egg is fully cooked, carefully slide it onto the mixed leaf salad.
7. Drizzle the salsa and ranch dressing mixture over the egg and salad.
8. Serve immediately and enjoy your delicious Salsa Poached Egg on Mixed Leaf Salad dish.

[/INST]

gt:
Mix thousand island and lawrys lemon pepper marinade and marinade chicken for a while
Pre heat oven to 400
Mix egg and milk
Mix seasonings and Panko bread crumbs
Dunk chicken in egg mixture then in bread crumbs
Place on cookie sheet or pan and cook for 1 hour
pred:
To prepare a delicious Steve's chicken, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).

2. In a large bowl, combine the 4 large chicken breasts, eggs, milk, zesty thousand island dressing, and any desired spices or seasonings. Mix well to ensure the chicken is evenly coated with the marinade.

3. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or aluminum foil, and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.

4. In a separate bowl, mix the Italian seasoned Panko bread crumbs with any desired seasonings.

5. After marinating, remove the chicken from the bowl and shake off any excess marinade.

6. Dip each chicken breast into the bread crumb mixture, ensuring it is evenly coated.

7. Place the breaded chicken breasts on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.

8. Bake the chicken in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until it is cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).

9. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into bite-sized pieces and serving.

Enjoy your delicious Steve's chicken with the accompanying ingredients, including the marinade, bread crumbs, and any additional seasonings or spices you may have used.

gt:
Place beans in a medium pot, cover with cold water by about 2 inches, and bring to a boil over high heat.
Reduce heat to medium and simmer until beans are cooked through, about 55 to 60 minutes.
(Beans are done once they mash easily when pressed between your fingers.)
Drain beans through a fine mesh strainer and rinse out the pot.
Return the pot to the stove and add cooked beans, water, sugar, and salt and bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
Reduce heat to medium low and simmer until cooking liquid has thickened slightly, about 15 minutes.
Stir in mochi, heat through, and serve.
pred:
1. Rinse the dried adzuki beans thoroughly in a colander under running water.
2. In a medium saucepan, combine the rinsed adzuki beans, water, and granulated sugar. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally.
3. Reduce the heat to low, cover the saucepan, and simmer for about 45 minutes or until the beans are tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
4. Remove the saucepan from the heat, add the kosher salt, and stir to combine.
5. Allow the mixture to cool slightly before serving.
6. To serve, use a spoon to scoop the cooked beans and liquid into a bowl, and garnish with the cut Basic Savory Mochi slices.

By following these key steps, you can prepare a delicious Adzuki Bean Porridge (Zensai) Recipe.

gt:
Mix the sauce and mustard that's included in the natto pack with the natto.
Break the egg into a bowl and mix in the soy sauce and mayonnaise.
Heat oil in a frying pan and then gently pour in the egg.
Place the natto and cheese on top.
Roll it up and then it's done.
pred:
[INST]
1. In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, mayonnaise, soy sauce, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
2. In a separate bowl, mix the Natto and cheese until well combined.
3. Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat. Add a small amount of oil and pour in the egg mixture. Cook until the edges start to set, then carefully pour the Natto and cheese mixture over the egg mixture.
4. Cook until the cheese is melted and the omelet is cooked through.
5. Serve the Gooey Cheesy Natto Omelet hot, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
In a mixer bowl, cream the cream cheese until light and creamy.
Add the confectioners sugar, lemon peel, and lemon juice, cream together.
For about 3 minutes.
Scraping the bowl, adding Cool Whip.
Mix on high for 1-2 minutes more.
Pour cheese filling into piecrust and refrigerate 2 hours to firm.
In a small bowl, mix the cherry pie filling with the almond extract, mixing well.
Remove from the refrigerator and add prepared pie cherry pie filling over top, returning to refrigerator until served.
Yields: 8 servings.
Note: I usually add 1 teaspoons almond extract and 2 -3 tablespoons sifted confectioners sugar; depending on the brand of cherry pie filling I bought.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, beat the Philadelphia Cream Cheese until smooth.
3. Add the minced rind and juice of the lemon, and continue to mix until well combined.
4. Gradually add the confectioners' sugar, mixing until smooth.
5. Add the Cool Whip, and mix until well combined.
6. In a separate bowl, mix the comstock original country cherry pie filling and almond extract.
7. Carefully pour the pie filling mixture over the cream cheese mixture, and mix until well combined.
8. Pour the mixture into a greased 9-inch springform pan.
9. Bake the cheesecake in the preheated oven for about 45-50 minutes, or until the edges are set and the center is just slightly jiggly.
10. Remove the cheesecake from the oven and let it cool on a wire rack for about 15-20 minutes.
11. Carefully remove the cheesecake from the pan, and let it cool completely on a wire rack.
12. Once the cheesecake is completely cooled, refrigerate it for at least 4 hours or overnight.
13. To serve, cut the cheesecake into wedges and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat an oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Grease 12 muffin cups, or line with paper muffin liners.
Sift together the flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder, salt, and nutmeg.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the melted butter, egg, buttermilk, and vanilla.
Pour the buttermilk mixture into the dry ingredients and stir just until mixed (the batter will not be smooth).
Gently stir in fruit, if desired (see Cook's Note).
Scoop the batter into the prepared muffin tins; fill the cups almost to the top.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden and the tops spring back when lightly pressed, about 18 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). Line a 12-cup muffin tin with paper liners or lightly grease the muffin tin.

2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder, salt, and nutmeg. Whisk until well combined.

3. Add the melted butter, egg, and buttermilk to the dry ingredients. Mix until just combined.

4. Fold in the vanilla extract.

5. Divide the batter evenly among the prepared muffin cups.

6. Bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean. Allow the muffins to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

7. Enjoy your delicious Basic Buttermilk Muffins!

gt:
Working in batches, pulse the vegetables in a food processor until finely chopped.
Transfer to a large bowl and toss well.
Stir in the sugar.
In a small saucepan, combine the vinegar, oil, dry mustard, celery seeds and salt and bring to a boil.
Pour the dressing over the slaw and toss well.
Refrigerate overnight.
Just before serving, drain the slaw and stir in the parsley.
pred:
1. Wash and chop the cabbage, onion, carrots, and celery into bite-sized pieces.
2. In a large bowl, combine the chopped cabbage, onion, carrots, and celery.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the sugar, vinegar, peanut oil, dry mustard powder, celery seeds, kosher salt, and chopped parsley leaves.
4. Pour the dressing over the vegetables and toss to coat evenly.
5. Cover the bowl and refrigerate overnight.
6. The next day, the vegetables will have absorbed the flavors from the dressing, and the slaw will be ready to serve.

[/INST]

gt:
Toss lettuce with 1/4 cup dressing in large bowl.
Top with layers of all remaining ingredients except remaining dressing.
Drizzle with remaining dressing just before serving.
pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the romaine lettuce, 1/2 cup of the Caesar dressing, and the crumbled Parmesan cheese.
2. In a separate bowl, toss the cooked bacon with the remaining Caesar dressing.
3. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
4. Spread the croutons on a baking sheet and toast them in the preheated oven for about 5-7 minutes, or until golden brown.
5. In a small bowl, mix the remaining Caesar dressing with the fresh basil leaves.
6. Assemble the salad by layering the romaine lettuce mixture, croutons, and the basil-dressing mixture in a large salad bowl.
7. Serve the salad immediately, garnished with the crumbled bacon.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
preheat oven 400F
clean potatoes in cold water (russets and large reds work well)
cut potatoes in to french fries and rinse in cold water
dry potatoes on paper towels and pat them dry
place cut potatoes in large bowl and add all the ingredients in to the bowl on top of the potatoes.
cover with plastic wrap and then gentle toss the potatoes around in the bowl mixing the ingredients.
once well coated empty the coated potatoes on to a large baking sheet.
make sure the are all flat and not on top of each other.
place in the oven.
bake for 50 min flipping them half way.
after cooking let set for 5 min to cool.
enjoy
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 450°F (232°C).
2. Wash and peel the potatoes, then cut them into evenly sized fries.
3. In a large bowl, mix together the olive oil, seasoning salt, Parmesan cheese, garlic, and oregano.
4. Toss the potatoes in the olive oil mixture until they are evenly coated.
5. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
6. Spread the potatoes out on the prepared baking sheet, making sure they are not overcrowded.
7. Bake the fries in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are golden brown and crispy on the outside, and cooked through.
8. Remove the fries from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Seasoned baked French fries!

gt:
Directions
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a casserole dish with nonstick spray.
Heat the spinach in a microwave oven on high for 5 minutes and squeeze dry.
Drain the artichoke hearts
Combine all the ingredients except the jack cheese in a large bowl.
Stir well.
Scrape into the prepared casserole dish and sprinkle the jack cheese on top.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Serve with crackers, tortilla chips, bread, bagel chips,...almost anything.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the spinach, artichoke hearts, mayonnaise, sour cream, grated mozzarella cheese, grated Parmesan, and grated pepper jack cheese. Mix well.
3. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the dip is hot and bubbly.
4. Serve the Spinach-Artichoke Dip Recipe immediately with pita chips, tortilla chips, or your favorite dipping utensils.

Enjoy your delicious Spinach-Artichoke Dip Recipe!

gt:
Place all the ingredients in a medium saucepan.
Cover with cold water by 1 to 2 inches and bring to a simmer over medium-high heat; reduce heat to medium low and simmer gently until the chicken is completely cooked and no longer pink in the center, about 20 minutes.
Remove the chicken from the poaching liquid to a cutting board and let cool to room temperature.
Meanwhile, make the shallot-tarragon jam.
Heat the oil and butter in a large frying pan over medium heat until the butter is foaming.
Add the shallots, salt, and pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, until the shallots are softened and just beginning to brown, about 10 minutes.
Stir in 1/4 cup of the vinegar and the sugar and cook, stirring occasionally, until the shallots are completely soft and caramelized and the jam is thick and syrupy, about 20 to 25 minutes.
Remove the pan from heat and stir in remaining 2 tablespoons of vinegar.
Let the jam cool for 20 minutes, then stir in the chopped tarragon.
Slice the chicken into 1/4-inch thick pieces.
Evenly divide the shallot jam on 1 side of 4 slices of the bread.
Divide the chicken evenly among the sandwiches, placing it on top of the jam in an even layer.
Close each sandwich and serve.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
3. Heat the olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken breasts and cook until browned on both sides and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes per side. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
4. In the same skillet, add the sliced onions and cook until they are softened and translucent, about 5-7 minutes.
5. Add the bay leaves, peppercorns, and salt to the skillet. Cook for another 2-3 minutes until fragrant.
6. Add the shallots to the skillet and cook until they are softened and caramelized, about 5-7 minutes.
7. Add the white wine-tarragon vinegar and sugar to the skillet. Cook until the liquid has reduced and the sauce has thickened slightly, about 2-3 minutes.
8. Add the cooked chicken back to the skillet and toss to coat with the sauce. Cook for another 2-3 minutes until the chicken is heated through.
9. Remove the skillet from the heat and let the chicken and sauce rest for a few minutes.
10. Serve the chicken and shallot jam on pain au levain topped with fresh tarragon leaves.

[/INST]

gt:
Drain beans and place into a large bowl.
Cut tomatoes into strip, about 1/3 in thick.
Add to bowl with beans.
Add olives and green onion.
Fold together carefully.
In a small bowl, whisk together the vinegar and mustard; slowly whisk in the oil until an emulsified mixture is formed.
Add salt & pepper and mix well.
Pour dressing over vegetables.
Fold together until well blended.
Before serving, garnish with sliced egg and a sprig of parsley if used.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Drain the canned baked beans and rinse them with cold water.
3. In a large bowl, combine the drained beans, small tomatoes, sliced green olive, chopped green onion, red wine vinegar, prepared mustard, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
4. Mix well to combine all the ingredients.
5. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for about 30 minutes, or until the beans are tender and the mixture is heated through.
6. Remove the baked beans from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Add the hard-boiled egg slices to the baked beans mixture and stir gently to combine.
8. Optionally, add a sprig of fresh parsley for garnish.
9. Serve the Baked Bean Salad immediately, or refrigerate it for later use.

The Baked Bean Salad is a delicious and nutritious dish that can be enjoyed as a side dish or a main course. The combination of baked beans, small tomatoes, green olive, green onion, red wine vinegar, prepared mustard, olive oil, salt, and pepper creates a flavorful and satisfying dish that is perfect for a variety of occasions.

gt:
Mix graham crackers, 1/3 cup sugar, and butter in a bowl; press half the graham cracker mixture into the bottom of 9x13-inch baking dish.
Combine boiling water and lemon gelatin in another bowl.
Mix lemon juice and lemon zest in a measuring cup and add enough water to make 1 cup; stir lemon juice mixture and 1 cup sugar into gelatin mixture until sugar is dissolved.
Refrigerate and allow mixture to partially set, about 30 minutes.
Beat evaporated milk in a cold glass or metal bowl until medium peaks form.
Lift your beater or whisk straight up: the tip of the peak formed by the milk should curl over slightly.
Fold gelatin mixture into whipped milk until evenly mixed.
Pour gelatin mixture into prepared crust and sprinkle remaining graham cracker mixture on top.
Chill at least 3 hours before serving.
pred:
[INSTRUCTIONS]
1. Crush the graham crackers into a fine crumb using a rolling pin or a food processor.
2. In a medium saucepan, melt the butter over low heat.
3. Add the crushed graham crackers to the melted butter and stir to combine.
4. Add the melted butter and graham cracker mixture to the lemon-flavored gelatin mix, stirring until well combined.
5. Add the boiling water and stir until the gelatin is fully dissolved.
6. Allow the mixture to cool for a few minutes, then pour it over the lemon zest and juice in a large mixing bowl.
7. Stir the mixture until it is well combined and smooth.
8. If the mixture is too thick, add a little more water, a teaspoon at a time, until it reaches the desired consistency.
9. Pour the mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or until set.
10. Once set, cut the dessert into squares and serve.

[/INSTRUCTIONS]

gt:
Combine garlic, rosemary, salt and pepper in small bowl.
Mash with fork to form coarse paste.
Place lamb in shallow baking dish.
Spread half of garlic paste over each side.
Cover and refrigerate at least 2 hours or overnight.
Bring to room temperature before cooking.
Prepare barbecue (medium-high heat).
Grill lamb until brown and crusty on outside and thermometer inserted into thickest part registers 130 degrees F for medium-rare, turning occasionally, about 25 minutes.
Let stand 10 minutes.
Cut on diagonal into thin slices and serve.
Variation:.
Add 2/3 cup red wine, 1/4 cup red wine vinegar, and 3/4 cup olive oil to the marinade.
Refrigerate overnight.
pred:
1. Preheat your grill to medium-high heat.
2. In a large bowl, mix together the garlic, rosemary, salt, and pepper.
3. Season the lamb with the garlic-rosemary mixture, ensuring it is evenly distributed.
4. Butterfly the lamb by cutting it in half lengthwise and then opening it up like a book.
5. Place the lamb on the grill and cook for 10-15 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 120°F (59°C) for medium-rare.
6. Remove the lamb from the grill and let it rest for 10 minutes before slicing it into individual portions.
7. Serve the Grilled Leg of Lamb With Garlic and Rosemary immediately, allowing the flavors to meld together.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Place a rack in the center of the oven.
Line a muffin tin with paper liners.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking soda.
In another medium bowl, whisk together canola oil, buttermilk, egg and vanilla extract along with the lemon juice and zest.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients all at once.
Whisk together until just combined.
Stir in the poppy seeds.
Pour the batter into the prepared muffin tins and bake for about 15 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool on a rack, and if you like you can sprinkle with some confectioners sugar.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking soda, and poppy seeds.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the canola oil, buttermilk, eggs, and vanilla extract.
4. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until just combined.
5. Fold in the zested and juiced lemons.
6. Fill muffin cups with the batter, about 3/4 full.
7. Bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
8. Allow the muffins to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Lemon Poppy Seed Muffins!

gt:
make minute rice in med sause pan
cook chicken in pan with water until done
when chicken done cut in pieces
in small pan saute onions,garlic with butter till onions are opaque
layer the rice first the a can of soup and spread evenly .put on half the chicken
pour over the sauted onions ,garlic and spread evenly .
shake on spices only a few each
repeat rice ,soup and chicken and shake on more Montreal chicken spice
set oven at 350
cover casserole with aluminum foil ,with a sharp knife make slits in foil .bake for 45min.
eat and enjoy as we did
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the chicken until it is fully cooked through. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, add the diced onion and garlic. Cook until the onion is translucent.
4. Add the cream of celery and cook until it is heated through.
5. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked chicken, rice, and cream of celery mixture.
6. Add the butter, chicken spice, and tumeric spice to the mixture. Stir until well combined.
7. Pour the mixture into a greased casserole dish.
8. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the filling is hot and bubbly.
9. Serve the casserole hot.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Butter and flour an 18 cm cake tin.
Melt the chocolate with the butter in a glass bowl over a pan of simmering water.
Mix well, and allow to cool slightly.
Blend flour, sugar and salt well.
Add the cooled chocolate mixture to the flour, fully incorporating.
Whisk in the eggs and the yolk one at a time.
Beat for about a minute until thickened and smooth.
Bake for 40-45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted is moist with crumbs.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a 9x9 inch baking pan with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
2. In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
4. Stir in the vanilla extract.
5. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, salt, and baking powder.
6. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until just combined.
7. Pour the batter into the prepared baking pan.
8. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the brownies comes out with a few moist crumbs.
9. Allow the brownies to cool completely in the pan before cutting into squares and serving.

[/INST]

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Grease a 12
In a large bowl, mix butter and sugar with an electric mixer until light and fluffy, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the eggs, one at a time, blending well after each one.
Stir in the vanilla and flour just until mixed.
Spoon the batter into pan.
Bake in the preheated oven until the tops spring back when lightly pressed, 18 to 20 minutes.
Cool in the pan set over a wire rack.
When cool, add icing.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans.
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the softened butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the cake flour, baking powder, and salt.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture, alternating with the orange and lemon juices, and mix until just combined.
6. Fold in the coconut and whipped cream.
7. Divide the batter evenly between the prepared pans.
8. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. Allow the cakes to cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.
10. To assemble the cake, place one cake layer on a serving plate, and spread a layer of orange and lemon curd on top. Add the other cake layer on top, and spread a layer of whipped cream on top of that.
11. Garnish with grated orange and lemon peel, and serve.

[/INST]

This recipe for Orange and White Cake combines the sweetness of butter and sugar with the tangy flavors of orange and lemon juices, creating a delicious and visually appealing dessert. The cake layers are moist and fluffy, while the whipped cream adds a light and airy texture. The orange and lemon peel garnish adds a pop of color and a refreshing citrusy flavor to the dessert, making it a delightful treat for any occasion.

gt:
Saute onion, garlic, and pepper with salt.
Add chicken, pepper, oregano, and basil.
Cook till the chicken is done.
Add can of tomatos and simmer.
Melt butter with garlic in microwave.
Slice bread and brush with melted garlic butter.
Toast bread in a skillet till golden brown.
Place garlic toast on plate and spoon topping over it to taste.
Top with parmesian cheese and serve.
pred:
[INST]
To make delicious Italian nachos, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Cut the loaf of bread into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes.
3. In a small bowl, mix the minced garlic, butter, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
4. Spread the butter mixture evenly over the bread cubes.
5. In a large baking dish, combine the diced chicken, sweet onion, and bell peppers.
6. Drizzle the diced tomatoes over the chicken mixture.
7. Bake the bread mixture in the oven for 10-15 minutes, or until it is golden brown and crispy.
8. Remove the baking dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
9. Serve the Italian nachos immediately, and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Heat oven to 375 degrees F.
Coat chicken with cheese mixture as directed on package; place on baking sheet sprayed with cooking spray.
Bake 28 to 30 min.
or until chicken is done (165 degrees F).
Meanwhile, combine remaining ingredients.
Serve chicken with salsa.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the FRESH TAKE Smokey Mesquite BBQ Recipe Cheese Breadcrumb Mix with the chicken breasts until evenly coated.
3. In a large skillet, heat some oil over medium-high heat. Add the chicken breasts, seasoned with salt and pepper, and cook until browned on both sides and cooked through, about 4-5 minutes per side.
4. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
5. In the same skillet, add the avocado, cherry tomatoes, sliced red onions, and chopped fresh cilantro. Cook until the vegetables are tender, about 5-7 minutes.
6. Add the fresh lime juice and cook for another minute, until the flavors are well combined.
7. Return the chicken breasts to the skillet and toss them in the salsa mixture. Cook for another 2-3 minutes, until the chicken is heated through and the salsa is warmed through.
8. Serve the chicken breasts with the Lime-Avocado Salsa on the side.

Essential ingredients:
- 6 small boneless skinless chicken breasts (1-1/2 lb.)
- 1 pkg. (6 oz.) FRESH TAKE Smokey Mesquite BBQ Recipe Cheese Breadcrumb Mix
- 1 avocado, chopped
- 2 cups cherry tomatoes, quartered
- 1/2 cup sliced red onions
- 1 Tbsp. chopped fresh cilantro
- 2 Tbsp. fresh lime juice

[/INST]

gt:
Put the bananas in a bowl and mash with the back of a fork.
It's okay to leave a few lumps.
Add all of the dry ingredients to the bananas.
Mix in with a rubber spatula until even.
It should be floury and full of lumps.
Add the oil and form it into a dough (press it together without kneading!).
Preheat the oven to 200C.
The moistness of the dough will depend on the size of the bananas.
If the dough is too wet, mix in cake flour, 10 g at a time, until desired consistency.
Dust working surface with flour (not included in ingredients), spread dough out with your hands, fold into thirds, then repeat for 7 or 8 more times.
Spread until about 2.5 cm thick, then cut out the dough into your desired shapes.
I used a cup to cut a round shape.
Bake in the oven for 15 to 20 minutes at 200C, then they're done!
They should be fluffy and golden.
Please also see my sweet potato version..
They are crispy and moist, with a sweet potato taste.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 200°C (400°F).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 2 and 1/2 ripe bananas, 150 grams or more cake flour, 200 grams bread flour, 2 teaspoons baking powder, and 50 grams sugar.
3. Add 50 grams of olive oil (or vegetable oil) to the mixture, and mix well.
4. Knead the dough until it comes together and forms a smooth, elastic ball.
5. Transfer the dough to a lightly floured surface, and roll it out to a thickness of about 1/2 inch.
6. Cut the dough into desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a knife.
7. Place the scones on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake the scones in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until they are golden brown and cooked through.
9. Allow the scones to cool for a few minutes on the baking sheet, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious, butter-free banana scones!

gt:
Shake ingredients with ice and strain into three seperate shot glasses.
Savor the scent for a moment and shoot.
pred:
1. First, pour the chilled strawberry cream liqueur into a cocktail shaker.
2. Next, add the vodka to the shaker.
3. Shake the mixture well, ensuring that the ingredients are well combined.
4. Once the mixture is well-shaken, pour it into a chilled glass.
5. Top the drink with a splash of chilled strawberry schnapps.
6. Stir the mixture gently to combine the ingredients.
7. Serve the Strawberry Bomb cocktail immediately.

[/INST]
