gt:
Saute the mushrooms in the olive oil in a medium sized pan for 4-5 minutes.
Add the shallots and garlic and cook for an additional 2 minutes.
Add the chopped herbs.
Add the white wine and reduce until the liquid is evaporated.
Season with salt and fresh ground black pepper and set aside.
Butter one side of each slice of bread.
Place the butter side down on four slices of the bread in a large non-stick fry pan at medium-low heat.
Divide the mushrooms into four and place them evenly on the four slices of bread.
Top the mushrooms with the Brie and cover with the other slices of buttered bread.
Cook for 3-5 minutes or until golden brown; then turn and cook on the other side for an additional 3-5 minutes.
Cut and serve immediately.
pred:
1. Preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
2. In a small bowl, mix the minced garlic, shallot, and white wine. Set aside.
3. In a large bowl, combine the sliced mushrooms, olive oil, and chopped fresh herbs. Season with salt and pepper.
4. Spread the mushroom mixture evenly on the slices of sourdough bread.
5. Place the sliced brie cheese on top of the mushroom mixture.
6. Place the sandwiches on the grill or grill pan, and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side, or until the bread is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
7. Remove the sandwiches from the grill and let them rest for a few minutes.
8. Spread soft butter on the inside of the sandwiches.
9. Cut the sandwiches in half and serve immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Cook bacon and set aside.
Heat some butter in non-stick pan over medium heat and Grill turkey breast stack without separating until the meat is golden brown on both sides, remove& set aside.
butter bread lightly on one side of each slice, Place in pan butter-side down.
Place a slice of Swiss cheese on unbuttered side, put turkey on Swiss cheese, Sprinkle with salt (optional).
Place bacon strips on breast and Stack tomato on top of bacon, Top off with remaining sourdough slice, unbuttered side toward tomatoes.
When golden brown flip.
After 2 mintues remove and serve, sliced into 3 equal size pieces -- Ya !
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Lay the slices of deli turkey on a cutting board or plate.
3. Lay the slices of cooked bacon on top of the deli turkey.
4. Add the slices of Swiss cheese on top of the bacon.
5. Place the slices of roma tomatoes or beefsteak tomatoes on top of the cheese.
6. Top the tomatoes with the slices of sourdough bread.
7. Drizzle melted butter over the sandwich.
8. Place the sandwich in a baking dish or on a baking sheet.
9. Bake the sandwich in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Remove the sandwich from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before cutting it into halves or quarters.

The essential ingredients for The Super Bird are deli turkey, bacon, Swiss cheese, roma or beefsteak tomatoes, sourdough bread, and melted butter. These ingredients will create a delicious and satisfying sandwich that is perfect for lunch or a light dinner.

gt:
Heat oil in a 6-quart Dutch oven or large heavy pot over medium heat; saute onion until translucent, 5 to 10 minutes.
Add garlic and saute until softened and fragrant, about 5 minutes.
Add 1/4 cup water, coriander, paprika, ginger, turmeric, cayenne pepper, black pepper, and cinnamon to onion mixture; cook and stir until fragrant, 2 to 3 minutes.
Stir chickpeas, tomatoes in juice, remaining 1/2 cup water, and bay leaf into onion mixture; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer until flavors have blended, about 10 minutes.
Stir coconut milk into chickpea and tomato mixture; simmer for 2 to 3 more minutes.
Add more water if needed and season with salt.
pred:
1. Heat the vegetable oil in a large saucepan or wok over medium heat.
2. Add the minced garlic and sauté for about 1 minute, or until fragrant.
3. Add the onion and sauté until it is soft and translucent.
4. Add the water, ground coriander, paprika, ground ginger, turmeric, cayenne pepper, ground black pepper, ground cinnamon, and salt. Stir well to combine.
5. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for about 30 minutes, or until the chickpeas are tender and the sauce has thickened.
6. Add the drained and rinsed chickpeas, diced tomatoes in juice, and the large bay leaf to the saucepan. Stir well to combine.
7. Cover the saucepan and let it cook for an additional 15-20 minutes, or until the chickpeas are tender and the sauce has thickened.
8. Remove the bay leaf and serve the Chana Masala over rice or with your preferred side dish.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 450F Lightly butter a medium-size gratin dish.
In a small saucepan, simmer the cream over medium heat until it is reduced to 3/4 cup, about 10 minutes.
Trim the base of the sprouts, discard the tough outer leaves, and rinse well.
Place the sprouts in a medium-sized saucepan with salt and cold water to cover.
Bring to boil and continue boiling for one minute.
Drain and refresh under cold running water.
Saute the bacon in a small skillet until lightly browned, 2 to 3 minutes.
Drain on paper towels and coarsely chop.
Combine the sprouts and bacon in the buttered gratin dish and season with salt, pepper and nutmeg.
Pour the cream over the top and sprinkle with the cheese.
Bake until nicely browned and crispy on top, about 15 minutes.
Serve at once.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove the bacon from the pan, reserving the drippings.
3. In the same skillet, cook the Brussels sprouts in the bacon drippings until tender, about 5-7 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
4. In a large mixing bowl, combine the heavy cream, grated nutmeg, and a pinch of salt. Whisk until smooth.
5. Add the cooked Brussels sprouts to the cream mixture and stir to combine.
6. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish or individual ramekins.
7. Sprinkle the grated gruyere cheese over the top of the mixture.
8. Bake the gratin in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Serve the Gratin of Brussels Sprouts hot.

[/INST]

gt:
Cut jerky strips into bite-sized pieces ( 1/2- to 1-inch).
Put the pieces in a sandwich bag then add the dried fruit.
Carry to work or school as traditional South African snack.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Jerky & Dried Fruit Snack, follow these steps:

1. Gather the ingredients:
- 3.25 (3 5/8 ounce) packages beef jerky, any style
- 2 ounces dried apricots
- 2 ounces dried plums or 2 ounces prunes

2. Preheat your oven to 200°F (93°C).
3. In a small bowl, mix the beef jerky and dried fruit.
4. Spread the mixture out on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
5. Roast the mixture in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. Once the jerky and dried fruit are fully cooked, remove the baking sheet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Once cooled, transfer the mixture to a small bowl and serve as a delicious snack.

This Jerky & Dried Fruit Snack is a healthy and tasty treat that combines the protein and flavor of beef jerky with the natural sweetness and nutritional benefits of dried fruits. The combination of beef jerky and dried fruit creates a satisfying and unique snacking experience.

gt:
Puree dressing ingredients in blender.
Cook noodles according to package directions.
During last 2 to 3 minutes of cooking time, add snow peas.
Drain noodles and snow peas and rinse under cold water; drain well.
In large bowl toss noodles and snow peas with cabbage and sesame dressing.
Top with cucumber, scallions, ham, and peanuts.
pred:
1. Cook the pasta according to package instructions, then drain and rinse with cold water.
2. In a large bowl, combine the peanut butter, soy sauce, rice vinegar, and Asian sesame oil.
3. Add the cooked pasta, snow peas, Napa cabbage, cucumber, scallions, and ham to the bowl.
4. Stir to combine all the ingredients.
5. Add the dry roasted peanuts as a garnish.
6. Serve the Sesame Noodle Salad immediately.

[/SYS]

gt:
Grind the mustard seeds to a powder, I use a coffee grinder.
In a ceramic or glass bowl mix the mustard powder with the water and leave for half an hour.
Then add the flour with the cayenne (if using) mix well.
Add vinegar, whisky, honey, nutmeg, salt and mix until well blended.
Cover and leave overnight.
Next day: if it looks too dry add more honey, so far the times I made it it never looked too dry but sometimes too thin and I add another spoon of flour, the mustard will thicken a bit more the next weeks so keep that in mind.
Pour into sterilized jars and seal, allow to mature/mellow for 2 to 3 weeks in a cool dark place.
After opening keep in the fridge.
pred:
To craft a delicious Whiskey Mustard, follow these steps:

1. In a large bowl, combine the yellow and black mustard seeds, water, flour, cayenne (or chili powder), and salt. Mix well.
2. Gradually add the cider vinegar, stirring constantly to ensure the seeds are evenly coated.
3. Allow the mixture to sit for about 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
4. After the seeds have softened and the mixture has thickened slightly, slowly drizzle in the runny honey, stirring continuously.
5. Once the honey has been fully incorporated, the Whiskey Mustard is ready to use.

Feel free to adjust the seasoning to your taste, and enjoy your homemade Whiskey Mustard!

gt:
In a large skillet, melt 1 tablespoon butter over medium heat.
Add pecans; cook and stir until lightly browned, about 5 minutes.
Remove pecans from skillet.
Add remaining 2 tablespoons butter to the skillet, and melt.
Add zucchini, and saute until soft.
Toss with pecans and cheese.
Serve.
pred:
[/INST]

[INST]
1. Preheat a large skillet over medium heat.
2. Add the butter to the skillet and let it melt.
3. Add the chopped pecans and cook until they are fragrant and slightly toasted, stirring occasionally.
4. Add the sliced zucchini to the skillet and cook until they are tender but still crisp.
5. Season the zucchini with salt and pepper to taste.
6. Add the grated Parmesan cheese to the skillet and stir until the cheese is melted and the zucchini is coated with a light layer of cheese.
7. Serve the Zucchini and Pecan Saute immediately, garnished with additional chopped pecans if desired.

[/INST]

[/INST]

gt:
Combine the potatoes, spinach, carrots, turnips, garlic, and lentils in a slow cooker.
Pour enough water over the mixture to cover.
In a bowl, stir the fresh basil, chili powder, cinnamon, dried basil, paprika, turmeric, cayenne pepper, ground ginger, sea salt, and black pepper; stir into the slow cooker.
Cover the cooker, and cook on High for 8 hours.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large pot, combine the cubed yellow potatoes, frozen chopped spinach, and carrots. Add enough water to cover the ingredients.
3. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender.
4. Add the diced turnips and continue to cook for another 10-15 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
5. In a small bowl, whisk together the lentils, water, and Cindy's Magical Motorvatin' Spice Mix.
6. Pour the lentil mixture into the pot with the vegetables. Stir to combine.
7. Add the minced garlic, chili powder, cinnamon, basil, paprika, turmeric, cayenne pepper, ginger, and sea salt to taste. Stir to combine.
8. Cook the soup over medium heat for about 10-15 minutes, or until the flavors have melded together and the soup is heated through.
9. Serve the Cindy's Snappy Sensational Superfood Soup hot.

[/INST]

[/INST]

gt:
Cut potatoes in half, then each half in quarters -- should come out with eight pieces per potato (Just cutting so they cook faster.
Amount of pieces is not important).
Place potatoes in sauce pan or pot with just enough water to cover.
Bring to boil and simmer until potatoes are done (about 20-30 minutes).
Drain water.
Place potatoes in medium bowl and add remaining ingredients to your taste.
Mash the potatoes.
Beat in enough half-n-half to make potatoes light and fluffy.
Add maybe a tablespoon at a time so you don't add too much liquid.
Please note that if you taste it before the cream is added, it will taste salty.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Wash the potatoes thoroughly and peel them.
3. Cut the potatoes into evenly sized pieces.
4. Place the potatoes in a large pot and cover them with cold water.
5. Bring the pot to a boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer and cook the potatoes until they are tender, but not mushy. This should take about 20-25 minutes.
6. Drain the potatoes and return them to the pot.
7. Add the sea salt, fresh ground pepper, and garlic powder to the pot.
8. Mash the potatoes with a potato masher or a fork, breaking them down into smaller pieces.
9. Add the half-and-half cream to the pot and stir to combine.
10. Cook the mixture over medium heat, stirring constantly, until it reaches the desired consistency.
11. Serve the Mashed Potato immediately, or let it cool slightly before serving.

Please note that these are general steps, and the actual cooking process may vary depending on individual preferences and the specific oven.

gt:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
Heat oil in medium skillet on medium heat.
Add ham, peppers and onions; cook 5 to 7 min.
or until vegetables are crisp-tender.
Remove from heat.
Stir in salsa.
Beat eggs and sour cream with whisk until blended.
Arrange 6 tortilla halves on bottom of 13x9-inch baking dish sprayed with cooking spray.
Spread half the vegetable mixture over tortillas; cover with half of the egg mixture and 1/2 cup cheese.
Repeat all layers starting with tortillas.
Top with remaining tortillas.
Let stand 5 min.
Bake 25 min.
Top with remaining cheese; bake 5 min.
or until melted.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until softened, about 3 minutes.
3. Add the chopped green and red peppers, and cook until they are tender, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the cooked ham and red salsa, and cook for an additional 2 minutes.
5. In a large mixing bowl, beat the eggs and sour cream together.
6. Add the cooked vegetables and ham mixture to the egg and sour cream mixture, and stir to combine.
7. Spread the mixture evenly over the corn tortillas, dividing the cheese between the tortillas.
8. Place the tortilla halves in a baking dish, and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Serve immediately, and enjoy your delicious Cheesy Vegetable Tortilla Bake!

[/INST]

[INST]<<SYS>>
The essential ingredients for preparing Cheesy Vegetable Tortilla Bake include 1 Tbsp. oil, 1 pkg. (6 oz.) OSCAR MAYER Baked Cooked Ham, chopped, 1 each green and red pepper, chopped, 1 onion, chopped, 1/2 cup red salsa, 6 eggs, beaten, 3/4 cup BREAKSTONE'S or KNUDSEN Sour Cream, 9 corn tortillas (6 inch), cut in half, and 1 pkg. (8 oz.) KRAFT Mexican Style Finely Shredded Four Cheese, divided.
<</SYS>>

[/INST]

gt:
1.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
2.
In a large bowl, combine the egg, bread crumbs, cheese, milk, pepper and onion.
Add the sausage to the bread crumb mixture and mix well.
I found that when making meatballs or meatloaf, your hands are the best tools to mix the meat mixturethis way you avoid over mixing.
3.
Shape into your preferred size of meatballs using your hands or an ice cream scoop.
I used a 2-inch ice cream scoop and I got 16 regular-sized meatballs.
You could easily using a mini scoop to make mini meatballs.
4.
Arrange meatballs in a shallow baking pan.
Bake for 20 minutes or until the meatballs are cooked through (160 degrees F).
5.
Serve with your favorite sauce and spaghetti.
Tip: If you want to freeze the extra meatballls, follow the directions above.
Once the meatballs are cooked and cooled, place them on a pan evenly spaced apart (so they dont freeze together) and place in the freezer for a few hours until they are completely frozen.
Store the frozen meatballs in a bag or container, label the bag, and save for another time you want meatballs.
To reheat: Thaw out the meatballs and reheat by placing them in a 350 degrees F oven until heated through or simmer them in spaghetti sauce on the stove.
pred:
1. In a large bowl, beat the egg until it is well-beaten.
2. Add the Italian bread crumbs, grated Parmesan cheese, milk, pepper, and onion. Mix well to combine all the ingredients.
3. Add the ground sausage to the mixture and mix until the ingredients are well-coated.
4. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
5. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
6. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
7. Using a small ice cream scoop or your hands, scoop out the meatball mixture and shape it into balls. Place the meatballs on the prepared baking sheet.
8. Bake the meatballs for 12-15 minutes, or until they are cooked through and golden brown.
9. Remove the meatballs from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Italian Meatballs!

gt:
Meatloaves: Heat oven to 450 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with foil.
Heat oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat.
Add onions and chillies and cook 4 minutes; remove from heat.
In a bowl, blend meatloaf mix, chorizo, tortilla chips, cilantro, yogurt, egg, and salt.
Add onion mixture and lightly mix with a fork; split into 4 portions.
Press meatloaf mixture in four 4 1/2- by 2-inch or 5- by 2-inch miniature loaf pans.
Bake on prepared baking sheet for 15 minutes.
Glaze: Combine all ingredients.
After loaves have baked 10 minutes, spoon glaze over loaves.
Bake the remaining 5 minutes or until loaves are fully cooked (160 degrees F with an instant read thermometer).
Pop them out of the baking dishes to serve.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground meatloaf mix, sausage, baked tortilla chips, chopped cilantro, nonfat yogurt, egg, kosher salt, chili sauce, adobo sauce, agave nectar, ground cumin, ground cinnamon, and dry mustard powder.
3. Mix the ingredients together until well combined.
4. Form the mixture into meatloaf shapes and place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
5. Bake the meatloaves in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until they are cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 160°F (70°C).
6. Remove the meatloaves from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes before slicing them into individual servings.
7. Serve the Mexican-Glazed Meatloaves with a dollop of sour cream, if desired, and enjoy the delicious flavors of this Mexican-inspired dish.

gt:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
Prepare cake batter and bake as directed on package for 24 cupcakes, stirring apples and cinnamon into batter before spooning into prepared muffin cups.
Cool in pans 10 min.
Remove to wire racks; cool completely.
Meanwhile, cut butter into combined flour and granulated sugar until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Sprinkle onto rimmed baking sheet sprayed with cooking spray.
Bake 15 to 20 min.
or until lightly browned.
Cool completely.
Beat pudding mix, powdered sugar and milk in large bowl with whisk 2 min.
(Mixture will be thick.)
Stir in COOL WHIP; spoon into resealable plastic bag.
Cut piece off one bottom corner of bag; use to pipe pudding mixture onto cupcakes.
Top with streusel and blackberries.
pred:
[<INST>]1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 12-cup muffin tin with cooking spray or butter.

[/INST]

[<INST>]2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the yellow cake mix, ground cinnamon, and flour. Add the butter and mix until the batter is crumbly.

[/INST]

[<INST>]3. In a separate bowl, mix the JELL-O Vanilla Flavor Instant Pudding with cold milk. Stir until smooth.

[/INST]

[<INST>]4. Add the pudding mixture to the cake batter, and mix until just combined.

[/INST]

[<INST>]5. Fill the prepared muffin tin with the cake batter, dividing it evenly among the cups.

[/INST]

[<INST>]6. Place the muffin tin in the preheated oven and bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a cupcake comes out clean.

[/INST]

[<INST>]7. Remove the muffin tin from the oven and let the cupcakes cool in the pan for a few minutes. Then, transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

[<INST>]8. While the cupcakes are cooling, prepare the topping. In a small mixing bowl, combine the COOL WHIP and blackberries. Mix until smooth.

[/INST]

[<INST>]9. Once the cupcakes are completely cooled, use a spoon to drizzle the blackberry topping over the top of each cupcake.

[/INST]

[<INST>]10. Enjoy your delicious Apple Crumble Cupcakes!

[/INST]

gt:
In a medium skillet, bring 1/4 cup coconut milk to a boil.
Add the curry paste, whisk together and bloom for 30 seconds.
Add the rest of the coconut milk and bring to a boil.
Add the brown sugar and stir to combine.
Add the red bell pepper and asparagus to the skillet and cook until crisp tender, 6 minutes.
Spritz in some lime juice.
Add the shrimp and cook until opaque, 3 minutes.
Serve curry over rice and top with torn basil and more spritzed lime!
pred:
1. Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat. Add the diced red bell pepper and asparagus, and cook until they are tender but still crisp.
2. Add the red Thai curry paste and brown sugar to the skillet, stirring to combine. Cook for a few minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
3. Add the coconut milk, lime juice, and shrimp to the skillet. Cook until the shrimp are pink and cooked through.
4. Add the cooked jasmine or basmati rice to the skillet, stirring to combine. Cook for a few minutes, allowing the rice to heat through.
5. Stir in the fresh basil leaves, torn, and cook for an additional minute.
6. Serve the Thai Shrimp Curry over a bed of rice, garnished with additional fresh basil leaves, if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 375F degrees.
Combine flour, oats, baking powder and salt.
In separate bowl, beat white sugar and butter until blended.
Whisk in cinnamon applesauce, egg, and vanilla.
Add flour mixture to applesauce mixture and stir until well blended.
In small bowl, combine chunky applesauce, raisins, brown sugar, and cinnamon.
Spoon half of oat mixture into sprayed 8-inch baking pan; pour raisin filling over top, and spoon remaining oat mixture over filling, spreading evenly.
Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until lightly browned; cool on wire rack.
pred:
To cook a delightful Applesauce Oatmeal Snack Bars dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the unbleached flour, rolled oats, baking powder, and salt.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the softened butter, white sugar, vanilla, and cinnamon.
4. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until well combined.
5. Stir in the cinnamon applesauce, egg, and raisins.
6. Pour the batter into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
7. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the bars comes out clean.
8. Allow the bars to cool for a few minutes, then cut them into bars and serve.

The dish is a delicious and nutritious snack, perfect for breakfast or a mid-day pick-me-up. The combination of oats, applesauce, and raisins provides a balance of flavors and textures, while the cinnamon and vanilla add a warm, comforting touch.

gt:
Combine chicken, zucchini, mushrooms and garlic in a baking dish.
Sprinkle the cream cheese cubes over all, then pour the alfredo sauce over the top and gently stir to moisten.
Bake at 350 degrees for 1-1/2 hours.
Serve over hot, cooked noodles.
Note: If desired, this could be made in the crockpot and cooked on low for 8 hours.
pred:
To cook Unknownchef86's Garlic Chicken Alfredo with these ingredients, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cubed chicken, sliced zucchini, and mushrooms. Season with salt, pepper, and any other desired herbs or spices.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk the cream cheese until smooth.
4. In a saucepan, heat the alfredo sauce over medium heat until it reaches the desired consistency.
5. In a large skillet or oven-safe dish, heat some oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until it becomes fragrant and slightly browned.
6. Add the chicken mixture to the skillet and cook until the chicken is fully cooked through, about 10-12 minutes.
7. Add the cooked noodles to the skillet and stir to combine with the chicken and vegetables.
8. Pour the alfredo sauce over the chicken and noodles, stirring to coat everything evenly.
9. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 10-15 minutes, or until the sauce is bubbly and the chicken is cooked through.
10. Serve the Garlic Chicken Alfredo over hot cooked noodles and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Wash broccoli thoroughly, drain.
Cut into bite-size flowerets.
Combine mayonnaise, sugar and vinegar, stirring until well blended.
Combine broccoli, bacon bits, onion and raisins in large bowl.
Toss with mayonnaise dressing.
Chill for several hours or overnight.
Stir in cashews before serving.
Enjoy!
6 to 8 servings.
pred:
To cook a delicious Broccoli Cashew Salad dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the chopped broccoli, bacon bits, red onion, raisins, and cashew halves or pieces.
3. In a separate bowl, mix together the mayonnaise, sugar, and apple cider vinegar.
4. Pour the dressing over the broccoli mixture and toss to coat evenly.
5. Spread the mixture onto a baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the broccoli is tender and slightly browned.
6. Remove the dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

This Broccoli Cashew Salad dish is not only delicious but also nutritious, as it contains a variety of ingredients that provide essential vitamins, minerals, and healthy fats. The combination of broccoli, cashews, and bacon bits adds a unique flavor profile, while the raisins and red onion contribute to a balanced taste and texture. The dressing made with mayonnaise, sugar, and apple cider vinegar adds a tangy and slightly sweet touch to the dish, making it a delightful and satisfying meal.

gt:
Place the butter in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with a paddle attachment and mix until creamy.
(**I think this is where personal preference and maybe even altitude will effect the outcome of these crackers.
I started out with 1 stick of butter, then blended all the other ingredients together.
The "dough" was too crumbly and looked like a struesel topping that you would put on top of muffins or a coffee cake.
The one stick of butter is what Ina calls for in her recipe.
I think this is a typo.
I added another 1/2 stick of butter to the flour mixture, and then beat it with the paddle attachment on my mixer.
This is when the "dough" balled up and looked right.
So, I think this recipe needs between 1 stick and 1 1/2 sticks.
You might even get by with 1 1/4 sticks.
).
Add the Parmesan, flour, salt, thyme and pepper and combine.
Dump the dough on a lightly floured board and roll into a 13-inch long log.
Wrap the log in plastic wrap and place in the freezer for 30 minutes to harden.
Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Cut the log crosswise into 1/4 to 1/2-inch thick slices.
Place the slices on a sheet pan and bake for 22-25 minutes.
**Cook time does not include freezing the dough for between 15-30 minutes (mine were hard enough to easily cut at 15 minutes).
pred:
To prepare the Barefoot Contessa's Parmesan Black Pepper Crackers, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the 12 tablespoons of butter, 3 ounces of grated parmesan cheese, and 14 cups of all-purpose flour.
3. Add the kosher salt and chopped fresh thyme leaves, and mix until the ingredients are well combined.
4. Gradually add the 12 teaspoon of fresh ground black pepper, and mix until the dough comes together.
5. Turn the dough out onto a floured surface, and knead it until it is smooth and elastic, about 5-7 minutes.
6. Roll the dough out to a thickness of about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm), and use a cookie cutter or a round biscuit cutter to cut out the crackers.
7. Place the crackers on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake the crackers in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until they are golden brown.
9. Remove the crackers from the oven, and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Barefoot Contessa's Parmesan Black Pepper Crackers!

gt:
Place all of the ingredients into bread maker.
Put the yeast into the yeast compartment.
Start the bread dough course.
[If using toppings] Wash the rosemary and pat dry any moisture.
Tear apart the leaves and mix with olive oil.
Optionally cut the black olives in half or thirds and mix with olive oil.
When the dough is finished, remove from the machine and divide into 4 portions.
Deflate and shape into balls.
Cover with a wrung out damp cloth and let rest for 10-15 minutes.
Roll the dough out flat and let rise a second time at 35C for 30 minutes until it doubled in size.
Poke dents into the dough with your finger and coat the surface with olive oil.
Leave it like this if you're making plain bread.
Place black olives in the holes if you prefer.
Or sprinkle with Krazy Salt and top with rosemary.
Bake for 15 minutes at 200C.
When it becomes lightly browned and the edges become crunchy, it's done.
Based on your oven, adjust the baking time by keeping an eye on how fast it's browning.
pred:
1. Preheat the Bread Maker according to the manufacturer's instructions.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the strong flour, cake flour, salt, and olive oil.
3. Add the water and mix until the dough comes together.
4. Cover the bowl with a clean cloth and let the dough rise in a warm place for about 1-2 hours, or until it has doubled in size.
5. After the dough has risen, transfer it to the Bread Maker.
6. Add the dry yeast, rosemary, and black olives to the dough.
7. Set the Bread Maker to the "Dough" setting, and let it knead the dough for about 10-15 minutes.
8. After the dough has been kneaded, set the Bread Maker to the "Bake" setting, and let it bake for about 25-30 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and fully cooked.
9. Remove the bread from the Bread Maker and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Grease an 8 inch glass baking dish.
Sift the flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt into a large bowl.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the buttermilk, corn oil and egg.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients, and mix just until blended.
Pour into the prepared pan, and shake gently to level it out.
Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean and the top is golden brown.
Serve hot.
Just with butter will do, it is plenty sweet enough!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the buttermilk, corn oil, and egg.
4. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until just combined. Do not overmix, as this can lead to a tough texture.
5. Pour the batter into a greased 9x9 inch baking dish or a cast iron skillet.
6. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
7. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before cutting it into squares and serving.

[/INST]

This recipe for Great-Grandmother Steinbeck's Johnnycake is a delicious and simple way to enjoy a classic corn bread. The combination of cornmeal, flour, sugar, and baking powder creates a tender and slightly sweet crumbly texture, while the buttermilk and egg add moisture and richness. The baking soda and salt help to balance the flavors and provide a subtle tanginess. The result is a perfect accompaniment to a variety of dishes, from breakfast to dinner, and can be enjoyed as a standalone snack or dessert.

gt:
Toss as much chicken as you would like in a frying pan and fry for about 5 minutes.
It's Perdue ready to cook chicken strips.
It's basically already cooked so your sort of just warming it up.
Put the 5 pieces of Steak um Steaks in a large pan.
Large enough to hold all the ingredients in the end.
Break them up into shreds and cook until done.
Add the Cooked Chicken to the completed steaks.
Add your mushrooms
Add your heaping spoonfuls of Cheddar Cheese
Break up your 7 slices of American Cheese and add it in
Mix it all together melting the cheese
Add to your roll and enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat a small amount of oil over medium heat. Add the chicken strips and cook until they are browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes. Remove from the skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, add the mushrooms and cook until they are tender and slightly browned, about 5-7 minutes.
4. In a small bowl, mix the cheddar cheese, American cheese, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
5. Place the cooked chicken strips on a large baking sheet.
6. Spread the cheddar cheese mixture evenly over the chicken strips.
7. Place the cooked mushrooms on top of the chicken strips.
8. Roll out the foot long roll and place it on top of the mushrooms.
9. Bake the cheesesteak in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Serve the Super Cheesie Steak Chicken Cheesesteak With Mushrooms hot.

[/INST]

gt:
Cook pasta in large saucepan as directed on package, omitting salt; drain.
Bring broth to boil in same pan.
Whisk in cream cheese product; cook and stir on medium heat 4 min.
or until cream cheese is completely melted and sauce is slightly thickened, stirring frequently.
Stir in Parmesan.
Add pasta; stir until evenly coated with sauce.
Sprinkle with nuts and parsley.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Cook the fusilli pasta according to the package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
3. In a small saucepan, heat the chicken broth over medium heat until hot.
4. In a large bowl, combine the Philadelphia Herb & Garlic Cream Cheese Product, grated Parmesan cheese, and chopped toasted walnuts.
5. In a separate bowl, mix the chopped fresh parsley with the toasted walnuts.
6. Add the hot chicken broth to the cream cheese mixture, stirring until smooth.
7. Pour the creamy herb and garlic sauce over the cooked fusilli pasta.
8. Add the chopped parsley and toasted walnut mixture to the pasta and sauce, stirring to combine.
9. Transfer the pasta and sauce mixture to a baking dish.
10. Sprinkle the top with the remaining chopped toasted walnuts.
11. Bake the pasta and walnut mixture in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the sauce is bubbly and the pasta is heated through.
12. Serve the Creamy Herb and Garlic Fusilli with Toasted Walnuts immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Heat oven to 350F.
Grease 12-inch pizza pan.
Place dough on prepared pan, seam-side down.
Pinch ends of dough together to form 1 (10-inch) ring.
Cut 12 diagonal slashes (1/2-inch deep) on top of dough using serrated knife.
Brush with egg white.
Bake 26-30 minutes or until deep golden brown.
Remove to cooling rack.
Cool completely.
Combine all spread ingredients in bowl; mix well.
Cover; refrigerate.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the beaten egg, sour cream, mayonnaise, cilantro, canned chipotle chile peppers, adobo sauce, cumin, and Land O Lakes Butter. Mix well.
3. Spread the mixture evenly over the two packages of refrigerated French bread dough, making sure to cover both sides.
4. Place the bread dough sandwiches on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
5. Bake the sandwiches in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
6. Remove the sandwiches from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
7. Carefully slice the sandwiches in half, creating a round shape.
8. Serve the Sandwich-In-The-Round With Chipotle Spread immediately.

This delightful dish is a delicious combination of flavors and textures, with the crispy bread, melted cheese, and the spicy, smoky chipotle spread. The combination of ingredients creates a unique and satisfying dish that is perfect for a quick and easy meal or a special treat.

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F
Prepare (grease and flour) a 9 x 13 inch cake pan.
Blend cake mix and pineapple with juice until well mixed.
Add coconut and stir well.
Pour into cake pan and bake for about 45 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Note: my oven runs a tiny bit hot, and this recipe NEVER takes 45 minutes, so keep a close eye on it after about 30 minutes.
Allow to cool, cut into squares and top with whipped topping and toasted coconut for garnish.
Delicious!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Grease and flour a 9x13 inch baking dish.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the box of Angel Food Cake Mix, the can of crushed pineapple with its juice, and the 1/2 cups of sweetened shredded coconut.
4. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
5. Gradually add the milk, mixing until the batter is smooth and well combined.
6. Pour the batter into the prepared baking dish.
7. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
8. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. Once the cake is fully cooled, you can add a layer of whipped cream and a dusting of additional coconut if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Pineapple Coconut Cake!

gt:
Whisk together vinegar, olive oil, parsley, basil and garlic in small bowl.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Toss sauce with asparagus, mushrooms and onion in shallow baking dish.
Cover with plastic wrap and let stand at room temperature 30 minutes.
Coat grill or grill pan with oil or nonstick cooking spray.
Preheat to medium-high heat.
Place spinach in large serving bowl; set aside.
Drain asparagus mixture, reserving marinade.
Grill vegetables 6 to 8 minutes, turning occasionally, or until tender and lightly charred.
Transfer to cutting board.
Cool 2 minutes, and cut into bite-size pieces.
Add grilled vegetables to spinach.
Transfer reserved marinade to small saucepan, and bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
Remove from heat.
Pour over salad mixture.
Toss salad with hot marinade, using tongs.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Serve immediately.
pred:
1. Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the balsamic vinegar, olive oil, minced garlic, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
3. Add the asparagus, portobello mushrooms, and red onion to the bowl, tossing to coat the vegetables evenly with the dressing.
4. Grill the vegetables for about 5-7 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly charred.
5. While the vegetables are grilling, prepare the spinach by rinsing it and then squeezing out excess water.
6. Add the spinach to the bowl with the grilled vegetables, tossing to combine.
7. Serve the Grilled Vegetable Salad immediately, or refrigerate until ready to serve.

This Grilled Vegetable Salad dish is a delicious and healthy option, featuring a variety of vegetables that are grilled to perfection. The combination of flavors from the balsamic vinegar, olive oil, and garlic creates a delightful taste, while the grilled vegetables add a smoky, charred element to the dish. The spinach provides a refreshing, slightly bitter taste, and the portobello mushrooms and red onion add a touch of sweetness and crunch. This dish is perfect for a light meal or a side dish, and can be easily customized with additional vegetables or herbs to suit individual preferences.

gt:
Soften gelatin in 1/2 cup of heavy cream.
Meanwhile, combine the honey and 1/2 cup cream in a saucepan, bring to a boil and remove from heat.
Whisk in the cream/gelatin mixture, followed by the remaining cream.
Whisk the new cream mixture into the yogurt in a separate bowl.
Pour into 6 individual serving cups/molds; or into a large mold.
(I poured it into a large yogurt container.
).
Refrigerate at least 6 hours.
Dip a mold in warm water to loosen the panna cotta; or spoon into bowls, and serve with fresh fruit.
The fruit really balances out the rich sweetness of the panna cotta.
The cookbook also had the fruit drizzled with honey, I found that to be too sweet.
pred:
1. In a small saucepan, combine the gelatin and honey. Heat over low heat, stirring constantly, until the gelatin is completely dissolved.
2. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the yogurt, cream, and cooled gelatin mixture. Whisk until smooth and well combined.
4. Pour the mixture into a large, clean, heat-resistant container. Cover the container with plastic wrap or a lid and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
5. After refrigerating, the mixture will have set into a panna cotta. If desired, top the panna cotta with fresh fruit, such as sliced strawberries or raspberries.
6. Serve the panna cotta immediately or refrigerate for a few more hours before serving.

This recipe is a simple and delicious way to enjoy the flavors of yogurt and honey, while also incorporating the natural sweetness of the fruit. The gelatin adds a subtle, smooth texture to the panna cotta, making it a delightful dessert or snack.

gt:
Using a very sharp knife, dice ahi into 1/3 1/2 inch cubes.
Transfer to a large bowl and fold in shallots, scallions, arame, 1/4 teaspoon sea salt, soy sauce and sesame oil.
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Once chilled, stir the poke and taste.
Add additional sea salt and soy sauce as needed.
Sprinkle the fish with toasted sesame seeds and serve.
For poke bowls, divide the poke into 2 portions and serve on top of bowls of steamed rice.
Top bowls with additional items such as gari, avocado slices, tobiko, pickled cucumbers, and nori strips.
For an appetizer, serve the poke with tortilla chips or noriten chips.
Note: Marinated akame (sea kelp) can often be found in the refrigerated section of Japanese grocery stores but ogo (also known as ogoniri) can be a bit easier to find at Asian grocery stores (or online) as its often sold dried.
pred:
To prepare an Ahi Shoyu Poke dish, follow these steps:

1. Prepare the ingredients:
- Rinse the Ahi tuna under cold water and pat it dry with paper towels.
- Finely chop the shallots or Maui sweet onion and scallions.
- Mince the marinated arame or ogo using a sharp knife or food processor.
- Season the tuna with sea salt and set aside.

2. Prepare the sauce:
- In a small bowl, whisk together the low sodium soy sauce, sesame oil, and a pinch of salt.

3. Combine the ingredients:
- In a large bowl, combine the tuna, chopped shallots or onion, scallions, minced arame or ogo, and seasoned soy sauce mixture.
- Gently toss the ingredients to combine and ensure that the tuna is evenly coated with the sauce.

4. Serve and enjoy:
- Serve the Ahi Shoyu Poke dish over rice or noodles, garnished with toasted sesame seeds for added flavor and texture.

Note: If you cannot find marinated arame or ogo, you can use fresh arame or ogo, and marinate it in a mixture of soy sauce, sugar, and a pinch of salt for at least 30 minutes before using.

gt:
Preheat an oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
Place the butternut squash, carrots, sweet potato, rutabaga, parsnips, and turnips into a large mixing bowl.
Drizzle with olive oil, and toss to coat.
Season to taste with kosher salt and pepper, and place the vegetables into a deep roasting pan.
Roast in the preheated oven until the vegetables have lightly browned around the edges and are tender, about 45 minutes.
Stir once as the vegetables roast to ensure even cooking.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, toss the vegetables with the olive oil, salt, and pepper.
3. Spread the vegetables out on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
4. Roast the vegetables in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
5. Remove the vegetables from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
6. Serve the roasted root vegetables as a side dish or a main course, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Put the butter and the chocolate in ben - mari until its liquid.
Beat the eggs with the sugar and the vanilla by hand (not a eletrical mixer).
Add the flour and the chocolate mix.
Butter the bowls and add sugar at the edges.
Divide the mix and put in a preheated oven for 10-12 minutes at 320F.
pred:
[INT]
To make a delicious chocolate souffle, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 175°C (350°F).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the butter, sugar, and vanilla flavoring.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
4. Sift the flour and baking powder together, then add them to the mixture.
5. Gradually add the chocolate, mixing until well combined.
6. Pour the batter into a souffle dish, ensuring it is evenly distributed.
7. Bake the souffle in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until it is puffed and golden brown.
8. Remove the souffle from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

[/INT]

[/INST]

gt:
Arrange pepper halves in a 9 inch square glass baking dish.
Cover dish with plastic wrap.
Poke a few holes in the plastic wrap for vents, and heat 4 minutes in the microwave, or until tender.
In a medium bowl, mix tomatoes and their liquid, rice, and water.
Cover with plastic, and cook in the microwave for 4 minutes, or until rice is cooked.
Stir green onions, corn, kidney beans, and red pepper flakes into the tomato mixture.
Heat in the microwave for 3 minutes, or until heated through.
Spoon hot tomato mixture evenly into pepper halves, and cover with plastic wrap.
Poke a few holes in the plastic to vent steam, and heat in the microwave 4 minutes.
Remove plastic, sprinkle with mozzarella cheese and Parmesan cheese, and allow to stand 1 to 2 minutes before serving.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the rice, stewed tomatoes, hot water, and crushed red pepper flakes. Mix well.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the mozzarella and Parmesan cheeses.
4. Cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove the seeds and membranes.
5. Stuff each bell pepper with the rice mixture, leaving a little room for expansion.
6. Place the stuffed peppers in a baking dish and pour the mozzarella and Parmesan cheese mixture over the top.
7. Bake the stuffed peppers in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until the peppers are tender and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Remove the stuffed peppers from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes before serving.

This Quick and Easy Stuffed Peppers dish is a delicious and nutritious meal that can be prepared in under an hour. The combination of rice, stewed tomatoes, and cheese creates a flavorful and satisfying filling, while the bell peppers provide a crunchy texture and a pop of color. The use of quick-cooking brown rice and frozen corn kernels adds a touch of convenience and nutritional value to the dish.

gt:
Start by making a roux on low heat in a 3-qt saute pan, with vegetable oil and flour.
When this has browned (it will have a toasty smell to it), adjust heat to medium and slowly start adding water to desired thickness.
Remember to keep stirring as you add water in small circles, always going in the same directions so it does not form lumps (reduce heat if starts to boil).
Stir in garlic and seasoning and browning sauce then gently stir in chopped chilis.
Add salt to taste.
If you are going to add meat, gently stir in meat.
Let sit on a low temperature about 10 minutes.
You can serve this with tortillas.
pred:
1. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or saucepan over medium heat.
2. Add the flour and cook, stirring constantly, until it becomes a light golden brown color. This is called a roux.
3. Gradually pour in the water, stirring constantly to prevent lumps.
4. Add the crushed garlic and seasoning, stirring to combine.
5. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. Add the browning sauce, green chilies, salt, and cooked chicken or pork (if using). Stir to combine.
7. Simmer for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the chili has reached your desired level of spiciness and flavor.
8. Serve the Chili Verde hot, garnished with fresh cilantro, if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
In a blender, puree the salsa and reserve.
In a small heavy saucepan, bring the rice, saffron, water, and 1/2 teaspoon salt to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low and cover.
Cook the rice until the water is absorbed, about 20 minutes.
Fluff the rice with a fork and let stand 5 minutes.
In a large heavy skillet, heat the oil over medium high heat until hot, then stir in the on-ion, garlic, 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, until golden, about 6 minutes.
Stir in the chicken and cook until the chicken is cooked, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the rice until combined.
Season the filling with salt and pepper to taste.
Preheat the oven to 350F.
Divide the filling between the tortillas.
(Reserve the remaining filling for another use.)
Roll each tortilla into a cylinder and place, side-by-side in a baking dish.
Pour the salsa over the tortillas and sprinkle with the cheese.
Bake the enchiladas until the filling is hot and the cheese is melted, about 15 minutes.
Serve.
pred:
To prepare Chicken and Rice Enchiladas, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the extra-virgin olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the onion and garlic, and cook until the onion is softened, about 2-3 minutes.
3. Add the chicken chunks to the skillet, and cook until they are browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes. Season the chicken with salt and pepper.
4. Add the salsa, rice, saffron, and water to the skillet, and stir to combine. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for about 20-25 minutes, or until the rice is cooked through and the liquid has been absorbed.
5. While the rice cooks, prepare the tortillas by cutting them in half or rolling them into small cylinders.
6. To assemble the enchiladas, place a spoonful of the chicken and rice mixture in the center of a tortilla, roll it up, and place it seam-side down in a lightly greased baking dish. Repeat with the remaining tortillas and filling.
7. Pour any remaining chicken and rice mixture over the enchiladas, and sprinkle the shredded cheese evenly over the top.
8. Bake the enchiladas in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly, and the enchiladas are heated through.
9. Serve the Chicken and Rice Enchiladas hot, garnished with cilantro, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Chicken and Rice Enchiladas!

gt:
For beef into a patty.
Season with salt, pepper and the oregano on both sides.
Heat the oil in a cast iron pan and cook to desired doneness.
Combine all the ingredients for the tzatziki sauce in a bowl and mix.
When burger is cooked the way you like it, spread 1 tablespoon of the sauce on the bottom of a toasted roll.
Add the burger, tomato, spinach and remaining sauce.
Sprinkle on the feta cheese.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the ground beef, salt, pepper, oregano, and garlic. Form the mixture into four equal-sized patties.
3. Heat the canola oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the patties until they are browned on both sides and cooked through, about 4-5 minutes per side.
4. Place the cooked patties on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 160°F (71°C).
5. While the burgers are cooking, prepare the toasted bun by spreading a layer of mayonnaise on one side.
6. Once the burgers are cooked, remove them from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes.
7. Place the cooked burgers on the toasted bun, and top with the cooked tomato, spinach leaves, and divided Tzatziki Sauce.
8. Add the crumbled feta cheese and Greek yogurt, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Serve the Greek Burger with a side of crushed potato chips or a fresh salad.

[/INST]

The Greek Burger with Tzatziki Sauce is a delicious and satisfying meal that combines the flavors of Greek cuisine with the classic burger experience. The combination of ground beef, tomato, spinach, feta cheese, and Tzatziki Sauce creates a unique and satisfying dish that is both filling and flavorful.

gt:
Mix all together until well blended.
Pour into 2 greased and floured loaf pans.
Bake at 350 degrees for 30 to 45 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the self-rising flour, salt, and baking soda.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the mashed strawberries, eggs, sugar, and oil.
4. Gradually add the strawberry mixture to the flour mixture, stirring until well combined.
5. Fold in the chopped nuts.
6. Pour the batter into a greased and floured loaf pan.
7. Bake for 1 hour or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
8. Allow the bread to cool in the pan for 10 minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350F
Bring one large pot of water to a rolling boil.
Add whole box of shells and a pinch of salt to boiling water, cover and switch to low heat.
Spray oven safe dish with cooking spray.
Put milk, one bag of cheese,a few dashes of pepper, the butter and a pinch of salt in the dish; mix well.
When noodles are still firm, but partially cooked drain them and add them to the bowl of milk and other mixed ingredients.
Stir together coating noodles in cheese mixture.
Cook for 20 minutes.
Add second bag of cheese and stir.
Top with breadcrumbs and cook for 15 more minutes or until golden brown at the edges.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the breadcrumbs, milk, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
3. Add the shredded cheese to the bowl and stir until the cheese is evenly distributed.
4. In a separate bowl, combine the noodles and butter.
5. Pour the cheese mixture over the noodles and stir until the noodles are evenly coated.
6. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
7. Serve immediately and enjoy your delicious Italian Mac & Cheese!

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350F (180C).
Sift together the first five dry ingredients.
In a large mixer bowl, cream together the peanut butter and unsalted butter until fluffy.
At low speed, mix in the egg, pureed banana, SugarTwin Granulated Brown, SugarTwin Granulated White, and vanilla.
With the mixer at low speed, slowly add the sifted dry ingredients until fully mixed.
Shape dough into one-inch balls.
Place on ungreased cookie sheet 1 (2.5cm) apart.
Flatten cookies with the palm of your hand.
If desired, make a fruit topping by mixing preserves with SugarTwin Granulated White.
With your thumb, make an indent in the middle of each cookie and fill with 1/4 tsp (1.25mL) of the fruit topping.
Bake for 12 14 minutes or until bottoms are golden brown.
Remove cookies from cookie sheets to wire rack, and cool completely.
pred:
To make delicious Peanut Butter and Banana Cookies, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream together the all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda, cream of tartar, and salt.
3. Add the peanut butter, butter, egg, and mashed banana to the dry ingredients, and mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the diabetic brown sugar and diabetic Sugar Twin until well combined.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until a smooth dough forms.
6. Chill the dough in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes to help it set.
7. Using a cookie scoop, scoop the dough onto the prepared baking sheet, spacing the cookies about 2 inches apart.
8. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown around the edges and set in the center.
9. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

These Peanut Butter and Banana Cookies are a delicious and healthy treat, perfect for any occasion.

gt:
Heat oven to 450 degrees F.
Place pizza crust on baking sheet.
Arrange tomatoes over crust; brush with 1 Tbsp.
dressing.
Heat remaining dressing in large skillet on medium-high heat.
Add zucchini and yellow squash; cook and stir 4 to 5 min.
or until crisp-tender.
Arrange over tomatoes; top with cheeses.
Bake 10 to 12 min.
or until crust is golden brown and mozzarella is melted.
Sprinkle with basil.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 475°F (245°C).
2. Place the pizza crust on a baking sheet or pizza stone.
3. Spread a thin layer of KRAFT Tuscan House Italian Dressing on the crust.
4. Add a layer of sliced tomatoes and zucchini.
5. Sprinkle a generous amount of KRAFT Shredded Mozzarella Cheese on top of the vegetables.
6. Add a layer of sliced yellow squash on top of the cheese.
7. Sprinkle a little more KRAFT Shredded Mozzarella Cheese on top of the squash.
8. Add a sprinkle of chopped fresh basil on top of the cheese.
9. Bake the pizza in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Remove the pizza from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Cut squash in half lengthwise; remove seeds and hair-like fibers.
Divide butter between the halves and season very generously.
Wrap loosely in plastic wrap that has been pierced and place in microwave.
Microwave for 25 minutes.
Remove from oven, scoop out squash and place in bowl.
Add more butter, if you like, and serve.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Cut the spaghetti squash in half lengthwise and scoop out the seeds and pulp with a spoon. Place the squash halves cut-side down on a baking sheet.
3. Drizzle the squash with 2 tablespoons of melted butter. Season the squash with salt and pepper to taste.
4. Roast the squash in the preheated oven for 30-40 minutes, or until the squash is tender and the flesh can be easily pierced with a fork.
5. If desired, add more butter to the squash while it's cooking, or after it's cooked, to enhance the flavor.
6. Serve the cooked spaghetti squash as a side dish or main course, garnished with additional salt, pepper, and herbs, if desired.

This simple and delicious spaghetti squash dish is a healthy and nutritious option that can be enjoyed by people of all ages. The combination of the tender squash, buttery flavor, and seasonings creates a satisfying and comforting meal.

gt:
To make the sauce, coarsely chop the cilantro and the parsley leaves.
In a mortar and pestle, mash the garlic with a pinch of salt.
Place the cilantro and parsley in a food processor fitted with the steel blade and process until finely chopped.
Add the garlic, lemon juice, olive oil, about 1/2 teaspoon salt (or to taste), and the yogurt and process until the mixture is smooth and green.
Transfer to a bowl.
Preheat the oven to 300 degrees.
Line a sheet pan with foil and oil the foil.
Season the fish fillets with salt and pepper and lay on the foil.
Place a pan of just boiled water on the floor of your oven and place the baking sheet with the fish in the oven on the middle rack.
Bake 10 to 20 minutes, depending on the thickness of the fillets, until the fish is opaque on the surface and you can pull it apart with a fork.
Remove the fish from the oven, transfer to plates or a platter, and spoon on the sauce.
Garnish with lemon wedges and serve.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the yogurt, lemon juice, garlic, salt, and pepper. Set aside.
3. In a large skillet or oven-safe pan, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the cod fillets and cook until they are cooked through and flake easily with a fork. This should take about 5-7 minutes.
4. Remove the cod fillets from the skillet and place them on a plate.
5. In the same skillet, add the cilantro leaves and stems, and cook for about 2 minutes or until they are wilted.
6. Pour the yogurt sauce over the cooked cilantro and cod fillets.
7. Return the skillet to the oven and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes or until the sauce is bubbly and slightly thickened.
8. Serve the cod fillets with the cilantro and yogurt sauce over a bed of rice or your preferred side dish.
9. Garnish with lemon wedges for a pop of citrus flavor.

Enjoy your delicious Cod Fillets With Cilantro Yogurt Sauce!

gt:
Combine fruit and 1/2 tsp.
cinnamon in 8-inch square microwaveable dish.
Microwave on HIGH 3 min.
Stir in tapioca.
Microwave 4 min., stirring after 2 min.
Cool 5 min.
Meanwhile, mix cereal, coconut, nuts, sugar, nutmeg and remaining cinnamon until blended.
Spoon fruit mixture into 8 dessert dishes; top with cereal mixture.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the peach slices, raspberries, cinnamon, and brown sugar. Mix well.
3. In a separate bowl, combine the tapioca, whole grain cereal flakes, coconut, and chopped pecans.
4. Pour the melted butter over the peach and raspberry mixture, and stir to combine.
5. Add the tapioca mixture to the fruit mixture, stirring gently to combine.
6. Spread the mixture evenly into a greased 9x9 inch baking dish.
7. Sprinkle the top with the chopped pecans.
8. Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the crisp is golden brown and the fruit is bubbly.
9. Allow the crisp to cool for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
In a large bowl, combine the spinach, feta cheese, mozzarella cheese, processed cheese food, 1/2 the butter, vinegar, garlic powder, salt and pepper.
Mix well and set aside.
Place a layer of phyllo dough into the bottom of a lightly greased 2-quart casserole dish.
Spread the spinach and cheese mixture into the dish and top with 4 layers of phyllo dough, spraying each layer with butter-flavored cooking spray.
Drizzle the remaining butter over the top.
Bake at 425 degrees F (220 degrees C) for 20 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 2 packages of frozen chopped spinach, 8 ounces of crumbled feta cheese, 1 cup of shredded mozzarella cheese, 1 cup of cubed processed cheese food, and 1 cup of melted butter. Mix well to combine the ingredients.
3. Add 2 tablespoons of distilled white vinegar, 1/2 teaspoon of garlic powder, salt, and pepper to taste. Mix until well combined.
4. Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish with some melted butter.
5. Spread the spinach mixture evenly over the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
6. Roll out the phyllo dough to fit the top of the baking dish, making sure to leave a little overhang.
7. Brush the top of the phyllo dough with melted butter.
8. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the phyllo dough is golden brown and the filling is bubbly and hot.
9. Remove the casserole from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before cutting it into squares and serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350. lightly oil 9x13 pan and dust with cocoa powder
Melt oil, chocolate chips and cocoa together in sauce pan over medium heat
Remove from heat.
Stir in sugar, eggs, vanilla and Zucchini
Stir in dry ingredients then pour into prepared pan
Bake 40-45 min or until toothpick inserted in middle comes out clean
While brownies baking prepare glaze in sauce pan.
melt together butter, chocolate chips, milk and cocoa.
Remove from heat Whisk in vanilla and icing sugar
Pour glaze over baked brownies upon removal from oven.
Cool 10 min.
Serve warm
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the coconut oil, dark chocolate chips, cocoa powder, sugar, eggs, vanilla, and zucchini.
3. Add the baking soda and salt to the mixture, and mix well.
4. Gradually add the flour, butter, cocoa, and dark chocolate chips to the bowl, mixing until well combined.
5. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9x9 inch baking dish.
6. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the dish comes out clean.
7. Allow the dish to cool for a few minutes before cutting it into squares and serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Combine all ingredients except dressing in large bowl; toss to blend.
Add 1/2 cup dressing (or more); toss again to coat.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the mixed baby greens, hearts of palm, cherry tomatoes, and pickled beets.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the blue cheese, crumbled, and green onions.
4. In a small saucepan, heat the balsamic dressing over low heat until it reaches the desired consistency.
5. Pour the dressing over the salad mixture and toss to combine.
6. Transfer the salad to a serving dish and serve immediately.

This Swamp Cabbage Salad dish is a delicious and refreshing combination of flavors and textures. The mixed baby greens provide a crisp and fresh base, while the hearts of palm add a unique, slightly sweet and tender element. The cherry tomatoes bring a burst of vibrant color and a burst of tangy flavor. The pickled beets add a touch of acidity and a hint of sweetness. Finally, the blue cheese and green onions add a rich, creamy, and slightly tangy taste, while the balsamic dressing brings everything together, creating a well-balanced and satisfying dish.

gt:
To make the crust, add the flour, salt, baking powder and butter to the bowl of a food processor and pulse a few times until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Do not over-mix.
With the machine running, add the ice water through the feed tube until a dough ball forms.
Wrap in plastic and refrigerate for at least one hour.
Preheat the oven to 375 F.
When the dough has chilled, roll it out on a well-floured surface into about a 10 circle.
Drape over and fit it into a 9 tart pan (preferably one with a removable bottom) and move your rolling pin across the fluted top to cut off the excess dough.
Make the filling by combine the Gorgonzola and ricotta cheeses in a bowl and mix together, by hand or with a mixer, until mostly smooth.
Add the milk if needed and season with salt and pepper.
Spread the cheese mixture evenly into the tart shell and top with the tomatoes.
Sprinkle a little salt over the top and bake for 35 45 minutes or until the crust is a light golden brown.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, salt, baking powder, and 1/4 cup of ice water.
3. Add the butter to the mixture and use your hands to mix until the dough comes together.
4. If the dough is too dry, add a bit more ice water. If it is too sticky, add a bit more flour.
5. Press the dough into a disk and wrap it in plastic. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
6. In a small bowl, mix the gorgonzola cheese, ricotta cheese, milk, salt, and pepper.
7. Roll out the chilled dough on a floured surface to a thickness of about 1/4 inch.
8. Transfer the dough to a 9-inch (23 cm) tart pan with a removable bottom.
9. Press the dough into the bottom and up the sides of the tart pan.
10. Spread the gorgonzola cheese mixture evenly over the dough.
11. Arrange the sliced tomatoes on top of the cheese mixture.
12. Bake the tart in the preheated oven for 35-40 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbly.
13. Remove the tart from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
14. Use a spatula to transfer the tart to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Puree first 5 ingredients in blender.
Let mixture stand at least 15 minutes and up to 1 hour.
Strain mixture into small bowl, pressing on solids to release any liquid; discard solids.
Stir in sweet chili sauce.
(Can be made 1 day ahead.
Cover and refrigerate.)
Combine first 7 ingredients in large bowl.
Add tofu and dressing to bowl; toss to coat.
Arrange 1 or 2 lettuce leaves on each of 6 plates.
Divide tofu mixture among lettuce leaves and serve.
*Available in the Asian foods section of most supermarkets and at Asian markets.
pred:
1. Prepare the ingredients:
- Wash and peel the ginger and lemongrass, then slice them thinly.
- Cut the lemongrass stalks into 4-inch pieces with the tough leaves removed.
- Cut the lime in half and juice them.
- Rinse the tofu and pat it dry.
- Wash and chop the cucumber, green onions, plum tomato, jalapeno chile, cilantro, mint, and basil.

2. Prepare the sauce:
- In a small bowl, mix the fish sauce, water, and sweet chili sauce.

3. Prepare the tofu filling:
- In a small bowl, mix the sliced ginger, lemongrass, lime juice, fish sauce mixture, and water.

4. Assemble the dish:
- In a large bowl, combine the tofu, sliced ginger, lemongrass, and lime juice mixture.
- Fold the tofu mixture into the fish sauce mixture, then mix well.
- Add the chopped cucumber, green onions, plum tomato, jalapeno chile, cilantro, mint, and basil to the tofu mixture.
- Stir everything together until well combined.

5. Assemble the lettuce cups:
- Place a lettuce leaf on a plate or in a lettuce cup.
- Fill the lettuce cup with the tofu mixture.
- Garnish with additional cilantro and mint leaves, if desired.

6. Serve and enjoy:
- Serve the Spicy Lime and Herbed Tofu in Lettuce Cups immediately.

[/INST]

Please note that the recipe may vary depending on the specific ingredients and preferences of the user.

gt:
In food processor combine green pepper, onion, garlic, jalapeno, and cilantro.
Pulse until consistency you like add the rest of the ingredients.
Continue to pulse until tomatoes are pureed and all is well-mixed.
Try to keep your teenagers mitts off of this until dinner!
Its tough!
~Katie
pred:
To cook a delightful Unforgettable Salsa dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the chopped green pepper, onion, garlic, and jalapeno.
3. Add the canned tomatoes, tomato paste, Italian seasoning, salt, pepper, and sugar. Mix well.
4. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake for 30-40 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the mixture is slightly thickened.
5. Remove the dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
6. Serve the Unforgettable Salsa hot, as a side dish or as a topping for various dishes.

This delicious salsa recipe is a perfect blend of flavors and textures, making it a delightful addition to any meal.

gt:
Cream butter and sugar together; beat in egg, syrup, and vanilla.
Dissolve baking soda in water; add to butter mixture.
Mix in flour.
Shape dough into small 2" rolls.
Wrap and chill overnight (or longer).
Slice thinly and place on a parchment-paper lined cookie sheet.
Bake in a preheated 400* oven for about 5-6 minutes until VERY lightly golden.
Decorate with melted chocolate, if desired.
Enjoy!
pred:
[INST]
To prepare Gluten-Free Vanilla Wafers, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the softened butter and sugar together until light and fluffy.
3. Add the egg and light corn syrup, and mix well.
4. Stir in the vanilla extract and baking soda.
5. Gradually add the hot water, mixing until well combined.
6. In a separate bowl, mix the sweet rice flour and tapioca starch.
7. Gradually add the dry mixture to the wet mixture, mixing until a smooth dough forms.
8. If desired, melt the chocolate and stir it into the dough.
9. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a greased baking sheet or a silicone mat.
10. Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
11. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Essential ingredients:
12 cup butter, softened
34 cup sugar
1 egg
2 tablespoons light corn syrup
1 teaspoon vanilla
2 teaspoons baking soda
1 tablespoon hot water
1 12 cups sweet rice flour
34 cup tapioca starch
melted chocolate (optional)

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat a gas or charcoal grill or place a grill pan over medium-high heat.
Combine salt and pepper and sprinkle on both sides of each steak.
Drizzle each side of steaks with canola oil.
Grill for 4 to 6 minutes on each side for medium-rare.
Let the steaks rest a few minutes before slicing and serving.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. Season the steaks with salt and pepper, ensuring that they are evenly coated.
3. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Once hot, add the steaks to the skillet and sear for 2-3 minutes on each side to create a nice crust.
4. Remove the steaks from the skillet and place them on a baking tray.
5. Place the baking tray in the preheated oven and cook for 6-8 minutes or until the internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare.
6. Remove the steaks from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

Enjoy your delicious Porterhouse Steaks!

gt:
Wash malagkit very well.
Drain.
Cook with coconut milk, salt, and sugar in a wok, stirring constantly.
When mixture is almost dry, stir to prevent it from sticking to the bottom of the wok.
Reduce the heat, and cover the mixture with banana leaves for a few minutes.
Wrap 2 tablespoon of the cooked malagkit in wilted banana leaves.
Tie in pairs, and steam for about 30 minutes in a big pot.
Serve with hot chocolate or ripe mangoes.
pred:
1. First, gather the necessary ingredients: 3 cups of glutinous rice, 5 cups of coconut milk, first extract, 12 cups of sugar, and 1 teaspoon of salt.
2. Rinse the rice thoroughly and soak it in water for about 15-20 minutes.
3. In a large pot, combine the coconut milk, first extract, and sugar. Stir well to ensure the sugar is fully dissolved.
4. Add the soaked rice to the pot, stirring gently to combine all the ingredients. Cook the rice on medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the rice is cooked through and the liquid has been absorbed.
5. Remove the pot from the heat and let the rice cool for a few minutes.
6. Once the rice has cooled, add the salt and mix well.
7. Transfer the rice mixture to a banana leaf, which will be used as a wrapping for the dish.
8. Fold the banana leaf over the rice mixture, creating a tight seal.
9. Place the wrapped rice mixture in a steamer or a large pot with a steamer insert, and steam for about 15-20 minutes, or until the rice is cooked through and the filling is hot and bubbly.
10. Carefully remove the banana leaf and serve the Budbud Pilit dish immediately.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Line a 13x9 inch baking pan with foil and grease foil.
Set aside.
Drain apricot halves, reserving juice in a 2-cup glass measuring cup.
Add enough apricot nectar to the reserved juice to equal the amount of water called for on the boxed mix (probably around 1 1/4 cups - if you don't have enough, add water to make up the difference).
Set liquid aside.
Cut apricot halves into 1/2-inch-thick slices; set aside.
Sprinkle brown sugar evenly over bottom of the prepared baking pan.
Sprinkle almonds over brown sugar.
Arrange apricot slices on top of almonds; set aside.
Prepare cake mix according to package directions, using the eggs and oil as instructed on the box, except add 1/2 cup oats into dry cake mix and substitute apricot juice mixture for the water called for in directions.
Pour batter evenly over apricot slices and almonds in pan, being careful not to disturb apricots and almonds.
Bake for 30 to 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool in pan on a wire rack for 20 minutes.
Carefully invert onto a large serving platter; remove foil.
Drizzle warm cake with caramel ice cream topping.
If desired, top each serving with sweetened whipped cream or ice cream.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 9-inch (23 cm) round cake pan.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the canned apricot halves, apricot nectar, and brown sugar. Mix well.
3. Add the eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
4. In a separate bowl, combine the sliced almonds, toasted, and spice cake mix.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, alternating with the vegetable oil, mixing until just combined.
6. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan.
7. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
8. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. In a small saucepan, heat the caramel ice cream topping over low heat, stirring constantly, until smooth and melted.
10. Drizzle the melted caramel topping over the cooled cake.
11. Cut the cake into wedges and serve.

[/INST]

This recipe for Upside-Down Apricot Caramel Crunch Cake combines the sweetness of apricot nectar or peach nectar with the tanginess of the canned apricot halves, creating a delightful balance of flavors. The toasted almonds add a crunchy texture, while the spice cake mix provides a delicious base. The caramel ice cream topping adds a rich, creamy touch, and the drizzled caramel sauce complements the cake perfectly. This cake is perfect for sharing with friends and family, and it's sure to be a hit at any gathering.

gt:
Wipe meat and place in a deep dish.
Combine remaining ingredients and pour over meat.
Turn to coat both sides.
Cover and refrigerate for 1 to 3 days.
Remove meat from frig 1 hour before cooking.
Drain off marinade and wipe meat with paper towel to remove excess marinade.
Broil or barbecue.
pred:
To create a delicious Texas Steak Marinade, follow these steps:

1. In a large bowl, combine the beef, salad oil, soy sauce, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, prepared mustard, black pepper, and minced garlic. Mix well to ensure all ingredients are evenly distributed.

2. Cover the bowl and refrigerate the marinade mixture for at least 2 hours or overnight. This allows the flavors to meld together and the marinade to penetrate the beef.

3. Preheat your grill or grill pan to high heat.

4. Remove the beef from the marinade, pat it dry with paper towels, and season it with salt and pepper to taste.

5. Grill the beef steaks for 4-6 minutes per side, or until they reach your desired level of doneness.

6. Remove the steaks from the grill and let them rest for a few minutes before slicing them into thin pieces.

7. Serve the Texas Steak Marinade with the sliced beef on top of a bed of lettuce, or use it as a base for a variety of dishes, such as a sandwich or a salad.

Enjoy your delicious Texas Steak Marinade!

gt:
Place tomatoes and beans in a food processor, process until about half of the beans are smooth.
Set aside.
Heat oil in a Dutch oven coated with cooking spray over medium-high heat.
Add onion to pan, saute 5 minutes or until lightly browned.
Add cumin and garlic; saute 1 minute.
Add bean mixture, broth, and next 3 ingredients (through pumpkin); bring to a boil.
Ladle about 1 cup of soup into each of 6 bowls; sprinkle each serving with about 2 tablespoons queso fresco and about 1 tablespoon green onions.
Garnish with pumpkin seed kernels, if desired.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
