2. In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the minced garlic and cook for another minute.
4. Add the chicken broth, sherry wine vinegar, and black pepper. Stir to combine.
5. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 15 minutes, or until the onions are tender.
6. Add the drained and rinsed black beans, pumpkin, and dry sherry. Stir to combine.
7. Cover the pot and cook for about 20-25 minutes, or until the pumpkin is tender and the soup has thickened.
8. Remove the pot from the heat and let it sit for a few minutes.
9. Stir in the crumbled queso fresco and green onions.
10. Serve the Pumpkin-Black Bean Soup hot.

[/INST]

gt:
Put everything except the bacon in a sealable plastic bag.
Seal the bag, shake to distribute the seasonings and refrigerate for 8 to 24 hours.
Thirty minutes before dinner, preheat the oven to 450 degrees.
Quickly rinse the spices off the rabbit with cold water.
Blot the pieces completely dry with paper towels, then blot the bacon dry.
Wrap each rabbit piece in a slice of bacon and place them seam-side down on a rimmed baking sheet or in a shallow roasting pan or a large ovenproof skillet.
(The flat pieces below the rabbits ribs, known as the flap, can be rolled up and then wrapped.)
Roast until the bacon crisps and the rabbit is no longer pink, 25 to 30 minutes.
It is impossible to imagine this as anything other than finger food (maybe with some roasted potatoes).
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix together the sherry vinegar, kosher salt, freshly ground black pepper, fennel seeds, coriander seeds, bay leaves, and thyme.
3. Add the rabbit pieces to the bowl and toss them in the marinade until they are evenly coated. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
4. Remove the rabbit from the marinade and pat it dry with paper towels.
5. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the sliced bacon and cook until it is crispy, about 5 minutes. Remove the bacon from the skillet and set aside.
6. In the same skillet, heat a small amount of oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until it is fragrant, about 1 minute.
7. Add the marinated rabbit pieces to the skillet and cook until they are browned on all sides, about 5 minutes.
8. Transfer the rabbit to a baking dish and wrap each piece with a piece of bacon.
9. Place the baking dish in the preheated oven and bake for about 25-30 minutes, or until the bacon is crispy and the rabbit is cooked through.
10. Remove the baking dish from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

Please provide the step-by-step instructions for cooking a delicious Roasted Bacon-Wrapped Rabbit from scratch using the following ingredients: 1 (2 1/2-to-3 pound) rabbit, cut into 8 to 10 pieces (see note),1/2 cup sherry vinegar,1 tablespoon kosher salt,1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper,1 teaspoon fennel seeds, crushed,1 teaspoon coriander seeds, crushed,2 bay leaves, broken into flakes,4 branches fresh thyme,4 to 6 cloves gar

gt:
For the chocolate cake: Preheat oven to 350 F. Line two 12-count cupcake pans with paper liners and set aside.
Prepare the cake mix according to the directions on the back of the box.
Fill cupcake liners 3/4 full and bake at 350 F for 18 minutes or until top springs back.
Remove from the oven and let them cool completely.
Using a melon scoop or cupcake corer, cut the top center out of the cupcakes.
Fill with cheesecake filling and top with raspberry butter cream (instructions below).
Drizzle with melted chocolate.
Keep refrigerated.
Top with M&Ms right before serving.
Recipe makes 24.
For the cheesecake filling: In a mixing bowl, beat the cream cheese and sour cream on low until creamy.
Add the milk and pudding mix and beat until mixed.
Fold in the Cool Whip.
For the raspberry buttercream In a mixing bowl, cream the butter and shortening.
Add the smashed raspberries and salt and beat again.
Slowly add the powdered sugar until all is incorporated.
Beat the frosting until fluffy.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Prepare the cake mix according to the instructions on the box.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the softened cream cheese, sour cream, milk, and dry cheesecake pudding mix. Mix until smooth.
4. Add the Cool Whip and mix until well combined.
5. In a separate bowl, mix the softened butter and shortening.
6. Add the butter mixture to the cream cheese mixture and mix until well combined.
7. Add the crushed raspberries and their juice, salt, and powdered sugar. Mix until well combined.
8. Fill the cupcake liners with the batter, about 3/4 full.
9. Bake the cupcakes for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
10. Allow the cupcakes to cool completely before frosting.
11. Frost the cupcakes with the chocolate frosting.
12. Crush the chocolate chips and sprinkle them on top of the frosting.
13. Add the raspberries on top of the chocolate chips.
14. Serve the Raspberry Cheesecake Chocolate Cupcakes immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Parboil the asparagus or wrap in plastic wrap and microwave for about 20 to 30 seconds.
Cut the asparagus in half and stuff into the chikuwa.
Even if the asparagus is thick, force it through.
Once the chikuwa are stuffed, slice into bite-sized pieces.
(I first slice them in half, then diagonally in half again.)
Heat a pan, then add mayonnaise (I use a 5 cm dab).
When the mayonnaise starts to dissolve, add the chikuwa and saute.
When the chikuwa turns a nice golden brown, remove from the heat, season with pepper and soy sauce, and it's ready to serve.
If the asparagus is still tough, microwave for about 30 seconds.
pred:
To cook a delightful Asparagus-Stuffed Chikuwa Fish Paste Sticks dish, follow these steps:

1. Prepare the ingredients:
- Wash the asparagus and remove the tough ends.
- Cut the asparagus into bite-sized pieces.
- Cut the Chikuwa into bite-sized pieces.
- Open the mayonnaise and black pepper, and set aside.
- Soak the Chikuwa in water for about 10 minutes to remove excess salt.

2. Prepare the dish:
- Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
- Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.

3. Assemble the dish:
- Stuff each piece of Chikuwa with a small amount of asparagus.
- Dip the stuffed Chikuwa in the soaked Chikuwa, ensuring it is evenly coated.
- Place the stuffed Chikuwa on the prepared baking sheet.

4. Bake the dish:
- Bake the stuffed Chikuwa in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until the Chikuwa is golden brown and the asparagus is cooked through.

5. Serve the dish:
- Remove the baked Chikuwa from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
- Slice the cooked Chikuwa into bite-sized pieces.
- Serve the Asparagus-Stuffed Chikuwa Fish Paste Sticks with a dollop of mayonnaise and a sprinkle of black pepper. Enjoy your delicious Asparagus-Stuffed Chikuwa Fish Paste Sticks dish!

gt:
Cook pasta as directed on package.
While the pasta is cooking, heat dressing in large skillet on medium heat.
Add garlic, chicken and vegetables; cook 10 to 12 minutes or until chicken is cooked through, stirring frequently.
Add broth and cream cheese; cook 1 minutes or until cheese is melted, stirring constantly.
Add Parmesan cheese; mix well.
Drain the pasta and return to pot.
Add chicken and vegetable mixture; toss lightly.
Cook 1 minute or until heated through.
Sauce will thicken after standing.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook for about 1 minute, stirring occasionally.
3. Add the chicken chunks to the skillet and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
4. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
5. In the same skillet, add the zucchini and cook until tender, about 5-7 minutes.
6. Add the asparagus to the skillet and cook until tender, about 3-5 minutes.
7. Add the cooked chicken back to the skillet and stir to combine.
8. Pour the reduced-sodium fat-free chicken broth over the chicken and vegetables, and bring to a simmer.
9. Reduce the heat to low and let the mixture simmer for about 10-15 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
10. In a small bowl, combine the cubed cream cheese and grated parmesan cheese.
11. Add the cream cheese mixture to the skillet and stir to combine. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth and creamy.
12. Season the pasta with salt and pepper to taste.
13. Drain the cooked pasta and add it to the skillet with the chicken and vegetables. Stir to combine.
14. Serve the Skinny Bride's Guide to Creamy Pasta Primavera immediately, garnished with fresh parsley if desired.

This cooking procedure provides a delicious and satisfying meal that incorporates a variety of ingredients, including penne pasta, light Italian dressing, chicken, zucchini, asparagus, red pepper, reduced-fat cream cheese, and grated parmesan cheese. The dish is not only flavorful but also nutritious, as it includes lean protein from the chicken and vegetables that provide essential vitamins and min

gt:
Rub the eggplant with a little vegetable oil.
Roast the vegetables over open flame (either on a grill or directly on a gas stovetop) until the skins are charred and the vegetables are cooked.
Let cool and peel the vegetables.
Discard any extra liquid released.
Trim the stems off the eggplant.
Chop the eggplant into pieces and put in a bowl.
Add the tomatoes and mash with a fork until there are no more chunks.
Take the peeled garlic, mash it with a fork, and add it to the mixture along with the slices of onion.
Season with salt and some fresh hot pepper, to taste.
Right before serving, heat up 3-4 tablespoons of extra virgin olive oil with 2-3 smashed cloves of garlic.
When garlic starts sizzling, take off heat and pour over the eggplant mixture.
Give it one more stir, and serve with roti or naan.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Cut the eggplant into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes and place them on a baking sheet. Drizzle them with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Roast the eggplant in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
3. While the eggplant is roasting, chop the plum tomatoes into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes.
4. In a large skillet or pan, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the sliced onion and cook until it is softened and translucent.
5. Add the minced garlic to the skillet and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant.
6. Add the roasted eggplant to the skillet and stir to combine.
7. Add the chopped plum tomatoes to the skillet and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the flavors have melded together.
8. Season the choka with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Serve the Baigan Choka hot, garnished with fresh cilantro or parsley, if desired.

This cooking procedure involves roasting the eggplant, chopping the plum tomatoes, and then combining them with the sliced onion, minced garlic, and vegetable oil in a large skillet. The dish is seasoned with salt and pepper, and served hot with fresh herbs as a garnish.

gt:
Preheat the oven to 350.
Butter and lightly flour a 9-by-13-inch baking dish.
In the top of a double boiler, melt the butter with the chocolate; let cool.
Meanwhile, in a large bowl, beat the eggs with the granulated sugar and brown sugar until thickened; beat in the vanilla.
Using a rubber spatula, gently fold in the chocolate mixture until combined.
Sift the flour over the batter and fold it in.
Fold in the pecans.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for about 25 minutes, or until a tester inserted in the center comes out with moist crumbs attached.
Let the brownies cool in the pan for 1 hour before cutting into squares.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
4. Stir in the chopped chocolate and vanilla extract.
5. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
6. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, stirring until just combined.
7. Fold in the chopped pecans.
8. Pour the batter into a greased 9x9 inch baking dish.
9. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
10. Allow the brownies to cool in the pan for about 10 minutes before cutting into squares and serving.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Chocolate Brown-Sugar Brownies!

gt:
Preheat oven to 375.
Cream together the first four ingredients.
Add the next five DO NOT ADD THE CHOCOLATE CHIPS!
and mix .
Spray a 13 by 9 pan.
Push mixture into the bottom of the pan and pour the chocolate-chips over it entirely.
Place the pan into the oven for five minutes, then take the bars out and the chips should be soft.
Swirl the chips into the dough so you cannot tell they were ever chips.
Place the pan back into the oven for seven minutes.
pred:
To create delicious and amazing chocolate-chip cookie bars, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the shortening and both sugars until smooth.
3. Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
4. Stir in the vanilla extract and water.
5. Gradually add the flour, baking soda, and salt, mixing until just combined.
6. Fold in the chocolate chips.
7. Pour the batter into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
8. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
9. Allow the bars to cool completely before cutting into squares and serving.

Enjoy your delicious homemade chocolate-chip cookie bars!

gt:
Add pasta, 1 tspn.
parsley flakes, dried onion (vary amount depending on how much you like onions), sea salt and pepper to a pot of water large enough to cook and stir all ingredients.
Bring to a boil and then cook 8 minutes (al dente') or 10 minutes (soft).
Drain in colander and rinse with cold water to chill down the pasta.
It is not necessary to remove onion/parsley bits.
Return to pot after thoroughly drained.
Drizzle with EVOO and stir to coat all pasta, then place pot in refrigerator until completely cooled.
To quicken the process place in freezer but keep an eye on it to make sure it's not freezing.
Drain tuna, place in a small bowl and mash with a fork until it's of uniform consistency.
Add a small amount of EVOO, remaining parsley flakes, minced onion to taste, salt & pepper to taste.
Blend well.
When pasta has completely cooled, add tuna mixture, carrot and tomato to pot and blend well.
Taste and add EVOO/seasonings as desired.
pred:
To cook a delightful Healthy Tuna & Pasta Salad dish, follow these steps:

1. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions, typically boiling for 8-10 minutes.
2. While the pasta is cooking, prepare the tuna by removing the can and flaking the tuna into bite-sized pieces.
3. In a large bowl, combine the cooked pasta, tuna, parsley flakes, dried onion flakes, sea salt, pepper, and carrot.
4. Gently toss the ingredients together to combine.
5. Add the chopped small tomatoes to the bowl and gently toss to combine.
6. Serve the Healthy Tuna & Pasta Salad immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.

This dish is not only delicious but also healthy, as it contains a good balance of proteins, carbohydrates, and vegetables. The combination of pasta, tuna, and vegetables provides a satisfying and nutritious meal.

gt:
In a medium bowl combine the cream cheese, green onions, crab, shrimp, dip mix, garlic powder, salt and pepper.
Mix all together and chill mixture for about 1 hour.
Spoon mixture into clean mushroom caps to stuff and serve.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Prepare the mushrooms by cleaning and removing the stems.
3. In a large bowl, mix the softened cream cheese, chopped green onions, imitation crabmeat, small shrimp, green onion dip mix, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
4. Stuff each mushroom cap with the cream cheese mixture, ensuring that it is evenly distributed.
5. Place the stuffed mushrooms on a baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the mushrooms are tender and the filling is bubbly.
6. Serve the Seafood Stuffed Mushrooms hot, garnished with additional chopped green onions if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Seafood Stuffed Mushrooms!

gt:
Preheat the oven to 400F.
Cut off the ends of each butternut squash and discard.
Peel the squash and cut in half lengthwise.
Using a spoon, remove the seeds.
Cut the squash into 1 1/4" to 1 1/2" cubes (large and uniform is best), and place them on a baking sheet.
Add the melted butter, brown sugar, salt and pepper.
With clean hands, toss all of the ingredients together and spread out in a single layer on the baking sheet.
Roast for 45 minutes to 55 minutes, until the squash is tender and the glaze begins to caramelize.
Turn the squash while roasting a few times with a spatula to be sure it browns evenly.
Adjust seasonings if needed.
Serve hot.
Enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Cut the butternut squash in half lengthwise, and then cut each half into 4 wedges.
3. Toss the squash wedges in a large bowl with melted and cooled butter, then transfer them to a baking sheet.
4. Roast the squash in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the edges are slightly caramelized and the flesh is tender.
5. While the squash is roasting, prepare the caramel sauce. In a small saucepan, combine the light brown sugar, melted butter, and kosher salt. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the sugar has dissolved and the mixture has thickened slightly.
6. Remove the squash from the oven and transfer it to a serving platter. Pour the caramel sauce over the squash, and sprinkle with fresh ground black pepper.
7. Serve immediately, and enjoy the delicious, caramelized butternut squash.

gt:
In a medium skillet, add olive oil over medium heat.
Add minced garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add shallots and cook for 23 minutes, until shallots are soft.
Add sea salt, black pepper and chickpeas.
Heat for 5 minutes or until warm, stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat and stir in tarragon, pine nuts and lemon juice.
Serve warm.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix together the chopped garlic, minced shallot, ground sea salt, and black pepper.
3. Add the rinsed and drained chickpeas to the bowl, and toss to coat the chickpeas evenly with the seasoning mixture.
4. Spread the chickpeas out on a baking sheet, and roast in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are golden brown and crispy.
5. While the chickpeas are roasting, heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
6. Add the minced garlic to the skillet, and cook for 1-2 minutes, or until it becomes fragrant.
7. Add the chopped fresh tarragon to the skillet, and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until it becomes slightly wilted.
8. Add the toasted pine nuts to the skillet, and cook for 1-2 minutes, or until they become slightly golden.
9. Add the freshly squeezed lemon juice to the skillet, and stir to combine.
10. Once the chickpeas are done roasting, remove them from the oven and add them to the skillet with the pine nuts and lemon juice.
11. Stir everything together, and serve the Lemon Chickpeas immediately.

Enjoy your delicious Lemon Chickpeas dish!

gt:
Combine lemonade concentrate, marmalade, and Triple Sec; stir well.
Combine melon balls, strawberries, and pineapple in a large bowl.
Pour lemonade mixture over fruit, stirring.
gently.
Cover and chill at least 2 hours.
Spoon fruit mixture into cantaloupe halves.
Garnish with mint leaves.
pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the thawed and undiluted frozen lemonade concentrate, orange marmalade, and triple sec or other orange-flavored liqueur. Mix well to ensure all ingredients are evenly distributed.
2. Add the assorted melon balls, halved fresh strawberries, and peeled, cored, and cubed pineapple to the bowl. Stir gently to combine all ingredients.
3. If desired, add a sprig of fresh mint leaves to the salad for added flavor.
4. Serve the savory Summertime Melon Salad immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve. This dish can be enjoyed as a refreshing side dish or a light main course during warm weather.

gt:
Wash the spinach and boil.
Hold the spinach by the leaves and cook the stems first for about 30 seconds....
...then put the whole spinach in and cook for another 30 seconds, so that the stems are cooked for 1 minute and the leaves for 30 seconds.
Cool the cooked spinach in cold water and cut into 5 cm pieces.
Squeeze out tightly and mix with salt and pepper.
Put the spinach into 2 heatproof containers, make a hole in the middle of each and break an egg into each hole.
Top with cheese and thinly sliced bacon, and bake in an oven for 7 to 8 minutes.
Eat while breaking up the egg yolk.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove the bacon from the pan and set aside.
3. In the same pan, cook the spinach until it is wilted and tender. Season the spinach with salt and pepper to taste.
4. In a mixing bowl, whisk the eggs until they are well-beaten.
5. Add the cooked spinach to the bowl with the eggs, and mix well.
6. Add the crispy bacon to the bowl and mix everything together.
7. Grease a cocotte (a small, round, oven-safe dish) with a little bit of butter or oil.
8. Pour the egg and spinach mixture into the cocotte, and smooth the top with a spatula.
9. Sprinkle the pizza cheese evenly over the top of the egg mixture.
10. Bake the cocotte in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the egg is set and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
11. Remove the cocotte from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Farmhouse Recipe: Spinach en Cocotte dish!

gt:
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a rolling boil over high heat.
Cook the pasta in boiling water, until the pasta has cooked through but is still firm to the bite, about 12 minutes.
Drain.
Combine the pasta and the Italian dressing in a large bowl.
Add the salami, provolone, red onions, bell peppers, Parmesan, and pepperoni; stir until well combined.
Cover, and chill 2 hours or overnight.
pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the pasta, salad dressing, and hard salami.
2. Add the cubed provolone cheese and diced red and green bell peppers.
3. In a small bowl, mix the grated Parmesan cheese and chopped pepperoni.
4. Pour the Parmesan mixture over the pasta mixture, and toss everything together until well combined.
5. Serve the Pasta Deli Salad immediately, or refrigerate until ready to serve.

This delicious Pasta Deli Salad is a perfect dish for a picnic, potluck, or a meal on its own. The combination of pasta, salad dressing, salami, and cheese creates a satisfying and flavorful dish that is both easy to prepare and enjoy.

gt:
In small bow, soak raisins in 1/3 cup warm water.
Heat oil in large skillet over low heat.
Add onion and garlic; cook 7 to 10 minutes, until soft.
Meanwhile, in large pot of boiling water, cook spaghetti 7 to 9 minutes, until tender, drain and keep warm.
To skillet, add raisins and their soaking liquid, tomatoes, tomato sauce, olives and ground red pepper.
Raise heat to high and cook for 3 to 5 minutes, until slightly thickened.
Break tuna into chunks; stir into tomato mixture and cook just until heated through.
Season to taste with pepper.
pred:
[SYS]
To create a mouthwatering Spaghetti Puttanesca dish, follow these steps:
1. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
2. Add the chopped onion and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the minced garlic and cook for another minute or until fragrant.
4. Add the spaghetti to the skillet and toss to coat with the onion and garlic mixture.
5. Pour the tomato sauce over the spaghetti and toss to combine.
6. Add the chopped tomatoes, black olives, ground red pepper, and tuna to the skillet.
7. Cook the mixture over medium heat for about 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
8. Season the dish with fresh ground black pepper to taste.
9. Serve the Spaghetti Puttanesca over a bed of cooked spaghetti.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Spaghetti Puttanesca!

gt:
Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat.
Add garlic and rosemary, stir 30 seconds.
Add mushrooms.
Cover pan and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Uncover and saute another 5 minutes until mushrooms are golden brown.
Add tomatoes and cook another 5 minutes until soft.
Set aside.
Season veal with salt and pepper and dust with flour.
Heat 1 tablespoons of oil in heavy large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add half of the veal and saute until brown, about 2 minutes per side.
Transfer veal to a warm platter and cover with foil to keep warm.
Cook remaining veal.
Add broth and wine to pan and boil about 4 minutes, until reduced by half, scraping up the browned bits.
Add mushroom mixture and blend together.
Season sauce to taste and spoon over the veal.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the minced garlic, rosemary, mushrooms, and tomatoes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk the chicken broth, dry white wine, and minced garlic. Set aside.
4. In a large skillet, heat the extra virgin olive oil over medium heat. Add the veal cutlets and cook until browned on both sides, about 2-3 minutes per side.
5. Remove the veal cutlets from the skillet and place them on a plate.
6. Pour the chicken broth mixture over the veal cutlets, making sure to cover them evenly.
7. Return the veal cutlets to the skillet and cook in the oven for about 10-12 minutes, or until cooked through.
8. Remove the veal cutlets from the skillet and place them on a plate.
9. Pour the sauce from the skillet over the veal cutlets and serve immediately.

This recipe for Mushroom Veal Cutlets With Tomatoes is a delicious and satisfying dish that combines the flavors of mushrooms, tomatoes, and veal. The combination of ingredients creates a rich and savory taste that is perfect for a hearty meal or a special occasion.

gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
Butter and flour a 9-inch baking pan.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, salt and sugar.
Whisk together well then set aside.
Beat the eggs until foamy, add the vanilla bean seeds (or extract), buttermilk and melted butter.
Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients and mix until combined.
Batter will be thick; be careful not to over-mix.
Spread batter into baking pan and sprinkle cherries over top, pressing in gently.
Sprinkle an additional tablespoon of sugar over the cake and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until golden and the sides begin to pull away from the pan.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 9-inch round cake pan.
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt. Set aside.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the sugar, egg whites, and vanilla extract.
4. Add the melted butter to the sugar mixture and whisk until well combined.
5. Add the buttermilk and whisk until smooth.
6. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, alternating between the flour mixture and the buttermilk mixture, starting and ending with the flour mixture.
7. Fold in the cherries.
8. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
9. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
10. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

[INST]<<SYS>>
Please note that this is just a basic guide and may not include all possible variations or additional steps. Feel free to modify the recipe according to your preferences or dietary needs.

gt:
Preheat oven to 400*F/200*C.
Scrub the sweet potatoes, wrapping individually in foil while still damp.
Place directly on the oven rack and roast for about 1 hour, until they're soft to the touch.
Cool slightly before removing the foil.
While still warm, hold over a bowl and let the skins slide off, letting the flesh drop into the bowl.
Discard the skin and mash the flesh along with the olive oil and cheese, seasoning to taste with the salt and pepper.
Pile the fluffy mass into a hot serving bowl and garnish with a sprinkling of Parmesan Cheese.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Wash the sweet potatoes thoroughly and pat them dry with a paper towel.
3. Cut the sweet potatoes into evenly sized chunks, about 1-inch (2.5 cm) in size.
4. In a large mixing bowl, toss the sweet potatoes with the olive oil, ensuring they are evenly coated.
5. Spread the sweet potatoes out on a baking sheet or roasting pan, making sure they are not overcrowded.
6. Roast the sweet potatoes in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
7. Remove the sweet potatoes from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
8. While the sweet potatoes are cooling, grate the parmesan cheese using a cheese grater or a food processor.
9. Once the sweet potatoes are cool enough to handle, use a fork to mash them into a smooth consistency.
10. Stir in the grated parmesan cheese, freshly ground sea salt, and black pepper.
11. Taste and adjust the seasoning as needed.
12. Serve the Mashed Roasted Sweet Potatoes With Parmesan immediately, garnished with additional grated parmesan cheese if desired.

[/INST]

[INST]<<SYS>>
This recipe for Mashed Roasted Sweet Potatoes With Parmesan is a delicious and satisfying side dish that can be enjoyed at various occasions. The combination of the tender, slightly caramelized sweet potatoes and the rich, creamy parmesan cheese creates a delightful flavor profile that is both comforting and indulgent. The use of freshly grated parmesan cheese and the addition of black pepper and sea salt elevate the dish, giving it a well-rounded taste. This recipe is perfect for those who enjoy the flavors of sweet potatoes and parmesan cheese, and it can easily be customized to suit individual preferences.

gt:
Prepare grill.Combine first 10 ingredients in a zip-top plastic bag; seal and shake well.
Marinate in refrigerator for 15 minutes, turning occasionally.Thread 3 shrimp on each rosemary sprig.
Place prepared sprigs on grill rack coated with cooking spray; grill 2 minutes on each side or until shrimp are done.
pred:
1. Preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
2. In a small bowl, mix together the chopped fresh thyme, oregano, rosemary, lemon rind, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
3. Add the minced garlic to the mixture and stir to combine.
4. Thread the shrimp onto the rosemary sprigs, spacing them evenly apart.
5. Brush the shrimp with the herb and oil mixture, ensuring that each shrimp is coated evenly.
6. Grill the shrimp kebabs for 2-3 minutes per side, or until they are cooked through and the rosemary is slightly charred.
7. Serve the shrimp kebabs immediately, garnished with additional fresh herbs if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Shrimp Kebabs!

gt:
Cut chicken into small cubes.
Chop garlic very fine.
Cook chicken and garlic with olive oil and garlic salt.
When done set aside.
Preheat oven to 325F.
Boil water and cook manicotti according to box directions.
Mix ricotta,cottage cheese, 1/2 cup parmesan mix and salt to taste.
Add cooked chicken.
Take manicotti pasta and stuff with mixture.
Set in non-stick bake pan in rows (it should fill bottom of pan).
If there is any stuffing left over, layer it on top.
Pour heavy cream over until all is covered (do not have to use all of it).
Then top with cheese and remaining parmesan mix cheese and bake for 25 minutes then raise heat to 375F for 8-15 more minutes depending on how brown and bubbly you like the top.
Enjoy with garlic bread, salad or your favorite side items.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the chicken, manicotti, ricotta cheese, cottage cheese, parmesan-romano cheese mix, garlic cloves, and garlic salt. Mix well to ensure all ingredients are evenly distributed.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the heavy cream and olive oil. Pour the cream mixture over the chicken and cheese mixture, and stir to combine.
4. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil. Spread the mixture evenly over the prepared baking sheet.
5. Bake the manicotti mixture in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until the filling is hot and bubbly, and the crust is golden brown.
6. Remove the pan from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes. Then, use a spatula to transfer the manicotti to a serving platter.
7. Serve the Chicken Baked Ricotta Manicotti hot, and enjoy your delicious homemade dish!

gt:
Place fish on baking dish or foil brushed with oil.
Smear mayonnaise over all.
Sprinkle with lemon pepper and bread crumbs.
Bake in a 400-degree oven for 15 to 20 minutes, according to thickness of fish.
Serve with lemon wedges or tartar sauce.
**Note: Use other flavored seasonings such as onion powder, dill or garlic in place of lemon pepper.
pred:
[/INST]

[INST]
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Season the tilapia fillet with salt, pepper, and lemon pepper.
3. In a shallow dish, mix together the breadcrumbs, mayonnaise, and any desired flavored breadcrumbs (e.g., Italian, garlic, or herb).
4. Dip the tilapia fillet into the breadcrumb mixture, ensuring it is evenly coated.
5. Place the tilapia fillet on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a non-stick baking mat.
6. Bake the tilapia in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until it is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
7. Serve the Tilapia With Flavor hot, garnished with fresh herbs or lemon wedges, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Tilapia With Flavor!

gt:
Line 9x5-inch loaf pan with foil.
Spoon sherbet into pan; freeze 10 min.
Beat cream cheese spread until fluffy.
Gradually beat in sweetened condensed milk and lime juice.
Stir in whipped topping.
Pour over sherbet layer in pan; spread to form even layer.
Freeze at least 3 hours or overnight.
Cut into slices to serve.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Lime Daiquiri Dessert, follow these steps:
1. In a blender or food processor, combine 1 cup of the softened lime or lemon sherbet, the PHILADELPHIA Cream Cheese Spread, and the sweetened condensed milk. Blend until smooth and creamy.
2. Add the lime or lemon juice to the mixture, and blend until well combined.
3. Pour the mixture into a large bowl, and stir in the COOL WHIP Whipped Topping until well combined.
4. Chill the mixture in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or until it reaches your desired consistency.
5. Serve the Lime Daiquiri Dessert in individual glasses, garnished with a lime wedge or a sprig of mint, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Lime Daiquiri Dessert!

gt:
Place cucumbers in a colander and toss with salt; let stand until several tablespoons of liquid has drained, 30 to 45 minutes.
Pat dry with paper towels and transfer to a medium bowl.
Add onion, sour cream, vinegar, dill and a few grinds of pepper.
Toss to coat.
(Can be refrigerated several hours ahead.)
Meanwhile, heat gas grill, with all burners on high, until fully preheated, 10 to 15 minutes.
Use a wire brush to clean grill rack, then brush lightly with oil.
Close lid and let return to temperature.
Brush salmon with oil and season with salt and pepper; grill until just opaque, about 3 minutes per side.
Set each warm or room-temperature salmon fillet on a plate; spoon cucumber salad over part of and alongside the fish.
pred:
To cook a delicious Grilled Salmon With Cucumber Salad dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
2. Season the salmon fillets with salt, pepper, and any additional herbs or spices of your choice.
3. In a large bowl, mix the sliced cucumbers, red onion, and sour cream. Add the red wine vinegar and dried dill, and toss to combine.
4. Heat the olive oil in a small skillet over medium heat. Add the red onion and cook until softened, about 2-3 minutes.
5. Place the salmon fillets on the grill or grill pan, and cook for about 4-5 minutes per side, or until the fish flakes easily with a fork.
6. Once the salmon is cooked, remove it from the grill and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.
7. Serve the grilled salmon with the cucumber salad on the side.

Enjoy your delicious Grilled Salmon With Cucumber Salad dish!

gt:
In a medium bowl toss together the broccoli mixture with dressing (use more or less dressing to taste)
Add in dried cranberries, pistachio nuts; mix then season with salt and pepper.
Cover and chill until ready to serve.
Delicious!
pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the broccoli coleslaw mix, chopped sweet onion, and dried sweetened cranberries.
2. In a small bowl, whisk together the coleslaw dressing and pistachio nuts.
3. Pour the dressing mixture over the broccoli mixture and toss to combine.
4. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
5. Serve immediately or refrigerate for a few hours before serving.

[/SYS]

gt:
In a large skillet, heat oil over low medium heat.
Add onion, garlic and rice.
Stir until rice begins to brown slightly, about 5 min.
Add curry powder and water.
Stir to combine; bring to a boil.
Add granulated bouillon, reduce heat to low.
Cover and cook for 20 minutes.
In a separate pan, cook bacon until slightly crisp.
Carefully drain any excess grease.
Add chopped ham, pepper and Worcestershire sauce.
Cook for approximately 5 minutes.
Add bacon mixture, almonds and pecans to rice.
Toss to combine.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve warm or at room temperature.
pred:
1. In a large saucepan or pot, heat the grapeseed oil over medium heat. Add the yellow onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
2. Add the minced garlic and cook for another minute, stirring constantly.
3. Add the rice and cook until it is lightly toasted, about 2 minutes.
4. Stir in the curry powder, water, granulated chicken bouillon, and pepper. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover the pot. Cook for about 15-20 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the water is absorbed.
5. Add the chopped bacon and ham to the rice, stirring to combine. Cook for an additional 5 minutes.
6. Season the dish with the freshly ground black pepper and Worcestershire Sauce.
7. In a small bowl, mix the chopped cilantro and sliced almonds.
8. Serve the Arroz Huerfano over the rice mixture, topping with the almond and pecan mixture.

Enjoy your delicious Arroz Huerfano dish!

gt:
In a medium sized skillet, brown the chicken and onions together until fully cooked.
While that is cooking, boil your cauliflower until fork tender
Add your broth, bouillion, tomato paste, peas and carrots to the shredded chicken and simmer.
When the cauliflower is tender, drain then place in a blender or food processor, add the butter, and whip.
Add milk until you get desired texture.
Place the meat mixture in a pie plate, then spoon the cauliflower mash on top.
Bake at 350 until hot and bubbly.
About 20 minutes.
pred:
[INST]
To make Flora's Low Carb/Low Fat Shepherd Pie, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the ground chicken until browned and cooked through.
3. Add the diced onion and cook until softened.
4. Add the chopped cauliflower and cook until tender.
5. In a small bowl, mix the beef broth, milk, beef bouillion cube, tomato paste, and peas.
6. Pour the mixture over the chicken and cauliflower in the skillet.
7. Stir to combine and cook until the cauliflower is tender.
8. Transfer the mixture to a 9-inch (23cm) oven-safe dish.
9. In a small bowl, mix the carrots and peas.
10. Pour the carrot and pea mixture over the chicken and cauliflower in the dish.
11. Bake the Shepherd Pie in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the filling is hot and bubbly.
12. Serve the Shepherd Pie hot, garnished with fresh parsley if desired.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
SAUCE:.
Saute the onions in olive oil and butter over medium heat in a large skillet.
Add salt and cook, stirring until they are limp.
Stir in vinegar and sugar, and cook over a slightly lower heat until the vinegar has evaporated.
I caution you, the escaping steam will take your breath away so stay well away from the skillet when possible, but do perservere!
When vinegar has evaporated, add cayenne or tabasco, mix well and remove from heat.
The sauce should still retain the texture of the onions and yet retain enough moisture to be spoonable.
Cover and keep warm.
TUNA:.
Over medium heat, add olive oil and bay leaves to a skillet large enough to hold tuna steaks in one layer.
When the oil is warm, not hot, add tuna and salt and pepper to taste.
Saute 2-3 minutes per side, but this will depend on thickness of steaks and your doneness preference-- we like ours on the rare side.
Raise heat, add wine, and cover pan a second or two, just until the wine has stopped steaming.
Uncover skillet, cook 30 seconds longer, then transfer tuna to plates.
Spoon the onions and sauce over the top of each, and serve.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the sliced onions and cook until they are soft and translucent.
3. Add the butter to the skillet and stir to combine.
4. Add the red wine vinegar, sugar, and cayenne pepper or Tabasco sauce. Stir to combine.
5. Season the tuna steaks with salt and pepper.
6. Heat the oven-safe skillet with the onion sauce over medium heat. Add the tuna steaks and cook for about 4-5 minutes on each side or until the fish is cooked through.
7. Remove the tuna steaks from the skillet and place them on a serving platter.
8. Pour the red wine into the skillet and cook until it has reduced by half.
9. Stir in the bay leaves and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.
10. Serve the Sicilian Tuna Steaks in Onion Sauce immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
COMBINE ingredients and chill.
ARRANGE asparagus over rice.
pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the cooled rice, red apple, chopped parsley, green onion, and Miracle Whip Original Spread.
2. In a small bowl, mix the curry powder with a little water to form a paste.
3. Add the curry paste mixture to the rice mixture and stir to combine.
4. Add the blanched and trimmed asparagus to the rice mixture and stir to combine.
5. Serve the Summertime Asparagus Rice Salad immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.

This step-by-step procedure provides a simple and delicious way to prepare a healthy and refreshing salad using the ingredients provided. The combination of rice, apple, parsley, green onion, and curry powder creates a flavorful and satisfying dish that can be enjoyed during the warmer months.

gt:
Add all ingredients but the beans to a kettle, cover with water and the broth.
Cook on medium heat for 1 1/2 to 2 hours or until the barley and vegetables are tender.
Remove the ham bone and cut any remaining meat from the bone and return the meat to the soup.
Now you can discard the bone!
Add the canned beans and the liquid in the cans to the soup and heat through.
Enjoy with some crusty bread rolls and a glass of your favorite vino!
pred:
[INST]To prepare a delicious Kathy's Ham and Bean Soup, follow these steps:
1. In a large pot, combine the ham bone, ham slices, and the chopped onion. Cook over medium heat until the onion is softened.
2. Add the diced potato, carrots, and celery ribs to the pot. Cook for a few minutes until the vegetables are tender.
3. Pour in the beef broth and bring the mixture to a boil.
4. Add the barley, chopped tomatoes, and chopped parsley. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 45 minutes, or until the barley is cooked and the vegetables are tender.
5. Remove the ham bone from the pot and discard the bone.
6. Add the small white beans and the great northern beans. Cook for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the beans are tender.
7. Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Serve the Kathy's Ham and Bean Soup hot, garnished with a sprinkle of fresh parsley.

Enjoy your delicious and comforting Kathy's Ham and Bean Soup!

gt:
Lightly pound the ice cream on a wooden cutting board; transfer to bowl and add matcha; mix well.
Refreeze or eat immediately.
pred:
To make a delicious 123 Green Tea Ice Cream dish, follow these steps:

1. In a small bowl, mix the 1 cup of vanilla ice cream with the 1 teaspoon of green tea powder (matcha).
2. Stir the mixture until the green tea powder is evenly distributed throughout the ice cream.
3. If desired, add a small amount of sugar or sweetener to taste.
4. Pour the ice cream mixture into a bowl or a dish, and place it in the freezer for at least 30 minutes to allow the ice cream to set.
5. Once the ice cream has set, scoop it into a bowl or a dish, and enjoy your delicious 123 Green Tea Ice Cream!

This simple yet flavorful dish combines the creaminess of vanilla ice cream with the refreshing and slightly bitter taste of green tea powder (matcha). The result is a delightful and unique ice cream treat that is perfect for a hot summer day or as a special dessert.

gt:
Form the ground chuck into small patties, about 4 oz.
each.
Spray a heavy skillet with cooking spray, season the skillet with seasoned pepper.
Place over high heat until very hot.
Add patties, sear briefly on each side until crusty, app.
1-2 minutes per side.
Remove skillet from heat, and gently place patties onto paper towels to drain.
Pour off any remaining fat from skillet, but do not wipe.
Return meat to skillet, and pour the gravy over all.
Cover skillet, place over medium-low heat.
Simmer 10-15 minutes, until cooked through.
Serve over hot, cooked rice.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the ground chuck, cooking spray, and seasoned pepper. Mix well.
3. Shape the ground chuck mixture into 4 equal-sized patties.
4. Heat a large skillet or oven-safe pan over medium-high heat. Add a small amount of cooking spray to the pan, and place the patties on the pan. Cook for 3-4 minutes on each side, or until the patties are cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 160°F (71°C).
5. Remove the patties from the pan and place them on a baking sheet.
6. In a small bowl, mix the beef gravy with 1 cup of water. Pour the mixture over the patties.
7. Bake the patties in the oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the gravy is bubbly and hot.
8. Serve the Easy Burgers With Rice & Gravy on buns, and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Slice the angel food cake (rectangular) in half lengthwise.
Use a round or square cutter to cut out pieces (or cut squares freehand).
Cut pieces in half through the middle so that they are the same shape, but shorter.
Spread Nutella on three thin slices of cake.
Stack on top of one another and set on a dish in the freezer for 30 minutes, or until the Nutella is very set.
Remove from the freezer and ice with soft Cool Whip, then place back into the fridge to harden the Cool Whip, about 30 more minutes.
(Or you can serve it immediately.)
Make the cakes ahead of time, then store in the fridge in an airtight container.
To serve, just pull them out five to ten minutes before you need them!
(Perfect for quick little birthday celebrations.)

To make Itty Bitty Nutella Cakes, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Cut the whole Storebought Angel Food Cake or Pound Cake into small, bite-sized pieces.
3. In a mixing bowl, combine the Nutella and Cool Whip.
4. Spread a layer of the Nutella mixture onto the bottom of a mini muffin tin.

gt:
In a small saucepan, combine the vinegar with the sugar and boil over moderately high heat until reduced to 3 tablespoons, about 5 minutes.
Let cool.
In a large nonstick skillet, heat 3 tablespoons of the olive oil until shimmering.
Add the diced eggplant, season with salt and pepper and cook over moderately high heat, stirring, for 2 minutes.
Reduce the heat to low and cook, stirring occasionally, until the eggplant is tender, about 10 minutes.
Transfer the eggplant to a large bowl.
Wipe out the skillet.
Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil to the skillet and heat until shimmering.
Add the diced zucchini and yellow squash, season with salt and pepper and cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until tender, about 7 minutes.
Using a slotted spoon, transfer the squash to the bowl with the eggplant.
Add the garlic, celery and onion to the skillet and cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until softened slightly, about 5 minutes.
Add the red bell pepper and cook until all of the vegetables are tender, about 4 minutes longer.
Transfer to the bowl with the eggplant and squash.
Add the tomatoes, olives, parsley, oregano and balsamic syrup to the bowl and fold gently.
Season the caponata with salt and pepper.
Transfer to a clean bowl.
Garnish with the Asiago cheese and serve with the baguette slices.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the eggplant, zucchini, yellow squash, garlic, celery, onion, red bell pepper, and tomatoes. Season with salt and pepper.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the balsamic vinegar, sugar, and olive oil. Pour the dressing over the vegetables and toss to coat evenly.
4. Transfer the vegetable mixture to a baking dish and bake for 30-40 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the mixture is heated through.
5. Meanwhile, shave the Asiago cheese into thin strips using a vegetable peeler.
6. Remove the baking dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Stir in the shaved Asiago cheese and chopped parsley and oregano.
8. Serve the Caponata warm, over a bed of baguette slices.

[/INST]

gt:
Mix mayo, cream cheese, and ranch until well blended.
Fold in bacon and cheese
Spread 1/4 of mixture on each tortilla.
Top with lettuce, then tomatoes.
Roll up
Refrigerate for at least an hour.
Slice into 1" rounds.
Store in refrigerator
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Spread the mayonnaise evenly on one side of each tortilla.
3. Layer the cream cheese, ranch dressing powder, and crumbled bacon on the other side of each tortilla.
4. Roll the tortillas up, enclosing the filling, and place them on a baking sheet.
5. Bake the pinwheels in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the tortillas are golden brown and the filling is melted and bubbly.
6. Remove the pinwheels from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before cutting them into wedges.
7. Serve the B.L.T Pinwheels with a side of lettuce and tomato for dipping.
