gt:
In a large serving bowl, mix together 2 tablespoons olive oil with the vinegar, basil, tomatoes, mozzarella, salt and pepper.
Set aside while rice cooks.
Heat remaining teaspoon of olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat.
Add onion and cook until softened, about 3 minutes.
Add rice and 3/4 pint water.
Bring to the boil, cover and simmer until water is absorbed and rice is tender, about 15 - 20 minutes.
Toss rice with tomato mixture; serve warm or at room temperature.
pred:
To create a delicious Ww Caprese Rice Salad, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the dried rice and 1 teaspoon of olive oil. Cover the bowl and let it sit for 15-20 minutes.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the balsamic vinegar and salt.
4. In a large skillet, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until it becomes soft and translucent.
5. Add the cherry tomatoes to the skillet and cook for a few minutes, until they start to release their juices.
6. Add the cooked rice to the skillet, stirring to combine.
7. Pour the balsamic vinegar mixture over the rice and stir to coat the rice evenly.
8. Add the mozzarella cheese to the skillet and stir until it melts and becomes fully incorporated into the rice mixture.
9. Season the rice salad with salt and pepper to taste.
10. Transfer the rice salad to a serving dish and garnish with the remaining 6 ounces of cherry tomatoes and the basil leaves.

Enjoy your delicious Ww Caprese Rice Salad!

gt:
Fill the bell pepper 'bowls' with the mixed vegetables and other optional extras.
Serve!
pred:
To cook a delicious Eat Your Bowl dish, follow these steps:
1. Prepare the vegetables: Wash and chop the bell peppers, tomatoes, mushrooms, corn kernels, cucumber, carrot, and any additional vegetables you choose to include.
2. Cook the rice or pasta: Cook the rice or pasta according to the package instructions.
3. Prepare the sauce: In a small bowl, mix together the ingredients for the sauce, such as tomato sauce, olive oil, garlic, and any additional seasonings you prefer.
4. Assemble the dish: In a large bowl, combine the cooked rice or pasta, the chopped vegetables, and the sauce. Mix everything together until the ingredients are well combined.
5. Add toppings: If desired, add toppings such as diced low-fat cheese, raw unsalted nuts, seeds, diced ham, cooked meat, diced marinated tofu, tinned beans, or cooked rice.
6. Serve: Portion the dish into individual bowls and serve immediately.

This Eat Your Bowl dish is a versatile and nutritious meal option that can be customized with various ingredients to suit individual tastes and dietary preferences.

gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Prepare a pot of water for the pasta and boil according to package directions, cutting 1-2 minutes off of cooking time since pasta will continue to cook in the oven.
Heat a saucepan over medium high heat and add butter.
Once melted and sizzling, whisk in flour to create a roux and cook until bubbly and golden in color, about 2 minutes.
Add milk and beer into saucepan whisking constantly, then add gouda and cheddar cheeses and stir until melted.
Turn heat down to medium and continue to stir, cooking for 5-6 minutes while mixture thickens.
It will most likely NOT thicken like regular mac n cheese because of the beer, but you want it to thicken a little bit.
Stir in pepper, paprika and nutmeg.
Add cooked and drained pasta to a casserole dish and pour cheese sauce over top, mixing gently to combine.
Top with Panko bread crumbs, some more pepper and sprinkle with romano cheese.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until bubbly and golden on top.
Remove from oven and let cool for 5 minutes, top with fresh parsley.
pred:
1. In a large pot or Dutch oven, melt the butter over medium heat.
2. Add the flour and cook, stirring constantly, until it turns golden brown, about 2 minutes.
3. Gradually pour in the milk, stirring constantly to prevent lumps.
4. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 10 minutes, or until it thickens slightly.
5. Add the beer, Gouda, Sharp Cheddar Cheese, black pepper, paprika, nutmeg, and Panko bread crumbs. Stir to combine.
6. Cook the mixture for about 5 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth and creamy.
7. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions until it is al dente.
9. Drain the pasta and return it to the pot.
10. Pour the sauce over the pasta and stir to combine.
11. Serve the Beer Mac n Cheese immediately, garnished with chopped parsley.

This savory Beer Mac n Cheese dish is a delicious and comforting meal that can be enjoyed by people of all ages. The combination of the pasta, cheese, and beer creates a rich and flavorful dish that is perfect for a cozy night in or a gathering with friends and family.

gt:
Add oils and salt to a large soaking tub of very warm water.
Soak feet for as long as it feels wonderful.
Rinse, dry and massage a lot of your favorite lotion into your feet.
Put on white cotton socks and relax!
pred:
1. In a large bowl, mix the epsom salts, peppermint extract, tea tree oil, and lavender.
2. Soak your feet in the mixture for 15-20 minutes.
3. Rinse your feet thoroughly with water and pat them dry.
4. Apply a moisturizer to your feet and massage them gently.
5. Enjoy the relaxing and soothing effects of the foot soak.

[/INST]

gt:
Butter and flour a cookie sheet pan.
Cream the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy.
On medium speed, add the eggs, 2 at a time, then add the sour cream and vanilla.
Scrape down the sides and stir until smooth.
Sift together the flour, cornstarch, salt, and baking soda in a bowl.
Add the flour mixture to the butter mixture until just combined.
Pour into the prepared pan.
Smooth the top with a spatula.
Bake in the center of the oven for 20 to 30 minutes at 350 degrees F until a toothpick comes out clean.
Cool to room temperature.
For the topping, combine the cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla together.
Whip the cream and fold it into the cream cheese mixture.
Frost the cake and decorate with fresh blueberries and strawberries.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the softened butter, sugar, and eggs. Mix until well combined.
3. Add the sour cream, vanilla extract, and mix until smooth.
4. Gradually add the flour, cornstarch, salt, and baking soda, mixing until well combined.
5. Add the cream cheese and powdered sugar, mixing until smooth.
6. Gradually add the heavy cream, mixing until smooth.
7. Fold in the fresh blueberries and strawberries.
8. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9-inch (23cm) round cake pan.
9. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
10. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
11. Once the cake is cooled, use a sharp knife to cut it into equal portions.
12. Decorate the cake with additional blueberries and strawberries, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious American Flag Cake!

gt:
Stir together the mayonnaise, shallot, chile, chives, parsley, tarragon, lemon zest and juice, 3/4 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon pepper in a medium bowl.
Gently fold in the crab so as not to break it into pieces.
Taste for salt and pepper and adjust if necessary.
Cover and refrigerate.
pred:
To cook a delightful Ben Pollingers Crab-Stuffed Roasted Lobster dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).

2. In a large bowl, mix together the mayonnaise, shallot, finger chile, lemon zest, and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

3. Add the crabmeat to the mayonnaise mixture and gently mix to combine.

4. In a separate bowl, mix the panko breadcrumbs, fresh chives, Italian parsley, and tarragon.

5. Dip each lobster in the mayonnaise mixture, then coat it with the breadcrumb mixture.

6. Place the lobsters on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.

7. Roast the lobsters in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the shells are slightly curled and the meat is cooked through.

8. Remove the lobsters from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes before serving.

9. Serve the cooked lobsters with the mayonnaise mixture spooned over the top, and enjoy your delicious Ben Pollingers Crab-Stuffed Roasted Lobster dish.

[/INST]

Ingredients:
- 5 tablespoons mayonnaise
- 3 tablespoons shallot (about 1 small)
- 2 teaspoons finger chile (slivered and seeded)
- 1 tablespoon fresh chives
- 1 tablespoon fresh Italian parsley
- 1 tablespoon fresh tarragon
- 1 teaspoon lemon zest
- 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice
- Fine sea salt and freshly ground black pepper
- 1 pound lump crabmeat
- 1/2 cup panko breadcrumbs
- 1/2 teaspoon fresh chives
- 1/2 teaspoon fresh Italian parsley
- 1/2 teaspoon

gt:
Shake the rum, vermouth, Cointreau, lemon juice, and grenadine with ice; then strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with lemon peel.
pred:
1. In a shaker, combine the light rum, dry vermouth, Cointreau, fresh lemon juice, grenadine, and a dash of lemon peel.
2. Shake well and strain into a chilled glass filled with ice.
3. Garnish with a lemon peel twist.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Bring a large pot of water to a boil.
Salt, add pasta and cook until al dente.
If using orecchiette, cook about 8-9 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a large skillet over medium high heat, break sausage up into pieces and cook until browned (you may want to add a bit of olive oil while sauteing depending on the fat content of the sausage).
Add peppers, scallions and zucchini and saute for another 4-5 minutes until softened.
Add spices and flour and toss together until flour is fully incorporated.
Add milk and cheese next and stir all together until cheese is melted.
At this point the pasta should be done cooking.
Drain well, reserving about a cup of the cooking water in a separate bowl (see note below) and add pasta to the pan.
Toss to coat pasta in cheesy mixture completely.
Add grape tomatoes and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately.
Note: Keep pasta cooking liquid for reheating.
Mac n cheese has a tendency to dry up once refrigerated and reheated.
Use some of the pasta water to help loosen it up a bit again when reheating or if not serving immediately.
pred:
1. In a large pot or Dutch oven, cook the pasta according to the package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.

2. In a large skillet or saucepan, cook the sausage over medium heat until browned and cooked through. Remove from the pan and set aside.

3. In the same skillet, add the chopped yellow and green bell peppers, scallions, and zucchini. Cook until the vegetables are tender but still crisp.

4. Add the cumin, smoked paprika, chili powder, and ground mustard to the skillet. Cook for a few minutes, stirring constantly, until the spices are fragrant.

5. Add the cooked sausage back to the skillet and stir to combine.

6. Pour the 1% milk into the skillet and stir to combine with the sausage and vegetables. Cook over medium heat until the sauce thickens slightly.

7. Add the grated cheddar cheese to the skillet and stir until melted and smooth.

8. Add the grape tomatoes and stir to combine.

9. Season the mac n cheese with salt and pepper to taste.

10. Serve the Super Creamy Spicy Sausage Mac n Cheese immediately, garnished with chopped scallions if desired.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Super Creamy Spicy Sausage Mac n Cheese!

gt:
Hold the head of lettuce with the stalk side up.
With the side your wrist, give a sharp whack to the base of the stalk!
By doing so, the leaves will separate from the stalk.
Hold the stalk between your fingers and twist.
The central stalk is now removed.
Wet a paper towel with water and lightly squeeze out the excess.
Stuff the gap in the lettuce from the removed stalk with this damp ball.
Put the lettuce into a plastic bag and store in the fridge.
Remove outer leaves and use as you need.
Make delicious salads, using a crispy and fresh lettuce.
Take a look atfor 'How to tear lettuce leaves and enhance their flavour'.
pred:
1. First, remove the stalk from the head of lettuce by gently twisting it and pulling it out.
2. Next, place the lettuce in a suitable size plastic bag, making sure that it is not overfilled.
3. Add a piece of kitchen paper to the bag, ensuring that it is placed on top of the lettuce.
4. Seal the bag, ensuring that the lettuce is completely covered and the kitchen paper is in contact with the lettuce.
5. Store the bag in the refrigerator, where it will keep the lettuce fresh for up to 5 days.

By following these steps, you will have successfully removed the stalk from the lettuce and kept it fresh for consumption.

gt:
Soak about 1 cup of TVP in boiling water, to cover, with several tbsp taco seasoning, extra chili powder, and salt to taste.
Let it sit until the TVP has soaked up much of the water and flavor from the spices.
Meanwhile, saute 1 chopped green pepper, 1 chopped med/large onion, and 1 to 2 cloves finely chopped garlic in wine or balsamic vinegar until the onion is translucent.
Stir in one can of diced tomatoes (~16 oz), one or two cans of drained and rinsed kidney beans, one can of tomato sauce (8 oz), chili powder, and 1/2 to 1 teaspoon dried basil (or several chopped leaves if fresh).
Drain excess liquid from the TVP (so there isn't a puddle of water.
it can still be wet) and add to the rest.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer 20 minutes or more.
pred:
1. In a large pot, combine the TVP, water, taco seasoning mix, chili powder, salt, and green bell peppers. Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.

2. Add the onions and garlic to the pot, stirring to combine. Cook for an additional 5 minutes, or until the onions are tender.

3. Pour in the wine or balsamic vinegar, and stir to combine. Cook for an additional 2 minutes, or until the liquid has evaporated.

4. Add the tomatoes, red kidney beans, and tomato sauce to the pot. Stir to combine, and bring the mixture to a boil.

5. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for about 30 minutes, or until the chili is thick and flavorful.

6. Taste the chili and adjust the seasoning with additional chili powder, salt, or pepper as needed.

7. Serve the Tvp Chili hot, garnished with fresh basil, if desired. Enjoy!

gt:
Preheat your oven to 450F.
Combine 1/4 cup flour, salt, pepper and cayenne in a bowl that is large enough to dip the onions into.
In another similar-sized bowl, combine the buttermilk, egg and remaining 1/4 cup flour.
Whisk until a smooth batter is formed.
Have all your ingredients nearby to minimize the mess.
Youll need your seasoned flour, then the batter and finally a bowl containing your crushed chips all at arms length.
Cover a baking sheet with a piece of parchment.
Drizzle with 3 Tablespoons of vegetable oil then pop it into the hot oven for 8 minutes, or until the oil just starts to smoke.
Carefully remove the baking sheet from the oven and rotate to evenly coat with oil.
Dip an onion ring into the seasoned flour.
This will help the batter to adhere, which helps the chips to adhere.
They all work together deliciously.
After the seasoned flour, dip the onion into the buttermilk batter.
Let the excess batter dribble off before you coat the wet ring with the crushed chips.
You will need to use your hands a bit to make sure the chips adhere.
Repeat this process with all the onion rings.
Quickly place your onion rings on the baking sheet then return to the oven.
Bake for 8 minutes then flip each ring over before baking for another 8 minutes.
pred:
To make delicious Oven Baked Onion Rings, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Cut the two whole onions into 1/2 inch rings.
3. In a large bowl, mix 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 1/2 teaspoons salt, 1/4 teaspoons black pepper, and 1/4 teaspoon cayenne.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together 1/2 cup buttermilk, 1 whole egg, and 1-1/2 cups crushed potato chips.
5. Dip each onion ring into the flour mixture, then coat it with the buttermilk mixture.
6. Heat 3 tablespoons of oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Fry the coated onion rings in batches until golden brown, about 3-4 minutes per side.
7. Transfer the fried onion rings to a wire rack placed over a baking sheet.
8. Bake the onion rings in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy.
9. Serve the delicious Oven Baked Onion Rings hot, as a side dish or appetizer.

[/INST]

Ingredients:
- 2 whole onions, cut into 1/2 inch rings
- 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, divided
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne
- 1/2 cup buttermilk
- 1 whole egg
- 1-1/2 cups crushed potato chips
- 3 tablespoons oil

[/INST]

By following these steps, you can create a delicious Oven Baked Onion Rings dish that is both crispy and flavorful.

gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. In a large bowl, add fruit and lemon juice.
Stir in half of the sugar, the cinnamon, and combine well.
Add fruit in to a greased 9 pie dish.
In a food processor, add flour, baking powder, salt and remaining sugar and pulse for 5 to 10 seconds until flour is mixed.
Add in butter and pulse for an additional 10 seconds until mixture is coarse.
Pour flour mixture into a separate bowl and stir in the egg and vanilla by hand.
Add spoonfuls of dough on top of fruit.
Do not spread.
Put the pie dish on top of a cookie sheet and bake for 35 minutes until golden brown and bubbly.
pred:
To make a delicious Blueberry Pear Cobbler, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix together the flour, baking powder, salt, and ground cinnamon.
3. Add the chilled butter cubes to the flour mixture, using your fingers or a pastry cutter, cut the butter into the flour until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg, sugar, and vanilla extract.
5. Pour the wet ingredients over the dry ingredients, and mix until the dough comes together.
6. Fold in the sliced pears and blueberries.
7. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9-inch (23cm) square baking dish.
8. Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the cobbler is golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
9. Allow the cobbler to cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Blueberry Pear Cobbler!

gt:
In a cocktail shaker, muddle the chile.
Add ice and all of the remaining ingredients except the garnish and shake well.
Double strain into a chilled martini glass and garnish with the flamed orange twist.
pred:
1. In a mixing glass, combine the vodka, vanilla vodka, Cognac, and Grand Marnier.
2. Add the dark creme de cacao and stir until well combined.
3. Add the ice to the mixture and stir until the ice is almost completely melted.
4. Garnish the drink with the flamed orange twist.
5. Serve the drink in a chilled glass.

[/INST]

gt:
In a medium skillet, combine the fingerling potatoes with 2 tablespoons of the olive oil, the garlic, saffron and a pinch each of salt and pepper.
Add 2 cups of water to cover and simmer over moderately low heat until the potatoes are tender, about 12 minutes.
Drain and let cool slightly.
Discard the garlic.
In a large bowl, whisk the mayonnaise with the lemon juice and the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil; season with salt and pepper.
Add the potatoes, tomatoes and diced fennel and toss.
Add the mixed baby greens, season with salt and pepper and toss again.
Serve right away.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the fingerling potatoes with olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper. Spread the potatoes out on a baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are golden brown and tender.
3. In a small bowl, mix the saffron threads with a pinch of salt.
4. In a large bowl, combine the roasted potatoes, saffron-infused oil, mayonnaise, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Toss to combine.
5. In a large bowl, combine the mixed greens, fennel, and tomatoes.
6. Add the potato mixture to the greens and toss to combine.
7. Serve the Saffron Fingerling Potato Salad with Mixed Greens and Tomatoes immediately, or refrigerate until ready to serve.

This delicious Saffron Fingerling Potato Salad with Mixed Greens and Tomatoes dish is a perfect combination of flavors and textures. The roasted fingerling potatoes add a rich, earthy taste, while the saffron threads and lemon juice give the dish a bright, citrusy kick. The mixed greens and tomatoes provide a refreshing crunch and a burst of freshness. The mayonnaise adds a creamy, slightly tangy element, and the fennel adds a subtle aniseed flavor. This dish is a delightful and healthy side dish or main course option that can be enjoyed at any gathering or meal.

gt:
In a medium saucepan, heat oil over medium heat.
Add garlic and saute until golden brown.
In a small saucepan, stir together milk, chicken broth, flour, salt and pepper over low heat until smooth and thick.
Stir into garlic.
Continue to cook over medium low heat, stirring frequently, until the sauce is thick.
Stir in Parmesan cheese.
pred:
1. Heat the olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat.
2. Add the minced garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly, until fragrant.
3. Add the skim milk, chicken broth, and flour, stirring constantly until smooth and well-combined.
4. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until it thickens slightly.
5. Gradually add the grated parmesan cheese, stirring until it is fully melted and the sauce is smooth and creamy.
6. Season the sauce with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Serve the Light Alfredo Sauce over your choice of pasta, such as fettuccine or linguine, and enjoy your delicious dish.

[/INST]

gt:
Melt butter in 10-inch skillet until sizzling; add potatoes, leeks, carrots and garlic.
Cook over medium-high heat just 5-7 minutes or until leeks are tender.
Place vegetables and all remaining ingredients except parsley in slow cooker.
Cook on low heat setting 4-6 hours or High heat setting 2-4 hours, or until potatoes are tender.
Just before serving; stir in parsley.
*Substitute any type of potato.
pred:
1. In a large pot or Dutch oven, melt the 2 tablespoons of Land O Lakes Butter over medium heat. Add the cubed ham and cook until it is browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the ham from the pot and set aside.

2. In the same pot, add the cubed potatoes and carrots, and cook until they are tender, about 10-12 minutes.

3. Add the cubed leek, garlic, and thyme leaves to the pot. Cook for an additional 3-5 minutes, or until the leek is tender.

4. Pour in the chicken broth, and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, and let the soup simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the potatoes are fully cooked and the carrots are tender.

5. Add the cooked ham back into the pot, and stir to combine.

6. Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste. If desired, add a splash of milk or cream to achieve a desired consistency.

7. Serve the Chunky Potato & Ham Soup hot, garnished with a sprinkle of fresh chopped parsley.

[/INST]

This recipe is a delicious and comforting soup that combines the flavors of potatoes, carrots, ham, and leeks. The addition of thyme leaves and garlic adds depth and complexity to the dish, while the chicken broth provides a rich and savory base. The soup can be customized with the addition of milk or cream to achieve a desired consistency, and it can be garnished with a sprinkle of fresh parsley for an extra touch of freshness.

gt:
In a very large saucepan, combine the heavy cream, milk, 1/3 cup of the sugar, and the salt.
Cook, whisking, over medium heat until just barely boiling and the sugar is dissolved, about 4 minutes.
Add the popcorn and stir until coated.
Cover and set aside until cool, about 30 minutes.
Strain the cream through a fine-mesh strainer into a medium saucepan, firmly pressing on the popcorn with the back of a spoon to extract every last drop of flavor and cream.
You should have about 3 cups of liquid.
Add more cream, if needed, to come up to this amount.
In an electric mixer fitted with the whisk attachment, beat the egg yolks and the remaining 2/3 cup sugar on medium-high speed for 5 minutes, or until the mixture is pale and thick and forms a ribbon when the beater is lifted.
Over medium heat, bring the cream mixture back to a simmer.
With the mixer on medium-low speed, slowly pour the mixture into the egg yolks until blended.
Pour the whole mixture back into the saucepan.
Cook over medium-low heat, stirring constantly with a heatproof spatulamaking sure you get the sides and bottom of the saucepanuntil the custard is thick enough to coat the spatula and to hold a line drawn through it with your finger, about 3 to 5 minutes.
Pour the custard through a fine-mesh strainer into a bowl.
This custard needs to be cooled at room temperature!
Because of the oil, it will harden if refrigerated, and the churned gelato wont have a smooth texture but will be more like overwhipped heavy cream and have a granular texture.
To churn, pour the custard into an ice cream maker and process according to the manufacturers instructions.
Serve immediately, or for a firmer gelato, scrape into a chilled bowl, cover, and freeze until firm, or for up to 3 days.
pred:
To cook Buttered Popcorn Gelato, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the heavy cream, whole milk, sugar, and kosher salt until well combined.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg yolks until they are light and fluffy.
4. Gradually pour the whisked egg yolks into the cream mixture, stirring gently to combine.
5. Pour the mixture into a 9x13 inch (23x33 cm) baking dish that has been greased or lined with parchment paper.
6. Bake the mixture in the preheated oven for about 45-50 minutes or until it is set and the edges are slightly golden.
7. Remove the baking dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Carefully pour the mixture onto a large piece of parchment paper or a silicone mat, spreading it evenly.
9. Allow the gelato to cool completely before cutting it into desired shapes or sizes.

This Buttered Popcorn Gelato recipe is a delicious and creative way to enjoy popcorn flavors in a frozen dessert. The combination of heavy cream, whole milk, sugar, and kosher salt creates a rich and indulgent taste, while the egg yolks add a smooth and creamy texture. The popcorn adds a delightful crunch and a hint of sweetness, making this a unique and enjoyable treat for everyone to enjoy.

gt:
Prepare Raita: Drain excess liquid from cucumber and blot with paper towel.
In medium bowl, mix together yogurt, cucumber, mint, onion, if using, and cumin.
Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour or up to 1 day.
To serve, garnish with additional chopped cucumber and paprika, if desired.
Heat oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Add onion; cook, stirring occasionally, for 6 minutes or until soft.
Stir in garlic, ginger and green chile; cook for 1 minute, stirring often.
Stir in tomatoes and ground round, breaking up with a spoon.
Stir in coriander and cumin.
Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes.
Stir in peas.
Cover, reduce heat and cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in lemon juice, garam masala and dried chile peppers, if desired.
Before serving, stir in fresh coriander.
Serve with basmati rice and Raita.
pred:
1. Heat the oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and ginger, and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
2. Add the sliced green chile pepper and cook for an additional 2 minutes, or until the pepper is tender.
3. Add the chopped tomatoes, Yves Veggie Cuisine Original Veggie Ground Round, ground coriander, cumin, lemon juice, garam masala, and dried red chile peppers (if using). Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
4. Add the chopped green peas and cook for 2 minutes, or until the peas are heated through.
5. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. Serve the Vegetarian Keema Matar with Cucumber Raita on the side.

To prepare the Cucumber Raita:
1. In a small bowl, mix the finely shredded or finely diced English cucumber, The Greek Gods Plain Yogurt, chopped fresh mint, finely diced red onion (optional), and a pinch of paprika or chili powder.
2. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Vegetarian Keema Matar with Cucumber Raita dish!

gt:
Heat the olive oil in a small skillet over medium-low heat; cook the onion and garlic in the hot oil until translucent, about 5 minutes.
Stir the peaches, pear, and honey into the onion and garlic mixture; allow to cook together for 2 minutes.
Season with the curry powder, salt, and pepper.
Continue cooking at a simmer until hot, 5 to 6 minutes.
pred:
1. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet or frying pan over medium heat.
2. Add the diced red onion and minced garlic to the skillet, stirring occasionally. Cook for about 2-3 minutes, or until the onion is softened and fragrant.
3. Add the diced peaches and pear to the skillet, stirring to combine. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the fruits are slightly softened.
4. Add the honey, curry powder, salt, and pepper to the skillet. Stir to combine and cook for another 2-3 minutes, or until the fruits are fully cooked and the flavors have melded together.
5. Serve the Peach Pear Salsa immediately, or refrigerate it for later use. Enjoy your delicious homemade salsa!

gt:
Add the water, cinnamon stick, vanilla, butter, and salt to a large saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat.
As soon as the mixture boils, remove from the heat and discard the cinnamon stick.
Add the flour to the saucepan all at once, stirring with a wooden spoon until it forms a shaggy ball of dough.
Transfer the dough to a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment.
Turn the mixer on at medium speed and add the egg, mixing until its thoroughly incorporated and the dough is smooth and sticky.
Use a spatula to scrape the dough into a pastry bag fitted with a large star tip.
Fill a large, heavy-bottomed pot with at least 2 inches of oil (the oil should not come more than halfway up the sides of the pan).
Heat over medium-high heat until a deep-frying thermometer registers 360 degrees F.
While the oil is heating, add the sugar and ground cinnamon to a medium bowl.
Stir with a whisk until thoroughly combined.
Set aside.
Working in batches, pipe 2 to 3 approximately 4-inch-long churros into the oil (use a table knife to cut off the batter at the tip).
With a spider or the tip of a long-handled slotted metal spoon, fully submerge the churros in the oil.
Fry until golden brown, carefully flipping and re-submerging the churros under the hot oil, about 2 minutes.
Remove with a spider or slotted spoon and drain on a wire rack over a paper towel.
Cool slightly before tossing in the cinnamon sugar.
Repeat with the remaining churro batter.
Be sure to keep the oil temperature consistent while frying.
Serve warm, with .
pred:
To prepare a delicious Churros Recipe dish, follow these steps:
1. Combine the water, cinnamon stick, and pure vanilla extract in a saucepan. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 15 minutes.
2. While the mixture is simmering, prepare the dough by combining the all-purpose flour, sifted, large egg, and kosher salt in a large bowl. Gradually add the melted butter, stirring until the dough comes together.
3. Remove the saucepan from the heat and carefully pour the hot liquid mixture into the dough, stirring to combine.
4. Cover the bowl with a damp cloth and let the dough rest for about 30 minutes, or until it has cooled slightly.
5. Preheat your fryer or a large pot with vegetable oil to a temperature of 350°F (175°C).
6. On a floured surface, roll out the dough into long, thin strips. Cut the strips into 3-inch (7.5 cm) pieces.
7. Carefully drop the dough pieces into the hot oil, being careful not to overcrowd the fryer. Fry the dough pieces until they are golden brown, about 2-3 minutes per side.
8. Remove the fried dough pieces from the oil using a slotted spoon or tongs, and transfer them to a wire rack or a paper towel-lined plate to drain.
9. While the dough pieces are frying, prepare the Mexican hot chocolate by combining the granulated sugar, ground cinnamon, and Mexican hot chocolate mix in a saucepan. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 5 minutes, or until the sugar has dissolved and the mixture has thickened slightly.
10. Serve the fried dough pieces with the Mexican hot chocolate for a delicious and warm treat.

Enjoy your homemade Churros Recipe dish!

gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F.
Sift together the flour, sugar, salt and baking soda in a bowl.
In a separate bowl, pour the hot coffee over the chopped chocolate, and allow chocolate to melt completely.
In a separate bowl, whisk together until well blended the eggs and vegetable oil, followed by the sour cream, vanilla, and coffee-chocolate mixture.
Stir the liquid mixture into the dry ingredients by thirds, stirring well after each addition until completely blended.
Divide the batter evenly between two buttered and floured parchment-lined 9-inch cake pans.
Drop each cake pan once onto the counter from a height of 3 inches to remove any air pockets (these would cause holes or tunnels in the baked cake layers.)
Bake in the preheated oven for 30-40 minutes, until the cake springs back slightly when gently tapped in the center OR when a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Remove immediately to cooling racks, and allow to rest for 5 minutes before turning out of the pans.
Allow cakes to cool completely before peeling off the parchment bottoms and frosting.
Enjoy the most moist, rich, chocolate chocolate cake you'll ever eat!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans.

2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the sugar, flour, baking soda, and salt. Add the hot coffee, oil, and sour cream, and mix until smooth.

3. Add the finely chopped chocolate and eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition.

4. Pour the batter evenly into the prepared pans, and smooth the tops with a spatula.

5. Bake the cakes for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of each cake comes out clean.

6. Allow the cakes to cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.

7. To make the frosting, beat the butter and vanilla extract together until smooth. Gradually add the powdered sugar, and continue beating until the desired consistency is reached.

8. Once the cakes are completely cooled, spread a layer of frosting on top of each cake.

9. Decorate the cakes with chocolate shavings, if desired.

10. Serve the cakes immediately, or store them in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

[/INST]

This recipe for a Very Good Chocolate Cake is a delicious and satisfying dessert that is sure to impress your guests. The combination of the moist cake and the rich, creamy frosting creates a perfect balance of flavors, making it a favorite among chocolate lovers. The detailed instructions and timing for each ingredient ensure that the cake comes out perfectly every time.

gt:
Place vegetables in the bottom of slow cooker.
Top with chicken.
Add soup and broth.
(No need to mix).
Cover and cook for 4 to 6 hours on low.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Crock Pot Smothered Chicken and Vegetables dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat some oil over medium heat. Add the sliced carrots, celery, and onion, and cook until the vegetables are tender but not browned.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked chicken, condensed cream of celery soup, chicken broth, and any additional seasonings or herbs you prefer.
4. Transfer the vegetable mixture to a large, oven-safe casserole dish.
5. Pour the chicken and vegetable mixture over the vegetables in the casserole dish.
6. Cover the dish with a lid or aluminum foil, and place it in the preheated oven. Cook for about 1 1/2 to 2 hours, or until the chicken is cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
7. Remove the dish from the oven, and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

This dish is a hearty and flavorful meal that can be enjoyed with a side of rice or pasta. The combination of tender vegetables and juicy chicken creates a satisfying and comforting dish that is perfect for a cozy evening at home.

gt:
Cook rice as directed on package, omitting salt.
Meanwhile, cook and stir bacon in large saucepan on medium heat until crisp.
Remove from pan with slotted spoon, reserving 1 Tbsp.
drippings in pan.
Drain bacon on paper towels.
Add onions and carrots to drippings in pan; cook 5 min.
or until crisp-tender, stirring occasionally.
Stir in flour; cook and stir 1 min.
Add broth; stir.
Bring to boil on high heat, stirring frequently; simmer on medium-low heat 10 min.
or until vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally.
Stir in rice, cream cheese spread and pepper.
Cook and stir 3 min.
or until cream cheese is melted and soup is thickened.
Stir in half the bacon.
Ladle soup into soup bowls; top with remaining bacon and chives.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large saucepan, cook the wild rice according to package instructions. This typically involves boiling the rice in water until it is cooked through and has a slightly chewy texture.
3. While the rice is cooking, chop the bacon into small pieces.
4. In a large skillet, cook the chopped onions and carrots over medium heat until they are tender.
5. In a small bowl, mix the flour with the pepper.
6. In the same skillet, cook the chopped bacon until it is crispy. Remove the bacon from the skillet and set aside.
7. In the same skillet, cook the onions and carrots until they are tender.
8. Add the cooked wild rice to the skillet and stir to combine.
9. Pour in the fat-free reduced-sodium chicken broth, and stir to combine.
10. Add the PHILADELPHIA Cream Cheese Spread to the skillet, and stir to combine.
11. Bring the mixture to a simmer, and then reduce the heat to low.
12. Cook the soup for about 15-20 minutes, or until the cream cheese is melted and the soup is heated through.
13. Season the soup with additional pepper, if desired.
14. Serve the Creamy Wild Rice Soup hot, garnished with chopped fresh chives.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Grease and flour a 9x13 inch baking pan.
In double boiler over low heat, melt the chocolate and butter together, stirring frequently until smooth.
Remove from heat and let cool.
In a large mixing bowl, mix together eggs, vanilla, salt and sugar.
Beat with an electric mixer for 8 to 10 minutes.
Slowly pour in chocolate mixture and flour.
Stir in the walnuts.
Spread batter evenly in the prepared pan
Bake for 17 to 20 minutes in the preheated oven, until the top is crackled.
Let cool for 2 hours before cutting into squares.
pred:
To cook a delicious Better than Grandma's Brownies dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, melt the 6 squares of unsweetened chocolate in a double boiler or a heat-resistant bowl set over a pot of simmering water.
3. Once the chocolate is melted, remove it from the heat and let it cool slightly.
4. In a separate bowl, beat the butter until it is soft and creamy.
5. Add the beaten eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
6. Add the vanilla extract and mix well.
7. Gradually add the flour, sugar, and salt to the chocolate mixture, stirring until well combined.
8. Fold in the chopped walnuts.
9. Pour the batter into a greased 9x9 inch baking dish.
10. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the dish comes out clean.
11. Allow the brownies to cool completely in the pan before cutting them into squares.

These steps will result in a delicious and fudgy Better than Grandma's Brownies dish, perfect for sharing with family and friends.

gt:
Heat broiler.
Melt 3 Tbsp.
butter.
Place fish on rack of broiler pan sprayed with cooking spray.
Broil 5 to 6 min.
on each side or until fish flakes easily with fork, brushing frequently with melted butter.
Cook and stir celery, onions and peppers in remaining butter in medium skillet on medium heat 3 to 5 min.
or until crisp-tender.
Stir in flour until blended.
Add tomatoes and VELVEETA; cook on low heat until VELVEETA is completely melted, stirring occasionally.
Serve over fish.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, melt 1/3 cup of butter over medium heat. Add the chopped celery, onions, and green peppers. Cook until the vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the chopped tomatoes and cook for an additional 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally.
4. In a small bowl, mix together the flour and the remaining 1/3 cup butter. Gradually add the milk, stirring constantly, until the mixture reaches a smooth, creamy consistency.
5. Add the cream mixture to the skillet with the vegetables, stirring to combine. Cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce thickens slightly.
6. Season the mixture with salt, pepper, and any other desired seasonings.
7. Place the ocean perch fillets on a baking sheet, and pour the sauce over the top.
8. Bake the fillets in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until they are cooked through and flake easily with a fork.
9. Remove the fillets from the oven, and let them rest for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Creole Fish Fillets!

gt:
Blend all ingredients and enjoy!
You can add more ice or milk to achieve the desired thick or thinness of your smoothie, I know everyone is different in preference!
Use regular milk if you want to amp up the protein a bit.
pred:
To craft a Wild Blueberry Snack Smoothie, follow these steps:

1. In a blender, combine 1 cup of Frozen Wild Blueberries and 1/2 cups of Cottage Cheese.
2. Add 1/2 cups of Unsweetened Vanilla Flax Milk (or another non-dairy milk) to the blender.
3. Blend the ingredients until smooth and creamy.
4. Optionally, add a pinch of salt and a drizzle of honey for extra flavor.
5. Pour the smoothie into a glass and enjoy your Wild Blueberry Snack Smoothie.

This Wild Blueberry Snack Smoothie is a delicious and nutritious treat that combines the natural sweetness of the blueberries with the creaminess of the cottage cheese and the smoothness of the non-dairy milk. The smoothie is not only easy to make but also provides essential nutrients, such as vitamins and minerals, making it a healthy snack option.

gt:
Place apples in pie shell.
Combine sugar, cream and flour, pour over apples; sprinkle with cinnamon.
Bake at 400'F for 10 minutes.
Reduce to 375'F for 35-40 minutes or until pie is set in center.
Serve warm or cold.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the sliced apples, sugar, and cinnamon. Mix well.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk the heavy cream until it reaches the desired consistency.
4. Add the whisked cream to the apple mixture and mix well.
5. Add the flour to the mixture and mix until combined.
6. Pour the mixture into a pie crust and bake for 45-50 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbly.
7. Allow the pie to cool for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Mix the first 6 ingredients together until combined.
Slowly add the water until you form a dough.
You may have to add more or less water to form the ball.
Roll out the dumpling dough on a floured surface thin and cut into bite size pieces.
Drop them one at a time into simmering chicken/broth.
She would always drop a few then wait a bit, then drop a few more.
She said this kept them from sticking together in the end.
After they are all added, give a gentle stir (once or twice around the pot, then leave it alone).
Let the dumplings simmer in the chicken/broth mixture until they float to the top (about 15 minutes or so).
I have let them simmer a longer, and that's fine.
She would taste the broth one last time after the dumplings were done for seasoning before we got to eat them!
pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, Crisco, salt, and pepper.
2. Gradually add the water to the flour mixture, stirring until a smooth dough forms.
3. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic.
4. Cover the dough with a damp cloth and let it rest for 30 minutes.
5. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
6. On a floured surface, roll out the dough to your desired thickness.
7. Cut the dough into small circles or use a cookie cutter to create the desired shape.
8. Place the dumplings on a greased baking sheet.
9. Bake the dumplings for 20-25 minutes, or until they are golden brown.
10. Serve the Grandma's Dumplings with your favorite dipping sauce or gravy.
