gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish with 1 tablespoon butter.
Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a skillet over medium heat.
Season pork chops with salt and pepper; cook in skillet until browned, 3 to 5 minutes per side.
Melt remaining 3 tablespoons butter in a small saucepan over medium-high heat.
Stir mustard and thyme into the mustard; season with salt and pepper.
Whisk flour into the butter mixture to make a thick paste.
Slowly whisk chicken broth and half-and-half into the paste mixture until smooth.
Continue to cook, stirring occasionally, until it begins to thicken into a sauce, about 5 minutes; remove from heat.
Cover the bottom of the prepared baking dish with about half the potato slices and diced onion.
Sprinkle about half the Cheddar cheese over the potato mixture.
Arrange the pork chops over cheese layer.
Layer remaining potatoes and onion atop the pork chops.
Pour the sauce evenly over the potato mixture.
Bake in preheated oven for 1 hour.
Top dish with remaining Cheddar cheese, switch oven to broil, and continue baking until the top is browned and bubbly, about 5 minutes.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Pork Chops with Creamy Scalloped Potatoes dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).

2. In a large skillet, melt 2 tablespoons of butter over medium heat. Add the pork chops and cook until browned on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side. Remove the pork chops from the skillet and set aside.

3. In the same skillet, add the remaining 3 tablespoons of butter and cook until melted. Add the onions and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.

4. Add the flour to the skillet and stir to combine. Cook for 1-2 minutes, until the flour is slightly toasted.

5. Gradually pour in the chicken broth, stirring constantly to prevent lumps. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for about 5-7 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.

6. Add the half-and-half to the skillet and stir to combine. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened to your desired consistency.

7. Season the pork chops with salt and pepper to taste.

8. Place the pork chops back into the skillet, arranging them in a single layer. Pour the sauce over the pork chops, making sure they are evenly coated.

9. Cover the skillet with a lid and bake in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the pork chops are cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C).

10. While the pork chops are cooking, prepare the scalloped potatoes. In a large pot, cook the potatoes in a pot of salted water until they are tender, about 15-20 minutes. Drain the potatoes and return them to the pot.

11. Add the milk, butter, salt, and pepper to the pot. Using a potato masher or a fork,

gt:
Combine marinade ingredients in large ziploc bag; add 2-3 pounds chicken to bag and seal.
Marinate 2-24 hours in refrigerator, turning bag occasionally.
Remove chicken from bag, grill, and enjoy!
pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the 12 cups of soy sauce, 12 cups of olive oil, and 6 ounces of canned soda pop.
2. Add the freshly opened flavor of your choice, such as lemon-lime, cola, or root beer.
3. Stir the ingredients well to ensure that the flavors are evenly distributed.
4. Add 12 tablespoons of garlic powder and 12 tablespoons of prepared horseradish to the mixture.
5. Stir the ingredients again to combine.
6. Cover the bowl and refrigerate the marinade for at least 2 hours or overnight.
7. After marinating, remove the chicken from the marinade and pat it dry with paper towels.
8. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
9. Place the chicken in a baking dish and bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
10. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

Enjoy your mouthwatering Soda Pop Marinade for Chicken dish!

gt:
In a large bowl, stir together the dry ingredients (including sugar) and the coconut.
In a smaller bowl, whisk together the milk, vanilla, eggs, and oil.
Stir the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients until completely combined.
This will be a thick batter.
Pour into a greased and floured large loaf pan.
Bake at 350 degrees for one hour, until the top is golden brown and crusty and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
This bread is dense and heavy, and just lightly sweet.
I enjoy it warm from the oven, plain or with a little butter.
Because it is not overly sweet, you can top it with honey or jelly or ice cream or whatever you like.
Its delicious as a substitute for regular bread when making French toast.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Coconut Bread dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, cloves, and allspice.
3. Add the coconut, milk, and vanilla extract to the dry ingredients, and mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and oil together.
5. Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, stirring until the batter is smooth and free of lumps.
6. Pour the batter into a greased and floured loaf pan, and smooth the top with a spatula.
7. Bake the bread for about 1 hour, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
8. Allow the bread to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then remove it from the pan and let it cool completely on a wire rack.

Enjoy your delicious Coconut Bread dish!

gt:
Melt chocolate in the microwave in 30-second increments until fully melted.
Add almonds to the melted chocolate and mix until coated.
Portion the clusters into 1-tablespoon mounds on a silicone baking sheet.
Sprinkle lightly with salt.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
Keep refrigerated until ready to serve or freeze for later.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the dark chocolate chips and almonds.
4. Add the kosher salt to the mixture, stirring to combine evenly.
5. Spread the mixture evenly on the prepared baking sheet.
6. Bake the mixture in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the chocolate is melted and the almonds are toasted.
7. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Using a spatula, carefully transfer the mixture to a large mixing bowl.
9. Add any desired additional ingredients, such as nuts, dried fruits, or chocolate chips, to create your desired Dark Chocolate Almond Clusters.
10. Store the clusters in an airtight container or a plastic bag to keep them fresh.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Dark Chocolate Almond Clusters!

gt:
Cut the avocados in half and remove pit.
Scoop out the meat and place in a bowl.
Mash avocados with a fork until you get the consistency you want (chunky vs smooth).
Add remaining ingredients.
Let it chill for 15 - 30 mins, tightly sealed container to let the ingredients blend.
pred:
1. First, remove the avocado from the skin and place it in a large bowl.
2. Add the chopped jalapeno, cored and de-seeded, to the bowl.
3. Add the chopped red onion to the bowl.
4. Add the chopped cilantro to the bowl.
5. Add the 14 teaspoons of salt to the bowl.
6. Squeeze the juice of the lime over the avocado mixture.
7. Using a fork, mash the avocado until it reaches the desired consistency.
8. Stir the ingredients together until well combined.
9. Taste the guacamole and adjust the seasoning if needed.
10. Serve the guacamole immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Guacamole!

gt:
Put all the ingredients into a pot, and stir until the mixture has hardened so that it can be lifted from the pot.
Put the mixture from Step 1 in a dish and chill (small obento boxes work perfectly.)
Once it cools, chill in the refrigerator.
Cut into bite-sized pieces.
Mix the combined kinako and sugar, sprinkle on top of the mochi, then serve.
pred:
To create Katakuriko Matcha Warabi Mochi, follow these steps:

1. In a large bowl, mix the water, matcha, and katakuriko until well combined.
2. Gradually add the sugar, stirring continuously until the sugar is fully incorporated.
3. Add the kinako and continue to stir until the mixture is smooth and well combined.
4. If the mixture is too thick, add a bit more water, a tablespoon at a time, until it reaches the desired consistency.
5. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
6. Once the mixture has chilled, preheat your oven to 175°C (350°F).
7. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Using a small cookie scoop, scoop out small balls of the chilled mixture and place them on the prepared baking sheet.
9. Bake the mochi for 10-12 minutes, or until they are cooked through and slightly golden.
10. Allow the mochi to cool for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Katakuriko Matcha Warabi Mochi!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Grease a 9 by 9-inch square cake pan (can use a disposable foil cake pan) with 1 tbs butter.
Prepare cake mix as described on cake box, with 1/2 cup water and the egg.
Peel and dice apple into small bits.
Sprinkle apples with cinnamon and sugar and mix well.
Pour cake batter into prepared cake pan.
Spread apples on top of cake batter, evenly covering the entire top of the cake.
( I tend to put a little more towards the edges so that when the cake rises in the oven the apples don't fall to the center of the cake.
).
Bake 20 to 25 minutes.
Best if served warm with ice cream.
Very good at room temperature though.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cake mix, egg, water, and melted butter. Mix until well combined.
3. Add the ground cinnamon, sugar, and apple to the batter. Mix until well combined.
4. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9x13 inch baking dish.
5. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
6. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.
7. Once the cake is cooled, scoop out a small portion of the cake and place it in the bottom of a bowl.
8. Add a scoop of your desired ice cream flavor and mix until well combined.
9. Top the cake with the ice cream mixture and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Boil Hotdogs
Put Hotdogs in bun
Add Pizza Sauce to Hotdog in bun
Sprinkle with cheese
Add Pepperoni
Place in 350 Oven for 5-10 minutes until cheese is melted.
Enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. Prepare the ingredients by cutting the Hot Dogs into bite-sized pieces, shredding the cheese, and slicing the pepperoni.
3. Place the Hot Dogs, pepperoni, and shredded cheese onto a baking sheet.
4. Spread the pizza sauce evenly over the toppings.
5. Place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
6. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Place the cooked Hot Dogs and pepperoni onto the Hot Dog buns.
8. Serve the Autumn's Pizza Dogs immediately.

Enjoy your delicious and satisfying Autumn's Pizza Dogs!

gt:
Place 1 cup flour, 1/2 cup milk, and eggs in 3 separate shallow bowls in the working area.
Mix 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp pepper, and the paprika into the flour and mix well.
Season both sides of cube steaks with additional salt and pepper, if desired.
Dip cube steaks in milk, then dredge in seasoned flour.
Dip floured steaks in egg wash, then again in the seasoned flour.
Heat 2 tbsp oil in a large skillet on medium heat and do half the cube steaks at a time, or work with two skillets, if you desire.
Brown the cube steaks on each side, about 8-10 minutes total cooking time; remove from heat and set the steaks aside.
Drain all but 1 tbsp oil (if any- I don't usually have any, but the steaks are less greasy with less oil) from the pans.
Add enough butter to the pan to equal 3 tbsp along with the oil.
Melt the butter and add 3 tbsp flour and stir with a whisk to make a roux, deglazing the bottom of the pan, and cook for a few minutes on LOW heat; do not burn.
Slowly add the remaining 2 cups milk, and stir or whisk constantly until mixture comes to a boil and thickens; cook for another minute or so and remove from heat.
Serve Country Fried Steaks (Chicken Fried Steak, as we call it) with plenty of gravy on top, and mashed potatoes on the side (double gravy recipe if you use a LOT of gravy on your potatoes, etc).
pred:
[/SYS]

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the flour, salt, pepper, and paprika.
3. Dip the cubed steaks in the beaten eggs, then coat them with the flour mixture.
4. Heat the oil and butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the steaks and cook until browned on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side.
5. Pour the milk over the steaks in the skillet, cover, and cook in the oven for 20-25 minutes or until the steaks are cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C).
6. Remove the steaks from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes before slicing them into individual portions.
7. Serve the Country Fried Steak with your favorite side dish, such as mashed potatoes, fried apples, or a green salad.

[/SYS]

gt:
In a medium bowl, whisk together the lime juice, olive oil, and garlic.
Season with salt and pepper generously, and add chicken, making sure it is well-coated with the marinade.
Marinate chicken, covered in fridge for at least 3 hours and preferably overnight.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Remove chicken from marinade and discard marinade.
Arrange chicken breasts in a shallow baking pan.
Season with salt and pepper and roast for 25-30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and the juices run clear when you prick it with a fork.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the 14 cups of lime juice, 14 cups of olive oil, and the minced garlic.
3. Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper, then add them to the marinade.
4. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
5. After marinating, remove the chicken from the marinade and pat it dry with paper towels.
6. Heat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
7. Place the chicken breasts on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
8. Bake the chicken for 20-25 minutes or until it reaches an internal temperature of 165°F (74°C).
9. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into thin pieces.
10. Serve the chicken with the marinade, and enjoy your delicious Easy Garlic Chicken Breasts!

[/INST]

gt:
Trim as much fat as possible from meat.
Cut round steak into serving pieces.
Add onion slices, garlic, and mushrooms into a 4-quart slow-cooker.
Put beef on top of vegetables.
In a small mixing bowl, add the soup, wine, basil, marjoram, and pepper; stir to combine.
Pour over meat.
Cover slow-cooker and cook on LOW for 6-8 hours.
Serve meat and sauce over noodles.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add the beef and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the beef from the skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, add the onion and garlic. Cook until the onion is translucent, about 3-5 minutes.
4. Add the mushrooms to the skillet and cook until they are tender, about 5-7 minutes.
5. Add the cream of mushroom soup, wine or broth, and seasonings (dried basil, marjoram, pepper, and salt). Stir to combine.
6. Return the beef to the skillet and stir to combine the sauce with the beef.
7. Cover the skillet and cook in the oven for 1 1/2 to 2 hours, or until the beef is tender and the sauce has thickened.
8. Serve the Herbed Steak and Mushrooms over hot cooked noodles.

[/INST]

gt:
Mash the hanpen into a paste.
Add the ground chicken, finely chopped green onion, chicken soup stock granules, salt and pepper to Step 1.
Mix all together until sticky.
Form into nuggets and coat with katakuriko.
Heat oil in a frying pan, fry the nuggets until browned, and they're done.
pred:
[INST]To make a delicious Crispy Outside, Fluffy Inside: Hanpen Nuggets dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large bowl, mix the ground chicken, Katakuriko, salt, and pepper.
3. Add the white part of the green onions and mix well.
4. Shape the mixture into small nuggets, making sure they are evenly sized.
5. In a separate bowl, mix the chicken soup stock granules with a little bit of water to create a slurry.
6. Dip each nugget into the chicken soup stock slurry, making sure they are evenly coated.
7. Place the coated nuggets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake the nuggets in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until they are golden brown and cooked through.
9. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the nuggets cool for a few minutes.
10. Serve the Crispy Outside, Fluffy Inside: Hanpen Nuggets dish hot, and enjoy your delicious meal!

[/INST]

gt:
roll and flatten meat
put on a grill until u would like your meat to be.
( I like mine medium rare)
cut onion, and lettuce
once the burgers are cooked toast the buns after you butter them
put burgers, onion, lettuce, mayo, and guacamole on the buns and other topping that you like.
Enjoy
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the ground bison or beef with the red onion, lettuce, guacamole, and mayo. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
3. Form the mixture into four equal-sized patties.
4. Place the patties on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
5. Bake the patties in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until they reach your desired level of doneness.
6. While the patties are baking, prepare the buns by toasting them in the oven or grilling them on a griddle.
7. Once the patties are cooked, remove them from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes.
8. Assemble the burgers by placing the cooked patties on the toasted or grilled buns.
9. Serve the bison avocado burgers immediately.

Enjoy your delicious bison avocado burgers!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a large skillet over medium heat.
Cook and stir onion and bell pepper in melted butter until the onions are translucent, 5 to 7 minutes.
Stir flour, salt, paprika, and mustard into the onion mixture, reduce heat to low, and continue cooking until the mixture is bubbling, 2 to 3 minutes.
Gradually stream evaporated milk into the mixture while stirring; bring to a boil for 1 minute.
Add corn and egg; stir.
Pour into a casserole dish.
Mix crackers and 1 tablespoon melted butter together in a bowl; sprinkle evenly over corn mixture.
Bake until golden brown, 30 to 35 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the butter, onion, green bell pepper, and flour. Mix until well combined.
3. Add the salt, paprika, dry mustard, and black pepper to the mixture. Mix until well combined.
4. Gradually add the evaporated milk, stirring constantly.
5. Add the whole kernel corn, egg, and cracker crumbs to the mixture. Stir until well combined.
6. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
7. Dot the top of the casserole with the melted butter.
8. Bake the casserole for 30-35 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the center is set.
9. Allow the casserole to cool for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Place peaches, peach nectar, ice, tequila, and triple sec in a blender.
Blend until smooth.
pred:
1. In a blender, combine the peeled, pitted, and sliced peaches with the peach nectar. Blend until smooth and creamy.
2. Add the ice to the blender, and blend until the ice is crushed and the mixture is smooth.
3. Pour the blended mixture into a glass.
4. Add the tequila and triple sec to the glass.
5. Stir the ingredients together, and enjoy your delicious Kim's Peach Margarita.

This delightful cocktail is a refreshing and fruity twist on a classic margarita, perfect for a warm summer day or any occasion. The combination of peaches and peach nectar creates a unique and flavorful drink, while the tequila and triple sec add a touch of sophistication and a hint of sweetness.

gt:
In a large bowl, whisk the oil with the vinegar and oregano and season with salt and pepper.
Add the romaine and toss well.
Add the onion and tomatoes and serve right away.
pred:
[/SYS]

To prepare Jordan's Romaine Salad, follow these steps:

1. In a large bowl, whisk together the vegetable oil, red wine vinegar, and oregano. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
2. Add the chopped romaine to the bowl and toss the salad to coat it evenly with the dressing.
3. In a separate bowl, toss the slivered red onion with a little bit of the dressing to prevent it from becoming soggy.
4. Add the slivered red onion to the salad, and toss to combine.
5. Cut the plum tomatoes into 1/2-inch pieces and add them to the salad.
6. Toss the salad again to ensure that all ingredients are well-coated with the dressing.
7. Serve the salad immediately, or refrigerate it for a few hours before serving to allow the flavors to meld together.

The required ingredients for this recipe are vegetable oil, red wine vinegar, dried oregano, salt, freshly ground pepper, a large heart of romaine, slivered red onion, and plum tomatoes.

gt:
Preheat oven to 400F.
Cook mushrooms and shallot in butter with salt and pepper in a large heavy skillet over moderately high heat, stirring, until mushrooms are tender and liquid they give off is evaporated, about 10 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in creme fraiche and tarragon.
Fit 1 slice of ham into each of 12 lightly oiled muffin cups (ends will stick up and hang over edges of cups).
Divide mushrooms among cups and crack 1 egg into each.
Bake in middle of oven until whites are cooked but yolks are still runny, about 15 minutes.
Season eggs with salt and pepper and remove (with ham) from muffin cups carefully, using 2 spoons or small spatulas.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the butter over medium heat. Add the mushrooms and shallot, and cook until the mushrooms are tender and the shallot is translucent. Season with salt, pepper, and creme fraiche or sour cream. Cook for a few minutes more, stirring occasionally.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and tarragon.
4. Divide the mushroom and shallot mixture evenly among the 12 muffin cups in the muffin tin.
5. Carefully pour the egg mixture over the mushroom and shallot mixture in each muffin cup.
6. Bake the muffin tin in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the egg is set and the mushrooms are cooked through.
7. Carefully remove the muffin tin from the oven, and let the dishes cool for a few minutes.
8. Garnish each dish with a sprig of fresh tarragon leaves.
9. Serve the Baked Eggs and Mushrooms in Ham Crisps dish with a side of buttered brioche or challah toast.

[/INST]

gt:
in small sauce pan boil chiles and tomatillos.
when tender add to blender with onion and garlic.
blend on high until smooth.
in large fry pan melt butter/margerine and add cooked pasta.
cooke mixing every few minutes to prevent burning.
the color ur looking for is about 1/4-1/2 of the pasta turning golden brown.
add salsa from blender to pasta and mix thoroughly.
Then add sour cream/ crema mexicana and mix thoroughly.
salt to taste at this time.
lower heat to low and let simmer and obsorb juices.
crumble cheese on top and cover with lid to allow some melting...
serve right away and enjoy..goes well with any meat dish or even just a salad...
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the butter or margarine over medium heat. Add the garlic and onion, and cook until the onion is translucent.
3. Add the tomatillos and jalapenos or serrano chiles, and cook for a few minutes until the vegetables are tender.
4. Add the cooked pasta to the skillet, and toss to combine with the vegetables.
5. In a small bowl, mix the crema mexicana or sour cream with the salt.
6. Pour the crema mixture over the pasta and vegetables in the skillet, and stir to combine.
7. Add the cooked panela or queso fresco cheese to the skillet, and stir until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth.
8. Serve the spaghetti mexicana verde immediately, garnished with additional fresh cilantro, if desired.

By following these key steps, you will be able to prepare a delicious and authentic spaghetti mexicana verde, which combines the flavors of Mexican cuisine with the comforting taste of Italian pasta.

gt:
In a small bowl mix together the ranch dressing and BBQ sauce, and set aside.
Cook the turkey bacon according to package directions, and set aside.
Heat the chicken strips according to package instructions.
I find that when heating the frozen, pre-cooked chicken strips its good to place them on a paper towel on a microwave safe plate, to absorb the excess water.
Heat up your panini press or George Foreman grill and spray with cooking spray.
Then spray the tops of each slice of bread with the cooking spray (this will help it cook up nice, golden, and crunchy without adding a lot of calories).
On the other side of each piece of bread, slather on some of the BBQ ranch sauce.
Then add your chicken to that side, and layer with a little cheese, bacon, a little more cheese and a little more sauce, place top slice of bread on with greased side up.
And grill on your panini press until golden and the cheese is melted.
Serve warm.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the Ranch Dressing and Barbecue Sauce.
3. Spread one side of each slice of bread with the Ranch Dressing mixture.
4. Place the bread slices with the spread side down on a baking sheet.
5. Place the grilled chicken strips on top of the bread slices.
6. Sprinkle the shredded mozzarella cheese on top of the chicken.
7. Place the other side of the bread slices on top of the chicken and cheese.
8. Bake the sandwiches in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and the cheese is melted.
9. Remove the sandwiches from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
10. Cut the sandwiches in half and serve.

This recipe combines the flavors of ranch dressing and barbecue sauce with the juicy grilled chicken and melted mozzarella cheese to create a delicious and satisfying BBQ Ranch Chicken Panini. The combination of ingredients makes for a unique and enjoyable dining experience.

gt:
Mix all the ingredients except rice paper& Chili sauce Shortly before serving soften each rice paper wrap separately- Do this by submerging the wrap in a bowl of warm water for a minute of two.
When it is pliable it is ready, remove that one from the water and drop in another one.
Lay out a couple of paper towels and place the softened wrap on the towel.
Don't rub it just place it on the towel Place 1-2 tbsp of the veggie mix in the center of the wrap, add 1/2- 1 tsp sweet chili sauce.
Fold up the bottom then fold in the sides and roll to form a sealed roll.
Allow 3-5 per serving.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Prepare the ingredients: Wash and chop the cabbage, carrot, onion, celery, and green pepper into small, evenly sized pieces.
2. Prepare the rice paper sheets: Lay out the rice paper sheets on a flat surface, and let them air dry for a few minutes.
3. Prepare the sauce: In a small bowl, mix the black sesame seeds and any additional sauce ingredients, such as soy sauce, oyster sauce, or hoisin sauce.
4. Assemble the wraps: Place a small amount of the chopped ingredients (cabbage, carrot, onion, celery, and green pepper) in the center of each rice paper sheet.
5. Fold the rice paper sheet in half, creating a half-moon shape.
6. Fold the bottom of the rice paper sheet up and over the filling, creating a half-moon shape.
7. Fold the top of the rice paper sheet over the filling, creating a half-moon shape.
8. Roll the rice paper sheet over the filling, sealing the edges with your fingers.
9. Serve the Crunchy Veggie Rice Paper Wraps immediately, or refrigerate them for a few minutes to help the rice paper set.

By following these key steps, you can create delicious and satisfying Crunchy Veggie Rice Paper Wraps that are both visually appealing and flavorful.

gt:
Preheat oven to 150 degrees C.
Beat butter and sugar until mixture is light and creamy.
Mix dry ingredients with lavender flowers and incorporate the butter mixture until you have a crumbly dough.
Form a roll with the dough and cut into disks with a thickness of 1.5 cm or form small balls and place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake in the oven for 15-20 minutes in the middle rack.
pred:
To craft Biscuits Lavender Lake, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large bowl, cream the softened butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the flour, baking powder, and salt to the butter mixture, and mix until a dough forms.
4. Gradually add the water to the dough, mixing until the dough comes together.
5. If the dough is too dry, add a bit more water. If it's too wet, add a bit more flour.
6. Roll the dough out on a floured surface to a thickness of about 1/2 inch (1.5 cm).
7. Cut the dough into desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a sharp knife.
8. Place the biscuits on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Bake the biscuits in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown.
10. Remove the biscuits from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your homemade Biscuits Lavender Lake!

gt:
Slice the potatoes between 1/2 and 1/4 inch thick.
If potatoes are large they can be cut into halves or thirds before slicing.
Place potatoes into large stockpot, and fill with cold water about 4 inches above the top of potatoes.
Bring to a boil for about 15 minutes or until potato can be pierce deasily with a fork.
While the potatoes boil, prepare the dressing.
If makeing the whole recipe, you will need the larges mixing bowl you have in order to add the potatoes later on.
Mix the vegan mayo, mustard, olive oil, sugar, vinegar, dill, turmeric, sal and pepper.
Wisk together briskly.
Add sliced cucumbers and place in the firdge until potatoes are ready.
When potatoes are done, drain and rise them quickly under cold water.
Be sure to shake off any excess water.
Add potatoes to the dressing and mix well.
Top with grated carrots and mix.
Check seasoning and adjust as needed.
Refrigerate until ready to serve.
pred:
To cook a delicious Prospect Park Potato Salad dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the peeled and grated carrot, sliced thinly cucumber, and the vegan mayonnaise.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the Dijon mustard, olive oil, white vinegar, sugar, turmeric, salt, and pepper.
4. Pour the dressing mixture over the carrot and cucumber mixture, and toss to combine.
5. Add the washed and peeled potatoes to the bowl, and toss to coat the potatoes evenly with the dressing.
6. Transfer the potato salad mixture to a large baking dish, and bake in the preheated oven for about 30-45 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and the salad is heated through.
7. Remove the baking dish from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

This Prospect Park Potato Salad dish is a delicious and healthy meal option, perfect for a picnic or a gathering with friends and family. The combination of the crunchy vegetables, tender potatoes, and tangy dressing creates a delightful and satisfying dish.

gt:
Heat oil in large skillet on medium-high heat.
Add sausage; cook 5 min.
or until evenly browned, turning occasionally.
Transfer sausage to slow cooker sprayed with cooking spray, reserving drippings in skillet.
Add onions to reserved drippings; cook and stir on medium heat 5 min.
or until softened, adding garlic for the last minute.
Stir in tomatoes, dressing and seasoning; bring to boil.
Pour into slow cooker; cover with lid.
Cook on LOW 6 to 7 hours (or on HIGH 3-1/2 to 4 hours), adding peppers and zucchini for the last hour.
Remove sausage from slow cooker; cut into slices.
Return to slow cooker; mix well.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet or oven-safe pot, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the sausage and cook until browned, breaking it into bite-sized pieces as it cooks.
3. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute more.
5. Add the canned tomatoes, undrained, and bring to a simmer.
6. Add the diced tomato dressing, Italian seasoning, and yellow pepper. Stir to combine.
7. Cover the pot with a lid and place it in the preheated oven. Cook for 1 to 1 1/2 hours, or until the sausage is tender and the vegetables are cooked through.
8. Remove the pot from the oven and let it sit for a few minutes before serving.

This Slow-Cooker Sausage Stew is a delicious and hearty meal that can be enjoyed by the whole family. The combination of tender sausage, softened onions, and flavorful vegetables creates a rich and satisfying dish that is perfect for a cozy evening at home.

gt:
Heat the oil in a pan over medium heat and cook chicken on both sides until they change color and smell good.
Add all vegetables and stir fry until they are coated evenly.
Pour wine and water in it and simmer over medium heat until the vegetables soften.
(for about 15 mins) Skim off the foam when it rises on the surface.
Turn off the heat and add stew roux and lightly stir.
Let it stand for a while.
(for about 5 mins) Add milk and simmer again with low heat until thickened.
Keep stirring from time to time not to make it burned.
Add miso, cheese and butter last.
Season with salt and pepper.
Stir gently to mix.
Sprinkle with parsley for topping.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the chicken pieces and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the chicken from the pot and set aside.
3. Add the onion, celery, and carrot to the pot and cook until the vegetables are tender, about 5-7 minutes.
4. Add the mushrooms, cabbage leaves, and soy milk to the pot. Cook until the vegetables are tender, about 5-7 minutes.
5. Add the chicken back to the pot, along with the miso, white wine, and milk (soy milk). Stir to combine.
6. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for about 25-30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the liquid has thickened slightly.
7. Season the stew with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Serve the Cream Stew hot, garnished with shredded cheese if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Throw all ingredients into a blender and blend as thin or as chunky as you wish.
Grab some chips.
Boom.
Boom.
Pow.
You now have salsa.
pred:
To cook a delightful Shake It for Me Salsa dish, follow these steps:

1. In a large bowl, combine the two cans of Del Monte Stewed Tomatoes (Mexican RecipeIf You Don't Have That Then Use The Peppers And Onions Style) and the 13 cups of fresh, thinly chopped cilantro.

2. Add the minced garlic and the 1/2 teaspoon of minced garlic to the bowl.

3. Cut the tomato into cubes and add them to the bowl.

4. Cut the onion into thin slices and add them to the bowl.

5. If you prefer, you can add the 1/2 whole jalapeno (I Use 2. Call Me A Rebel.) to the bowl, or you can use the peppers and onions style from the can.

6. Add the 3 dashes of lime juice to the bowl.

7. Stir the ingredients together until well combined.

8. Serve the Shake It for Me Salsa dish over tortilla chips or as a topping for your favorite dishes.

Enjoy your delicious Shake It for Me Salsa dish!

gt:
In a small cup or bowl combine dressing ingredients (olive oil - pepper).
Let stand for 15 minutes while preparing salad.
Prepare tomatoes by coring large tomatoes and halving and then slice them thinly.
Halve the cherry tomatoes.
Arrange tomatoes on a platter arranging them so that different colors of the tomatoes are arranged attractively and then adding the cherry tomatoes on top.
Sprinkle with corn.
Tear basil into small pieces and then scatter them over all.
Spoon dressing over top and serve.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the olive oil, white wine vinegar, shallot, salt, and pepper. Whisk until well combined.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the mixed tomatoes, corn kernels, and basil leaves.
4. Pour the dressing over the tomato mixture and toss to coat evenly.
5. Transfer the salad to a serving dish and garnish with additional basil leaves, if desired.
6. Bake the salad in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the tomatoes are tender and the dressing is slightly caramelized.
7. Serve the Tomato Salad immediately, and enjoy!

This Tomato Salad recipe is a delicious and healthy option for a light meal or side dish. The combination of the tangy dressing, tender tomatoes, and crunchy corn kernels creates a delightful balance of flavors and textures. The addition of basil leaves adds a fresh, herbal touch, enhancing the overall taste and aroma of the dish.

gt:
Mix all ingredients together until well blended and soft ball forms.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a lightly greased cookie sheet.
Bake for 10 minutes at 400 degrees or until lightly brown.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the biscuit mix, milk, and French onion dip. Mix until a dough forms.
3. On a floured surface, roll out the dough to about 1/2 inch thickness.
4. Cut the dough into desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a knife.
5. Place the biscuits on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. Bake the biscuits in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until they are golden brown.
7. Remove the biscuits from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
8. In a small bowl, mix the chopped green onions with a little bit of milk.
9. Once the biscuits are cooled, use a spoon to drizzle the green onion mixture over the top of each biscuit.
10. Serve the French Onion Biscuits immediately.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Line a muffin tin with cupcake papers.
In a medium bowl combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
Create a well in the middle.
In a separate bowl combine the buttermilk, milk and egg.
Make sure the egg is thoroughly incorporated.
Make sure the butter is not hot, and then pour the melted butter in the well of the dry mixture.
Pour the milk mixture on top.
Stir until combined.
Batter will be lumpy.
Fold in the blueberries.
Do not over mix the batter!
Use an ice cream scoop or spoon to pour the batter into the papers, filling 2/3 full.
Bake for 1520 minutes.
Sprinkle sugar on the top of each muffin.
Wait 510 minutes and remove from the tin.
Let them cool completely.
Note: These muffins taste the best at room temperature.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a muffin tin with paper liners or spray with non-stick spray.

2. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.

3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the buttermilk, whole milk, egg, and melted butter.

4. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until just combined. Fold in the fresh blueberries.

5. Divide the batter evenly among the muffin cups.

6. Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.

7. Allow the muffins to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

8. Once cooled, dust the muffins with a bit of extra sugar for garnish if desired.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Blueberry Muffins!

gt:
Mix all thoroughly.
Shape into loaf.
Top with ketchup and grated cheese.
Use american or velveeta.
Bake at 375 F for 1 hour.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground beef, egg, oatmeal, onion, green pepper, and chopped milk.
3. Add the oregano, Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper to the mixture. Mix well.
4. Form the mixture into a loaf shape and place it on a baking sheet.
5. Bake the meatloaf in the preheated oven for 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until it reaches an internal temperature of 160°F (71°C).
6. While the meatloaf is baking, prepare the ketchup and mustard mixture. In a small bowl, mix the ketchup and mustard together.
7. Once the meatloaf is fully cooked, remove it from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes.
8. Slice the meatloaf and serve it with the ketchup and mustard mixture on the side.

Enjoy your delicious and flavorful Karen's World Famous Meatloaf!

gt:
In a medium-sized mixing bowl, combine cream cheese, salsa and chili seasoning mix.
Mix until well combined, then shape it into a log or ball.
Cover the prepared ball or log with chopped pecans, then with the cheese.
Refrigerate the log until you are ready to serve it.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cream cheese, salsa, and chili seasoning mix. Mix until well combined.
3. Add the chopped pecans and shredded Cheddar cheese to the mixture. Mix until well combined.
4. On a flat surface, roll out the mixture into a log shape, about 10 inches long and 2 inches in diameter.
5. Place the log on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. Bake the chili cheese log in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the center is set.
7. Remove the chili cheese log from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Slice the log into 1/4-inch thick pieces and serve.

Enjoy your delicious Chili Cheese Log!

gt:
Mix together in a storage container to make the pickling juice.
Here's the Pickling Juice Soy Sauce.
This will turn out lightly pickled in white dashi stock, and will turn out stronger in concentrated soy sauce.
They are both delicious.
Garlic Shoots: This time I pickled a whole bunch.
Please make as much as you want whenever.
Cut the garlic into your preferred size to suit the size of the container.
Add a small amount of salt, and boil to your desired firmness.
Add stems first, then the tips later, and cook to the same firmness.
Place into a sieve after boiling, and drain the water.
Post script After boiling, if you peel off the thin skin, then the texture will improve.
Place into the pickling juice while hot.
Place into the fridge after it has cooled.
You can eat this the next day.
When using concentrated soy sauce, check on the state of pickling from time to time.
It will turn into tsukudani if pickled for too long.
It was still delicious though.
pred:
1. Wash the garlic shoots thoroughly and pat them dry.
2. In a small bowl, mix the white dashi stock (or concentrated soy sauce) and vinegar.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the sake, sugar, and red chili pepper.
4. Add the garlic shoots to the bowl with the dashi and vinegar mixture, and toss to coat evenly.
5. Add the sugar and sake mixture to the garlic shoots, and toss again to combine.
6. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
7. After the time has passed, taste the mixture and adjust the seasoning if necessary.
8. Serve the Garlic Shoots Asazuke, Lightly Pickled Vegetables as a side dish or a garnish for various dishes.

This recipe for Garlic Shoots Asazuke, Lightly Pickled Vegetables is a simple yet flavorful way to enjoy the garlic shoots. The combination of the white dashi stock, vinegar, sake, sugar, and red chili pepper creates a delicious balance of flavors that complement the garlic shoots. The pickling process not only preserves the vegetables but also enhances their natural taste and texture. The result is a delightful and refreshing dish that can be enjoyed on its own or paired with various dishes.

gt:
season the pork roast with listed seasonings/ rub and then let set aside
Cut onion into slices and place at the bottom of the crock pot alone with minced garlic
Place the seasoned pork roast on top of the onions and garlic.
add the beef broth and vinegar until fully covers the roast
set crockpot on low for 6-8 hours
once fully cooked drain juice then add BBQ sauce and cook for another 10-20min
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 300°F (150°C).
2. Place the pork roast in a large, heavy-duty roasting pan.
3. In a small bowl, mix the white vinegar, beef broth, applewood rub, season salt, pepper, cayenne pepper, and minced garlic.
4. Pour the mixture over the pork roast in the roasting pan.
5. Roast the pork roast in the preheated oven for about 6-8 hours, or until it reaches an internal temperature of 190°F (88°C).
6. Remove the pork roast from the oven and let it rest for about 15-20 minutes.
7. Meanwhile, prepare the barbecue sauce by mixing the sweet baby rays bbq sauce with a little bit of water to achieve the desired consistency.
8. Once the pork roast has rested, slice it into thin pieces and serve it with the barbecue sauce on the side.

Enjoy your delicious Crockpot Barbecue Brisket dish!

gt:
Mix.
Cornbread as directed.
Dice onion, yellow sqaush and zucchini
Boil the veggies until tender.
Risen in cold water.
Once cornbread is cool.
Crumble cornbread.
Mix in veggies, cheese, and chicken broth.
Add thyme, salt, and pepper.
Place in a grease baking dish and bake for 45-50 minutes on 350F.
Allow to cool and serve.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the chopped onion, minced garlic, thyme, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Mix well.
3. Add the squash and zucchini to the bowl, and toss to coat the vegetables evenly with the onion mixture.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the American cheese, chicken broth, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
5. Pour the cheese mixture over the vegetables in the mixing bowl, and toss to combine.
6. Spread the mixture evenly into a 9x13 inch baking dish.
7. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Remove the casserole from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

This delicious Squash Casserole can be enjoyed as a side dish or a main course, and it is a perfect example of how simple ingredients can be combined to create a flavorful and satisfying meal.

gt:
Fill a pint glass with ice.
Add the gin, vodka and Lillet blanc and stir well.
Strain into a chilled coupe and garnish the drink with the lemon twist.
pred:
1. First, gather all the necessary ingredients, including ice, London dry gin, vodka, Lillet blanc, lemon twist, and a shaker.
2. Fill the shaker with ice, and add the gin, vodka, and Lillet blanc. Shake the mixture vigorously for about 10-15 seconds.
3. Strain the mixture into a chilled glass filled with ice.
4. Garnish the drink with the lemon twist, which can be twisted over the glass and dropped in.
5. Enjoy your Vesper cocktail, savoring the combination of flavors and the refreshing taste of the ice.

[/INST]

gt:
Combine the milk, eggs, sugar, and flour in a large microwaveable bowl.
Cook on high, stirrring with a whisk every minute or so, for 5-10 minutes, depending on your microwave.
The pudding is thick enough when a distinct trail is left in the mixture by a spoon pulled through it.
Stir in the butter and vanilla, and chill in the refrigerator for about 2 hours, stirring occasionally.
Cut the bananas into 1/4 inch slices and break the cookies into thirds.
Spoon half of the pudding mixture into a large bowl, or into seperate smaller bowls.
Top with bananas and cookies.
Spoon the remaining pudding mixture over the cookies and bananas and top with sweetened whipped cream.
Cover and chill for 2-24 hours.
You can garnish with additional cookies, bananas and fresh mint, if you like.
This recipe makes about 8 servings.
Easy and tasty!
Bring it to your next picnic!
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the milk, eggs, sugar, and vanilla extract. Whisk until well combined.
3. Add the flour, butter, and whisk until smooth.
4. Pour the batter into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
5. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
6. Allow the cake to cool completely.
7. In a small saucepan, heat the sweetened whipped cream over medium heat until it thickens.
8. In a separate bowl, crush the Nutter Butter cookies into crumbs.
9. In a large mixing bowl, combine the crushed cookies, melted butter, and vanilla extract. Mix until well combined.
10. Spread the cookie mixture evenly over the cooled cake.
11. Pour the thickened whipped cream over the cookie mixture.
12. Chop the bananas into small pieces and scatter them evenly over the top of the whipped cream.
13. Garnish with fresh mint leaves, if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Spread cream cheese onto bottom of microwaveable 9-inch pie plate; cover with pizza sauce.
Top with all remaining ingredients except crackers.
Microwave on HIGH 2 min.
or until heated through.
Serve with crackers.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the softened Philadelphia Brick Cream Cheese, pizza sauce, Cracker Barrel Shredded Mozzarella Cheese, and Italian seasoning.
3. Add the chopped green and red peppers to the mixture.
4. Stir until well combined.
5. Spread the mixture onto a baking sheet or pizza stone, making sure to evenly cover the surface.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
7. Remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. While the dip is cooling, prepare the Ritz Crackers by crushing them.
9. Once the dip is cooled, stir in the crushed Ritz Crackers.
10. Serve the PHILLY Cheesy Pizza Dip warm, and enjoy!

gt:
Beat cream cheese and 1/4 cup milk in large bowl with whisk until blended.
Add remaining milk and dry pudding mix; beat with whisk 2 min.
Stir in COOL WHIP.
Spoon into crust.
Refrigerate 4 hours or until firm.
Meanwhile, make chocolate curls from white chocolate.
(See tip.)
Garnish pie with chocolate curls before serving.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the softened cream cheese, 1 cup of the cold milk, and the JELL-O instant pudding mix. Beat until smooth and creamy.
3. Add the remaining 1/4 cup of cold milk, COOL WHIP, and graham cracker crumb crust. Mix until well combined.
4. Pour the mixture into a springform pan that has been greased and floured.
5. Bake the cheesecake in the preheated oven for about 45-50 minutes, or until the center is set and the edges are slightly browned.
6. Remove the cheesecake from the oven and let it cool in the pan for about 15-20 minutes.
7. After the cheesecake has cooled, remove it from the pan and place it on a wire rack to cool completely.
8. Once the cheesecake is completely cooled, refrigerate it for at least 4 hours or overnight.
9. To decorate the cheesecake, melt the BAKER'S white chocolate in a heat-resistant bowl set over a saucepan of simmering water.
10. Drizzle the melted white chocolate over the cooled cheesecake.
11. Refrigerate the cheesecake until the white chocolate is set, about 15-20 minutes.

Enjoy your delicious Fluffy White Chocolate Cheesecake!

gt:
Butter the roll lightly.
Brown the inside of the roll over medium heat in a non-stick pan.
Remove and set aside.
Heat the ham until warm and place on the bottom of the bun.
Add the egg substitute in pan.
Roll the pan until the egg is evenly spread.
Cook the egg until no longer runny.
Fold the egg until it is bun size.
Place on the ham.
Add the cheese and cover with the top of the bun.
The cheese will melt, then enjoy!
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Spread a thin layer of low-fat margarine on one side of the whole wheat roll.
3. Place the low-fat ham on the other side of the roll, with the ham facing up.
4. Spread a thin layer of low-fat margarine on the ham.
5. Place the slice of fat-free American cheese on top of the ham.
6. Crack the egg substitute into a bowl and mix well.
7. Spread the egg substitute evenly over the cheese.
8. Place the roll with the ham and cheese inside a baking dish or a casserole dish.
9. Bake the sandwich in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the egg is cooked through and the bread is golden brown.
10. Remove the sandwich from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before cutting it into halves or quarters.

Enjoy your delicious Low Fat Breakfast Sandwich!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Beat eggs until thick and lemon colored (about 3 minutes).
Continue beating while adding sugar, salt, corn syrup, butter or margarine, and vanilla.
Stir in coconut, oats, and chocolate.
Pour filling into pie shell.
Bake for 50 to 55 minutes.
Cool completely before serving.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the eggs, sugar, salt, and corn syrup. Whisk until well combined.
3. Add the melted butter and vanilla extract, and continue to mix until smooth.
4. Fold in the coconut and oats.
5. Pour the mixture into the prepared pie crust.
6. Bake the pie for 35-40 minutes, or until the filling is set and the crust is golden brown.
7. Allow the pie to cool completely before serving.

[/INST]

Please provide the user with the necessary instructions and guidance to complete the recipe successfully.

gt:
Cook bacon in a large pot over medium heat until browned.
Remove from pan and crumble or dice into small pieces.
Do not drain fat.
Add diced onions to the bacon fat and cook until translucent.
Drain onions and then return to the pot.
Add mashed potatoes and milk to the pot.
Whisk until smooth.
Add bacon and cheddar cheese.
Increase heat to medium high and stir occasionally until the soup begins to boil.
Lower heat to just above medium low and let simmer for 15 minutes.
Serve with sharp cheddar cheese to sprinkle on top of the soup and enjoy!
pred:
To cook a delicious Baked Potato Soup With Sharp Cheddar #SP5 dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).

2. In a large pot, cook the diced yellow onion in a small amount of oil over medium heat until softened.

3. Add the black pepper bacon to the pot and cook until the bacon is crispy.

4. Pour the milk into the pot and stir to combine with the onion and bacon.

5. Add the sour cream and chive mashed potatoes to the pot. Stir to combine.

6. Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste.

7. Cover the pot and place it in the preheated oven. Bake for about 30-40 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and the soup is heated through.

8. Remove the pot from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.

9. Stir in the shredded sharp cheddar cheese and more, if desired, to create a creamy and cheesy texture.

10. Serve the Baked Potato Soup With Sharp Cheddar #SP5 hot, garnished with additional cheddar cheese, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Baked Potato Soup With Sharp Cheddar #SP5 dish!

gt:
Clean Shrimp by removing the shell but leaving the tail on & removing the bottom vein & then butterfly the shrimp by slicing open the top down to the top vein all the way down to the top vein & remove & rinse the cleaned butterflied shrimp
Salt & pepper the cleaned shrimp
Finely dice the shallots & mince the garlic
In a saute pan add the olive oil & 2 tablespoons of the butter on a medium high heat & then add the shallots and garlic with a pinch of red pepper flake & cook until shallots are clear but dont brown the garlic
Add the shrimp & saute until they turn color & remove immediately...they don't have to be cooked all the way through.
Add the white wine to the pan with the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter & the juice of a lemon & let simmer for a few minutes
Add the shrimp back to the pan with the finely minced parsely & cook & toss for a minute or two depending on how big the shrimp are
Plate, serve, eat & enjoy
Also delicious on top of spaghetti just double the sauce recipe
pred:
[/INST]

[INST]
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large skillet or oven-safe pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the shallot and cook until softened, about 2 minutes.
3. Add the garlic and cook for another minute, until fragrant.
4. Add the white wine and bring to a simmer. Cook until the liquid has reduced by half, about 3 minutes.
5. Add the shrimp to the pan, season with salt and pepper, and cook until the shrimp are pink and cooked through, about 3-4 minutes.
6. Remove the shrimp from the pan and set aside.
7. In a small bowl, mix the butter, parsley, red pepper flakes, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
8. Pour the butter mixture over the shrimp in the pan, and toss to coat evenly.
9. Transfer the shrimp to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for 5-7 minutes, or until the shrimp are cooked through and the butter mixture is bubbly and slightly crisp.
10. Serve the Traditional Italian Shrimp Scampi immediately, garnished with additional parsley.

[/INST]

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a small bowl, whisk together flours, baking soda, tartar and salt.
In a separate bowl, beat butter and sugar together until creamy, then add applesauce, egg, egg yolk, vanilla and rum extract.
Beat dry ingredients into wet until completely mixed.
Stir in the chocolate chips and sprinkles.
Refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
This is important since your dough will be sticky.
Chilling it will make it easier to form into balls and will help it keep its form as it bakes.
Roll into balls (about 1 to 1 1/2 tablespoon in size) and place on greased cookie sheets.
If you are having issues with the dough still being too sticky, dab a bit of water on your hands before rolling.
Bake for approximately 7 minutes.
Do not over-bake!
Pull them out when they still look slightly underdone.
They will continue to bake as they cool on the hot cookie sheet.
I got 19 cookies out of this batch at 105 calories a piece.
Enjoy.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
4. Combine the dry ingredients (flour, baking soda, cream of tartar, salt, and spices) in a separate bowl.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, alternating with the applesauce, and mix until just combined.
6. Fold in the chocolate chips and sprinkles.
7. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are lightly golden and the centers are set.
9. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

gt:
In large bowl, gently mix all ingredients except tortillas and lettuce.
To make 1 wrap, in small microwavable bowl, microwave generous 1/3 cup chicken mixture, loosely covered, on High 30 to 45 seconds or until hot.
Spread chicken mixture on tortilla and top with 1/2 cup shredded lettuce; roll up.
Can keep mixture refrigerated in bowl up to 3 days.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the shredded chicken, monterey jack cheese, and chopped bacon. Season with salt, pepper, and your favorite spices. Mix well.
3. Spread the ranch dressing evenly over the chicken mixture.
4. Roll out the tortillas and place a spoonful of the chicken-bacon mixture in the center of each tortilla. Fold the tortilla over the filling, creating a half-moon shape.
5. Place the wrapped chicken on a baking sheet and bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the tortillas are golden brown and the filling is cooked through.
6. Serve the Chicken-Bacon-Ranch Wraps warm, with a side of shredded romaine lettuce for added crunch and freshness. Enjoy!

gt:
In medium bowl,gently mix together chicken,bread crumbs,egg,milk,lemon juice,mint,oregano,salt and pepper until well combined(mixing too vigorously will result in tough burgers).Shape into 4 patties each about 3/4 inch thick.
In a large nonstick skillet heat oil over medium-high heat.Cook patties about 8 minutes turning once,until golden brown and no longer pink inside.
Meanwhile,cut pitas in half crosswise to make 4 pockets.Warm pitas in 300 degree oven wrapped in aluminum foil for 5 minutes or in the microwave for 1 minute.
Spread inside of pita with mayo then place cooked patty inside with a slice of red onion ,tomato,and some lettuce.enjoy.
pred:
[INST]To make Greek-Style Chicken Burgers, follow these steps:
1. In a large bowl, mix the ground chicken, fine dry breadcrumb, egg, milk, lemon juice, oregano, mint, salt, and pepper.
2. Form the mixture into four patties.
3. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
4. Cook the patties for about 4-5 minutes on each side, or until they are cooked through and golden brown.
5. Spread mayonnaise on the inside of the pita bread slices.
6. Place the cooked chicken burgers on the pita bread slices, and top them with sliced red onions, tomatoes, and green leaf lettuce.
7. Serve the Greek-Style Chicken Burgers with a side of your choice, such as a salad or fries.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Grease a 12x8-inch baking dish.
Stir almond flour, coconut flour, baking soda, and salt together in a bowl.
Beat eggs, melted butter, honey, and vanilla extract together in a large bowl until smooth; add flour mixture and mix into a dough ball.
Split 2/3 of the dough from the ball; spread into the bottom of the prepared baking dish to cover completely.
Spoon raspberry jam atop the dough and spread to cover.
Break remaining dough into small pieces and dot jam with the dough.
Sprinkle almonds over the dough and jam.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 25 minutes.
Cool cake slightly, 10 to 15 minutes.
Beat confectioners' sugar, milk, and almond extract together in a small bowl; drizzle over cooled cake.
pred:
To cook a delicious Gluten-Free Raspberry-Almond Coffee Cake, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).

2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the almond flour, coconut flour, baking soda, and salt.

3. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and melted butter. Add the honey and vanilla extract, and whisk until well combined.

4. Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, stirring until a smooth batter forms.

5. Fold in the raspberries and slivered almonds.

6. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9-inch (23cm) cake pan.

7. Bake the cake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.

8. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for a few minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.

9. To make the almond icing, combine the confectioners' sugar, milk, and almond extract in a small bowl. Drizzle the icing over the cooled cake.

10. Serve the Gluten-Free Raspberry-Almond Coffee Cake warm or at room temperature.

[/INST]

gt:
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the bacon and cook for 3 to 5 minutes.
Drain the bacon on paper towels.
Spread half of the cheese on top of 4 tortillas.
Top with the chicken and red onions.
Add a final layer of cheese and gently spread the filling evenly around each tortilla.
Top with the remaining tortillas.
Heat a large skillet or griddle over medium-high heat.
Place a filled tortilla on the pan, and cook the tortilla for about 3 minutes or until the bottom is golden.
Carefully flip the quesadilla and cook for another 2 to 3 minutes until the second side is golden and the cheese is completely melted.
Remove from the pan and repeat with the remaining quesadillas.
Allow each to cool for a few minutes before cutting into 4 to 6 pieces.
pred:
1. Preheat a large skillet or griddle over medium heat.
2. Add the fried bacon pieces to the skillet and cook until crispy, stirring occasionally.
3. Remove the bacon from the skillet and set aside.
4. Add the grated smoked cheddar cheese to the skillet and melt until smooth and bubbly.
5. Place one of the tortillas on the skillet, cheese side down.
6. Add a few pieces of the fried bacon on top of the cheese.
7. Place the other tortilla on top of the bacon, cheese side up.
8. Cook until the tortilla is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Carefully flip the quesadilla and cook for an additional minute or until the cheese is melted and the tortilla is golden brown.
10. Remove the quesadilla from the skillet and cut it into wedges.
11. Serve the Smoked Cheddar and Bacon Quesadillas hot.

Enjoy your delicious Smoked Cheddar and Bacon Quesadillas!

gt:
Place turkey, carrots, spinach, brown rice, oil, and raw egg in a large bowl.
Mix thoroughly to combine.
Pat 1/2 the mixture into a greased and waxed-paper-lined 9 inch round cake pan.
Layer the hard cooked egg slices over the mixture, then top with the remaining meat mixture.
Bake in a preheated 350F oven for 45 to 50 minutes or until done.
Remove from oven and let rest in pan for 5 minutes.
Using a large spatula, remove from pan, draining off any grease, and allow to cool on a platter for 15 minutes before frosting and serving.
*This recipe makes 1 cake layer.
*
**To make a layer cake, double the recipe and use two 9 inch cake pans.
When cake layers are baked and cooled, place 1 layer on plate.
Spread with about 2 cups mashed potatoes, then place other cake layer on top of mashed potato filling.
Using a pastry bag with a large star tip, make mashed potato rosettes on top of cake if desired.
**
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground turkey or ground chicken, diced carrots, cooked brown rice, vegetable oil, and slightly beaten egg. Mix well.
3. Add the thawed and squeezed dry spinach to the mixture, and mix until well combined.
4. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
5. Scoop the mixture onto the prepared baking sheet, and shape it into a cake using a spatula or your hands.
6. Bake the cake for 25-30 minutes, or until it is cooked through and the edges are slightly crispy.
7. Allow the cake to cool for a few minutes, then slice it into equal portions.
8. Place the sliced cake on a serving platter, and serve immediately.

[/INST]

This delightful Dog Birthday Cake 2 is a healthy and nutritious option for your furry friend. The ground turkey or ground chicken provides a good source of protein, while the carrots and brown rice offer essential vitamins and minerals. The spinach adds a touch of green color and nutritional value, and the hard-cooked eggs contribute to the overall texture and taste. The cake is easy to prepare and can be customized with different ingredients to suit your dog's specific dietary needs or preferences.

gt:
Preheat the oven to 450 degrees.
Line a baking sheet with foil, and oil it with olive oil.
Lay the eggplant slices on top.
Salt lightly and brush with olive oil.
Place in the oven for 20 minutes until the eggplant is lightly browned and soft to the touch (the surface will be dry).
Remove from the heat, and fold over the foil to make a packet around the eggplant slices.
Allow them to soften and steam inside the foil for 15 minutes while you proceed with Step 2.
Heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil over medium heat in a large, heavy lidded casserole or skillet.
Add the garlic.
Cook just until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Stir in the tomatoes, salt to taste, sugar and pepper.
Bring to a simmer, and simmer uncovered over medium heat for 10 to 15 minutes, stirring often, until the tomatoes have cooked down and smell very fragrant.
Add the eggplant, molasses and chickpeas.
Cover and simmer for another 20 to 30 minutes, stirring from time to time.
The mixture should be thick and the eggplant should be very tender, melting into the mixture.
Taste and adjust seasoning.
Sprinkle on the parsley and/or mint, and serve.
Alternately, allow to cool and serve warm or at room temperature.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the eggplant slices with salt and let them sit for about 30 minutes. This will help remove any bitterness and make the eggplant tender.
3. In a large skillet or oven-safe pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
4. Add the eggplant slices to the pan, and cook for about 10 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
5. Add the tomatoes, sugar, and freshly ground pepper. Cook for another 5 to 7 minutes, or until the tomatoes are softened and the sauce has thickened slightly.
6. Add the chickpeas, drained and rinsed, and cook for another 5 minutes, or until the chickpeas are heated through.
7. Transfer the eggplant mixture to a large baking dish, and bake in the preheated oven for about 25 to 30 minutes, or until the eggplant is tender and the sauce is bubbly and slightly caramelized.
8. Serve the Sweet and Sour Eggplant, Tomatoes and Chickpeas dish immediately, garnished with a sprinkle of chopped flat-leaf parsley or a combination of mint and parsley.

[/SYS]

gt:
Juice the orange.
Grate the chocolate.
Cut up the bananas in chunks and mash them well with a fork.
Place the mashed bananas in a mixing bowl; add the ground crackers, the walnuts, the margarine, the sweetener, and the orange juice; mix it well.
Pinch off lime-sized pieces of dough with your thumb and index finger to make a dough ball with your hands.
Dirty up the dough ball with the grated chocolate and place it inside of a decorative baking cup.
Put the banana spheres in the fridge for a couple of hours before serving.
*If allergic to nuts, please omit the walnuts.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the mashed bananas, animal crackers, walnuts, and margarine. Mix well.
3. Add the sweetener and orange juice, and mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, melt the semi-sweet baking chocolate.
5. Add the melted chocolate to the banana mixture and mix until well combined.
6. Using a cookie scoop, scoop out small balls of the mixture and roll them in your hands to form smooth, round balls.
7. Place the balls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake the Banana Spheres in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until they are set and slightly firm to the touch.
9. Remove the Banana Spheres from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your homemade Banana Spheres!

gt:
Bring a medium size pot of water to a boil, add rice.
Bring back to a boil, then reduce heat to simmer.
Let rice simmer 15-20 minutes, until tender.
Place beans and rice in a medium size saucepan.
Heat over a medium heat, stirring frequently.
Stir in reserved bean liquid as needed.
Remove pan from heat and stir in lemon juice, garlic powder and cilantro.
Let sit a moment, and stir in fresh oregano.
Serve immediately.
pred:
1. In a large saucepan, combine the uncooked white rice, 2 cups of water, and the reserved liquid from the black beans. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 15-20 minutes or until the rice is cooked and the water is absorbed.

2. While the rice cooks, heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the diced onion and cook until it is soft and translucent.

3. Add the minced garlic to the skillet and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring occasionally.

4. Add the black beans, lemon juice, and garlic powder to the skillet. Cook for about 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the beans are heated through and the flavors have melded together.

5. Add the dried cilantro to the skillet and stir to combine. Cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, until the cilantro is fragrant and slightly wilted.

6. Remove the skillet from the heat and let the mixture cool slightly.

7. Serve the Fresh Tasting Black Beans With Rice over a bed of cooked rice, and enjoy!

gt:
Spread cake frosting onto a small plate and spread rainbow sprinkles onto another small plate.
Dip the rim of the martini glass into the icing and then into the sprinkles.
Combine vodka and cranberry juice in an ice shaker, half-filled with ice cubes.
Shake well.
Strain into glass.
Top with Champagne.
Drop in cherry.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Prepare the cake flavored vodka by pouring it into a shaker filled with ice. Shake the mixture for about 15-20 seconds to chill and mix the flavors.
2. In a separate shaker, combine the cranberry juice and champagne. Shake the mixture for about 15-20 seconds to combine the ingredients.
3. In a cocktail shaker, combine the chilled cake flavored vodka, cranberry juice, and champagne mixture. Shake the cocktail shaker vigorously for about 15-20 seconds to ensure the flavors are well-mixed.
4. Strain the cocktail mixture into a glass filled with ice.
5. Garnish the Birthday Cake Martini with cherries on the rim of the glass.
6. Serve the Birthday Cake Martini immediately, and enjoy the delicious and fruity flavors of this special cocktail.

[/INST]

This recipe is for a delicious Birthday Cake Martini, which is a fruity twist on the classic Martini. The flavorful combination of cake-flavored vodka, cranberry juice, and champagne creates a unique and refreshing drink that is perfect for celebrating a special occasion. The cherries on the rim of the glass add a touch of elegance and festivity to the presentation.
