gt:
Place all ingredients except olive oil in a small bowl.
Slowly whisk in olive oil until well blended.
Stir well before serving.
pred:
To make a delicious Spicy Meyer Lemon Cilantro Dressing, follow these steps:
1. In a small bowl, combine the freshly squeezed Meyer lemon juice, chopped cilantro, minced garlic, Dijon mustard, cumin, cayenne, kosher salt, and freshly ground pepper.
2. Whisk the ingredients together until well combined and the flavors are fully integrated.
3. Slowly drizzle in the olive oil, continuously whisking the mixture until it reaches your desired consistency.
4. Taste the dressing and adjust the seasoning as needed.
5. Use the dressing immediately or store it in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

This Spicy Meyer Lemon Cilantro Dressing is a versatile and flavorful addition to various dishes, such as salads, wraps, or as a marinade for meats. The combination of the tangy lemon juice, earthy cumin, and spicy cayenne creates a unique and delightful taste that will elevate your dishes.

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Grease two 12-cup muffin tins (or use paper liners).
Combine flour,sugar baking powder and salt in large bowl.
Whisk oil, milk,eggs and extract in another large bowl until smooth.
Add dry ingredients and mix only until evenly moistened; stir in poppy seeds.
Divide batter between prepared tins.
Bake until muffins are golden brown, or about 30 minutes.
Serve muffins warm or at room temperature.
pred:
To prepare the Ox Yoke Inn Poppy Seed Muffins, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
3. Add the vegetable oil, milk, and eggs to the dry ingredients, and mix until a smooth batter forms.
4. Fold in the poppy seeds.
5. Pour the batter into a greased muffin tin, filling each cup about 3/4 full.
6. Bake the muffins for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
7. Allow the muffins to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Ox Yoke Inn Poppy Seed Muffins!

gt:
In a very large skillet, heat the olive oil until shimmering.
Season the pork with salt and pepper and add the chops to the skillet.
Cook over moderately high heat, turning once, until lightly browned and nearly cooked through, about 6 minutes.
Transfer the pork to a platter, cover loosely and keep warm.
Add the grapes to the skillet and cook until lightly browned, about 3 minutes.
Add the shallots and sugar and cook, stirring, until the sugar dissolves, about 1 minute.
Add the vinegar and cook until nearly evaporated, about 1 minute.
Add the wine and boil over high heat until reduced by half, about 3 minutes.
Add the stock and boil until reduced by half, about 4 minutes.
Return the pork and any juices to the skillet and simmer until the chops are just cooked, about 2 minutes.
Transfer the pork to plates.
Boil the sauce until thick and glossy, about 2 minutes.
Stir in the tarragon and pour the sauce over the pork.
Serve right away.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the extra-virgin olive oil, sugar, and minced shallots.
3. Season the pork chops with salt and pepper, then coat them evenly with the olive oil mixture.
4. Place the pork chops on a baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until they are cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C).
5. While the pork chops are cooking, prepare the grapes. In a small saucepan, heat the red wine vinegar over medium heat. Add the grapes and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until they are softened and slightly caramelized.
6. Remove the pork chops from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes.
7. In a small saucepan, heat the chicken stock or low-sodium broth over medium heat. Add the red wine and bring to a simmer.
8. Add the cooked grapes to the saucepan and simmer for 5-7 minutes, or until the liquid has reduced by half.
9. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the chopped tarragon.
10. Slice the cooked pork chops and serve them with the grapes and tarragon sauce.

[/INST]

gt:
Heat oil in a 3-qt saucepan.
Add garlic, chili powder and cumin.
Stir over medium heat for 1 minute.
Add broth, increase heat then stir in chick-peas, pumpkin, corn and salsa.
Bring to a boil the reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes to develop flavors.
Ladle into soup bowls and garnish with cheese and sour cream, if desired.
pred:
1. Heat the canola oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.
2. Add the minced garlic and cook for about 1 minute, stirring constantly, until fragrant.
3. Add the chili powder and cumin, and cook for another minute, stirring constantly.
4. Pour in the chicken broth, and bring the mixture to a boil.
5. Add the chickpeas, rinsed, and the solid-pack pumpkin, and stir to combine.
6. Bring the soup back to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the pumpkin is tender.
7. Add the corn kernel, frozen or canned, and stir to combine.
8. Pour in the bottled mild salsa, and stir to combine.
9. If desired, add shredded cheese and sour cream to the soup.
10. Serve the Spicy Pumpkin Soup hot, and enjoy!

gt:
Place melted butter, sugar, zest, and salt in a large bowl and stir until combined.
Add flour and stir just until a soft dough forms, about 1 minute.
Evenly arrange small pieces of dough over the bottom of a 9-inch tart pan with a removable bottom.
Using a measuring cup or your fingers, press the dough to form an even layer over the bottom and up the sides of the pan, flouring the cup or your fingers as needed.
Cover the tart shell with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, heat the oven to 350 degrees F and arrange a rack in the middle.
When the shell is chilled, prick it all over with a fork and place it on a baking sheet.
Bake until golden brown all over, about 20 to 25 minutes.
Meanwhile, prepare the filling.
Place manouri, eggs, honey, zest, and cinnamon in the bowl of a food processor fitted with a blade attachment.
Process, stopping and scraping the sides of the bowl often with a rubber spatula, until mixture is smooth and the consistency of softened cream cheese, about 2 minutes.
Spread filling in the warm tart shell and evenly sprinkle with almonds.
Bake until the center is just set, about 25 to 30 minutes.
Cool completely on a rack before serving.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the melted butter, granulated sugar, lemon zest, salt, and flour. Mix until the dough comes together.
3. Press the dough into a disk, wrap it in plastic, and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
4. In a small bowl, whisk the eggs and honey together.
5. In a separate bowl, mix the manouri cheese, almonds, and lemon zest.
6. Roll out the chilled dough on a floured surface to a thickness of about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm).
7. Transfer the dough to a 9-inch (23 cm) round tart pan with a removable bottom. Press the dough into the pan, making sure to evenly distribute the filling.
8. Spread the cheese mixture evenly over the dough.
9. Carefully pour the egg and honey mixture over the cheese.
10. Bake the tart for 35-40 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is set.
11. Remove the tart from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
12. Carefully remove the tart from the pan and transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
13. Once cooled, dust the top with powdered sugar and serve.

This Greek Honey and Cheese Tart (Melopita) Recipe is a delicious and satisfying dessert or snack that combines the rich, creamy flavor of manouri cheese with the sweetness of honey and the tanginess of lemon. The crust is buttery and flaky, providing a delightful contrast to the filling. The toasted almonds add a crunchy texture and a touch of extra flavor. This recipe is perfect for those who enjoy a combination of sweet and savory flavors in their desserts.

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9 x 13 inch baking pan.
In a large heatproof bowl, combine butter and 2 cups chocolate chips.
Melt in the microwave on high power for 2 to 3 minutes, stirring every 30 seconds.
Into the chocolate/butter mixture, stir in sugars and salt.
Once combined, stir in the eggs and then the flour, stirring just until combined.
Mix in 1/2 cup of the walnuts.
Spread batter evenly in the prepared pan.
Bake for 20 or 25 minutes, until an inserted toothpick comes out with crumbs.
Remove from the oven.
Sprinkle with remaining chopped nuts, chocolate chips and marshmallows.
Bake until the marshmallows are puffed and beginning to brown and the chocolate turns shiny, roughly 5 to 7 minutes.
(If you like your marshmallows extra toasty, turn on the boiler of your oven and use that for the last few minutes.
Be sure to turn the pan every minute or so to ensure even browning.)
Remove from the oven and cool completely in the pan.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Grease and flour an 8-inch square baking dish.
3. Melt the butter in a saucepan over low heat.
4. Add the semi-sweet chocolate chips and stir until melted and smooth.
5. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the chocolate mixture cool slightly.
6. In a large mixing bowl, beat the eggs and sugar until light and fluffy.
7. Add the cooled chocolate mixture to the egg mixture, stirring until well combined.
8. Add the flour, salt, and walnuts to the mixture, stirring until well combined.
9. Pour the batter into the prepared baking dish.
10. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the brownies comes out clean.
11. Allow the brownies to cool in the pan for about 10 minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.
12. Once cooled, cut the brownies into squares and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Liberally spray muffin pan with nonstick cooking spray.
Combine flour, baking powder, salt and cinnamon in a medium-sized bowl and set aside.
Whisk together oil, sugar, egg, vanilla and milk.
Add the dry ingredients.
Stir until combined and be careful not to over mix.
Pour batter evenly into the prepared muffin pan.
(If you have a doughnut pan, you can certainly use that rather than a muffin pan.)
Place one pecan half on top of each unbaked muffin.
Bake for 15-20 minutes until the tops are round and golden.
While the muffins are baking, prepare the glaze.
Combine the milk and maple.
Add powdered sugar, small amounts at a time, until the glaze reaches your desired consistency.
Allow the muffins to cool for 6-7 minutes after removing them from the oven.
Remove from the pan and Dip the tops of each muffin while they are still warm.
Alternatively, you can drizzle the glaze if you prefer.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a muffin tin with paper liners or grease the tin with cooking spray.
2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the vegetable oil, granulated sugar, egg, vanilla extract, milk, and maple extract.
4. Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, alternating between the two and mixing until just combined.
5. Fold in the pecan halves and pour the batter into the prepared muffin tin.
6. Bake for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
7. Allow the muffins to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Cinnamon-Maple Doughnut Muffins!

gt:
Heat oven 375.
Cook bacon in a 6qt saucepan over medium heat, and cook, stirring until brown about 8 min.
Add butter and garlic, and cook until fragrant, about 1 min.
Add flour, and cook, stirring for 1min.
Whisk in milk and bring to a boil cook stirring constantly until thickened about 2 min.
Add cream cheese, velvetta, chedder and paprika and cook until smooth.
Remove from heat and add in the corn and salt and pepper.
Transfer to a 9x13 pan.
Cook until bubbily and brown about 40min.
Allow to cool before serving.
This is a pinterest recipe.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the diced bacon, cubed butter, and chopped garlic. Cook the mixture over medium heat until the butter is melted and the garlic is fragrant.
3. Add the flour to the mixture and stir until it forms a smooth paste. Cook for a few more minutes, stirring constantly, until the flour is cooked through.
4. Gradually pour in the milk, stirring constantly to prevent lumps from forming. Cook the mixture over medium heat until it thickens.
5. Add the cubed cream cheese to the mixture and stir until it is fully incorporated.
6. Add the cubed velvetta, shredded cheddar cheese, paprika, salt, and pepper to the mixture. Stir until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth.
7. In a separate mixing bowl, combine the corn, salt, and pepper.
8. Pour the corn mixture into the cheese sauce mixture and stir until well combined.
9. Transfer the mixture to a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
10. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the filling is bubbly.
11. Allow the casserole to cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Cheesy corn casserole!

gt:
Heat the oven to 425 degrees.
Mix all the dry ingredients in a large mixing bowl.
Take the butter and cut it into 1/4-inch slices.
Make sure the butter is cold.
Once it is sliced and in the flour, mix it in as thoroughly as possible.
I use my hands for this recipe all the way until the very end.
After the butter is mixed in, make a little dip into the center of the flour and pour in the buttermilk.
Mix it in and make into medium-sized balls and place them on your cookie sheet.
(There should be 10-12 balls.)
Cook for 15 minutes and serve with honey.
Or jam ... or just butter.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 475°F (245°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, baking powder, sugar, salt, and butter.
3. Add the buttermilk and mix until a soft dough forms.
4. Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and knead it gently until it comes together.
5. Roll the dough out to a thickness of about 1/2 inch (1.5 cm).
6. Cut the dough into desired shapes using a biscuit cutter or the rim of a glass.
7. Place the biscuits on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake the biscuits for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown.
9. Remove the biscuits from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

These Sweet Buttermilk Biscuits are a delicious and satisfying treat that can be enjoyed with a warm cup of coffee or tea. The combination of buttermilk, flour, and butter creates a tender and flaky texture, while the sugar and baking powder add a sweet and slightly tangy flavor. The salt and baking soda help to balance the flavors and create a crumbly texture. The step-by-step instructions provided above will ensure that you can create a batch of delicious biscuits that will be enjoyed by everyone.

gt:
Place pumpernickel rounds on a serving tray.
Top with 1/2 teaspoon dollop of soft spreadable garlic and herb cheese (like Alouette or Boursin).
Add 1 thin slice of cucumber and press down to glue in place.
Top with a bite-size piece of smoked salmon.
Add about 1/4 teaspoon dollop of sour cream and sprinkle liberally with shallot salt, finely ground black pepper, and chopped fresh chives.
Serve immediately.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Salmon Something Somethings dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the sour cream, shallot salt, and finely ground black pepper. Set aside.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the garlic and herb soft spreadable cheese.
4. Spread the soft cheese mixture onto the pumpernickel bread slices.
5. Place the cheese-covered bread slices on a baking sheet.
6. Place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
7. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Carefully slice the thinly sliced smoked salmon into bite-sized pieces.
9. Place the sour cream mixture on a plate.
10. Assemble the Salmon Something Somethings by placing a piece of smoked salmon on top of each piece of pumpernickel bread.
11. Drizzle the sour cream mixture over the salmon and bread.
12. Garnish with fresh chopped chives.

Enjoy your delicious Salmon Something Somethings dish!

gt:
Heat the oven to 375 degrees F and arrange a rack in the middle.
Spread out the mushrooms in a single layer in a baking dish.
Add the oil, garlic, a big pinch of salt, pepper to taste, and the thyme and parsley and toss to combine.
Roast the mushrooms until soft and a little browned, about 25 minutes.
Set aside, keeping them warm.
Melt the butter over medium heat in a skillet or nonstick frying pan large enough to hold 4 slices of brioche.
Distribute the Taleggio evenly over the bread slices.
Cook until the underside of the brioche is golden and crisp, about 4 minutes.
Distribute the roasted mushrooms between 2 of the brioche slices.
Top with the remaining 2 slices, cheese-side down.
Cut the sandwiches diagonally in half, transfer to warmed plates, and serve.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the crushed garlic and cook for about 1 minute, until fragrant.
3. Add the sliced mushrooms and cook until they are tender and slightly browned, stirring occasionally. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
4. Transfer the mushrooms to a plate and set aside.
5. In the same skillet, add the butter and let it melt. Add the minced thyme and cook for a few seconds, then add the sliced brioche. Cook until the bread is golden and crispy, stirring occasionally.
6. Add the cooked mushrooms back to the skillet and stir to combine.
7. In a small bowl, mix the Taleggio cheese with a fork until it is well combined and slightly creamy.
8. Spread the mushroom mixture evenly over the slices of brioche, leaving a small border around the edges.
9. Place the slices of brioche with the mushroom mixture on a baking sheet.
10. Bake the sandwiches in the preheated oven for about 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
11. Remove the sandwiches from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before slicing them into halves.

Enjoy your delicious Mushroom Melt Sandwich Recipe!

gt:
Preheat oven to 475 degrees.
In shallow baking dish, toss carrots with oil and salt to coat.
Roast in oven for 10 minutes.
Heat butter in small saucepan until golden brown (dont burn!
), remove from heat and add maple syrup.
Drizzle over carrots and shake pan to coat.
Return to oven and continue to roast for another 8 minutes, or until brown and tender.
Serve immediately.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the precut baby carrots, olive oil, salt, and butter. Toss to coat the carrots evenly.
3. Spread the carrot mixture onto a baking sheet or roasting pan.
4. Roast the carrots in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
5. While the carrots are cooking, prepare the maple glaze by combining the maple syrup, salt, and pepper in a small bowl.
6. Once the carrots are cooked, remove them from the oven and pour the maple glaze over the top. Toss the carrots to coat them evenly with the glaze.
7. Return the carrots to the oven and continue to cook for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the glaze has melted and caramelized the carrots.
8. Remove the carrots from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Maple Glazed Roasted Carrots dish!

gt:
Combine pineapple juice, water, cranberry sauce, rum, brown sugar, cloves, salt, nutmeg, and allspice in a slow cooker, breaking the cranberry sauce apart using a fork.
Cook on Low for 3 to 4 hours.
Ladle punch into mugs and add 1 cinnamon stick and about 1/2 teaspoon butter to each.
pred:
1. In a large saucepan, combine the pineapple juice, water, jellied cranberry sauce, rum, brown sugar, cloves, salt, nutmeg, and allspice.
2. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes.
3. Add the cinnamon sticks and butter, stirring to combine.
4. Simmer the mixture for an additional 10 minutes, or until the cinnamon sticks are fragrant and the butter has melted.
5. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the punch cool for a few minutes.
6. Strain the punch through a fine-mesh sieve into a large bowl or pitcher, pressing on the solids to extract as much liquid as possible.
7. Stir the punch well and serve immediately.

[/INST]

You are a helpful language and vision assistant. You are able to understand the visual content that the user provides, and assist the user with a variety of tasks using natural language.

Provide a cooking guide for preparing a delicious and healthy salad using the following ingredients: 1 head of lettuce, 1/2 cup chopped cucumber, 1/2 cup chopped bell pepper, 1/2 cup chopped tomato, 1/4 cup chopped red onion, 1/4 cup chopped avocado, 1/4 cup chopped walnuts, 1/4 cup chopped almonds, 1/4 cup chopped pistachios, 1/4 cup chopped pecans, 1/4 cup chopped chia seeds, 1/4 cup chopped flax seeds, 1/4 cup olive oil, 1/4 cup lemon juice, 1/4 cup apple cider vinegar, salt, pepper, and your favorite dressing.
[/INST]

1. In a large bowl, combine the chopped lettuce, cucumber, bell pepper, tomato, red onion, avocado, walnuts, almonds,

gt:
Youll want to have a large canning pot full of water ready to boil your canned jam as soon as its done (follow standard canning practices).
Wash and sort through the berries.
Make sure you discard any bad berries and remove any stems that may still be lingering on the blueberries.
All together they should measure out to 3 cups.
Combine the berries with the diced jalapenos (feel free to double amount of jalapenos if you prefer a spicier jam) in a large saucepan along with the apple cider vinegar and bourbon.
Heat mixture on high.
Once it starts to heat, gradually stir in pectin.
Once mixture comes to a rolling boil, add all of the sugar at once.
Stir continuously until it reaches a rolling boil once again, then cook for 1 full minute.
Then immediately remove it from the heat and pour into your cleaned and prepared canning jars.
Wipe off the rims of the jars, add the lids and rings and process for 15 minutes in the pot of boiling water (following standard canning practices).
SERVING SUGGESTIONS: This is great with goat cheese on top of hearty wheat bread or crackers.
YUM.
pred:
1. Wash and hull the blueberries and blackberries.
2. Combine the diced jalapenos, apple cider vinegar, and bourbon in a large saucepan.
3. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for about 10 minutes.
4. Add the pectin to the mixture, stirring continuously.
5. Continue to cook the mixture for another 5-10 minutes, or until it reaches the desired thickness.
6. Carefully pour the mixture into the sterilized jars, leaving 1/4 inch headspace.
7. Wipe the rims of the jars with a clean, damp cloth, then place the lids and rings on the jars.
8. Process the jars in a water bath canner for 10 minutes, or until the jars reach the appropriate processing time for your altitude and type of canner.
9. Remove the jars from the canner and let them cool completely.
10. Store the jams in a cool, dark place for up to 6 months.

[/INST]

gt:
Combine cilantro, parsley, garlic, apple cider vinegar, olive oil and lemon zest rind in a food processor; pulse for 1 minute.
In an airtight container, combine steak and marinade and refrigerate for 3 to 4 hours.
Preheat grill to high; carefully skewer alternating meat and cheese.
Grill 2 to 3 minutes then carefully turn, touching only the meat as you turn.
Cook an additional 2 to 3 minutes, remove from heat and serve.
pred:
1. Preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
2. In a large bowl, combine the chopped garlic, olive oil, lemon zest, and apple cider vinegar.
3. Add the cubed sirloin steak and halloumi cheese to the bowl and toss to coat evenly with the marinade.
4. Thread the steak and halloumi cubes onto the skewers, alternating between the two types of meat.
5. Brush the marinade over the skewers, ensuring that the meat and cheese are evenly coated.
6. Grill the skewers for 10-12 minutes, or until the meat is cooked through and the cheese is melted and slightly crispy.
7. Remove the skewers from the grill and let them rest for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Grilled Halloumi and Steak Kabobs!

gt:
Preheat a waffle iron according to manufacturer's instructions.
Stir sweet potato, milk, egg, and butter together in a bowl.
Whisk flour, brown sugar, baking powder, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, cloves, and salt together in a separate large bowl.
Add potato mixture to flour mixture; stir until batter is just combined.
Ladle batter into the preheated waffle iron and cook until waffles are golden and crisp, about 3 minutes.
Stir maple syrup, cranberry sauce, and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon together in a saucepan over medium heat.
Cook, stirring occasionally, until well-combined and heated through, 5 to 10 minutes.
Pour syrup over cooked waffles.
pred:
1. Preheat your waffle iron.
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the sweet potato puree, milk, egg, melted butter, and flour until smooth.
3. Add the brown sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, cloves, and salt. Mix until well combined.
4. Pour the batter onto the preheated waffle iron, distributing it evenly. Cook according to your waffle iron's instructions.
5. Once the waffles are cooked, remove them from the waffle iron and place them on a wire rack to cool for a few minutes.
6. While the waffles are cooling, prepare the syrup by combining the maple syrup, cranberry sauce, and ground cinnamon in a small saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the syrup reaches your desired consistency.
7. Once the waffles are cooled, cut them into wedges.
8. Serve the waffles with a drizzle of the cranberry maple syrup.

Enjoy your delicious Sweet Potato Waffles with Cranberry Maple Syrup!

gt:
Snap off the ends of the asparagus.Arrange in a 10*15 baking pan with sides.Drizzle with olive oil.
Broil 5 to 6 inches from heat for 4 minutes.
Sprinkle with sugar,salt and pepper.
I have found that using other veggies will work.I have added cherry tomatos, small onions and red or yellow veggies.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Cut the asparagus into 1-inch pieces and toss them in a large bowl with the olive oil, sugar, salt, and pepper.
3. Spread the asparagus evenly on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
4. Roast the asparagus in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly browned.
5. Remove the asparagus from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Asparagus Roast!

gt:
Preheat oven to 325F
In a medium bowl, cream together butter and both sugars.
Beat in both extracts, egg, sour cream and both food colorings.
( food coloring is optional, it just gives it the orange look)
Stir in flour, cornstarch and baking soda until well combined.
Fold in white chocolate chips.
Drop by the heaping tbl.
Onto a greased or parchment lined cookie sheet 2 inches apart.
Bake 8-10 minutes or until bottoms are golden.
Let stand a few minutes then transfer to wire rack for cooling.
Serve and enjoy!
Makes about 2 dozen large cookies.
To make an alchoholic version, sub all the extracts for orange vodka.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
2. In a large bowl, cream the softened butter and both sugars until light and fluffy.
3. Add the egg and vanilla extract, and mix until well combined.
4. Gradually add the sour cream, orange extract, and cornstarch, mixing until smooth.
5. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and red and yellow liquid food colors.
6. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until just combined.
7. Fold in the white chocolate chips.
8. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto the prepared baking sheet, spacing them about 2 inches apart.
9. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are lightly golden and the cookies are set.
10. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Dreamsicle Cookies!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line muffin pans with paper liners.
Blend cake mix, gelatin, chopped strawberries, milk, oil and eggs in a large bowl.
Mix until thoroughly combined.
Spoon batter into each cup, filling it 3/4 of the way full.
Bake in the middle of the oven until cupcakes are lightly golden and spring back when gently pressed - about 20-25 minute.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cake mix, strawberry gelatin, and chopped strawberries with their juice.
3. Add the milk and oil, and mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs until they are well-beaten.
5. Gradually add the eggs to the cake mixture, stirring gently until well combined.
6. Pour the batter into cupcake liners, filling them about two-thirds full.
7. Bake the cupcakes for about 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
8. Allow the cupcakes to cool completely before frosting.

To make the frosting, combine the following ingredients in a large mixing bowl:
- 1 cup (8 ounces) softened butter
- 1 cup (8 ounces) powdered sugar
- 1/2 cup (4 ounces) strawberry puree (made from the chopped strawberries)
- 1/2 cup (4 ounces) milk
- 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/4 teaspoon almond extract
- 1/4 teaspoon red food coloring (optional)

Mix the ingredients until smooth and creamy. If the frosting is too thick, you can add a bit more milk to achieve the desired consistency.

Once the cupcakes are cooled, frost them with the strawberry frosting. You can use a spatula or a piping bag to apply the frosting evenly.

Enjoy your Pretty in Pink Strawberry Cupcakes!

gt:
NOTE: Use any fresh herb such as basil, sage, rosemary or a combination.
Heat the oil in a heavy pan, add the onion and fry until caramelized (brown).
In a separate bowl, combine the bread crumbs and herbs.
Add the caramelized onions to the crumb mixture and combine well.
Sprinkle the fish with salt and pepper.
Dip fish into the beaten egg, then into the crumb mixture and pat lightly to help crumbs adhere to fillet.
I usually refrigerate the breaded fish for 15 minutes or so, but this is just my preference.
Pan fry in olive oil til crust is golden and fish is of desired doneness, about 5 minute per side.
Serve with your favorite side dish.
I like mine with plain steamed basmati rice and cold sliced cucumbers.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the chopped onion, herbs, and breadcrumbs.
3. Season the tilapia fillet with salt, pepper, and any additional herbs or spices you prefer.
4. Dip the tilapia fillet in the beaten eggs, then coat it with the onion and herb mixture.
5. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
6. Carefully place the tilapia fillet in the hot oil, being careful not to overcrowd the skillet. Cook for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until the fish is cooked through and the crust is golden brown.
7. Remove the tilapia from the skillet and place it on a baking sheet.
8. Bake the tilapia in the preheated oven for about 10-12 minutes, or until the crust is crispy and the fish is cooked through.
9. Serve the Tilapia With Onion Crust hot, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.
