gt:
Preheat oven to 400F.
Scrub potatoes and prick with a fork.
Bake 1 hour.
Let potatoes cool.
Peel (if desired) and cut into chunks.
Preheat oven to 350F.
In a large bowl, combine remaining ingredients.
Add potatoes and toss gently.
Spoon into a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Bake 40-45 minutes or until hot and bubbly.
pred:
To create a delicious Loaded Baked Potato Casserole, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Wash and peel the potatoes, then cut them into evenly sized pieces.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the potatoes, sour cream, mayonnaise, onion, and bacon bits.
4. Add the melted butter to the mixture, stirring to combine.
5. In a separate bowl, mix the ranch dressing mix with 1/2 cup of water.
6. Pour the ranch dressing mixture into the potato mixture, stirring to combine.
7. Transfer the mixture to a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
8. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for 45-50 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and the top is golden brown.
9. Remove the casserole from the oven, let it cool for a few minutes, then serve and enjoy!

This Loaded Baked Potato Casserole is a delicious and satisfying dish that combines the flavors of baked potatoes, sour cream, mayonnaise, onions, bacon bits, and ranch dressing. The result is a comforting and filling meal that is perfect for gatherings or a cozy night in.

gt:
Bring large pot of water to boil.
Add noodles and cook as label directs; drain and rinse with cold water.
Meanwhile, whisk the lime juice, fish sauce, brown sugar, garlic and Sriracha souce and 1/3 cup of water in medium bowl.
Transfer 1/4 cup of marinade to another bowl and toss with shrimp.
Toss another 1/4 cup marinade with the asparagus and mushrooms in a third bowl.
Let shrimp and vegetables marinate 10 minutes at room temperature.
Toss noodles with the remaining marinade.
Heat grill or grill pan to medium-high.
Grill shrimp, asparagus and mushrooms until shrimp is just cooked through and the asparagus is slightly tender, 2-3 minutes per side.
Half the mushrooms and cut asparagus into pieces.
Divide the noodles among bowls and top with shrimp, asparagus, mushrooms carrot and cilantro.
pred:
[INST]To make the Grilled Shrimp and Noodle Salad, start by bringing a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the rice noodles and cook according to the package instructions until they are tender but still firm. Drain the noodles and set aside.

In a large bowl, combine the lime juice, fish sauce, light brown sugar, and garlic. Whisk until the sugar is fully dissolved. Add the shrimp to the bowl and toss to coat them evenly with the marinade. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 2 hours.

While the shrimp marinates, preheat your grill or grill pan to high heat. Grill the shrimp until they are cooked through and pink, about 2-3 minutes per side. Remove the shrimp from the grill and let them cool for a few minutes.

Next, heat a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add the shiitake mushrooms and cook until they are tender and slightly caramelized, about 5-7 minutes. Add the carrot and cook until it is slightly tender, about 3-5 minutes.

Add the cooked noodles to the skillet and toss to combine with the mushrooms and carrot. Add the cilantro and toss again.

To assemble the salad, divide the cooked noodles and vegetables among four plates. Place the grilled shrimp on top of the noodles and vegetables. Serve immediately and enjoy!

[/INST]

[/INST]

gt:
In large sauce pan melt butter over low heat
Add flour and wisk together to make a rouge
Immediately add half and half and water
Stir constantly until thick adding in nutmeg, garlic powder, and parsley
Add cheese stir constantly until melted and creamy
Serve over pasta or chicken
pred:
1. In a large saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat.
2. Add the flour and cook, stirring constantly, until it turns golden brown. This will take about 2 minutes.
3. Gradually pour in the half and half, stirring constantly to prevent lumps.
4. Add the water, nutmeg, garlic powder, and parsley. Stir to combine.
5. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. Add the shredded asiago cheese, stirring until it melts and the sauce is smooth and creamy.
7. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Serve the Alfredo sauce over your choice of pasta or rice.

[/INST]

gt:
In large saucepan, melt butter over medium-high heat.
Add onion and garlic and cook for 4 minutes, stirring frequently, or until onion is tender.
Reduce heat to medium-low.
Add flour, and cook, whisking constantly for 2 minutes.
Gradually add half-and-half, whisking constantly, for 8-10 minutes or just until mixture comes to a boil.
Remove from heat, and stir in nutmeg, salt and pepper.
Add cheese, stirring until melted and smooth.
Serve with pasta, vegetables, chicken or seafood.
pred:
1. Heat the butter in a saucepan over medium heat.
2. Add the minced onions and cook until they are soft and translucent.
3. Add the minced garlic and cook for an additional minute.
4. Add the all-purpose flour and stir continuously to create a roux. Cook for a few minutes until the flour is lightly browned.
5. Gradually pour in the half-and-half, stirring constantly to prevent lumps.
6. Add the ground nutmeg, salt, and black pepper, stirring to combine.
7. Bring the sauce to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for about 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
8. Gradually add the parmesan cheese, stirring until it is melted and fully incorporated into the sauce.
9. Remove the sauce from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
10. Serve the Garlic Alfredo Sauce over your choice of pasta or rice, and enjoy!

gt:
Combine everything in a bowl, stir until wasabi is thoroughly mixed in.
Refrigerate for at least 10 minutes to let the flavors come together.
Lasts up to 2 weeks in fridge but I doubt it will last that long.
pred:
1. In a small bowl, mix together the yogurt and mayonnaise.
2. In a separate bowl, mix the wasabi paste, minced garlic, and minced ginger.
3. Add the wasabi mixture to the yogurt and mayonnaise mixture, stirring to combine.
4. Taste the sauce and adjust the seasoning if necessary.
5. Serve the sauce immediately, or refrigerate it for later use.

This recipe combines the tangy and creamy flavors of yogurt with the spicy and zesty taste of wasabi paste, creating a unique and flavorful sauce that can be used as a condiment or a base for various dishes. The addition of garlic and ginger adds depth and complexity to the flavor profile, enhancing the overall taste of the sauce.

gt:
Put chopped zucchini, onion, ham and half of cheese in a pan and stir fry with no oil until they wilt and are golden brown Lightly season with salt and pepper.
Mix sauce and step 1's mixture well and put on the scooped zucchini.
Sprinkle with the rest of cheese and toast in the toaster until it becomes golden brown.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
2. In a small bowl, mix the miso, sugar, and mirin.
3. In a large bowl, toss the zucchini, onion, and ham with the miso mixture.
4. Brush the grill or grill pan with a little oil, then place the zucchini mixture on the grill or grill pan. Cook for about 5-7 minutes, or until the zucchini is tender and slightly charred.
5. Remove the zucchini from the grill or grill pan and let it cool for a few minutes.
6. Place the grilled zucchini on a serving plate.
7. Spread the miso cheese sauce over the grilled zucchini.
8. Serve immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Cut artichoke hearts into small pieces.
Mix all ingredients together except paprika.
Put into baking dish and sprinkle paprika on top for color.
Bake at 350 degrees f for 20 minutes or until bubbly.
Serve with crackers or baguette thins.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the mayonnaise or sour cream, parmesan cheese, and garlic powder. Mix well.
3. Add the water-packed artichoke hearts and mix until well combined.
4. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
5. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the dip is hot and bubbly.
6. Sprinkle the top with paprika for added flavor.
7. Serve the Artichoke Heart Dip warm, with pita chips, crackers, or vegetables for dipping.

This Artichoke Heart Dip recipe combines the creamy texture of mayonnaise or sour cream with the rich, nutty flavor of parmesan cheese, and the tangy taste of garlic powder and paprika. The addition of water-packed artichoke hearts adds a unique, earthy flavor and a touch of crunch to the dip. The baking process ensures that the dip is warm and bubbly, making it an ideal appetizer or snack for gatherings and parties.

gt:
Combine potatoes, egg substitute or eggs, water and All-Purpose Original Blend Mrs.
Dash in medium bowl; mix well.
In non-stick skillet or on griddle place approximately 1/4 cup potato mixture; press with spatula to about 4 inches in diameter.
Cook over medium or medium-high heat 4 to 5 minutes on each side or until golden brown.
Repeat with remaining potato mixture.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the shredded potatoes, onions (minced or shredded), and egg substitute or egg.
3. Add water and mix well.
4. Season the mixture with your desired amount of Mrs. Dash seasoning mix or other seasoning to taste.
5. Pour the mixture onto a baking sheet or a greased baking dish.
6. Bake the mixture in the preheated oven for about 30-40 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and the edges are slightly crispy.
7. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Using a spatula or a fork, gently press the mixture to form patties.
9. Serve the Hash Browns (Patties - Low Sodium) Homemade hot, as a side dish or a main course.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Hash Browns (Patties - Low Sodium) and savor the taste of a healthy, homemade meal.

gt:
Mix the flour, wheat bran, wheat germ, brown sugar, cinnamon and salt together with fingers until lumps in sugar are gone.
Add beaten eggs, then oil.
Stir in grated vegetables, nuts, raisins or dates and coconut.
Finally, add the baking soda.
Butter and wax paper line a 9 x 13 inch pan.
Bake at 350F for 1 hour and for 15 minutes more at 300F
Store covered for a few days.
Wheatland Bounty.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Beet and Carrot Whole Wheat Cake, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the whole wheat flour, wheat bran, wheat germ, brown sugar, cinnamon, and salt.
3. Add the eggs, oil, and grated vegetables (half carrots, half beets, or as desired). Mix well.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the raisins (or half of each) or dates (or half of each) and coconut.
5. Add the baking soda to the wet ingredients and mix well.
6. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
7. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9x13 inch baking dish.
8. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. Allow the cake to cool for a few minutes before removing it from the pan and letting it cool completely on a wire rack.

This Beet and Carrot Whole Wheat Cake is a delicious and nutritious dessert or snack that combines the natural sweetness of the vegetables with the richness of whole wheat flour and the crunch of nuts and raisins. It is a healthy alternative to traditional cakes, as it is made with whole wheat flour and contains a variety of nutritious ingredients.

gt:
Start with making a Roux (Ideally you would use a bacon fat Roux with this Gumbo, but it isn't essential)
Cook the Roux while constantly stirring until it reaches somewhere between the colour of peanut butter and chocolate.
The darker it is the richer the taste (can take up to 30mins).
Than add the Holy trinity (onions, bell peppers, celery):
(Ratio of the trinity is 2 parts onion, 1 part celery, 1 part bell pepper.
For 1 litre of stock I use 3/4 of a bell pepper, 2 small onions and 1& 1/2 sticks of celery.
)All finely chopped.
Not chunky.
Saute your aromatics with the roux.
it'll cause a lot of steam and hissing when you first drop it in so make sure you turn the heat down and don't freak out.
When the onions are translucent transfer the mix to a slow cooker and add about a litre of chicken stock and any spices you want.
A good spice mix of salt, black pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne, paprika and a few bay leaves will be fine.
While the Gumbo simmers, brown off some chicken and sausages in a pan.
Ideally you would use andouille sausages but Polish kabanos or kielbasa sausage is a good substitute.
Once the meat has been browned off add it to the gumbo.
When the gumbo is nearly ready (3 to 4 hrs total cook time), add okra or File powder to help thicken the sauce.
Only if needed.
Traditionally serve with rice and a crusty bread roll, but I like mine with home made chips/fries and a pitta bread.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Season the chicken legs with salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne, and paprika.
3. Heat the oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the chicken legs and cook until browned on all sides, about 10 minutes. Remove the chicken from the pot and set aside.
4. Add the sausage to the pot and cook until browned, about 5 minutes. Remove the sausage from the pot and set aside.
5. Add the bell pepper, onions, and celery to the pot. Cook until the vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes.
6. Add the chicken stock, bay leaves, and the seasoned chicken legs to the pot. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 1 hour or until the chicken is cooked through.
7. Remove the chicken from the pot and let it cool. Once it is cool enough to handle, shred the meat into bite-sized pieces.
8. Return the shredded chicken to the pot and stir to combine.
9. In a small bowl, mix the flour with a little bit of water to create a slurry. Gradually pour the slurry into the pot, stirring constantly to avoid lumps. Cook for an additional 5 minutes or until the sauce has thickened.
10. Serve the Gumbo hot over cooked rice or with crusty bread. Enjoy!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Sift together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt and spices, and set aside.
In a separate bowl, beat together the eggs, oil, sugar and pumpkin.
Gradually add the dry ingredients and mix well.
Pour the batter into an ungreased jelly roll pan (17 x 12 inches) and bake for 15-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean.
You can also used a 9 x 13 inch pan and bake for 25-30 minutes.
Let cool on a wire rack and frost.
To make the frosting, beat together the cream cheese, butter, vanilla and milk.
Add the powdered sugar one cap at a time, blending well after each addition.
Add more milk if necessary.
pred:
[INST]To create delicious Frosted Pumpkin Bars, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, ginger, cloves, and nutmeg.
3. In a separate bowl, beat the eggs and then add the vegetable oil, sugar, and vanilla extract. Mix well.
4. Gradually add the pumpkin puree to the wet ingredients, mixing until well combined.
5. Add the softened cream cheese to the wet ingredients and mix until smooth.
6. Gradually add the butter to the mixture, mixing until well combined.
7. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until well combined.
8. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9x13 inch baking dish.
9. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the bars comes out clean.
10. Allow the bars to cool completely before frosting.
11. To make the frosting, beat the powdered sugar, milk, and vanilla extract together until smooth and creamy.
12. Spread the frosting over the cooled bars, and enjoy your delicious Frosted Pumpkin Bars!

[/INST]

gt:
In a medium saucepan, toast the black peppercorns over moderately high heat, swirling the pan, until fragrant, about 3 minutes.
Add the vinegar, 1 1/2 cups of water and the 2 tablespoons of kosher salt and bring to a boil.
Remove from the heat and stir in the carrots.
Let stand for at least 1 hour or up to 1 day.
Meanwhile, in a small skillet, toast the cumin seeds over moderately high heat, swirling the pan often, until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
Pour the seeds into a blender.
Add 1/2 cup of the parsley leaves, the chopped carrot tops, cilantro leaves, chile, garlic and ice.
Blend into a coarse paste, then drizzle in the tahini and puree until a smooth sauce forms.
Stir in the lemon juice and remaining 1/4 cup of water and season the charmoula sauce with salt and pepper.
Drain the carrots and discard the brine, or save it to use again.
Pat the carrots dry and toss them with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil.
Light a grill or heat a cast-iron grill pan.
Add the carrots and grill over high heat until crisp-tender and grill marks appear, about 8 minutes.
Transfer the carrots to a plate and let cool to room temperature.
Pour all but 2 tablespoons of the charmoula onto a platter and scatter the grilled carrots over the sauce.
In a bowl, toss the remaining 1 cup of parsley leaves with the reserved 2 tablespoons of charmoula and the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil and scatter over the carrots.
Sprinkle with the chopped almonds and serve.
pred:
1. In a small saucepan, combine the peppercorns, balsamic vinegar, water, and salt. Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes.
2. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the carrots and cook until they are tender but still crisp, about 5-7 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
3. Add the reserved carrot tops, chilies, garlic, and ice to the skillet. Cook for 2 minutes, or until the carrot tops are tender.
4. In a small bowl, mix the tahini, lemon juice, and pepper. Gradually pour the tahini mixture into the skillet, stirring to combine. Cook for 2 minutes or until the sauce thickens slightly.
5. Remove the skillet from the heat and stir in the chopped almonds. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. Serve the Grilled Pickled Carrots with Charmoula and Almonds immediately. Enjoy your delicious meal!

gt:
Shred the maitake mushrooms with your hands, and thinly slice the shiitake mushrooms (shred the stems too).
Combine the ingredients and mushrooms in a pan and heat.
When the mushrooms are cooked, pour in the katakuriko slurry to thicken the sauce.
Bring water to a boil in a pot and drop the oysters one by one.
When they become plump, transfer to a colander, rinse off the excess katakuriko, and pat dry.
Shred the maitake mushrooms with your hands, and slice the shiitake mushrooms thinly (shred apart the stems too).
Combine the ingredients and mushrooms in a pan and heat.
When the mushrooms are cooked, add katakuriko dissolved in water to thicken the sauce.
Put the yuba (or tofu) that has been cut into bite sized pieces on a plate with the Step 2 oysters, pour the mushroom sauce over, and serve.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a small bowl, mix the Katakuriko with a little bit of water to create a slurry.
3. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the Yuba (or silken tofu) and cook until it becomes golden brown.
4. Add the Maitake and Shiitake mushrooms, cooking until they are tender.
5. Add the Dashi stock and bring the mixture to a simmer.
6. Add the Katakuriko slurry to the skillet, stirring constantly to prevent lumps.
7. Reduce the heat to low and let the sauce simmer for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
8. In a separate bowl, mix the Soy sauce, Sake, and Mirin.
9. Carefully add the sauce mixture to the skillet, stirring to combine.
10. Add the oysters to the skillet, stirring to coat them evenly with the sauce.
11. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the oysters are cooked through and the sauce is slightly thickened.
12. Remove the skillet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
13. Serve the "Crystalized" Oysters with Thick Mushroom Sauce immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Heat oven to 350F (If using dark pan, decrease oven temperature to 325F).
Generously grease 9x5-inch loaf pan with shortening or spray with cooking spray.
In large bowl, beat sugar and butter with electric mixer on medium speed until well blended.
Beat in eggs, bananas and yogurt.
Add flour, baking soda and salt; beat until combined.
Stir in 1/2 cup of the crushed granola bars until well combined.
Pour batter into greased pan.
In small bowl, mix remaining 1/4 cup crushed granola bars and the coconut.
Sprinkle evenly over batter in pan; press in lightly.
Bake at 350F for 60 to 70 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean, covering with foil during last 15 to 20 minutes of baking to prevent excessive browning.
Cool in pan on wire rack 15 minutes.
Remove loaf from pan; place on rack.
Cool completely, about 2 hours.
Wrap tightly and store in refrigerator.
pred:
To cook Crunchy Banana Colada Bread, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the softened butter, sugar, eggs, mashed banana, and yogurt. Mix until well combined.
3. In a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, and salt. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, stirring until just combined.
4. Fold in the coarsely crushed Nature Valley banana nut crunchy granola bars and flaked coconut.
5. Pour the batter into a greased and floured loaf pan.
6. Bake the bread for 1 hour, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
7. Allow the bread to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Crunchy Banana Colada Bread!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Grease 13x9 inch casserole dish.
Cook ground beef and sausage in skillet.
Stir in tomatoes and let simmer then add soup and bring to a simmer.
Make a layer of potatoes and onion in baking dish.
Next make a layer of meat sauce and sprinkle with mozzarella cheese.
Repeat until all ingredients are used up.
I make about two hearty layers.
Bake 60-65 minutes covered with foil or until potatoes are soft.
Remove foil and sprinkle swiss or gruyere cheese and bake for an additional 10 minutes.
Cheese should be melty and bubbly.
Cool for 15 minutes and sprinkle with parsley before serving.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Italian Sunday Supper Casserole, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the lean ground beef over medium heat until browned, breaking it up into small pieces as it cooks.
3. Add the Italian pork sausage to the skillet and cook until browned, breaking it up as well.
4. Drain the canned tomatoes and add them to the skillet along with the cancreamy tomato soup. Stir to combine.
5. Add the sliced potatoes to the skillet and cook until they are tender, stirring occasionally.
6. In a separate bowl, mix the shredded mozzarella and gruyere or swiss cheese.
7. Pour the cooked beef and sausage mixture into a large casserole dish.
8. Layer the potatoes and cheese mixture on top of the beef and sausage mixture.
9. Sprinkle the chopped fresh parsley on top of the cheese layer.
10. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for 30-40 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.

This delicious Italian Sunday Supper Casserole is a hearty and satisfying meal that can be enjoyed by the whole family. The combination of ground beef, sausage, potatoes, and cheese creates a rich and flavorful dish that is perfect for a cozy, home-cooked meal.

gt:
Heat olive oil in a dutch oven, season chicken thighs with salt & pepper, cook chicken til golden colored on each side, remove chicken place on a plate.
Saute onions, peppers, mushrooms & garlic for 5 minutes, season with salt & pepper
Place chicken on top of vegtables and add tomatoes & bayleaf.
Bring all to a light boil, then cover & turn down heat to a simmer, but still bubbly.
Add oregano and cook about 45 min to 1 hour.
ENJOY:)
pred:
[INST]
To prepare Quick Cacciatore using the provided ingredients, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. In a large skillet or oven-safe pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chicken thighs and cook until browned on both sides and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes per side. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
3. In the same pan, add the onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes. Add the red, yellow, and green peppers and cook until they are tender, about 5-7 minutes.
4. Add the mushrooms and cook until they are tender, about 5-7 minutes.
5. Add the diced tomatoes, bay leaf, garlic, salt, and pepper to the pan. Stir to combine and cook for a few minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
6. Add the chicken back to the pan, and stir to combine.
7. Cover the pan with a lid or aluminum foil and place it in the preheated oven. Cook for about 25-30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and slightly thickened.
8. Remove the pan from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes.
9. Remove the bay leaf and serve the Quick Cacciatore over rice or pasta. Enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Boil Water
Put the whole jelly sachet in a mixing bowl
put 1 cup of boiling water in with the jelly chrystals
add in the 220ml of vodka
stir until all jelly chrystals have disolved
poor into shot glasses and put in the fridge to set
pred:
[INST]
1. In a saucepan, heat the Boiling Water over medium heat.
2. Add the Jelly to the saucepan, stirring until the Jelly is fully dissolved.
3. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the mixture cool for a few minutes.
4. Carefully pour the mixture into the shot glasses, ensuring that each glass is filled to the top.
5. Allow the Jelly to set in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours before serving.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
For cocktail sauce, combine ketchup, horseradish and sugar in a small bowl.
Chill until needed.
In a large sauce pot add shrimp,beer, chicken bouillon cube,sea salt,old bay seasoning,lemon pepper, black pepper and Greek seasoning.
Stir to combine flavors.
Bring to a boil and boil only until shrimp turns light pink about 5 minutes.
Drain and add ice to chill shrimp.
pred:
1. In a large pot, combine the raw shrimp, beer, chicken bouillon cube, sea salt, Old Bay Seasoning, lemon pepper, black pepper, and all purpose Greek seasoning (if using). Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer and cook for about 10 minutes or until the shrimp are cooked through and the sauce has thickened.

2. Remove the shrimp from the pot with a slotted spoon and set aside to cool slightly.

3. In a small bowl, mix the ketchup, horseradish, sugar, and a pinch of salt.

4. To serve, place the cooked shrimp on a serving platter and spoon the cocktail sauce mixture over the top.

This Boiled Shrimp in Beer With Cocktail Sauce recipe is a delicious and flavorful dish that combines the natural taste of shrimp with the richness of beer and the tangy, spicy flavors of the cocktail sauce. The addition of the chicken bouillon cube and Old Bay Seasoning adds depth and complexity to the dish, while the sea salt and lemon pepper enhance the overall taste. The ice and ketchup help to create a smooth, creamy texture, and the horseradish and sugar add a burst of heat and sweetness. This dish is perfect for a casual gathering or a special occasion, and it can be easily customized to suit individual preferences.

gt:
Preheat broiler.
Mix dressing and mustard with wire whisk until well blended.
Place beets and onions in medium bowl.
Add half of the dressing mixture; toss to coat.
Brush bread slices with remaining dressing mixture.
Place on baking sheet.
Broil 2 to 2-1/2 min.
or until lightly toasted.
Mix cream cheese and feta cheese until well blended.
Spread onto toast slices just before serving; top with the beets and spinach.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a small bowl, whisk together the KRAFT Balsamic Vinaigrette Dressing and Grey Poupon Dijon Mustard.
3. In a large bowl, toss the sliced beets, red onions, and spinach leaves together.
4. Spread the beet mixture evenly over the sliced bread, leaving a small border around the edges.
5. Spread the vinaigrette mixture evenly over the beet toast.
6. Top the vinaigrette with crumbled feta cheese.
7. Bake the toasted beet and feta bites in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Serve the Toasted Feta & Beet Bites immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
In a salad bowl combine vinegar and sugar and stir until sugar dissolves.
Add watermelon, cucumber and cilantro and toss.
Top with peanuts and toss again.
pred:
[INST]
To prepare a delicious Watermelon Salad, follow these steps:
1. In a large bowl, combine the rice vinegar, sugar, and salt.
2. Add the watermelon, cucumbers, and cilantro to the bowl, and toss to combine.
3. Allow the mixture to sit for about 15-20 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
4. Add the dry-roasted unsalted peanuts to the bowl, and toss again to combine.
5. Serve the Watermelon Salad immediately, or refrigerate for a few hours before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Watermelon Salad!

gt:
Start water to make egg noodles while cutting up hot dogs and onions.
Preheat oven to 350F.
Brown in skillet: hot dogs, onion, oregano, and butter.
Stir frequently to keep from burning.
(When hot dogs appear cooked, its generally done) Add noodles to water when water comes to a boil.
Drain noodles and combine in a greased casserole dish with: all ingredients in skillet, cream of celery soup, milk, and parsley.
Mix together well.
Sprinkle bread crumbs across the top to keep mixture from burning.
Cook covered for 40-45 minutes at 350F.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked egg noodles, cream of celery soup, milk, and parsley. Mix well.
3. Add the chopped onion and oregano to the mixture.
4. In a separate bowl, toss the hot dog pieces in butter to coat them evenly.
5. Add the hot dog pieces to the noodle mixture, stirring gently to combine.
6. Transfer the mixture to a greased baking dish or casserole dish.
7. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the hot dog pieces are cooked through and the casserole is hot and bubbly.
8. Remove the casserole from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

This Hot dog Casserole is a delicious and satisfying meal that combines the flavors of the hot dog pieces, the creamy and savory cream of celery soup, and the fresh parsley. The onion and oregano add depth and complexity to the dish, while the egg noodles provide a comforting and filling base. This dish is perfect for a cozy dinner or a potluck gathering, and it can be easily customized with additional ingredients or seasonings to suit your preferences.

gt:
Dice the onion(s) into small dice.
Saute in 1 butter until golden.
Add rice and stir thoroughly to coat; cook over medium-high heat for about two minutes.
Add the wine, salt and dill to the rice/onion mixture.
Heat vegetable stock in a separate pot.
Using a large soup ladle, add one ladleful to the rice at a time, stirring constantly in between additions.
(This is somewhere between half a cup and a cup of stock.)
Wait until the liquid is absorbed before adding the next ladleful.
The whole process of adding liquid should take anywhere from 20-30 minutes.
Take half of the smoked salmon and chop it fine.
Add to remaining butter and cream thoroughly.
Take the other half of the smoked salmon and coarsely chop it.
About two minutes before the rice has finished cooking, add the butter/salmon mixture and the coarsely chopped salmon.
Stir for another two minutes, until thoroughly incorporated and creamy.
Add the parmesan and stir for another minute or two.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large saucepan, heat the vegetable stock or chicken broth over medium heat.
3. Add the butter to the saucepan, and let it melt.
4. Add the onion and cook for about 5 minutes, until it is softened.
5. Add the rice to the saucepan, and stir to coat it with the liquid. Cook the rice for about 2 minutes, until it is slightly toasted.
6. Pour in the wine, and let it cook until it has been absorbed by the rice.
7. Add the salt, dill weed, and smoked salmon to the saucepan. Stir to combine.
8. Gradually pour in the vegetable stock or chicken broth, stirring constantly to prevent the rice from sticking to the bottom of the saucepan.
9. Cook the risotto over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the rice is tender and the liquid has been absorbed. This should take around 20-25 minutes.
10. Once the rice is cooked, remove the saucepan from the heat, and stir in the parmesan cheese.
11. Serve the Smoked Salmon Risotto immediately, and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Beat butter in mixer with paddle attachment until fluffy.
Add powdered sugar gradually until incorporated, scraping sides of the bowl twice during the process.
Add whiskey and beat again, scraping the bowl to make sure everything gets mixed together.
Spoon into a bowl and serve, or keep in the fridge (it will last for days covered in plastic wrap) until you need it.
NOTE: The hard sauce will harden in the fridge, so be sure to remove it at least a couple of hours before you want to serve.
Hard sauce should be smooth and easily spooned onto desserts.
Serve on warm pie.
Yum!
pred:
1. In a small saucepan, melt the softened butter over low heat.
2. Add the powdered sugar and stir until smooth.
3. Gradually add the whiskey, stirring constantly to prevent lumps from forming.
4. Continue stirring until the sauce reaches the desired consistency, which is usually a smooth, pourable consistency.
5. Taste the sauce and adjust the amount of whiskey to suit your preference.
6. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. If the sauce is too thick, you can add a bit more whiskey to thin it out.
8. Once the sauce has cooled, it is ready to use.

Feel free to adjust the ingredients or cooking method to suit your taste preferences.

gt:
Boil potatoes peel and mash potatoes when done boiling
Add 1can of cream of mushroom to smashed potatoes
Season with garlic salt and melted butter
Mix cheese and sour cream chives together mix with potatoes
SpriNkle leftover cheese over potatoes and chives and bacon bits bake for 15min or until cheese has melted
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. Wash and peel the potatoes, then cut them into bite-sized pieces.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the potatoes, cream of mushrooms, sour cream, chopped onion chives, and shredded cheese.
4. Add the garlic powder and bacon bits to the mixture.
5. Mix everything together until well combined.
6. Pour the mixture into a greased casserole dish.
7. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for about 30-40 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Remove the casserole from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Party potatoes casserole!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and shortening.
Add sugars, vanilla, and eggs.
Mix well.
Stir in oats, flour, baking powder, and baking soda.
When well-blended, stir in coconut, pecans, Rice Krispies, and chocolate chips.
When batter is thoroughly mixed, measure 1/4 C for each cookie on a large ungreased baking sheet.
Bake 10 to 12 minutes, or until edges are golden.
For a crisper cookie, bake 12 to 15 minutes.
Allow cookies to cool slightly on baking sheet before removing.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the margarine and solid shortening until smooth.
3. Add the brown sugar, sugar, eggs, vanilla, and salt. Mix until well combined.
4. Gradually add the oats, flour, baking powder, baking soda, and coconut. Mix until well combined.
5. Stir in the chopped pecans and Rice Krispies.
6. Fold in the chocolate chips.
7. Drop the mixture by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a greased baking sheet.
8. Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
9. Allow the Buffalo Chips to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Buffalo Chips!

gt:
Place the cubed pumpkin and orange juice in a small saucepan and bring it to a boil over medium-low heat.
Simmer the pumpkin for 10 to 15 minutes, until it is soft.
Carefully transfer to a blender, in batches if necessary, and blend until smooth.
Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat, and cook and stir the onion, garlic, chile, turmeric, cumin, nutmeg, and coriander for 1 to 2 minutes.
Stir in the ham, and cook and stir for about 5 minutes, until the ham has started to brown.
Pour the pureed pumpkin mixture into the spicy ham mixture, and stir the peanut butter into the sauce.
Mix well to combine, and bring back to a simmer.
Serve hot.
pred:
To make a delicious Ham and Pumpkin Satay dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the pumpkin, orange juice, butter, onion, garlic, chile, turmeric, cumin, nutmeg, and coriander seed. Mix well.
3. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
4. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake for about 30-40 minutes, or until the pumpkin is tender and the mixture is heated through.
5. While the pumpkin mixture is baking, prepare the ham by cutting it into small, bite-sized pieces.
6. In a small bowl, mix the peanut butter, soy sauce, and honey.
7. Once the pumpkin mixture is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it cool slightly.
8. Add the cooked ham to the pumpkin mixture and stir to combine.
9. Transfer the mixture to a skewer or a small grill pan, and cook the Ham and Pumpkin Satay on medium heat for about 10-15 minutes, or until the ham is cooked through and the pumpkin is slightly charred.
10. Serve the Ham and Pumpkin Satay immediately, garnished with fresh cilantro if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Place all ingredients - except grapes, water and cornstarch into a small saucepan.
In a very small container, stir together the cornstrch and water to form a smooth paste.
Simmer, stir in paste incrementally as needed to thicken.
Add grapes and serve sauce under crispy duck quarters.
pred:
To cook a delightful Orange Ginger Sauce for Duck dish, follow these steps:

1. In a saucepan, combine 12 ounces of Drambuie or 12 ounces of maple syrup, 14 cups of orange marmalade, 14 cups of orange juice, 12 teaspoons of grated orange rind, and 18 teaspoons of ginger.

2. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly.

3. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 10 minutes, or until the sauce thickens slightly.

4. Add 12 cups of peeled green seedless grape, and stir to combine.

5. Gradually add 12 ounces of water, stirring constantly to prevent lumps from forming.

6. In a small bowl, mix 12 tablespoons of cornstarch with a little bit of water to form a slurry.

7. Slowly pour the cornstarch mixture into the saucepan, stirring constantly to avoid lumps.

8. Continue stirring until the sauce thickens and reaches the desired consistency.

9. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool slightly.

10. Pour the sauce over the cooked duck, and serve immediately.

This Orange Ginger Sauce for Duck dish is a delicious and flavorful combination of sweet and tangy flavors, with the added depth of ginger. The combination of orange marmalade, orange juice, and grated orange rind provides a bright and zesty taste, while the grape adds a touch of sweetness and a hint of natural fruitiness. The cornstarch slurry helps to thicken the sauce, creating a smooth and velvety texture that complements the tender duck meat.

gt:
Chop hulled strawberries in a food processor, leaving a few chunks.
Stir in sugar.
In a bowl, whip cream until stiff peaks form.
In another bowl, whip egg whites until stiff peaks form.
Fold whipped cream into strawberries.
Fold egg whites into strawberry mixture.
Serve immediately.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Wash and hull the strawberries, and place them in a large mixing bowl.
2. Add the sugar and mash the strawberries slightly with a fork to release their juices.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg whites until they form soft peaks.
4. Gently fold the egg whites into the strawberry mixture until well combined.
5. Slowly pour the heavy cream into the bowl, stirring gently to combine.
6. Chill the mixture in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or overnight.
7. When ready to serve, spoon the mousse into individual serving dishes or a large bowl.
8. Chill the mousse in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Strawberry Mousse!

gt:
Pour about 2 inches of oil into a 3-quart pot and heat over medium-high flame.
Combine all dry ingredients in a medium mixing bowl.
Add in eggs, vanilla and ricotta and stir to fully incorporate.
The consistency will be like a thick batter.
When oil is hot (about 375 degrees), start frying in small batches of 3 or 4 at a time using about 1 tablespoon of batter for each zeppola.
The batter will puff up when dropped in the hot oil.
Fry about 3 minutes or until deeply and evenly browned on all sides, flipping over about half way through.
Transfer fried zeppole to paper towels to absorb excess oil and garnish liberally with powdered sugar.
Zeppole are best when warm, but can be served up to 2-3 hours after cooking.
pred:
To create The One And Only Zeppole, follow these steps:

1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, sugar, and vanilla extract.
2. Add the ricotta, well-beaten eggs, and vegetable oil to the bowl, and mix until a smooth batter forms.
3. Preheat your frying pan or deep fryer with vegetable oil to a temperature of 350°F (175°C).
4. Using a spoon, scoop small portions of the batter and carefully drop them into the hot oil.
5. Allow the zeppole to cook for about 5 minutes or until they are golden brown on all sides.
6. Remove the zeppole from the oil using a slotted spoon or a spider, and place them on a wire rack to drain any excess oil.
7. Once the zeppole are cooled, dust them with powdered sugar for a sweet and delicious finish.

Enjoy your homemade The One And Only Zeppole!

gt:
Prepare graham cracker crust according to package instructions.
(Or make your own if youre that ambitious!)
Cream Cheese Layer
In a mixing bowl, blend 1/2 cup whipped topping, 4 oz cream cheese, and 1/2 cup confectioners sugar until creamy.
Spread into crust.
Chocolate Layer
Stir together sugar, cornstarch, and salt in saucepan.
Blend milk and egg yolks, gradually stir into sugar mixture.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens and boils.
Boil and stir one minute.
Remove from heat; blend in vanilla and melted chocolate.
Cover with plastic wrap, pressing plastic wrap onto the filling; allow to cool at room temperature.
When the filling has cooled enough that it wont melt the cream cheese layer, stir until smooth, and pour over the cream cheese layer.
Cover with plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator for several hours.
When ready to serve, cover with whipped topping.
You may also garnish with mini chocolate chips or chocolate shavings.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cornstarch, sugar, and salt. Add the milk and whisk until smooth.
3. Place the bowl over a saucepan of simmering water, making sure the bottom of the bowl does not touch the water. Cook the mixture, stirring constantly, until it thickens and comes to a boil.
4. Remove the bowl from the saucepan and continue stirring until the mixture thickens further and cools slightly.
5. In a separate bowl, beat the egg yolks and vanilla until smooth. Gradually pour the cooled cornstarch mixture into the egg yolks, stirring constantly.
6. Return the mixture to the saucepan and cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens and cools slightly.
7. In a separate bowl, beat the softened cream cheese until smooth. Gradually add the melted chocolate and continue beating until well combined.
8. Fold the whipped topping into the chocolate mixture.
9. Pour the chocolate mixture into the cooled pie crust.
10. Bake the pie for 35-40 minutes, or until the filling is set and the crust is golden brown.
11. Allow the pie to cool completely before serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat broiler.
In small saucepan, heat oil over medium heat.
Add curry powder, red pepper flakes and a little salt.
Cook, stirring constantly, for 1 minute.
Remove from heat.
Arrange vegetables on broiler pan and brush with seasoned oil.
Broil vegetables until beginning to brown,12 to 15 minutes, turning once.
Meanwhile, make raita.
In serving bowl, whisk yogurt and honey until blended.
Stir in remaining ingredients and set aside.
Make pancakes.
In large bowl, mix flour and salt.
Beat eggs well, then add to flour.
Continue mixing and gradually stir in milk.
Add chilies, cumin and cilantro, and mix well.Let batter stand for 30 minutes.
In large nonstick skillet,heat 1/2 tsp.but-ter over medium heat.Pour in about one-quarter of batter, tilting pan so batter spreads evenly.When bubbles begin to appear on top of pancake,flip it over with a spatula and cook for about 1 minute on the other side.Transfer pancake to plate and keep warm.Cook remaining pancakes as directed.
To serve,roll vegetables in each pancake, and serve with any remaining vegetables and raita.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt, and cumin.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, yogurt, honey, and curry powder.
4. Add the vegetables, chilies, and cilantro to the egg mixture, and stir to combine.
5. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until just combined.
6. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
7. Pour the batter onto the skillet and cook until the edges are set and the center is still slightly wet.
8. Carefully flip the pancakes and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes or until the bottoms are golden brown and the edges are crispy.
9. Transfer the pancakes to a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the pancakes are cooked through and the edges are golden brown.
10. Serve the Spicy Vegetable Pancakes hot, garnished with fresh cilantro and mint.

[/SYS]

gt:
Stir together orange drink and Splenda until it dissolves in a saucepan.
Add rhubarb to pan and cook for 7-8 minutes or until rhubarb becomes tender.
Stir in berries and cook 1-2 minutes more, or until berries start to stain sauce red.
Stir in orange extract and remove from heat.
Serve over low carb ice cream (or topped with sugar free whipped cream).
pred:
1. Wash and chop the rhubarb into bite-sized pieces.
2. In a large saucepan, combine the chopped rhubarb, Splenda granular, and sugar-free orange extract or lemon extract.
3. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally.
4. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 15-20 minutes, or until the rhubarb is tender and the liquid has thickened slightly.
5. Stir in the fresh berries and cook for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the berries are tender and the mixture is well combined.
6. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the compote cool for a few minutes.
7. Pour the compote into a clean glass jar or container, and store it in the refrigerator.
8. Serve the Rhu-Berry Compote as a refreshing and healthy dessert or snack.

[/INST]

gt:
In a large bowl, add cereal, marshmallows and both chocolate chips and combine.
On a large baking sheet covered with wax paper, pour the cereal mix and spread out evenly.
Place chocolate bark in a container and microwave for 30 seconds.
Stir, microwave again for 30 seconds and stir until completely melted.
Drizzle chocolate all over the mixture.
Using a spatula, stir around slightly to help coat the rest of the cereal.
Allow to cool completely or stick the pan in the refrigerator if youre anxious to eat it.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the Golden Graham Cereal, Dehydrated Mini Marshmallows, and White Chocolate Chips.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the Milk Chocolate Chips and Dark Chocolate Chips (if using) until well combined.
4. Pour the melted chocolate mixture over the cereal mixture and stir until well combined.
5. Spread the mixture evenly onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are slightly crispy and the center is set.
7. Allow the crunch to cool completely before breaking it into pieces.

Enjoy your delicious Graham Cracker Crunch!

gt:
Wash, stem and chop the collards and set aside.
The easiest way to do this is to work from the back of the leaf.
Slice down each side of the stem and put leaves in a pile.
Roll and slice thinly crosswise, then slice diagonally into 1 to 2 inch pieces.
Mince garlic, onions, mushrooms and red bell pepper.
Combine and set aside.
Combine tomatoes, raisins, chickpeas and spices and set aside.
Coat large covered non-stick frying pan or Dutch oven (at least 5 quarts) with oil.
Add garlic, onions, mushrooms and bell pepper.
Cook and stir until onion is soft and translucent, adding small amounts of water as needed to prevent sticking.
Add collards and small amount of water if needed to prevent sticking.
Cover and allow collards to wilt, mixing frequently.
Add tomato mixture and continue cooking, stirring frequently for about 5 to 7 minutes or until collards are tender but still nice and bright.
pred:
1. In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
2. Add the diced onions and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
3. Add the sliced mushrooms and cook until they release their juices, about 5-6 minutes.
4. Add the red bell pepper and cook until it begins to soften, about 3-4 minutes.
5. Add the chopped collard greens and cook until they are wilted, about 5-6 minutes.
6. Stir in the fire-roasted tomatoes, raisins, and chickpeas. Season with the ground coriander, cinnamon, cumin, crushed red pepper flakes, and salt and pepper to taste.
7. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then cover and cook over low heat for about 20-25 minutes, or until the collard greens are tender and the flavors have melded together.
8. Serve the Collards Moroccan Style over rice or couscous, and enjoy!

gt:
Place all ingredients in a large bowl and mix well with a spoon.
Sift mixture twice.
Store in a tightly covered container, as it keeps well for several weeks at room temperature.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, and baking powder.
3. Add the dry milk powder and salt, and mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg and vanilla extract.
5. Gradually add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients, stirring until a dough forms.
6. If the dough is too dry, you can add a bit of milk to achieve the right consistency.
7. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to your desired thickness.
8. Cut out your desired shapes using cookie cutters or a sharp knife.
9. Place the cookies on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
10. Bake for 8-10 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
11. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

gt:
Spread insides of pita halves with mayo.
Fill with remaining ingredients.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Place the cut-in-half pita bread on a baking sheet.
3. Spread a thin layer of KRAFT Light Mayo Reduced Fat Mayonnaise on each pita half.
4. Top each pita half with a slice of smoked turkey breast, a slice of tomato, a slice of cucumber, a slice of red onion, and a slice of green pepper.
5. Season the pita with salt and pepper to taste.
6. Bake the pita in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and the filling is heated through.
7. Serve the cooked pita immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
clean okra, cut into pieces about half inch,
need 3 bowls, 1 for corn meal and add seasonings.mix well
1 bowl for flour, 1 bowl for egg and milk mix well
now heat oil in medium frying pan.on medium heat .
you are starting with putting okra in the flour, then egg mixture, then the cornmeal mixtuer.
drop a little cornmeal into pan, if it starts frying it's ready.add okra to oil and fry untill light golden color, then ready, place fried okra on papertowel
eat when hot or warm.
pred:
1. First, gather the necessary ingredients: 12 long fresh okras, 1 egg, 1/4 cup milk, 1 cup flour, 1 1/2 cup corn meal, 1/4 tsp salt, 1/4 tsp pepper, 1 tsp tony chachere's original Creole seasoning, and 1 cup vegetable oil.

2. Preheat the oven to 200°F (93°C).

3. In a large bowl, whisk together the egg, milk, and flour until smooth. Add the corn meal, salt, pepper, and Creole seasoning, and mix well.

4. Cut the ends off the okras and cut them into 4-inch pieces.

5. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or frying pan over medium-high heat. When the oil is hot, carefully drop the okra pieces into the hot oil, being careful not to overcrowd the pan. Cook the okra for about 5-7 minutes, or until they are golden brown on all sides.

6. Remove the cooked okra from the oil with a slotted spoon and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to drain.

7. Serve the fried okra immediately, or let them cool and store them in an airtight container for later use.

Enjoy your delicious Sunshines fried okra!

gt:
Preheat fry pan with oil to medium high.
Slice eggplant into 1/4 in thick slices.
In small bowl mix milk and egg thoroughly.
In separate small bowl mix almonds, flour, cumin, garlic, salt, pepper.
Dip slices in milk/egg and let excess drip off a little bit.
Dip slices in the dry mix coating completely.
Place in fry pan and cook for about 2-3 minutes.
Underneath will be golden brown.
Flip over and cook another 2 minutes.
Underside will be golden brown.
Remove and place on plate covered with paper towel to remove excess oil.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).

2. Cut the eggplant into evenly sized pieces, and place them in a large bowl.

3. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and milk together until well-combined.

4. Add the crushed almonds, flour, ground cumin, garlic, salt, and white pepper to the egg mixture. Mix well to combine.

5. Pour the egg mixture over the eggplant pieces, and toss to coat evenly.

6. Spread the eggplant mixture onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.

7. Bake the eggplant for about 20-25 minutes, or until it is tender and golden brown.

8. Remove the baking sheet from the oven, and let the eggplant cool for a few minutes.

9. Serve the Almond Crusted Eggplant as a main course or side dish. Enjoy!

gt:
Combine oil and cumin seeds in heavy small saucepan.
Cook over medium heat 5 minutes to blend flavors, stirring occasionally.
Cool completely.
Combine remaining ingredients in large bowl.
Add cumin oil and toss to blend.
Season salad to taste with salt and pepper.
pred:
[/INST]

1. In a large bowl, combine the chickpeas, cucumbers, parsley, sundried tomatoes, and lemon juice.
2. In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, cumin seeds, garlic, and red pepper flakes.
3. Pour the dressing over the chickpea mixture and toss to coat evenly.
4. Serve the Chickpea Salad immediately or refrigerate for a few hours before serving.

This Chickpea Salad with Parsley, Lemon, and Sun-dried Tomatoes is a delicious and nutritious dish that can be enjoyed as a main course or a side dish. The combination of flavors and textures from the chickpeas, cucumbers, parsley, sundried tomatoes, and lemon juice creates a refreshing and satisfying meal. The addition of the olive oil, cumin seeds, and red pepper flakes enhances the overall taste and aroma of the dish, making it a delightful and healthy option for those looking to incorporate more plant-based ingredients into their diet.

gt:
Preheat oven to 350F Coat a standard (12 cup) muffin tin with cooking spray.
In a large bowl, whisk egg whites, sugar, cocoa and salt until combined.
Add coconut; mix until well coated.
***I would add the sliced almonds in at this point with the coconut.
They didn't want to stick to the tops of the cookies!

Dividing evenly, spoon mixture into muffin tin and pat in gently with moistened fingers.

Remove from oven and cool in tin for 5-10 minutes.
Run a thin metal spatula around the edges to loosen from pan.
Turn out onto rack to cool completely.
Cookies keep in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days.
pred:
[INST]To prepare Chocolate Coconut Macaroon Cups, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the egg whites, sugar, and cocoa powder. Whisk until well combined.
3. Fold in the sliced almonds.
4. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
5. Using a small cookie scoop or a spoon, scoop out small mounds of the mixture onto the prepared baking sheet.

7. Allow the macaroon cups to cool completely on the baking sheet.
8. Once cooled, carefully remove the macaroon cups from the baking sheet and transfer them to a serving plate.
9. Enjoy your delicious Chocolate Coconut Macaroon Cups!

[/INST]

gt:
Mix milk and vinegar together, and set aside.
Mix flour and salt.
Cut in shortening with fork.
Add milk and vinegar.
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the milk, vinegar, and Crisco shortening.
2. Gradually add the flour, stirring until a dough forms.
3. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic.
4. Cover the dough and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 2 hours.
