Add to other ingredients alternately with milk.
Add walnuts.
Chill 3 hours.
Form into 1 inch balls.
Roll in confectioners sugar.
Place on greased cookie sheet 2-3 inches apart.
Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.
Cool slightly before removing.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter or margarine until soft and fluffy.
3. Add the melted and cooled chocolate squares, vanilla extract, and salt. Mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and chopped walnuts.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, alternating with the milk, and mix until just combined.
6. Fold in the confectioners' sugar.
7. Drop the batter by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a greased or lined baking sheet.
8. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are set and the centers are still slightly soft.
9. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Chocolate Crinkles!

gt:
Preheat your oven to 375 degrees F. Spray a donut pan with nonstick spray and set aside.
For the donuts: In a large bowl whisk together the brown sugar, eggs, butter, yogurt, milk, vanilla and food coloring.
Sift the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder and salt into the wet ingredients and gently fold in until just mixed (I normally dont worry about sifting but its particularly great for cocoa powder and I highly recommend it for this recipe).
Evenly pour the batter into each donut well and gently tap the bottom of the pan on a counter to release any air bubbles.
Bake at 375 degrees F for 8-12 minutes until the donuts are just set; if you bake them too long theyll be too dry and not at all velvety!
Top with cream cheese frosting once the donuts are completely cooled.
For the cream cheese frosting: Cream together the cream cheese and butter until soft and fluffy.
Add the vanilla and powdered sugar and mix until smooth.
Spread on cooled donuts.
If you have leftovers you can always freeze it, thaw when ready to use and just whip it to regain the texture!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 13 cups of packed brown sugar, 2 whole eggs, 3 tablespoons of melted butter, 2 tablespoons of plain yogurt, 4 tablespoons of milk, 1 tablespoon of vanilla extract, 1 tablespoon of red food coloring, 3/4 cups of flour, 13 cups of cocoa powder, 1 teaspoon of baking powder, and 1/4 teaspoon of salt.
3. Mix the ingredients together until well combined.
4. Add the cream cheese, at room temperature, and mix until smooth.
5. Gradually add the 8 ounces of weight cream cheese, mixing until well combined.
6. Gradually add the 8 tablespoons of butter, at room temperature, mixing until smooth.
7. Add the vanilla extract and powdered sugar, mixing until well combined.
8. If the dough is too dry, add a bit more milk, 1 tablespoon at a time, until the desired consistency is reached.
9. Once the dough is the right consistency, shape it into small balls and place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
10. Bake the donuts in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown on the outside and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
11. Allow the donuts to cool for a few minutes on the baking sheet, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

[INST]<<SYS>>
Please let me know if you have any questions or need further assistance.

gt:
Cook pasta in large saucepan as directed on package, omitting salt and adding broccoli to the boiling water for the last 2 min.
; drain.
Rinse with cold water; drain well.
Place 3 cups pasta mixture in large glass serving bowl; top with peppers.
Cover with 3 cups pasta mixture, onions, carrots and remaining pasta mixture.
Mix Miracle Whip, dressing and cheese; spread over salad to seal.
Refrigerate several hours or until chilled.
Top with basil and toss gently before serving.
pred:
To cook a delicious Layered Pasta Salad Primavera dish, follow these steps:

1. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions. In this case, cook the farfalle pasta until it is al dente.
2. While the pasta is cooking, prepare the vegetables. Chop the small broccoli florets into bite-sized pieces, slice the red pepper into rings, and cut the carrots into thin slices.
3. In a large bowl, combine the cooked pasta, chopped broccoli, sliced red pepper, and thinly sliced carrots.
4. In a small bowl, whisk together the Miracle Whip, Kraft Rancher's Choice Dressing, and 1/2 cup of grated Parmesan cheese.
5. Pour the dressing mixture over the pasta mixture, and toss to combine.
6. Add the chopped fresh basil to the salad, and toss again to combine.
7. Serve the Layered Pasta Salad Primavera immediately, or refrigerate until ready to serve.

This dish is a delicious and nutritious meal that combines pasta, vegetables, and a creamy dressing for a satisfying and flavorful experience.

gt:
Oil a normal sized loaf pan
Whisk the bean flour into a quarter of the water to make a smooth paste
Bring the rest of the water to the boil in a large pot
Slowly whisk the paste into the boiling water whisking well as it thickens
Stir constantly until the mix is so thick you can hardy stir anymore, around 10 minutes
Pour into the loaf pan and let cool, then cover with foil and refridgerate for 24 hours before cubing or slicing
The texture should be inbetween firm and silken tofu and so can be used for a wide variety of dishes.
I have used to make sauces, cheesecakes, mousses, burgers, mocksteaks and even in soup for texture
This recipe is for unflavoured tofu and won't taste nice as it is.
For a chicken flavoured tofu add garlic powder, onion powder and chicken seasoning to the flour.
For fish add lemon juice and kelp/seaweed flakes.
For meat add soy sauce.
Most of the flavour us going to end up coming from what you marinade and crust the pieces with
pred:
[/INST]

[INST]
1. First, gather all the necessary ingredients, including 1325 ml cold water and 300 grams white bean flour.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cold water and white bean flour.
3. Stir the mixture until it reaches a smooth and consistent consistency.
4. If the mixture is too thick, add a bit more water. If it's too thin, add a bit more white bean flour.
5. Once the desired consistency is reached, cover the bowl and let it sit for about 30 minutes to allow the mixture to thicken.
6. After 30 minutes, check the mixture and stir it again if needed.
7. Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
8. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
9. Pour the mixture onto the prepared baking sheet, spreading it evenly to form a thin, even layer.
10. Bake the tofu for about 30-40 minutes, or until it reaches the desired level of doneness.
11. Remove the tofu from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
12. Once the tofu is cool enough to handle, cut it into desired shapes or sizes.
13. Serve the tofu immediately or store it in an airtight container for later use.

[/INST]

[/INST]

gt:
Shake and pour over ice.
Layer method:.
Read above, but I also did according to the way I listed the liquors.
If you look at my pictures you will see the layers.
Deceiving it is!
They did slowly settle that way.
It`s cool to watch!
pred:
To cook a delightful B-52 dish, follow these steps:

1. In a large mixing glass, combine 12 fluid ounces of Baileys Irish Cream, 12 fluid ounces of green creme de menthe, and 12 fluid ounces of Grand Marnier.
2. Fill a shaker with ice, and then pour the mixture into the shaker.
3. Shake the mixture vigorously for about 10-15 seconds, until the ice is well-blended and the drink is chilled.
4. Strain the mixture into a tall glass filled with ice.
5. Garnish the drink with a sprig of mint, if desired.

This B-52 dish is a delicious and refreshing cocktail that combines the flavors of Baileys Irish Cream, green creme de menthe, and Grand Marnier. The combination of these ingredients creates a unique and delightful taste that is perfect for a special occasion or a relaxing evening.

gt:
Cut the fish into pieces that are about 2" x 1" and rub them evenly with the salt, turmeric, and cayenne.
Cover and set aside in the refrigerator for 30 minutes-10 hours.
Put the mustard powder, cayenne, turmeric, and salt in a small bowl.
Add 1 tablespoon water and mix thoroughly.
Add another 7 tablespoons water and mix.
Set aside.
Pour the oil into a medium frying pan and set over medium-high heat.
When hot, put in the mustard seeds.
As soon as they start to pop, a matter of seconds, add the cumin and fennel seeds.
Stir once and quickly pour in the mustard paste.
Add the green chilies, stir, and bring to a gentle simmer.
Place the fish pieces in the sauce in a single layer.
Simmer gently for about 5 minutes, or until the fish is just cooked through, spooning the sauce over the fish all the time.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the salt, turmeric, cayenne pepper, and ground mustard.
3. Place the salmon fillet in a baking dish and season it with the spice mixture.
4. In a small saucepan, heat the mustard oil over medium heat. Add the mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and fennel seeds, and cook until the seeds are fragrant, about 1 minute.
5. Add the chilies, slit side down, and cook until they are slightly charred and blistered, about 2 minutes.
6. Pour the mustard sauce over the salmon fillet, making sure it is evenly coated.
7. Bake the salmon in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until it is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
8. Remove the salmon from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

This mouthwatering Salmon in a Bengali Mustard Sauce dish is a delicious and flavorful meal that can be enjoyed by both vegetarians and meat-eaters alike. The combination of the tender salmon fillet with the rich, spicy, and slightly tangy mustard sauce creates a delightful and satisfying dish that can be enjoyed at any time of the day.

gt:
Note: If you are adding tomato, bacon or ham, put it in the skillet first.
Arrange the ham or bacon to fit the bread.
Break the egg over the tomato, bacon or ham.
Break the egg and yolk into a buttered/sprayed preheated skillet on medium low heat.
Try to keep the egg about the same size as your bread.
Salt and pepper to taste.
Place a slice of bread on the egg when the egg is almost cooked through but still gooey on top.
The egg will adhere to the bread when you've finished the sandwich.
Flip the sandwich over to brown the bread.
Place a slice of cheese on top of the egg.
To keep thinly sliced bread from burning, place a cover over the skillet to melt the cheese faster.
Place the second slice of bread on the egg and cheese when the cheese begins to melt.
Turn the sandwich over to brown the other side.
Enjoy.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Spread a thin layer of butter or nonstick cooking spray on one side of each slice of bread.
3. Place the bread slices on a baking sheet or a non-stick surface.
4. Crack the egg onto the bread slices, making sure to cover the entire surface.
5. Add a slice of cheese on top of the egg.
6. If desired, add sliced deli ham, bacon, or cooked strips halved.
7. Bake the sandwich in the preheated oven for about 10-12 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and the egg is cooked through.
8. Remove the sandwich from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing it in half.

Enjoy your delicious Eggwich!

gt:
Pre-heat oven to 200C.
In a large mixing bowl, mix (with your hands) the potatoes, onion, cumin, cinnamon, oil, salt and pepper.
Spread this mixture evenly in a baking dish (I use a 20 cm by 26 cm).
Pour the crushed tomatoes and any juices over the potatoes.
Pour water into the pan.
Cover with foil and bake for 45 minutes.
After this time, reduce oven temperature to 180C, remove foil and bake an additional 30 minutes until the potatoes are tender and the sauce has thickened.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the sliced onion and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the sliced potatoes and sauté for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
4. Add the ground cumin, ground cinnamon, sea salt, and pepper. Stir to combine.
5. Pour in the canned crushed tomatoes, and add the water. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender.
6. Carefully transfer the pot to the preheated oven and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the potatoes are golden brown and crispy on the outside.
7. Remove the pot from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Serve the Cumin Potatoes and Tomatoes hot, garnished with fresh herbs, if desired.

The cooking process involves several steps, such as preheating the oven, heating the oil, sautéing the onion and potatoes, adding the spices and tomatoes, simmering the mixture, transferring it to the oven, and finally, letting it cool before serving. The end result is a delicious Cumin Potatoes and Tomatoes dish that can be enjoyed with friends and family.

gt:
Cut the green stems off the strawberries so they will stand upright when placed on your serving tray.
With a small sharp knife, cut an "X" in each strawberry, cutting almost to the bottom of each strawberry.
Gently, with your fingertips, spread each strawberry apart to make "petals".
In a medium sized bowl, whip the mascarpone cheese and whipping cream until soft peaks form.
Add the sugar and vanilla and continue to whip until stiff peaks form.
Spoon the cream into a pastry bag fitted with a large open star tip
Pipe the cream into the strawberries.
pred:
1. Wash and hull the strawberries.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the mascarpone cheese, heavy whipping cream, sugar, and vanilla extract.
3. Gently fold the strawberries into the cream mixture, ensuring they are evenly coated.
4. Pour the mixture into a 9-inch springform pan.
5. Bake the cake in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) for about 45 minutes, or until the cake is set and the edges are slightly golden.
6. Allow the cake to cool for 10 minutes before removing it from the pan and allowing it to cool completely.
7. Once cooled, cut the cake into 16 equal pieces and serve.

[/INST]

gt:
Peel, devein, and butterfly the shrimp, leaving the tails on if you like.
Place shrimp in a mixing bowl and toss gently with olive oil, wine, 2 tsp salt, and 1 tsp pepper.
Set aside.
In a small bowl, mash the butter and garlic, shallots, parsley, rosemary, red pepper flakes, lemon zest, lemon juice, egg yolk, panko, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/4 tsp pepper until well mixed.
In a shallow, oven proof serving dish, arrange the shrimp in a single layer butterflied side own with tails curling up and toward the center of the dish.
Pour the remaining marinade over shrimp.
Spread the butter mixture evenly over the shrimp.
It's a little tricky to spread it evenly, just do your best as it will melt and disperse when baked.
Bake for 5-6 minutes on high until hot and bubbly.
If you want to brown the top of the bread crumbs, place under a broiler for 1 minute.
Serve with the lemon wedges.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the shrimp, olive oil, white wine, and butter. Season with salt, pepper, and crushed red pepper flakes. Toss to coat the shrimp evenly.
3. Spread the shrimp mixture on a baking sheet or tray. Roast the shrimp in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until they are cooked through and the edges are slightly crispy.
4. While the shrimp are cooking, prepare the sauce. In a small bowl, whisk together the egg yolk, lemon juice, minced garlic, shallots, parsley, rosemary, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
5. Remove the cooked shrimp from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
6. Carefully drain the shrimp and transfer it to a large mixing bowl. Pour the sauce over the shrimp and toss to coat evenly.
7. In a small bowl, mix the panko and a pinch of salt and pepper.
8. Add the panko mixture to the shrimp mixture and toss to coat the shrimp evenly.
9. Serve the shrimp scampi immediately, garnished with lemon wedges.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Combine 1/2 cup mayonnaise and next 3 ingredients in a saucepan.
Gradually add milk, and cook, stirring constantly, over medium-low heat 8019 minutes or until thicken.
Remove from heat.
Add cheddar cheese, and next 3 ingredients, stirring until cheese melts and is well-blended.
Place half of potato slices evenly in a lightly greased 11x7" baking dish; pour half of cheese mixture over potatoes.
Repeat layers with remaining half of potato slices and cheese mixture.
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
Bake, covered, at 350 degrees, for 1 hour.
Uncover and bake 30 minutes more or until potatoes are golden brown and fork tender.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the mayonnaise, flour, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
3. Add the milk, shredded cheddar cheese, parsley, chives, thyme, and grated parmesan cheese. Mix until the ingredients are well combined.
4. Drain the thinly sliced baking potatoes and transfer them to a large mixing bowl. Pour the mayonnaise mixture over the potatoes and toss to coat evenly.
5. Transfer the potato mixture to a 9x13 inch baking dish.
6. Bake the potatoes in the preheated oven for 30-40 minutes, or until they are tender and golden brown.
7. Remove the dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Serve the Southern Living Cheesy Scalloped Potatoes hot, garnished with additional chopped parsley and chives, if desired.

This step-by-step procedure will guide you through the process of making delicious Southern Living Cheesy Scalloped Potatoes using the provided ingredients.

gt:
First, you peeled and chop the onions, set them aside.
Then you take the potato and the carrot, peel them and cut then in bite sizes.
You take the chicken breast and cut it in bite sizes
You cook the chicken breast until its white almost golden.
(It doesnt need to be full cooked)
In another pan(it has to be spacy) u cook the onion with the olive oil.
Add the carrots and the potato and mix them together.
Then add the chicken.
Add the water and wait for it to boil.
When it starts boils take out the fat that is floating.
When the vegetables are tender, turn off the fire.
Add the curry spice and mix
Optional u may add a tablespoon of worcestershire sauce, curry powder, ketchup sauce, and apricot jam for taste.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 3 minutes.
3. Add the chicken breasts to the skillet and cook until browned on both sides and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.
4. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
5. In a small bowl, mix the golden curry sauce mix with 1 cup of water.
6. Add the curry sauce mixture to the skillet with the onions and cook until the sauce has thickened, about 2-3 minutes.
7. Add the carrots, potatoes, and chopped onion to the skillet. Cook for 5-7 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.
8. Return the chicken to the skillet and stir to combine.
9. If desired, add the apricot jam and worcestershire sauce to the skillet. Stir to combine.
10. If using, add the curry powder and ketchup to the skillet. Stir to combine.
11. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and slightly thickened.
12. Serve the chicken curry over rice or with your choice of side dish. Enjoy!

gt:
Heat oven to 350F.
Mix tomato sauce, barbecue sauce and chili powder in medium bowl until blended.
Reserve 1/2 cup sauce for later use.
Add chicken, beans, 1 cup cheese and onions to remaining sauce; mix lightly.
Spoon about 1/3 cup chicken mixture down centre of each tortilla; roll up.
Place, seam sides down, in 13x9-inch baking dish sprayed with cooking spray; top with reserved sauce.
Sprinkle with remaining cheese.
Bake 15 to 20 min.
or until heated through.
Top with remaining ingredients.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the canned no-salt-added tomato sauce, Bull's-Eye Bold Original Barbecue Sauce, chili powder, and shredded cooked chicken breasts. Mix well to combine.
3. Spread the chicken mixture evenly over the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.
4. In a separate bowl, combine the rinsed pinto beans, Cracker Barrel Shredded Tex Mex Cheese, green onions, and shredded lettuce.
5. Roll out the corn tortillas, one at a time, to make thin strips.
6. Layer the tortilla strips over the chicken mixture in the baking dish, covering the chicken completely.
7. Pour the remaining sauce over the tortilla layer.
8. Sprinkle the fresh cilantro and chopped tomato over the top of the enchiladas.
9. Bake the enchiladas in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly, and the chicken is cooked through.
10. Serve the Easy BBQ Chicken Enchiladas hot, garnished with additional fresh cilantro and sliced green onions if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Coat baking sheet with cooking spray.
Combine 5 cups butternut squash chunks, 2 cups diced apple, leek whites, oil, and maple syrup in large bowl, and season with salt and pepper, if desired.
Spread squash mixture in single layer on prepared baking sheet, and roast 30 minutes, or until tender, stirring occasionally.
Cook potato chunks and remaining 1 cup butternut squash in boiling, salted water 5 to 7 minutes, or until just tender.
Drain, and set aside.
Puree roasted vegetables in blender until smooth.
Add puree and apple juice to large soup pot with 4 cups water.
Whisk in vinegar, and heat over medium heat.
Season with salt and pepper, if desired.
Add boiled potatoes and squash, remaining 1 cup diced apple, and leek greens, and simmer 5 minutes, or until hot.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, toss the butternut squash, apples, and leeks with olive oil and maple syrup. Season with salt, pepper, and a pinch of cinnamon.
3. Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet, and roast in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and slightly caramelized.
4. While the vegetables are roasting, cook the potatoes in a large pot of boiling salted water until they are tender, but still firm. Drain the potatoes and return them to the pot.
5. Add the apple juice, apple cider vinegar, and a pinch of salt and pepper to the pot. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the potatoes are tender and the liquid has thickened slightly.
6. Carefully transfer the roasted vegetables to the pot with the potatoes, and stir to combine.
7. Cook the chowder over low heat for 10-15 minutes, or until the flavors have melded together and the chowder is heated through.
8. Serve the Roasted Squash and Apple Chowder with Colorful Potatoes hot, garnished with a sprinkle of freshly grated nutmeg, if desired.

[/INST]

This delicious Roasted Squash and Apple Chowder with Colorful Potatoes dish is a hearty and flavorful meal that combines the natural sweetness of the apples and squash with the earthy taste of the potatoes. The roasted vegetables add a rich, caramelized texture and aroma, while the chowder base provides a comforting and satisfying warmth. The vibrant colors of the vegetables and the potatoes make the dish visually appealing and inviting.

gt:
Dry-roast the walnuts.
Combine the ingredients in a bowl.
Peel and julienne or grate the carrots.
Wash the apple and cut into thin wedges.
Add the apple to the bowl from Step 1 and mix together.
Add the remaining ingredients, mix, and serve.
If you let it sit for 20-30 minutes, the flavors will settle and become even more delicious.
pred:
1. Wash and peel the carrot and apple.
2. Chop the carrot into bite-sized pieces and the apple into thin slices.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the chopped carrot, apple, and walnuts.
4. In a small bowl, mix the dried cranberries, chopped parsley, olive oil, cider vinegar, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
5. Pour the dressing over the carrot, apple, and walnut mixture and toss to coat evenly.
6. Allow the salad to sit in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
7. Serve the Cranberry and Walnut Carrot Salad chilled or at room temperature.

This Cranberry and Walnut Carrot Salad is a delicious and healthy side dish that can be enjoyed as a light lunch or a refreshing snack. The combination of the sweet and tangy flavors from the carrot, apple, and cranberries, along with the crunchy texture of the walnuts, creates a delightful and satisfying dish. The dressing adds a burst of flavor and moisture, enhancing the overall taste of the salad.

gt:
Preheat oven to 325F Butter six 3/4-cup ramekins or custard cups and place in 13x9x2-inch metal baking pan.
Fill large bowl with ice and water.
Bring cream to simmer in medium saucepan.
Remove cream from heat.
Add spinach, salt, and white pepper and stir until spinach wilts, about 1 minute.
Place saucepan over ice water; stir to cool mixture quickly.
Pour cooled spinach mixture into blender; add eggs and roasted garlic.
Blend until spinach is pureed and custard is smooth.
Divide custard among prepared ramekins.
Pour enough hot water into pan to come halfway up sides of ramekins.
Bake custards until gently set in center, turning pan after 30 minutes, about 55 minutes total.
Do ahead: Can be made 1 day ahead.
Cool custards in water.
Remove from water, cover, and chill.
Rewarm custards 2 at a time, uncovered, about 1 minute in microwave at 50 percent power.
Cut around custards to loosen and turn out onto plates.
Drizzle with extra-virgin olive oil and serve.
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the heavy whipping cream, spinach leaves, kosher salt, and fresh ground white pepper.
2. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs until they are well-beaten.
3. Gently fold the whipped cream mixture into the eggs, ensuring that the spinach leaves are evenly distributed.
4. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
5. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. Pour the mixture onto the prepared baking sheet, spreading it evenly to form a thin layer.
7. Bake the custards in the preheated oven for about 30-35 minutes, or until the edges are set and the center is still slightly wobbly.
8. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the custards cool for a few minutes.
9. Using a spatula, carefully transfer the custards onto a serving platter.
10. Garnish the custards with a drizzle of extra virgin olive oil, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Fresh Spinach and Roasted Garlic Custards!

gt:
In a small bowl, mix soy, sugar, and water
In a skillet, heat one one tbsp oil and Brown the chicken.
Remove from heat and keep it aside
Take remaining oil add in a different skillet or cooking pan, saute vegetables till el Dante.
Add chicken to the veggies, all the spices and your soy mixture
Cook for 5 minutes or until source gets a lil thicker.
Serve with rice and soup.
pred:
1. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat.
2. Add the red bell pepper and cook for about 3 minutes, until it is slightly softened.
3. Add the green peas and cook for an additional 2 minutes.
4. Add the chicken strips and cook for 5 minutes, until they are cooked through.
5. Add the water, sugar, soy sauce, lemon pepper, crushed red pepper, and garlic powder. Stir to combine.
6. Cook for an additional 3 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.
7. Serve the Spicy Chicken Stir-fry over a bed of rice or noodles.

[/SYS]

gt:
Dissolve yeast and sugar in 1 cup warm water in a large bowl; let stand 5 minutes.
Lightly spoon flour into dry measuring cups; level with a knife.
Add 2 3/4 cups flour and 1 teaspoon salt to yeast mixture, stirring until well blended.
Turn dough out onto a floured surface.
Knead until smooth and elastic (about 5 minutes); add enough of remaining 1/4 cup flour, 1 tablespoon at a time, to prevent dough from sticking to hands.Place dough in a large bowl coated with cooking spray, turning to coat top.
Cover and let rise in a warm place (85), free from drafts, 1 hour or until doubled in size.Preheat oven to 400.While dough rises, remove white papery skin from garlic head (do not peel or separate the cloves).
Wrap head in foil.
Bake at 400 for 40 minutes; cool 10 minutes.
Separate cloves; squeeze to extract garlic pulp.
Discard skins.Cover a baking sheet with parchment paper; sprinkle with cornmeal.
Place dough on prepared baking sheet.
Roll dough into a 15 x 10-inch rectangle.
Lightly coat dough with cooking spray.
Bake at 400 for 10 minutes or until lightly browned; remove from oven.
Combine garlic pulp, tomato, and remaining ingredients in a medium bowl.
Spread cheese mixture over crust; bake at 400 for 15 minutes or until lightly browned.
Let stand for 10 minutes.
Cut into 12 squares.
pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the dry yeast, sugar, and warm water. Stir until the yeast is dissolved. Allow the mixture to sit for about 5 minutes or until it becomes frothy.
2. Add the flour, salt, and cooking spray to the yeast mixture. Stir until the dough comes together.
3. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it is smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes.
4. Place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl, cover it with a clean cloth, and allow it to rise in a warm place until it has doubled in size, about 1 to 1 1/2 hours.
5. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
6. Punch down the risen dough and transfer it to a lightly floured surface. Roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1/2 inch (1.25 cm).
7. Spread a thin layer of mayonnaise on one side of the rolled-out dough.
8. Top the mayonnaise with the chopped garlic, tomato, and basil.
9. Fold the dough over the filling, pressing the edges to seal the filling in.
10. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Place the filled dough on the prepared baking sheet.
11. Bake the dough in the preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes, or until it is golden brown.
12. Remove the baked dough from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
13. Using a sharp knife, cut the dough into squares.
14. Serve the Roasted Garlic, Tomato, and Basil Squares warm.

[/INST]

This recipe provides a delicious and satisfying meal, combining the flavors of roasted garlic, tomato, and basil. The squares are easy to prepare and can be enjoyed as a snack or a side dish.

gt:
Dissolve salt and sugar in the water.
Add garlic and chicken portions and marinate for 3-6 hours.
Prepare deep fryer as per product directions and preheat oil to 375F.
Fry chicken pieces, a few at a time without crowding, for 6-8 minutes or until a golden color.
Drain on paper towel and keep warm in a 150F oven until all pieces are cooked.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the chicken pieces with the coarse salt and brown sugar. Allow the mixture to sit for 30 minutes.
3. After 30 minutes, drain the chicken pieces and rinse them with cold water to remove any excess salt and sugar.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the crushed garlic cloves with the remaining 3 cups of water.
5. Place the chicken pieces in a large, non-reactive bowl and pour the garlic water mixture over them.
6. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
7. After marinating, remove the chicken pieces from the bowl and pat them dry with paper towels.
8. Heat a large skillet or frying pan over medium-high heat. Add a small amount of oil to the pan, and then carefully place the chicken pieces in the pan, skin side down.
9. Cook the chicken for about 5-7 minutes or until the skin is golden brown and crispy.
10. Flip the chicken pieces over and cook for an additional 3-5 minutes or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
11. Remove the chicken from the pan and place it on a wire rack or a plate to cool for a few minutes.
12. Serve the Marinated Fried Chicken - (Without Batter) hot, and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Place pork in 3 quart slow cooker.
Combine next 8 ingredients; spoon over pork.
Cover; on low, cook until very tender, 12 hours.
Transfer to plate; using 2 forks, shred.
Return pork to sauce in cooker.
Toss coleslaw with scallion.
Serve pork in taco shells with coleslaw and tomato.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 300°F (150°C).
2. Season the pork butt with salt, pepper, and any additional desired spices.
3. Place the pork butt in a Crock Pot and cook on low heat for 8-10 hours, or until the meat is tender and shreds easily with a fork.
4. Remove the pork from the Crock Pot and set aside to cool.
5. Once the pork is cool enough to handle, shred it into bite-sized pieces.
6. In a large bowl, mix the shredded pork with the tomato paste, barbecue sauce, white vinegar, dark brown sugar, lime zest, chili powder, garlic, salt, and scallion.
7. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
8. In a large skillet, heat some oil over medium heat. Add the Coleslaw and cook until it is heated through.
9. In a large taco shell, place a portion of the pork mixture and some Coleslaw.
10. Serve the Crock Pot Pulled Pork Tacos immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 400F.
Tear each pita wedge at fold to form 2 triangles.
Brush rough sides of pita triangles with 1 tablespoon oil and toast on a baking sheet until crisp and golden, 8 to 10 minutes.
Pulse peanut butter, chopped cilantro, lime juice, water, ginger, Tabasco, salt, and remaining tablespoon oil in a food processor until combined well but still slightly chunky.
Toss chicken with peanut sauce and season with salt.
Mound on pita toasts and top with cilantro leaves.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the crunchy peanut butter, chopped fresh cilantro, and 32 whole fresh cilantro leaves.
3. In a large bowl, whisk together the lime juice, water, chopped peeled fresh ginger, Tabasco or hot sauce, and salt.
4. Add the shredded cooked chicken to the bowl and toss to coat the chicken evenly with the marinade.
5. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
6. Carefully place the marinated chicken into the hot skillet, and cook until the chicken is cooked through and the marinade has thickened, about 5-7 minutes.
7. Carefully remove the chicken from the skillet using a slotted spoon, and place it on a plate.
8. Allow the chicken to cool slightly, then cut it into bite-sized pieces.
9. Using a sharp knife, cut the 2 (6-inch) pita loaves into 8 wedges.
10. Place one wedge of pita on a plate, and top it with a spoonful of the chicken mixture.
11. Repeat with the remaining pita wedges and chicken mixture.
12. Serve the Chicken Satay Bites warm, and enjoy!

gt:
Combine sugar and 1/4 cup water in a small saucepan; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat, and simmer 2 minutes or just until sugar dissolves.
Remove from heat; cool.
Combine sugar syrup, club soda, pomegranate juice, vodka, and lime juice.
Place crushed ice in a martini shaker; add about 3/4 cup pomegranate mixture.
Cover and shake.
Strain into a glass.
Garnish with lime slice, if desired.
Repeat procedure with remaining pomegranate mixture.
pred:
To craft a delicious Pomegranate and Lime Cocktail, follow these steps:

1. In a large mixing bowl, combine 14 cups of sugar and 14 cups of water. Stir until the sugar is fully dissolved.
2. Add 1 cup of club soda, 1 cup of unsweetened pomegranate juice, and 12 cups of vodka to the mixture. Stir well to combine.
3. Crush some ice and add it to the mixture. Stir until the ice is fully incorporated.
4. If desired, add a squeeze of fresh key lime juice from 3 limes. Stir to combine.
5. Garnish the cocktail with a key lime slice, if desired.

Enjoy your Pomegranate and Lime Cocktail!

gt:
To prepare the pork and pineapple: In a cup, mix the sugar, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, pepper, and salt.
Mix half of the spices with pork, then toss with the oil.
Mix the remaining spices with the pineapple.
Let stand at room temperature for 15 minutes while preparing the avocado crema.
To prepare the avocado crema: Whisk the avocado with the sour cream, lime juice, and salt in a small bowl.
Press a piece of plastic wrap directly onto the surface to keep the crema fresh looking.
Coat a large nonstick skillet with olive oil spray.
Warm over medium-high heat for 2 minutes.
Add the pork and cook.
turning once or twice, for 8 minutes or until browned and cooked through.
Add the cilantro and toss to combine.
Transfer to a clean plate and cover loosely to keep warm.
( I put in warm oven).
Add the pineapple to the pan and cook, turning once or twice, for 3 to 4 minutes or until golden.
Remove from the heat.
To assemble each serving, place 3 tortillas on a plate.
Divide 1/4 of the pork and pineapple between each tortilla Top with the crema.
Delicious!
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the pork tenderloin, sugar, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, red pepper, salt, and olive oil. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the mashed avocado, nonfat sour cream, lime juice, and salt.
4. Heat a large skillet or griddle over medium-high heat. Add the pork mixture and cook until it is browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.
5. Remove the pork from the skillet and set aside.
6. In the same skillet, add the pineapple chunks and cook until they are tender, about 5-7 minutes.
7. Add the cooked pork back to the skillet and stir to combine.
8. Serve the pineapple and pork tacos with the avocado crema on the side.

[/INST]

The cooking procedure for Pineapple and Pork Tacos With Avocado Crema involves several steps. First, the pork tenderloin is marinated with sugar, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, red pepper, salt, and olive oil. The pork is then refrigerated for at least an hour or overnight to allow the flavors to meld together. Next, the pork is cooked in a skillet or griddle until it is browned and cooked through. After the pork is removed, the pineapple chunks are added to the skillet and cooked until tender. The cooked pork is then returned to the skillet, and the pineapple is stirred to combine. Finally, the pineapple and pork tacos are served with the avocado crema on the side. The avocado crema is made by mixing mashed avocado, nonfat sour cream, lime juice, and salt. This crema adds a delicious, creamy, and tangy flavor to the tacos, enhancing the overall dining experience.

gt:
Wash squash, cut in half lengthwise, then in 1/4-inch slices.
Combine with chopped onion and cook in water to barely cover until both are tender.
Drain thoroughly, pressing out excess water with back of spoon.
Mash squash and onion with potato masher.
Mix with half the butter, the cracker crumbs, eggs, sugar, to taste, salt and pepper.
Pour into greased casserole dish.
Pour remaining butter on top and sprinkle with additional cracker crumbs.
Bake at 375F for 45-60 minutes, or until top is golden brown and bubbly.
NOTE: This recipe is from a restaurant in Smyrna, Georgia called Aunt Fannie's Cabin.
Aunt Fannie was a freed slave of an old Georgia family who remained with the family until her death.
The menu at the Cabin represented many of the dishes that Aunt Fannie prepared for the family.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the chopped onion, melted butter, and eggs. Mix well.
3. Add the summer squash, sugar, salt, and black pepper to the bowl. Mix until well combined.
4. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
5. Sprinkle the saltine crumbs evenly over the top of the casserole.
6. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the squash is tender.
7. Allow the casserole to cool for a few minutes before serving.

Aunt Fannie's Summer Squash Casserole is a delicious and satisfying side dish or main course that can be enjoyed during the warmer months. The combination of tender summer squash, sweet onions, and crunchy saltine crumbs creates a delightful contrast of textures and flavors. This dish is perfect for gatherings, potlucks, or simply enjoying at home with your family.

gt:
Boil chicken until done then chop into small pieces.
Mix 3 tbs of Jamaican jerk rub in to the chicken.
take seeds out of bell peppers and chop into small pieces.
add juice of 1 lemon to bell peppers.
Layer 1 bag of doritos on large baking pan and spread the chicken mixture of it and then add cheese to your own preference.
Pop into 400 degree oven until cheese melt.
Before you serve add the bell peppers to the top.
You can also add sour cream, guacamole, or salsa.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the jamaican jerk spice with a little bit of oil to create a marinade.
3. Season the chicken breasts with the jamaican jerk spice marinade, ensuring they are evenly coated.
4. Place the chicken breasts on a baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes or until cooked through.
5. While the chicken is cooking, prepare the nachos by opening the bag of Doritos and spreading them evenly on a baking sheet.
6. Bake the Doritos in the oven for 5-10 minutes or until they are crispy.
7. Once the chicken is cooked, let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into bite-sized pieces.
8. In a small bowl, mix the sour cream and lemon juice together.
9. Assemble the nachos by placing the chicken pieces on top of the crispy Doritos.
10. Add the sour cream mixture to the top of the chicken and Doritos, and sprinkle the four-cheese Mexican blend cheese over the top.
11. Bake the nachos in the oven for 5-10 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
12. Serve the Jamaican Jerk Nachos immediately and enjoy!

gt:
Line roasting pan with aluminum foil and coat with cooking spray.
Place beef in pan.
Mix all ingredients together and pour over beef.
Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 2 1/2 to 3 hours at 350 degrees.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. Season the chuck roast or beef brisket with salt, pepper, and any additional herbs or spices you prefer.
3. Heat a large oven-safe skillet or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the ketchup, dry onion soup mix, and 12 cups of water to the skillet or Dutch oven. Stir to combine.
5. Place the chuck roast or beef brisket on top of the mixture in the skillet or Dutch oven.
6. Cover the skillet or Dutch oven with a lid and place it in the preheated oven. Cook for about 3 hours, or until the meat is tender and the internal temperature reaches 160°F (71°C).
7. Remove the skillet or Dutch oven from the oven and let it rest for about 15-20 minutes before slicing and serving.

This recipe for a delicious Brisket utilizes a combination of ingredients to create a flavorful and tender dish. The chuck roast or beef brisket is the main protein source, while the onion adds depth and flavor to the dish. The ketchup provides a sweet and tangy taste, and the dry onion soup mix adds a savory, umami-rich element to the dish. The water helps to cook the meat evenly and tenderize it, while also creating a rich and flavorful sauce.

By following these steps, you can create a delicious Brisket dish that will be enjoyed by everyone.

gt:
Place the watermelon, peppermint leaves, honey, and ice cubes into a blender.
Cover, and puree until smooth.
Serve immediately.
pred:
1. First, wash the watermelon and peel off the rind.
2. Cut the watermelon into small cubes.
3. Remove the seeds from the watermelon cubes.
4. Add the cubed watermelon to a blender or food processor.
5. Add the peppermint leaves, and if desired, honey.
6. Blend the mixture until smooth and creamy.
7. Pour the mixture into a glass.
8. Add ice cubes to the glass.
9. Stir the mixture gently.
10. Enjoy your Refreshing Watermelon Cooler.

[/INST]

gt:
Cook all ingredients in saucepan on low heat 20 min.
or until heated through, stirring occasionally.
(Do not boil.)
Remove cinnamon sticks and cloves; discard.
Serve cider warm.
pred:
1. In a large saucepan, combine the water and the Crystal Light Singles Cherry Pomegranate Low Calorie Drink Mix.
2. Add the cinnamon sticks, whole cloves, and ground nutmeg to the saucepan.
3. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 10-15 minutes, or until the Crystal Light Singles Cherry Pomegranate Low Calorie Drink Mix is fully dissolved.
4. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
5. Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve or a cheesecloth into a clean saucepan or a large pitcher.
6. Serve the Cherry Pomegranate Mulled "Cider" hot, garnished with a cinnamon stick and a sprig of fresh rosemary, if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Heat oven to 350F.
Beat cream cheese, potatoes, 1/4 cup sugar and cinnamon with mixer until blended.
Spoon into 1.5-L casserole dish; top with fruit.
Mix flour, oats and remaining sugar in medium bowl; cut in margarine with pastry blender or 2 knives until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Stir in nuts; sprinkle over fruit.
Bake 35 to 40 min.
or until heated through.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked sweet potatoes, brown sugar, cinnamon, and Granny Smith apple. Mix well.
3. In a separate bowl, combine the flour, oats, and cold non-hydrogenated margarine. Mix until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
4. Pour the sweet potato mixture into a greased baking dish.
5. Sprinkle the crumb mixture evenly over the sweet potato mixture.
6. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the crisp is golden brown and the filling is bubbly.
7. Remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Oat-Topped Sweet Potato Crisp!

gt:
Prepare hot chocolate according to package insturctions.
Drop in one peppermint patty and stir as it desolves.
Enjoy by the fire or outside on a cold day.
pred:
1. First, prepare the hot cocoa by combining the 8 ounces of regular hot cocoa with milk or water, depending on your preference.
2. Next, open the Hershey's York miniature peppermint patties and remove the chocolate center.
3. In a small saucepan, heat the milk or water over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until it reaches a simmer.
4. Add the chocolate center from the peppermint patties to the hot milk or water, stirring gently to melt the chocolate.
5. Once the chocolate is melted, remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the prepared hot cocoa.
6. Allow the mixture to cool for a few minutes, then pour it into a mug.
7. Optionally, you can add a small amount of whipped cream or a dusting of cocoa powder on top for extra flavor and presentation.

Enjoy your delicious Cool Mint Hot Chocolate!

gt:
1.
Put 4 cups watermelon in a blender; process until smooth.
Strain through a sieve into a pitcher; discard solids.
Repeat procedure with remaining watermelon cubes.
Combine lime juice, sugar, and ginger in a bowl; stir with a whisk until sugar dissolves.
Add lime juice mixture and watermelon balls to watermelon mixture; stir in sparkling water just before serving.
Serve over cracked ice, if desired.
pred:
[INST]
1. In a large bowl, combine the watermelon cubes, lime juice, sugar, and grated ginger. Stir to combine.
2. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
3. After chilling, add the sparkling water and stir to combine.
4. If desired, add cracked ice to the bowl and stir again.
5. Serve the Watermelon-Ginger Punch in chilled glasses, garnished with a lime wedge and a sprig of fresh ginger, if desired.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Position an oven rack close to the broiler and heat the broiler.
Put the peppers skin side up on a baking sheet and broil until blackened.
Transfer the peppers to a small bowl, cover the bowl with plastic wrap, and let cool.
Reduce the oven to 400 degrees F.
In a medium bowl, combine the olive oil, cumin, cayenne, half of the garlic, and the lime juice.
Season with salt.
Add the chicken to the bowl and toss to coat it well with the vinaigrette.
When the peppers are cool enough to handle, remove the blackened skin, and chop the peppers finely.
In a small bowl, combine the sour cream, onion, the other half of the garlic, the cilantro, and the chopped peppers.
Put the tortillas on a baking sheet.
Divide the chicken among the tortillas leaving a little space around the edges.
Top with the sour cream mixture and then the cheese.
Bake until the cheese is melted, about 5 minutes.
Garnish with a little fresh cilantro and serve with some salsa.
Eat as is with a knife and fork or roll the tortilla up and eat with your hands.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the red bell pepper and the flattened poblano chile with the extra virgin olive oil, cayenne, cumin, minced garlic, and lime juice. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
3. Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and slightly charred.
4. While the vegetables are roasting, season the shredded chicken with salt and pepper.
5. In a large skillet, heat the remaining tablespoon of olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
6. Add the sour cream to the skillet and stir to combine. Cook until the sauce has thickened slightly, about 2-3 minutes.
7. Remove the roasted vegetables from the oven and let them cool slightly.
8. Add the roasted vegetables to the skillet with the chicken and stir to combine.
9. Serve the Roasted Poblano & Bell Pepper Chicken Taco in corn tortillas and top with salsa.

[/INST]

[INST]<<SYS>>
You are a helpful language and vision assistant. You are able to understand the visual content that the user provides, and assist the user with a variety of tasks using natural language.
<</SYS>>

Provide a cooking guide for preparing Roasted Poblano & Bell Pepper Chicken Taco and list the required ingredients as follows: 12 red bell pepper, stemmed, seeded, and flattened,1 poblano chile, stemmed, seeded, and flattened,1 12 cups shredded rotisserie cooked chicken,2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil,1 pinch cayenne,12 teaspoon cumin,1 minced garlic clove,12 lime, juice of,1 pinch kosher salt,12 cup sour cre

gt:
Preheat oven to 350.Place 1 cup milk, egg substitute, and goat cheese in a blender; process until smooth.
Combine goat cheese mixture, remaining 2 1/4 cups milk, black pepper, thyme, nutmeg, and garlic in a large bowl, stirring with a whisk.
Add bread cubes; stir gently to combine.
Let stand 10 minutes.Place half of the bread mixture in a 13 x 9-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray.
Arrange Parmesan cheese, ham, and artichoke hearts evenly over the bread mixture.
Top with remaining bread mixture, and sprinkle evenly with fontina cheese.Bake strata at 350 for 40 minutes or until edges are bubbly.
Let stand 15 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the 3 1/4 cups of milk, egg substitute, goat cheese, pepper, thyme, nutmeg, and minced garlic.
3. Add the sourdough bread cubes to the bowl and toss to coat evenly with the milk mixture.
4. Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
5. Pour the bread mixture into the prepared baking dish and press it down to ensure it is evenly distributed.
6. Spread the grated Parmesan cheese evenly over the bread mixture.
7. Top the bread mixture with the chopped smoked ham, artichoke hearts, and fontina cheese.
8. Drizzle the remaining 1/2 cup of milk over the top of the strata.
9. Bake the strata in the preheated oven for 35-40 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and the cheese is bubbly and melted.
10. Remove the strata from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

gt:
1) Heat oil in large, heavy pot over medium-high heat.
Add bell pepper and onion; saute 5 minutes or until vegetables begin to soften.
Add garlic, ginger and curry paste; cook 1 minute, stirring constantly.
2) Add coconut milk and fish sauce, brown sugar and 2 cups water to pot; bring to a simmer.
3) Add potatoes and carrots; reduce heat to low.
Cover and simmer until vegetables just begin to soften, 5 to 8 minutes.
4) Add zucchini and snow peas; simmer 8 minutes.
If the stew is too thick add water to thin.
Stir in lime juice and sprinkle with basil.
5) Serve hot over jasmine rice.
pred:
1. Heat the canola oil in a large pot over medium heat.
2. Add the red bell pepper and yellow onion, and cook until they are tender.
3. Add the minced garlic and ginger, and cook for an additional minute.
4. Add the green curry paste and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly.
5. Add the unsweetened coconut milk, fish sauce (if using), and brown sugar. Stir to combine.
6. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for about 15-20 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
7. Add the cubed potato, sliced carrot, and zucchini to the pot. Cook for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
8. Add the snow peas to the pot, and cook for a few more minutes, or until they are tender.
9. Serve the Thai Vegetable Stew hot, garnished with a squeeze of lime juice and a sprinkle of chopped basil.

[/INST]

gt:
1.
Stir together the cooked orzo, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, parsley, salt, and 1/2 teaspoon black pepper in a medium saucepan.
Keep warm over low heat.
2.
Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a large skillet over medium-high.
Add half of shrimp and saute for about 2 minutes or until shrimp is almost done.
Remove shrimp to a plate.
Add remaining shrimp and saute for 2 minutes and remove shrimp to plate.
3.
Add remaining tablespoon butter into the skillet.
Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds to 1 minute, or until garlic starts to brown.
Stir constantly to prevent scorching.
Add shrimp, remaining lemon juice, and remaining black pepper.
Stir until shrimp is coated.
Cook for another minute or until shrimp is done.
4.
Serve shrimp over orzo.
This recipe is adapted from Cooking Light.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the cooked orzo, 1 tablespoon of fresh lemon juice, and 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Toss to combine.
3. In a small bowl, mix the chopped curly parsley, 1/2 teaspoon of salt, and 1/2 teaspoon of freshly ground pepper.
4. In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of butter over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
5. Add the shrimp to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until they are pink and cooked through.
6. Remove the shrimp from the skillet and set aside.
7. In the same skillet, add the remaining tablespoon of butter and cook the curly parsley mixture until it is fragrant and slightly wilted.
8. Add the cooked orzo to the skillet and toss to combine with the shrimp and parsley mixture.
9. Transfer the orzo mixture to a baking dish and top with the cooked shrimp.
10. Drizzle the remaining tablespoon of lemon juice over the top of the dish.
11. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the shrimp is cooked through and the orzo is tender.
12. Serve the Lemon Pepper Shrimp Orzo hot, garnished with additional chopped parsley, if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Arrange tomato slices on a serving platter.
(Mix optional onion slices with tomatoes).
Sprinkle feta cheese, parsley, (optional garlic) and pepper over tomatoes; drizzle with olive oil.
Serve immediately.
NOTE: Serving size = about 3 slices.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the crumbled feta cheese with garlic and herbs.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the minced fresh parsley, black pepper, and olive oil.
4. In a large skillet, heat the garlic clove, pressed, over medium heat. Add the onion and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
5. Add the sliced tomatoes to the skillet and cook until they start to release their juices and become tender, about 10 minutes.
6. Remove the skillet from the heat and stir in the parsley mixture.
7. Transfer the tomato mixture to a large baking dish.
8. Sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese mixture evenly over the tomatoes.
9. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the feta cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Remove the dish from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Cook udon noodles according to package directions.
Drain and rinse with cold water.
In a large bowl, add all of the vegetables and lettuce.
Add noodles and combine.
In a small bowl, add garlic, hoisin, rice vinegar, sesame oil, soy sauce, Sriracha, wasabi paste, agave syrup and lemon juice.
Stir with a whisk.
Add sauce into the bowl with the noodle mixture and toss to combine.
pred:
To make a delicious Udon Noodle Salad with Fresh Veggies dish, follow these steps:
1. Cook the Udon Noodles according to the package instructions, usually boiling for 3-5 minutes until they are cooked through.
2. While the noodles are cooking, chop the green onions, yellow pepper, green pepper, and edamame into small pieces.
3. Once the noodles are cooked, rinse them under cold water to stop the cooking process and prevent them from becoming mushy.
4. In a large bowl, combine the cooked noodles, chopped green onions, yellow pepper, green pepper, edamame, cherry tomatoes, and spring mix lettuce.
5. In a small bowl, mix the minced garlic, hoisin sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, soy sauce, low sodium, sriracha, wasabi paste, agave syrup, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
6. Pour the sauce mixture over the noodle mixture and toss everything together until the ingredients are evenly coated.
7. Serve the Udon Noodle Salad with Fresh Veggies dish immediately, as it is best when served fresh and cold. Enjoy your delicious and healthy meal!

gt:
Heat oven to 325 degrees F.
Line 13x9-inch pan with foil, with ends of foil extending over sides.
Beat cream cheese, sugar, vanilla and lemon zest with mixer until blended.
Add eggs, 1 at a time, mixing on low speed after each just until blended; pour into prepared pan.
Bake 1 hour or until center is almost set.
Cool completely.
Refrigerate 2 hours.
Use foil handles to lift cheesecake from pan.
Crumble cheesecake into large bowl.
Add strawberries; mix well.
Shape into 48 balls, using about 1 Tbsp.
for each.
Roll in graham crumbs until evenly coated.
Place on parchment-covered rimmed baking sheet.
Refrigerate 1 hour.
Melt chocolate as directed on package.
Dip cheesecake balls, 1 at a time, in chocolate; return to baking sheet.
Sprinkle with any remaining graham crumbs.
Refrigerate 1 hour or until chocolate is firm.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the softened cream cheese, sugar, vanilla, and lemon zest. Mix until smooth and creamy.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
4. Stir in the sliced strawberries.
5. Pour the mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish that has been greased and floured.
6. Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the edges are set and the center is slightly jiggly.
7. Allow the cake to cool completely in the pan.
8. Crush the graham crackers using a rolling pin or food processor.
9. In a small saucepan, melt the BAKER'S Dark Semi-Sweet Dipping Chocolate over low heat.
10. Dip the cooled cake into the melted chocolate, allowing the excess to drip off.
11. Roll the cake in the crushed graham crackers to coat evenly.
12. Refrigerate the cake for at least 30 minutes to set the chocolate coating.

Enjoy your delicious Bri Emerys Strawberry Cheesecake Bites!

gt: Sprinkle with powdered sugar before slicing, if desired.
pred:
[/SYS]

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, cream together the melted butter, sugar, and egg until light and fluffy.
3. Add the molasses, milk, and grated gingerroot or ginger puree to the bowl, and mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, cinnamon, allspice, nutmeg, baking soda, and salt.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, stirring until just combined.
6. If desired, dust your hands with powdered sugar and shape the dough into a log or other desired shape.
7. Place the dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the log comes out clean.
9. Allow the gingerbread to cool on a wire rack for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

Enjoy your delicious Fresh Ginger Gingerbread!

gt:
Remove the skin from the kabocha and slice finely.
Wrap and microwave for 3 minutes until soft.
Mash with a spoon and season with mayonnaise and salt.
When smooth, shape into round, bite-sized pieces and top with plum sesame salt to finish.
This is what it looks like in a bento.
If you add other toppings such as black sesame seeds, thinly sliced baby corn or green vegetable paste, it looks different and cute.
You can even make a Jack-o'-Lantern.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).

gt:
In a bowl, add ribs and marinade ingredients.
Marinate meat in total for 2 hours, after 1 1/2 hours remove from refrigerator.
It is best when grilling to start with room temperature meat.
Set your indoor grill to a searing setting.
If using a grill pan, set to high.
Heat pan up and then turn to a medium - high setting.
Grill meats several minutes on each side.
Timing of doneness depends on thickness.
When halfway through, pour leftover marinade on top of meat.
This is just perfect on outdoor grills too when weather permits.
Serve along with your favorite sides.
We served over basmati rice with broccoli.
You can take the marinade and make a second batch without meat and simmer on stove to serve as a dip or over any side you pair with it.
Never use the marinade the meat has soaked in without cooking, or bringing leftover to a boil.
Recipe by taylor68too
pred:
1. Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
2. In a large bowl, mix the country style ribs with the worcestershire sauce, sweet chili sauce, fresh lemon juice, salt, and annato seed oil. Make sure the ribs are evenly coated.
3. Place the ribs on a grill rack and cook for about 20-25 minutes, or until the meat is tender and cooked through.
4. While the ribs are cooking, prepare the sauce by combining the ingredients in a small saucepan. Bring the sauce to a simmer over medium heat, and let it cook for about 5-10 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and coated the ribs evenly.
5. Once the ribs are cooked, remove them from the grill and let them rest for a few minutes. Then, use a fork to shred the meat into bite-sized pieces.
6. Serve the grilled ribs with the sauce on the side, allowing the guests to enjoy the delicious combination of flavors.

gt:
Preheat the oven to 350 F and line a cupcake pan with 6 cupcake liners.
In a medium bowl, combine the cake mix, egg, water and cream.
Beat with an electric mixer for 1 minute.
Evenly divide the cake batter into the 6 cupcake liners.
Put pan into the oven and bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center of one comes out clean.
Remove pan from oven and set on a rack.
Let the cupcakes cool completely.
For the topping: In a small bowl, melt the chocolate chips and butter in the microwave in 15-second intervals, stirring between each.
It should only take two or three 15-second intervals.
Stir in the peppermint extract once the mixture is melted smooth.
Have the crushed candy canes ready in a bowl.
Dip the top of each cupcake in the melted chocolate, and then roll it in the crushed candy canes.
Set cupcakes on a plate.
You can let the chocolate harden in the fridge for 30 minutes, but do not store the cupcakes in the fridge any longer than that because the candy canes will weep.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cake mix, egg, water, and cream. Mix until smooth.
3. Add the dark chocolate chips and melted butter, and mix until well combined.
4. Fold in the crushed candy canes.
5. Line a muffin tin with cupcake liners, and fill each cup with the batter.
6. Bake the cupcakes for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a cupcake comes out clean.
7. Allow the cupcakes to cool completely in the pan.
8. Once cooled, frost the cupcakes with a peppermint buttercream frosting.
9. Crush the remaining candy canes and sprinkle them on top of the frosting.
10. Enjoy your delicious Chocolate Peppermint Crunch Cupcakes!

[/INST]

gt:
Place cereal and raisins in a plastic container.
Include a plastic spoon.
Pour milk over cereal just before serving.
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 2/3 cup of honey-flavored multi-grain cereal flakes with oat clusters, and the 1/4 cup of raisins.
2. Pour the skim milk into the bowl, stirring gently to combine the ingredients.
3. Mix the ingredients until they are well-coated and evenly distributed.
4. If the mixture is too dry, you can add a bit more milk to achieve the desired consistency.
5. Serve the Lunchbag Cereal immediately or store it in an airtight container for later consumption.

This recipe creates a delicious and nutritious breakfast or snack option using the provided ingredients. The honey-flavored cereal flakes provide a sweet and satisfying taste, while the raisins add a touch of natural sweetness and a hint of dried fruit flavor. The skim milk adds a creamy texture and a source of essential nutrients, such as calcium and vitamin D.

gt:
heat oven to 160C Grease and line a 25cm/10 inch springform cake tin with greaseproof paper.
melt the chocolate and butter together in a pan over a gentle heat.
In another pan, heat the milk with the cooked chestnuts until just boiling, then process to a rough puree with a processor.
Seperate the egg whites from the yolks.
Put the yolks with the sugar and mix, add the chocolate mixture and chestnut puree.
Mix until you have a smooth batter.
Wisk the whites until stiff, then fold gently into the chocolate chestnut mix.
Transfer to the cake tin and bake for about 30 minutes or until just set, with a slight wobble in the centre.
Cool completely then serve cut in a thick wedge with a thick dollop of double cream.

To prepare the Soft and Gooey Chestnut and Chocolate Cake, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 175°C (350°F).
2. Grease and flour a 20cm (8 inch) round cake pan.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the dark chocolate, unsalted butter, cooked peeled chestnuts, milk (or rice milk), and eggs. Mix until smooth and well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the caster sugar and flour. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, stirring until smooth.
5. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
6. Bake the cake for 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
7. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
8. Once the cake is completely cooled, dust it with powdered sugar, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Soft and Gooey Chestnut and Chocolate Cake!

gt:
Cook noodles according to package directions.
Cook beef and onion until meat is no longer pink and drain.
Add tomato sauce and water and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat, cover and cook for 8 minutes.
Drain the noodles and add to beef mixture.
Mix in the corn, salt and pepper.
Sprinkle with cheese, cover and cook until heated through and cheese is melted.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet or oven-safe pan, cook the ground beef over medium heat until it is browned and cooked through. Drain any excess fat.
3. Add the chopped onion to the skillet and cook until softened.
4. Add the drained Mexican corn and the tomato sauce to the skillet. Stir to combine.
5. Add the water and bring the mixture to a boil.
6. Add the egg noodles to the skillet and stir to combine.
7. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Cover the skillet with a lid and bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the noodles are cooked through and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Remove the skillet from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

This delicious Easy Beef Skillet Supper is ready to be enjoyed with your family and friends.

gt:
Remove plastic netting or twine from around the leg of lamb, if any, and open up the roast on a cutting board.
Place the boned side of the roast up.
With a sharp paring knife, cut away any excess fatty areas.
Use a sharp knife to cut 1/2-inch deep slits in the meat about 2 inches apart, to help the meat lie flat.
Cover the meat with a sturdy piece of plastic wrap or a cut-apart food storage bag, and pound the meat with a mallet or the edge of a small plate until the roast is about 3/4 inch thick everywhere, and 10 to 14 inches square.
Preheat an oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Sprinkle the upper side of the meat with salt and pepper, and then spread spinach leaves over the top of the roast to within 1/2 inch of the edges.
Break up the goat cheese and sprinkle it evenly over the spinach, then sprinkle the pine nuts over the cheese.
Roll the roast up into a tight cylinder, and tie the roast together with kitchen twine at 2 inch intervals.
It's okay if a little stuffing protrudes from the sides of the roast.
In a flat dish, mix together the flour, 1 tablespoon of salt, 1 tablespoon of pepper, the thyme, and the fennel seeds, and press the tied roast firmly into the flour mixture to coat all sides.
Heat the sesame oil in a heavy oven-proof or cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat until the oil shimmers, and sear all sides of the roast, including the ends, to a golden brown color.
Lay the roast into the skillet, place into the preheated oven, and roast to your desired degree of doneness, or an internal temperature of 145 degrees F (65 degrees C) for medium, about 40 minutes.
Remove from the oven, cover with a doubled sheet of aluminum foil, and allow to rest in a warm area 10 to 15 minutes before slicing.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Season the leg of lamb with salt and black pepper, ensuring it is evenly coated.
3. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the pine nuts and cook until they are golden brown, about 2-3 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.
4. In a large mixing bowl, combine the goat cheese, spinach leaves, and pine nuts. Season with salt, pepper, and thyme.
5. Cut the lamb into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes.
6. In a separate mixing bowl, combine the flour, salt, and pepper. Add the lamb cubes and toss to coat evenly.
7. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the lamb and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.
8. Add the sesame oil to the skillet and heat it over medium heat. Add the spinach and fennel seeds mixture and cook until the spinach is wilted, about 2-3 minutes.
9. Carefully place the lamb cubes on top of the spinach mixture. Cover the skillet and cook in the oven for about 1 hour, or until the lamb is cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C).
10. Remove the lamb from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes. Then, using kitchen twine, tie the lamb into a neat bundle.
11. Slice the lamb into 1-inch (2.5 cm) pieces and serve.

This recipe provides a delicious and satisfying meal, combining the tender and flavorful lamb with the fresh and earthy spinach and goat cheese. The sesame oil and pine nuts add a touch of richness and depth to the dish, making it a delightful and well-rounded meal.

gt:
Cook pasta according to package directions.
Cut tiny zucchini into rounds, or cut medium-sized zucchini into quarter rounds about 1/4 inch thick.
In a skillet, saute the zucchini, garlic and pine nuts in olive oil until the garlic is golden and the zucchini is barely tender, for just a few minutes.
Put the zucchini into a large serving bowl and add the tomatoes, parsley, basil, cheese, lemon juice and olive oil.
Add black pepper to taste and mix well.
When pasta is el dente, drain it and add to the serving bowl.
Toss everything and serve immediately.
Sprinkle with Parmesan if desired.
pred:
1. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions, usually boiling until al dente.
2. While the pasta is cooking, heat the olive oil in a large skillet or pan over medium heat.
3. Add the minced garlic and cook for about 1 minute, until fragrant.
4. Add the pine nuts and cook for another minute, until they become slightly toasted.
5. Add the zucchini to the skillet and cook until they are tender but still have a slight crunch.
6. Add the tomatoes to the skillet and cook until they are softened and slightly mushy.
7. Add the fresh parsley and basil to the skillet and cook for a minute or two, until they are wilted.
8. Drain the cooked pasta and add it to the skillet with the vegetables.
9. Add the mozzarella cheese and stir to combine.
10. Season the dish with freshly ground black pepper and a squeeze of lemon juice.
11. Serve the Summer Corkscrew Pasta immediately, garnished with a sprinkle of freshly grated parmesan cheese.

[/INST]

gt:
Put ice cubes into electric blender, start so that the cubes break up.
Put the remaining ingredients into blender and blend until smooth.
Serve.
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 34 cup of orange juice concentrate, 1 cup of 2% low-fat milk, 1 cup of water, and 3 tablespoons of sugar.
2. Stir the mixture until the sugar is fully dissolved.
3. Add 12 teaspoons of almond extract to the mixture, and stir to combine.
4. Pour the mixture into a blender or food processor, and blend until smooth and creamy.
5. Add 1 cup of ice cubes to the blender or food processor, and blend until the ice is completely crushed and the mixture is smooth and slushy.
6. Pour the slushy mixture into a glass, and enjoy your Orange Splash dish.

8. Transfer the sauce to a large oven-safe dish or casserole, and smooth the top with a spatula or spoon.
9. Bake the Hot Kangaroo Mince in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the filling is hot and bubbly.
10. Serve the Hot Kangaroo Mince immediately, garnished with fresh herbs if desired. Enjoy!

gt:
Preheat the broiler on your oven.
In a frying pan with an ovenproof handle heat the oil and saute onion, garlic and green bell pepper over a low heat.
Saute until vegetables are just tender but not browned.
Add the zucchini and continue cooking, stirring occasionally, until crisp-tender.
Add the potatoes, stir well to combine, and continue cooking, stirring frequently, until the potatoes are heated through and starting to stick to the pan.
Then add the tomatoes and black olives, stirring well to combine with the other ingredients, and cook just until the tomatoes have begun giving up their juice.
Beat the eggs with the salt, pepper, oregano, and cayenne.
When all the vegetables are cooked, pour the eggs over them
Arrange the tomato slices over the top of the eggs, and sprinkle the mozzarella and Parmesan cheeses over the tomato slices.
Cook gently over low heat until the eggs are almost set (they'll be firm around the edges and a bit runny in the middle).
Slip the pan under the broiler for a minute or two, until the eggs are fully set and the cheese has melted and begun to brown.
Cut into wedges and serve.
pred:

2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic, and cook until the onion is translucent.
3. Add the green bell pepper and zucchini, and cook for a few more minutes until they are tender.
4. Add the cooked potatoes, tomato, black olives, eggs, salt, pepper, oregano, cayenne pepper, and sliced tomato. Stir to combine.
5. Pour the mixture into a greased 9-inch (23cm) round baking dish.
6. Sprinkle the mozzarella cheese and Parmesan cheese over the top.
7. Bake the frittata in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly, and the edges are slightly golden.
8. Let the frittata cool for a few minutes before slicing it into wedges and serving.

gt:
Puree first 7 ingredients in processor.
With machine running, gradually add oil through feed tube and process until blended.
Transfer 1/4 cup herb mixture to small bowl; reserve.
Add yogurt and lemon juice to remaining mixture in processor and blend.
Place chicken in 13x9x2-inch glass baking dish.
Pour yogurt mixture over chicken; turn to coat.
Cover and refrigerate 1 hour.
Prepare barbecue (medium heat).
Place chicken, skin side down, on grill.
Cover and grill until chicken is cooked through, turning every 5 minutes, about 30 minutes total.
Grill mango slices 2 minutes per side; set aside.
Meanwhile, combine rice, 3 cups water, and reserved 1/4 cup herb mixture.
Bring to boil.
Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer until tender, about 15 minutes.
Remove from heat; let stand, covered, 5 minutes.
Fold in mango cubes and pine nuts.
Arrange chicken on large platter; garnish with grilled mango slices and cilantro sprigs.
Serve mango jasmine rice alongside.
pred:
1. Preheat your grill to high heat.
2. In a large bowl, mix the yogurt, lemon juice, cumin, paprika, cayenne pepper, and garlic. Season the chicken with salt and pepper, then toss it in the yogurt mixture.
3. Grill the chicken until it is cooked through and slightly charred, about 6-8 minutes per side.
4. While the chicken is grilling, prepare the rice by washing the rice and then cooking it in a saucepan with the water, salt, and pine nuts. Bring the rice to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover the pan. Cook the rice until it is tender and the water has been absorbed, about 15-20 minutes.
5. Once the chicken is cooked, let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into bite-sized pieces.
6. To serve, place the chicken on a platter and surround it with the cooked rice. Garnish with the chopped cilantro and parsley, and serve immediately.

To prepare Sweet Potato Soup, follow these steps:
1. In a large pot or Dutch oven, sauté the chopped onion and garlic clove over medium heat until the onion is translucent.

Enjoy your delicious Sweet Potato Soup!

gt:

or until crisp-tender.

Stir in chicken.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

Cover with remaining tortillas and press slightly.

or until golden brown.
