To create a delicious Cheesy Chicken Quesadillas with Peppers dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).

2. In a small bowl, mix the 1/4 cup of Kraft Zesty Italian Dressing with 2 cloves of minced garlic.

3. In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and onion, and cook until the onion is translucent.

4. Add the sliced red peppers to the skillet and cook for a few more minutes, until they are tender.

5. Add the sliced mushrooms to the skillet and cook until they are tender and slightly browned.

6. Remove the skillet from the heat and stir in the cooked chicken, mixing well.

7. Spread half of the Cracker Barrel Shredded Tex Mex Cheese evenly over one of the tortillas.

8. Add the chicken and vegetable mixture to the other tortilla, then top with the remaining cheese.

9. Place the filled tortilla on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.

10. Carefully flip the quesadilla and bake for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the tortilla is crispy.

11. Cut the quesadilla into wedges and serve immediately.

This delicious Cheesy Chicken Quesadillas with Peppers dish combines the flavors of chicken, vegetables, and cheese, creating a satisfying and flavorful meal. The use of fresh ingredients and the addition of the zesty Italian dressing adds a unique twist to the dish, making it a delightful and memorable culinary experience.

gt:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a bowl, whisk flour, baking soda, and salt.
In a large bowl, beat butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until well blended.
Beat in peanut butter.
Beat in egg and vanilla extract.
Beat in flour mixture until combined.
Stir in chips.
Drop dough by slightly rounded 1/4 cupfuls 4 inches apart onto prepared baking sheets.
Press a fork into each to make a crosshatch design.
Bake 11 to 12 minutes, or until browned at the edges.
Let stand 2 minutes on baking sheets before removing to wire rack to cool completely.

To prepare Peanut Butter Cookies, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugars until smooth.
3. Add the egg and vanilla extract, and mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until a dough forms.
6. Fold in the peanut butter chips.
7. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are lightly golden and the cookies are set.
9. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

The essential ingredients for making Peanut Butter Cookies are: all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt, unsalted butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar, chunky peanut butter, large egg, vanilla extract, and peanut butter chips.

gt:

6. Garnish the Summer Brew with the lime wedges, if desired.
7. Serve the Summer Brew immediately, and enjoy the refreshing and flavorful beverage.

[/INST]

gt:
Combine all ingredients in a stockpot and simmer until fork tender-this can take from 3-4 hours.
Can be made in a crock pot also-decrease liquid by about 1/2, bouillon powder by 1/3, and cook on low for 8-10 hours (or until tender as above).
When tender, remove from heat and allow meat to cool in the broth until cool enough to handle (this will keep the meat moist).
Shred (or "pull") either with forks or by hand.
Place in storage container and add some of the broth to moisten; refrigerate until needed.
Reheat either in microwave, or in saucepan; use a little of the juice to keep it moist.
For the Mexican-flavored pot roast, don't shred-slice fairly thick (about 1/2"), and make a gravy by thickening some of the juice with either cornstarch or roux (sorry, you'll have to thicken by sight; tough to give an exact quantity for that); serve with plain steamed rice/boiled potatoes and a vegetable-broccoli and/or carrots come to mind first.
Leftovers make great open-faced hot sandwiches.
For soup, take broth and add some onions, carrots, celery, an extra bit of canned diced tomato (you can use almost anything for veggies depending on what you like/have on hand), some of the pork meat and posole (or hominy); simmer until tender and add shredded cabbage; cook another 15 minutes.
Serve with hot tortillas and a salad for a complete meal.
Can also be made as beef machaca by using bottom (outside) round, chuck, or brisket; replace chicken bouillon powder with beef.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. Season the pork with salt and pepper.
3. In a large pot, combine the pork, water, chicken bouillon powder, and garlic cloves. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 4-6 hours or until the pork is tender and can be easily shredded with a fork.
4. Remove the pork from the pot, and let it cool slightly.
5. Shred the pork into bite-sized pieces using two forks.
6. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the shredded pork and cook until browned, about 5-7 minutes.
7. Add the diced tomatoes or tomato paste, jalapenos, oregano, and any additional seasoning you prefer. Cook for an additional 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the flavors have melded together and the pork is heated through.
8. Serve the Pork Machaca in tacos, burritos, or as a main dish with your favorite side dishes.

[/INST]

This recipe is for a delicious and tender Pork Machaca, a popular Mexican dish made with shredded pork that has been cooked in a flavorful sauce. The ingredients include a pork butt, water, chicken bouillon powder, garlic, jalapenos, oregano, and tomatoes or tomato paste. The pork is cooked for several hours until it is tender and can be easily shredded. Once the pork is cooked, it is combined with the sauce, which includes diced tomatoes or tomato paste, jalapenos, oregano, and any additional seasoning you prefer. The final dish is served in tacos, burritos, or as a main dish with your favorite side dishes.

gt:
Heat oil in a large heavy saucepan or Dutch oven.
Add garlic& veggies and cook, stirring constantly, for a few minutes until onions are translucent.
Stir in spices; add tomatoes with their liquid& concentrated chicken stock that has been dissolved in the boiling water.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes.
Add pasta and continue cooking for another 15 minutes, stirring frequently.
Taste& adjust seasoning.
Stir in beans& cook for about 5 minutes longer to heat through.
Ladle into soup bowls& top with a few shavings of Parmesan.
pred:
1. In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped garlic and onions, and cook until they are softened, about 5 minutes.
2. Add the carrots, celery, red pepper, and chopped basil or dried basil. Cook for an additional 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
3. Add the sliced tomatoes, chicken broth, and boiling water. Stir to combine, then bring the mixture to a simmer.
4. Add the drained red kidney beans and white kidney beans, and cook for about 15-20 minutes, or until the beans are tender.
5. Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste.
6. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions until it is al dente.
7. Serve the Pasta E Fagioli hot, topped with shaved Parmesan cheese.

[/INST]

gt:
In small bowl, toss cheese and flour.
In small saucepan, heat buttermilk and cider.
Add cheese and caraway seeds.
Stir til melted.
Keep warm while serving.
Serve with chunks of rye bread for dipping.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Warm and Creamy Swiss Cheese Dip With Caraway, follow these steps:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the grated or sliced swiss cheese, flour, and caraway seed.
2. Gradually add the buttermilk, stirring to combine the ingredients.
3. Place the bowl in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
4. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
5. Pour the mixture into a baking dish and bake for about 20-25 minutes, or until the dip is hot and bubbly.
6. Remove the baking dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

This warm and creamy Swiss cheese dip with caraway is a delightful appetizer or snack option, perfect for gatherings or parties. The combination of the rich, tangy swiss cheese, the flour, and the caraway seed creates a delightful flavor profile that is both comforting and satisfying. The warmth of the dip adds an extra layer of warmth and coziness, making it an ideal choice for colder weather or for those seeking a hearty, indulgent treat.

gt:
Before baking ham, place pineapple slices on ham with toothpicks and place cherries in center of pineapple.
In a medium microwave safe bowl combine brown sugar and reserved pineapple juice.
Mix together and microwave for about 5 minutes, until mixture is thick.
Pour some of this glaze over the ham about every 15 minutes in the last hour of baking, until all is used.
pred:
1. First, remove the pineapple juice from the can and save it for later use.
2. In a small saucepan, combine the drained pineapple, maraschino cherries, and brown sugar.
3. Cook the mixture over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the sugar has dissolved and the mixture has thickened slightly.
4. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the mixture cool for a few minutes.
5. Once the mixture has cooled, pour it over the ham slices and let it marinate for at least 30 minutes.
6. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
7. Place the ham slices in a single layer on a baking sheet and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the ham is cooked through and the glaze is bubbly and caramelized.
8. Remove the ham from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

This Pineapple Glaze for Ham dish is a delicious and easy-to-prepare meal that combines the sweetness of the pineapple, the tanginess of the maraschino cherries, and the richness of the brown sugar. The glaze not only enhances the flavor of the ham but also adds a visually appealing touch to the dish.

gt:
Put the cream cheese and butter in a heatproof bowl and microwave (600 W) for 1 minute.
Using a whisk, mix until smooth.
Add the sugar and mix again.
Add the yogurt and mix.
Add the egg and lemon juice and mix.
Sift the cornstarch into the mixture and mix to combine.
Grease the bottom of the rice bowl with butter (not listed).
Pour in the Step 4 mixture and turn the rice cooker on.
Once cooked, switch the rice cooker off.
Take the bowl out of the rice maker.
Once it is cooled, take the cake out of the bowl.
pred:
1. Preheat your ricecooker to the highest setting.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cream cheese, butter, sugar, and yogurt. Mix until smooth.
3. Add the egg and lemon juice, and mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the cornstarch (or cake flour) with a small amount of water to form a smooth slurry.
5. Gradually add the cornstarch mixture to the cream cheese mixture, stirring constantly.
6. Pour the mixture into a greased ricecooker.
7. Cook the cheesecake on the highest setting for about 30-40 minutes, or until the center is set.
8. Remove the cheesecake from the ricecooker and let it cool completely before cutting and serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Directions:.
Preheat oven to 350o.
Season chicken with salt and pepper.
On a clean work surface, lay chicken breast flat, smooth sides down.
Fill and roll: Layer each breast with 12-15 arugula leaves, one bacon strip tore into pieces, and 1 tablespoon of Feta cheese.
Starting at the narrow end, roll up chicken tightly; seal with a toothpick.
Transfer chicken to a 2 quart baking dish (or a dish just large enough to hold the chicken) sprayed with non-stick cooking spray.
In a small pot, heat the Ragu and milk on low heat while gradually adding cream cheese.
Stir until cream cheese is melted and well incorporated with the Ragu Alfredo Sauce.
Slowly pour the sauce over the chicken.
Sprinkle chicken with the parmesan cheese and pine nuts.
Bake uncovered 35-40 minutes until chicken is opaque throughout.
Let chicken rest for 5 minutes.
Remove toothpicks prior to serving.
Enjoy!
pred:
To make a delicious Stuffed Chicken Breast Alfredo With a Creamy Cheese Twist#Ragu dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper, then arrange them in a single layer on a baking sheet.
3. Roast the chicken breasts in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until they are cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
4. While the chicken is cooking, prepare the arugula by removing the stems and discarding them. Rinse the leaves thoroughly under cold water, then pat them dry with a paper towel.
5. In a small bowl, mix the crumbled feta cheese and bacon.
6. Once the chicken breasts are cooked, let them rest for a few minutes before slicing them into thin pieces.
7. In a large skillet or saucepan, heat the cream cheese spread over medium heat until it is melted and smooth.
8. Add the milk to the cream cheese mixture and stir to combine.
9. Gradually add the jarragu alfredo sauce to the cream cheese mixture, stirring constantly to prevent lumps from forming.
10. Season the sauce with salt and pepper to taste.
11. To assemble the dish, place the cooked chicken breast slices on a serving platter or individual plates.
12. Spread the creamy cheese mixture over the chicken breasts, then sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese and bacon mixture on top.
13. Serve the Stuffed Chicken Breast Alfredo With a Creamy Cheese Twist#Ragu immediately, allowing the flavors to meld together.

Enjoy your delicious Stuffed Chicken Breast Alfredo With a Creamy Cheese Twist#Ragu dish!

gt:
Cut the green peppers in half lengthwise and remove the seeds.
Cut into long strips.
Wrap with plastic and heat in the microwave for 2-3 minutes.
When wilted and tender, let cool while still wrapped.
Once cooled, gently drain the liquid from the canned tuna, mix with the green peppers, and mix with 3-4 tablespoons of the ponzu.
Don't squeeze the green peppers.
This time, I added grated carrots to ponzu soy sauce and mixed it with the green peppers.
Other than the carrots, you can use grated daikon radish, turnips, apples, onions, etc.
Homemade Ponzu Soy Sauce.
pred:
[/SYS]

[INST]
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Cut the green bell pepper into bite-sized pieces.
3. In a small bowl, mix the Ponzu soy sauce, grated carrot, and a pinch of salt.
4. Heat a skillet over medium heat and add a drizzle of oil. Cook the green pepper pieces until they are tender and slightly browned.
5. In a separate skillet, heat a drizzle of oil and cook the canned tuna until it is cooked through.
6. Combine the cooked green pepper and tuna in a mixing bowl.
7. Pour the Ponzu sauce mixture over the tuna and green pepper mixture, stirring to combine.
8. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake for 10-15 minutes, or until the sauce is bubbly and slightly caramelized.
9. Serve the Green Pepper and Tuna with Grated Carrot Ponzu over rice or noodles.

[/SYS]

gt:
Put the lemongrass, garlic, ginger, green onions, cilantro, chili flakes and lime zest into a food processor or chopper along with the water and blitz them until they are finely chopped and combined.
Add the mixture to the turkey and also put in the egg white.
Mix the turkey and the other ingredients together by hand until they are well combined.
Put into the fridge to chill for about 30 minutes for them to firm up a bit.
Take out of the fridge and shape into four equal sized burger patties.
Then either fry them off in a pan as you would normally do or do as I do and brush them very lightly with a bit of extra virgin olive oil and cook them on a Foreman type grill.
It takes about 8 minutes or so for them to be fully cooked.
Serve.
pred:
1. In a large bowl, mix together the ground turkey, egg white, and chopped green onion. Season the mixture with the red chili pepper flakes, lime zest, and freshly grated ginger.

2. In a small bowl, mix together the chopped lemongrass, garlic, and water. Allow the mixture to sit for a few minutes to infuse the flavors.

3. Add the lemongrass mixture to the ground turkey mixture and stir to combine.

4. Form the mixture into 4 equal-sized patties.

5. Heat a large skillet or griddle over medium-high heat. Add a small amount of oil to the pan, and cook the turkey burgers for about 4-5 minutes per side, or until they are cooked through and slightly charred.

6. Serve the turkey burgers on a bun with your favorite condiments and garnishes, such as cilantro, green onion, and a squeeze of lime. Enjoy your delicious Thai Inspired Turkey Burgers!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350F Grease a 9x13in pan.
In a small bowl, combine flour, baking powder and salt.
In a large saucepan, melt butter and chocolate over low heat, stirring until smooth.
With a wooden spoon, beat in 1 1/2 cups of sugar.
Add 4 eggs and 2 teaspoons of vanilla, beat until well blended.
Stir in flour mixture just until blended.
In a small bowl, with mixer at medium speed, beat cream cheese until smooth, gradually beat in remaining sugar.
Beat in remaining egg, almond extract and vanilla until just blended.
Spread 1/2 of the chocolate batter in prepared pan.
Spoon creamcheese mixture in large dollops on top of chocolate.
Spread remaining chocolate batter over cream cheese mixture.
"Marble" with a butter knife by swirling the knife in broad strokes.
Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out almost clean, about 35-40 minutes.
Cool completely before cutting.
pred:
[INST]1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, alternating with the almond extract and cold cream cheese, mixing until just combined.
6. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9x13 inch baking dish.
7. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
8. Allow the cake to cool completely in the pan before cutting into squares and serving.

[/INST]

Ingredients:
- 14 cups flour
- 34 teaspoons baking powder
- 12 teaspoons salt
- 12 cup butter
- 8 ounces semisweet chocolate
- 2 cups sugar
- 5 eggs
- 2 12 teaspoons vanilla
- 12 ounces cold cream cheese
- 34 teaspoons almond extract

[/INST]

[/INST]

gt:
Saute the onion in oil and butter until translucent (about 4 minutes).
Add the sweet potato, and allow to saute for about 5 minutes.
Add cumin, salt and pepper and saute for an additional minute.
Add all other ingredients (expect for the lime juice and hummus).
Allow to simmer for about 25 minutes, or until the sweet potatoes are tender.
Once tender, add the lime juice, stirring to combine.
If you would like a creamy soup, blend all ingredients in a blender until smooth.
Twirl in thinned hummus with water, if desired.
You can also just eat the soup as is, if you like it chunky.
Enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large pot, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until it is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the sweet potatoes, cumin, sea salt, and pepper. Cook for about 10 minutes, or until the sweet potatoes are tender.
4. Add the diced tomatoes, chickpeas, and garlic. Cook for another 5 minutes.
5. Pour in the vegetable stock, balsamic vinegar, and lime juice. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 20 minutes.
6. Add the chopped chipotle peppers and stir to combine.
7. Remove the pot from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Using an immersion blender, blend the soup until smooth and creamy. Alternatively, you can transfer the soup to a blender and blend until smooth.
9. Return the soup to the pot and stir in the water.
10. Taste and adjust the seasoning as needed.
11. Serve the Spicy Chipotle Sweet Potato Soup hot, garnished with a dollop of hummus on top if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Spicy Chipotle Sweet Potato Soup!

gt:
pre-heat oven to 425
Line 9in pie plate with prepared pie dough and refrigerate.
Mix together rhubarb and strawberries and sprinkle cornstarch over...
add sugar and egg and toss til coated.
Pour mixture into pie dough and cover with other pie dough, crimp edges and piece top to vent, or cut strips and weave strips on top of pie.
Bake in pre-heated oven for 15 mins.
cover edges with foil to prevent burning, reduce heat to 325 F for 15 to 25 mins longer.
Cool completely.
Pie will be runny.
Serve with ice cream.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the sugar, cornstarch, and egg until well combined.
3. Add the peeled and cut rhubarb and sliced strawberries to the bowl, and mix until the fruit is evenly coated with the sugar mixture.
4. Roll out one of the pie doughs on a floured surface to a thickness of about 1/8 inch (3 mm).
5. Transfer the fruit mixture to the pie dough, spreading it evenly across the bottom and up the sides of the dough.
6. Roll out the remaining pie dough on a floured surface to a thickness of about 1/8 inch (3 mm).
7. Place the rolled-out dough on top of the fruit mixture, pressing it down gently to seal the edges and cover the fruit.
8. Bake the pie in the preheated oven for 45-50 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbly.
9. Allow the pie to cool for about 15-20 minutes before serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Either make or purchase a 1.5 lb loaf of French or Italian bread (torpedo or batard shape).
Slice along entire loaf without cutting all the way through the bottom crust.
Cut the proscuitto into enough pieces to allow a piece per slice of bread.
Mix the garlic into the cheese.
Into each slice, slip one piece of ham and 1 to 2 tablespoons of cheese and garlic mixture.
Line a baking sheet with a piece of foil 3 to 4 inches longer than the loaf.
Crumple another sheet of foil to fit in the middle of the first sheet of foil to raise the middle of the loaf.
Set the loaf on the crumpled foil so that the loaf is arched.
Wrap the first sheet of foil around the loaf allowing the top of the loaf to be exposed and twist the ends of the foil to form a tight package.
Sprinkle any remaining cheese mixture along the top of the loaf.
Place in the center of a 350F oven and bake for 20 minutes or until the cheese is partially browned.
Carefully remove the bottom sheet of foil and serve on a long platter or serve with the foil pulled away from the loaf for access.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Garlic Cheese Bread With Prosciutto, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).

2. Cut the Italian bread into 1-inch (2.5 cm) thick slices.

3. In a small bowl, mix the minced garlic with 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Spread the garlic-infused oil evenly over the sliced bread.

4. In a separate small bowl, combine the shredded mixed Italian cheeses.

5. Spread the cheese mixture evenly over the bread slices.

6. Cut the prosciutto into thin slices.

7. Place the bread slices on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.

8. Bake the bread in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.

9. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.

10. Carefully slice the prosciutto into thin strips and arrange them on top of the bread slices.

11. Serve the Garlic Cheese Bread With Prosciutto immediately, as it is best when warm and fresh from the oven.

Enjoy your delicious Garlic Cheese Bread With Prosciutto!

gt:
Toast bread and cut in half.
Place cheese, avocado and tomato on half slice of toast.
Top with remaining toast.
Tasty!
pred:
[/INST]

[INST]
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Place the bread slices on a baking sheet.
3. Spread a thin layer of butter on one side of each bread slice.
4. Place the cheese slices on the buttered side of the bread slices.
5. Place the avocado slices on top of the cheese.
6. Place the tomato slices on top of the avocado.
7. Bake the bread slices in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Carefully remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the sandwiches cool for a few minutes.
9. Slice the sandwiches in half and serve.

gt:
Crumble meat into skillet
Add water
Mix the water and meat well
Add seasonings
Allow cooking time stirring occasionally
Drain meat
Pour meat back into skillet and add salsa...stir
pred:

This recipe is simple and easy to follow, making it an excellent choice for those who want a quick and delicious taco meat option. The combination of ground beef, onions, water, salsa, and taco seasoning creates a flavorful and satisfying dish that can be customized with various toppings and ingredients to suit your preferences.

gt:
Combine tomatoes, mozzarella, avocado, basil, and corn in a bowl.
Add olive oil, truffle oil, balsamic vinegar, salt, and black pepper.
Toss gently to incorporate all ingredients.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the sliced plum tomatoes, mozzarella balls, and avocado.
3. Drizzle the olive oil over the ingredients, then add the white truffle oil and balsamic vinegar. Toss the ingredients to combine.
4. Season the salad with salt and cracked black pepper to taste.
5. Spread the salad on a baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the mozzarella is melted and bubbly, and the tomatoes are slightly charred.
6. Remove the salad from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Add the fresh basil strips to the salad and toss to combine.
8. Serve the Perfect Caprese Salad immediately.

gt:
Chop sausage and cook in a 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium-high heat about 4-6 minutes.
Transfer with slotted spoon to a bowl.
Add frozen potatoes to drippings in the skillet; cook 15-20 minutes, turning occasionally until brown.
Whisk eggs, water, salt and freshly ground pepper in a bowl.
Reduce heat to medium; sprinkle sausage over potatoes.
Pour eggs over sausage and cook for 5 minutes.
Heat broiler.
Cover skillet handle with foil.
Broil frittata 5 inches from heat source 3 minutes until just cooked through.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the sausage over medium heat until browned and cooked through. Remove from the skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, add the frozen potatoes and cook them until they are tender. Drain any excess water and set aside.
4. In a mixing bowl, whisk the eggs and water together. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
5. Add the cooked sausage and potatoes to the mixing bowl with the eggs. Stir to combine.
6. Pour the mixture into a greased 9-inch (23cm) round baking dish.
7. Bake the frittata in the preheated oven for about 30-35 minutes, or until the edges are set and the center is still slightly wobbly.
8. Remove the frittata from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before cutting it into wedges and serving.

Enjoy your delicious Sausage and Potato Frittata!

gt:
Add cauliflower to saucepan of boiling water; cook 4 to 5 min.
or until crisp-tender.
Drain well.
Meanwhile, heat dressing in large skillet on medium-high heat.
Add peppers, onions and garlic; cook and stir 3 to 4 min.
or until vegetables are crisp-tender.
Add cauliflower to vegetable mixture in skillet; cook and stir 2 min.
Stir in parsley; sprinkle with cheese.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Garlicky Cauliflower dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the cauliflower florets, red pepper, sliced red onion, minced garlic, and chopped parsley.
3. In a small bowl, mix the Italian Sun-Dried Tomato Dressing and 1/4 cup of water.
4. Pour the dressing mixture over the cauliflower mixture, and toss to coat evenly.
5. Transfer the cauliflower mixture to a baking dish, and spread it out evenly.
6. Sprinkle the coarsely chopped fresh parsley and 1/4 cup of grated Parmesan cheese over the top of the cauliflower mixture.
7. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the cauliflower is tender and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Remove the dish from the oven, and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

This Garlicky Cauliflower dish is a delicious and healthy side dish that can be enjoyed with a variety of meals. The combination of cauliflower, red pepper, red onion, garlic, and parsley creates a flavorful and satisfying dish that is both nutritious and satisfying.

gt:
Heat oil over medium-high until hot.
Stir in 5 spice powder, garlic powder, ginger, peppers, soy sauce and salt.
Add chicken, cook and stir for 5-8 minutes or until coated with spices and no longer pink.
Add chicken broth, curry, vinegar and coconut milk.
Stir.
Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add vegetables to skillet and bring to a boil.
Cook for 3-5 minutes or until vegetables are tender - crisp.
Serve over rice.
pred:
1. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
2. Add the chicken pieces and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
3. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
4. Add the onions, garlic, ginger, and pepper to the skillet and cook until the onions are translucent, about 3-4 minutes.
5. Add the chicken back to the skillet and cook until the chicken is fully cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.
6. Add the curry powder, soy sauce, rice wine vinegar (or regular vinegar), and coconut milk to the skillet. Stir to combine.
7. Add the mixed vegetables to the skillet and cook until they are tender but still crisp, about 5-7 minutes.
8. Serve the Thai Curry Chicken & Vegetables over a bed of cooked rice.

[/INST]

gt:
In a small bowl, mix confectioners' sugar with 2 to 3 tablespoons water until mixture is smooth but thick.
Place waxed paper under rack for a quick cleanup.
For easy pouring, transfer glaze to a liquid-measuring cup, and drizzle over loaves.
Let dry 15 minutes before serving.
Makes enough for 2 loaves.
Looking for more breakfast recipes?
Start the day with one of our French toast recipes, easy quiche recipes, or breakfast casserole recipes that feed the whole family.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the confectioners' sugar with 1/2 tsp. of water until the sugar is moistened.
3. Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
4. Bake the sugar mixture in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until it reaches a golden-brown color.
5. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the sugar mixture cool for a few minutes.
6. Carefully transfer the sugar mixture to a small bowl to cool completely.
7. In a small saucepan, heat 1/4 cup (60 ml) of water over medium heat.
8. Add the cooled sugar mixture to the saucepan, stirring constantly to combine.
9. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 5 minutes, or until the sugar mixture has thickened and cooled slightly.
10. Use the sugar glaze immediately or store it in an airtight container for later use.

[/INST]

The sugar glaze can be used to enhance the flavor of various dishes, such as cakes, cookies, or even as a topping for ice cream. It can also be used as a base for other sauces or glazes.

gt:
In a medium bowl add mayo, mustard, relishes and seasonings.
Stir till well combined
Add in tuna, eggs and apples into bowl with wet ingredient and mix well.
Serve on any type of bread or crackers you like.
Also good on a salad.If you do
If you do not like a very wet tuna salad, then only add in a 1/2 cup mayo instead of a full cup.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the tuna, eggs, apple, mustard, mayo, sweet relish, dill relish, pepper, garlic powder, and minced onion. Mix well.
3. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake for about 20-25 minutes or until the tuna is cooked through and the mixture is hot and bubbly.
4. Serve the My Mom's Tuna Salad immediately.

[/INST]

Please note that the cooking time may vary depending on the size of the tuna pack and the oven's temperature.

gt:
Place the garbanzo beans into a non-reactive pot with the olive oil & cook slowly over a low heat.
Once the beans come up to a simmer, cook for 15 minutes more.
Lightly oil the Sea Bass filets & season them with salt & pepper.
Cook on a hot grill until just cooked through.
Distribute the beans equally among 6 bowls & place the filets on top.
Spoon the Romesco on top of the fish.
Serve immediately.
Romesco Sauce:
Fry the peppers & chile flakes in 2 Tbls of olive oil until blistery.
Remove them then fry 4 cloves of garlic until light brown.
Add the bread & fry until crispy.
Remove and set aside.
Crush the remaining 4 cloves of garlic in a mortar, add the fried garlic, peppers, chile, bread, & nuts.
This can be done in a blender but the consistency is better in a mortar.
Peel and seed the tomato.
Chop it and mix it with the other crushed ingredients.
Slowly incorporate the remaining vinegar & oil.
Adjust the seasoning with salt.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
3. Add the Romesco Sauce to the skillet and stir to combine. Cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.
4. Season the sea bass with salt and pepper. Place the sea bass pieces on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
5. Drizzle the Romesco Sauce over the sea bass pieces, ensuring they are evenly coated.
6. Roast the sea bass in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
7. Remove the sea bass from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

[INST]<<SYS>>
To complete the recipe, you can now serve the cooked sea bass with garbanzo beans and Romesco Sauce. Enjoy your delicious meal!
<</SYS>>

gt:
Adjust oven rack to lowest position and heat oven at 350F
Grease a 9 inch pie plate with softened butter, then coat the plate evenly with grated Parmesan.
Combine Gruyere cheese, ham and scallions in a bowl, sprinkle cheese and ham mixture evenly in bottom of prepared pie dish.
Combine flour, baking powder, pepper and salt in the now - empty bowl, whisk in half and half, eggs, melted butter, mustard and nutmeg until smooth.
Slowly pour the batter over the cheese and ham mixture in the pie dish.
Bake until the pie is golden brown and the filling is set, 30 to 35 Minutes.
Let cool on a wire rack for @ 15 minutes, slice into wedges, serve warm.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Ham and Cheese Pie dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the softened unsalted butter, melted butter, and shredded gruyere cheese.
3. Add the diced deli ham, minced scallions, and mix well.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, baking powder, pepper, and salt.
5. Gradually add the half-and-half to the cheese mixture, stirring until the dough comes together.
6. Add the eggs, Dijon mustard, and nutmeg, and mix until the dough is smooth and well combined.
7. Turn the dough onto a lightly floured surface and roll it out to a thickness of about 1/2 inch (1.25 cm).
8. Transfer the dough to a 9-inch (23 cm) pie dish and press it evenly into the bottom and up the sides of the dish.
9. Bake the pie crust for 25-30 minutes, or until it is golden brown and set.
10. Remove the pie crust from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
11. Carefully pour the cheese and ham filling over the cooled pie crust.
12. Return the pie to the oven and bake for an additional 20-25 minutes, or until the filling is hot and bubbly, and the crust is golden brown.
13. Allow the pie to cool for a few minutes, then slice and serve.

Enjoy your delicious Ham and Cheese Pie!

gt:
Note: I have played around with different types of seafood, and my favorite combo is squid, scallops and shrimp.
Take chopped calamari fillets, shrimp and scallops, and put in a bowl.
Then add lemon or lime juice over the seafood until it is covered.
Give it a good stir and then set aside while you work on the seasonings.
The seasonings are simple: tomato, red onion, a handful of cilantro, serrano pepper, and garlic.
Chop everything and add to the bowl containing the marinating seafood.
Let it marinate overnight.
Serve over lettuce leaves and enjoy!
pred:
[INST]
1. Start by cleaning and rinsing the seafood, ensuring it is free of any debris or contaminants.
2. In a large bowl, combine the chopped calamari, shrimp, and scallops.
3. Squeeze the lime or lemon juice concentrate over the seafood, ensuring it is evenly distributed.
4. Add enough water to cover the seafood, and mix well.
5. Allow the mixture to marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes to 2 hours.
6. While the seafood is marinating, prepare the other ingredients.
7. Chop the tomato and red onion into small, even pieces.
8. Wash the cilantro and remove any leaves that are wilted or damaged.
9. Remove the seeds from the serrano pepper, and chop it finely.
10. Finely chop the garlic.
11. Once the seafood is marinated, drain it and discard the marinade.
12. In a large bowl, combine the seafood, tomato, red onion, cilantro, serrano pepper, and garlic.
13. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
14. Serve the Ceviche immediately or refrigerate it for a few hours before serving.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
Spray a 1-quart baking dish with cooking spray.
In a bowl, mix the egg, mayonnaise, and pepper.
Stir in the Cheddar cheese and onion, and transfer to the prepared dish.
Bake 25 minutes in the preheated oven, until golden brown.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Grease a 9x9 inch baking dish with cooking spray or butter.
3. In a large bowl, combine the egg, mayonnaise, ground black pepper, and shredded Cheddar cheese. Mix well.
4. Add the finely chopped onion to the mixture.
5. Pour the mixture into the prepared baking dish.
6. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the edges are slightly golden and the center is set.
7. Allow the dish to cool for a few minutes before cutting it into squares and serving.

This Appetizer Cheese Bake is a delicious and easy-to-prepare dish that combines the rich flavors of Cheddar cheese, onion, and mayonnaise. The lightly beaten egg adds moisture and a creamy texture to the dish, while the ground black pepper provides a subtle kick of flavor. The baked dish is perfect for serving as an appetizer or snack at gatherings or parties.

gt:
Peel the sweet potato, cut into thin, round slices, and soak in water for about 10 minutes.
Microwave for about 6 - 7 minutes.
Once soft, mash with a folk.
While the sweet potato is still hot, add in the butter and soft light brown sugar, and kneed it all together.
Once mixed, add the milk and mix more.
When cooled, mix in the egg yolk (set aside a small amount for glazing.)
Form the mixture into boat-like shapes, and place in aluminium cups.
Mix together the reserved egg yolk and a small amount of honey, and glaze the tops.
Bake in the toaster oven for about 15 minutes until browned.
Remove from the toaster oven, coat the tops once more with the remaining glaze, and bake for another 4-5 minutes.
This will give them a really nice finish and they will look delicious.
They puff up and look delicious.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. Wash and peel the sweet potato, then cut it into bite-sized pieces.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the sweet potato pieces, salted butter, milk, and soft light brown sugar. Mix well until the sweet potato pieces are evenly coated.
4. Add the egg yolk and mix until well combined.
5. If desired, add a pinch of salt and pepper for added flavor.
6. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
7. Transfer the sweet potato mixture to the prepared baking sheet.
8. Bake the sweet potato mixture in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the center is cooked through.
9. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
10. Using a spatula, carefully transfer the cooked sweet potato mixture to a large mixing bowl.
11. If desired, drizzle a small amount of honey over the sweet potato mixture for added sweetness and glazing.
12. Serve the One Bowl Sweet Potato Bites with Light Brown Sugar immediately, or let them cool completely before serving.

Enjoy your delicious One Bowl Sweet Potato Bites with Light Brown Sugar dish!

gt:
make a well in the bowl with your flour
pour in milk and oil , i use lemon juice cause it just helps the rise for me.
incorporate flour from inside going out may need a little more milk or flour
pinch off six balls of dough , she used canned milk , which i do to i use 1 cup of the canned milk for gravy and 1 cup for biscuits with the wash out canned water 1/4 cup of it
,i like big biscuits , or 12 depending on size you want , just make them the same size .
put on lightly greased cookie sheet
some people use cast iron skillet
bake in preheated 425 degree oven 15- 20 minutes until browned.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 450°F (232°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the self rising flour, milk, and lemon juice. Whisk the mixture until it reaches a smooth consistency.
3. Gradually add the oil to the mixture, stirring constantly to avoid lumps.
4. If the mixture is too thick, you can add a bit more milk to achieve the desired consistency.
5. Once the dough comes together, turn it out onto a floured surface and knead it gently until it becomes smooth and elastic.
6. Roll the dough out to a thickness of about 1/2 inch (1.25 cm).
7. Cut the dough into desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a sharp knife.
8. Place the biscuits on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Bake the biscuits in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown on the edges and cooked through.
10. Remove the biscuits from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Southern Oil Biscuits With Self Rising Flour!

gt: In a medium-sized bowl, blend all ingredients with a wooden spoon until completely incorporated.
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the softened butter, vanilla extract, and cinnamon.
2. Gradually add the confectioners' sugar or Splenda granular, mixing well to ensure the sugar is fully incorporated.
3. If the mixture is too dry, add a small amount of milk or water to achieve the desired consistency.
4. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
5. Once the mixture has chilled, scoop out a small amount and roll it between your hands to form a smooth ball.
6. Store the flavored butter in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks or freeze it for up to 3 months.

[/INST]

gt:
Place lentils in a small bowl.
Cover with cold water and soak 10 minutes.
Drain.
Cook lentils in boiling salted water until tender, but firm, about 30 minutes.
Drain lentils.
rinse under cold water, then drain gain.
Preheat oven to 375 egrees.
Place squash in large bowl; toss with 2 tablespoons oil, cumin, paprika and sea salt.
Arrange squash in a single layer n baking sheet; roast 20 minutes.
Turn squash over and roast 10 to 15 minutes longer.
Cool.
Combine lentils, pumpkin and oil from baking sheet with arugula, half the goat cheese, mint, vinegar and 1 tablespoon oil.
Season with salt and pepper.
Divide among plates; sprinkle remaining goat cheese over.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the lentils with 3 tablespoons of the olive oil. Season with cumin, smoked paprika, and salt. Spread the lentils out on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly crispy.
3. In a large pot, bring the butternut squash, peeled and cut into 1-inch pieces, to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the squash is tender.
4. In a large bowl, combine the cooked lentils, roasted squash, and crumbled goat cheese.
5. In a small bowl, whisk together the red wine vinegar, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
6. Add the sliced mint leaves to the salad and toss to combine.
7. Serve the Spiced Butternut Squash, Lentil and Goat Cheese Salad immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
In a large mixing bowl, combine flour, cocoa, espresso powder, baking soda and salt.
Mix and set aside.
In a stand mixer, cream together butter, shortening, sugar and brown sugar.
Add eggs one at a time and mix until combined.
Add flour/cocoa mixture by the 1/4-cupful until incorporated.
Scoop dough into 2 balls and roll in sanding sugar.
Bake in a 350 degrees F oven for 14 minutes.
Allow to cool on pan for several minutes.
Transfer to cooling racks and allow to cool completely before storing in an airtight container.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a baking sheet or line it with parchment paper.

2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and shortening until light and fluffy. Add the sugar and continue to mix until well combined.

3. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Stir in the vanilla extract.

4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, cocoa, baking soda, and salt. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until just combined.

5. Fold in the unsalted butter and white sanding sugar.

6. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto the prepared baking sheet, spacing them about 2 inches apart.

7. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are set but still slightly soft in the center. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

8. Enjoy your delicious Chocolate Espresso Snaps!

gt:
Combine the water and vinegar in a skillet or shallow pot.
Cook fish in water/vinegar mixture in a simmer until the liquid has evaporated or the fish is cooked through, whatever comes first.
Preheat oven to broil.
Once fish has cooked on the stovetop, place fish in a baking dish.
Pour melted butter over the fish.
Sprinkle with paprika.
Broil fish for 5 minutes.
This meal is delicious served with rice and broccoli, or noodles and asparagus.
pred:
1. In a large pot, combine 2 cups of water, 3 tablespoons of white wine vinegar, 2 teaspoons of salt, and 4 whole white fish fillets. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer.

2. While the water is heating, melt 1/2 stick of butter in a small saucepan. Once the butter is melted, add a pinch of paprika to enhance the flavor.

3. Once the water has reached a simmer, carefully add the melted butter and paprika mixture to the pot. Stir gently to combine.

4. Allow the dish to cook for approximately 10-15 minutes, or until the fish fillets are cooked through and the sauce has thickened slightly.

5. Serve the Poor Man's Lobster dish immediately, garnished with a sprinkle of paprika for added flavor.

This simple yet delicious dish can be enjoyed by anyone looking for a budget-friendly alternative to lobster. The combination of white wine vinegar, salt, and paprika adds a unique and savory flavor to the fish, creating a satisfying and satisfying meal.

gt:
Season chicken cubes with salt and black pepper.
Mix cornstarch and water in a bowl until smooth; whisk in lemon juice, rice vinegar, ketchup, soy sauce, brown sugar, and chile pepper sauce into cornstarch mixture, stirring until brown sugar has dissolved and cornstarch is free of lumps.
Place a heavy skillet over medium-high heat; pour in vegetable oil.
Add slices of red chili and ginger to the hot oil.
Cook, stirring often, until oil is flavored, about 2 minutes.
Stir in cashews and garlic; cook until cashews are lightly golden brown, about 2 minutes more.
Lightly toss seasoned chicken cubes with cashew mixture in skillet until combined, about 30 seconds.
Turn heat down to medium-low and pour cornstarch mixture into skillet.
Stir constantly until sauce has thickened, about 30 seconds.
If too thick, add a splash of water.
Simmer 2 more minutes to heat the chicken through.
Adjust levels of salt, black pepper, soy sauce, and chile pepper sauce to taste.
Stir in cilantro just until wilted, about 15 seconds.
pred:
1. In a small bowl, mix the cornstarch with cold water until smooth. Set aside.

2. In a large skillet or wok, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the chicken pieces and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.

3. Add the rice vinegar, ketchup, soy sauce, and brown sugar to the skillet. Cook until the sauce has thickened slightly, about 2-3 minutes.

4. Add the sliced hot red chile pepper, sliced ginger, and minced garlic to the skillet. Cook for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant.

5. Return the cooked chicken to the skillet. Pour the cornstarch mixture over the chicken and stir to coat evenly. Cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the chicken is fully cooked through and the sauce has thickened.

6. Add the cashews and cilantro to the skillet. Cook for 1-2 minutes, or until the cashews are slightly toasted and the cilantro is wilted.

7. Serve the Chef John's Cashew Chicken over rice or noodles, and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
FOR THE COFFEE CAKE: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F & grease a 9-inch round baking pan.
In a large bowl, combine sugar, walnuts, raisins, butter & lemon zest.
Separate biscuits & cut each into quarters, then toss the quartered biscuits with the sugar mixture, coating them thoroughly, before putting them in the prepared baking pan.
Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown, then remove from the oven & immediately invert the coffee cake onto a wire rack.
FOR THE GLAZE: In a small bowl, stir together the 2 glaze ingredients until smooth, then drizzle the glaze over the warm coffee cake.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the melted butter, granulated sugar, and lemon zest.
3. Add the chopped walnuts and mix well.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, lemon juice, and vanilla extract.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients (powdered sugar, flour, baking powder, and salt) to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
6. Fold in the refrigerated buttermilk biscuits, and mix until the dough comes together.
7. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9x13 inch baking dish.
8. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. Allow the cake to cool for a few minutes, then use a spatula to carefully lift the cake from the pan and transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
10. Once the cake is fully cooled, use a sharp knife to cut it into squares or triangles.

[/INST]

gt:
Mix flour and salt together in a bowl.
Slowly mix water, a few tablespoons at a time, into flour mixture until dough is smooth and easy to handle.
Knead dough for 10 minutes and let rest for 20 minutes.
Preheat oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C).
Form dough into desired shapes and arrange on a baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until dry and hard, about 2 hours.
Allow to cool completely.
pred:
1. Combine the all-purpose flour and salt in a large mixing bowl.
2. Gradually add the cold water, stirring until the dough comes together.
3. If the dough is too dry, you can add a bit more water. If it's too wet, you can add a bit more flour.
4. Knead the dough until it becomes smooth and elastic.
5. Cover the dough with a damp cloth and let it rest for about 30 minutes.
6. Preheat your oven to 275°F (130°C).
7. Roll out the dough on a floured surface to your desired thickness.
8. Cut out shapes or designs using cookie cutters or a knife.
9. Place the dough shapes on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
10. Bake the dough in the preheated oven for about 30-40 minutes, or until it is dry and hard.
11. Allow the dough to cool for a few minutes before removing it from the baking sheet.
12. Once it has cooled, you can paint or decorate the dough shapes with food coloring or other materials.

By following these key steps, you can create a perfect Salt Dough that you can use for various crafting or decorating projects.

gt:
1.
Preheat oven to 350 F.
2.
In a large bowl, cream butter and sugar.
Beat in applesauce and vanilla.
Set aside.
3.
In a medium-sized bowl sift together flour, cinnamon, baking soda and salt.
Add this into the sugar mixture.
Mix well.
4.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a greased cookie sheet.
5.
Bake for 6-8 minutes until golden-brown.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the softened butter and brown sugar until smooth.
3. Add the no-sugar-added applesauce, vanilla extract, and mix until well combined.
4. Gradually add the flour, cinnamon, baking soda, and salt, mixing until a dough forms.
5. Roll the dough out on a floured surface to a thickness of about 1/4 inch.
6. Cut the dough into desired shapes using cookie cutters or a knife.
7. Place the cookies on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown around the edges.
9. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Cinnamon Apple Cookies!

gt:
Preheat oven to 400 F. If using a pizza stone, place it inside the oven to preheat.
While the oven is preheating, heat half of the olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the lamb and cook until browned and completely done, breaking up the meat as it cooks.
Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate and set aside.
Lightly brush one side of each naan with olive oil.
Once the oven is preheated, place the breads on the pizza stone or on a baking sheet and bake for 5 minutes.
Remove from the oven.
Spread about 2 tablespoons of tomato puree over each pizza.
Divide the lamb, mozzarella, onion, olives, and sun-dried tomatoes evenly over each pizza.
Return to the oven and bake for 10 more minutes, until cheese is bubbly.
Remove pizzas from the oven and top with cucumbers and feta.
Enjoy!
pred:
[/INST]

[INST]To make the Greek Lamb Naan Pizzas, preheat your oven to 450°F (232°C). In a large bowl, combine the ground lamb, 1 tablespoon of the olive oil, and season with salt and pepper. Mix well and shape the mixture into 4 equal-sized patties.

Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the patties to the skillet and cook for about 4-5 minutes on each side, or until they are cooked through and slightly charred. Remove the patties from the skillet and let them rest for a few minutes.

While the patties are resting, prepare the toppings. Spread the tomato puree evenly over the top of each naan bread. Add the shredded mozzarella, red onion, Kalamata olives, sun-dried tomatoes, cucumber, and crumbled feta cheese.

Place the naan breads on a baking sheet and transfer them to the preheated oven. Bake for about 10-12 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.

Serve the Greek Lamb Naan Pizzas warm and enjoy your delicious homemade pizzas!

[/INST]

[/INST]

gt:
In a pan melt the butter and add all the ingredients.
Let them lightly brown.
Cool the mixture down.
With a teaspoon make small mounds.
Bake them at 180C for 20 or until they brown.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 175°C (350°F).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy.
3. Add the egg and vanilla extract, and continue to mix until well combined.
4. Gradually add the oatmeal, dried apricots, ground cinnamon, and salt. Mix until well combined.
5. Fold in the lemon zest.
6. Drop the mixture by spoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
7. Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
8. Remove from the oven and let the macaroons cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Oatmeal macaroons!

gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Mix butter or margarine, cottage cheese and flour together.
Roll the dough into a circle about 1/4 inch thick.
Cut the dough into triangular wedges.
Sprinkle raisins into the broad end of the wedge along with cinnamon and sugar.
Roll from the broad edge toward the pointed edge to form crescents.
Sprinkle the crescents with cinnamon and sugar.
Arrange the cookies on an ungreased baking sheet.
Bake for 12 minutes.
pred:
[INSTR]
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the butter, cottage cheese, flour, raisins, cinnamon, and sugar. Mix until well combined.
3. Roll the dough out on a floured surface to a thickness of about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm).
4. Cut the dough into desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a sharp knife.
5. Place the shaped dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. Bake the cookies for 12-15 minutes, or until they are golden brown around the edges.
7. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INSTR]

[/INST]

gt:
Combine cabbage, scallions, sesame oil and vinegar.
Toss well and chill until ready to serve.
Toss with sesame seeds before serving.
pred:
1. Wash the cabbage thoroughly and remove any leaves that are not edible.
2. Cut the cabbage into small, bite-sized pieces.
3. In a large bowl, combine the chopped cabbage, scallions, and toasted sesame seeds.
4. In a small bowl, whisk together the dark sesame oil, rice wine vinegar, and a pinch of salt.
5. Pour the dressing over the cabbage mixture and toss to coat evenly.
6. Serve the Oriental Cabbage Salad immediately or refrigerate for a few hours before serving.

This Oriental Cabbage Salad is a delicious and healthy side dish that can be enjoyed as part of a meal or served as a light snack. The combination of the crunchy cabbage, the mild flavor of the scallions, and the nutty taste of the toasted sesame seeds creates a satisfying and balanced dish.

gt:
Toss pork strips in the taco seasoning to coat evenly.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat; add pork strips, onion, bell pepper, and 3 cloves minced fresh garlic; stir-fry 3-5 minutes.
Divide the pork mixture and mango chunks into four equal parts.
Roll up in warmed tortillas.
Serve with chipotle sour cream.
For the chipotle sour cream mixture; in a medium bowl combine sour cream, chilpotle chiles, cilantro and 1 minced garlic clove; mix until well blended.
Cover and refrigerate several hours to blend flavors.
To warm the tortillas; wrap loosely in a kitchen towel, microwave on HIGH for 30-40 seconds.
pred:
1. Heat the oil in a large skillet or frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the pork strips and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the pork from the pan and set aside.

2. In the same skillet, add the sliced onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes. Add the taco seasoning mix and cook for another 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly.

3. Add the mango chunks to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes, until the mango is slightly softened.

4. Add the sour cream to the skillet, stirring to combine. Cook for another 2-3 minutes, until the sour cream has melted and the mixture is heated through.

5. Add the minced garlic cloves, divided, and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly.

6. Add the cooked pork strips back to the skillet and stir to combine. Cook for another 2-3 minutes, until the pork is heated through.

7. Warm the flour tortillas by placing them in a warm water bath or by placing them in a dry skillet over low heat.

8. To serve, place a portion of cooked pork and mango mixture on each tortilla, and top with a dollop of minced canned chipotle chiles in adobo. Garnish with a sprinkle of fresh cilantro.

Enjoy your delicious Mango Pork Fajitas With Chipotle Sour Cream!

gt:
Put the zest, butter, sugar and juice in a heatproof metal bowl.
Stand the bowl over a pan of boiling water and heat until the sugar and butter have melted.
Lower the heat, you dont want the water to boil now - more like a simmer.
Whisk in the beaten eggs (and yolks if using), just in a small stream, really slowly.
Stir with a wooden spoon until thickened, about 25-30 minutes.
Store in the fridge.
Enjoy!
pred:
1. In a large bowl, whisk together the 58 cup lemon juice, 2 large oranges, and the zest of the oranges.
2. In a separate bowl, mix the diced butter and sugar.
3. Add the butter and sugar mixture to the lemon juice mixture, and whisk until smooth.
4. Add the eggs, one at a time, whisking after each addition.
5. If you want the curd to be thicker, like jam or butter, add the egg yolks one at a time, whisking after each addition.
6. Allow the mixture to sit in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
7. After the mixture has chilled, pour it through a fine-mesh sieve into a clean bowl, pressing on the solids to extract as much liquid as possible.
8. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
9. After the curd has chilled and thickened, it is ready to use.

This recipe will yield a delicious, tangy, and creamy The Best Ever Citrus Curd that can be used as a topping for desserts, as a filling for pastries, or as a spread on toast. The combination of the fresh citrus flavors from the oranges and the rich, buttery taste of the curd make it a perfect addition to any dish.

gt:
cut avacodo In half remove the seed (I've heard if you lay the seed on top of the guacamole when you go to refrigerate it or while it sits out it helps keep the guacamole from turning brown.)
make slice marks up and down the avacado and across to make little square(makes it easier to mash) dig it out with a spoon and place it into a mixing bowl
add lemon juice and mash
add in the rest of youre ingredients and stir well
dig in
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mash the avocado using a fork or a potato masher until it reaches a smooth consistency.
3. Add the minced garlic and onion powder to the avocado mixture, stirring to combine.
4. Add the diced tomato, lemon juice, and salt and pepper to taste. Stir to combine.
5. Add the fresh cilantro, chopped jalapeno pepper, and a pinch of cumin to the mixture. Stir to combine.
6. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the avocado is fully melted and the mixture is slightly browned.
7. Remove the baking dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Serve the guacamole immediately, or let it cool completely before serving.

This cooking procedure involves several steps, starting with preheating the oven, followed by mashing the avocado, adding the other ingredients, and baking the mixture until it reaches the desired consistency and texture. The final product is a delicious, creamy, and flavorful guacamole that can be enjoyed as a dip, topping, or side dish.

gt:
Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add eggs and vanilla and beat well.
Sift together remaining ingredients; stir into creamed mixture and mix well.
Chill dough, roll and cut with cookie cutters.
Bake in a 350F oven 10 to 12 minutes, depending on thickness of cookies.
pred:
To create a delightful Cardamom Butter Cookie dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter until it is light and fluffy.
3. Add the sugar and continue to cream until the mixture is smooth and fluffy.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and vanilla extract until well combined.
5. Gradually add the egg mixture to the butter mixture, alternating with the dry ingredients (flour, baking powder, salt, and spices). Mix until the dough comes together.
6. Cover the dough and refrigerate it for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
7. On a floured surface, roll out the dough to your desired thickness. Cut out your desired cookie shapes using a cookie cutter or a sharp knife.
8. Place the cookies on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown around the edges.
10. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Cardamom Butter Cookies!

gt:
Heat the butter in a large Dutch oven over medium high heat.
Season the steak slices with a big pinch of salt and crushed red pepper, then get them in the hot pot to brown.
Allow the beef to brown on both sides, then remove it to plate.
Drain all of the grease, then put the pot back on the heat.
Add the minced garlic, sage and rosemary to the pan and let them get fragrant for just 30 seconds.
Deglaze the pan with the wine and scrape up any brown bits.
Then pour in the marinara sauce and Worcestershire sauce.
Stir the mixture well and bring it to a gentle boil.
Reduce it to a simmer and return the beef to the pot.
Let the beef simmer in the sauce and get super tender for an hour, stirring occasionally.
Then take the pot off of the heat.
The sauce will be mostly reduced away and thickly coating the beef.
Taste for salt and add a pinch more if needed.
Serve immediately over buttered noodles or rice with a sprinkle of chopped fresh rosemary on top and some greens on the side!
Enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the 2 tablespoons of butter over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
3. Add the beef chunks to the skillet and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes. Season the beef with the salt and pepper, as needed.
4. Remove the beef from the skillet and set aside.
5. In the same skillet, add the sage and rosemary leaves. Cook for a few seconds, until fragrant.
6. Add the red wine to the skillet and cook until it has reduced by half, about 3-5 minutes.
7. Add the marinara sauce to the skillet and stir to combine.
8. Return the beef to the skillet and cook until the sauce has coated the beef and the internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C), about 5-7 minutes.
9. Remove the beef from the skillet and let it rest for a few minutes.
10. Strain the sauce and discard the solids.
11. Serve the beef in wine sauce over a bed of mashed potatoes or noodles.

[/INST]

gt:
Heat oven to 450 degrees F. Heat a stovetop grill pan over medium heat.
Roasted tomatoes: Place tomatoes on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or foil; lightly coat with olive oil cooking spray and season with salt and pepper.
Roast tomatoes 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly charred and softened.
Chicken: Meanwhile, lightly coat chicken breasts with cooking spray and season with salt and pepper.
Grill 4 minutes per side or until just cooked through.
Remove to a plate; loosely cover with foil and let rest.
Arugula pesto: Put pesto ingredients in a food processor and pulse until smooth (makes 1 1/4 cups).
Place chicken on plates and drizzle each with 2 tablespoons pesto.
Serve with roasted tomatoes.
Store remaining pesto in the refrigerator for up to one week.
pred:
1. Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
2. Rinse the cherry tomatoes and pat them dry with a paper towel.
3. In a large bowl, combine the cherry tomatoes, kosher salt, and black pepper.
4. Grill the chicken breasts for 4-5 minutes per side or until cooked through.
5. Allow the chicken to rest for a few minutes before slicing it into thin pieces.
6. In a large bowl, combine the sliced chicken, baby arugula, fresh basil leaves, and grated Parmesan cheese.
7. In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, water, kosher salt, and black pepper.
8. Pour the dressing over the chicken mixture and toss to coat evenly.
9. Add the pine nuts to the salad and toss again.
10. Serve the Grilled Chicken with Arugula Pesto salad immediately.

[/SYS]

gt:
In a large bowl, combine all of the marinade ingredients together.
Add the sliced meat, then transfer into a resealable plastic bag, place on the bottom shelf of the refrigerator, and marinate for at least an hour, or up to 4 hours.
Over medium high heat, using a wok, grill, or large saute pan, cook the meat until medium rare.
While the meat is cooking, combine all of the Sweet Chili Sauce ingredients and pour into a side bowl until service.
Once the meat is properly cooked, transfer to a warm plate and serve with the vegetables and Sweet Chili Sauce.
Or add to the middle of a lettuce leaf, the meat, a drizzle of sauce and any or all of the sides.
pred:

- Cut the flank steaks or sirloin into thin strips against the grain.
- Slice the green onion (scallions) on an angle.
- Mince the garlic.
- Grate the carrots.
- Chop the cilantro and mixed mushrooms.
- Grate the serrano chili (optional).
- Grate the carrots.
- Chop the cilantro.
- Chop the mixed mushrooms.
- Grate the carrots.
- Chop the cilantro.

7. Cook the vegetables:

- Cook the vegetables until they are tender and slightly browned.

8. Combine the cooked meat and vegetables:
