gt:
Season beef with salt and black pepper.
In a large nonstick deep skillet, heat olive oil over medium high heat.
Add beef and brown on all sides, about 10 minutes.
Remove from heat.
Transfer beef roast to the slow cooker.
Also to the slow cooker, add onion, garlic, tomatoes (add the liquid from one can only), tomato paste, red wine, oregano, basil, thyme, parsley, crushed red pepper and a generous amount of salt and black pepper.
Slow cook on low for 68 hours or until the beef is falling apart.
Shred the beef with two forks and mix well.
Serve the beef ragu over pasta, garnished with fresh parsley and grated Parmesan cheese.
Enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. Season the beef roast with salt and black pepper.
3. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the diced onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the minced garlic and cook for another minute, until fragrant.
5. Add the canned whole San Marzano tomatoes and their juices, and bring to a simmer.
6. Reduce the heat to low and let the sauce simmer for about 1 hour, stirring occasionally.
7. Add the tomato paste, red wine, oregano, basil, thyme, parsley, crushed red pepper, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Stir to combine.
8. Add the cooked pasta to the sauce and stir to combine.
9. Transfer the mixture to a slow cooker and cook on low for 6-8 hours, or on high for 3-4 hours, or until the beef is tender and the sauce has thickened.
10. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
11. Serve the slow cooker beef ragu over cooked pasta, garnished with fresh parsley and grated Parmesan cheese.

[/INST]

gt:
Mix all ingredients.
Store in airtight container.
For 1 Serving Place 2 Tbsp.
Hot Spiced Tea Mix in large cup or mug.
Add 3/4 cup boiling water.
Stir until mix is dissolved.
For 4 Servings Place 1/2 cup Hot Spiced Tea Mix into heatproof pitcher or bowl.
Add 3 cups boiling water.
Stir until mix is dissolved.
For 16 Servings Place 2 cups Hot Spiced Tea Mix in heatproof container.
Add 3 quarts (12 cups ) boiling water.
Stir until mix is dissolved.
pred:
1. Begin by pouring 1-1/2 cups of COUNTRY TIME Classic Lemonade Iced Tea Mix into a large mixing bowl.
2. Add 1/2 cup of sugar to the bowl, and stir until the sugar is fully incorporated.
3. Next, add 1/2 tsp. of ground cinnamon and 1/2 tsp. of ground cloves to the bowl. Stir until the spices are evenly distributed.
4. If desired, you can add a splash of lemon juice to the tea mix for a refreshing twist.
5. Once the spices are well-incorporated, the Hot Spiced Tea Mix is ready to be enjoyed.

Alternatively, you can also use the Hot Spiced Tea Mix as a base for other tea-based beverages, such as hot chocolate or a warm spiced tea, by adding milk, cream, or a non-dairy alternative.

Enjoy your delicious Hot Spiced Tea Mix!

gt:
Cut the shiso leaves lengthwise.
Remove the tomato stems, wash, and coat with katakuriko.
Spread the pork slices and wrap each tomato first with pork, shiso leaf, and siumai skin.
Cut the shiso leaves lengthwise.
Remove the tomato stems, wash, and coat with katakuriko.
Spread the pork slices and wrap each tomato first with pork, shiso leaf, and siumai skin.
If you wrap the tomatoes so the tops are peeking out, the dumplings will look pretty.
Squeeze the siumai skin around the tomato once it's wrapped around it avoid unraveling.
Heat a pan over medium heat with vegetable oil and cook 10 siumai dumplings.
When the bottoms turn golden brown, add about 2 tablespoons of water, cover with a lid and steam cook.
Repeat with the remainders.
With these siumai dumplings and beer, you're all set!
I recommend dipping in mustard soy sauce, yuzu pepper paste or ponzu sauce.
They are great in packed lunches too!
pred:
To cook a delicious Easy Pan-fried Tomato Shumai Dumplings dish, follow these steps:

1. Prepare the ingredients:
- 280 grams thinly sliced pork
- Salt and pepper
- Garlic powder (or raw grated garlic)
- Sake
- Katakuriko
- 20 cherry tomatoes
- 10 shiso leaves
- 20 siumai skins
- Vegetable oil
- Lettuce, radish sprouts, etc.
- Japanese mustard + soy sauce
- Yuzu pepper paste + soy sauce
- Ponzu + Japanese mustard

2. Prepare the dumplings:
- Mix the pork, garlic powder, salt, and pepper together in a large bowl.
- Add the sake and mix well.
- Shape the mixture into small balls, then flatten them slightly.
- Place the dumplings on a plate, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.

3. Prepare the sauce:
- In a small bowl, mix the Japanese mustard, soy sauce, and yuzu pepper paste.

4. Prepare the pan-frying:
- Heat a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
- Add a small amount of oil to the pan, swirling it around to coat the pan evenly.
- Carefully place the dumplings in the pan, being careful not to overcrowd the pan.
- Cook the dumplings for about 2-3 minutes on each side, or until they are golden brown and cooked through.

5. Serve:
- Remove the dumplings from the pan and place them on a serving plate.
- Drizzle the pan-fried dumplings with the sauce, and garnish with the shiso leaves and sliced cherry tomatoes.

Enjoy your delicious Easy Pan-fried Tomato Shumai Dumplings dish!

gt:
Combine water and broth; set aside.
Melt buter in a large nonstick saucepan Over medium heat.
Add 1/3 cup shallots, cover and cook for 2 minutes.
Add rice.
Cook 2 minutes uncovered, stirring constantly.
stir in 1/2 cup wine; cook 30 seconds or until the liquid is absorbed, stirring constantly.
Adding salt and 1/2 cup broth mixture, stir until absorbed.
Continue adding broth 1/2 cup at a time, stirring constantly.
Besure broth is absorbed before adding the next (about 20 minutes total).
Stir in Gouda, cook just until melted.
Stir in arugula or spinach.
Cook just until spinach is wilted.
pred:
1. In a large saucepan, combine the water, chicken broth, and butter. Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and let simmer for 10 minutes.
2. Meanwhile, in a separate saucepan, heat the rice according to the package instructions.
3. Add the wine to the saucepan with the water mixture, and stir to combine.
4. Slowly pour the hot rice mixture into the saucepan with the wine mixture, stirring constantly to prevent the rice from sticking to the bottom.
5. Cook the risotto over low heat, stirring constantly, until the rice is cooked through and the liquid has been absorbed, about 20-25 minutes.
6. Remove the saucepan from the heat, and stir in the shredded smoked gouda cheese.
7. Season the risotto with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Serve the Smoked Gouda Risotto immediately, garnished with chopped arugula or spinach.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 400.
Add first 5 wet ingredients to the mixer.
Mix on low continuously.
Combine the remaining dry ingredients in a separate bowl.
Slowly add dry ingredients to the wet ingredients.
Mix until just blended and let sit for 5 minutes.
Drop tablespoon sized blobs onto your cookie sheet, spacing them 1-2 inches apart.
(About a dozen per sheet.)
Bake for 8 minutes or until golden brown at 400.
Immediately move to a cooling rack.
Enjoy!
Recipe makes about 4 dozen.
pred:
To make a delicious Eggnog Softies dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the softened butter, granulated sugar, eggs, and vanilla extract. Mix until well combined.
3. Add the eggnog, all-purpose flour, oat flour, whole wheat flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Mix until the ingredients are well combined.
4. Add the chia seeds and ground nutmeg to the mixture. Mix until the chia seeds are evenly distributed.
5. If the dough is too dry, add a bit more eggnog to achieve the desired consistency.
6. On a floured surface, roll out the dough to your desired thickness.
7. Cut out the dough into desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a sharp knife.
8. Place the dough shapes on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Bake the cookies for 12-15 minutes or until they are golden brown.
10. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Eggnog Softies dish!

gt:
peel potatoes and chop into small cubes.
boil for 15 minutes.
drain and let it cool for about 10 minutes.
add wahoo fillet, olives , capers , green chili
mix dressing and add to the salad
serve cold.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Scrub the potatoes clean and cut them into bite-sized pieces.
3. In a large bowl, combine the potatoes, smoked wahoo, black olives, green chilies, pickled capers, garlic clove, salt, and pepper.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the olive oil, lemon juice, and sumac.
5. Pour the dressing over the potato mixture and toss to coat evenly.
6. Transfer the potato salad to a baking dish and bake for about 30-40 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and the salad is heated through.
7. Serve the Smoked Wahoo Potato Salad hot or at room temperature.

[/INST]

gt:
In the container of a food processor or blender, combine the garlic, onion, cucumber, bell pepper, tomatoes, olive oil, vinegar, parsley, salt and pepper.
Cover and blend to your desired texture.
Stir in the tomato sauce and paprika and transfer to a bowl or container.
Refrigerate for at least 1 hour to blend the flavors.
pred:
To prepare a perfect Gazpacho a la Mrs. Landesman, follow these key steps:

1. In a large bowl, combine the crushed garlic, coarsely chopped onion, and sliced green bell pepper.
2. In a separate bowl, mix the chopped cucumber, tomatoes, and olive oil.
3. Add the chopped cucumber mixture to the bowl with the garlic, onion, and green bell pepper.
4. Add the distilled white vinegar, fresh parsley, salt, and pepper to taste.
5. Mix well and refrigerate the mixture for at least 1 hour or overnight.
6. After chilling, blend the mixture in a blender until smooth and creamy.
7. Taste and adjust the seasoning if necessary.
8. Pour the Gazpacho into a large bowl or serving dish.
9. Serve immediately or refrigerate for a few hours before serving.

By following these steps, you will have a delicious and refreshing Gazpacho a la Mrs. Landesman.

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Grease two 8-inch cake pans with shortening and dust with about 1 teaspoon flour, shaking to remove excess flour.
Beat 1/2 cup butter in a bowl using an electric mixer until light and fluffy.
Add white sugar and beat until incorporated into the creamed butter.
Add eggs, 1 at a time, to creamed butter mixture, beating until thoroughly combined before adding the next egg.
Stir 1 teaspoon vanilla extract into creamed butter mixture.
Whisk flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon together in a bowl.
Gradually beat 1/3 the flour mixture into butter mixture, alternating with the 3/4 cup milk and ending with flour mixture until batter is smooth.
Pour batter into the prepared cake pans.
Bake in the preheated oven until cake is golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean, 25 to 30 minutes.
Turn cakes onto a wire rack to cool completely, at least 30 minutes.
Beat 1/2 cup butter in a bowl using an electric mixer until smooth and creamy; beat in 1 teaspoon vanilla extract and honey.
Gradually beat enough confectioners' sugar into creamed butter mixture to reach desired consistency, adding 1 tablespoon milk if needed to thin the icing.
Spread 1/3 the icing over the top of 1 cake using a spatula.
Place the second cake over the icing layer and spread remaining icing over entire cake.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 9-inch (23cm) round cake pan.
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the softened butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon.
4. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture, alternating with the milk, beginning and ending with the dry ingredients. Mix until just combined.
5. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
6. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
7. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
8. To make the icing, beat the butter at room temperature until smooth and creamy. Add the vanilla extract and honey (if using), then gradually add the confectioners' sugar, beating until the desired consistency is reached.
9. Once the cake is completely cooled, spread the icing over the top and sides of the cake.
10. Serve the Snickerdoodle Cake immediately, or store it in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Mix together oil, capers, garlic, pepper flakes, and chipotle.
Toss with mushrooms to coat.
Pour into a pan to contain the deliciousness (9x9 works perfectly).
Put pats of butter on top of the mushrooms.
Put in the oven for 15-20 minutes.
You will smell when its done.
Nom nom nom.
When its out of the oven, finish with lemon (its refreshing!)
and let it cool just long enough that your mouth wont be burned for a week.
Serve with bread.
Try to breathe between bites.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and red pepper flakes, and cook for about 1 minute, until fragrant.
3. Add the chopped chipotle peppers and cook for another minute, until they are slightly softened.
4. Add the sliced mushrooms to the skillet and cook until they are tender and slightly browned, about 5-7 minutes.
5. Add the minced capers and butter to the skillet, stirring to combine. Cook for another 2-3 minutes, until the butter has melted and the sauce has thickened slightly.
6. In a small bowl, mix the lemon juice with a pinch of salt and pepper. Pour the lemon mixture over the mushrooms and stir to combine.
7. If using a loaf of crusty bread, cut it into 1-inch pieces and place them on a baking sheet. Drizzle the bread with a little olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Roast the bread in the preheated oven for about 10-12 minutes, until it's golden brown and crispy.
8. Serve the mushrooms over the crispy bread, and enjoy your delicious Matador Mushrooms dish!

gt:
Take the 2 chicken breasts in a skillet with very little (half a cup) of water, let it boil @ 350F for about 15 minutes.
Add diced onions as it boils
Remove and dice chicken after it is cooked.
In the skillet, combine the chicken, strips of bell pepper, let it simmer a few minutes then add the corn.
(Also if you haven't added already to your preference go ahead and add: the salt, the pepper and the garlic)
Now you can add in the tomatoes and the chili powder.
After its had a while to simmer and soak up the tomatoes, you can now add the corn tortilla strips.
After letting sit for a few minutes tortilla will begin to tear apart.
turn off heat, add cheese of your choice, i.e.
cheddar, monterrey jack or cream cheese as a topping.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the garlic and cook for another minute.
4. Add the chili powder, salt, and pepper. Stir to combine.
5. Add the corn, tomatoes, and water. Bring to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let the mixture cook for about 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. While the sauce cooks, prepare the tortillas by cutting them into bite-sized pieces.
7. Once the sauce has cooked for the desired amount of time, add the cooked chicken breasts to the skillet. Cook for a few minutes until the chicken is cooked through.
8. To assemble the Chilaquiles, place a tortilla piece on a plate. Top with a spoonful of the chicken and sauce mixture. Repeat with the remaining tortilla pieces and sauce.
9. Add the cheese of your preference on top of the Chilaquiles.
10. Serve the Chilaquiles immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
In a skillet, saute the broccoli, mushrooms,and onion in butter until tender.
Remove from the heat and keep warm.
In a mixing bowl, beat eggs, water, mustard, Italian seasoning and garlic salt until foamy.
Stir in cheese, tomatoes and broccoli mixture.
Pour into a greased shallow 1 1/2 qt.
baking dish.
Bake at 375 degrees for 22-27 minutes.
or until knife in center comes out clean.
4-6 servings.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until they are soft and translucent.
3. Add the mushrooms and cook until they are tender, about 5-7 minutes.
4. Add the broccoli florets and cook until they are tender, about 5-7 minutes.
5. In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, water, Dijon mustard, Italian seasoning, and garlic salt.
6. Add the cooked ham to the skillet with the mushrooms and broccoli. Cook for a minute or two to heat the ham through.
7. Pour the egg mixture over the vegetables and ham in the skillet. Cook until the eggs are set, about 10-12 minutes.
8. Sprinkle the shredded cheddar cheese over the top of the frittata.
9. Place the skillet in the preheated oven and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Remove from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before cutting into wedges and serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
Place potato chunks into a 9x13-inch baking dish, drizzle with olive oil, and toss potatoes to coat.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes.
Remove from oven, and stir cremini mushrooms, onion, honey, rosemary, thyme, sage, mustard powder, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper into the potatoes.
Return baking dish to oven and bake until mushrooms and potatoes are tender, about 15 more minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the potatoes, mushrooms, onion, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the honey, olive oil, rosemary, thyme, sage, dry mustard powder, garlic powder, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
4. Pour the honey mixture over the vegetables, tossing to coat evenly.
5. Transfer the vegetables to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. Roast the vegetables in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the potatoes are tender and golden brown, and the mushrooms are cooked through.
7. Season with additional salt and pepper, if needed.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Drop the K-Cup pack into any K-Cup brewer.
Press brew.
pred:
[INST]
To make a delicious Starbucks French Roast K-Cup, follow these steps:
1. Begin by placing the Starbucks French Roast K-Cup pack in a mug.
2. Add 6 fluid ounces of water to the mug.
3. Place the mug in a microwave-safe container or on a microwave-safe plate.
4. Heat the mug in the microwave for approximately 1 minute and 30 seconds, or until the water reaches a boil.
5. Carefully remove the mug from the microwave and let it sit for a few seconds to allow the coffee to cool slightly.
6. Carefully remove the K-Cup pack from the mug and discard the paper filter.
7. Pour the hot coffee into a cup or mug.
8. Enjoy your delicious Starbucks French Roast K-Cup!

[/INST]

gt:
Cut chicken in strips.
In large skillet bring chicken and stock to simmer over medium high heat.
Add celery, onion and sweet peppers.
Cook, stirring often, for about 5 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink and vegetables are tender crisp.
Mix together juice, vinegar, brown sugar, corn starch and soya sauce until blended Stir into skillet and bring to a boil.
Cook, stirring, for about 2 minutes until glossy and thickened.
Add pineapple.
Simmer for about 2 minutes or until heated through.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (175 degrees Celsius).
2. In a large skillet or oven-safe pan, heat some oil over medium-high heat.
3. Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper, then add them to the skillet and cook until they are browned on both sides and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes per side.
4. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
5. In the same skillet, add the chicken stock, celery, onion, and red and green peppers. Cook until the vegetables are tender, about 5-7 minutes.
6. Add the pineapple juice or orange juice, brown sugar, vinegar, cornstarch, soya sauce, and pineapple chunks to the skillet. Stir to combine.
7. Return the chicken breasts to the skillet and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and coated the chicken.
8. Remove the chicken from the skillet and serve it over rice or noodles.

Enjoy your delicious Sweet and Sour Skillet Chicken!

gt:
Process cookies in food processor until fine crumbs form; mix with butter.
Press onto bottom of 13x9-inch dish.
Refrigerate 10 min.
Meanwhile, beat cream cheese, sugar and 2 Tbsp.
milk in medium bowl with whisk until well blended.
Stir in 1-1/4 cups Cool Whip; spread over crust.
Beat pudding mixes and remaining milk in medium bowl with whisk 2 min.
Stir in peanut butter; spread over cream cheese layer.
Let stand 5 min.
or until thickened.
Cover with remaining Cool Whip.
Refrigerate 4 hours or until firm before cutting into 24 pieces to serve.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Crush the Oreo cookies in a food processor or blender until they reach a fine crumb.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the crushed cookies, melted butter, and softened Philadelphia Brick Cream Cheese. Mix until well combined.
4. Gradually add the sugar to the mixture, mixing until smooth.
5. Add the cold milk, mixing until well combined.
6. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x9 inch baking dish.
7. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the edges are set and the center is slightly jiggly.
8. Allow the baked mixture to cool for a few minutes before cutting it into 12 equal squares.
9. In a separate bowl, combine the thawed Cool Whip Whipped Topping and 1/2 cup of the cold milk. Mix until well combined.
10. Spread the Cool Whip mixture over the cooled baked mixture.
11. Cut the Jell-O Vanilla Instant Pudding into small pieces and mix it with the remaining 1/3 cup of cold milk.
12. Carefully pour the pudding mixture over the Cool Whip mixture.
13. Refrigerate the Peanut Butter-Striped Delight for at least 2 hours or until the pudding is set.

[/INST]

gt:
Wash and chop up all the salad ingredients.
Make sure theyre dry and put them in a large salad bowl.
Toast the pine nuts and add them to the salad.
Whisk the dressing up in a separate bowl, then pour it over the salad and toss it all together.
*TIP: If your honey is thick, heat it up for just a few seconds in the microwave to make it easier to stir.
pred:
To make a delicious Fiesta Salad With Honey Mustard Vinaigrette, follow these steps:

1. Gather the necessary ingredients: 1 head Butterhead Or Romaine Lettuce, Washed, Dried, and roughly chopped; 1 whole Red Bell Pepper, Deseeded and Chopped; 1 can Sweet Whole Kernel Corn, Drained; 1/2 pounds Cherry Tomatoes, Halved; 4 Tablespoons Pine Nuts, Toasted; 1/4 cups Mayonnaise; 1 Tablespoon Chopped Fresh Parsley; 1 Tablespoon Honey; 1 teaspoon Dijon Mustard; 1 Tablespoon White Wine Vinegar; 3 teaspoons Sunflower Oil; 1-1/2 teaspoons Lemon Juice; 2 dashes Garlic Salt; 5 dashes Curry Powder; 2 dashes Cayenne Pepper; 2 dashes Paprika; 3 dashes Cracked Black Pepper.

2. Prepare the vinaigrette: In a small bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, honey, Dijon mustard, white wine vinegar, sunflower oil, lemon juice, garlic salt, curry powder, cayenne pepper, and paprika. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

3. Prepare the salad: In a large bowl, combine the lettuce, bell pepper, cherry tomatoes, and corn.

4. Add the vinaigrette: Pour the vinaigrette over the salad, tossing to coat evenly.

5. Garnish with pine nuts: Sprinkle the pine nuts over the salad.

6. Serve: Fiesta Salad With Honey Mustard Vinaigrette is ready to be enjoyed. You can serve it as a side dish or a main course, depending on your preference.

Enjoy your delicious Fiesta Salad With Honey Mustard Vinaigrette!

gt:
In a skillet, cook sausage over medium heat, until pork is no longer pink; drain.
In a Dutch oven, cook pasta shells according to package directions; drain and rinse with cold water.
Using a pastry brush, coat sides and bottom of a 3-quart baking dish with oil.
Pour half of the marinara sauce into baking dish.
In a large bowl, combine eggs, ricotta cheese, 2- 1/2 cups of mozzarella, 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese, Romano cheese, basil, pepper and prepared sausage.
Stuff shells with meat mixture; arrange in baking dish.
Pour remaining marinara sauce over shells.
Cover and bake at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes.
Uncover; sprinkle with remaining mozzarella and Parmesan cheese.
Bake 5 minutes longer or until cheese is melted.
Sprinkle with parsley.
Serve.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the sausage over medium heat until browned, breaking it into smaller pieces as it cooks. Remove the sausage from the skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
4. Add the marinara sauce to the skillet and stir to combine. Bring the sauce to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 10-15 minutes.
5. In a large mixing bowl, combine the ricotta cheese, egg, and 1 cup of the shredded mozzarella cheese. Season with salt, pepper, and the chopped fresh or dried basil.
6. In a separate mixing bowl, combine the grated romano cheese and the grated parmesan cheese.
7. Spread the cooked sausage in the bottom of a large baking dish.
8. Pour the marinara sauce over the sausage, then top with the ricotta mixture.
9. Sprinkle the remaining shredded mozzarella cheese and grated romano and parmesan cheeses over the top.
10. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly, and the dish is hot and bubbly.
11. Remove the dish from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Using a small sharp knife, remove the peel and bitter white pith from the lemons; thinly slice the lemons crosswise.
Transfer to a bowl, toss with the olive oil, sea salt and pepper and let stand for 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, light a grill or preheat the broiler.
Set the mushrooms in a large shallow dish, gill side up.
In a small bowl, combine the onion, anchovies, vinegar and Marsala.
Pour the marinade over the mushrooms and let stand at room temperature for 20 minutes.
Grill the mushrooms over a medium-high fire or broil them for about 15 minutes, turning, until tender and lightly charred.
Transfer the mushrooms to a large platter, cover loosely with foil and keep warm.
Prick the sausages all over with a fork and grill or broil for 10 to 15 minutes, turning, until cooked through.
Add the sausages to the platter.
Season the lamb chops with salt and pepper and grill or broil for about 3 minutes per side for medium rare; arrange the chops on the platter.
Mound the arugula on the platter, pile the lemon salad alongside and serve with Almond Mint Salsa.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the mushrooms, onion, and anchovies. Season with salt, pepper, and a drizzle of olive oil. Toss to coat evenly.
3. Spread the mushroom mixture on a baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the mushrooms are tender and slightly caramelized.
4. In a small bowl, mix the balsamic vinegar and Marsala wine. Set aside.
5. In a large skillet, heat a drizzle of olive oil over medium-high heat. Season the chicken sausages with salt and pepper. Add the sausages to the skillet and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
6. Remove the sausages from the skillet and set aside.
7. In the same skillet, add a drizzle of olive oil and cook the lamb chops until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
8. Remove the lamb chops from the skillet and set aside.
9. In a large bowl, combine the arugula, red onion, and lemon zest. Season with salt and pepper.
10. In a small bowl, mix the almonds, mint, and a drizzle of olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.
11. To assemble the dish, place the roasted mushrooms and sausages on a platter. Drizzle the balsamic vinegar and Marsala mixture over the mushrooms and sausages.
12. Arrange the lamb chops on top of the mushrooms and sausages.
13. Drizzle the almond and mint salsa over the lamb chops.
14. Serve the Mixed Grill with Sicilian Lemon Salad on the side.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven according to package directions for tater tots.
Bake for 20 mins or so.
Just to keep slightly crisp.
Chop bacon and saute with the onion.set aside.
In same pan, brown the sausage.
Drain excess grease.
Mix with bacon and onion.
Spray a large casserole dish with cooking spray and add meat mixture to bottom.
When tots are done, adjust oven temperature to 350
Spread tater tots over meat mixture in the casserole dish.
Beat together the eggs, milk, and gravy mix.
Add salt and pepper if desired.
(I also added a dash of paprika )pour over the tater tots.
Sprinkle cheese over the top.
Bake for 45 minutes or until set.
Allow to cool for 10 minutes or so and enjoy!
:)
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the tater tots, bacon, sausage, onion, and milk. Mix well.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and cheese together.
4. Pour the egg and cheese mixture over the tater tot mixture, and stir to combine.
5. Add the country gravy mix to the dish, stirring to combine.
6. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
7. Bake the casserole for 25-30 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the center is set.
8. Let the casserole cool for a few minutes before serving.

This delicious Tater tot breakfast casserole dish is ready to be enjoyed.

gt:
Mix cake flour, baking powder, and granulated sugar in a bowl, and chill in the fridge.
Cut the butter into 1 cm cubes and chill the fridge as well.
Sift the dry ingredients, and add the butter.
Rub the mixture together with your fingers until it resembles panko.
Add cold milk, and briefly mix with a spoon.
When the dough is not floury any more, it's done.
Roll into a ball, and wrap with plastic wrap, then let it sit for 1 hour in the fridge.
Roll out the dough to a 2.5 cm thickness, and cut with a 5 cm diameter cookie cutter.
Coat with a thin layer of milk (for the glaze), and bake for 20 minutes at 190C (375F) on the bottom rack.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 220°C (425°F).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cake flour, baking powder, and granulated sugar.
3. Cut the butter into small pieces and add it to the dry ingredients.
4. Using a pastry blender or your hands, mix the butter into the dry ingredients until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
5. In a separate bowl, whisk the milk and egg together.
6. Add the milk mixture to the dry ingredients, stirring gently until the dough comes together.
7. Turn the dough onto a floured surface and knead it gently until it forms a smooth, elastic ball.
8. Roll the dough out on a floured surface to a thickness of about 1/2 inch (1.25 cm).
9. Cut the dough into rounds using a cookie cutter or a round cutter.
10. Place the scones on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
11. Bake the scones in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until they are golden brown and cooked through.
12. Remove the scones from the oven and let them cool on a wire rack for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Combine all ingredients and mix well.
Serve chilled.
pred:
To create a delicious Creamy Picante Dressing, follow these steps:

1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the sour cream, mayonnaise, and picante sauce. Whisk the ingredients together until smooth and well-combined.

2. Add the ground cumin to the mixture, stirring to ensure even distribution.

3. Taste the dressing and adjust the seasoning as needed, ensuring that the flavors are balanced and harmonious.

4. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or a lid and refrigerate the dressing for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.

5. Once the dressing has chilled, it is ready to be used as a base for salads, dips, or marinades. You can also add additional ingredients, such as chopped herbs, minced garlic, or lemon juice, to customize the dressing to your taste.

Enjoy your delicious Creamy Picante Dressing!

gt:
Place flour in flat bowl.
(for coating filets).
Stir lime juice and liquid egg together and put in its own bowl.
Mix breadcrumbs and coconut together.
Add salt, pepper, Basil, garlic salt and place in a flat bowl.
With each filet, cover in flour, shake off excess, dip in egg/lime mix, and coat both sides with the breadcrumbs/coconut.
Place on a cookie sheet that has been sprayed with cooking spray.
Bake @ 375 for 15 min (or until it flakes).
I served with a Broccoli & Rice dish, and steamed zucchini.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the Egg Beaters, coconut, salt, sweet basil leaves, garlic salt, and pepper.
3. Dip the tilapia fillets in the coconut mixture, ensuring they are evenly coated.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the breadcrumbs with the remaining coconut mixture.
5. Dip the tilapia fillets in the breadcrumb mixture, ensuring they are evenly coated.
6. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray.
7. Place the tilapia fillets on the prepared baking sheet.
8. Bake the tilapia for 12-15 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
9. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the tilapia rest for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Coconut/Lime Tilapia!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and 3/4 cup of powdered sugar until fluffy.
Beat in the fresh grated orange peel and the orange and vanilla extracts.
In another mixing bowl, combine the flour and salt; gradually add this to creamed mixture and mix well.
Stir in chopped nuts; mix well.
Shape into 3/4 inch balls and place each ball about 1 inch apart on an ungreased baking sheet.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the bottoms are lightly browned.
Remove from oven; transfer to a wire rack and cool completely.
Place the remaining powdered sugar in a 1-gallon Ziplock bag; add a few cookies at a time and shake to coat.
Sprinkle with ground cinnamon, if desired.
Store in an airtight container.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, cream the softened butter and 6 cups of powdered sugar until smooth and fluffy.
3. Add the orange peel, orange extract, vanilla extract, and salt, and mix well.
4. Gradually add the flour and mix until a dough forms.
5. If the dough is too soft, refrigerate it for about 30 minutes or until it reaches the desired consistency.
6. In a separate bowl, mix the chopped walnuts and hazelnuts.
7. Roll the dough into small balls, about the size of a golf ball.
8. Roll each ball in the nut mixture to coat it evenly.
9. Place the coated balls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
10. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the balls are golden brown.
11. Allow the balls to cool for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
12. Sprinkle the cooled balls with ground cinnamon, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Easy Nutty Orange Snowballs!

gt:
In a small pot boil water and sugar, once boiling, add the basil stems, chili and lemon zest and remove from heat.
All the syrup to cool to room temperature.
Then you can refrigerate the simple syrup for anywhere 15 minutes or up to 24 hours.
The longer it sits the more flavor you will get.
Remove the basil stems from the syrup and discard.
In a large bowl toss the melon with the chilled syrup.
Add the remaining salt, the white pepper if using and the basil leaves, toss gently .
Drizzle with olive oil and serve.
pred:
1. In a large saucepan, combine the water, sugar, and basil stems and leaves. Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes.

2. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the mixture cool for a few minutes.

3. Add the red chili, lemon zest, and honeydew melon pieces to the saucepan. Stir to combine.

4. Add the salt and sea, and stir to combine.

5. If desired, add the white pepper and extra virgin olive oil. Stir to combine.

6. Serve the Spicy & Savory Sweet Honeydew Melon dish immediately, or let it cool and refrigerate for a few hours before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Spicy & Savory Sweet Honeydew Melon dish!

gt:
1.
Heat a large, heavy nonstick skillet over medium heat.
Add oil to pan, and swirl to coat.
Add chopped onion, and cook for 7 minutes or until tender, stirring frequently.
Add apple; cook for 5 minutes, stirring frequently.
Add flour, curry, and garlic; cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Add broth, and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat, and simmer for 2 minutes or until slightly thick.
Stir in chutney, cream, and salt.
Add cauliflower and edamame; cook for 8 minutes or until cauliflower is tender, stirring occasionally.
Serve over rice, and top with currants and almonds.
Garnish with cilantro and green onions, if desired.
pred:
1. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
2. Add the apple and cook until it begins to soften, about 3 minutes.
3. Add the flour and curry powder, stirring to coat the vegetables evenly. Cook for 1 minute.
4. Add the broth, mango chutney, and whipping cream. Bring to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let the mixture simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the cauliflower is tender.
5. Add the edamame and rice, stirring to combine. Cook for an additional 5-7 minutes, or until the rice is cooked through and the cauliflower is tender.
6. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Serve the Vegetarian Country Captain dish hot, garnished with chopped fresh cilantro and sliced green onions, if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Peel, seed, and chop cucumber.
Mix the cucumber and finely chopped green onions, season well with salt.
Let it stand for about 15 minutes.
The salt will help the cucumber release some of its natural juices - press it lightly and drain off any liquid.
Wash and chop the tomatoes.
Mix the chopped parsley and dill with the cucumber-onion mixture.
Beat the yogurt well, and combine with the other ingredients.
Seasoned with salt and pepper to taste.
Let it chill for about an hour.
Garnish with extra dill.
This recipe is ideal for a light-hearted evening snack or a snack with bread.
pred:
[INST]
1. Wash and peel the cucumber and tomatoes thoroughly.
2. Chop the cucumber into small, bite-sized pieces.
3. Chop the green onions into small, thin pieces.
4. In a large bowl, combine the chopped cucumber, green onions, and tomatoes.
5. In a separate bowl, mix the plain yogurt, parsley, dill, ground cumin, white salt, and pepper.
6. Pour the yogurt mixture over the cucumber, tomato, and green onion mixture.
7. Stir the ingredients together until well combined.
8. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight for the flavors to meld together.
9. Serve the Cucumber and Tomato Yogurt (Kheera Ka Ray) as a refreshing and healthy side dish or snack.

[/INST]

gt:
In a chilled martini glass, layer raspberry liqueur, vodka, and Champagne.
Garnish with licorice, wax teeth, candy corn, and/or blood orange slice.
pred:
[INST]
To create a delicious and unique Vampire Kiss Martini, follow these steps:
1. In a shaker, combine 1 part raspberry liqueur, Chambord, and 1 part vodka.
2. Add 1 part Champagne, Korbel, and a pinch of Licorice for a hint of flavor.
3. Shake the mixture well and strain it into a chilled glass.
4. For a finishing touch, add a wax tooth or candy corn for a creepy effect, and a blood orange slice for a pop of color and a touch of sweetness.
5. Enjoy your Vampire Kiss Martini, and remember to drink responsibly.
<</SYS>>

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Heat the oil in a medium heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat.
Add half the onions, the carrots and celery and cook until tender, about 10 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add 2 cups water, the wine and pork belly and bring to a boil.
Cover, transfer to the oven and braise until the belly is tender, about 2 hours.
Let cool in the braising liquid.
Set the pork belly aside, then strain and reserve the liquid.
Render the bacon in a heavy-bottomed pot over medium-high heat.
Add the remaining onions and cook until tender, about 10 minutes.
Reduce the heat to medium, add the braised pork belly, ham hock, sauerkraut, caraway seeds, juniper berries and bay leaf.
Cover with the reserved braising liquid and bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat and simmer about 45 minutes.
Add the potatoes, bratwurst, garlic sausage and honey to the sauerkraut, cover and steam together for 30 minutes more.
To serve, slice the pork belly into serving pieces.
Discard the bay leaf.
Mound the sauerkraut on a generous platter and pile the meat and potatoes on top.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. In a large, heavy-bottomed pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until they are soft and translucent, stirring occasionally.
3. Add the carrot and celery, and cook for a few more minutes, until they are tender.
4. Season the vegetables with salt and pepper, and continue cooking until the vegetables are slightly caramelized.
5. Add the dry Riesling to the pot, and stir to deglaze the pan. Allow the liquid to cook down for a few minutes, until it has thickened slightly.
6. Add the pork belly to the pot, and cook until it is browned and cooked through.
7. Remove the pork from the pot, and set aside.
8. Add the bacon to the pot, and cook until it is crispy.
9. Add the ham hock, and cook until it is tender.
10. Add the sauerkraut to the pot, and cook until it is heated through.
11. Add the caraway seeds, crushed juniper berries, and bay leaf to the pot.
12. Pour the pot of contents into a large baking dish, and place the pork belly on top.
13. Add the potatoes to the dish, and pour the remaining sauce over the top.
14. Cover the dish with aluminum foil, and bake in the preheated oven for about 2 hours, or until the pork is cooked through and the potatoes are tender.
15. Remove the dish from the oven, and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious John Besh's Choucroute Garnie!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350.Combine all ingredients in a large bowl, and spoon into a 2-quart casserole.
Bake at 350 for 45 minutes.

Combine all ingredients.
Mix well.
Serve with hot wings.
Thin with a
little milk to desired consistency for salad.
pred:
To make a delicious Blue Cheese Dressing dish, follow these steps:

1. In a large bowl, combine the mayonnaise, sour cream, onions, minced garlic, parsley, lemon juice, white vinegar, and blue cheese crumbles. Mix well to ensure all ingredients are evenly distributed.

2. Season the dressing with salt and pepper to taste. You can also add additional seasonings, such as paprika, cayenne pepper, or a pinch of sugar, to enhance the flavor.

3. Cover the bowl and refrigerate the dressing for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.

4. Once the dressing has chilled, it is ready to be used as a salad dressing or as a base for other dishes. You can drizzle it over salads, use it as a base for sandwiches, or even incorporate it into dips or sauces.

By following these steps, you can create a delicious Blue Cheese Dressing dish that can be enjoyed on its own or paired with various dishes to enhance their flavors.

gt:
Combine all of the ingredients in a mason jar, screw on the top and shake to thoroughly mix.
Let sit for at least 20 minutes.
Keep refrigerated.
Makes about 3/4 to 1 cup of dressing.
pred:
1. In a small bowl, whisk together the Balsamic Vinegar, Olive Oil, Dijon Mustard, Honey, and garlic. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
2. Gradually drizzle in the olive oil while continuously whisking the mixture.
3. Once the dressing is fully combined, set it aside to allow the flavors to meld together.
4. To serve, pour the dressing over a salad or use it as a marinade for grilled vegetables or meats.

[/INST]

gt:
Mix together all taco seasoning ingredients in bowl or cup and set aside
Brown turkey in oil - make sure you use a wooden spoon to break up turkey while cooking
Add water and seasoning and mix
Bring water to boil
Cover and simmer for 10 minutes
Chop lettuce and tomatoes, place in separate bowls
Place cheese in a bowl
Heat shells at 325 degrees for 5 minutes
Assemble your tacos!
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the ground turkey and cook until browned, breaking it up into small pieces as it cooks. Season with the chili powder, onion powder, cumin, garlic powder, oregano, and brown sugar. Cook until the turkey is fully cooked through.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked turkey, shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, and shredded Mexican cheese blend. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
4. Place the taco shells on a baking sheet and fill each one with the turkey and cheese mixture.
5. Bake the taco shells in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
6. Serve the tacos with a dollop of low fat sour cream, a side of salsa, and a sprinkle of additional chili powder and paprika, if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
placed salt in crock, followed by sliced apples' brown sugar, cinnamom, oatmeal' milk and water - DO NOT STIR
cook overnight for 8-9 hours on low
pred:
1. Preheat the crockpot on low heat.
2. In a separate bowl, mix the sliced apples, brown sugar, and cinnamon.
3. Place the mixture in the bottom of the crockpot.
4. Add the oatmeal, milk, and water to the crockpot.
5. Cook the mixture on low heat for 6-8 hours, stirring occasionally.
6. Serve the warm, delicious crockpot breakfast.

[/INST]

gt:
Beat the eggs in a mixing bowl with a wire whisk until smooth.
Stir in the shredded and diced zucchini, then season with salt, pepper, Parmesan cheese, and basil.
Add the flour a little at a time, stirring between additions until no dry lumps remain.
Heat the oil in a large skillet to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Drop the batter into the hot oil by the spoonful a few at a time making sure not to overcrowd the oil.
Cook until the fritters are golden brown on each side, about 4 minutes.
Drain on a paper towel-lined plate before serving.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, zucchini, shredded, diced zucchini, salt, and pepper.
3. Add the grated Parmesan cheese, chopped fresh basil, and flour to the zucchini mixture, stirring until well combined.
4. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
5. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or frying pan over medium heat.
6. Using a spoon or your hands, scoop out small amounts of the zucchini mixture and form into small, round patties.
7. Carefully place the patties into the hot oil and fry for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until they are golden brown and cooked through.
8. Remove the fritters from the oil and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to drain any excess oil.
9. Serve the Old-Fashioned Italian Zucchini Fritters warm, with a side of marinara sauce for dipping.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Old-Fashioned Italian Zucchini Fritters!

gt:
For the cookies:
Whisk flour, cocoa, baking soda and salt in a medium-sized bowl.
In a large bowl, stir-whisk butter, sugars, corn syrup, vanilla and milk until smooth.
Stir the flour mixture into the butter mixture, then add the pecans and stir some more.
Cover and chill until firm enough to scoop, 3-4 hours.
This dough can be made 1 day in advance.
Keep chilled.
Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.
Using a tablespoon, scoop out dough and form into round balls.
Arrange on baking sheet leaving space in between.
Press gently with fingers to flatten slightly.
Bake one sheet at a time for 8-10 minutes.
Remove cookies, still on the parchment paper, to a wire rack to cool.
Repeat with the remaining dough.
For the drizzle:
Once the cookies are cooled; either in a bowl over lightly simmering water or in the microwave, melt the chocolate chips with the coconut oil until smooth.
With a fork, dip and drizzle over the cookies.
Let stand for about 30 minutes for the drizzle to set and serve!
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugars until light and fluffy.
3. Add the eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, cocoa, baking soda, and salt.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until just combined.
6. Fold in the chopped pecans and chocolate chips.
7. If desired, add the non-refined coconut oil to the mixture.
8. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
9. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are set and the centers are still slightly soft.
10. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat the oven to 200.
Line a large baking sheet with paper towels.
In a shallow bowl, beat the eggs with 1 tablespoon of water.
Put the flour and panko in 2 separate shallow bowls.
Season the pork cutlets with salt and pepper.
Dredge in the flour, then dip in the egg, letting the excess drip back into the bowl.
Dredge the coated pork in the panko, pressing lightly to help it adhere.
In a large skillet, heat 1/4 inch of olive oil until shimmering.
Add 3 of the cutlets and fry over moderately high heat, turning once, until browned and just cooked through, about 5 minutes; transfer to the prepared baking sheet.
Repeat with the remaining cutlets.
Transfer the pork to the oven to keep warm.
Wipe out the skillet and heat the 1 teaspoon of olive oil in it.
Add the bacon and cook over moderate heat, stirring, until browned and crisp, 3 to 5 minutes.
Add the apples and onion and cook over moderately high heat, stirring occasionally, until the apple just starts to soften, about 3 minutes.
Add the apple cider and vinegar and cook until the liquid is reduced by half, about 3 minutes.
Scrape the apple mixture into a large bowl.
Add the dandelion greens and toss well.
Season with salt and pepper and toss again.
Transfer the pork Milanese to plates, top with the salad and serve right away.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large bowl, whisk the eggs, then add the flour, panko, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
3. Dip each pork cutlet into the egg mixture, then coat it with the panko mixture.
4. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the pork cutlets and cook until golden brown, about 3 minutes per side.
5. Remove the pork from the skillet and place it on a wire rack.
6. In the same skillet, cook the bacon until crispy, then remove it from the pan and set it aside.
7. In the same skillet, cook the apples, onions, and red onion until tender.
8. Add the apple cider, apple cider vinegar, and dandelion greens to the skillet. Cook until the liquid has evaporated and the greens are wilted.
9. Place the cooked pork cutlets on a baking sheet, and bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until cooked through.
10. Serve the Pork Milanese with Dandelion Green Salad.

[/SYS]

gt:
Cut off the ends and green parts of leeks.
Wash them carefully in order to remove any soil, cut them in pieces of 3 cm (1 inch) length.
In a large pan heat the olive oil, sautee the onion and the leeks for approx 10 minutes.
Add gradually into the saucepan the tomatoes, potatoes, carrots, parsley and the celery.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add 1 cup of water and simmer until tender (20 - 30 minutes) and all the water is absorbed (add more water if required) Remove from heat and stir in the lemon juice, one tablespoon first, taste and add more if you like.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large, heavy-bottomed pot or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
3. Add the chopped onion and sauté until it is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the chopped leeks and continue to cook until they are softened, about 10 minutes.
5. Add the chopped carrots, potatoes, and celery to the pot. Cook for an additional 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. Pour in the canned tomatoes, and stir to combine.
7. Add the chopped parsley, salt, and pepper. Stir to combine.
8. Cover the pot with a lid, and place it in the preheated oven.
9. Cook the stew in the oven for 1 1/2 to 2 hours, or until the vegetables are tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
10. Remove the pot from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes.
11. Stir in the lemon juice, and serve the stewed leeks with tomatoes hot.

[/INST]

gt:
For the stock; put all the ingredients into a medium pot, cover with water, about 10 cups, and bring to a boil.
Skim off the scum that floats to the surface, and simmer the stock until the chicken has cooked, about 1 1/2 hours.
Leave the chicken to cool in the stock.
For the soup, sweat the diced carrot, celery and onion in the oil in a medium pan together with the garlic until the vegetables are soft.
Add the sliced shiitake mushrooms and fry until cooked.
When the stock is ready, strain the liquid over the vegetables and mushrooms.
You'll need 8 cups.
Keep the chicken carcass and pick off the cooked meat in small pieces.
Add this to the soup with the spinach, when the spinach has wilted in the soup add the nutmeg, salt and pepper.
As an variation you may also add a poached egg or some grated parmesan on top of the soup.
pred:
1. Heat the olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
2. Add the chopped onion, and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the minced garlic, and cook for another minute, until fragrant.
4. Add the diced carrots, celery ribs, and sliced mushrooms to the pot. Cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. Add the diced chicken to the pot, and cook until it is fully cooked through.
6. Add the baby spinach leaves, and cook until they are wilted.
7. Add the nutmeg, salt, and pepper to taste.
8. Pour in the chicken broth, and bring the mixture to a boil.
9. Reduce the heat to low, and let the soup simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the flavors have melded together.
10. Serve the Chicken, Spinach & Shiitake Mushroom Soup hot, garnished with a sprinkle of freshly grated nutmeg, if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Dissolve yeast in warm water (using wood or plastic spoon and plastic or glass bowl) Add remaining ingredients as listed.
Grease muffin pan, or spray with pam.
Fill each muffin space 1/2 full.
Bake on 425 F.
about 20 minutes.
Mixture will be soupy and will not need to rise.
If you don't want to bake all of these at the same time, the dough may be kept in the refrigerator for several days.
pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the warm water and yeast. Allow the mixture to sit for about 5-10 minutes or until the yeast is foamy.
2. Add the sugar, melted margarine, and beaten egg to the yeast mixture. Mix well.
3. Gradually add the self-rising flour, stirring until a soft dough forms.
4. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic.
5. Place the dough in a greased bowl, cover it with a damp cloth, and allow it to rise in a warm place for about 1-2 hours or until it has doubled in size.
6. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
7. Punch down the dough and roll it out on a floured surface to a thickness of about 1/2 inch (1.25 cm).
8. Spread the melted margarine evenly over the dough, leaving a 1/2 inch (1.25 cm) border around the edges.
9. Roll the dough up from the short end, starting with the margarine-covered side. Place the roll seam-side down on a greased baking sheet.
10. Bake the rolls in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes or until they are golden brown.
11. Remove the rolls from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before slicing them into individual servings.

[/INST]

1. In a large skillet, heat some oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onions and cook until they are softened.
2. Add the minced garlic and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, stirring occasionally

gt:
Place a Whisper pattern on top of the sliced cheese and cut out using a toothpick or a sewing needle.
Cut out the nori to make facial features and attach to the cheese.
There you have a two-dimensional Whisper.
Place on top of rice or similar.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Prepare a baking sheet by lining it with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
3. Cut the sliced cheese into small, evenly-sized pieces.
4. Spread the sliced cheese evenly across the prepared baking sheet.
5. Sprinkle the sliced cheese with a dash of sushi nori seaweed.
6. Place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
7. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Carefully transfer the melted cheese and sushi nori seaweed onto the desired bento box shape, using a spatula or your hands.
9. Allow the cheese and seaweed to cool for a few more minutes before serving.

[/INST]

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Prepare a baking sheet by lining it with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
3. Cut the sliced cheese into small, evenly-sized pieces.
4. Spread the sliced cheese evenly across the prepared baking sheet.
5. Sprinkle the sliced cheese with a dash of sushi nori seaweed.
6. Place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
7. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Carefully transfer the melted cheese and sushi nori seaweed onto the desired bento box shape, using a spatula or your hands.
9. Allow the cheese and seaweed to cool for a few more minutes before serving.

gt:
Combine all the ingredients and knead.
Roll it up once it becomes somewhat smooth.
If you're using a bread maker, let it knead for about 10 minutes,and then take it out and roll it up.
No rising.
Leave it to rest for 20 minutes.
Spray water and cover with a wet paper towel.
Roll it out into the shape of your choice and place it on top of parchment paper.
Poke holes with a fork.
If you keep the rim a little thicker, the sauce and toppings won't spill out.
Top it with the sauce and toppings you like and bake for 18 to 20 minutes at 200C Please adjust the baking time accordingly.
This is a fluffy, thick pizza (anchovy, garlic, onions, mayonnaise, cheese).
More like a pizza bread, due to its thickness.
This is a thinly rolled out crust.
Since the surface area got bigger, I added lots of toppings.
It's made with basil sauce.
This pizza is topped with dried curry sauce and cheese Very easy to make using leftovers, but still good.
Pizza with tomatoes, cheese, and mayonnaise.
Pizzas are fun to make, since you can do so with a variety of toppings.
Here is an example of using this dough to make it into a naan to go with curry.
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, salt, and yeast.
2. Gradually add the water, stirring to combine the ingredients.
3. Knead the dough until it becomes smooth and elastic, about 10-15 minutes.
4. Cover the dough with a damp cloth and let it rise in a warm place for about 1-2 hours, or until it has doubled in size.
5. Preheat your oven to 200°C (400°F).
6. Punch down the dough and transfer it to a lightly floured surface.
7. Roll out the dough into a thin, even layer.
8. Transfer the rolled-out dough to a pizza stone or a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
9. Spread a thin layer of tomato sauce over the dough.
10. Add your desired toppings, such as cheese, vegetables, or meats.
11. Bake the pizza in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
12. Remove the pizza from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

This step-by-step procedure will help you create a delicious oil-free pizza crust using the provided ingredients.

gt:
Let the butter and chicken stand at room temperature for 3o minutes or so.
Preheat oven to 425 degrees.
Remove and discard any giblets, excess fat, and plastic pop-up timer, if there is one.
To prevent burning, tuck the chicken's wing tips under the body.
Season the cavity of the chicken, liberally, with salt and pepper.
Roll the lemon back and forth on the counter to get the juices going.
Pierce the entire surface of the lemon with the fork.
Smash up the garlic cloves- the side of a knife does this well.
Insert lemon, garlic and thyme into the cavity of the bird.
Arrange the onion slices in the center of a heavy-duty roasting pan.
(Arranging the onions in overlapping rows works great) Place the chicken on top with the breast side up.
Tie the chicken legs together with kitchen twine.
Spread the softened butter over the entire surface of the chicken.
Season generously with salt and pepper.
Roast the chicken until skin is crisp and the skin is a nice golden brown.
The juices should run clear when the chicken is pierced with a fork- about 1 1/2 hours.
The chicken will be cooked perfectly when an instant-read thermometer (inserted into the breast- then thigh) will read 165 degrees.
Garnish with sprigs of thyme.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Season the chicken with salt and fresh ground pepper on both sides.
3. Heat the butter in a large oven-safe skillet or roasting pan over medium heat.
4. Add the sliced onions and cook until they are softened and slightly caramelized.
5. Add the garlic cloves and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
6. Remove the chicken from the refrigerator and pat it dry with paper towels.
7. Place the chicken in the prepared pan, skin side up.
8. Sprinkle the chicken with the thyme sprigs and any additional fresh thyme.
9. Pour the lemon juice over the chicken, making sure to coat it evenly.
10. Roast the chicken in the preheated oven for about 1 1/2 to 2 hours, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C) and the juices run clear.
11. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for 10-15 minutes before carving and serving.

Enjoy your delicious Roasted Chicken With Lemon, Garlic and Thyme!

gt:
In a blender combine milk, frozen strawberries, 1/2 banana, chocolate milk powder, vanilla and sugar.
Blend until smooth.
If consistency is too runny, you may add more strawberries.
pred:
To create a delicious Chocolate Strawberry Banana Milkshake, follow these steps:
1. In a blender or a mixer, combine 1 cup of low-fat milk, 1/2 cup of frozen unsweetened strawberries, and 1/2 ripe banana.
2. Add 2 tablespoons of powdered chocolate drink mix, and 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla extract to the blender.
3. Blend the mixture until smooth and creamy.
4. Add 2 teaspoons of white sugar to the blender, and blend until fully combined.
5. Pour the Chocolate Strawberry Banana Milkshake into a glass, and enjoy your delicious treat.

This recipe creates a refreshing and indulgent milkshake, perfect for a hot summer day or as a treat after a meal. The combination of chocolate, strawberries, and bananas provides a delightful taste that is both sweet and fruity.

gt:
Blend ingredients together in a jar and store in the refrigerator.
Use generously with falafel as well as with fresh green salads.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Creamy Cucumber Dressing, follow these steps:
1. In a small bowl, mix the nonfat plain yogurt, minced garlic, and lemon juice until well combined.
2. Add the chopped cucumber to the bowl, and mix until the cucumber is evenly coated with the dressing.
3. Season the dressing with salt and pepper to taste.
4. Allow the dressing to sit for a few minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
5. Serve the Creamy Cucumber Dressing over a salad or as a dip for vegetables.

The Creamy Cucumber Dressing is a healthy and refreshing side dish that can be enjoyed with a variety of meals. The combination of yogurt, cucumber, and garlic creates a unique and flavorful dressing that is both light and satisfying.

gt:
Cut up Chicken Breast into small pieces place in pot of boiling water cook until done, then drain.
Mix spices, beans and carrot, in pot with water, add can of rotel tomatoes.
cook until done.
Pre cook the noodles till they are still firm on the inside, then drain.
Combine: Chicken, Noodles, and vegetables in large soup pot, add tomato paste, mix in well.
Cook on medium low for 1 hour.
Use large 11 x 15 " casserole dish; using slotted spoon layer of your soup mixture (layer should be at least half of the casserole dish).
Spread two cups of mozzarella cheese evenly over mixture.
Add second layer of soup mixture evenly over cheese, layer of soup mixture.
Pour 1 1/2 cup of broth over the entire dish.
Top with 3 cups of Colby Jack cheese.
Bake in over @ 350 degrees for 45 min, let it stand for five minutes.
Can be served with Homemade Cornbread or Hard rolls sliced in half, buttered and toasted.
NOTE: You can use a smaller casserole dish.
And the soup mixture can be frozen in gallon or quart size bags (depending on your cooking needs) for future uses.
Which will definitely cut down on prep time.
NOTE: You can also prepare your complete casserole in a freezer to oven container.
Substitute stew meat or ground beef for the chicken.
All these taste great,.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the chicken breasts, Rotel Tomatoes, tomato paste, lima beans, carrots, casarecce noodles, colby-monterey jack cheese, mozzarella cheese, salt, pepper, cayenne pepper, Italian seasoning, garlic powder, and dehydrated onion.
3. Mix everything together until well combined.
4. Transfer the mixture to a 9x13 inch baking dish, and bake for about 30-35 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the noodles are tender.
5. Serve the Chicken Vegetable Casserole hot, and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
In large pot steam sliced apples 1- 2 minutes.
Cool 1- 2 minutes.
Add the rest of the ingredients and pie filler is ready to use.
Hint When dealing with large quantities of apples I prepare double and triple batches of the pie filler, cool and set into the fridge while preparing the pastry.
I find using the recipe 'Lemon Tang Pastry' which was passed to me as no-fail pastry works so very well making the preparation of pies for the freezer a snap.
Time depends on how fast you can prepare the apples, those with experience do get throught prep time quickly!
pred:
To create a delicious Rosy Crabapple or Apple Pie Filling, follow these steps:

1. In a large saucepan, combine the sliced apples, water, sugar, and flour. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for about 15-20 minutes, or until the apples are tender and the mixture has thickened slightly.

2. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the lemon juice. Allow the mixture to cool slightly.

3. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter or margarine and the salt (if using). Gradually add the cooled apple mixture to the butter mixture, stirring until well combined.

4. Pour the filling into a freezer-safe container or airtight can, and refrigerate or freeze until ready to use.

5. To use the filling, preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). Roll out your pie crust and place it in a pie dish. Pour the cooled filling over the crust, and then cover the pie with a pie crust or a top crust.

6. Bake the pie in the preheated oven for about 45-50 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbly and slightly caramelized. Allow the pie to cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Rosy Crabapple or Apple Pie Filling!

gt:
Spray small microwavable bowl with cooking spray.
Add egg and VELVEETA; mix well.
Season with pepper to taste.
Microwave on HIGH 30 seconds; stir.
Microwave 10 to 15 seconds longer or until egg is set and no visible liquid remains.
Microwave bacon as directed on package.
Meanwhile, toast bread slices; spread with jam.
Serve eggs, bacon and toast with the orange.
pred:
1. In a large skillet, heat a small amount of oil over medium heat.
2. Add the cubed VELVEETA and cook until it is melted and slightly browned.
3. Add the lightly beaten egg and stir gently to combine. Cook until the egg is fully cooked and the VELVEETA is melted.
4. Season with pepper to taste.
5. Toast the two slices of whole wheat bread.
6. Spread one tablespoon of strawberry jam on one slice of toasted bread.
7. Place the other slice of toasted bread on top of the strawberry-jam-covered slice.
8. Cut the half of the medium seedless orange into thin slices.
9. Arrange the orange slices on top of the sandwich.
10. Serve immediately.

This Sunrise Scramble recipe combines the flavors of the melted VELVEETA, the lightly beaten egg, and the toasted whole wheat bread. The addition of the strawberry jam adds a sweet touch, while the orange slices provide a refreshing citrusy contrast. This dish is perfect for breakfast or a quick snack.

gt:
Mix it all together and put into a casserole dish.
Bake for 15-20 minutes on 425F.
Easy, fast, GOOOD!
Note: We add 2 cups of carrots, the nuts we use are walnuts, and the cheese is sharp cheddar.
Just sayin!
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the turkey or chicken, mayonnaise, nuts, lemon juice, and cheese. Mix well.
3. Add the celery, croutons, and shredded carrots to the bowl. Mix well.
4. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
5. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the mixture is hot and bubbly.
6. Serve the Hot Turkey Salad immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat pot with olive oil
Toss in all veggies, let soften
Constantly stir veggies prevent burning or sticking
Toss in cornstarch and half a stick of butter, along with bullion cubes
Once turned a light Carmel color, add in milk and chicken broth.
Stirring frequently.
Place all seasonings in and let come to a slight bubble.
Add biscuits, tearing quarter size dumplings, rolling into balls and flattened out.
Add shredded oven baked chicken in and let it go until everything has married and biscuits cooked through.
Add a lil sprinkle cheddar when serving and ENJOY!
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large saucepan, combine the chicken broth, cream chicken, non-sweet almond milk, and Italian seasoning. Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 10 minutes.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the cornstarch with a small amount of non-sweet almond milk until smooth. Gradually pour the cornstarch mixture into the saucepan, stirring constantly. Cook for about 2 minutes or until the mixture thickens.
4. While the sauce is thickening, heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the chopped onion, bell pepper, and carrots to the skillet and cook for about 5 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
5. Add the cooked chicken breast to the skillet and cook for about 5 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.
6. In a small bowl, mix the house seasoning with a small amount of non-sweet almond milk. Pour the mixture over the chicken and vegetables in the skillet.
7. In a separate bowl, mix the biscuits according to the package instructions.
8. Carefully spoon the chicken and vegetable mixture into a 9x9 inch baking dish.
9. Sprinkle the biscuits evenly over the chicken and vegetables.
10. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes or until the biscuits are golden brown and the chicken is cooked through.
11. Serve the Quick chicken and dumplings hot.

[/INST]

gt:
Heat oven to 350F.
Combine 1/3 cup sugar and butter in bowl.
Beat at medium speed until creamy.
Add 1 1/2 cups flour and 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg; beat at low speed until well mixed.
(Mixture will be crumbly.)
Press crust mixture onto bottom of ungreased 13x9-inch baking pan.
Bake 15-17 minutes.
Combine all filling ingredients except nutmeg in same bowl.
Beat at medium speed, scraping bowl often, until mixture is creamy.
Spread filling over hot, partially baked crust; sprinkle with 1/8 teaspoon nutmeg.
Continue baking 28-33 minutes or until set.
Cool completely.
Cut into bars with wet knife.
Store refrigerated
*Substitute Land O Lakes Fat Free Half & Half.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the sugar, butter, and flour.
3. Add the eggnog, cream cheese, and eggs, mixing until smooth.
4. Add the nutmeg, and mix until well combined.
5. Press the mixture evenly into the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.
6. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the edges are set and the center is slightly jiggly.
7. Allow the bars to cool completely before cutting into squares and serving.

[/INST]

[INST]<<SYS>>
Please note that the eggnog used in this recipe should be homemade or store-bought, as the recipe does not include any specific brand or type of eggnog.
<</SYS>>

[/INST]

gt:
In a large glass or stainless-steel bowl, combine the chopped tomatoes with the mozzarella, basil, olives, balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper.
In a large pot of boiling, salted water, cook the spaghetti until just done, about 12 minutes.
Drain, add to the tomato mixture, and toss.
Heat the oil in a small frying pan over moderately low heat.
Add the garlic and cook, stirring, for 1 minute.
Pour the oil over the pasta and toss again.
Variations: Add some drained capers, chopped red onion, or grated Parmesan to the pasta.
Wine Recommendation: Valpolicella, the crisp, fruity, cherry-scented wine from the shores of Lake Garda in the Veneto, is the perfect hot-weather wine for tomato-and-herb-based dishes.
Try one here for a delightful accompaniment.
pred:
[/SYS]

[INST]
1. Preheat your oven to 450°F (232°C).
2. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the spaghetti according to the package instructions until al dente.
3. In a large bowl, combine the chopped tomatoes, mozzarella, basil, and olives. Season with balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper.
4. Drain the cooked spaghetti and add it to the bowl with the tomato mixture. Toss to combine.
5. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the minced garlic and cook for about 1 minute, until fragrant.
6. Pour the tomato mixture over the spaghetti in the skillet, and stir to combine.
7. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for about 10-15 minutes, or until the spaghetti is heated through and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Serve immediately and enjoy your delicious Spaghetti with Tomatoes, Basil, Olives, and Fresh Mozzarella.

[/SYS]

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat your oven to 375 F and spray a small baking dish with non-stick spray.
I used a 7-inch oval baker.
In a large bowl, combine the goat cheese, Colby cheese, Parmesan, mayo, sour cream, pimentos, relish, garlic powder, onion powder, chili powder and a dash of salt and black pepper.
Mix to fully combine.
Pour the mixture into the prepared baking dish, and spread to even out the top.
Place it in the oven and bake for 20-25 minutes or until bubbly.
Remove from heat and let it cool for just a minute.
Serve warm, garnished with green onions and served with radishes and tortilla chips!
Enjoy!
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the goat cheese, Colby cheese, and Parmesan cheese.
2. Add the mayonnaise, sour cream, and jarred pimentos. Mix until well combined.
3. Add the garlic powder, onion powder, chili powder, salt, and black pepper. Mix until well combined.
4. Taste the dip and adjust the seasoning if necessary.
5. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
6. For garnish, slice the green onions and set aside.
7. Serve the dip with radishes and tortilla chips for dipping.

[/SYS]

gt:
Place the raspberries and tea bags in a large glass bowl.
Pour the boiling water over the berries and tea bags; cover and let stand for 5 minutes.
Remove the tea bags; strain the berries from the mixture, then discard them.
Cool for a few hours.
If desired, chill the tea.
Serve in tall glasses, with ice cubes, a few more berries, and a wedge or slice of orange, lemon, or lime, if desired.
pred:
1. First, prepare the tea by steeping the tea bags in the boiling water for the recommended steeping time.
2. Once the tea has steeped, remove the tea bags and discard them.
3. Add the fresh or frozen raspberries to the tea, stirring gently to ensure they are evenly distributed.
4. If desired, add ice cubes to the tea to make it cold and refreshing.
5. Stir the tea again to ensure the raspberries are well-incorporated.
6. Optionally, garnish the tea with additional raspberries for a pop of color and flavor, or orange wedges, lime wedges, or lemon wedges for a citrusy twist.
7. Serve the iced raspberry tea in a glass or cup, and enjoy!

By following these key steps, you can create a delicious and refreshing iced raspberry tea that is perfect for hot summer days or any time you want a tasty and healthy beverage.

gt:
Mix all ingrediants and pour into a greased bread pan.
Bake at 300 for 1 hour and 15 minutes.
Test for doneness with a toothpick.
Sometimes it will need 10-15 more minutes.
Let cool before removing from pan.
pred:
To create delicious Moist Banana Bread, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the sugar, shortening or butter, eggs, mashed bananas, milk, and baking soda. Mix until well combined.
3. Gradually add the hot water, flour, and salt to the mixture, stirring until the batter is smooth and free of lumps.
4. Pour the batter into a greased and floured loaf pan.
5. Bake the bread for 1 hour or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean.
6. Allow the bread to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
7. Once the bread is fully cooled, slice it and enjoy!

This recipe will yield a delicious, moist, and flavorful banana bread that is perfect for breakfast or as a snack. The combination of the sweet bananas, buttery or shortening base, and the baking soda helps create a tender and fluffy texture.

gt:
In a large saucepan cook the mushrooms, onion, and garlic in hot oil till onion is tender but not brown.
Stir in the rice- Cook and stir for 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, in another saucepan bring the vegetable or chicken broth to a boil; reduce heat and simmer.
Slowly add 1 cup of the broth to the rice mixture, stirring constantly.
Continue to cook and stir till liquid is absorbed.
Add 1/2 cup broth and the asparagus or broccoli to the rice mixture, stirring constantly.
Continue to cook and stir till liquid is absorbed.
Add 1 cup more broth, 1/2 cup at a time, stirring constantly till the broth has been absorbed.
This should take about 15 minutes.
Stir in tomato, carrot, and the remaining 1/2 cup broth.
Cook and stir till rice is slighly creamy and just tender.
Stir in fontina or Muenster cheese, Parmesan cheese, and basil or parsley.
If desired, garnish with some tomato slices- Serve immediately.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large, oven-safe skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the sliced mushrooms and cook until they are tender and slightly browned, about 5-7 minutes.
3. Add the chopped onion and cook until softened, about 3-5 minutes.
4. Add the minced garlic and cook for another minute, stirring constantly.
5. Add the rice or long grain rice to the skillet and stir to coat the rice with the oil and onion mixture. Cook for a few minutes, until the rice is slightly toasted.
