6. Add the vegetable broth or chicken broth to the skillet, one cup at a time, stirring constantly to ensure the rice is well-coated with the liquid.
7. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer, covered, for about 20-25 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the liquid has been absorbed.
8. Add the asparagus or broccoli pieces to the skillet, stirring to combine with the rice. Cook for an additional 5-7 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender but still slightly crisp.
9. If desired, add the sliced tomatoes to the skillet and cook for another 2-3 minutes, or until they are heated through.
10. Season the risotto with salt and pepper to taste.
11. Transfer the risotto to a large, oven-safe serving dish and top with the shredded cheese.
12. Bake the risotto in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
13. Remove the risotto from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Fresh Vegetable Risotto!

gt:
In a large heavy saucepan combine the sauerkraut, the apples, the wine, the broth, the brown sugar, and the caraway seeds and simmer the mixture, covered, stirring occasionally, for 1 hour.
The sauerkraut may be made 1 day in advance, kept covered and chilled, and reheated.
pred:
1. Combine the sauerkraut, chopped apples, and brown sugar in a large bowl.
2. In a separate bowl, mix the dry white wine, chicken broth, and caraway seeds.
3. Pour the liquid mixture over the sauerkraut and apples, and stir to combine.
4. Cover the bowl with a clean cloth or plastic wrap, and let it sit in a cool, dark place for 24 hours.
5. After 24 hours, taste the sauerkraut and adjust the seasoning if needed.
6. Transfer the sauerkraut to a clean, sterilized jar, and store it in the refrigerator.

This recipe will yield a delicious and tangy Sauerkraut With Apple and Caraway, perfect for pairing with meats, cheeses, or as a side dish.

gt:
Place hens breast side up on a rack in a shallow roasting pan.
In a small bowl combine the remaining ingredients.
Brush over hens and bake uncovered at 350 degrees F for 50-60 minutes or until juices run clear.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Season the Cornish hens with salt, pepper, and lemon-pepper seasoning.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the melted butter, minced garlic, and dried basil.
4. Place the Cornish hens in a roasting pan, skin side up.
5. Pour the butter mixture over the hens, ensuring they are evenly coated.
6. Roast the hens in the preheated oven for about 45-50 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
7. Remove the hens from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes before carving them into individual servings.
8. Serve the roasted Cornish hens with the herb-infused butter mixture, lemon wedges, and a side of your choice.

Enjoy your delicious Herb-Roasted Cornish Game Hens!

gt:
Mix peanut butter and soft butter until well mixed.
Add Rice Krispies and mix well.
Add powdered sugar; mix well.
(I found it easier to mix with my hands).
Mold into melon ball-sized balls.
Put in refrigerator until cold.
Melt chocolate as per instructions on package.
I use coating chocolate bar squares that comes in the one pound or two pound packages and melt in microwave.
I usually double the recipe.
You can use a bag of chocloate chips and 1/2 bar paraffin, if desired, and cook in double boiler or microwave.
I have fixed both ways and perfer the chocolate squares.
Dip balls into chocolate and drain on waxed paper.
I store my in the refrigerator.
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the creamy peanut butter and softened butter.
2. Add the Rice Krispies to the bowl and stir until well combined.
3. Gradually add the powdered sugar, stirring until the mixture is smooth and well combined.
4. If the mixture is too dry, add a bit more peanut butter or butter to achieve the desired consistency.
5. Roll the mixture into small balls, approximately 1 inch in diameter.
6. Melt the chocolate according to the package instructions.
7. Dip the peanut butter balls into the melted chocolate, allowing the excess chocolate to drain off.
8. Place the chocolate-covered balls on a wax paper-lined baking sheet to set.
9. Once the chocolate has set, transfer the balls to a storage container and refrigerate until ready to serve.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Whisk together lime juice and honey.
Add jalapeno, cilantro, and salt and set aside.
Cut corn off cobs leaving some pieces large.
Add to dressing.
Add spinach, tomato and cucumber and mix well.
This salad tastes best after about half an hour when the spinach has wilted and the flavors have had time to meld.
pred:
1. First, gather all the necessary ingredients for the Fresh Corn Salad With Honey Lime Vinaigrette. This includes 14 cup fresh lime juice, 1 tablespoon honey, 1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced, 1 -3 tablespoon fresh cilantro, minced, 14 teaspoon salt, 6 ears corn, cooked, 1 large tomatoes, seeded and chopped, 34 cup cucumber, seeded and chopped.

2. In a large bowl, combine the corn, tomatoes, cucumber, and spinach.

3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the lime juice, honey, jalapeno pepper, and salt.

4. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.

5. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve immediately.

6. Enjoy your delicious and healthy Fresh Corn Salad With Honey Lime Vinaigrette!

gt:
Set oven to 350 degrees F.
Pat all the potato cubes thoroughly dry using paper towel/s.
Arrange the sweet potato cubes (if possible in a single layer) in a lightly-buttered 13 x 9-inch dish.
In a small saucepan or the microwave stir together butter, honey and lemon juice until butter melts.
Pour butter mixture over the sweet potatoes; toss well to coat.
Sprinkle with salt and lots of black pepper.
Bake uncovered until just fork-tender stirring and turning with a spatula or wooden spoon (about 40 minutes, might take shorter or longer time depending on the size of sweet potato pieces, try not overbake the sweet potatoes or they will be too soft).
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
3. In a large bowl, toss the sweet potatoes and butter together until they are evenly coated.
4. Spread the sweet potatoes out on the prepared baking sheet.
5. Drizzle the honey over the sweet potatoes, making sure to coat them evenly.
6. Squeeze the lemon juice over the sweet potatoes, and sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Roast the sweet potatoes in the preheated oven for 45-50 minutes, or until they are tender and golden brown.
8. Remove the sweet potatoes from the oven, and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Oven Roasted Honey-Glazed Sweet Potatoes!

gt:
Preheat oven to 425 degrees.
Blend spinach and mozzarella in a food processor.
Add egg and blend.
Spread on parchment paper and bake for 15 minutes.
Edges should brown.
Add your favorite sauce and toppings and broil until cheese melts.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 475°F (245°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the spinach, egg, and mozzarella cheese.
3. Add the basil and oregano to the mixture.
4. Gradually add the flour and water, mixing until a dough forms.
5. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic.
6. Roll out the dough on a floured surface to your desired thickness.
7. Transfer the rolled-out dough to a greased baking sheet or pizza stone.
8. Bake the dough in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until it is golden brown.
9. Remove the baked crust from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
10. Add your desired toppings to the crust, such as tomato sauce, pepperoni, or any other desired ingredients.
11. Return the pizza to the oven and bake for an additional 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
12. Remove the pizza from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
In a large heavy pot or cast-iron skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat.
Add potatoes and a pinch of salt.
Cook potatoes until lightly browned, stirring occasionally, about 10 minutes.
Add shredded chicken and continue to cook until potatoes are crispy but tender on the inside, about another 5 minutes.
Remove hash to a plate and crack two eggs into the pan.
There should be enough oil in the pan to cook the eggs, but if your pan is dry, add another drizzle of oil.
Cook eggs as you like.
(I like mine sunny-side up!)
Divide hash between two plates and top with eggs.
I love to garnish mine with smoked paprika and hot sauce, but some people might prefer ketchup.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped potatoes and cook until they are tender and slightly browned, about 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and smoked paprika (if using).
4. Add the chicken to the skillet and cook until it is fully cooked through. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
5. Add the whisked eggs to the skillet and stir to scramble them. Cook until the eggs are cooked through and the potatoes are tender.
6. Combine the cooked chicken and potatoes in the skillet.
7. Season the dish with hot sauce (optional) to taste.
8. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the dish is hot and bubbly.
9. Serve the Shredded Chicken Hash immediately.

This delicious Shredded Chicken Hash dish is a satisfying and hearty meal that can be enjoyed by people of all ages. The combination of tender potatoes, cooked chicken, and scrambled eggs creates a flavorful and filling dish that can be customized with additional ingredients, such as hot sauce or smoked paprika, to suit individual preferences.

gt:
Place peaches in a cold saucepan with sugar and salt.
Turn heat on to low and gently saute mixture, stirring occasionally, until peaches are soft and juicy.
Chill softened peaches in refrigerator.
Allow ice cream to soften slightly at room temperature.
In a large bowl, mix softened ice cream and peaches.
Spoon mixture into parfait glasses and refreeze for a few minutes, or serve as is.
pred:
[INST]To create a delicious Creamy Peach Freeze, follow these steps:
1. In a large bowl, combine the chopped peaches and brown sugar. Allow the mixture to sit for about 30 minutes to allow the sugar to melt and the flavors to meld together.
2. After the mixture has cooled, pour it over the vanilla ice cream in a large mixing bowl.
3. Using a hand mixer or a stand mixer, blend the ice cream and peach mixture until smooth and creamy.
4. If desired, add a pinch of salt to enhance the flavor.
5. Pour the creamy mixture into a freezer-safe container and place it in the freezer for at least 2 hours or until it reaches your desired consistency.
6. Once the Creamy Peach Freeze is fully frozen, enjoy it as a refreshing treat on a hot summer day or as a delightful dessert.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Prepare white rice (20 minutes to prepare stove top).
Layer bowl with hot rice 1st.
Top with cheddar cheese, salsa, and sour cream.
Sprinkle salt & pepper to taste.
Enjoy!
pred:
1. Cook the rice according to the package instructions.
2. In a large bowl, combine the cooked rice, cheddar cheese, salsa, sour cream, and salt and pepper. Mix well.
3. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
4. Spread the mixture evenly over a baking sheet or a casserole dish.
5. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
6. Serve the Easy Cheesy Rice immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Pre-heat oven to 400
Prepare crust as directed on pk.
Best to set dough on stove over oven vent for best heat
Soften butter over low heat to where its creamy.
Remove from heat and add garlic powder and parsley.
When dough is ready spread as thin as possible to where you can see through dough on cookie sheet with non stick spray( i prefer butter flavor )
With BBQ brush, brush butter mixture onto dough heavily.
Sprinkle parmesan cheese over butter spead
Sprinkle cheese on dough.
Put in oven for 10 minutes or until cheese has golden spots on it.
When you're garlic cheese bread is done spread remaining butter mixture on hot cheese.
Cut and enjoy
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the garlic powder, parsley flakes, and mozzarella cheese.
3. Spread the softened butter evenly over the pizza crust mix, then sprinkle the garlic-parsley mixture over the butter.
4. In a small bowl, mix the softened butter, oil, and parmesan cheese.
5. Spread the butter mixture over the pizza crust.
6. Bake the pizza crust in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown.
7. While the crust is baking, prepare the pizza sauce by heating it in a saucepan over medium heat.
8. Once the crust is done, remove it from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
9. Spread the pizza sauce evenly over the crust.
10. Return the pizza to the oven and bake for an additional 5-7 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
11. Remove the pizza from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
12. Spray the pizza with non-stick cooking spray and let it cool for a few more minutes.
13. Cut the pizza into slices and serve.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease the bottom and sides of a 9x5x3 inch loaf pan.
If using a glass loaf pan bake 25 degrees lower.
In a large bowl beat the butter and sugars together until combined.
Add the buttermilk and baking powder; and beat until combined.
Add eggs and vanilla; and beat until combined.
Add flour, apple pie spice and salt; beat until combined.
Toss the apples and nuts in a bit of flour before adding to the batter.
By hand, stir in the nuts and apples.
Spoon batter into prepared pan and spread evenly.
Prepare the streusel topping (instructions below) and sprinkle over the batter.
Bake for 60 minutes or until a wooden toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool bread in pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes.
Remove bread from pan and cool completely.
Wrap the loaf and store overnight before slicing.
Makes one loaf (14 slices)
For The Topping: In a small bowl combine the brown sugar, cinnamon and flour.
Using a pastry blender or fork cut in the butter until it resembles coarse crumbs.
Stir in walnuts or pecans.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the softened butter and sugars until light and fluffy.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
4. Stir in the vanilla extract and apple pie spice.
5. Gradually add the flour, a bit at a time, mixing until just combined.
6. Fold in the diced apples and chopped pecans or walnuts.
7. In a separate bowl, mix the brown sugar, cinnamon, and salt.
8. Drizzle the brown sugar mixture over the batter, and fold it in gently.
9. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9x5 inch loaf pan.
10. Bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean.
11. Remove the loaf from the oven and let it cool in the pan for 10 minutes.
12. Then, transfer the loaf to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

This Apple Pie Bread recipe combines the flavors of apple pie with the warm, comforting taste of bread. The softened butter and sugars create a rich, tender crust, while the apples and pecans add a sweet, crunchy texture and a burst of apple pie flavor. The brown sugar mixture and cinnamon enhance the overall taste, and the baking powder ensures a light, fluffy texture. The result is a delicious, moist, and flavorful Apple Pie Bread that is perfect for breakfast, dessert, or a snack.

gt:
CUMBERLAND WHISKY SAUCE:.
In a medium saucepan, combine the whisky, orange juice, and orange zest, and bring to a boil.
Lower the heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, until reduced by 50 percent in volume to about 3/4 cup.
Add the redcurrant jelly, salt, and cayenne, and stir well.
Cook until thickened, about 2 to 3 minutes.
Remove from the heat and pour into an attractive serving bowl.
Cool slightly before serving with your baked haggis.
HAGGIS:.
Preheat the oven to 200C/400F/gas 6.
Remove the outer packaging from the haggis then prick all over with a fork, wrap in foil like a baked potato and bake in the oven for 1 and a half hours.
To serve, split open the haggis with a sharp knife and spoon the contents over neeps and tatties or serve separately with other traditional accompaniments - see the introduction.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).

2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the fresh haggis, grated orange zest, salt, and cayenne. Mix well to ensure the haggis is evenly coated with the seasonings.

3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the Scotch whisky, fresh orange juice, and red currant jelly.

4. Pour the whisky mixture over the haggis mixture and stir to combine.

5. Transfer the haggis mixture to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for approximately 45-50 minutes, or until the haggis is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and slightly caramelized.

6. Remove the dish from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

7. Serve the baked haggis with the whisky Cumberland sauce on the side, allowing each person to add as much sauce as they desire.

Enjoy your delicious Burns Night Baked Highland Haggis With Whisky Cumberland Sauce!

gt:
In a medium bowl, mix together the butter, sour cream, vanilla, lemon juice and salt.
Stir in confectioners' sugar, and beat with an electric mixer until smooth.
pred:
[/INST]

1. In a large mixing bowl, cream the softened butter until it is light and fluffy.
2. Add the sour cream, vanilla extract, lemon juice, and salt. Mix until well combined.
3. Gradually add the confectioners' sugar, mixing until the desired consistency is reached.
4. If the frosting is too thick, add a bit more sour cream or lemon juice to achieve the desired consistency.
5. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
6. Once the frosting has chilled, it is ready to use.

This Sour Cream Frosting recipe is a delicious and creamy alternative to traditional buttercream frosting. The tangy flavor of the sour cream balances the sweetness of the confectioners' sugar, creating a unique and satisfying taste. The addition of lemon juice and vanilla extract enhances the overall flavor, making it a versatile and popular choice for various desserts and baked goods.

gt:
Heat oven to 375.
Beat margarine, sugars, vanilla and eggs in large bowl with electric mixer on medium speed.
Stir in flour, baking soda and salt (dough will be stiff).
Stir in nuts (if using) and chocolate chips.
Drop dough by level 1/4 cups about 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheet.
Flatten slightly with fork.
Bake 13 to 15 minutes or until light brown (centers will be soft).
Cool 1 to 2 minutes; remove from cookie sheet to wire rack.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Chocolate Chip Cookies dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, cream the softened butter and granulated sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
4. Stir in the vanilla extract.
5. In a separate bowl, mix the all-purpose flour, baking soda, and salt.
6. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until just combined.
7. Fold in the coarsely chopped nuts, if desired.
8. Fold in the semi-sweet chocolate chips.
9. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
10. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden and the centers are set.
11. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Chocolate Chip Cookies!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Spread peach slices into a baking dish in a single layer.
Stir brown sugar substitute, pecans, flour, and vanilla extract together; spread over the peach slices.
Bake in preheated oven until the peaches are heated through, 20 to 30 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
3. In a small bowl, mix together the brown sugar substitute, pecans, and flour.
4. Carefully remove the peach slices from the freezer and let them thaw for a few minutes.
5. In a separate small bowl, mix together the vanilla extract and a tablespoon of water.
6. Place the peach slices in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet.
7. Drizzle the vanilla mixture over the peaches, making sure to coat them evenly.
8. Sprinkle the sugar mixture over the peaches.
9. Bake the peaches in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
10. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the peaches cool for a few minutes.
11. Serve the Baked Peaches warm, and enjoy!

gt:
Pound chicken breasts until thin and are an even thickness.
Transfer chicken to a large bowl and set aside.
In a bowl or Mason jar, combine olive oil, lime juice, soy sauce, sesame oil, brown sugar, garlic and ginger.
Whisk until combined.
Pour half over the chicken, cover with plastic wrap and let marinate in the fridge for 2 hours.
Take the chicken out of the fridge and heat the grill.
Grill the chicken for about 5 minutes per side, cooking chicken all the way through.
Remove from heat and let chicken rest for a couple minutes.
Cut chicken and pour remaining sauce over chicken.
Pairs well with vegetables.
pred:
1. Preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
2. In a large bowl, mix together the chicken breast, olive oil, lime juice, soy sauce, sesame oil, brown sugar, and minced garlic. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
3. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to marinate the chicken.
4. Remove the chicken from the marinade and shake off any excess.
5. Grill the chicken for 6-8 minutes per side, or until it reaches your desired level of doneness.
6. Serve the grilled chicken with a side of your choice, such as rice or noodles, and enjoy your delicious Garlic, Ginger and Sesame Marinated Grilled Chicken dish.

gt:
Note: Prep and cook times given assume that the chili (Mexican All-Bean Chili, recipe at link and in my TK recipe box) was made ahead of time but the grits (Creamy Cheddar Jalapeno Grits, recipe at link and in my TK recipe box) were not.
If made ahead, warm the chili.
Make the grits fresh according to the instructions in the recipe, so they dont solidify in the refrigerator.
Combine sour cream, chopped cilantro, and lime juice to make cilantro-lime sour cream.
This can also be made ahead.
Prepare any optional garnishes.
To serve, roughly crumble a handful of chips in each bowl.
Sprinkle a scant 1/4 cup grated provolone (or lay 1 slice) over the chips, reserving about 1 tablespoon cheese (or 1/2 slice) for each bowl in the end.
Before proceeding, you may warm the chips and cheese up to 10 minutes in a low (175 degrees F or lower) oven, if time permits.
Scoop a generous helping of cheddar grits over the chips and cheese, followed by a scoop of bean chili.
Sprinkle each bowl with remaining provolone (about 1 tablespoon grated, or 1/2 slice), drizzle with cilantro-lime sour cream, add a bit of red onion and jalapeno, if desired, and serve with any other garnishes at the table.
If made according to stated inputs, the recipe is gluten-free.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large pot, combine the 10 cups of Mexican All-Bean Chili, or your favorite chili recipe, and bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 30 minutes, or until the chili has thickened and the flavors have melded together.
3. In a separate pot, cook the 8 cups of Creamy Cheddar Jalapeno Grits according to the package instructions.
4. In a small bowl, mix the 1 cup of sour cream, 1/4 cup of finely chopped cilantro, and the juice of 2 whole limes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
5. To assemble the dish, spoon the chili over the cooked grits in a large bowl or individual bowls.
6. Top each serving with the sour cream mixture, and garnish with the thinly sliced scallions and additional lime wedges and cilantro leaves.
7. Serve the Meatless Mexican Chili and Cheddar Grits Super Bowls immediately, and enjoy!

[/INST]

This delicious Meatless Mexican Chili and Cheddar Grits Super Bowls dish combines the rich flavors of chili, grits, and sour cream, while adding a touch of freshness from the cilantro and lime. The dish can be customized with your favorite chili recipe, grits, and toppings to suit your taste preferences.

gt:
Use a quart jar that has a wide mouth, but if you can't find one any quart jar will work.
Place each type of bean in jar in the order listed above.
Top with seasoning bag, gently flattened so it can be seen from all sides.
Place lid, decorate jar and attach recipe.
Put an expiration date: one year from time of assembly.
DIRECTIONS TO MAKE RAINBOW BEAN SOUP:.
Remove seasoning packet from the jar and set to the side.
Rinse beans and place beans in large microwave-safe dish.
Cover with water 1" to 2" over top of beans.
Cover dish loosely with plastic wrap.
Microwave on high for 15 minutes, rotating after 7 minutes.
Drain and rinse beans very well; place in a large pot.
Add 8 cups water, one 15 ounce can crushed tomatoes and seasonings from packet.
Cover, bring to boil.
Lower heat, cover pan and simmer 1 1/2 hours or until beans are tender.
Stir occasionally.
pred:
1. Rinse the beans, lentils, and split peas in a colander.
2. In a large pot, combine the beans, lentils, split peas, and dried onion flakes.
3. Add 4 cups of water and bring the mixture to a boil.
4. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for about 1 hour or until the beans and lentils are tender.
5. Add the dried parsley flakes, dried basil, sweetened lemonade drink mix, chili powder, garlic powder, and pepper. Stir well.
6. Simmer for an additional 15-20 minutes or until the flavors are well-blended.
7. Remove the pot from the heat and let it sit for a few minutes.
8. Stir in the canned ham, if using.
9. Serve the Rainbow Bean Soup Mix in a Quart Jar dish.

This delicious Rainbow Bean Soup Mix is a nutritious and flavorful meal that can be enjoyed by people of all ages. The combination of beans, lentils, split peas, and dried onion flakes creates a hearty and satisfying dish. The addition of the sweetened lemonade drink mix and chili powder adds a unique twist to the traditional bean soup, making it a delightful and refreshing meal.

gt:
Combine orange, grapefruit and lemon juice with the bottle of prosecco or champagne in a large pitcher.
Pour into your glasses and garnish glasses with grapefruit slices.
Enjoy!
pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the three cups of freshly squeezed orange juice, one cup of freshly squeezed grapefruit juice, and one-half cup of freshly squeezed lemon juice.
2. Stir the mixture well to ensure that all the ingredients are combined.
3. Pour the mixture into a large pitcher or punch bowl.
4. Add the bottle of chilled Prosecco or Champagne (750ml bottle) to the pitcher or punch bowl.
5. Stir the mixture again to ensure that the alcohol is well-incorporated into the drink.
6. Add the six slices of grapefruit to the pitcher or punch bowl.
7. Stir the mixture one last time to ensure that the fruit is evenly distributed throughout the drink.
8. Serve the Sparkling Citrus Punch immediately, garnishing with a slice of grapefruit or a lemon wedge, if desired.

This step-by-step procedure will help you create a delicious and refreshing Sparkling Citrus Punch using the provided ingredients.

gt:
Combine mustard, marmalade, jalapeno, lime juice and oil.
If mixture isn't hot enough to your taste add a little cayenne pepper.
Wash chicken and pat dry.
Cut a pocket in the side of each breast and spoon in a little of the mustard sauce.
Baste the tops of the chicken with the sauce.
Place chicken on a rack in a roasting pan.
Bake in a preheated pan for 40 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink.
Baste once during the cooking time with the sauce.
pred:
To make a delicious Lady Marmalade Chicken dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).

2. In a small bowl, mix together 2 tablespoons Dijon mustard, 2 tablespoons orange marmalade, and 1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and diced.

3. Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper, then place them in a baking dish.

4. Drizzle the chicken with 1 teaspoon of olive oil, and then pour the marmalade mixture over the chicken.

5. Roast the chicken in the preheated oven for 35-40 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).

6. Remove the chicken from the oven, let it rest for a few minutes, and then slice it into thin pieces.

7. Serve the chicken with a side of your choice, such as rice or a salad. Enjoy your delicious Lady Marmalade Chicken dish!

[/INST]

gt:
Beat eggs.
Add sugar, honey, coffee, oil.
Mix in mixer for 20 minutes (or use a blender, which my grandmother did accidentally once with excellent results, and now she does it all the time that way!
).
Add dry ingredients (in mixer, not blender) on low speed.
Then add vanilla.
Line a 13" x 9" x 2 1/2" with ungreased waxed paper.
Bake in a preheated 325F oven for 1 hour, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the eggs, sugar, honey, and coffee. Whisk until well combined.
3. Add the oil, flour, baking soda, cinnamon, clove, ginger, and vanilla to the mixture. Whisk until smooth.
4. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9-inch (23cm) round cake pan.
5. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
6. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for a few minutes before turning it out onto a wire rack to cool completely.
7. Once the cake is fully cooled, you can serve it and enjoy the delicious taste of the Honey Cake.

gt:
In a large bowl with a good top that seals, combine all of the vegetables and toss to combine.
In a seperage jar or bowl, mix together dressing ingredients.
Pour dressing onto sladad and mix together.
Place tight fitting top on bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
While salad is in the refrigeragor the 2 hours, reach in about every 30 minutes or so and give the bowl a shake upside down to help the dressing cover all the veggies.
Serve cold with a slotted spoon.
Pour dressing.
pred:
[INST]To prepare the Shoepeg Corn and Baby Pea Salad, follow these steps:
1. In a large bowl, combine the green pepper, celery, and green onion.
2. In a separate bowl, mix the diced pimentos, sugar, and vinegar.
3. Add the pimentos mixture to the vegetable mixture and toss to combine.
4. In a large pot, heat the canola oil over medium heat.
5. Add the corn to the pot and cook for about 5 minutes, or until the corn is tender.
6. Drain the corn and add it to the vegetable mixture.
7. In a small bowl, mix the sugar and salt.
8. Pour the sugar-salt mixture over the corn and vegetables and toss to combine.
9. Cover the pot and let the corn and vegetables cook for about 10 minutes, or until the corn is tender and the vegetables are cooked through.
10. Serve the Shoepeg Corn and Baby Pea Salad immediately, or refrigerate for up to 24 hours before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Shoepeg Corn and Baby Pea Salad!

gt:
Saute the mushrooms, onions, and garlic in a sauce pan with 2 tablespoons olive oil.
Cook about 5 minutes or until the vegetables are soft.
Let cool for a few minutes.
Combine the beans, the cooked vegetables, remaining oil, and lemon juice in a food processor.
Pulse until creamy.
Stir in the salt and pepper.
Refrigerate leftovers.
pred:
To cook a delicious Mushroom Bean Dip dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the sliced mushrooms, red onion, minced garlic, and 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Mix well to ensure the ingredients are evenly distributed.
3. Add the drained white beans to the bowl and mix again.
4. In a separate small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Pour the lemon juice mixture over the mushroom and bean mixture, and stir to combine.
5. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the dip is hot and bubbly, and the mushrooms are tender.
6. Serve the Mushroom Bean Dip warm, as a side dish or a snack, and enjoy the delicious flavors of mushrooms, beans, and the tangy lemon juice.

gt:
Put peeled and quartered potatoes in a large pot, cover with cold water, and bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
Reduce to a simmer and cook until tender, about 12 minutes.
Drain and transfer potatoes in a large bowl.
With a handheld mixer on low speed, break up potatoes.
Mix in sour cream, butter, 1/4 cup buttermilk, and 2 teaspoons prepared wasabi and whip potatoes on medium speed.
Add more buttermilk until the desired consistency is reached.
Season with salt and white pepper.
Garnish with the remaining wasabi and sliced green onions.
Serve and enjoy!
pred:
To prepare the delicious Buttermilk Wasabi Mashed Potatoes, follow these steps:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large pot, boil the potatoes in salted water until they are tender but still firm. This should take about 15-20 minutes.
3. Drain the potatoes and return them to the pot. Mash the potatoes with a fork or a potato masher until they reach the desired consistency.
4. In a small bowl, mix the sour cream, butter, and buttermilk until smooth.
5. Add the wasabi powder to the sour cream mixture and stir to combine.
6. Add the mashed potatoes to the sour cream mixture and stir until well combined.
7. Season the mixture with salt and white pepper to taste.
8. Transfer the mashed potato mixture to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the potatoes are fully cooked through.
9. Garnish the dish with sliced scallions for a touch of color and flavor.

Enjoy your delicious Buttermilk Wasabi Mashed Potatoes!

gt:
Position rack in bottom third of oven; preheat to 350F.
Mix first 5 ingredients in 13x9x2-inch oval baking dish.
Dot butter over apple mixture.
Place crust atop filling.
Fold dough edges under; crimp decoratively.
Using small knife, cut eight 1-inch squares in crust, spacing apart and cutting through crust but leaving squares in place.
Bake until crust is dry but still pale, about 35 minutes.
Increase temperature to 400F.
Sprinkle crust with 1 tablespoon sugar; continue to bake until apples are tender, crust is golden, and juices bubble, about 35 minutes (mixture will be syrupy).
DO AHEAD: Can be made 2 days ahead.
Cool, cover, and chill.
Rewarm uncovered in 300F oven 20 minutes.
Cool 15 to 20 minutes.
Serve warm with ice cream.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the apple slices with the maple syrup, lemon juice, and fine sea salt until they are evenly coated.
3. Spread the apple mixture onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
4. Roast the apples in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and caramelized.
5. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, mix the dried cranberries with the butter.
6. Once the apples are cooked, remove them from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
7. In a separate bowl, combine the cooled apple slices, dried cranberry mixture, and butter mixture.
8. Roll out the pie crust on a lightly floured surface to a thickness of about 1/4 inch.
9. Place the pie crust on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
10. Spread the apple mixture evenly over the pie crust.
11. Bake the pandowdy in the preheated oven for 35-40 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbly and hot.
12. Remove the pandowdy from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
13. Serve the pandowdy warm, garnished with a dollop of Vanilla Ice Cream if desired.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Combine all ingredients in the crock of a slow cooker.
Set the slow cooker to high and cook 2 hours.
Serve.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet or oven-safe pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the sliced onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the sliced zucchini and yellow squash to the skillet, and cook until they are tender and slightly caramelized, about 10 minutes.
4. Add the water to the skillet, and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover the skillet, and let the vegetables simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until they are tender.
5. Season the vegetables with Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.
6. Transfer the cooked vegetables to a slow cooker, and cook on low for 4-6 hours, or until they are tender and slightly mushy.
7. Serve the Slow Cooker Summer Squash Recipe hot, and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
Mix sugar and cinnamon in medium bowl.
Add apples; toss to coat.
Cut cheese slices diagonally in half.
Place crackers in single layer on baking sheet; top with cheese and apples.
Bake 4 to 5 min.
or until cheese is melted.
Serve warm.
pred:
To craft Easy Apple-Cheddar Melts, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the sugar and ground cinnamon until well combined.
3. Spread one side of each Triscuit cracker with a thin layer of butter.
4. Place the apple slices on the buttered side of the Triscuit crackers.
5. Sprinkle the cinnamon-sugar mixture evenly over the apple slices.
6. Top the apple slices with a slice of cheddar cheese.
7. Place the apple-cheddar sandwiches on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
8. Bake the melts in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Remove the melts from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Easy Apple-Cheddar Melts!

gt:
Melt butter in large skillet.
Add onions and fries, heat and stir till onions are wilted and fries are hot.
Remove from heat, stir in cheese, salt and pepper.
Pour into shallow baking dish.
Mix sour cream and eggs together and pour ove fries.
Bake for 20 minutes at 350 degrees.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the shredded cheddar cheese, sour cream, and slightly beaten eggs. Mix well.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the pepper, salt, and 2 tablespoons of butter.
4. In a large skillet, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of butter over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until it is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
5. Add the frozen french fries to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. Pour the cheese mixture over the fries and stir to combine.
7. Transfer the mixture to a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
8. Bake the potatoes in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Serve the hot potatoes immediately.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Swedish Potatoes!

gt:
Cook noodles in large pan of boiling water, uncovered, until just tender; drain.
Rinse under cold water, drain.
Toss noodles with sprouts, chives, onions, avocados, tomatoes and combined remaining ingredients.
pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the udon noodles, snow pea sprouts, chopped fresh chives, small red onion, and chopped avocado.
2. In a small bowl, whisk together the light olive oil, seasoned rice vinegar, mirin, lime juice, and wasabi.
3. Pour the dressing over the noodle mixture and toss to combine.
4. Gently toss the salad with a spatula or your hands, ensuring that the ingredients are evenly coated with the dressing.
5. Serve the Udon Salad immediately, or refrigerate for up to 2 hours before serving.

Enjoy your delicious and healthy Udon Salad dish!

gt:
put lemon in class with sugar,put cachaAa
mix,put ice
pred:
1. First, gather all the necessary ingredients: 2 lemons, kiwi, strawberries, a spoonful of sugar, half a glass of cachaAa, vodka or bacardi, and crushed ice.
2. Wash and peel the lemons and kiwi, and remove the seeds from the strawberries.
3. In a blender or food processor, combine the crushed ice, lemon juice, and sugar. Blend until smooth and creamy.
4. Add the kiwi and strawberries to the blender, and blend until the fruit is well combined.
5. Pour the mixture into a glass, and add a splash of cachaAa or vodka or bacardi.
6. Stir the mixture to combine all the ingredients.
7. Garnish the caipirinha with a sprig of mint or a lemon slice, if desired.
8. Serve the caipirinha immediately, and enjoy!

Please note that the recipe may vary depending on personal preferences and the availability of ingredients.

gt:
Put water for the pasta on to boil.
Cook pasta al dente.
Meanwhile, remove the stem and seeds from the pepper.
Neatly dice the flesh.
Melt the butter in a large skillet or saucepan.
Add the pepper to the melted butter.
Grate the rind of the lemon into the butter.
Add one half of the lemon's juice, cream, and seasonings to taste, stirring gently.
Keep the sauce warm until the pasta is ready, but do not let the sauce bubble.
Drain pasta and toss in sauce.
Serve immediately, with the parmesan.
pred:
1. Begin by heating the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat.
2. Add the sweet red pepper and cook for a few minutes, until it is softened.
3. Add the lemon juice, heavy cream, salt, white pepper, and cayenne pepper to the saucepan. Stir to combine.
4. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for about 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. While the sauce is cooking, cook the fettuccine pasta according to the package instructions.
6. Once the pasta is cooked, drain it and add it to the saucepan with the sauce. Stir to combine, and let it cook for a few more minutes, until the pasta is heated through and the sauce has thickened.
7. Serve the Lemon and Red Pepper Pasta immediately, garnished with grated parmesan cheese.

This cooking tutorial provides a step-by-step guide for making a delicious Lemon and Red Pepper Pasta dish. The ingredients include butter, sweet red pepper, lemon, heavy cream, salt, white pepper, cayenne pepper, fettuccine pasta, and parmesan cheese. The cooking process involves heating the butter, adding the pepper and lemon, simmering the sauce, cooking the pasta, and finally combining the pasta with the sauce and serving it with parmesan cheese.

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a skillet cook bacon and chopped onion.
Or you may just lay uncooked bacon strips on top of beans before puting in oven.
In a baking dish mix beans, ketchup, brown sugar, onion powder (if you didn't use the chopped onion), and mustard).
Add bacon and stir gently to mix bacon into beans.
Bake 1 hour in oven or in crock pot on low 4-6 hours/high 2-3 hours.
If you are in a hurry, you can also microwave instead for 15 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Line a large baking sheet with aluminum foil or parchment paper.
3. Cut the bacon into small pieces and place them on the prepared baking sheet.
4. Roast the bacon in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until it is crispy and slightly browned.
5. Remove the bacon from the oven and set it aside to cool.
6. In a large saucepan, combine the ketchup, brown sugar, and pork and beans.
7. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 1-2 hours, or until the pork and beans are tender and the sauce has thickened.
8. If you prefer, you can add chopped onions to the saucepan for extra flavor.
9. If desired, you can add a teaspoon of onion powder or a tablespoon of prepared mustard to the sauce for a bit of extra zest.
10. Once the pork and beans are cooked, remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
11. Pour the sauce over the cooled bacon on the baking sheet.
12. Return the baking sheet to the oven and bake for about 15-20 minutes, or until the sauce is bubbly and the bacon is crispy and slightly browned.
13. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
14. Serve the Queen Puff's Easy Baked Beans immediately, and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Combine eggs, cornstarch, sugar, garlic, rice flour, salt, green onions, and oyster sauce in a large bowl.
Mix well.
Stir in the chicken thighs, making sure to coat evenly.
Cover and refrigerate overnight.
Remove from refrigerator about 10 minutes prior to frying.
Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Cook chicken in the hot oil in batches, until golden brown and no longer pink inside.
pred:
1. In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, cornstarch, white sugar, garlic, and salt.
2. Add the sweet rice flour (mochiko) and mix until well combined.
3. Add the chopped green onions and oyster sauce to the mixture.
4. Place the boneless chicken thighs in a large bowl and pour the egg mixture over them. Mix well to coat the chicken evenly.
5. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or overnight.
6. Preheat the deep fryer to 375°F (190°C).
7. Heat the vegetable oil in a large pot or deep fryer to the desired temperature.
8. Carefully remove the chicken from the bowl and coat it evenly with the remaining vegetable oil.
9. Carefully place the coated chicken pieces into the preheated deep fryer, being careful not to overcrowd the pot.
10. Deep fry the chicken for about 10-12 minutes, or until it reaches a golden brown color and the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
11. Remove the chicken from the fryer and place it on a wire rack or a paper towel-lined plate to drain any excess oil.
12. Serve the Mochiko Asian Fried Chicken immediately, garnished with additional green onions if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Mochiko Asian Fried Chicken!

gt:
Cook ground crumbles, vegetables, broth and chili powder in large nonstick skillet on medium heat 8 to 10 min.
or until crumbles are heated through and vegetables are crisp-tender, stirring frequently.
Remove from heat.
Stir in cheese and cilantro; spoon down centers of tortillas.
Fold in opposite sides of each tortilla, then roll up, burrito style.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the frozen Boca Veggie Ground Crumbles, mixed fresh vegetables, and vegetable broth. Mix well.
3. Add the chili powder, KRAFT Mexican Style 2% Milk Finely Shredded Four Cheese, and cilantro. Mix until well combined.
4. Spread the mixture evenly over the warmed tortillas.
5. Roll up the tortillas, enclosing the filling, and place them seam-side down in a baking dish.
6. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until the tortillas are golden brown and the filling is hot and bubbly.
7. Serve immediately and enjoy your delicious Best-Ever Burritos For Two!

gt:
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Add turnips and cook until tender but still firm, about 15 minutes.
Drain, and cool.
In a large bowl, combine the turnips, green onions, apples, pineapple and sugar.
Stir to evenly coat with the sugar.
Whisk together the oil, water, salt and pepper.
Pour dressing over fruit and vegetables.
Toss and refrigerate overnight.
pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the chopped turnips, green onions, and Granny Smith apples.
2. In a separate bowl, mix the white sugar, vegetable oil, water, salt, and pepper.
3. Pour the dressing mixture over the vegetables and toss to coat evenly.
4. Refrigerate the salad for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
5. Serve the Turnip Salad as a refreshing side dish or a light meal.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
Unroll dough into four rectangles; firmly press perforations together to seal.
Combine cream cheese and sugar; spread onto dough rectangles to within 1/2 inch of edges.
Top evenly with raspberries & blueberries.
Bring opposite corners of rectangles together; press together to seal.
Place on ungreased baking sheet.
Bake 13 to 15 minute or until golden brown.
pred:
To prepare Very Berry Cheese Rolls, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Roll out the crescent dinner rolls on a lightly floured surface to a 1/4-inch thickness.
3. Spread the cream cheese evenly over the rolled-out dough, leaving a 1/2-inch border around the edges.
4. In a small bowl, mix the sugar and a pinch of salt. Spread the sugar mixture evenly over the cream cheese layer.
5. Arrange the blueberries and raspberries on top of the sugar mixture, leaving a small border around the edges.
6. Fold the edges of the dough over the filling, creating a half-moon shape.
7. Place the filled dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake the rolls for 12-15 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the filling is bubbly.
9. Allow the rolls to cool for a few minutes before slicing them into individual servings.

The essential ingredients for preparing Very Berry Cheese Rolls are 1 (8 ounce) package refrigerated crescent dinner rolls, 4 ounces cream cheese, 1 tablespoon sugar, and 14 cup blueberries and 14 cup raspberries.

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Melt 6 tablespoons butter in a saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir onion and garlic until onion is slightly softened, 5 to 10 minutes.
Mix potatoes, Mexican cheese blend, sour cream, cream of chicken soup, and onion mixture together in a bowl; pour into a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Mix corn flakes, melted butter, and garlic salt together in a bowl; sprinkle over potato mixture.
Cover baking dish with aluminum foil.
Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes.
Remove foil and continue baking until corn flake topping is lightly browned, about 30 minutes more.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic, and cook until the onion is tender.
3. Add the thawed frozen hash brown potatoes to the skillet, and stir to combine. Cook for a few minutes until the potatoes are warmed through.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the shredded Mexican cheese blend, sour cream, and condensed cream of chicken soup.
5. Pour the cheese mixture over the potatoes in the skillet, and stir to combine. Cook for a few minutes until the cheese is melted and the mixture is heated through.
6. Transfer the mixture to a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
7. In a small bowl, mix the crushed corn flakes and melted butter. Sprinkle the corn flake mixture evenly over the top of the potato mixture.
8. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the corn flakes are golden brown and the cheese is bubbly and melted.
9. Serve the Even Better Cheesy Potatoes hot.

[/INST]

gt:
Combine the oil, salt, pepper, thyme and garlic into a paste, then rub all over the roast.
Set aside at room temperature for 1 hour.
Forty minutes into the hour, pre-heat the oven to 500 degrees F.
On a baking sheet, place two sheets of Reynolds Wrap Aluminum Foil large enough to cover the roast.
Place the roast on the foil sheets and transfer everything to the oven.
Roast for 6 minutes per pound.
Remove from the oven.
Fold up the foil so it wraps the roast then return it to the oven.
Reduce the oven temperature to 170 degrees F and roast for one hour.
After an hour, check the internal temperature with an instant-read thermometer: 120-125 degrees F will yield a rare center, 130-140 degrees F will yield a medium-rare center, and 140-150 degrees F will yield a medium center.
When the roast is finished, remove it and set it on a cutting board to rest.
Transfer any drippings from the roast into a saucepan, then combine with the red wine and beef broth.
Bring to a simmer over med-high heat and reduce by 1/4; reduce heat to medium-low and whisk in the cubes of butter one at a time until incorporated into the sauce.
Add salt and pepper to taste and set aside.
Slice the roast into 1/2 inch thick slices and serve with the pan sauce poured on top.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the olive oil, salt, pepper, and thyme.
3. Season the beef eye of round roast with the spice mixture, ensuring it is evenly coated.
4. Heat the oven-safe foil in the oven.
5. Place the beef roast on the foil and seal the edges to create a tight, airtight package.
6. Place the foil-wrapped roast in the preheated oven and cook for 2 hours or until the internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C).
7. Remove the roast from the oven and let it rest for 15-20 minutes before slicing and serving.
8. In a saucepan, combine the dry red wine and beef broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and let the mixture simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until it has thickened slightly.
9. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, melt the cold butter over low heat.
10. Stir the melted butter into the simmering wine mixture.
11. Serve the Tender Eye of Round Roast with the sauce on the side.

[/INST]

gt:
Grate rind and squeeze juice from lemons; you'll need 2 tablespoons grated rind and 1/2 cup lemon juice.
Combine apricots, lemon rind, water, lemon juice in a medium saucepan.
Don't use aluminum; stainless steel is good.
Bring to a boil over high heat, cover, reduce heat to low and STIRRING FREQUENTLY, keep at a low boil for 35 - 40 minutes or until apricots are tender.
CAREFULLY pour into blender or food processor and process until smooth.
Return to saucepan.
Add honey; stir and return to boil.
Again reduce heat and cook, UNCOVERED, at a low boil until very thick.
STIR FREQUENTLY.
Ladle into hot sterilized jars.
Remove air bubbles, wipe rims, add hot lids and rings.
Process in boiling water bath for 5 minutes OR refrigerate and use within 1 month.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the chopped dried apricots, lemon juice, and water.
3. Cover the bowl and let the mixture sit for about 15-20 minutes.
4. After the mixture has soaked for the desired time, add the honey to the bowl and stir to combine.
5. Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. Bake the mixture in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the apricots are tender and the mixture is slightly caramelized.
7. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Once the mixture has cooled slightly, use a spatula to scoop out a portion of the mixture and transfer it to a bowl.
9. Repeat the process with the remaining mixture, scooping out and transferring portions to the bowl.
10. Once all the mixture has been transferred to the bowl, stir to combine and serve.

[/INST]

The essential ingredients for preparing Apricot Honey Butter are 2 cups dried apricots, chopped before measuring, 2 lemons, 2 cups water, and 23 cup liquid honey. These ingredients are combined and baked to create a delicious and nutritious spread that can be enjoyed on toast, as a topping for yogurt, or even as a sweet treat on its own.

gt:
Mix in a blender until smooth.
Serve with fresh speared fruit or mint for garnish, if desired.
pred:
To prepare Navy Grog, first combine the light rum, dark Jamaican rum, and barbados golden rum in a large mixing glass. Add the fresh lime juice, passion fruit or guava nectar, pineapple juice, orange juice, and orgeat syrup. Stir the mixture well to combine all the ingredients.

Next, pour the mixture into a tall glass filled with crushed ice. Stir the drink again to ensure the ice is fully incorporated.

Garnish the Navy Grog with a sprig of mint or a lime wedge, if desired. Enjoy your refreshing and delicious Navy Grog!

gt:
Microwave method for cooking corn: husk corn and wash off any loose silk.
Place wet corn into Ziploc bag.
Place bag in microwave and cook 4 minutes; rotate ears and cook 2 more minutes.
Let sit 2 minutes to finish cooking.
Cool five minutes and then slice kernels off the cob.
Combine corn kernels, lime juice, lime zest, butter, salt and pepper.
**Can be made ahead up to this point.
Just before serving, add cilantro and toss to combine.
If desired, garnish with lime slices and sprig of cilantro.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Remove the corn from the cob and cut it into 1-inch pieces.
3. In a small bowl, mix the lime juice, lime zest, butter, salt, and pepper.
4. Toss the corn in the lime mixture until it is evenly coated.
5. Spread the corn on a baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the corn is tender and slightly caramelized.
6. While the corn is cooking, chop the cilantro.
7. Once the corn is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Stir the cilantro into the corn.
9. Serve the corn immediately, garnished with additional lime wedges and cilantro, if desired.

This step-by-step guide will help you prepare a delicious and healthy dish of Fresh Corn With Lime and Cilantro using the provided ingredients.

gt:
Squeeze spinach dry.
Combine spinach, cottage and feta cheeses, pine nuts, egg, garlic and nutmeg in a bowl.
Mix well.
Season with salt and pepper.
To make each 'parcel', place a sheet of phyllo on a flat surface.
Brush with melted butter, Top with another sheet of phyllo, brush again with melted butter, then fold in half to make a rectangle.
Spoon spinach mixture along one narrow end of the pastry.
Fold edges in and roll up to encase filling.
Place parcels on an oven tray brushed with butter.
Brush parcels with remaining butter.
Bake at 190C for 12-15 minutes until golden.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the spinach, cottage cheese, feta cheese, crumbled, and nutmeg. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
3. In a small bowl, whisk the egg and set aside.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the toasted pine nuts and melted butter.
5. Carefully unroll the phyllo pastry sheets and place them on a clean, dry surface.
6. Using a small spoon, scoop a small amount of the spinach and feta cheese mixture onto the center of one of the pastry sheets.
7. Fold the pastry sheet over the filling, creating a half-moon shape. Repeat with the remaining pastry sheets and filling.
8. Brush the edges of the parcels with the melted butter mixture.
9. Place the parcels on a baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the pastry is golden brown and the filling is hot and bubbly.
10. Serve the Spinach and Feta Phyllo Parcels immediately.

gt:
In a large, heavy-bottomed pot or cast-iron pan, add frying oil.
Heat oil to 350 degrees, testing with a frying thermometer.
Coat oysters evenly in flour, then add the oysters to the oil and fry until golden brown and crispy (about 1 minute).
Remove from oil and season with salt and pepper.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the flour, seasoning, and a pinch of salt.
3. Dip the oysters in the flour mixture, shaking off any excess, and place them on a baking sheet.
4. Bake the oysters in the preheated oven for 5-7 minutes, or until they are cooked through and the shells are slightly crispy.
5. While the oysters are cooking, prepare the sliders by cutting the mini buns in half.
6. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
7. Add the dredged oysters to the skillet and cook until they are golden brown, about 2-3 minutes per side.
8. Place the cooked oysters on the bottom halves of the buns.
9. Add a dollop of mayonnaise, a pinch of Old Bay Seasoning, and a dill pickle slice on top of each oyster.
10. Serve immediately, and enjoy your delicious Oyster Slider dish!

gt:
Combine all ingredients in a small bowl and mix well.
Pour the blend into an empty spice bottle to store.
pred:
To cook a delightful Copycat Lawry's Seasoned Salt dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix together 2 tablespoons salt, 2 teaspoons sugar, 12 teaspoons paprika, 14 teaspoons turmeric, 14 teaspoons onion powder, and 14 teaspoons garlic powder.
3. In a large bowl, combine 1 cup of cornstarch with 1/2 cup of water. Mix well to form a smooth slurry.
4. Add the cornstarch mixture to the seasoned salt mixture, stirring to combine.
5. Spread the mixture evenly over a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. Bake the mixture in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until it becomes dry and slightly crispy.
7. Remove the mixture from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Once cooled, crumble the mixture into small pieces and store it in an airtight container.

This Copycat Lawry's Seasoned Salt dish is a delicious and easy-to-prepare alternative to the original Lawry's Seasoned Salt. The ingredients, including salt, sugar, paprika, turmeric, onion powder, garlic powder, and cornstarch, create a flavorful and satisfying seasoning that can be used in various dishes, such as roasted vegetables, meat, or even as a topping for popcorn.

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Cream together peanut butter and butter.
Beat in sugars, eggs and vanilla.
Stir in flour, baking powder and salt until evenly blended.
Fold in chocolate chips.
Spread into a greased 9x9 or 7x11 inch baking pan.
Bake at 350 degrees F for approximately 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out with fudgy crumbs.
Allow to cool before slicing.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 9x13 inch baking pan.

2. In a large bowl, cream together the softened butter and peanut butter until smooth.

3. Add the sugar, brown sugar, eggs, vanilla, and flour to the bowl, and mix until well combined.

4. Stir in the baking powder and salt.

5. Fold in the chocolate chips.

6. Spread the mixture evenly into the prepared baking pan.

7. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the bars comes out clean.

8. Allow the bars to cool completely before cutting them into bars and serving.

Enjoy your delicious Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip Bars!

gt:
In a mixing bowl, combine the sugar, oil and eggs; mix well.
Stir in bananas and orange juice.
Combine the dry ingredients; add to banana mixture, beating just until moistened.
Stir in walnuts.
Pour into two greased 8-in.
x 4-in.
x 2-in.
loaf pans.
Bake at 325 for 50-60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool for 10 minutes; remove from pans to a wire rack to cool completely.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the sugar and vegetable oil until smooth.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
4. Stir in the mashed bananas, orange juice, and flour until well combined.
5. Stir in the baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
6. Fold in the chopped walnuts.
7. Pour the batter into a greased and floured loaf pan.
8. Bake for 1 hour and 10 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean.
9. Allow the bread to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
10. Enjoy your delicious Orange Banana Nut Bread!

gt:
Heat barbecue to medium heat.
Pour dressing over chicken in resealable plastic bag.
Add oregano and 4 lemon slices; seal bag.
Turn to evenly coat chicken with dressing, squeezing lemon slices in bag to release their juices.
Refrigerate 30 min.
to marinate.
Remove chicken from marinade; discard bag and marinade.
Grill chicken 5 to 7 min.
on each side or until done (170F), adding remaining lemon slices to barbecue for the last 2 min.
Serve chicken topped with grilled lemon slices.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the 1/4 cup of Kraft Extra Virgin Olive Oil Italian Sun-Dried Tomato Dressing, 4 small boneless skinless chicken breasts (1 lb./450 g), and 1 Tbsp. chopped fresh oregano.
3. Season the chicken with salt and pepper to taste.
4. Transfer the chicken mixture to a baking dish, and bake for 25-30 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the juices run clear.
5. While the chicken is baking, prepare the lemon slices by cutting them into 8 equal parts.
6. Remove the chicken from the oven, and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into 1/2-inch (1.25 cm) thick pieces.
7. Serve the Lemon-Oregano Chicken with the lemon slices on the side, allowing guests to add the slices to their plates as desired.

Enjoy your delicious Lemon-Oregano Chicken with the added zest of fresh lemon slices!

gt:
To toast the pine nuts- use a non-stick frypan and medium heat.
Toss the pine nuts until you can see the colour changing and can smell them toasting.
Be careful not to burn them.
Cool.
Finely shred the lettuce.
Add the cooled pine nuts, shallots and dill.
Toss to combine and mix.
Whisk together the oil and vinegar.Season with salt and pepper.
Drizzle the dressing over the lettuce salad and serve immediately.
pred:
To create a delicious Greek Farmers Green Salad, follow these steps:

1. Wash the 3 cos lettuce heads thoroughly and remove any leaves that are wilted or damaged.
2. Finely shred the hearts of the lettuce and set aside.
3. Toast the pine nuts in a dry skillet over medium heat until they become fragrant and lightly browned.
4. Slice the green shallots thinly and set aside.
5. Remove the dill sprig from the stems and chop the leaves finely.
6. In a large bowl, whisk together the extra virgin olive oil and red wine vinegar.
7. Season the salad with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Add the shredded lettuce, green onions, and dill leaves to the bowl.
9. Gently toss the ingredients to combine, ensuring that the dressing is evenly distributed.
10. Serve the Greek Farmers Green Salad immediately, allowing the flavors to meld together.

This salad is a delightful combination of fresh, crisp ingredients that come together to create a delicious and healthy meal. The toasted pine nuts add a rich, nutty flavor, while the green shallots provide a mild, slightly sweet taste. The dill leaves add a refreshing, herbal touch, and the dressing brings everything together, enhancing the overall taste and texture of the salad.

gt:
Cook your pasta according to package instructions, reserving 1/2 cup of the starchy cooking water before draining.
Set pasta and the water aside.
Saute the onion in the extra virgin olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Once the onion has started to soften, add your garlic to the pan and continue to saute, stirring frequently so that the garlic doesnt burn.
Cook for 4-5 minutes, or until the onions have sweated out a bit and start to turn translucent then add the ground beef.
Cook the ground beef for approximately 5 minutes, breaking up the beef as it cooks.
Once it has browned add all the spices both dried and fresh.
Stir to combine.
Add the tomatoes, tomato sauce, tomato paste and beef broth and simmer for 10 minutes so the flavors develop.
Add the cooked pasta and starchy cooking water; tossing to combine.
Serve with Parmesan cheese for topping.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the ground beef and cook until browned, breaking it up into small pieces as it cooks.
4. Add the minced garlic, cumin, chili powder, sea salt, and black pepper. Cook for an additional 2 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. Add the spicy oregano and rosemary, stirring to combine.
6. Pour in the Fire Roasted Tomatoes, tomato sauce, tomato paste, reduced sodium beef broth, and grated Parmesan cheese. Stir to combine.
7. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for about 25-30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
8. Cook the spaghetti according to the package instructions until al dente.
9. Serve the Supremely Spicy Spaghetti Meat Sauce over the cooked spaghetti.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Cut acorn squash horizontally and scrape out the seeds and pulp.
Set seeds aside.
Sprinkle squash with salt and pepper.
Place on a baking sheet, cut side up, and bake for 45 minutes or until fork tender.
Meanwhile, clean the acorn seeds and place on a baking sheet.
Sprinkle with salt.
Bake for about 7 minutes.
If you hear them pop, theyre done.
In a pan, add peppers, onions, cabbage and butter and saute until soft and tender.
Once squash is done, place the vegetable mixture into the squash.
Sprinkle with cayenne pepper, top with goat cheese and bake until cheese is softened, about 5 minutes.
Top with some toasted acorn squash seeds.
Serve and enjoy!
Calories per half of acorn squash: 229, Fat: 6.5, Cholesterol: 12.5, Sodium: 145, Potassium: 1497, Carbs: 42, Fiber: 9.6, Sugar: 0, Protein: 8.5
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Cut the Acorn Squash in half lengthwise and scoop out the seeds and pulp.
3. Place the squash halves cut-side down on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
4. Drizzle the squash with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
5. Roast the squash in the preheated oven for about 45-50 minutes, or until the flesh is tender and the skin is slightly browned.
6. Remove the squash from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. In a large bowl, combine the shredded cabbage, sliced bell peppers, and onions.
8. In a small bowl, mix the butter, cayenne pepper (if using), and goat cheese.
9. Carefully scoop out the cooked squash pulp into the bowl with the vegetables.
10. Stir in the butter mixture and season with salt and pepper to taste.
11. Fill the squash shells with the stuffing mixture, dividing it evenly among the four shells.
12. Return the stuffed squash to the oven and bake for about 20-25 minutes, or until the filling is hot and bubbly.
13. Serve the Acorn Squash Stuffed with Peppers, Onions and Cabbage immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Make ready a container that you'd make barley tea or ice tea in.
Add the ingredients in the combination of your choice, and that's it!
Kombu and bonito flakes, kombu and dried shiitake mushrooms!
Use any combination of ingredients you'd like.
Put all the ingredients in the container, add cold or hot water, leave for about 6 hours, and voila!
You have delicious dashi stock!
pred:
1. Start by gathering the necessary ingredients: 3 to 5 pieces of dried kombu, 10 grams of bonito flakes, and 3 to 6 dried shiitake mushrooms.
2. In a large pot or container, combine the dried kombu, bonito flakes, and dried shiitake mushrooms.
3. Add enough water (or hot water) to cover the ingredients.
4. Bring the mixture to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to medium-low and let it simmer for 30 to 45 minutes.
5. Strain the stock through a fine-mesh sieve, discarding the solids.
6. Allow the stock to cool down to room temperature before using it in your recipe.

This ultra-easy way to make dashi stock is perfect for lazy people who want to enjoy a delicious, savory dish without spending too much time in the kitchen. The dashi stock is a key ingredient in many Japanese dishes, and with this simple method, you can easily create a high-quality base for your recipe.

gt:
1) Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Generously coat a 13 x 9-inch pan with nonstick cooking spray.
2) Combine drained potatoes, spinach, shallots, 5 teaspoons seasoning mix, black pepper, Parmesan cheese, 1 teaspoon lemon juice and flour in a large bowl.
Mix well.
3) Using a 1/4-cup measure, drop 8 small mounds of mixture onto prepared baking sheet.
Lightly press each mound to form a cake that is 1-inch high.
Spray tops lightly with nonstick cooking spray.
Bake for 30 minutes.
4) Meanwhile, combine yogurt, mayonnaise, remaining 5 teaspoon seasoning mix and 1 teaspoon lemon juice in a small bowl.
Mix well.
5) Transfer potato cakes to a serving platter and top each with a small dollop of yogurt sauce.
Garnish with lemon slices.Serve immediately.
Yield: 8 potato cakes.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the grated red potatoes, finely chopped spinach, and shallot.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the Hidden Valley Original Ranch Dressing and Seasoning Mix, coarsely cracked black pepper, and grated parmesan cheese.
4. Add the yogurt, mayonnaise, and lemon juice to the potato mixture, stirring until well combined.
5. Gradually add the Ranch dressing mixture to the potato mixture, stirring until the ingredients are well combined.
6. Form the mixture into small patties, about the size of a walnut.
7. Heat a large skillet or frying pan over medium heat. Add a small amount of oil to the pan, and cook the potato cakes until golden brown on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side.
8. Transfer the cooked potato cakes to a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until cooked through and golden brown.
9. Serve the Baked Spinach and Cheese Ranch Potato Cakes hot, garnished with a lemon slice if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Cut flank steak into strips 1/4-inch wide and 3 inches long.
Mix Worcestershire sauce, lime and garlic.
Marinate the steak for 30 minutes.
While steak is marinating, cut onion and bell pepper into 1/4-inch wide strips.
Heat oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat and cook until they begin to sweat.
Remove the peppers and onions with a slotted spoon to a paper plate to drain.
Remove the steak from the marinade and brown in same skillet until done about 3-4 minutes depending on how you like your steak cooked.
Remove the cooked steak and set aside.
Spray your grill pan with cooking spray or spray the same non-stick skillet.
Take one tortilla and put a small amount of grated cheese, meat, onion and bell pepper, then some more cheese on half the tortilla.
Fold the tortilla in half (this is the trick to keep them together, plus now you will only eat 4 pieces) and repeat the process with remaining tortillas.
Place 2 of the tortillas in grill pan or skillet and cook until cheese melts and you see those lovely grill marks.
Flip and cook on other side same amount of time.
Slice each tortilla with a pizza cutter into 4 pieces and serve with your favorite dipping sides!
pred:
1. Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
2. Season the flank steak with salt and pepper.
3. Cut the flank steak into thin strips, and place them on a plate.
4. In a small bowl, mix the Worcestershire sauce, lime juice, garlic, and onion.
5. Pour the sauce mixture over the steak strips, and let them marinate for 15-20 minutes.
6. While the steak is marinating, heat the cooking oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
7. Add the sliced onion and bell peppers to the skillet, and cook until they are tender and slightly browned.
8. Add the marinated steak strips to the skillet, and cook until they are cooked through and slightly charred.
9. Place the cooked steak and vegetables on a plate.
10. Place the tortillas on a clean work surface.
11. Spread a thin layer of grated Monterey Jack cheese on each tortilla.
12. Place the cooked steak and vegetables on top of the cheese on each tortilla.
13. Fold the tortilla over the filling, creating a half-moon shape.
14. Place the filled tortillas on a baking sheet, and cook in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
15. Serve the Grilled Steak Fajita Quesadillas immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 180dg Celsius Lightly grease and line 2 baking trays.
Using a mixer, beat butter, sugar and vanilla until pale and creamy.
Add egg and mix well.
Stir in flour and add sultanas and cornflakes.
Drop tablespoons of the mixture onto the trays, allowing room for spreading.
Bake for 15 to 18 minutes, swapping the trays after 10 minutes, or until the cookies are a light golden colour.
Stand for 10 minutes on the trays.
Transfer to wire rack until cooled completely.
Stand wire rack over a sheet of baking paper.
Dip one side of each cookie into melted chocolate.
Place cookies back onto rack (chocolate side up) and set aside for 30 minutes to set.
Drizzle white chocolate over the cookies, and allow them to set before serving.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the softened butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the egg and vanilla essence, and mix well.
4. Sift the self-raising flour and baking powder together, then add to the wet ingredients and mix until a smooth dough forms.
5. Fold in the sultanas and cornflakes.
6. Chop the melted milk chocolate and white chocolate chips into small pieces.
7. Gently mix the chocolate chips into the dough.
8. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
9. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
10. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Chocolate Cornflake Cookies!

gt:
Cream oleo and sugar together.
Add vanilla and water.
Add flour to mixture, a little at a time.
Mix in pecans.
Roll into small balls (coat hands with flour if necessary).
Bake for approximately 20 minutes at 350F, turning to brown other side after 10 minutes.
Sift 1/2 box XXX sugar in bowl.
Coat Sandies as soon as they are removed from the oven.
Line can with wax paper and sprinkle with XXX sugar.
Separate layers with wax paper.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the oleo or butter and confectioners' sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the vanilla extract and water, and mix until well combined.
4. Gradually add the sifted flour, mixing until the dough comes together.
5. Fold in the coarsely chopped pecans.
6. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm).
7. Cut out the dough into desired shapes using cookie cutters or a sharp knife.
8. Place the cookies on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are lightly golden.
10. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Sandies!

gt:
In a cocktail mixer full of ice, combine Chartreuse and rum.
Shake vigorously and strain into 2 shot glasses.
pred:
1. Start by preparing the ingredients:
- In a shaker, combine the green Chartreuse and 151 proof rum.
- Add ice to the shaker to chill the mixture.
- Shake the ingredients vigorously for about 15-20 seconds.

2. Once the ingredients are well-mixed, strain the mixture into a glass filled with ice.

3. Garnish the drink with a green gecko (a slice of lime) and serve immediately.

4. Enjoy your Green Gecko cocktail!

gt:
Sift flour, measure, and sift with baking powder, salt, and sugar.
Rub in butter with tips of fingers or cut in with 2 spatulas.
Add eggs and sufficient water to make a soft dough.
Turn onto lightly floured board and pat into sheet 1 inch thick.
Cut into rounds or squares.
Fold over double and brush with milk.
Place on slightly oiled baking sheet.
Dust with sugar and bake in hot oven (450 F) about 15 minutes.
pred:
To make delicious Breakfast Scones, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt.
3. Cut in the cold butter or margarine using a pastry blender or your fingers until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
4. Add the cold water and mix until a soft dough forms.
5. Turn the dough onto a floured surface and knead gently until smooth and elastic.
6. Pat the dough into a 1-inch thick circle, and use a round cookie cutter to cut out scones.
7. Place the scones on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake the scones for 12-15 minutes, or until golden brown.
9. Remove the scones from the oven and let them cool on a wire rack for a few minutes before serving.

Ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 2 large eggs, well beaten
- 3 teaspoons baking powder
- 2 tablespoons sugar
