- 1 teaspoon salt
- 2 tablespoons butter or margarine
- 1 cup cold water

These ingredients will help you create delicious, fluffy, and buttery scones that are perfect for a breakfast or brunch meal.

gt:
Place water, salt, carrots, 1/2 of the bell pepper, celery, beet, tomatoes, and quartered potatoes in a large stock pot over high heat.
Bring to a boil.
Melt 1/3 cup butter in a separate skillet over medium heat.
Saute onions in butter until tender, approximately 5 minutes.
Stir in tomatoes, reduce heat to medium low, and simmer for 15 minutes.
Remove 1/2 cup of sauce from skillet, and set aside.
Stir half of the cabbage into the skillet with remaining sauce, and continue simmering 5 minutes more, or until tender.
Remove beet from boiling liquid and discard.
Remove potatoes with a slotted spoon or tongs, and place in a bowl with remaining 1 tablespoon of butter and the cream.
Mash together until smooth.
Return the 1/2 cup of reserved onion-tomato sauce to the stock pot.
Stir in diced potatoes, and simmer until just tender but still firm, approximately 5 minutes.
Increase heat to a low boil, and stir in remaining cabbage, tomato sauce, and mashed potatoes.
Reduce heat and simmer a few minutes more.
Stir in remaining bell pepper, season with black pepper, and serve.
pred:
To make delicious Borscht I, follow these steps:

1. In a large pot, combine 6 cups of water, 3/4 tablespoon of salt, and the chopped carrots, green bell pepper, and celery. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for about 20 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.

2. Add the chopped beet, canned peeled and diced tomatoes, potatoes, butter, onion, and canned tomatoes to the pot. Stir to combine, and continue to cook for another 15-20 minutes or until the vegetables are tender and the potatoes are cooked through.

3. While the soup is cooking, prepare the cabbage by finely shredding it.

4. In a small bowl, mix the heavy cream, diced potatoes, dried dill weed, and 1/4 teaspoon of ground black pepper.

5. Once the soup is cooked, add the cream mixture to the pot and stir to combine. Cook for an additional 5-10 minutes or until the soup reaches your desired consistency.

6. Season the soup with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.

7. Serve the Borscht I hot, garnished with a dollop of sour cream, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Borscht I!

gt:
Roll out the pizza dough onto a pan.
Set aside.
In a food processor, combine basil, garlic, parmesan, pine nuts, and a little salt and pepper.
Blend together, and add oil slowly just until the mixture combines.
Spread the pesto onto the pizza dough.
Top with the cubed mozzarella and sun-dried tomatoes.
Brush the edges of the crust with olive oil.
Bake at 400 degrees for 10 to 15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is bubbly.
Remove from the oven and try to stop yourself from eating it all in one sitting.
pred:
[/SYS]

1. Preheat your oven to 475°F (245°C).
2. Roll out the pizza dough on a lightly floured surface to your desired thickness.
3. Spread a thin layer of olive oil on the dough, leaving a small border around the edges.
4. Add the fresh basil, garlic cloves, grated Parmesan, and pine nuts evenly across the dough.
5. Add the sun-dried tomatoes, cubed fresh mozzarella, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
6. Fold the edges of the dough over the toppings, creating a crust.
7. Place the pizza on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

Enjoy your delicious Pesto Pizza with Sun-dried Tomatoes!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
On a cutting board use a meat pounder to pound chicken breasts to a medium thickness.
In a small bowl beat the two eggs.
on a small plate place some bread crumbs.
On top of each chicken breast put a slice of cheese, a slice of ham, and a teaspoon of the dijon mustard on each chicken breast.
Roll the chicken in the egg mixture and then roll it in bread crumbs.
Place a toothpick in the center to hold it together.
Place rolled chicken breasts in a baking dish and bake covered with aluminum foil for 20 minutes.
Take of the aluminum foil and continue to bake for another 10-15 minutes or until the chicken is done.
This can be served with rice or noodles.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Season the chicken breasts with salt, pepper, and paprika.
3. In a small bowl, mix the Dijon mustard, 1 teaspoon of salt, and 1/2 teaspoon of pepper.
4. In another small bowl, mix the breadcrumbs with 1 egg and 1/2 teaspoon of salt.
5. Dip each chicken breast into the beaten eggs, then coat them with the breadcrumb mixture.
6. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add a small amount of oil and cook the chicken breasts until they are golden brown on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side.
7. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
8. In the same skillet, add the remaining oil and cook the sliced ham until it is browned and cooked through.
9. Add the Dijon mustard mixture to the skillet and stir to combine.
10. Return the chicken breasts to the skillet and cook for a few minutes until the cheese is melted and the sauce is bubbly.
11. Remove the chicken from the skillet and place it on a baking sheet.
12. Bake the chicken in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly, and the chicken is cooked through.
13. Serve the Chicken Cordon Bleu hot, garnished with chopped parsley if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Combine the Better Than Bouillon chicken base/paste and 2 cups of water in a small pot.
Bring to a boil and then remove from heat and set aside.
In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium high heat.
Add the onion, garlic and red pepper flakes and saute for 5 minutes.
Add the roasted red bell pepper and chopped heirloom tomatoes.
Stir to combine and let cook for about 5 more minutes.
Add the bouillon liquid to the tomato mixture and turn the heat to medium.
Continue to cook for 15 minutes.
Using a blender, or immersion blender, puree the mixture until smooth and then transfer back into the pot.
Stir in the goat cheese and season with salt and pepper.
Let cool.
In a another bowl, combine the lump crab meat with chives, a squeeze of lemon juice and salt and pepper to taste.
Once the soup is at room temperature, pour individual servings into bowls and top with a handful of the crab.
(Note you can also serve this soup warm, but as its summer, I prefer it to be room temperature).
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Cut the roasted red bell pepper into small pieces and set aside.
3. In a large pot or saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
4. Add the onion and garlic to the pot and cook until the onion is softened.
5. Add the red pepper flakes, roasted red bell pepper, and chopped chives to the pot.
6. Pour in the bouillon paste and water, stirring to combine.
7. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 15 minutes.
8. Add the roasted heirloom tomatoes, canned or pre-cooked crab meat, and goat cheese to the pot.
9. Simmer for an additional 10 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.
10. Remove the pot from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
11. Stir in the lemon juice and season with salt and pepper to taste.
12. Serve the Roasted Red Pepper and Tomato Soup hot, garnished with a drizzle of olive oil and a sprinkle of chives.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Place sliced bananas in a medium bowl and cover with pineapple juice.
Toss gently until slices are coated.
Let soak for 30 minutes, then drain.
Place bananas in pie shell.
In a small bowl mix sugar and cinnamon.
Sift over top of bananas.
Dot with slices of butter or margarine.
Put on top crust and seal, slashing 2 to 3 vents near center.
Bake in preheated oven until crust is golden brown, about 30 minutes.
Pie can be served hot or cold.
pred:
[/INST]

[INST] <<SYS>>
To create a delicious Royal Hawaiian Pie, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the sliced bananas, pineapple juice, white sugar, and ground cinnamon. Mix well.
3. Add the butter to the mixture and stir until well combined.
4. Roll out the pie shells on a floured surface to fit the pie pans.
5. Place the pie shells in the pie pans, and pour the banana mixture into the shells.
6. Bake the pie for 45-50 minutes, or until the filling is bubbly and the crust is golden brown.
7. Allow the pie to cool completely before serving.

Enjoy your Royal Hawaiian Pie!
<</SYS>>

[/INST]

gt:
Stir boiling water into gelatin in medium bowl at least 2 minutes until completely dissolved.
Stir in cold water.
Refrigerate 1 hour 15 minutes or until slightly thickened (consistency of unbeaten egg whites).
Gently stir in whipped topping.
Pour into 4-cup mold or individual molds sprayed with cooking spray.
Refrigerate 4 hours or until firm.
Unmold dessert onto serving plate.
Garnish with 1/4 cup each additional whipped topping and fresh raspberries, if desired.
Store leftover dessert in refrigerator.
pred:
1. In a small saucepan, bring the boiling water to a boil.
2. Add the JELL-O gelatin to the boiling water, stirring until the gelatin is fully dissolved.
3. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
4. Add the cold water to the saucepan, stirring until the gelatin mixture is smooth and well-combined.
5. Stir in the thawed COOL WHIP Whipped Topping.
6. Pour the mixture into a serving dish or individual bowls.
7. Refrigerate the dish for at least 2 hours or until the gelatin has set.
8. Serve the Basic Bavarian dish chilled or at room temperature.

This dish is a simple yet delicious dessert that can be enjoyed by people of all ages. The combination of the gelatin, cold water, and COOL WHIP Whipped Topping creates a creamy, smooth texture that is both refreshing and satisfying. The versatility of this dish allows for various flavors and toppings to be added, making it a versatile option for any occasion.

gt:
In the bowl of a stand mixer, combine flour, chai tea leaves, baking powder and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk together buttermilk, eggs, canola oil, brown sugar (if using) and vanilla extract.
Turn mixer on medium speed and slowly pour wet ingredients into the dry and allow to whisk until batter is smooth.
Heat a saute pan or cast iron skillet to medium-high heat and coat with cooking spray.
Pour about 1/4 cup batter into the pan.
Cook until bubbles start to form on the top; flip and cook another 3060 seconds, until bottom has browned.
Stack pancakes and top with vanilla yogurt and walnuts.
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 1-1/2 cup whole wheat pastry flour, 4 teaspoons chai tea leaves, 2 teaspoons baking powder, 1/4 teaspoon coarse salt, and 1-1/4 cup low-fat buttermilk. Whisk the ingredients together until smooth and free of lumps.

2. In a separate bowl, whisk the 2 whole large eggs until they are well-beaten. Add the 2 tablespoons canola oil and whisk until the mixture is smooth and well-combined.

3. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients and stir until the batter is smooth and well-combined.

4. If desired, add 2 tablespoons of brown sugar to the batter for added sweetness.

5. Stir in the 1/2 tablespoon vanilla extract and 1/2 cup vanilla yogurt.

6. Fold in the chopped walnuts.

7. Preheat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat.

8. Pour the batter onto the preheated pan or griddle, using a 1/4 cup measuring cup to ensure even distribution.

9. Cook the pancakes for about 2-3 minutes on each side, or until they are golden brown and cooked through.

10. Serve the Chai Walnut Pancakes warm, with a drizzle of syrup and a sprinkle of additional chopped walnuts, if desired.

[/INST]

These Chai Walnut Pancakes are a delicious and flavorful breakfast option, perfect for a cozy morning at home. The combination of the chai tea leaves, vanilla yogurt, and walnuts adds a unique and satisfying twist to the classic pancake recipe. The warm, golden-brown pancakes are sure to delight your taste buds and provide a satisfying start to your day.

gt:
In a large bowl, combine the oil, vinegar, soy sauce, mustard powder, garlic powder, black pepper and thyme.
Chop the asparagus diagonally into 2-3 cm pieces and add to bowl.
Slice the corn from the cob and place into the bowl (can be fresh or cooked, or substitute thawed frozen corn if you can't get it on the cob).
Dice the bell peppers and add to bowl.
Ensure the chickpeas are well drained then add to the bowl.
Gently combine all ingredients and serve.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the cooked asparagus with the corn kernels, chickpeas, red bell pepper, and orange bell pepper.
3. In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, rice wine vinegar, light soy sauce, mustard powder, garlic powder, black pepper, and thyme.
4. Pour the dressing over the vegetables and toss to coat evenly.
5. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. Transfer the salad to a serving dish and serve immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat the oven to 350.
Brush the cut sides of the squash with 1 teaspoon of the olive oil and season the cavities with salt and pepper.
Place the squash cut side down on a baking sheet and roast for about 45 minutes, until tender.
Meanwhile, in a saucepan, bring 2 cups of lightly salted water to a boil.
Add the quinoa, cover and simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in the raisins and simmer, covered, until the water is absorbed, about 5 minutes.
Transfer the quinoa to a large bowl and let cool.
In a small bowl, whisk the vinegar and honey with the remaining 1 tablespoon plus 2 teaspoons of olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Add the dressing to the quinoa along with the apple, shallot, garlic, mint and parsley and toss well.
Add the arugula and toss gently.
Set the squash halves on plates.
Fill with the salad and serve.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the quinoa with the golden raisins, sherry vinegar, and honey.
3. In a separate bowl, toss the diced Granny Smith apple with the minced shallot, garlic, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
4. In a large skillet, heat the extra-virgin olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced mint and parsley, and cook for about 1 minute, until fragrant.
5. Add the diced Granny Smith apple mixture to the skillet, and cook for about 3 minutes, until the apples are tender.
6. Add the cooked quinoa mixture to the skillet, and toss everything together until well combined.
7. Season the roasted Delicata squash with salt and pepper, and place them in a single layer on a baking sheet. Drizzle the squash with a little extra-virgin olive oil, and roast in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until tender and slightly caramelized.
8. Serve the roasted Delicata squash with the quinoa salad mixture on top.

[/INST]

gt:
Cook pasta in a large pot of boiling, salted water until al dente.
In a large bowl, mix together cooked spaghetti, chopped chicken, cream of mushroom soup, canned mushrooms, onion, and vegetables.
Mix in tomatoes with chilies, if desired.
Pour mixture into a greased 2 quart casserole dish.
Place cubed processed cheese food on top of dish.
Bake in a preheated 350 degree F (175 degrees C) for 30 minutes, or until cheese is bubbly and melted.
pred:
1. Cook spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente.
2. While the spaghetti is cooking, heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the chopped chicken breast halves and cook until browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, add the sliced mushrooms and cook until they are tender, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the onion to the skillet and cook until it is softened, about 3-5 minutes.
5. Add the cooked spaghetti to the skillet and stir to combine.
6. Pour the condensed cream of mushroom soup over the spaghetti and stir to combine.
7. Add the cooked chicken, cauliflower, and carrots to the skillet. Stir to combine.
8. If desired, add the diced tomatoes with green chile peppers.
9. Stir in the cubed processed cheese food.
10. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
11. Serve the Chicken and Spaghetti hot.

[/INST]

gt:
Heat vegetable oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat.
Saute onion, garlic, and ginger in hot oil until the onion begins to turn translucent, 5 to 7 minutes.
Stir salt, cinnamon, cloves, cumin, cayenne pepper, and celery seed into the onion mixture; continue to cook, stirring frequently, until the onion is completely softened, 2 to 3 minutes more.
Stir blueberries and brown sugar into the onion mixture.
Mash the berries as they cook until completely softened, about 10 minutes.
Blend the blueberry mixture with an immersion blender until the mixture is thick with no large chunks.
Stir balsamic vinegar into blueberry mixture, reduce heat to low, and cook at a simmer until thickened to your liking, 10 to 15 minutes more.
pred:
1. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
2. Add the diced onion and minced garlic to the skillet, and cook until the onion is softened and translucent.
3. Add the grated ginger root and cook for another minute, until fragrant.
4. Add the salt, cinnamon, cloves, cumin, cayenne pepper, and celery seed to the skillet, stirring to combine.
5. Cook for another minute, until the spices are fragrant and well combined.
6. Add the blueberries to the skillet, and cook until they begin to release their juices and soften.
7. In a small bowl, whisk together the packed brown sugar and balsamic vinegar.
8. Pour the sugar-vinegar mixture over the blueberries in the skillet, and stir to combine.
9. Cook for a few more minutes, until the sauce has thickened slightly and the blueberries are coated with the sauce.
10. Remove the skillet from the heat, and let the Blueberry Ketchup cool for a few minutes.
11. Serve the Blueberry Ketchup over grilled meats, chicken, or fish, or use it as a topping for oatmeal, pancakes, or waffles.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 375.
Melt butter and saute onion and garlic.
Set aside.
Combine corns, salt and egg.
Beat in muffin mix.
Fold in butter mixture.
Pour into greased casserole dish.
Combine chicken, chiles, sour cream, salt and pepper.
Spread over corn mix, leaving 1/2 inch border around edges.
Sprinkle with cheese.
Bake for 35 minutes.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the butter, onion, garlic, salt, and pepper. Mix until the onion is tender.
3. Add the corn, creamed corn, sour cream, green chilies, and egg to the bowl. Mix until well combined.
4. Add the corn muffin mix, cooked chicken, and shredded monterey jack cheese to the bowl. Mix until everything is well combined.
5. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
6. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the center is set.
7. Remove the casserole from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

This Chicken Souiza Cornbread Casserole is a delicious and hearty dish that combines the flavors of corn, chicken, and cheese. The creamy and slightly spicy green chilies add depth and richness to the dish, while the corn muffin mix provides a crispy texture and a hint of sweetness. This casserole is perfect for a comforting meal or a crowd-pleasing dish for gatherings.

gt:
Heat oil in small saucepan over medium heat.
Add kumquats and onion, and saute 5 minutes, or until onion is softened.
Stir in sugar and 1/2 cup water, reduce heat to medium low, and simmer 5 to 7 minutes more.
Remove from heat, and stir in vinegar.
Cool, and store in airtight container in refrigerator.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a small saucepan, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
3. Add the sliced kumquats and cook for about 5 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the diced red onion, sugar, and white wine vinegar or cider vinegar.
5. Add the mixture to the saucepan with the kumquats and cook for another 5 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.
6. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Transfer the mixture to a blender or food processor and blend until smooth.
8. Pour the chutney into a small serving dish and refrigerate until chilled.
9. Serve the Kumquat Chutney as a side dish or a topping for various dishes, such as pancakes, waffles, or ice cream.

Enjoy your delicious Kumquat Chutney dish!

gt:
Cover 4 plates with spinach.
Top with remaining ingredients.
Serve immediately.
pred:
1. First, gather the necessary ingredients: baby spinach leaves, fresh blueberries, raspberries, halved strawberries, peaches, coarsely chopped green grapes, toasted pecan halves, and Kraft Berry Balsamic Dressing.

2. Wash and dry the spinach leaves thoroughly.

3. Cut the peaches into halves and remove the seeds.

4. Rinse the blueberries, raspberries, and strawberries under cold water.

5. In a large bowl, combine the baby spinach leaves, peaches, blueberries, raspberries, and strawberries.

6. Toast the pecan halves in a dry skillet over medium heat until they become fragrant and slightly browned.

7. In a small bowl, mix the Kraft Berry Balsamic Dressing.

8. Add the toasted pecan halves to the fruit mixture, and toss everything together gently.

9. Serve the Fruit & Nut Fusion Salad immediately, or refrigerate it for a few hours before serving.

[/INST]

gt:
In a crockpot, add the chicken and the rest of the ingredients.
Stir until combined.
Cook on low for 8 9 hours or on high for 4 6 hours.
About 1 hour before it is done, shred the chicken by taking two forks and pulling the chicken apart.
Serve with optional toppings, such as cheese, Greek yogurt, avocado, diced tomatoes, tortilla chips, etc.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet or oven-safe pot, heat a drizzle of oil over medium heat. Add the chicken breasts and cook until they are cooked through, about 10-12 minutes. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet or pot, add another drizzle of oil and cook the diced onion and bell pepper until they are softened, about 5-7 minutes.
4. Add the corn, black beans, green chilies, and minced garlic to the skillet or pot. Cook for an additional 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. Add the cooked chicken back to the skillet or pot, along with the canned tomatoes, tomato sauce, chili powder, cumin, ancho chili powder, smoked paprika, and a splash of water. Stir to combine.
6. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then cover and transfer it to the preheated oven. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce is thickened.
7. Serve the Southwestern Chicken Chili hot, garnished with fresh cilantro and sour cream, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Southwestern Chicken Chili!

gt:
In a frying pan, combine all of the ingredients except the fish.
Bring to a boil, then add the fish of your choice.
When it comes to a boil, cover with a small lid that fits right on top of the fish (a drop lid or otoshi-buta) and simmer for 7-9 minutes and it's ready.
The heat is about this strong.
It's almost on high heat.
Go as high as you can without making it boil over.
As shown on the photo, make a hole in the center of an aluminum foil to release the steam and simmer.
Do not touch the fish.
After about 8 minutes, the sauce has boiled down to 1/3 and it's ready!
It's very quick!
Make sure you don't simmer for too long!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a medium-sized pot, combine the sugar, sake, mirin, and soy sauce.
3. Add the dashi stock powder and stir to dissolve the ingredients.
4. Place the fillets of fish in the pot and cover the pot with a lid.
5. Cook the fish on medium heat for 10 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
6. Remove the fish from the pot and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.
7. Enjoy your delicious, simmered fish!

[/TUTORIAL]

gt:
Start by heating water in a large pot and salt the water.
When the water is boiling, cook the pasta until al dente, around 6 minutes or so.
In the meantime, melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat.
Add the garlic and cook until golden.
Add the lemon zest and 1/4 cup of the cream.
Add salt and pepper.
When the pasta is finished cooking, drain it and add to the saucepan along with the remaining cream.
Toss well, making sure every piece of spaghetti gets covered!
Serve with a little freshly grated Parmigiana and your best Sophia dress!
Buon appetito!
pred:
1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the spaghetti and cook according to the package instructions until al dente.
2. In a large skillet or saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook for about 1 minute, until fragrant.
3. Add the sliced lemon zest and juice to the skillet, stirring to combine.
4. Gradually add the heavy cream, stirring constantly, and bring the mixture to a simmer.
5. Reduce the heat to low and let the sauce simmer for about 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. Season the sauce with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Drain the cooked spaghetti and return it to the pot. Pour the sauce over the spaghetti and toss to combine.
8. Serve the spaghetti al limone immediately, garnished with freshly grated Parmigiana.

[/INST]

gt:
Mix all ingredients lightly with a spoob in a medium sized bowl
Enjoy:)
pred:
1. First, gather all the necessary ingredients: 1 stalk celery thinly chopped, 2 boiled eggs chopped, 1 mango diced, 1/2 tbsp sour cream, 1/2 tbsp mayo, 1 salt & pepper to taste, and 5 leaves of romaine or redleaf lettuce thinly sliced.

2. In a large bowl, combine the chopped celery, boiled eggs, and diced mango.

3. Add the sour cream and mayo to the bowl, and mix well to combine.

4. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.

5. Add the chopped romaine or redleaf lettuce to the bowl and toss gently to combine.

6. Serve the chicken salad immediately or refrigerate it for later use.

Enjoy your delicious homemade chicken salad with diced mangos!

gt:
Cook pasta as directed.
Reserve 1/2 C of pasta water, drain pasta, return to pot.
Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add mushrooms and onion and cook, tossing occasionally, until the mushrooms begin to release their juices, 2-3 minutes.
Add the wine, 1/2 t salt, and 1/4 t pepper and cook until the mushrooms begin to brown, 5-6 minutes and liquid is nearly gone.
Toss the pasta with the brie and reserved water until pasta is coated.
Stir in mushroom mixture and arugula.
Serve while hot.
pred:
1. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions until al dente.
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the sliced onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the mushrooms and cook until they release their liquid and become tender, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
4. Add the wine to the skillet and cook until it has reduced by half.
5. Add the cooked pasta to the skillet and toss to combine with the mushrooms and onions.
6. Remove the skillet from the heat and stir in the brie cheese.
7. In a small bowl, whisk together the hot water and the lemon juice. Pour the mixture over the pasta and toss to combine.
8. Add the baby arugula to the skillet and toss to combine with the pasta.
9. Season the pasta with salt and pepper to taste.
10. Serve the Pasta With Brie, Mushrooms, and Arugula immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Wrap a medium-sized sweet potato in foil and roast at 400 degrees F for 45 to 50 minutes (until the potato feels very soft).
When cool enough to handle, mash the sweet potato flesh with a fork and set aside.
Lower oven temperature to 350 degrees F.
In a bowl, combine the flour, oats, baking powder, baking soda, salt, nutmeg, cinnamon and whisk to combine.
Set aside.
In a mixer, cream the sugars and butter until smooth.
Add the mashed sweet potato, ground ginger, orange zest, and vanilla and mix to combine.
Add the egg and mix just until incorporated
Slowly incorporate the flour mixture into the wet mixture just until the dough forms.
On a parchment-lined or lightly oiled baking sheet, drop spoonfuls of dough.
Bake for 12-14 minutes until the edges are golden brown.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Peel and mash the sweet potato in a large bowl.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, oats, baking soda, baking powder, salt, nutmeg, and cinnamon.
4. Add the mashed sweet potato, brown sugar, granulated sugar, butter, grated ginger, orange zest, vanilla extract, and egg to the flour mixture.
5. Mix until well combined.
6. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
7. Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the edges are lightly golden and the cookies are set.
8. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Heat oven to 350F.
Mix dry cake mix, dressing and 1 egg until blended; spoon into 24 lined muffin cups, adding about 2 Tbsp.
to each prepared cup.
Beat cream cheese in small bowl with mixer until creamy.
Add 1 cup sugar and lemon juice; mix well.
Add remaining eggs, 1 at a time, mixing after each addition just until blended.
Spoon into muffin cups.
Bake 20 to 25 min.
or until centers are almost set and edges are lightly browned.
Cool in pans 10 min.
Remove to wire racks; cool completely.
Refrigerate 3 hours.
Microwave marmalade in small microwaveable bowl on HIGH 10 sec.
or just until warmed.
Add blueberries; stir to evenly coat.
Spoon over cheesecakes; sprinkle with remaining sugar.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Prepare a 9-inch springform pan by greasing it with cooking spray or butter.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the lemon cake mix, 1 egg, and 1/2 cup of the MIRACLE WHIP Dressing. Mix until well combined.
4. Pour the batter into the prepared springform pan.
5. Bake the cake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
6. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for about 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
7. Meanwhile, prepare the filling by combining the softened cream cheese, 1 cup of powdered sugar, and 2 tablespoons of lemon juice in a large mixing bowl. Beat until smooth and creamy.
8. Once the cake is cooled, carefully remove the springform pan and place the cake on a serving plate.
9. Spread the cream cheese filling evenly over the top of the cake.
10. Dust the top of the cake with the remaining 1 tablespoon of powdered sugar.
11. Arrange the fresh blueberries on top of the filling.
12. Refrigerate the cake for at least 2 hours or until chilled and set.

Enjoy your delicious Lemon-Blueberry Cheesecake Minis!

gt:
Put all the minced herbs in a heavy saucepan.
Add the oil.
Bring it to a simmer over medium heat, stirring every now and again.
Simmer for 10 seconds.
Take the pan off the heat, keep stirring for another 30 seconds.
(Yes, seconds.)
Let the herbs now steep in the oil for about an hour, until cool (you didn't think it was going to be that quick a recipe, did you?
).
Strain the oil through a fine sieve into a measuring cup, pressing on the steeped herbs to get out all the oil and all the herby essense.
Divide the herb oil between 4 pretty oil bottles.
Seal tightly.
Keep in the fridge at least 1 day to develop the flavors.
Keep this oil in the fridge.
pred:
1. Wash and dry the fresh herbs thoroughly.
2. In a large bowl, combine the fresh basil, oregano, thyme, and parsley.
3. Gently toss the herbs to ensure they are evenly distributed.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk the olive oil until it is smooth and creamy.
5. Pour the olive oil over the herbs and toss them gently to coat evenly.
6. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
7. After the herbs have marinated, strain the oil through a cheesecloth or a fine-mesh sieve to remove any solids.
8. Discard the solids and return the oil to the bowl.
9. Season the oil with salt and pepper to taste.
10. Store the Mediterranean Herb Oil in a clean, airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

[/INST]

3. Gently toss the herbs to ensure they are evenly distributed.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk the olive oil until it is smooth and creamy.
5. Pour the olive oil over the herbs and toss them gently to coat evenly.
6. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
7. After the herbs have marinated, strain the oil through a cheesec

gt:
Bring a large pot of water to boil.
Add salt, stock cube & little oil to the water.
Cook the noodles & drain it.
Chop all the vegetables, scramble the eggs & shred the chicken.
Heat three tablespoons of oil in a pan.
Add ginger-garlic paste.
When it starts to turn brown, add the vegetables & saute for a few minutes.
Run some hot water through the noodles, drizzle some oil & sprinkle little pepper.
Add chicken, noodles, sauces, pepper, vinegar, sugar & salt into the vegetables.
Stir fry for two minutes.
Mix well.
Add scrambled eggs & toss well.
Garnish with chopped spring onions or celery leaves.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Chicken Hakka Noodles dish, follow these steps:

1. Cook the Hakka Noodles according to the package instructions, usually boiling for a few minutes until they are soft and cooked through.
2. While the noodles are cooking, prepare the chicken by cutting it into bite-sized pieces and cooking it in a pan or wok with a little oil. Season the chicken with salt, pepper, and any other desired seasonings.
3. In a separate pan or wok, cook the onion, cabbage, carrot, green bell pepper, mushroom, and celery until they are tender but still crisp.
4. In a small bowl, mix the ginger-garlic paste, soy sauce, chilli sauce, dark soy sauce, black pepper powder, vinegar, sugar, and chicken stock cube.
5. Once the chicken is cooked, add the mixed sauce to the pan with the vegetables and cook for a few minutes until the sauce has thickened slightly.
6. Add the cooked noodles to the pan with the chicken and vegetables, stirring to combine all the ingredients.
7. Serve the Chicken Hakka Noodles dish hot, garnished with chopped green onions if desired.

This dish is a delicious and satisfying meal that combines the flavors of chicken, vegetables, and noodles, making it a popular choice for those who enjoy a hearty and flavorful dish.

gt:
Mix dressing and barbecue sauce.
Cover each of 2 of the ham slices with second ham slice, with slices slightly overlapping.
Top with 2% Milk Singles and bacon pieces; roll up.
Place on microwavable plate.
Microwave on HIGH 15 seconds or until 2% Milk Singles begins to melt.
Serve as dippers with the dressing mixture.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Spread a thin layer of Miracle Whip Dressing on a piece of wax paper or parchment paper.
3. Place a slice of cheese on the Miracle Whip, followed by a slice of ham.
4. Roll the cheese and ham mixture into a log shape, securing the edges with a toothpick if necessary.
5. Repeat the process with the remaining ingredients, creating a total of 4 roll-ups.
6. Place the roll-ups on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
7. Bake the roll-ups in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Serve the Hot Bacon, Ham & Cheese Roll-Ups with BBQ Dipping Sauce on the side for dipping.

This delicious dish can be enjoyed with friends and family, making it a perfect addition to any gathering or meal.

gt:
Combine sour cream and mayonnaise in small bowl.
Chop bacon and red onion and add to sour cream mixture.
Stir in salt and black pepper, cover and refrigerate.
Preheat oven to 425.
Bake potatoes for 50-60 minutes or until tender.
Remove potatoes from oven and cool completely.
Coarsely chop potatoes into 1/2-inch pieces.
Place in large bowl and fold in sour cream mixture.
Sprinkle sliced green onions and shredded cheddar cheese over the top.
Cover and refrigerate 4-6 hours or overnight.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Wash and peel the potatoes, then cut them into bite-sized pieces.
3. In a large bowl, combine the potatoes, sour cream, mayonnaise, and chopped green onions. Mix well to ensure the potatoes are evenly coated.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the chopped bacon, red onion, salt, and pepper.
5. Add the bacon mixture to the potato mixture, stirring to combine.
6. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake for 45-60 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and the filling is hot and bubbly.
7. Remove the dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Garnish the salad with shredded cheddar cheese, if desired.
9. Serve the Awesome Loaded Baked Potato Salad immediately, and enjoy!

gt:
In large bowl, combine oil, Spices and salt.
Add chicken and potatoes; toss to coat well.
Arrange chicken and potatoes in single layer on foillined baking sheet.
Roast in preheated 425F (220C) oven 30 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink and potatoes are tender, turning potatoes occasionally.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix together the club house paprika, rosemary, minced garlic, coarse black pepper, and salt.
3. Season the chicken thighs with the spice mixture, ensuring they are evenly coated.
4. Heat the olive oil in a large, oven-safe skillet over medium heat. Add the seasoned chicken thighs and cook until browned on both sides, about 5-7 minutes per side.
5. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
6. Add the small red potatoes to the skillet and cook until they are tender and slightly browned, about 15-20 minutes.
7. Return the chicken to the skillet, nestling it among the potatoes. Cook for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the potatoes are tender.
8. Remove the chicken and potatoes from the skillet and place them on a baking sheet.
9. Roast the chicken and potatoes in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the potatoes are golden brown.
10. Remove the chicken and potatoes from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Rosemary Roasted Chicken With Potatoes dish!

gt:
Sprinkle green chilies in a sprayed 9 inch pan.
Add layer of cooked sausage, and a layer of cheddar cheese.
In a large bowl, mix together eggs, milk, and biscuit mix, and mix well.
Pour slowly over chilies, sausage, and cheese.
Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes, or until center is set.
Serve with salsa.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the sausage over medium heat until browned and crumbled. Remove from heat and set aside.
3. In a mixing bowl, combine the green chilies, shredded cheddar cheese, and eggs. Mix well.
4. In a separate mixing bowl, combine the biscuit mix, milk, and hot salsa. Mix until a dough forms.
5. Grease a 9-inch (23cm) springform pan with cooking spray or butter.
6. Spread a layer of the biscuit dough evenly over the bottom of the pan.
7. Pour the sausage mixture over the biscuit dough.
8. Spread the cheese and egg mixture evenly over the sausage.
9. Bake the Quesadilla Pie in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Remove the Quesadilla Pie from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
11. Using a sharp knife, cut the Quesadilla Pie into wedges and serve.

[/INST]

gt:
In a skillet over medium-high heat, add the butter.
As the butter melts and begins to foam, add the Bosc pears.
Cook for 2 to 3 minutes until they begin to soften.
Add the brown sugar and stir to incorporate the sugar mixture, evenly coating the pears.
Stir in the salt, cardamom, and vanilla extract, and continue to stir until the liquid becomes syrupy.
Transfer to a serving bowl and serve over vanilla ice cream garnished with crystallized ginger.
pred:
To create a delightful Sugared Cardamom Pears dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 4 tablespoons of butter, brown sugar, salt, and ground cardamom. Mix until smooth.
3. Add the peeled, cored, and cut pears to the bowl, tossing them to coat them evenly with the butter mixture.
4. Transfer the pears to a baking dish and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
5. Remove the baking dish from the oven and let the pears cool for a few minutes.
6. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, mix the vanilla ice cream and Madagascar vanilla extract until smooth.
7. Once the pears are cool, use a fork to poke a few holes in each pear.
8. Drizzle the melted butter mixture over the pears and serve immediately.
9. For garnish, sprinkle some crystallized ginger on top of the pears.

This Sugared Cardamom Pears dish is not only visually appealing but also delicious, with the sweetness of the brown sugar and the warmth of the cardamom complementing the natural flavors of the pears. The addition of the vanilla ice cream and crystallized ginger provides a delightful contrast of textures and flavors, making this dish a perfect dessert or snack option.

gt:
Note: To make homemade dashi quickly, combine 1 1/2 teaspoons of dashi granules with 3 cups of water.
Transfer dashi to a small soup pot over medium-low heat.
Meanwhile, stir together hot water and miso until miso is dissolved.
Pour watery miso mixture into the pot.
Add cubed tofu.
Bring the pot to a simmer.
To serve, sprinkle sliced green onions and a pinch of katsuobushi on top.
pred:
To make a delicious Simple Miso Soup dish, follow these steps:

1. In a large pot, combine the 3 cups of Dashi Stock and 1/2 cup of hot water. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat.

2. Add the 3 tablespoons of Awase Miso to the pot, stirring constantly to avoid lumps. The Miso will gradually dissolve and become creamy.

3. Once the Miso has fully dissolved, add the 12 ounces of firm tofu, diced. Cook the tofu until it is tender but not mushy.

4. Add the sliced green onion to the pot, stirring to combine with the other ingredients.

5. If desired, add the 2 tablespoons of Katsuobushi to the pot. Katsuobushi is a type of dried, fermented fish that adds a unique umami flavor to the soup.

6. Simmer the soup over low heat for about 10-15 minutes, or until the tofu is tender and the flavors have melded together.

7. Serve the Simple Miso Soup hot, garnished with additional green onion or a drizzle of soy sauce, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Simple Miso Soup dish!

gt:
Combine the ingredients marked and make the sauce.
Peel the boiled shrimps, cut the imitation crab sticks into bite-sized pieces, shred the shiso leaves and dice the tomato and avocado into 1 cm cubes.
Mix everything with the sauce made in Step 1.
When the pasta has boiled to your desired degree of firmness, rinse well under cold running water and drain.
Mix it with the sauce from Step 2.
*Taste it, and add more soy sauce if it's too light for you.
Transfer it to a serving plate and it's done.
Chilled Tomato and Cured Ham Pasta
Chilled Avocado Cream Pasta
pred:
1. Cook the spaghetti according to the package instructions until al dente.
2. In a large bowl, combine the shrimp, imitation crab sticks, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Toss to coat evenly.
3. In a small bowl, mix the olive oil, soy sauce, and wasabi paste.
4. Heat a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add the shrimp and crab mixture, and cook until the shrimp are pink and cooked through, about 2-3 minutes.
5. Add the cooked spaghetti to the skillet, and toss to combine with the shrimp and crab mixture.
6. Add the grated garlic, shiso leaves, and toss to combine.
7. Serve the Chilled Tomato, Avocado, and Shrimp Pasta immediately, or chill it in the refrigerator for a few hours before serving.

[/INST]

This dish is a delicious and refreshing combination of flavors and textures, perfect for a hot summer day. The shrimp and crab provide a satisfying seafood taste, while the avocado adds a creamy, rich texture. The tomato and shiso leaves add a burst of freshness and a hint of citrus, and the soy sauce and wasabi paste provide a savory, umami flavor. The grated garlic adds a touch of warmth and depth to the dish.

gt:
Put all the ingredients in the blender and blend well.
You can serve it in any glass you want.
We garnished it with a piece of parsley leaf and a strawberry.
If you have a better way to make it look pretty, just do it.
pred:
1. First, place the ice cubes in a blender or a large mixing bowl.
2. Add the vanilla ice cream, full cream milk, lemon juice, and Cointreau to the blender or mixing bowl.
3. Blend the mixture until it reaches a smooth consistency.
4. Pour the mixture into a glass and add the Bailey's.
5. Stir the mixture gently to combine all the ingredients.
6. Serve the QBC Snow White Cocktail Drink immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
In a bowl, whisk together peanut butter, broth, red chilies, honey ginger, garlic, and tamari, tasting and adding more of anything you may want more of.
If you like it mild, use less red chiles (1/4 teaspoon) and if you like it hot, add more!
Set aside.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add in onion and cook until onion is fragrant and translucent, 4-5 minutes.
Cut veggies into bite size pieces and add to onions (except spinach).
Cook for 2 more minutes.
Next, add in peanut sauce and reduce temperature to low.
Cover and let cook until veggies are tender, 6-8 minutes.
Cook brown rice noodles according to package directions while veggies are cooking.
Add drained rice noodles to the veggie mixture along with the spinach if using.
Give a good stir until everything is coated.
Serve into 2 bowls and sprinkle with bean sprouts, cilantro, and lime juice.
pred:
To make a delicious Spicy Peanut Sauce Noodle Bowl, follow these steps:

1. In a large saucepan, combine 2 Tablespoons of natural peanut butter, 13 cups of vegetable broth, 1 teaspoon of red chiles, crushed, 1 tablespoon of honey, 1 teaspoon of ginger, minced, 1 clove of garlic, 2 tablespoons of tamari soy sauce, and 1 tablespoon of olive oil.

2. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.

3. While the sauce is cooking, prepare the noodles according to the package instructions.

4. In a large bowl, combine the cooked noodles, diced onion, cauliflower, broccoli, carrots, and/or spinach, and bean sprouts.

5. Pour the spicy peanut sauce over the noodles and vegetables, and toss everything together until the sauce is evenly distributed and the noodles are coated.

6. Serve the Spicy Peanut Sauce Noodle Bowl immediately, garnished with cilantro and a squeeze of lime juice, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious and healthy Spicy Peanut Sauce Noodle Bowl!

gt:
Combine all ingredients in large bowl, mix all.
Pour into ice cream mixer, according to your individual mixer's instructions.
WITHOUT ice cream maker, stir until dissolved, pour into pan and freeze until firm, then take out and break with masher, next mix until smooth, and lastly put back into freezer until firm.
ENJOY!
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 3 cups of granulated sugar, 1 tbsp of lemon juice, and 1/4 tsp of Morton Coarse Kosher Salt. Whisk the ingredients together until the sugar is fully incorporated and the lemon juice is evenly distributed.

2. Add the 7 cups of heavy whipping cream to the bowl and whisk until the mixture is smooth and well combined.

3. Slowly pour in the 1/2 tsp of vanilla extract, and continue whisking until the vanilla is fully incorporated.

4. If desired, add 3 cups of chocolate chips to the mixture, and continue whisking until the chocolate chips are fully melted and the mixture is smooth.

5. If desired, add 4 drops of food coloring to the mixture, and continue whisking until the desired color is achieved.

6. Optionally, add 1/2 tsp of mint extract to the mixture, and whisk until the mint is fully incorporated.

7. Once the desired consistency and color are achieved, the Mint Chocolate Chip mixer is ready to be served or used in various recipes.

[/INST]

gt:
Dissolve yeast in warm water with sugar.
Whisk in eggs.
Add flour and salt to make a batter a little thicker than pancake batter.
Allow to rise in a warm spot until double in bulk.
Heat oil to 375 degrees.
Drop by spoonfuls in hot oil.
Keep them rolling around until browned.
Drain and serve with powdered sugar or maple syrup.
pred:
To make Armenian Zeppole (Bishi), follow these steps:

1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the yeast, warm water, sugar, and eggs. Mix well.
2. Gradually add the flour, stirring until a smooth dough forms.
3. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic.
4. Cover the dough with a damp cloth and let it rise in a warm, draft-free place for about 1-2 hours, or until it has doubled in size.
5. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
6. Punch down the dough and transfer it to a lightly floured surface.
7. Roll out the dough into a large, round shape, about 1/2-inch thick.
8. Cut the dough into 8 equal pieces.
9. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
10. Carefully place the dough pieces into the hot oil, being careful not to overcrowd the pan. Cook for about 2-3 minutes on each side, or until they are golden brown.
11. Remove the cooked zeppole from the oil and place them on a wire rack to drain.
12. While the zeppole are cooling, prepare the icing by mixing the powdered sugar, water, and vanilla extract in a small bowl.
13. Once the zeppole are cool, drizzle the icing over them.

Enjoy your delicious Armenian Zeppole (Bishi)!

gt:
Combine 1 cup of club soda, sugar, cherry powder and the cherry juice in a blender until completely mixed.
Add the crushed ice and process until blended smooth.
Pour cherry mixture into a pitcher and add the remaining club soda.
Stir just to mix then pour into glasses.
pred:
[/INST]

[INST] <<SYS>>
To create a delicious 7-11 Cherry Slurpee dish, follow these steps:
1. In a large bowl, mix 2 cups club soda, 12 teaspoon kool-aid cherry powdered drink mix, and 12 teaspoon maraschino cherry juice.
2. Add 2 cups crushed ice to the mixture, stirring gently to combine all ingredients.
3. Pour the mixture into a tall glass, filling it to the top.
4. Garnish the drink with a maraschino cherry on a stick, if desired.
5. Enjoy your homemade 7-11 Cherry Slurpee!

gt:
Preheat oven to 425 F. Wash the chestnuts and, with a sharp knife, make an X cut on each one of them (that will make it easy to cook and prevents the chestnuts from exploding in the oven).
Spread them evenly in a baking sheet with the cut side facing up and sprinkle salt on them.
Place in the oven in the middle rack and roast for about 35 minutes, shaking the pan once in a while to rotate them so they cook evenly.
Peel the chestnuts as soon as possible (but watch your fingers!)
because after cooling down completely they are difficult to peel.
Plus, they taste better warm.
Pair them with your favorite red wine.
Enjoy!
pred:
To create a delicious Roasted Chestnut dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Wash the chestnuts thoroughly and remove any stems or debris.
3. Place the chestnuts in a large bowl and toss them with a pinch of salt to help them absorb the flavors.
4. Spread the chestnuts out on a baking sheet or roasting pan, ensuring they are not overcrowded.
5. Roast the chestnuts in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are golden brown and slightly crispy on the outside.
6. Remove the chestnuts from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
7. Once cooled, use a nutcracker or a sharp knife to crack the chestnuts open.
8. Serve the Roasted Chestnuts as a delicious side dish, snack, or dessert.

Enjoy your homemade Roasted Chestnut dish!

gt:
Mix all ingredients with a fork.
Yields 4 cups.
pred:
To make a delicious Buffalo Chicken Spread dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the chopped Buffalo Chicken Bites, whipped cream cheese, blue cheese crumbles, and mayonnaise. Mix well to ensure the ingredients are evenly distributed.
3. Add salt to taste, as desired.
4. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
5. Remove the baking dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
6. Serve the Buffalo Chicken Spread immediately, or let it cool completely before storing in the refrigerator.

This dish is a delicious and creative way to enjoy Buffalo Chicken Bites, whipped cream cheese, blue cheese crumbles, and mayonnaise, all combined in a spread that can be served as a dip, topping, or sandwich filling.

gt:
Remove and discard casings from sausage.
Cook sausage in a large skillet, stirring until sausage crumbles and is no longer pink; drain.
Add green onions and next 3 ingredients to skillet.
Saute 4 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
Stir in roasted bell peppers.
Drain and cool.
Spread 4 cups of bread cubes in a lightly greased 13- x 9-inch baking dish.
Top with half each of the sausage mixture and cheese.
Repeat with remaining bread, sausage, and cheese.
Whisk together eggs and milk.
Pour egg mixture over bread.
Cover and chill 8 hours.
Bake, covered, at 325 for 1 hour or until bubbly and hot.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet or oven-safe pan, cook the sausage over medium heat until browned, breaking it up into bite-sized pieces as it cooks.
3. Add the green onions and cook until they are softened, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the zucchini, salt, and pepper, and cook until the zucchini is tender, about 5 minutes.
5. Stir in the roasted red peppers and cook for another 2 minutes.
6. In a large mixing bowl, combine the bread, cheese, and eggs.
7. Pour the milk over the bread mixture and stir until the bread is soaked.
8. Pour the sausage and vegetable mixture into the bread mixture, stirring to combine.
9. Transfer the mixture to a 9x13 inch baking dish and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the casserole is set and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Allow the casserole to cool for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

You are a helpful language and vision assistant. You are able to understand the visual content that the user provides, and assist the user with a variety of tasks using natural language.
