To prepare a delicious Deli-Style Smoked Turkey Panini, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Spread a thin layer of Miracle Whip Dressing on one side of each slice of bread.
3. Place the bread slices with the Miracle Whip side facing up on a baking sheet.
4. Top each slice of bread with a slice of smoked turkey breast, a slice of tomato, and a sprinkle of Grey Poupon Dijon Mustard.
5. Place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and the turkey is cooked through.
6. Remove the panini from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before cutting it into 8 equal pieces.

The essential ingredients for this delicious Deli-Style Smoked Turkey Panini include 8 slices Italian bread, 1/4 lb. (4 oz.) VELVEETA, cut into 8 slices, 20 slices OSCAR MAYER Deli Fresh Smoked Turkey Breast, 1 tomato, cut into 4 slices, and Grey Poupon Dijon Mustard. These ingredients, combined with the proper cooking technique, will result in a delicious and satisfying sandwich.

gt:
Cut cauliflower heads into florets.
Fill a large saucepan 3/4 full with water, salt the water lightly and bring water to a boil.
Add 1/2 of the cauliflower florets to the boiling water; boil until tender.
Drain well.
Melt butter in a 4 quart soup pot over a medium-low heat.
Saute the onion and garlic in the butter until the onion is tender.
Pour in the vegetable stock and unboiled cauliflower florets.
Mix in nutmeg and bring the mixture to a boil; boil until cauliflower is tender.
Remove pot from heat to cool.
Use an electric blender to blend the soup-onion-cauliflower mixture until smooth (blend the mixture 2 cups at a time).
Place the blended soup back in the 4 quart soup pot and heat over a medium-low heat.
Pour milk into the pot and stir well.
When the mixture is simmering, mix in the cooked florets and 1 1/2 cup of cheese.
Stir until cheese melts and the soup has thickened.
Serve hot, season with sprinkles of cheese and black pepper to taste.
.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large pot, cook the onion and garlic in the butter over medium heat until the onion is softened.
3. Add the cauliflower and cook for a few minutes until it starts to soften.
4. Pour in the vegetable broth, bring to a boil, and then reduce the heat to low.
5. Add the nutmeg, milk, and shredded white Cheddar cheese. Stir until the cheese is melted and the soup is heated through.
6. Season with freshly ground black pepper to taste.
7. Serve the Cauliflower and White Cheddar Cheese Soup hot, garnished with a sprinkle of freshly grated black pepper if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
If youre making the pastry, mix the flour and butter in a food process or until mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs.
Add 1-2 tablespoons of water and process for 5 seconds to combine.
Turn out onto lightly floured surface and gather into a smooth ball.
Roll out the pastry on a sheet of baking paper large enough to fit the base and sides of a 23 cm (9 inch) flan tin.
Ease the pastry into the tin, trim the edge and chill for 15 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 190C (375F).
Cover the pastry with a piece of greaseproof paper, fill with uncooked rice or baking beads and bake for 10 minutes.
Remove the paper and weights and bake for another 10 minutes.
Cool slightly.
Thinly slice the potatoes.
Cook in a steamer for 15 minutes, until just tender (I use the microwave).
Drain off any liquid, cover and allow to cool slightly.
Layer the potato in the pastry shell in an overlapping pattern with the onion, gently pushing the layers in to compact them.
(I just make one layer of white potato, one of sweet potato, then a layer of onion).
Finish with a layer of onion.
Combine the cream, eggs, mustard, and seasonings and pour over the tart.
Bake at 190C (375F) for 35 minutes or until golden.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Mixed Potato Tart, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, butter, and a pinch of salt. Rub the butter into the flour until it resembles coarse breadcrumbs.
3. Add the sweet potatoes, peeled potatoes, and onion to the bowl. Mix well to combine.
4. Gradually add the cream and eggs, mixing until the dough comes together.
5. Season the dough with salt, pepper, and any desired seasoning.
6. Press the dough evenly into a round, flat, and slightly thick disk.
7. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Place the dough on the prepared baking sheet.
9. Bake the tart for 30-35 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is set.
10. Remove the tart from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing it into wedges and serving.

Enjoy your delicious Mixed Potato Tart!

gt:

To make it easier for you and your guests using a cracker, crack the crab legs before serving.
You can serve warm or cold.
Reserve in the fridge until ready to use.
Once ready to serve, heat the butter in the microwave in 30 second intervals, mixing with a spoon every 30 seconds until hot enough to serve or heat on the hob on low heat constantly stirring.
Add a dash of piri-piri/hot sauce to the butter just to give it a bit of a kick and stir.
Use the butter to dip the de-shelled crab claws.
Yum

gt:
Mix together the flour, oat bran, baking powder and cinnamon in a large bowl.

In another bowl beat together the egg, milk/soymilk, butter/oil, vanilla and brown sugar until smooth.
Add the wet ingredients (eg the second bowl) to the dry ingredients (eg the first bowl) and mix gently until completely, but just combined.
Fold in the pecans.

Spoon the batter onto the griddle (in about 1/4 cup increments) and cook until pancake appears to look more solid around the edges and bubbles form in the centers.
Each side should be golden or golden brown.
Serve hot with maple syrup.

dressing.

gt:
Combine the cornmeal, flour, sugar, mustard, baking powder and salt.
Mix well.
Add the soymilk, egg replacer and shortening and mix until very smooth.
Pour this mixture into a tall glass.
Put the dogs on the sticks and dip them into the cornmeal batter to coat evenly.

gt:
Preheat oven to 375.Place first 3 ingredients in a food processor, and process until well blended.
Add butter, and pulse 4 to 5 times or just until combined.
Add the eggs, 1 at a time, pulsing 1 or 2 times after each addition.
Add buttermilk, vanilla, and lemon juice; pulse until blended.Lightly spoon flour into dry measuring cups; level with a knife.
Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl, stirring with a whisk.
Make a well in center of mixture.
Add buttermilk mixture; stir just until moist.
Gently fold in raspberries.
Let batter stand 5 minutes.
Spoon batter into 12 muffin cups coated with cooking spray.
Sprinkle with turbinado sugar.
Bake at 375 for 22 minutes or until muffins spring back when touched lightly in center.
Remove muffins from pans immediately; place on a wire rack.
pred:

2. In a large bowl, combine the 1/2 cup granulated sugar, 1/2 cup packed brown sugar, and 2 1/2 tablespoons almond paste.
3. Add the softened butter and mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the 2 large eggs, 1/2 cup fat-free buttermilk, vanilla extract, fresh lemon juice, and 1 teaspoon of salt.
5. Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, mixing until just combined.
6. Fold in the 1 1/2 cups fresh raspberries.
7. Generously coat a muffin tin with cooking spray or use a non-stick muffin pan.
8. Fill each muffin cup with the batter, dividing it evenly.
9. Bake the muffins for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
10. Allow the muffins to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

These Raspberry-Almond Muffins are a delicious and nutritious treat, perfect for breakfast or a snack. The combination of the sweet raspberries, tangy lemon juice, and the rich almond paste creates a delightful flavor profile that is both satisfying and refreshing. The muffins are easy to prepare and can be enjoyed by everyone, making them a popular choice for gatherings and events.

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees .
Grease and flour two 8x4-inch loaf pans.
Combine flour, baking soda, salt, baking powder, cinnamon and pecans.
Set aside.
Beat eggs lightly in a large mixing bowl.
Add sugar, oil, and vanilla; beat until creamy.
Stir in pineapple and zucchini.
Add dry ingredients, stirring only until dry ingredients are moistened.
Pour batter into the 2 prepared loaf pans.
Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until the top of the loaves test done.
Cool 10 minutes in pans.Turn out onto a cooling rack and allow bread to cool completely.
Yields 2 loaves.
Optional: Sprinkling sugar on top of unbaked bread produces a sweet, crispy crust.
pred:
To prepare a perfect Zucchini Cake (Disguised As Bread), follow these key steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Grease and flour a 9x9 inch (23x23 cm) baking dish.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, salt, baking powder, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, sugar, oil, and vanilla extract.
5. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, stirring until just combined.
6. Fold in the chopped pecans, shredded zucchini, crushed pineapple, and well-drained zucchini.
7. Pour the batter into the prepared baking dish.
8. Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. Allow the cake to cool for a few minutes in the pan, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.

By following these key steps, you will be able to prepare a delicious and moist Zucchini Cake (Disguised As Bread) that your family and friends will enjoy.

gt:
Juice the leftover yuzu after you use their zest for something else.
Remove the seeds, and put into a storage container.
You can use the juice like vinegar.
There are so many uses for this, such as in a dipping sauce for gyoza dumplings, in sweets, or cocktail drinks.
You can also blend with other citrus juices such as lemon or orange.
Put the yuzu juice and sugar in a pot.
Bring to a boil for a second, then turn off the heat.
Then mix with a chopstick until the sugar is dissolved.
The sushi vinegar is done!
Rinse the rice, and cook in a rice cooker with the konbu seaweed and water.
Use a little less water than you usually would for firm rice.
Spread the freshly cooked rice on a large plate, and mix with a rice paddle to evaporate the water.
Sprinkle the sushi vinegar evenly little by little over the rice as you mix.
The sushi rice is done.
We used the rice for hand rolls.
This one has salmon in it.
We fight over the delicious fillings.
This is a negitoro (fatty tuna and green onion).
pred:
1. In a small saucepan, combine the yuzu citrus juice and sugar. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally.
2. Reduce the heat to low and simmer the mixture for about 5 minutes, or until the sugar has dissolved completely.
3. In a large saucepan, combine the uncooked white rice and the yuzu citrus mixture. Cook the rice over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the rice is cooked and the liquid has been absorbed.
4. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the rice rest for a few minutes.
5. Add the small piece of kombu to the rice and stir gently to combine.
6. Serve the cooked rice immediately, or let it cool and refrigerate for later use.

[/SYS]

gt:
Combine dry ingredients.
Make a well in the middle.
In a separate bowl, combine wet ingredients, including the 1/3 cup water.
Put wet mixture in the well of dry ingredients.
Stir just until moistened.
Fold in chips.
Use a light hand; a heavy hand leads to heavy cupcakes.
Use cupcake liners for muffin pans.
Fill about 2/3 full with batter.
Any empty muffin holders should be filled half full with water.
Do not just put under the sink to do this.
Put water in a something with a lip, like a liquid measuring cup, and use that.
(Yes, I learned this the hard way.
).
Bake at 375 degrees for 12 minutes.
Leaving on the liners, remove from pans immediately.
Cool on racks.
Number of muffins really depends on how full you fill your tins.
Sprinkle tops with confection's sugar, if desired.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, cocoa, baking soda, and salt.

4. Fold in the mini chocolate chips.
5. Pour the batter into cupcake liners, filling them about 2/3 full.
6. Bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a cupcake comes out clean.

gt:
Grind the oatmeal and pecan pieces in a food processor until they resemble cornmeal--reasonably fine but with some texture.
Whisk the whole wheat flour, cornstarch, ginger, salt and baking soda together in a medium bowl.
Whisk in the oat/nut mixture.
In another medium bowl, beat the butter with an electric mixer until smooth and light, about 1 minute.
Gradually add the granulated and light brown sugar; continue beating until evenly combined, about 3 minutes more.
Add the vanilla and the egg.
Mix in the dry ingredients to make a textured dough.
Line a 1 1/2-quart loaf pan or 3 mini loaf pans with plastic wrap and pack dough into the bottom half of the pan.
Press to level off the dough.
Lay a piece of plastic wrap on top and refrigerate until completely firm, about 2 hours.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone mats.
Remove dough from the pan and unwrap.
Slice dough in half lengthwise if using a large pan.
Slice each log crosswise into 1/4-inch thick cookies.
Place the cookies about a 1-inch apart on the prepared pans.
Bake until golden brown, 15 to 18 minutes.
Transfer cookies to a rack to cool and crisp.
pred:
To create delicious Ginger Pecan Oatmeal Crisps, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the quick-cooking oatmeal, pecan halves, whole wheat flour, cornstarch, ground ginger, salt, and baking soda. Mix well.
3. In a separate bowl, cream the softened butter and granulated sugar until light and fluffy. Add the light brown sugar and vanilla extract, and continue to mix until well combined.
4. Add the egg to the butter mixture, and mix until well combined.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until a smooth batter forms.
6. Spread the batter evenly onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
7. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the center is set.
8. Remove the crisps from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes. Then, use a spatula to transfer the crisps to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Ginger Pecan Oatmeal Crisps!

gt:
First, make verjus:.
Pull the grapes away from their stems, then press them, extracting as much of the juice as possible.
Filter this juice through muslin, a jelly bag, or use coffee filter paper.
Bottle this and sterilize it, or freeze some in ice cube trays.
Or use it up within the next few days.
Brown the chicken cut in pieces for a good ten minutes.
Add the chopped garlic and cook briefly.
Pour in a large glass of verjus, and some chicken stock made with 1/2 cube 1/2 cup of hot water.
Add the chopped parsley.
Cook over low heat for 20 minutes, partially covered until towards the end, when you take the cover off.
Use more verjus, if you want.
It is a pleasant, fruity taste with a tart, vinegary quality.
Serve with mashed potatoes or Sarlat Potatoes, recipe#209855, fresh green beans, or other summer fare.

gt:
Cut the papaya in half and peel the skin.
Julienne the papaya with a slicer or something similar and soak in water to remove the acerbic taste.
Cut the carrot into the same sized thin strips.
Heat the sesame oil in a frying pan.
Add the papaya and carrot and stir-fry so that they are coated in the oil.
Once they become tender, add the tuna.
Add the ingredients and simmer until the liquid evaporates.
Once the liquid has evaporated, it's done.
pred:
1. Prepare the ingredients: Wash and peel the papaya and carrot, and cut them into bite-sized pieces.
2. Heat a wok or large skillet over medium heat. Add sesame oil and stir-fry the vegetables until they are tender-crisp.
3. Add the canned tuna and cook for a few minutes until it is heated through.
4. In a small bowl, mix the dashi stock, soy sauce, and sake.
5. Pour the sauce mixture over the stir-fried vegetables and tuna in the wok.
6. Stir-fry the ingredients until the sauce is fully incorporated and the vegetables are coated with the sauce.
7. Serve the Papaya Stir-Fry dish immediately, garnished with sesame seeds if desired.

This delicious Papaya Stir-Fry dish combines the natural sweetness of the papaya with the tender-crisp texture of the carrot and the savory flavor of the canned tuna. The dashi stock, soy sauce, and sake create a rich and flavorful sauce that complements the ingredients, making it a satisfying and healthy meal option.

gt:
Make the Macarons Preheat the oven to 325 degrees .
Make the Macarons Pulse the confectioners' sugar and almond flour in a food processor until combined.
Sift the mixture 2 times, discarding any remaining almond chunks.
Make the Macarons In a large mixing bowl or standing mixer, whisk the egg whites on medium until soft peaks form.
Slowly add the granulated sugar (and food coloring if using) and increase speed until stiff peaks form.
Fold the sifted flour and powdered sugar mixture into the whites, until mixture is smooth and shiny.
Make the Macarons Transfer the batter to a pastry bag fitted with a 1/2-inch plain round tip, and pipe 3/4-inch rounds 1 inch apart on a parchment-lined baking sheets.
Tap the bottom of each sheet on the work surface to release any trapped air.
Make the Macarons Let this stand at room temperature for 10 minutes, then bake in oven, one sheet at a time, rotating halfway through, until macarons are cooked through, about 10 minutes.
Let the macarons cool on the sheet for two minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
Meanwhile, Make the Orange Buttercream In a food processor or stand mixer, beat together the butter, confectioners' sugar, orange zest, orange juice and sea salt until smooth and creamy.
Place in a pastry bag fitted with a 1/2-inch plain round tip.
Meanwhile, Make the Orange Buttercream To complete the macarons, pipe one teaspoon of buttercream filling onto one shell and top with another.
Serve immediately, or stack between layers of parchment, wrap in plastic and freeze for up to 3 months.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 300°F (150°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the confectioners' sugar, almond flour, and baking powder.
3. Whisk the egg whites until they form stiff peaks.
4. Gently fold the egg whites into the sugar mixture, ensuring that the mixture is well combined.
5. Add the vanilla extract, orange gel food coloring (if using), orange zest, and orange juice. Mix until well combined.
6. Gradually add the softened butter, mixing until the mixture is smooth and free of lumps.
7. Transfer the batter to a piping bag fitted with a round tip.
8. Pipe the batter onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Bake the macarons for 12-15 minutes, or until they are set and slightly golden.
10. Allow the macarons to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

[INST]<<SYS>>

gt:
Put sugar in gallon size crock, squeeze lemons, save rinds and set aside.
Strain juice into crock.
Heat 4 cups water to boiling water, pour over rinds and strain into crock immediately.
Boil 4 more cups water, steep tea and then strain into crock.
Fill crock with remaining 8 cups of water.
Stir well.
Do not refrigerate until tea has cooled to room temperature.
pred:
To make First Presbyterian Iced Tea, follow these steps:
1. In a large pot, combine 2 cups of sugar and 6 lemons.
2. Squeeze the lemons over the sugar and stir to dissolve the sugar.
3. Add 2 ounces of loose tea leaves to the pot and stir.
4. Pour 16 cups of water into the pot and stir to combine.
5. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for about 10 minutes.
6. Remove the pot from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Strain the tea mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a large bowl.
8. Stir the tea mixture until it is completely cooled.
9. Pour the tea mixture into an ice-cold pitcher or a glass container.
10. Stir the tea mixture again to ensure it is well-chilled.
11. Serve the First Presbyterian Iced Tea immediately, garnished with a slice of lemon if desired.

This recipe will yield a refreshing and delicious iced tea that combines the natural sweetness of the lemons with the aromatic flavor of the loose tea leaves. Enjoy your First Presbyterian Iced Tea!

gt:
Mix all dry ingredients in medium-sized bowl.
Melt butter in microwave.
Dip chicken in butter and then coat in dry mix.
Place on large baking pan sprayed with Pam and bake for 20 minutes at 400 degrees.

6. Place the chicken breasts on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
7. Bake the chicken breasts in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
8. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into thin pieces.
9. Serve the Parmesan Baked Chicken with your favorite side dishes, such as steamed vegetables or a salad. Enjoy your delicious homemade Parmesan Baked Chicken dish!

gt:

In a large bowl, combine cottage cheese, eggs, vegetable oil, soup mix, walnuts, cereal and onion.

gt:
Slice the baguette into 1/2 inch thick rounds.
Discard the crust from the edges.
Warm the milk in a bowl with 2 tablespoons of honey for around 30 seconds on the microwave.
In another bowl, beat 5 eggs and then incorporate into the milk mixture.
Set aside.
In another bowl, mix the sugar with the cinnamon and set aside.
Make a process line with the slices of bread, the bowl of milk mix, one empty plate with a paper towel, the bowl of sugar/cinnamon and a plate to pile the finished rabanadas.
Soak three or four slices of bread in the milk mixture for enough time to get well moist but still hard and easy to handle.
Transfer them to a skillet with hot olive oil and fry them in medium-heat around 2 minutes on each side, until golden brown.
Transfer the slices to the plate with paper towel to drain a little, then coat them with the sugar/cinnamon mixture and finally put them in the last plate.
Repeat the process with the remaining slices of bread.
Then, dive in!

18. Remove the bread pieces from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

gt:

gt:
1.
Heat oven to 450F degrees.
Place the potatoes in a large roasting pan.
Drizzle with 3 Tablespoons of the oil and toss to coat.
Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon of the salt and 1/4 teaspoon of the pepper.
Roast for 20 minutes.
Stir and roast for additional 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, rinse the cod fillets and pat them dry with paper towels.
2.
After the 30 minutes of roasting, move the potatoes to the sides of the pan and place the fillets in the center.
Drizzle with the remaining oil and sprinkle with the remaining salt and pepper.
Redistribute the potatoes around the fillets.
Roast until the fillets are the same color throughout and flake easily, about 10-15 minutes.
Top with the lemon zest, lemon juice and chives (if using).
pred:
To prepare a delicious Roast Cod with Crisp Potatoes dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).

2. In a large bowl, toss the potatoes with 3 tablespoons of olive oil, 1 tablespoon of salt, and 1/2 teaspoon of black pepper. Spread the potatoes out on a baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for 30-40 minutes, or until they are golden brown and crispy.

3. While the potatoes are roasting, season the cod fillets with 1 tablespoon of olive oil, 1/2 teaspoon of salt, and 1/4 teaspoon of black pepper.

4. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat, and add the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Once the skillet is hot, add the cod fillets and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side, or until they are cooked through and flake easily with a fork.

5. Remove the cod fillets from the skillet and set aside.

6. In a small bowl, mix the zest and juice of the lemon with the chopped chives.

7. To assemble the dish, place the cooked potatoes on a serving platter. Slice the cooked cod fillets and arrange them on top of the potatoes. Drizzle the lemon-chive sauce over the cod and potatoes.

8. Serve the Roast Cod with Crisp Potatoes dish immediately, and enjoy the delicious combination of flavors and textures.

gt:
Combine oregano, 1/2 teaspoon salt, paprika, garlic powder and black pepper in a small bowl; mix well.
Place bell peppers and onion in slow cooker.
Add chicken; sprinkle with the oregano mixture.
Cover; cook on LOW 8 hours or on HIGH 4 hours.
Stir in ketchup and remaining 1/2 teaspoon of salt.
If desired, cut chicken and let it sit in the sauce, for a half hour or so before serving, to absorb the flavor.
Serve chicken and vegetables over hot cooked noodles or rice.
pred:
1. Preheat the slow cooker on high.
2. In a large bowl, combine the chicken breasts, oregano, salt, paprika, garlic powder, and black pepper. Mix well to ensure even distribution of the seasonings.
3. Place the chicken mixture in the slow cooker.
4. Add the green bell peppers and onion to the slow cooker.
5. Pour the ketchup over the chicken and vegetables, ensuring that they are evenly coated.
6. Cook the dish on high for 4-6 hours, or until the chicken is cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
7. Remove the chicken from the slow cooker and let it rest for a few minutes before shredding it into bite-sized pieces.
8. Return the shredded chicken to the slow cooker and stir to combine with the vegetables.
9. If desired, serve the dish over egg noodles or rice.
10. Enjoy your delicious Slow Cooker Old World Chicken and Vegetables dish!

gt:
Set oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease a large cookie sheet.
In a large bowl combine the butter with peanut butter, white sugar, brown sugar and vanilla or maple extract until creamy and well combined.
Beat in eggs until completely combined.
In a bowl combine the flour with sifted cocoa powder and baking soda; add/mix into the creamed mixture until combined.
Mix in the chocolate chips and frozen chopped peanut butter cups.
Drop by tablespoonfuls onto baking sheet.
Bake for 8-10 minutes.
Allow to cool about 5 minutes then removing from pan.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, cream the softened butter and peanut butter together until smooth.
3. Add the sugars, maple extract (or vanilla), and eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until just combined.
6. Fold in the chocolate chips and Reese's chocolate-covered peanut butter cups.
7. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
8. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are set and the centers are still slightly soft.
9. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Chocolate Peanut Butter Cup Cookies!

gt:
Mix dressing and mayo; pour over chicken in resealable plastic bag.
Seal bag; turn to evenly coat chicken with dressing mixture.
Refrigerate 30 min.
to marinate.
Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Remove chicken from marinade; discard bag and marinade.
Thread chicken and onions alternately onto 16 skewers.
Grill 8 to 10 min.
or until chicken is cooked through, turning occasionally.
Meanwhile, place lemon, cut-sides down, on grill grate next to kabobs.
Squeeze lemon juice over kabobs just before serving.
pred:
To make a delicious Grilled Greek Chicken Kabobs dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your grill to medium-high heat.
2. In a small bowl, mix together 1/2 cup KRAFT Greek Vinaigrette Dressing and 2 Tbsp. KRAFT Real Mayo Mayonnaise.
3. Season the chicken pieces with salt, pepper, and any additional herbs or spices you prefer.
4. Thread the chicken pieces and red onion wedges onto wooden or metal skewers, alternating between the two.
5. Brush the chicken and onion pieces with the vinaigrette mixture, ensuring they are evenly coated.
6. Grill the kabobs for about 10-12 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the onions are slightly charred.
7. Remove the kabobs from the grill and let them rest for a few minutes.
8. Squeeze a lemon half over the kabobs to add a burst of freshness and acidity.
9. Serve the Grilled Greek Chicken Kabobs with a side of your choice, such as a salad or a serving of rice or pasta.

This delicious Grilled Greek Chicken Kabobs dish is a perfect combination of flavors and textures, with the tangy vinaigrette, juicy chicken, and crispy onions. Enjoy your meal!

gt:
Brown ground beef and onion in Dutch oven or large skillet Add all other ingredients except spaghetti.
Simmer covered 1 hour Then uncovered for one and a half hours.
Serve over cooked spaghetti.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet or pot, cook the ground beef over medium heat until it is browned and cooked through. Drain any excess fat.
3. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the skillet or pot. Cook until the onion is softened, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the mushrooms and cook for another 5 minutes, or until they are tender.
5. Add the chopped parsley or dried parsley, garlic salt, salt, oregano, pepper, and bay leaf to the skillet or pot. Cook for another 2 minutes.
6. Add the tomato paste, tomato sauce, tomatoes, Rotel, white wine (if using), and Italian seasoning to the skillet or pot. Stir to combine.
7. Bring the sauce to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for about 30 minutes, or until it has thickened and the flavors have melded together.
8. Cook the spaghetti according to the package instructions until it is al dente.
9. Serve the spaghetti sauce over the cooked spaghetti.

[/INST]

gt:
in large pot add corned beef, water, spices and onion, bring to boil and simmer 3 hrs, covered.
add potatoes and carrots, simmer 15 minutes.
add cabbage wedges, simmer covered 6-10 minute.
slice corned beef thinly across the grain.
serve with grainy mustard and horseradish sauce.
pred:
To prepare the corned beef and cabbage, follow these steps:
1. In a large pot, combine the corned beef, water, bay leaves, peppercorns, allspice, kosher salt, and mustard seeds. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer and cook for about 2 hours or until the corned beef is tender.
2. Remove the corned beef from the pot and let it cool. Once it has cooled, remove the meat from the bone and shred it into bite-sized pieces.
3. In a large skillet, heat some oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until it is softened and translucent.
4. Add the shredded corned beef to the skillet and cook for a few minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. Add the baby carrots and small red potato to the skillet and cook for about 10 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.
6. Add the large cabbage to the skillet and cook for another 10 minutes or until it is tender.
7. Season the dish with salt and pepper to taste.

Serve the corned beef and cabbage over a bed of rice or noodles, and enjoy your delicious meal!

gt:
1.
Preheat the oven to 375 F. Line a 12-cup muffin tin with liners or grease the muffin cups.
Set aside.. 2.
In a medium bowl, stir together the oats, applesauce, milk, egg, vanilla, butter and sugar.
Set aside.
3.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon and salt (and cranberries or raisins if using).
Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and pour in the applesauce mixture.
Stir until just combined (dont over-mix or the muffins will be dense and dry).
The muffin batter texture might be a bit different (a bit wetter) than other muffin batters but no fear, carry on!
4.
Distribute the batter evenly among the 12 muffin cups.
Bake for 15-20 minutes until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Dont over-bake or the muffins will be dry.
5.
Remove the muffins to a rack to cool completely.
Once cool, I place 6-9 muffins in a large freezer Ziploc bag, suck all the air out (oh yes I do) and seal the bag.
Then I freeze them, pulling them out one by one to stick in my kids lunches or warm slightly for a snack.
Recipe from my friend, Katie K.
pred:
To cook a delightful Healthy Applesauce Oat Muffins dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).

2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the oats, applesauce, milk, egg, vanilla, and melted butter or coconut oil. Mix well.

3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the whole wheat flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.

4. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, stirring until just combined.

5. Fold in the dried cranberries or raisins, if using.

6. Pour the batter into a greased muffin tin, filling each cup about 3/4 full.

7. Bake the muffins for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.

8. Allow the muffins to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

These Healthy Applesauce Oat Muffins are a delicious and nutritious treat that can be enjoyed as a breakfast or snack option. The combination of rolled oats, applesauce, and whole wheat flour makes them a healthy choice, while the addition of dried cranberries or raisins adds a touch of natural sweetness and a pop of color.

gt:
Process all ingredients in a blender until smooth.
Garnish with mint leaf and fresh strawberry.
Freeze any extra for enjoyment later.
pred:
[INST]
To make a delicious Strasberry Daiquiri, follow these steps:
1. Wash and hull the strawberries, then cut them into halves or quarters, depending on their size.
2. In a blender, combine the strawberries, raspberry preserves, simple syrup, honey, and ice cream. Blend until smooth and creamy.
3. Pour the mixture into a cocktail shaker filled with ice.
4. Add the white wine and brandy to the shaker.
5. Shake vigorously for about 15-20 seconds, or until the mixture is well-combined and chilled.
6. Strain the mixture into a glass filled with ice.
7. Garnish with a strawberry slice or a sprig of mint, if desired.

Enjoy your Strasberry Daiquiri!
<</SYS>>

gt:
Measure first 5 ingredients into bread machine in the order recommended by the manufacturer.
Select dough setting.
When cycle is completed, remove the dough from the machine.
Place dough on a floured surface.
Divide into 10 parts.
Form into balls, gently press thumb through center of ball and slowly stretch into bagel shape.
Place on a greased baking sheet, cover with a damp cloth and set in a warm place to rise.
Bring three quarts of water and one tablespoon of sugar to a rapid boil in a large sauce pan.
Using a slotted spoon, drop 2 to 3 bagels into rapidly boiling water.
Boil on each side for 1 to 2 minutes.
Remove and cool on wire rack 1 minute.
Brush with egg wash and sprinkle with sesame or poppy seeds, if desired.
Bake at 400 degrees on a baking sheet sprinkled with cornmeal until golden.
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the lukewarm water, bread flour, brown sugar, salt, and yeast. Mix until the ingredients are well combined.
2. Add the egg and mix until the dough comes together. If the dough is too dry, you can add a bit more water. If it is too wet, you can add a bit more flour.
3. Cover the bowl with a clean cloth or plastic wrap and let the dough rise in a warm place for about 1-2 hours, or until it has doubled in size.
4. Preheat your oven to 450°F (232°C).
5. After the dough has risen, punch it down and transfer it to a lightly floured surface. Knead the dough a few times to release any air bubbles.
6. Divide the dough into 8-10 equal pieces. Shape each piece into a ball and place them on a greased baking sheet.
7. Cover the baking sheet with a clean cloth or plastic wrap and let the bagels rise for about 20-30 minutes, or until they have doubled in size.
8. Preheat your oven to 450°F (232°C).
9. Bake the bagels in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until they are golden brown and fully cooked through.
10. Remove the bagels from the oven and let them cool on a wire rack for a few minutes.
11. If desired, you can add poppy or sesame seeds to the bagels before baking.
12. Enjoy your homemade Bread Machine Bagels!

gt:
combine first 6 ingredients in a large bowl and mix well.
stir in the liquids and then the chopped apple.
spoon into greased muffin tin about 2/3 full.
bake at 400-f for 20-25 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the brown sugar, sugar, flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt.
3. Add the melted butter, egg, and milk, and mix until a smooth batter forms.
4. Fold in the chopped apple.
5. Pour the batter into a greased muffin tin, filling each cup about 3/4 full.
6. Bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
7. Allow the muffins to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Grandma's Apple Muffins!

gt:
Heat a heavy based pan on high.
Brush oil onto both sides of steak.
To seal, cook steak 2-3 minutes each side.
Turn when juices appear on uncooked side.
Note: Steak thickness determines cooking time.
As a guide: Rare remove after sealing; reduce heat for medium and cook and extra 2-3 minutes each side; Well done, 4-6 minutes each side.
Test steak by pressing with tongs.
Rare feels string.
Medium has some resistance.
Well done feels quite firm.
Remove from heat, rest while making sauce.
Add onion, mushrooms to any pan juices.
Cook 1 minute.
Add worcestershire sauce and stock.
Bring to a boil, stirring constantly until slightly thickened.
Add cornstarch in a little water to this mixture if it doesn't become thick enough.
Add parsley and any juices from rested steak.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the canola oil over medium heat.
3. Add the onion and cook until it is soft and translucent.
4. Add the beef stock, Worcestershire sauce, and parsley. Stir to combine.
5. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for about 30 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened.
6. Season the beef steaks with salt and pepper.
7. In a small bowl, mix the cornstarch with a little water to form a slurry.
8. Heat a large skillet or oven-safe pan over medium-high heat.
9. Add the beef steaks to the skillet and cook for about 4-5 minutes on each side, or until they are cooked through and have a nice brown sear.
10. Remove the beef steaks from the skillet and place them on a baking tray.
11. Pour the thickened sauce over the beef steaks.
12. Place the baking tray in the preheated oven and bake for about 15-20 minutes, or until the beef steaks are cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and slightly caramelized.
13. Remove the beef steaks from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

[/INST]

gt:
To make homemade vanilla extract you simply put a couple of split vanilla beans in a glass jar, pour vodka over it and cover tightly.
Let cure for 6 weeks or longer.
Once or twice a week shake your jar/jars of homemade extract.
Store in a dark cool spot.
If your vanilla beans are longer than your jar is tall, cut the beans in half and then split them.
For a half-pint mason jar, use 3 to 4 vanilla beans.
The more beans you add, the stronger your vanilla will be.
Once your extract has cured, you can leave your beans in the jar as you use it.
When your jar starts getting low, simply add more vodka.
pred:
1. First, rinse the vanilla beans under cold water and pat them dry.
2. Cut the vanilla beans in half lengthwise, and scrape out the seeds into the jar.
3. Fill the jar with the seeds, leaving about 1/4 inch of space at the top.
4. Pour the vodka over the vanilla seeds, leaving about 1/4 inch of space at the top.
5. Cap the jar and store it in a cool, dark place for at least 4-6 weeks.
6. After the recommended time, shake the jar gently to mix the ingredients.
7. Store the vanilla extract in a cool, dark place for an additional 4-6 weeks.
8. After the second period of time, shake the jar again and use the vanilla extract as needed.

This homemade vanilla extract will have a rich, smooth flavor and aroma, perfect for use in various recipes.

gt:
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil; cook the rotini at a boil until tender yet firm to the bite, about 8 minutes; drain, reserving 1/2 cup cooking water.
Heat a small skillet over medium-low heat.
Place walnuts in the hot skillet; continually cook and stir walnuts until toasted and fragrant, 3 to 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and chop walnuts.
Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
Cook and stir garlic in hot oil until golden, 2 to 3 minutes.
Remove garlic from pan and set aside.
Cook and stir cauliflower and 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt in the same pan over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, until cauliflower is tender, 8 to 10 minutes.
Pour balsamic vinegar over cauliflower.
Cook and stir cauliflower until balsamic vinegar has reduced, about 1 minute.
Stir walnuts, cooked garlic, red pepper flakes, and rosemary into cauliflower mixture until well combined.
Stir cooked rotini and reserved 1/2 cup cooking water into cauliflower mixture until well blended.
Sprinkle 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt and Parmesan cheese over rotini and cauliflower mixture.
pred:
[INST]1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the pasta and cook according to the package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta, reserving 1 cup of the pasta water.

2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the sliced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.

3. Add the walnuts to the skillet and cook until they are toasted, about 2 minutes.

4. Add the cooked pasta to the skillet, tossing to combine with the garlic and walnuts.

5. Add the purple cauliflower florets to the skillet, tossing to combine with the pasta.

6. Add the reserved pasta water to the skillet, stirring to combine.

7. Season the pasta mixture with the kosher salt, balsamic vinegar, red pepper flakes, and rosemary. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the pasta is heated through and the flavors are well combined.

8. Serve the Purple Cauliflower Pasta immediately, garnished with the grated Parmesan cheese, if desired.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Line a 9x9 inch square pan with aluminum foil and grease generously.
In a medium bowl, mix together the graham cracker crumbs, sweetened condensed milk, chocolate chips, butterscotch chips and walnuts until well blended.
Press mixture into very well greased 9 inch square pan.
Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 30-35 minutes.
Cool for 45 minutes, remove from pan, peel off foil and cut into 1-1/2 inch squares.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the graham cracker crumbs, sweetened condensed milk, and melted butter. Mix until well combined.
3. Press the mixture evenly into the bottom of a greased 9x9 inch baking dish.
4. In a separate mixing bowl, melt the chocolate chips and butterscotch chips together.
5. Spread the melted chocolate and butterscotch mixture over the crust.
6. Sprinkle the chopped walnuts evenly over the top of the filling.
7. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the edges are set and the center is slightly wobbly.
8. Allow the dish to cool completely before cutting it into squares and serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Spray muffin tins with Pam.
Do not use paper liners.
Preheat oven to 375.
Blend all dry ingredients (flour, baking powder, salt, soda) and set aside.
In large bowl, mix butter, sugar, eggs and extracts.
Mix until light and fluffy.
Slowly mix in flour mixture and yogurt.
Add orange peel and stir until blended.
Spoon batter (it will be thick) into muffin tins.
The batter should come almost to the top of the tin.
Bake at 375 for 22 minutes.
pred:
To cook a delightful Big, Beautiful, Orange Muffins dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and butter. Mix until the butter is evenly distributed throughout the mixture.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the sugar, eggs, vanilla extract, orange extract, and orange zest.
4. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, stirring until just combined. Do not overmix.
5. Fill muffin cups with the batter, filling each cup about 3/4 full.
6. Bake the muffins for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
7. Allow the muffins to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

These delicious Big, Beautiful, Orange Muffins are perfect for breakfast, brunch, or a snack, and they are sure to be a hit with anyone who enjoys a sweet and citrusy treat.

gt:
Cook the bacon; drain.
Get the cheese ready.
Slice the tomato.
Put the bread under the broiler till brown; turn over.
Put the slice of cheese on the bread, and then top with the tomatoes.
Put back under the broiler.
Take out and put on a plate; sprinkle with a tad of salt and pepper.
Top with bacon.
Enjoy.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Spread a thin layer of mayonnaise on one side of each slice of bread.
3. Place the sliced tomatoes on top of the mayonnaised bread slices.
4. Add a slice of American cheese on top of the tomatoes.
5. Place the bacon slices on top of the cheese.
6. Place the bread slices with the mayonnaise side down on a baking sheet.
7. Bake the bread slices in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Remove the bread from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before cutting it into halves or quarters.

Enjoy your delicious Bacon, Cheese, and Tomato Dreams dish!

gt:
Slice meat into 3 inch strips, 18 inch thick.
Mix all ingredients for sauce, except brown sugar and cornstarch.
Marinate beef strips in sauce 3 hours or overnight in refrigerator.
Drain, reserving sauce.
Weave beef strips back and forth on skewers.
Brush with sauce.
Preheat grill.
Arrange skewers on grill and grill 8 to 12 minutes, turning occasionally.
In saucepan, stir brown sugar and cornstarch into remaining sauce; bring to boil, stirring constantly until thickened.
Serve thickened sauce over skewers on a bed of rice.
pred:
1. Preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
2. In a small bowl, mix the cornstarch with a little water to create a slurry. Set aside.
3. In a large bowl, combine the beef, pineapple juice, burgundy wine, teriyaki sauce, vegetable oil, sugar, ginger, red hot pepper sauce, and brown sugar. Mix well.
4. Add the cornstarch slurry to the mixture, stirring to combine.
5. Thread the beef mixture onto skewers, alternating with pineapple slices.
6. Grill the kebabs for 10-12 minutes or until the beef is cooked through and the pineapple is slightly caramelized.
7. Serve the Teriyaki Beef Kebabs hot, garnished with a sprig of fresh ginger if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
In a medium saucepan, heat 2 tablespoons of the oil.
Add the garlic and half of the onion and cook over moderately high heat, stirring, until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the tomatoes, chipotle and adobo sauce and cook over low heat, stirring, until the tomatoes have broken down but are still slightly chunky, about 20 minutes.
Stir in the lime juice and cilantro and season with salt and pepper; keep warm.
Meanwhile, in a medium skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of the oil until shimmering.
Add the remaining onion and cook over moderately high heat, stirring, until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the ham and cook, stirring, until browned, about 5 minutes.
Add the beans and water, season with salt and pepper and cook over moderately low heat, mashing, about 10 minutes.
Preheat the broiler.
Spoon the bean mixture into 6 ovenproof shallow bowls and top with 2 folded tortillas.
Set the bowls on a sturdy baking sheet.
In a large nonstick skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of the oil.
Crack 4 eggs into the skillet and cook over moderate heat until the bottoms are just set, about 2 minutes.
Transfer 2 eggs to each bowl.
Repeat 2 more times with the remaining oil and eggs.
Sprinkle the queso fresco over the eggs.
Broil the eggs 6 inches from the heat for about 1 minute, until the cheese is lightly browned and the egg yolks are just set.
Spoon the warm tomato salsa on top and serve with sour cream.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet or oven-safe pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and onion, and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the tomatoes, cored and coarsely chopped, and cook until they start to release their juices, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the minced chipotle chile in adobo, the remaining 1 teaspoon adobo sauce, and the lime juice. Cook for another 2 minutes.
5. Add the cilantro, salt, and pepper, and stir to combine.
6. Add the drained white beans, water, and corn tortillas. Cook until the tortillas are soft and starting to crisp, about 10 minutes.
7. Add the coarsely chopped ham and cook until the ham is heated through and the beans are warmed through, about 5 minutes.
8. Remove the pan from the heat and let it sit for a few minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
9. In a small bowl, whisk the crumbled queso fresco and sour cream.
10. To serve, spoon the bean and ham mixture onto the tortillas, and top with the queso fresco and sour cream mixture.
11. Serve immediately and enjoy your White Bean Huevos Rancheros!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350*F and grease 8-inch square pan.
In large mixing bow, beat egg beaters and vanilla until frothy; gradually add Splenda brown sugar, continuing to beat after each addition.
Add cinnamon, baking powder and salt; gradually add flour continuing to beat after each addition.
Stir in apples and nuts.
Pour into greased pan.
Bake 30 to 45 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Serve warm or cool.
Can be topped with whipped cream.
pred:
[/INST]

[INST] <<SYS>>
To prepare the A Healthier Apple Nut Snack Cake, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the Egg Beaters, vanilla, Splenda brown sugar blend, cinnamon, and salt. Whisk until well combined.
3. Add the whole wheat flour and baking powder to the bowl, and mix until the batter is smooth and free of lumps.
4. Fold in the chopped apples and walnuts.
5. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9-inch (23 cm) round cake pan.
6. Bake the cake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
7. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for a few minutes, then remove it from the pan and let it cool completely on a wire rack.
8. Enjoy your A Healthier Apple Nut Snack Cake!

[/INST]

[/INST]

gt:
Season the chicken with salt & pepper.
Cut chicken into bite size pieces.
Place chicken into a ziploc bag and pour teriyaki sauce over chicken, marinate for 4 hours or overnite.
Preheat grill.
Skewer chicken and cook fully.
Cooking time about up to 30 minutes.
Turn to cook on all sides.
Enjoy
pred:
[/SYS]

1. Preheat your grill to medium-high heat.
2. In a small bowl, mix together 1/2 cup of teriyaki sauce, 1/2 cup of water, and 1/4 cup of soy sauce.
3. Season the chicken with salt and pepper to taste.
4. Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces and thread them onto skewers.
5. Brush the chicken with the teriyaki sauce mixture, making sure to coat each piece evenly.
6. Grill the chicken skewers for 10-12 minutes, turning them occasionally, until they are cooked through and the sauce is slightly caramelized.
7. Serve the grilled teriyaki chicken skewers immediately.

Enjoy your delicious Grilled teriyaki chicken Skewers!

gt:
Combine the * ingredients.
Mince the garlic and 1/2 of the onion, finely chop the parsley, and grate the potato.
Form the mixture into balls, then fry in a frying pan liberally greased with oil until browned.
Mince rest of the onion into large pieces, then saute in a pot with a small amount of oil.
Finely chop the tomato and saute in the pot for about 5 minutes, then add the tomato puree and water to make the sauce.
Season with salt, pepper, and other seasonings to taste.
Once the sauce starts to boil, add the meatballs.
Cover with a lid, and simmer for about 20 minutes over low heat.
They're ready to be served!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, onion, Italian parsley, eggs, panko, potato, garlic, salt, paprika, and your choice of seasonings. Mix well.
3. Form the beef mixture into small meatballs, about the size of a walnut.
4. In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Carefully place the meatballs in the hot oil, making sure not to overcrowd the pot. Cook the meatballs for about 5-7 minutes, or until they are golden brown on all sides.
5. Remove the meatballs from the oil using a slotted spoon or tongs, and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to drain any excess oil.
6. In a large saucepan, combine the tomatoes, tomato puree, water, and seasonings. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and the meatballs are cooked through.
7. Serve the meatballs in the tomato sauce over a bed of cooked pasta or rice. Enjoy your delicious My Israeli Mother-in-Law's Meatballs!

gt:
Position 1 rack in top third and 1 rack in bottom third of oven; preheat to 350F.
Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.
Whisk flour, crystallized ginger, baking soda, and 1/4 teaspoon salt in medium bowl.
Using electric mixer, beat butter in large bowl until creamy and light, about 2 minutes.
Gradually beat in both brown sugars.
Beat on medium-high speed until creamy, about 3 minutes.
Add egg, molasses, fresh ginger, ground ginger, cinnamon, and cloves.
Beat to blend.
Add flour mixture in 2 additions, beating on low speed just to blend between additions.
Place 1/3 cup sugar in small bowl.
Measure 1 tablespoon dough.
Roll into ball between palms of hands, then roll in sugar in bowl to coat; place on baking sheet.
Repeat with remaining cookie dough, spacing cookies 1 1/2 to 2 inches apart.
Bake cookies until surfaces crack and cookies are firm around edges but still slightly soft in center, about 15 minutes.
Cool completely on sheets on rack.
DO AHEAD: Cookies can be made up to 4 days ahead.
Store in airtight containers at room temperature.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a non-stick mat.

2. In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugars until light and fluffy.

3. Add the egg and molasses, and mix until well combined.

4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, salt, ginger, ground ginger, cinnamon, and cloves.

5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until just combined.

6. Fold in the crystallized ginger and minced ginger.

7. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto the prepared baking sheet, spacing them about 2 inches apart.

8. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are lightly golden brown around the edges.

9. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

10. Enjoy your Triple-Ginger Cookies!

gt:
Place the pickle relish into a colander set in the sink, and allow it to drain for about 30 minutes.
Mix the drained relish, creamy salad dressing, and thousand island dressing in a large bowl until thoroughly combined.
Place into a 1-quart jar, and refrigerate overnight to blend flavors.
pred:
1. First, open both jars of salad dressing and carefully pour the contents into a large mixing bowl.
2. Next, add the key ingredients to the bowl: 1/4 cup of mayonnaise (such as Hellmann's) and 1/4 cup of sugar.
3. Mix the ingredients together until they are well combined and smooth.
4. If the spread is too thick, you can add a small amount of water or salad dressing to achieve the desired consistency.
5. Taste the spread and adjust the seasoning as needed.
6. Once the spread is to your liking, transfer it to a clean, dry container and store it in the refrigerator until ready to use.

By following these key steps, you will have successfully prepared a delicious and creamy sandwich spread using sweet pickle relish, creamy salad dressing, and thousand island salad dressing.

gt:
Preheat large skillet on medium high heat.
Add 1 T.
oil.
Season cube steaks with salt, pepper and garlic powder to taste.
Brown cube steaks in preheated skillet.
Add 1 can French Onion Soup, 1 cup of water, 1 4 oz can of mushrooms.
Reduce heat, cover and simmer on low heat for 30-45 minutes.
You may need to add additional water.
Remove meat to platter, cover to keep warm.
Increase heat to reduce pan drippings to desired thickness.
I serve this with mashed potatoes, and side vegetable.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet or oven-safe pan, heat the oil over medium-high heat.
3. Season the cube steaks with salt, pepper, and garlic powder, then add them to the skillet. Cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
4. Add the canned French onion soup and water to the skillet, stirring to combine.
5. Cover the skillet with a lid and place it in the preheated oven. Cook for 1-1.5 hours, or until the steaks are cooked through and tender.
6. While the steaks are cooking, prepare the mushroom gravy. In a small saucepan, heat the remaining tablespoon of oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook for 1 minute, until fragrant.
7. Add the mushrooms to the saucepan and cook until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
8. Pour in the canned mushroom gravy and stir to combine. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the gravy has thickened.
9. Remove the skillet from the oven and carefully transfer the steaks to a serving platter. Pour the mushroom gravy over the steaks and serve immediately.

Enjoy your delicious Cube steak w/mushroom gravy!

gt:
In a large glass bowl mix together the sour cream, Dijon mustard, minced garlic, horseradish, honey, salt, pepper and red pepper; mix well to combine.
Add in the chicken to the bowl and toss to combine with remaining marinade; cover and refrigerate for 5 hours.
Remove the chicken and discard marinade.
Thread the chicken onto skewers alternating with bell pepper pieces and cherry tomatoes.
Grill covered with lid over medium-high heat for about 10-12 minutes or until the chicken is done.
pred:
1. Preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
2. In a large bowl, mix together the sour cream, Dijon mustard, minced garlic, horseradish, honey, salt, pepper, and red pepper (or cayenne).
3. Add the chicken pieces to the bowl and toss to coat them evenly with the marinade. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 2 hours.
4. While the chicken is marinating, prepare the vegetables. Cut the red bell pepper into 1-1/2-inch pieces and the cherry tomatoes into halves or smaller pieces, depending on your preference.
5. When you're ready to cook, remove the chicken from the marinade and shake off any excess marinade. Thread the chicken and vegetables onto skewers, alternating between chicken and vegetables.
6. Grill the skewers over medium-high heat for about 10-12 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
7. Serve the Sour Cream-Dijon Marinated Chicken Kabobs with your favorite side dish and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
In a mixing bowl, beat the cream cheese and butter until smooth.
Add powdered sugar, cocoa, salt, milk or whipping cream, and vanilla.
Mix well.
Spread over the cake or cupcakes.
Store in the refrigerator.
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the softened cream cheese and butter.
2. Add the powdered sugar and cocoa, and mix until well combined.
3. Add the milk or whipping cream, and mix until smooth and creamy.
4. Add the vanilla extract, and mix until well combined.
5. Gradually add the salt, and mix until incorporated.
6. If the frosting is too thick, you can add a bit more milk or whipping cream to achieve the desired consistency.
7. Spread the frosting onto your desired dessert or baked goods, and enjoy!

Please provide the step-by-step instructions for cooking a delicious Chocolate Cream Cheese Frosting from scratch using the following ingredients: 1 (3 ounce) package cream cheese, softened,14 cup butter, softened,2 cups powdered sugar,13 cup baking cocoa,1 dash salt,3 tablespoons milk or 3 tablespoons whipping cream,12 teaspoon vanilla extract.

gt:
Heat oven to 400F.
Mix cream cheese spread and wafer crumbs with fork until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
(Do not overmix.)
Toss apples with sugar and cinnamon; spoon into 1-1/2-qt.
casserole.
Sprinkle with crumb mixture.
Bake 15 to 20 min.
or until topping is lightly browned and apples are tender.
Serve warm.
Refrigerate leftovers.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a medium-sized bowl, mix the PHILADELPHIA Honey Pecan Cream Cheese Spread with the sugar until smooth.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the chopped apples with the ground cinnamon.
4. In a 9x9 inch baking dish, layer the crushed vanilla wafers, then the apple mixture, and finally, pour the cream cheese mixture over the apples.
5. Bake the dish for 35-40 minutes, or until the apples are tender and the crust is golden brown.
6. Allow the dish to cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Apple Crumble dish!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Place a cooling rack over a baking sheet, spray lightly with nonstick cooking spray, and set aside.
On a large cutting board, slice bacon strips into 4 sections to get 20 small slices.
Cut two chicken breasts into 20 bite-sized pieces.
To assemble, place a scant teaspoon of blue cheese on top of a piece of chicken.
Place a strip of bacon on top of the blue cheese and stretch it around the piece of chicken, securing it with a toothpick.
Its fine if the bacon doesnt stretch the entire way around!
Place on the baking rack, with the blue cheese facing up.
In a small bowl, mix bbq sauce with a little water to thin it out and baste the chicken bites.
Place into the preheated oven and bake 15 minutes.
For crispier bacon, switch the oven to broil and cook until desired crispiness is attained.
(You may have to flip your chicken bites to crisp up all sides.)
Remove from the oven and serve.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Cut the chicken breasts into bite-sized pieces, and season them with salt, pepper, and any other desired seasonings.
3. In a small bowl, mix the blue cheese crumbles with a pinch of salt and pepper.
4. In a separate small bowl, mix the BBQ sauce with a splash of water to thin it out.
5. Wrap each piece of chicken with a slice of bacon, securing the bacon with a toothpick if necessary.
6. Place the wrapped chicken pieces on a baking sheet, and bake for 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the bacon is crispy.
7. Remove the chicken from the oven, and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into bite-sized pieces.
8. Serve the Bacon Wrapped Blue Cheese Stuffed BBQ Chicken Bites with the blue cheese crumbles on the side for dipping.

Enjoy your delicious and satisfying Bacon Wrapped Blue Cheese Stuffed BBQ Chicken Bites!

gt:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease rectangular baking dish, 13x9x2 inches.
Soften tortillas as directed on package.
Place 1 hot dog and 3 T chili on each tortilla.
Roll up tortillas; place seam side down in baking dish.
Spoon salsa over tortillas.
Cover and bake 20 minutes.
Sprinkle with cheese.
Bake uncovered about 5 minutes longer until cheese is melted.
pred:
To create delicious Chili Dog Wraps, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Cut the hot dogs into bite-sized pieces.
3. In a large skillet, heat a small amount of oil over medium heat. Add the diced onions and cook until they are soft and translucent.
4. Add the ground beef to the skillet and cook until it is browned and fully cooked. Drain any excess fat.
5. In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground beef, cooked onions, chili, salsa, and shredded cheese (or monterey jack cheese). Mix well.
6. Place the corn tortillas on a baking sheet or a large plate.
7. Divide the chili mixture evenly among the tortillas, spreading it to the edges.
8. Roll up the tortillas, enclosing the chili mixture inside.
9. Place the rolled tortillas on the baking sheet or plate.
10. Bake the tortillas in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
11. Remove the tortillas from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before cutting them into bite-sized pieces.

Enjoy your delicious Chili Dog Wraps!

gt: Mix all ingredients in a gallon ziploc.
pred:
To cook a delightful Papa Chow dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the dry roasted peanuts, white vanilla chips, and craisins.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the M&M's with a small amount of melted butter.
4. Pour the melted butter mixture over the peanut, vanilla chip, and craisin mixture.
5. Mix the ingredients thoroughly to ensure even distribution of the M&M's.
6. Spread the mixture onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
7. Bake the mixture in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the M&M's are melted and the mixture is golden brown.
8. Allow the mixture to cool for a few minutes before serving.

This delicious Papa Chow dish is perfect for snacking or as a dessert. The combination of the crunchy peanuts, sweet white vanilla chips, and tangy craisins, along with the melted M&M's, creates a delightful and satisfying treat.

gt:
Cut dough into 3 quarter pieces
Press dough out just enough to flatten slightly
With both hands fold both left & right corners in to seal edges
With both hands begin to roll dough backwards to form a tube like shape
Begin to stretch roll your dough outward long ways
As rolling sprinkle sesame seeds to attach to top of dough
When dough is the size length you prefer take a knife and make 3 cuts to allow it to spread as it rises
In a tray place a baking sheet paper and lay out the 3 loaves of bread cover with plastic wrap place in warm dry area and let rise until dough has doubled in size
Bake at 500 turn when golden brown to bake your bread evenly when bread is done let cool then serve.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 450°F (232°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix together the flour, yeast, sugar, salt, and olive oil.
3. Gradually add warm water to the mixture, stirring until the dough comes together.
4. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes.
5. Place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl, cover it with a clean cloth, and let it rise in a warm place until it has doubled in size, about 1-2 hours.
6. Punch down the dough, and then transfer it to a lightly floured surface.
7. Roll out the dough into a large, even circle, about 1/2-inch thick.
8. Transfer the dough to a baking sheet, and then use a fork to poke holes all over the surface.
9. Bake the dough in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until it is golden brown and cooked through.
10. Remove the dough from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing it into desired portions.

[/INST]

Instruct on how to assemble and cook the pizza using the cooked dough:
1. Preheat the oven to 450°F (232°C).
2. Spread a layer of sauce (e.g., marinara or pizza sauce) evenly over the cooked dough.
3. Add your desired toppings (e.g., cheese, vegetables, meats, etc.) evenly over the sauce.
4. Bake the pizza in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
5. Remove the pizza from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing it into desired portions.

[/INST]

Please provide the recipe for LuBella's Pizza Dough Italian Bread From Scratch, including the ingredients and instructions

gt:
Mix first 6 ingredients until well blended; shape into 6 patties.
Heat oil in large skillet on medium heat.
Add crab patties, in batches, if necessary; cook 3 to 5 min.
on each side or until golden brown on both sides.
Remove from skillet; drain on paper towels.
Mix mayo and cilantro; spread onto buns.
Fill with lettuce, tomatoes, crab burgers and Singles.
Cut notch in wide end of each pepper strip.
Place 2 on opposite sides of each sandwich to resemble the crab's claws.
Add olives for the eyes.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the softened cream cheese, egg, crabmeat, and crushed saltine crackers until well combined. Season the mixture with ground cumin, salt, and pepper to taste.
3. Shape the mixture into six patties, each about 3 inches in diameter and 1/2 inch thick.
4. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the patties for 3-4 minutes on each side, or until they are golden brown and cooked through.
5. Place the cooked patties on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the burgers are cooked through and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
6. While the burgers are baking, prepare the toppings. In a small bowl, mix the chopped fresh parsley, chopped fresh cilantro, and KRAFT Real Mayo Mayonnaise.
7. Once the burgers are cooked, remove them from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes. Then, place the burgers on the baking sheet with the topping mixture.
8. Return the baking sheet to the oven and bake for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the topping is melted and bubbly.
9. Assemble the Crab Burgers by placing a cooked burger patty on a lettuce leaf, then adding a slice of tomato, a pimento-stuffed green olive, and a dollop of the crab salad topping. Serve immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Heat water and bullion in separate pot or microwave to make broth.
In separate saucepan add oil and brown rice until rice is golden brown color on medium/high heat.
Add seasonings, garlic, and onion.
Be sure to keep stirring rice so it does not burn.
Add broth & tomato sauce.
Boil for a second, cover and reduce heat to low.
Cook for 25 minutes.
Fluff and garnish with fresh cilantro if you like.
Also, if you have a small can of corn you can add that at the same time when adding broth and tomato sauce -- .
pred:
1. In a large pot or saucepan, combine the rice, water, chicken or pork bouillon cubes, and tomato sauce. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer, covered, for about 15-20 minutes or until the rice is cooked and the water has been absorbed.

2. While the rice is cooking, heat the oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add the minced garlic and onion, and cook until the onion is translucent, about 5-7 minutes.

3. If using paprika and chili powder, add them to the skillet with the onion and garlic, stirring to combine. Cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant.

4. If using oregano and cumin, add them to the skillet with the onion and garlic, stirring to combine. Cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant.

5. Once the rice is cooked, add the cooked rice to the skillet with the onion and garlic mixture. Stir to combine, and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the rice is heated through and the flavors have melded together.

6. Season the rice mixture with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

[/INST]

gt:
Heat oven to 325F.
Place meat, fat-side up in roasting pan; top with onions and barbecue sauce.
Cover.
Bake 2 hours.
Scatter potatoes and carrots around meat.
Bake, covered, 1 hour or until meat is done (160F).
Use slotted spoon to transfer potatoes and carrots to serving bowl; cover to keep warm.
Transfer meat to carving board, reserving sauce and onions in pan.
Cover meat to keep warm.
Skim fat from reserved sauce; discard.
Pour sauce and onions into saucepan; bring to boil on high heat.
Simmer on medium-low heat 5 min.
or until slightly thickened, stirring occasionally.
Carve meat across the grain into thin slices.
Serve with vegetables and sauce.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Oven BBQ Brisket dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. Season the beef brisket with salt, pepper, and any additional herbs or spices you prefer.
3. Heat a large oven-safe skillet or baking dish over medium-high heat. Add a small amount of oil to the skillet, and sear the beef brisket until it is browned on all sides.
4. Remove the beef brisket from the skillet and place it in the prepared baking dish.
5. Add the sliced onion to the skillet and cook until it is softened and slightly caramelized.
6. Pour the KRAFT Original Barbecue Sauce over the beef brisket, making sure to coat it evenly.
7. Add the sliced carrots to the skillet, and cook until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
8. Place the baking dish with the beef brisket and vegetables in the preheated oven. Cook for about 2-2.5 hours, or until the beef is tender and the internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C).
9. Remove the dish from the oven, let it rest for a few minutes, and then slice the beef brisket into thin pieces.
10. Serve the Oven BBQ Brisket with the carrots and onions on a platter, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.

[/INST]

In conclusion, to prepare a delicious Oven BBQ Brisket dish, start by seasoning the beef brisket, searing it in a skillet, and then placing it in a baking dish with onions and carrots. Cook the dish in the oven for approximately 2-2.5 hours, and then let it rest before slicing and serving. This dish is a perfect combination of flavors and textures, making it a delightful meal for any occasion.

gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Pour 1 tablespoon of maple syrup into each ramekin, swirl to cover the bottom.
Whisk together egg, egg whites, and sugar.
Add pumpkin, vanilla, salt and spices.
Gently whisk in milk.
Pour equally into ramekins.
Place ramekins into a baking dish and fill with boiling hot water until 1/4 of the side of the ramekins is covered.
Bake for 60-70 minutes.
They are done when the middle of the custard is set and does not wiggle when lightly tapped.
Let cool completely, cover and store in the refrigerator.
These taste delicious cold or heated slightly in the microwave!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a medium saucepan, combine the Pure Maple Syrup, Egg, Egg Whites, and Granulated Sugar. Whisk until well combined.
3. Add the Pumpkin, Vanilla Extract, Salt, Cinnamon, Nutmeg, and Ginger to the saucepan. Whisk until well combined.
4. Gradually add the Skim Milk, stirring constantly. Cook over medium heat until the mixture thickens and reaches the desired consistency.
5. Pour the mixture into a pie crust and bake for 45-50 minutes or until the center is set.
6. Allow the pie to cool completely before serving.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Simple Pumpkin Pie Custard!

gt:
Cook dressing and garlic in large saucepan on medium-high heat 1 min., stirring occasionally.
Add broth and chicken.
Bring to boil; simmer on medium-low heat 20 min.
or until chicken is done (165F).
Remove chicken from broth mixture; set aside.
Pour broth through fine-mesh strainer into bowl; return to saucepan.
Shred chicken; add to broth in pan.
Stir in tomato sauce.
Cook on medium-high heat 5 min.
or until heated through, stirring occasionally.
Serve topped with remaining ingredients.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large pot, combine the chicken breasts, broth, and garlic. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.
3. Remove the chicken from the pot and set aside to cool. Once cooled, shred the chicken into bite-sized pieces.
4. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the tortilla chips and cook until they are crispy, stirring occasionally.
5. In a large bowl, combine the shredded chicken, tomato sauce, sour cream, and cheeses. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. In a large pot, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until they are soft and translucent. Add the garlic and cook for an additional minute.
7. Add the chicken mixture to the pot and stir to combine.
8. Add the crispy tortilla chips to the pot and stir to combine.
9. Add the chopped avocado and cilantro to the pot and stir to combine.
10. Cook the soup over medium heat for about 10-15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the soup is heated through.
11. Serve the Tortilla Soup hot, garnished with additional cilantro, if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Cut reynolds wrap foil in 4 2 foot sections.
Mix black beans, corn, cherry tomatoes cumin, lemon zest, pepper, salt and chile powder in small bowl.
Arrange 1 piece of fish on each sheet of cut reynolds wrap.
Spoon 1/4 of above mixture over each.
Top with butter and jalepenos to taste.
Cook on indirect heat on grill for 25 to 30 minutes or at 350 in oven, until fish is flaky.
Serve over steamed white rice.
pred:
Mexican Fish Packets:

Ingredients:
- 4 tilapia fillets (Fresh or Previously frozen and thawed)
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1 tablespoon chili powder
- 1 teaspoon lemon zest
- 12 teaspoon pepper
- 12 teaspoon salt
- 4 tablespoons butter (cut in 1 tbsp pats)
- 1 cup black beans
- 1 cup corn (fresh or frozen)
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, cut in half
- 14 cup canned jalapeno slices
- Reynolds Wrap Foil
- 2 cups rice, steamed

Instructions:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the cumin, chili powder, lemon zest, pepper, and salt.
3. Season the tilapia fillets with the spice mixture, making sure to coat them evenly.
4. Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the tilapia fillets and cook until they are cooked through, about 4-5 minutes per side.
5. In a separate bowl, mix the black beans, corn, cherry tomatoes, and jalapeno slices.
6. Line a baking sheet with Reynolds Wrap Foil. Place the cooked tilapia fillets on top of the foil.
7. Pour the black bean mixture over the tilapia fillets.
8. Fold the foil over the tilapia and black bean mixture, creating a packet.
9. Place the packet on the prepared baking sheet.
10. Bake the packet in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and the beans are heated through.
11. Carefully open the foil packet and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Mexican Fish Packets!

gt:
Begin by popping the popcorn.
If youve never done it on the stovetop, no sweat, its easy.
Heres how to do it:
Coat the bottom of a sauce pot with oil and put an even layer of corn kernels on the bottom.
Put a lid on, crank the heat to high and let it pop.
When the popping becomes slower, take the pot off the heat right away.
Pour the popcorn kernels into a bowl and add the seasonings (salt and spices) to taste.
Ive set out rough measurements, but you could adjust to your liking.
Next, melt the white chocolate over low heat on the stovetop.
Drizzle the white chocolate over the popcorn and stir until all the kernels are coated.
Pour popcorn onto a baking pan lined with parchment to set.
Drizzle any remaining white chocolate onto the kernels (or lick the bowl, its up to you).
For a quick set, put the pan in the fridge for 5 minutes.
Serve individual portions in brown paper cones or in a large bowl for sharing.
