I highly encourage smuggling this into the movie theater on date night.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 200°F (93°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the popcorn kernels, olive oil, salt, and chili powder. Mix well.
3. Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
4. Roast the popcorn in the preheated oven for about 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the popcorn is golden brown and crispy.
5. Remove the popcorn from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
6. In a small saucepan, melt the white chocolate over low heat.
7. Add the melted chocolate to the cooled popcorn, stirring gently to combine.
8. Spread the chocolate-covered popcorn on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Return the popcorn to the oven and bake for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the chocolate is melted and the popcorn is slightly crispy.
10. Remove the popcorn from the oven and let it cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Spiced White Chocolate Popcorn dish!

gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F.
In a stand mixer fitted with a flat paddle attachment, mix together butter, sugar, and vanilla extract on low speed until creamy.
Gradually add flour, 1/4 cup at a time, while mixer is still running.
Add ground spices.
Increase speed to medium and mix until dough is well incorporated and sticks together, about 5 minutes.
With a lightly greased rolling pin, poll out dough on a clean lightly floured surface.
(Note: Roll very quicklythe dough may stick to the pin.)
Cut out 24 circles with a 1 1/2 inch cutter.
Transfer unbaked cookies to a baking sheet.
Top each cookie with the amount of pepitas desired.
Bake for 15 minutes or until the edges are golden brown.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the vanilla extract and mix well.
4. Gradually add the flour, cinnamon, and nutmeg, mixing until a dough forms.
5. Knead the dough on a floured surface until smooth and pliable.
6. Roll the dough out to a thickness of about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm).
7. Cut the dough into desired shapes using cookie cutters or a knife.
8. Place the cookies on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are lightly golden brown around the edges.
10. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Cinnamon Shortbread Cookies!

gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
Mix all of the dry ingredients into a sifter/strainer over a small bowl (flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt) and sift into the bowl.
In a large bowl, add the butter, brown sugar, granulated sugar and vanilla extract and beat until creamy.
Beat in the egg.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the creamy mixture using a wooden spoon.
Add the white chocolate chips, dried cherries/Craisins, and almonds and mix well.
Spoon rounded tablespoon-sized balls onto an ungreased cookie sheet, 1 inch or so apart.
Place in the oven for 9 to 11 minutes, or until cookies start to brown around the edges.
Remove from oven and let cool for 2 minutes on the cookie sheet.
Then remove to a wire cooling rack to finish cooling.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugars until light and fluffy.
3. Add the egg and vanilla extract, and mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until just combined.
6. Fold in the white chocolate chips and cherry juice-infused craisins (or dried cherries).
7. Fold in the slivered almonds.
8. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are lightly golden and the cookies are set.
10. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

gt:
Heat oven to 325 degrees F.
Mix crumbs, 3 Tbsp.
sugar and butter; press onto bottom of 9-inch springform pan.
Bake 10 min.
Beat cream cheese, 1 cup sugar, flour and vanilla in large bowl with mixer until blended.
Add sour cream; mix well.
Add eggs, 1 at a time, mixing on low speed after each just until blended.
Pour over crust.
Bake 1 hour 10 min.
or until centre is almost set.
Run knife around rim of pan to loosen cake; cool before removing rim.
Refrigerate 4 hours.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. In a medium bowl, mix together the Honey Maid Graham Crumbs, sugar, and melted butter until well combined.
3. Press the crumb mixture evenly into the bottom and up the sides of a springform pan.
4. In a large bowl, beat the Philadelphia Brick Cream Cheese and sugar until smooth and creamy.
5. Add the flour, vanilla, and sour cream to the cream cheese mixture, and mix until well combined.
6. Pour the batter over the crumb mixture in the springform pan.
7. Bake the cheesecake in the preheated oven for about 60-70 minutes, or until the edges are set and the center is just set.
8. Remove the cheesecake from the oven and let it cool in the pan for about 10 minutes.
9. Then, transfer the cheesecake to a wire rack to cool completely.
10. Once cooled, refrigerate the cheesecake for at least 4 hours or overnight before serving.

[/INST]

[INST]<<SYS>>
Please note that the above recipe is a general guideline and may vary depending on the specific ingredients used and the desired texture and taste of the cheesecake.

gt:
Mix hamburer with 1/4 cup of the soup and add onions, bread crumbs, egg, salt & pepper.
Be sure to mix thoroughly.
Shape into 6 salisbury steaks and place in baking dish.
Bake 350F for 30 minutes.
Remove from oven and spoon off excess grease.
Now combine remaining soup with water and pour over steaks.
Return to oven and bake an additional 10 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, egg, breadcrumbs, onion, salt, pepper, and water. Mix well to combine all the ingredients.
3. Form the beef mixture into small patties, about the size of a tennis ball.
4. Heat a large skillet or frying pan over medium-high heat. Add a small amount of oil to the pan, and cook the patties until they are browned on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side.
5. Remove the patties from the pan and place them on a baking sheet.
6. Pour the cream of mushroom soup over the patties, making sure to cover them evenly.
7. Bake the patties in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are cooked through and the filling is hot and bubbly.
8. Serve the Salisbury Steak hot, garnished with your favorite toppings, such as mushrooms, cheese, or a dollop of ketchup.

[/INST]

gt:
Place peaches in a square 8 X 8 X 2 microwave safe dish.
Mix remaining ingredients until crumbly and then sprinkle over the peaches.
Microwave uncovered on 100% power for 6 minutes.
Rotate dish 1/2 turn.
Continue to microwave uncovered until peaches are tender, 4-6 minutes longer.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the Bisquick, oats, and brown sugar.
3. Add the softened butter or margarine and mix until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
4. Add the peaches and mix until well combined.
5. Spread the mixture evenly in a 9x9 inch baking dish.
6. Dot the top with the softened butter or margarine.
7. Sprinkle the ground cinnamon and nutmeg evenly over the top.
8. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the crisp is golden brown and the filling is bubbly.
9. Allow the crisp to cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Microwave Peach Crisp!

gt:
Brown ground beef using salt and pepper to season the meat while cooking.
Drain off fat.
Add the can of tomato soup, Velveeta cheese and Miricle Whip.
Heat the mixture over meduim heat.
Stir slowly until cheese is melted and everything is mixed well.
Open hamburger buns and place them on a baking sheet lined with aluminum foil.
(I usually have enough mixture for 7 hamburger buns or 14 halfs)
Spoon the ground beef / cheese mixture onto the hamburger bun halfs.
Top with pepperoni slices if you wish.
(I usually use 3 slices of normal pepperoni slices or 7-8 pieces of mini slices per bun)
Broil in oven until top is golden brown.
Take care not to burn the bottom of the buns.
Let cool 2 or 3 minutes before eating.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the ground beef over medium heat until it is browned and cooked through. Drain any excess fat.
3. In a mixing bowl, combine the cooked ground beef, tomato soup, Miracle Whip, and pepperoni slices (if using). Mix well.
4. Divide the beef mixture into 4 equal portions. Shape each portion into a patty.
5. Place the patty on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
6. Bake the patties in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until they are cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 160°F (70°C).
7. While the patties are baking, prepare the buns by spreading a layer of Miracle Whip on each side.
8. Once the patties are cooked, remove them from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes.
9. Assemble the pizza burgers by placing a cooked patty on each bun, and then adding a layer of cheese on top of the patty.
10. Return the pizza burgers to the oven and bake for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
11. Remove the pizza burgers from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Pizza Burgers!

gt:
In a large mixing bowl wisk together mayonnaise, sour cream and heavy cream until throughly mixed.
Add all dried ingredients and wisk throughly.
Wisk in remaining ingredients and cover bowl with plastic wrap.
Refrigerate for a minimum of 4 hours before serving.
Refrigerating overnight for best results.
pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the mayonnaise, sour cream, heavy cream, garlic powder, onion powder, cajun spice, ground black pepper, salt, dried tarragon, dried dill, and chopped chives.
2. Stir the mixture until well combined.
3. Add the fresh parsley and chopped fresh chives to the bowl. Stir again until the ingredients are well combined.
4. Taste the dip and adjust the seasoning as needed.
5. Cover the bowl and refrigerate the dip for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
6. Serve the Zesty Ranch Dip with fresh vegetables, pita chips, or crackers. Enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Using a fork, coarsely mash avocado with lemon juice and garlic.
Stir in remaining ingredients to blend.
Garnish as desired and serve with tortilla chips.
pred:
1. First, prepare the avocados by peeling and seeding them.
2. In a large bowl, mash the avocados until they are smooth and creamy.
3. Add the lemon juice, garlic, tomatoes, onion, and cumin to the avocado mixture.
4. Stir to combine all the ingredients.
5. Season the guacamole with salt and pepper to taste.
6. Serve the guacamole immediately, or refrigerate it for a few hours before serving.
7. To serve, scoop the guacamole onto tortilla chips or use it as a dip for chips.

[/INST]

gt:
In a large heavy cast iron or non-stick skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of the butter over medium low heat until melted.
Fry half of the English muffins, cut side down, until golden, about 3 minutes.
Repeat with 1 more tablespoon butter and the remaining English muffins.
In a medium bowl, stir together the cheeses, mayonnaise, scallion and a large pinch each salt and pepper.
Divide the cheese mixture between the English muffins, pressing the tops down to make sandwiches.
Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of butter in the skillet over low heat until melted, then place the sandwiches in the skillet and cover.
Cook, turning occasionally, until the cheese is melted and the English muffins are toasted, 4 to 6 minutes total.
Serve.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat your griddle or skillet over medium heat.
2. Spread one side of each English muffin with mayonnaise.
3. Place the muffins, mayonnaise-side down, on the griddle or skillet.
4. Add the grated cheddar cheese to one side of the muffins and the creamy cheese to the other side.
5. Cook the muffins until the cheese is melted and bubbly, and the bread is golden brown.
6. Carefully flip the muffins over and cook for an additional minute or until the cheese is fully melted and the bread is cooked through.
7. Remove the muffins from the griddle or skillet and let them cool for a moment.
8. Add the chopped scallion to the top of each muffin.
9. Sprinkle the muffins with kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper.
10. Serve the Borough Market Grilled Cheese immediately.

Enjoy your delicious and satisfying grilled cheese sandwich!

gt:
Allow couscous to cool slightly.
Mix all ingredients together.
Chill and serve.
Amazingly delicious!
pred:
[/INST]

[INST]To prepare the Cool Couscous Toss, follow these steps:
1. In a large bowl, combine the cooked couscous, garbanzo beans, corn, black-eyed peas, and chopped tomatoes.
2. In a separate bowl, mix the Italian salad dressing and the green onions.
3. Pour the dressing mixture over the couscous mixture and toss everything together until the ingredients are well-coated.
4. Serve the Cool Couscous Toss immediately, or refrigerate it for a few hours before serving to allow the flavors to meld together.

Enjoy your delicious Cool Couscous Toss!

gt:
Cut off the roots of the shimeji and enoki mushrooms and shred.
Roughly cut the seaweed into 3-4 cm lengths.
Heat oil in a pan, pour in the beaten egg, stir fry lightly, then take it out.
Put the ingredients from Step 1 into the pan and stir fry over medium heat.
When the mushrooms soften, add sake, mirin and oyster sauce one by one.
Put the egg back into the frying pan, toss, and turn off the heat.
Transfer to a serving dish.
pred:
To cook a delicious Stir-fried Mushroom, Seaweed, and Egg dish, follow these steps:

1. Prepare the ingredients: Rinse the mushrooms and seaweed thoroughly, and chop them into bite-sized pieces.

2. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.

3. Add the chopped mushrooms and seaweed to the skillet, stirring occasionally to ensure even cooking. Cook for about 3-5 minutes, or until the mushrooms are tender and the seaweed is slightly wilted.

4. Crack the egg into the skillet and stir it into the mushrooms and seaweed. Cook for another 2-3 minutes, or until the egg is cooked to your desired level of doneness.

5. Add the oyster sauce, sake, and mirin to the skillet, stirring to combine. Cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.

6. Season the dish with salt and pepper to taste.

7. Serve the Stir-fried Mushroom, Seaweed, and Egg dish immediately, garnished with chopped green onions if desired.

This dish is not only delicious but also visually appealing, as the vibrant colors of the mushrooms, seaweed, and egg complement each other. The combination of flavors and textures makes it a satisfying and enjoyable meal.

gt:
Using your hands, form the sausage into balls about the size of almonds.
In a 12- to 14-inch saute pan, heat the oil over medium heat until just smoking.
Add the sausage balls in two batches, and saute, rolling them around, until they are browned all over, 5 to 6 minutes per batch.
Remove, and set aside on a plate.
Add the eggplant cubes to the pan and cook until dark golden brown, about 5 minutes.
Drain off the fat, and add the 1 cup red wine to the eggplant.
Bring to a boil, and then add the tomato sauce and the sausage balls.
Bring to a boil again.
Lower the heat to a simmer and cook for 5 minutes, then remove from the heat.
Pour the 4 liters red wine into a large pasta pot.
Add the salt and 4 cups of water, and bring to a boil.
Drop the gemelli into the boiling wine/water, and cook for 1 minute less than the package instructions indicate.
Just before the pasta is done, carefully ladle 1/2 cup of the cooking wine/water into the sausage mixture.
Drain the pasta in a colander and add it to the sausage mixture.
Add the parsley and toss over medium heat for about 30 seconds, until the pasta is nicely coated.
Pour into a warmed serving bowl and serve immediately, with the grated pecorino on the side.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced eggplant and cook until it is tender and slightly browned, about 10 minutes.
3. In a large bowl, combine the sausage, eggplant, red wine, tomato sauce, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
4. Transfer the mixture to a large baking dish.
5. Cook the mixture in the preheated oven for about 30 minutes, or until the sausage is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and slightly thickened.
6. While the sauce is cooking, cook the pasta according to the package instructions until it is al dente.
7. Drain the pasta and add it to the baking dish with the sausage and sauce mixture. Stir to combine.
8. Sprinkle the top with the chopped parsley and grated Pecorino Romano cheese.
9. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Serve the Wine-Stained Gemelli & Sausage Meatballs hot.

[/INST]

gt:
Grease the bottom and sides of a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Beat 2 1/4 cup flour, milk, 1/4 cup sugar, yeast, 6 tablespoons butter, vanilla extract, and 1 pinch salt in a large bowl with an electric mixer on high until dough is smooth, about 5 minutes; spread into baking dish and press dough up the sides.
Press apple slices into dough.
Mix 1 cup sugar, 3/4 cup flour, candied lemon peel, cinnamon, nutmeg, and 1 pinch salt in a bowl.
Cut in 1/2 cup butter with a knife or pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse crumbs; sprinkle over apples.
Allow dough to rise for 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Bake in preheated oven until golden brown, about 35 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 9-inch (23cm) round cake pan.
2. In a large bowl, combine the flour, milk, sugar, yeast, and salt. Mix until smooth.
3. Add the softened butter and vanilla extract, and mix until the dough comes together.
4. Turn the dough out onto a floured surface, and knead until smooth and elastic, about 5-7 minutes.
5. Place the dough in the prepared cake pan, and smooth the top with a spatula.
6. Cover the pan with a clean, damp cloth, and let the dough rise in a warm, draft-free place until it has doubled in size, about 1-1 1/2 hours.
7. While the dough is rising, prepare the apple mixture. In a large bowl, toss the apples with the sugar, flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, and a pinch of salt.
8. After the dough has risen, punch it down, and then transfer it to a floured surface.
9. Spread the apple mixture evenly over the dough, leaving a 1-inch (2.5cm) border around the edges.
10. Roll out the dough on a floured surface to a thickness of about 1/2 inch (1.25cm).
11. Place the rolled-out dough over the apple mixture, and press the edges to seal the filling in.
12. Brush the top of the dough with the remaining melted butter.
13. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 45-50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
14. Remove the cake from the oven, and let it cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Then, transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
15. Once the cake is completely cooled, dust it with powdered sugar, if desired.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Melt together cream cheese and butter in a small saucepan.
Add crab meat and seasonings, stirring gently for 1-2 minutes.
Remove from heat and cool to room temperature.
Spread mixture evenly over toasted muffin halves and sprinkle with chopped parsley and more Old Bay seasoning.
Place on cookie sheet.
(For OAMC, freeze them on the baking sheet, then transfer to a heavy duty freezer bag and use as needed).
Bake in preheated 425F oven for about 5 minutes (about 10 minutes if frozen).
Serve whole, or use a pizza cutter and cut each into 4 segments for appetizers.
pred:
To cook a delightful Crab Rangoon Bites dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix together the neufchatel cheese or cream cheese, butter, lump crabmeat, Old Bay Seasoning, garlic powder, and parsley (or green onion).
3. Spread the mixture evenly on the split and lightly toasted English muffins.
4. Place the muffin tops in a single layer on a baking sheet.
5. Bake the Crab Rangoon Bites in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the filling is melted and bubbly.
6. Serve the Crab Rangoon Bites warm, and enjoy!

This dish is a delicious and easy-to-prepare appetizer that combines the flavors of crab, cream cheese, and Old Bay Seasoning. The English muffin tops provide a crispy base, while the melted filling adds a creamy and savory element. The fresh parsley or green onion adds a touch of freshness and color to the dish.

gt:
Season the pork chops with seasoned salt on both sides.
Heat a large, nonstick skillet over medium-high heat, and grease with cooking spray.
Cook the pork chops until golden brown on both sides, 6 to 8 minutes.
Remove from the skillet and set aside.
Stir the cream of celery soup, cream of mushroom soup, sour cream, and sage together in the skillet until combined.
Stir in the green beans and O'Brien potatoes, then place the pork chops on top of the vegetables.
Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and cook until the pork chops are no longer pink in the center, 15 to 20 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Season the pork chops with the seasoned salt, ensuring they are evenly coated.
3. In a large skillet, heat some oil over medium heat. Add the pork chops and cook until browned on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side. Remove the pork chops from the skillet and set aside.
4. In the same skillet, add the condensed cream of celery soup and condensed cream of mushroom soup. Stir to combine.
5. Add the sour cream and rubbed sage, stirring until the sour cream is fully incorporated.
6. Return the pork chops to the skillet, ensuring they are evenly coated with the sauce. Cook for an additional 5-7 minutes, or until the pork chops are cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
7. In a separate saucepan, combine the green beans and frozen O'Brien potatoes mix. Add enough water to cover the ingredients, and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 10-12 minutes, or until the green beans are tender and the potatoes are cooked through.
8. Serve the pork chops with the creamy gravy and the cooked green beans and potatoes. Enjoy your delicious Pork Chops O'Brien with Creamy Gravy!

gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Fill the cavity of the trout with the garlic, onion, and lemon juice.
Rub trout with butter, and place on a large piece of foil.
Season with garlic salt, salt, and pepper.
Place the jalapeno on top of the trout.
Seal trout in the foil.
Bake trout 25 minutes in the preheated oven, or until easily flaked with a fork.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the minced garlic, butter, garlic salt, salt, and pepper to taste.
3. Place the trout fillet in a baking dish, skin side down.
4. Spread the garlic-butter mixture evenly over the trout fillet.
5. Place the lemon slice on top of the trout fillet.
6. Add the diced jalapeno pepper and any remaining garlic-butter mixture.
7. Bake the trout in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
8. Remove the trout from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious and savory Krazy Garlic Trout dish!

gt:
If using fresh tomatoes...Cook tomatoes in hot water for 10 minutes, transfer tomatoes (not water) to a blender and puree.
For a thicker sauce, instead drop raw tomatoes in boiling water for 1 minute.
Cool under cold water.
When cool remove skin and cut into eighths.
Pour tomatoes back into pan and simmer for 20 minutes
If using canned tomatoes, skip previous step and proceed.
Put olive oil, chopped onion in large saucepan and cook on medium until onion becomes pale gold
Add carrot and celery and cook on medium high for another 2 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the cooked, fresh or canned tomatoes and a pinch of salt (if fresh), stir.
Adjust heat as necessary to cook at a steady low simmer.
Make sure to leave pan uncovered, or the sauce will not reduce to the desired concentration and texture.
Cook for 45 minutes or to taste, stirring occasionally.
Correct for salt and pepper to taste.
pred:
[INST]
1. Begin by preparing the vegetables. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and carrot, and cook until they are tender and slightly browned.
2. Add the celery and cook for a few more minutes, until the vegetables are tender.
3. Add the chopped tomatoes and their juice, and cook until the vegetables are tender and the sauce has thickened slightly.
4. Season the sauce with salt and pepper to taste.
5. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions until it is al dente.
6. In a large bowl, combine the cooked pasta and the vegetable sauce.
7. Serve the pasta with a sprinkle of grated Parmesan cheese and a drizzle of extra virgin olive oil, if desired.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Mix apple, celery, orange, grapes and walnuts.
Add mayo; mix lightly.
Serve over cantaloupe.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the chopped apple, celery, and orange sections.
3. Add the chopped walnuts, toasted, and the seedless grape halves.
4. In a small bowl, mix the mayonnaise with the chopped cantaloupe.
5. Pour the mayonnaise mixture over the fruit mixture and toss to combine.
6. Transfer the fruit mixture to a baking dish and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the fruit is tender and the mixture is slightly bubbly.
7. Serve the Mini Waldorf immediately, and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Soak the kiriboshi daikon in water and then squeeze it to remove the excess water.
If there is water in the canned soybeans, drain them well.
Julienne the carrots.
Cut the bacon into thin strips.
Heat the olive oil in a frying pan.
Add the ingredients and stir-fry.
Season with salt and black pepper.
All done.
My recipe for quiche, "Easy!
Kiriboshi Daikon Quiche with Homemade Crust" uses this as a filling!
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large skillet or wok, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
3. Add the sliced bacon and cook until it is crispy, about 5 minutes.
4. Remove the bacon from the skillet and set aside.
5. Add the sliced carrot and soy beans to the skillet and cook until the vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes.
6. Add the cooked bacon back to the skillet and stir to combine.
7. In a small bowl, whisk together the black pepper and coarse salt.
8. Add the whisked seasoning to the skillet and stir to combine.
9. Add the bag of Kiriboshi daikon to the skillet and stir to combine.
10. Cook the stir-fry for a few minutes, until the daikon is tender.
11. Serve the Kiriboshi Daikon & Olive Oil Stir-Fry over rice or noodles.

[/INST]

gt:
Mix together all the sauce ingredients in a bowl and stir well until combined.
Cover and chill in the refrigerator, to allow the flavors to infuse, for at least 1 hour prior to serving.
pred:
To cook a delightful Chinese Dipping Sauce dish, follow these steps:
1. In a small bowl, mix the light soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, sesame oil, and sugar.
2. In a separate bowl, mix the finely chopped shallots, grated ginger, and red chile.
3. Combine the two bowls of ingredients, and mix well.
4. Allow the sauce to marinate for at least 15 minutes before serving.
5. Serve the sauce as a dipping sauce for various dishes, such as egg rolls, dumplings, or even as a condiment for noodles or stir-fries.

The ingredients used in this dish include light soy sauce, shallots, rice wine vinegar, sesame oil, superfine sugar, fresh ginger, and red chile. These ingredients work together to create a flavorful and delicious dipping sauce that can be enjoyed with a variety of dishes.

gt:
Season meat with S/P.
Heat 3-4 quart saute pan over med-high heat.
Add 1 tablespoons EVOO, and swirl to coat the bottom of the pan.
When the oil is hot, add the meat and brown it deeply on all sides (7-10 minutes).
Remove from heat and let sit on a plate.
Add remaining oil, onions, carrots, celery and garlic cloves.
Saute stirring frequently, until veggies are just beginning to soften (about 4 minutes).
Return meat to the pan, and add broth, potatoes, basil and bay leaf.
Bring broth to a boil, then reduce heat to med-low.
Add wine.
Let simmer for 10 minutes, then reduce heat to low.
Cook over low heat for 3 hours.
Taste periodically, add S/P if needed.
After removing heat, discard bay leaf, and serve hot.
pred:
[/SYS]

[INST]To prepare Sweet Pork Stew, follow these steps:
1. In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
2. Add the pork and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
3. Remove the pork from the pot and set aside.
4. Add the onions, carrots, and celery to the pot and cook until the vegetables are tender, about 10-12 minutes.
5. Add the garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
6. Add the beef broth, potatoes, and pork to the pot.
7. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 1-2 hours, or until the pork is tender and the potatoes are cooked through.
8. Season the stew with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Remove the bay leaf and serve the Sweet Pork Stew hot.

Enjoy your delicious Sweet Pork Stew!

gt:
In a small bowl, blend onion juice, Worcestershire sauce, hot pepper sauce, mayonnaise, cream cheese.
Stir in shrimp.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a mixing bowl, combine the shrimp, onion juice, Worcestershire sauce, hot pepper sauce, and mayonnaise.
3. Add the softened cream cheese to the mixture and stir until well combined.
4. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the dip is hot and bubbly.
5. Serve the Spicy Shrimp Dip warm, with crackers or bread for dipping.

[/INST]

gt:
In a food processor, combine the black beans, cilantro, olive oil and lime juice and process until pureed.
Scrape the puree into a small saucepan and bring to a simmer.
Season with salt and pepper and remove from the heat.
In a large skillet, combine the olive oil with the wine, scallions, jicama, tomato and poblano and season with salt and pepper.
Boil for 1 minute.
Season the grouper fillets with salt and pepper and arrange them in the skillet, skinned side down.
Cover and simmer over moderate heat until the fish is just cooked, 5 to 6 minutes.
Reheat the black bean sauce.
Transfer the grouper to a platter.
Strain the cooking liquid into the sauce, reserving the vegetables.
Spoon the sauce onto plates and top with the grouper and reserved vegetables.
Garnish with the cilantro and serve.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a small bowl, whisk together the cooked black beans, their liquid, cilantro leaves, extra-virgin olive oil, fresh lime juice, salt, and pepper. Set aside.
3. In a large skillet or oven-safe dish, heat the extra-virgin olive oil over medium heat. Add the scallions and cook until they are softened, about 2 minutes.
4. Add the diced jicama and cook for another 2 minutes, until it is slightly tender.
5. Add the tomato and cook for another 2 minutes, until it is slightly softened.
6. Add the diced peeled jicama, cooked black bean mixture, and wine. Bring to a simmer, then transfer the mixture to a large oven-safe dish.
7. Season the fish fillets with salt and pepper, then arrange them on top of the jicama mixture.
8. Cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
9. Remove the foil, and let the dish rest for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Grouper with Jicama and Black Bean Sauce dish!

gt:
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl and mix well.
Chill 2 hours before serving.
pred:
1. Wash and chop the broccoli florets into bite-sized pieces.
2. Slice the red onion into thin pieces.
3. Chop the dried cranberries into bite-sized pieces.
4. Dice the apple into small pieces.
5. Chop the walnuts into small pieces.
6. Prepare the poppy seed dressing by mixing the ingredients together.

1. In a large bowl, combine the broccoli, red onion, dried cranberries, apple, and walnuts.
2. Drizzle the poppy seed dressing over the salad, tossing gently to coat the ingredients evenly.
3. Serve the salad immediately, or refrigerate for a few hours before serving to allow the flavors to meld together.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Brown the hamburger with the onions, garlic and peppers until the meat is cooked and the onions are clear.
Drain well (I just leave mine in the colander draining while I prepare the sauce).
In the crock pot, whisk together all the remaining ingredients.
Fold in the hamburger mixture.
Stir to coat.
Cook on low for 5-6 hours.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the ground chuck over medium heat until it is browned and no longer pink.
3. Add the diced onion, celery, and bell pepper to the skillet and cook until the vegetables are tender.
4. Add the minced garlic and cook for an additional minute.
5. In a large Crock Pot, combine the ground chuck, tomato sauce, catsup, mild barbecue sauce, light brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, white vinegar, beef bouillon granules, dry mustard, soy sauce, and Mrs Dash southwest chipotle seasoning mix.
6. Stir to combine all ingredients.
7. Cover the Crock Pot and cook on low for 8-10 hours or on high for 4-5 hours.
8. Serve the Sloppy Joes over a bed of cooked noodles or rice.

These steps will guide you through the process of preparing a delicious Crock Pot Sloppy Joes for a crowd using the provided ingredients. The dish is a popular choice for gatherings and parties, as it is easy to prepare and can be served hot and ready to enjoy.

gt:
Steam half of spinach, covered, for 5 minutes or until the spinach wilts; place steamed spinach in a colander.
Repeat procedure with remaining spinach.
Cool slightly, and squeeze dry.Place spinach in a bowl.
Add onions and remaining ingredients; toss mixture well to combine.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.
pred:
1. In a large skillet, heat the sesame seeds over medium heat until they are fragrant and lightly toasted.
2. Add the green onions and cook for a few minutes until they are softened.
3. Add the spinach and cook until it is wilted and tender.
4. In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, dark sesame oil, kosher salt, and minced garlic.
5. Pour the sauce over the spinach mixture and stir to combine.
6. Cook the spinach mixture over medium heat for a few minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sauce has thickened slightly and the spinach is heated through.
7. Serve the Seasoned Spinach immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Prepare noodles according to package directions.
Heat oil in large heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat.
Add lamb, half at a time, and brown on all sides.
Remove when done.
Add leeks, garlic and wine to pot and scrape up browned bits on bottom of pot.
Cook for 2 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add tomatoes, broth, pepper and rosemary.
Bring to a simmer.
Return lamb to pot.
Cover and cook over low heat for 1 hour.
Stir in green beans and salt.
Serve over noodles.
pred:
1. In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
2. Add the lamb stew meat and cook until browned, breaking it into smaller pieces as it cooks.
3. Add the leeks, white part only, and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the crushed red wine and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes.
5. Add the chopped dumplings, tomatoes, beef broth, pepper, rosemary, and salt. Stir to combine.
6. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the lamb is tender and the dumplings are cooked through.
7. Add the frozen green beans and cook for an additional 5-7 minutes, or until the green beans are tender but still crisp.
8. Serve the NO YOLKS Lamb Stew hot, garnished with fresh herbs, if desired.

This comprehensive recipe for crafting NO YOLKS Lamb Stew involves a variety of ingredients, including lamb stew meat, dumplings, leeks, garlic, tomatoes, beef broth, rosemary, pepper, and green beans. The recipe provides step-by-step instructions for preparing the dish, ensuring that the ingredients are cooked to perfection and the final product is delicious and satisfying.

gt:
1.
Cook peas and asparagus in boiling water for 3 minutes or until asparagus is crisp-tender; drain.
Plunge into ice water; drain.
Cook pasta according to package directions, omitting salt and fat.
Drain pasta in a colander over a bowl, reserving 1/4 cup cooking liquid.
Combine pasta and vegetables.2.
Combine cheese and the next 3 ingredients (through eggs) in a bowl, stirring well with a whisk.
Gradually add hot cooking liquid to egg mixture, stirring constantly with a whisk.
Cook bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until crisp, stirring occasionally.
Remove bacon from pan, reserving 1 tablespoon drippings in pan.
Add bacon to pasta mixture.
Cook bell pepper in drippings for 3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add pasta mixture; cook 1 minute or until thoroughly heated.
Remove pan from heat, and stir in egg mixture.
Return pan to low heat; cook for 2 minutes or until sauce thickens slightly, stirring constantly.
pred:
1. In a large skillet, cook the bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove the bacon from the skillet and set aside.
2. In the same skillet, cook the asparagus and peas until tender but still crisp. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
3. In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, grated pecorino Romano cheese, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
4. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
5. In the same skillet, cook the red bell pepper over medium heat until tender. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. Add the cooked pasta, asparagus, peas, and red bell pepper to the bowl with the egg mixture. Stir to combine.
7. Pour the egg mixture over the pasta and stir to coat evenly.
8. Return the cooked bacon to the skillet and stir to combine with the pasta mixture. Cook over medium heat until the cheese is melted and the sauce is heated through.
9. Serve the Spring Vegetable Carbonara immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
In a small bowl, combine the vinegar, fish sauce, lime juice and sugar.
Stir until the sugar dissolves.
Arrange the cucumbers and red peppers on a serving platter or bowl.
Pour the dressing over the top and mix to coat the ingredients evenly.
Top with the peanuts and cilantro.
Serve cold or at room temperature.
To make this dish vegan, simply substitute the fish sauce for light soy sauce.
Adapted from Simply Thai Cooking cookbook, 2nd edition.
pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the rice vinegar, fish sauce, lime juice, sugar, and salt.
2. Add the sliced cucumber and pepper to the bowl, tossing to coat the vegetables evenly with the dressing.
3. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
4. Just before serving, add the crushed peanuts and chopped cilantro to the bowl, tossing to combine.
5. Serve the Thai Cucumber Salad immediately, or refrigerate for a few more minutes before serving to allow the flavors to meld together even more.

[/SYS]

gt:
pre heat oven 325
cut 1 lemon into slices for the top
place tilapia in glass dish and squeeze 2 lemons all over the fish
sprinkle with garlic and pepper and parsley flakes (I love garlic so I add a lot)
add sliced lemons to the top and bake for 25 mins
pred:
To cook a delicious Lemon Garlic Tilapia dish, follow these steps:

1. Prepare the ingredients:
- Wash the tilapia fillets and pat them dry with a paper towel.
- Mince the garlic and set aside.
- Juice the lemon and set aside the juice.
- Chop the parsley and set aside.

2. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).

3. In a small bowl, mix the minced garlic with some olive oil.

4. Season the tilapia fillets with salt, pepper, and any additional herbs or spices you prefer.

5. Place the tilapia fillets on a baking sheet or a foil-lined baking sheet.

6. Brush the tilapia fillets with the garlic-infused olive oil mixture.

7. Bake the tilapia fillets in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until they are cooked through and flake easily with a fork.

8. While the tilapia is baking, combine the lemon juice with the minced garlic and parsley flakes in a small bowl.

9. Once the tilapia is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes.

10. Serve the Lemon Garlic Tilapia dish immediately, garnished with a sprinkle of parsley flakes.

Enjoy your delicious Lemon Garlic Tilapia dish!

gt:
Drain the tofu.
Prepare the chocolate cake according to the directions on the box.
When mixing all the ingedients together, also add in the tofu.
Once mixed, add in the water.
Put into a cake dish and cook according to the box directions.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Grease and flour a 9-inch (23cm) round cake pan.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cake mix, tofu, water, and any additional ingredients as per the cake mix instructions.
4. Mix the ingredients until smooth and well combined.
5. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
6. Bake the cake for about 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
7. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.
8. Once cooled, use a sharp knife to cut the cake into equal portions.

This delicious Healthy Chocolate Cake dish can be enjoyed as a dessert or a snack, providing a balance of flavors and nutrients. The tofu adds a creamy texture and a source of plant-based protein, while the cake mix provides a rich chocolate flavor and a moist texture. The water helps to achieve the right consistency and moisture in the batter.

gt:
In the canister of a blender, combine bananas, yogurt, almond milk, oats, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg, honey, and ice.
Blend until reaches desired consistency.
Pour into tall glasses and sprinkle with a dash of cinnamon, if desired.
Enjoy!
pred:
1. First, peel the two bananas and cut them into chunks.
2. Place the banana chunks in a blender, along with the frozen chunks.
3. Add the Greek yogurt, almond milk, oats, vanilla extract, cinnamon, nutmeg, and honey to the blender.
4. Blend the ingredients until smooth and creamy.
5. Add ice to the blender until it is 3/4 full.
6. Blend the mixture until it reaches the desired consistency.
7. Taste and adjust the sweetness if needed.
8. Pour the smoothie into a glass and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 400 F. Spray or butter the bottom and sides of a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the leeks and mushrooms and cook, stirring occasionally, for 20-25 minutes, or until the leeks have softened and browned and the mushrooms have released their liquid and begun to reduce.
Add the spinach and garlic and cook for another 2 minutes, or until the spinach has wilted.
Season with just a dash of salt and pepper.
Remove from heat and set aside.
In a large bowl, mix together the eggs, milk, salt, pepper, and 3/4 of the cheese until well-combined.
Add the bread cubes and mix everything together with your hands until the bread cubes are thoroughly soaked in the egg mixture.
Transfer the bread and egg mixture to the prepared baking dish and top with the remaining cheese.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the bread pudding is set in the middle and golden brown on top.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, melt the 2 tablespoons of unsalted butter over low heat.
3. Add the sliced leeks and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the sliced mushrooms and cook until they release their liquid and become tender, about 5 minutes more.
5. Add the spinach and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes.
6. Remove the vegetables from the heat and let them cool slightly.
7. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and milk together.
8. Add the cooked vegetables to the bowl with the eggs and milk mixture.
9. Stir in the salt, pepper, and grated cheddar cheese.
10. Gradually add the bread cubes to the mixture, stirring to combine.
11. Transfer the mixture to a greased 9x9 inch baking dish.
12. Bake the bread pudding in the preheated oven for 35-40 minutes, or until a knife inserted into the center comes out clean.
13. Allow the bread pudding to cool for a few minutes before serving.

This delightful Savory Bread Pudding with Spinach, Leeks, and Mushrooms dish is a delicious and comforting meal that can be enjoyed by everyone. The combination of vegetables, cheese, and bread creates a rich and satisfying flavor profile that is perfect for a cozy dinner or a special occasion.

gt:
Pre heat to 375
Roll out crescent rolls
Seal the seams
Cut length wise about 1/4 in apart
Wrap the hot dogs like a mummy
Cook as directed for crescent rolls
Decorate with mustard and ketchup
pred:
To make a delicious Mummy dogs dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Cut the hot dogs into bite-sized pieces.
3. Unroll the Crescent rolls and press them out to form a flat, rectangular shape.
4. Spread a layer of ketchup on one side of each Crescent roll piece.
5. Place a piece of hot dog on top of the ketchup-covered Crescent roll piece.
6. Add a dollop of mustard on top of the hot dog.
7. Roll up the Crescent roll piece around the hot dog, sealing the edges to encase the hot dog.
8. Place the Mummy dogs on a baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the crescent rolls are golden brown and the hot dogs are fully cooked.
9. Serve the Mummy dogs warm and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Toast bread & keep warm on plates.
Fry duck eggs in butter & place them on toast.
Add a good knob of butter to frying pan, saute mushrooms for 30 seconds, tossing frequently.
Scatter mushrooms around the eggs, add seasoning and serve immediately.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs, salt, and pepper.
3. Heat a non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Add the butter and mushrooms, cooking until the mushrooms are tender and slightly browned.
4. Toast the slices of wholemeal bread.
5. Place one of the toasted slices on a baking sheet. Spread a thin layer of the mushroom mixture on top of the toast.
6. Carefully pour the whisked egg mixture over the mushroom mixture on the toast.
7. Place the other toasted slice on top of the egg mixture.
8. Bake the sandwich in the preheated oven for about 10-12 minutes, or until the egg is set and the bread is golden brown.
9. Remove the sandwich from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before cutting it into wedges and serving.

Enjoy your delicious Duck egg on toast recipe!
